Review Title: Tucked away place near the train station
Review Text:
My daughter took my wife and I to Hart's Bakery.  This is a place you would never run into by accident. Actually I never saw it until I was standing directly in front of it.  But believe me the locals knew where it was so it had to have great food. It did.

Mostly the main food was sausage rolls and pasties.  For those of you from other places pasties are like turnovers.  The pasties had potatoes and cheese and lamb with some veggies.  The sausage rolls were large and delicious.

Included are photos of the bakery front entrance, the inside, a plate of sausage rolls and potato cheese pasty and the deserts.  

There are a few tables to sit but most patrons did take away.

The staff was helpful and quick to provide service.  Overall it was an excellent experience.  GO!
all food is homemade always busy helpful staff all bread is sourdough based bristol is blessed to have such a bakery like this

Simple , honest , real offering from these guys. A fast paced ,lively environment which is a refreshing change from the world of sellophane wrapped sweat breads that depressingly greet you in corner shops and unloved Kiosks

Embrace it for what it is, which is a charismatic bakery offering fabulous quality products. The staff work tirelessly to bake and serve you with a honest smile and are a great team.

As a result this is exceptional value too.

It's packed for a reason! People vote with their feet.

Enjoyed my coffee & cake, beautiful cake & great choice. 

It was a little tricky to find, not being a frequent traveller in Temple Meads & I thought it was expensive. 

The place was very busy & many people seemed repeat business customers, so I seem to be in minority. 

Great cake - have I already mentioned that!

Leave Temple Meads station if you have an hour to spare between trains.Walk down the slope and turn immediately left (under the arches) There,in the most unlikely setting, is a real foodie find! Delicious sour-dough loaves( which they will obligingly cut in half if one rustic loaf is too much),pasties as far removed from Ginsters as it is possible to be and little crispy savoury tarts(I had butternut squash,ricotta and thyme) And the cakes? Yum! Shortbreads and brownies and custard tarts and ,and... Eat there and buy a loaf to give to someone at the end of your journey!

This is a fabulous cafe/bakery tucked away so unless you know about it you're not likely to just come across it. But if you are reading these reviews, it's well worth a diversion.
The first thing that strikes you as you enter the bakery is the atmosphere, the hustle & bustle and energy the place has, it's a real 'work place' as well as a place to eat.
The food, sweet or savoury is just delicious....if you visit around lunchtime, try the soup, it comes with some great bread. But don't go without tasting one of their pastries.
The staff are friendly and efficient. Parking is quite simple.

Review Title: So many baked goods, so little time!
Review Text: This place is busy at breakfast and lunch, but well worth a little wait to try one or more of their savoury or sweet, freshly baked treats -- they pay proper care and attention to expertly crafted croissant, bread, pastries, pasties, etc. etc. An Aladdin's cave of baked treasures beneath Temple Meads!
great choice, good coffee, all in a trendy setting. what more do you need near the train station. walk out from the mainstream for a few minutes and you always find better.
Just popped in for coffee and as always service outstanding and coffee has to be one of the best in Bristol. A real diamond

Thought I would give this place a try after I had purchased tickets from Temple Meads, wish I had not bothered.  Paid nearly ¬£10.00 for 2 brownies and 2 tepid coffees in the smallest coffee mugs I have ever seen.  Absolute rip off if you are thinking of going here my advice would be  forget it.

Review Title: great chice of baked goods and breakfast treats
Review Text: went here twice for breakfast while visiting Bristol. The first visit we had good coffee and sour dough toast with raspberry and vanilla jam, hubby had marmalade which he said was a little bitter for his liking our son had a bacon muffin and cinnamon bun both of which he enjoyed he found his hot chocolate a little weak tasting. Second visit we had coffee almond croissant and 'Saturday  bread' (very sticky and sweet just what I needed)

Review Title: Probably the best bakery in Bristol
Review Text: A fantastic little bakery, probably the best in Bristol serving homemade bread, pastries, cakes and savory snacks (their sausage rolls are particularly delicious) as well as teas and coffees. Their cinnamon rolls are just unbelievable. Friendly, knowledgeable staff too. I love it.

I‚Äôve been going to Harts since it opened under the arches. Good bread, pastries and cakes. Croissants I find to be better than most of the croissants in France. Love the cakes but increasingly finding the bread a little too holey. Avoid busy times - staff are always great but it is a relatively small space.

Review Title: One of the best cheese toasties
Review Text: Usually very busy and deservedly so but always friendly and fast service. Fantastic custard tarts, carrot & walnut cake and of course the cheese toastie. Perfect <3
started using this bakery awhile a go open plan all food done fresh every day prices are resonable  staff always helpful best sougherdough bread puding best ive tried

Review Title: Not a great experience at busy times of the day!
Review Text: We read the reviews and decided to go for breakfast to Harts bakery on the way to catching the train.We arrived to find 6 to 8 people queueing which was fine but then a large number of people came in also .We managed to order after about 10 minutes and decided as they were so busy to go for the pain au chocolate and coffees. The coffee is not made as you order and there was one man trying to make coffee for everyone.We started to eat our pain au chocolate  whilst we waited for our coffees.They were dry and didn't have much chocolate ( we ended up leaving most of them ,) eventually after about 10 mins ,and after our coffees were offered to a table of other people with the waitress stating loudly they moved! as the people said the coffees weren't theirs (we hadn't moved at all!!) our drinks arrived.The coffees were good but we'd waited so long by then that we had to drink down quickly and head for the train.I will not be returning there are better alternatives to what seemed to me a chaotic cafe .If you do go there there's a metal stairs just beyond the cafe which will take you up to the station which is useful

Again we visited before using temple mead's above the bakery last week, every time we use the train we always make sure we visit here first!
It was busy and had a lovely atmosphere as always, ordered two savory croissants, a Portuguese tart and two coffees. They were all perfectly done, the Portuguese tart was absolutely stunning and i could of eaten many more!!
It really is such a great place to visit and everyone is always so friendly.

I frequently pop in for breakfast and/or lunch. Staff are wonderful and friendly, and there is always something delicious to have. It's hidden in one of the tunnels under the station and is a beautifully decorated relaxing place to go to.

So many good things to pick from so I'll give you a few of the yummier options.
- Cinnamon buns
- Egg and bacon muffin
- Raspberry and vanilla jam on toast
- Chocolate fudge cake
- Chocolate and walnut brownies
- Chocolate chip cookies

They also do specials at lunch times [Friday specials are the best but get there early to avoid disappointment]. Some to watch out for if they have them: Chorizo stew; Meatloaf sandwich; anything that has homemade onion rings in... you know what... there are too many to list.

Every time someone asks me how I'm enjoying Bristol I start every answer with "Oh my god I'm eating so much baked stuff from this great little bakery round the corner from work." Wonderful people, wonderful food, if you're at Bristol Temple Meads station then you have to make sure you're there early enough to get a snack from Hart's before getting your train.

One of the best bakeries about. Make sure you get there early on a Saturday otherwise you will lose your loaf. It sells out quick there, so best to get their number and reserve it, so you won't be disappointed. Awesome cakes, quiches, and sausage rolls. A couple of times a month they have a cheesemonger visit too. A definite must visit artisan bakers.

Under a railway arch at Temple Meads station and worth seeking out.  Probably the best sausage roll I have ever eaten, yummy custard tarts and superb sourdough bread. Interesting to see the bakers at work at the back, and very good value We'll be back!

Came here with my boyfriend to have a sweet treat after lunch at Temple Quay Market. The bakery has a great atmosphere and it feels very authentic - I love that you can see the kitchen beyond the counter, as it makes the customer feel very connected to the chefs. There's so much variety and everything is beautifully presented and looks delicious. We had the chocolate fudge cake with cashew brittle, a coconut macaroon and a piece of shortbread and they were all fantastic and well-priced. There are also many options for dietary needs - I am lactose intolerant and the coconut macaroon suited me perfectly. Definitely worth a visit!

Review Title: Yummy food & coffee in a relaxed atmosphere
Review Text: Delicious food, top notch coffee in a relaxed and homely environment. Definitely worth a look. I had so much trouble picking something to eat. Best part was watching the relaxed kitchen were the guys were pottering around baking (I'm sure they weren't pottering but that's how relaxed they all seemed).

We were picking up tickets at the station half way through one of Tim Mowl's excellent architectural walks from "Bristol Explored" and decided to stop at Hart's to pick up some cakes to take home for tea.   But when we saw the food on offer we decided to stay for a simple lunch.  I had the best Gazpacho I have ever tasted anywhere in the world - was the secret ingredient sun dried baby tomatoes marinated in olive oil?   Whatever, it was delicious and served at the correct temperature with sour bread and a huge smile.   My husband had a very good pea, mint and feta cheese tart.   We both had excellent Americano coffees and we took home two generous slices of carrot and walnut cake - one of which we have just eaten and enjoyed.  It was very succulent with delicious icing.

This is a simple restaurant - very clean with charming and helpful staff - looking forward to a return visit.

We went on a weekend of baking with Laura. We made pizzas, sourdough bread, croissants, pain au chocolate, chocolate tart & lots more......
We had a fantastic time learning the different techniques & eating our prepared food. The pizzas were amazing & the best I've eaten. We made so much food & had nothing to clear up. Laura & her staff had set everything up when we arrived Saturday evening & all we had to do was make the different foods & no washing up. Brilliant.

We ate our hot croissants etc & went home with huge goodie boxes. Great baking weekend

After reading all the good reviews I was keen to visit Harts Bakery.

To start with positives, it looked really busy on a Saturday morning, a good sign. The rosemary and olive bread we had later with dinner was tasty.
The shortbread was yum yum and I would buy it again.

Unfortunately the almond croissant had no almond paste? I was a little confused as to whether they just topped it with flaked almonds and voila. The pain au chocolate was equally disappointing, the pastry was dry and the chocolate was still tubular and just not great.
My other half also added the sausage roll wasn't a great deal to shout about.

Only had a coffee and shortbread, but both were very good. The bread and other baked goods, savoury and sweet, looked really nice and the small was amazing. I would certainly return to try more options.

I love harts. The bread is delicious. The pastries are gorgeous. I especially love the new hazelnut, chocolate sticky bun things. Pandoro is another favourite. Sausage rolls are soooo good. The custard tarts are perfect. It gets really busy but that's because it's really, really good.

Nice little cafe with friendly staff, good menu choices and convenient location. The place I always visit before train journey. 

Keep it up guys!!!

Review Title: Could this be the Best Bread in Britain?
Review Text: If you love bread you will find the range of sourdough breads here amazing. Not only do they taste exceptionally good, but unlike most other breads, they keep well for days. If you live nearby and enjoy real bread, visit this bakery ASAP. You won't regret it!

Review Title: A very small cafe,  could be better!
Review Text:
My husband and I have visited the bakery since it opened and followed the success of Laura Hart. But, in recent times the quality of the food has not been as good as it was and the staff at the moment are almost to the point rude.
it is a real shame that these areas have been compromised as it had such promise. There is a lot of hype but to be honest there are plenty cafes and bakeries in bristol that are as good if not much better.
We will no doubt keep returning as we travel to london frequently with work and the food at the bakery is preferable to the food on the train!
Visited this place last week,lovely choice of desert specially the pastry is excellent.excellent service,must visit place.

I visited this bakery 4 months ago and I still dream of all the delicious goodies here. Its also very handy for travellers, discreetly tucked around the corner of the main Bristol train station. I sometimes have an urge to fly to Bristol just to revisit this place! Amazing coffee, breads, cakes, pastries, pizzas. Yum.

had to have my car serviced at Vauxhall's so decided to walk to the station for a cuppa in Wetherspoons and then thought , I'll get a sausage roll in Harts . 
To say I was disappointed would be putting it mildly . It was so greasey , I took one bite and decided to cut my losses . By which time I had walked to the old church by the Shakespeare pub so I couldn't take it back . I think the birds  in my garden enjoyed it so as they say " Every cloud .........

Review Title: best commercial pastry I have ever tasted
Review Text: Hart's is a bakery, not a restaurant...but you can get a great lunch... something new on offer every day. The pasties (after 11 to avoid disappointment) are excellent (type changes every day); the cakes superb; very good coffee.
Lovely bakery with excellent food and staff. Egg and Bacon Muffin for a breakfast treat in the mornings

Review Title: A refuge from the winter cold
Review Text:
My friend and I called into Hart's one wintry day for a chat. It wasn't as easy to find as one might think, tucked away under the incline of Temple Meads railway station. However, once found, we had a most enjoyable hour.

The staff were exceptionally friendly and efficient; it wasn't too crowded and  the ambience just right for us.

The menu choice was certainly adequate.

I would certainly recommend Hart's to a friend and will definitely visit again soon.

A delicious custard tart with a flat white coffee. Friendly fast service. This place gets very busy with eating in and take aways but the service is friendly and friendly. Mostly shared tables but a lot of chatter and bustle keeps things private.

Harts bakery is not in a glamorous location or luxuriously appointed, it just provides some of the best bread, muffins and baked goods we've ever enjoyed. In particular, try the bacon and egg breakfast muffin, cinnamon rolls and do not leave without eating (and taking with you some more for later!) their Portuguese custard tarts, the best we've had outside Portugal, and better than some there. Oh, and the coffee's great too!

Review Title: Avoid the station rubbish & go straight here before you board your train
Review Text: The BEST coffee, the BEST bread, the BEST cakes for miles around and so so much better than the mass produced & overpriced rubbish available at the station.  The lunches are great too.  If you want to sit in there are benches and long tables & outside there is a bit of seating.  There's also good bike parking.  Great informal atmosphere with food being produced in front of your eyes.  Love it.
There is a good atmosphere, great bread, good coffee and wonderful cakes! Surroundings are basic, but it is friendly with good service. Not had lunch there though.
The food, coffee, service & atmosphere in this place is spot on. Highly recommend it. A real hidden gem that everyone in bristol & beyond should visit!!

Bought a bunch of stuff from here for m'colleagues in the office at xmas.  Egg and bacon muffins are the stuff of legend - not so healthy for sure but hardly surprising and they were really tasty.  Plus lovely staff.  It's expensive, TBH, but it's an independent business with some personality, and their fare is great so I reckon they're well worth it.  Back in Bristol this Tuesday and looking forward to ducking in.

This place is great, generally I go with a  plan to have something i saw last time, then there always seems to be something new that sounds great! It's a never ending cycle of visits to Hart's bakery! which is no more than they deserve frankly for a string of new ideas that feel like they're made by someone who really loves what they do. I've read some of the average reviews and so what if every pasty isn't a world beater? Many are and they're all inventive. So once one of the ace sausage rolls had too much fennel, sourdough bread has a crust and everything isn't hermetically sealed in plastic. People like you lot should go to Greggs end eat some generic paste, at least it'll keep you quiet for 99p.

Decided to stop and get some lunch before a recent trip on the train. Lovely little building and nice atmosphere. Had a sausage roll which was delicious and a banana and toffee cake which again was superb! The flat white was perfect. The breads all looked delicious and will visit again for some takeaway items! Very nice place.

Review Title: The best bakery in the world.
Review Text: Forget everywhere else, the sausage rolls here are the best on the planet. Simple as.  A bit of a well kept secret (though frequently queued out of the door): forget the franchises on the station, Harts is but two minutes walk from Platform Three at Temple Meads but I guarantee you won't regret it..

I never knew this hidden-away placed existed. I must have walked over the top of it more than a hundred times. 
A colleague recently recommended it: "excellent coffee", she said "and if you like sausage rolls they are the best". 
Well today I had the sausage roll. Best ¬£2.80 I've spent for ages. 
Fluffy crisp pastry. Lots of meat, delicately seasoned with a hint of heat. It was, frankly, bloody delightful. 
Next time I'm anywhere near Temple Meads I'm going to have another. Will probably try the coffee too. 
As an aside, the location is quite fascinating. A tunnel under the approach to Temple Meads Station. A few tables for dining in with a nice rustic feel. 
Something tells me their other fare will be equally munchie!

Located under the railway arches outside Temple Meads station.  Very nice people.  Rustic.  Outstanding FRESH food - cooked/baked on-the-spot.  Pasties to die for (menu changes).  sausage rolls to die for.  You MUST try the cheese and ham toastie !!!  Oh - and they have good coffee too.  Small place.  Bench seats.  Don't be late - they're so good they sell out !!  Not the cheapest - but you HAVE to try this place.  And you can buy fresh bread etc to take home.

Review Title: A sheer pleasure for a Sour Dough Fan like me plus more.
Review Text:
It seems everytime I visit Bristol these days from Oxford there are two places that are a must for me this time in the morning of the 17th December   The first is Harts Bakery just at the side of Temple Meads incline and the other is the Pieminister in Stokes Croft.  My visit on the 17th December was a delight once again, superb coffee excellent choice of pastries etc for mid morning, I was sorry that once again I missed the Bacon Butties which are to die for, however I did manage to get a number of the Sour Dough Loaves which are truly superb and as good as any in San Francisco, plus a lot more varieties.  As usual I bought a number of each for my wife and I as well as for our daughter and her family.  The bread freezes without problem and also toasted it is from frozen it is again a delight to be enjoyed.   Croissants were again another purchase and above all the very pleasant staff and rapid service makes the trip all the more pleasant, plus being able to park right outside if you are careful is another bonus.
I did revisit later in the day to take advantage also of their pasties both vegetarian and meat which again are superb.
I cannot say too much about this venue other than it is exceptional and the only reason I have not given it a best meal I have ever had is because it was more a snack than a meal but was nonetheless fantastic.   Be aware that they are not open on Mondays.
Really pleased to find this little gem so close to Bristol Temple Meads Station. Friendly service, good choice, spotless and super sourdough!

An unlikely yet highly successful venue. Under the arches on the 'down ramp' at Bristol Temple Meads station. A welcoming smile wrapped in attentive and rapid service. A range of 'home' baked and carefully made pastries, soups and cakes that you can see and almost become involved with making. Delicious. All of them. Bench-style seating means a culinary journey blends with meeting someone interesting whilst munching. A perfect lunch break from the rigours of staring into a computer screen.

The best sausage rolls in Bristol, excellent sourdough bread and very good flakey buttery croissants. They use real butter and good oil so some things can be a little greasy (e.g. sausage rolls), but soo tasty!! A must-try establishment if you are every feeling peckish/ hungry near Temple Meads. Beware: closed on Mondays.

Review Title: Lovely bakery, lovely staff, lovely food
Review Text: I popped in here yesterday as I had 30 mins to kill before my train. It was closing but the staff welcomed me in anyway and just cleared up around me discreetly while I ate. I had a gorgeous, (huge) sausage roll and a hot chocolate which kept me full up for hours and hours. I ate my moist bread and butter pudding on the train and it was a generous portion full of lovely dried fruits. The staff were really friendly, the atmosphere in there was lovely. Shame I live in Leeds, I would love to have this bakery as a local.

Review Title: Coffee, toast and raspberry jam - simple, tasty, a real treat
Review Text:
My friend has been raving as to how good Harts Bakery is. When my house sale fell through she insisted on treating me to breakfast. It was lovely and warm; bakers were bustling; trestle tables made for informal seating; beautiful flowers in cases; and delicious bread and coffee.
I returned today to get myself a fabulous tart and coffee for my train journey. Hope to make it to the pizza night on the 28/11.

I'm yet to try any food here but having seen everything up close, I can confirm it all looks even better than the photos on here! The mocha's are really good, I'd even go as far as to say they are the best I've ever tasted. Great little place with really friendly, smiley staff. Can't wait to try the food!

This place is fantastic - the best pastries I have ever tasted. A really lovely bustling business - and the constant stream of people tells its own story. And nice people who were even happy to part with some sourdough starter for our own bread. You will be all the poorer if you don't try Hart's Bakery!

Bought a couple of sourdough loaves and a brownie from this place. 

Really nothing to write home about. The bread was OK when toasted, but really, really hard to cut and chewy. Not good. I ended up throwing half of it away.

Brownie was stodgy.

It's not cheap either.

Review Title: Great strong coffee and delicious bread and cakes
Review Text: Close to Temple Meads station and a great place to visit for strong coffee and delicious bread and cakes. Friendly, young staff and reasonable prices.

The food snacks bread fantastic unfortunately the coffee sucks Luke warm quite expensive and even when we complained we were offered a refill which was again warm not hot and the flavour lacked, would go elsewhere for coffee but for pasteries food deff visit again ....

Visited at approximately 10.30 on a Saturday.  Expecting a nice selection of breads and pastries as was advertised on their website.  Unfortunately they had no pastries whatsoever and had apparently sold out of croissants.

The bakery is small and has a lot of seating at the front which meant that the place was very crowded.  The queue was backed up to the door and you could not see any of what was on offer while waiting.  There was a total of four breads, all sourdough.

We ordered two cake pieces, a cookie and a sourdough.  The person serving was very pleasant but forgot to get us one of the pieces of cake we ordered.  We only realised when we got home and there was no receipt to check what we had been charged for. ¬£9.45 for a cookie, a piece of cake and a loaf of bread seems quite steep though.

We left feeling that this was more of an artisan coffee shop than a bakery and with such a small selection of breads and pastries we will unlikely be visiting again.

Upon tasting the food, I can't say that it was really anything special.  The bread was good, as was the cake, but nothing to write home about, and the cookie was probably not as good as the ones you get in cafe Nero (which can't be a good thing).

I would like to say more positive things about this place but apart from the fact it is an independent bakery/coffee shop that seems to be doing well my partner and I left feeling quite deflated.

Finally visited a couple of times recently, after having Harts bread/pastries at Kondi's and Small st. 
The sourdough and pastries are delicious, the cinnamon buns are my favourite for sure... Or the custard tarts. (The chocolate and raspberry brownies are nice too).
 Super coffee, roasted by Extract. Friendly staff! Lovely benches to sit at but I would definitely recommend visiting early to ensure pastry availability. My new favourite in Bristol.

We came here for a takeaway breakfast and the food was very good. Unfortunately the coffee was barely lukewarm and the person serving the drinks was so abrupt she was verging on rude. Will come for food again but I'm not sure I would bother with the coffee again.

Brilliant for a quick bite. Unforunately we managed to get there at 2pm on a Saturday which is an hour before closing. So there wasn't much of a choice. But the black pudding sausage roll and the minted lamb pasty were very tasty. My boyfriend bought some shortbread to take away and the coffee is decent. Worth a visit. Wish I could of tried the cinnamon buns!

Loved the food: banana and toffee cake, chocolate and nuts but the coffee was disappointing.  My husband had a latte and I a cappuccino but both were warm - not hot and for some unknown reason mine was 2/3rds the size of the latte but was the same price.  The bread looked lovely and the service was good its just the coffee that now needs to be sorted as we noticed a lot of people drinking theirs very quickly as well.
I have been here with my girlfriend birthday. very nice cake and excellent value of money also , will definitely recommend for my self birthday.

Review Title: Very pleasant bakery - ideal for pre-train nourishment
Review Text: Visited here after a night shift and before a long train journey. Very pleasant little cafe - welcoming and nice food both to eat in or take away. Pity about the short opening hours though.

Review Title: a little culinary gem in Bristol
Review Text: over a period of a week we visited the bakery on 4 occasions, including breakfast and lunch on the same day. It produces freshly baked products to a high standard, both savoury and sweet. their sausage rolls, pasties and filled croissants are as good as you will get anywhere, with imaginative variations on the fillings and there is always a lunch time special for about a fiver. The pastries too have a little extra twist and the coffee is excellent. You can sit and watch these artisan bakers in full flow just a few feet away. It is situated just below and to the right of the entrance to Temple Meads station, in the arches under the road up to the station, a little distance from the centre but easily reached.

Review Title: oh so cool! stop displaying all those cakes!
Review Text:
I visited for the first time today and I am hooked. The place has such a great vibe!
People just come and sit, have a lunch, talk, hang out and go back to their offices. I tried the pea and mint tartlet, my husband had a chicken and ham pasty.
I had one of those cheeky nut and dried fruit bars, they taste perfect!
I love watching people making cakes, bread, cleaning up, just beavering away. This place has got it soo right!
I will be coming back :)

Day tripped to Bristol and feeling a bit peckish, we came across this Bakery. I can't review it highly enough. The food we had was lovely. Fresh, full of flavor and the staff we really helpful with my friend who has allergies. We even bought extra to take home. Yum

Lovely food and really lovely friendly staff . But why oh why is the food left out exposed all day. What is wrong with covering your food up. Surely you cannot get a good food hygiene rating for leaving the food uncovered all day .

Review Title: The best cake in the world ever!
Review Text:
Words fail to describe how good their gluten free orange cake is. The only way to really experience this is to go, buy a slice, and munch away. 
Enjoy!

Review Title: Great local bakery and nice vibe to boot
Review Text: This place is a real hidden gem - tucked away in a back street but well worth making the effort to seek out. Great cakes and very good coffee too. Also the place has a really great atmosphere - you can watch the bakers at work as you relax and chat over coffee and cake. Wonderful!

I visited Hart's after reading that it was one of the top places to go in the Naked Guide to Bristol Best Breakfast Guide. It doesn't offer a traditional fry-up but specialises in pastries which are outstanding. The coffee is excellent as well. A worthy top-billing in the excellent Naked Guide to Bristol.

Hidden down a side road by the station Hart's Bakery is definitely worth seeking out. We went for Saturday lunch and enjoyed a tasty pork sausage roll with very flaky pastry and a white onion, cheese and thyme pie with melt-in-the mouth pastry. Very good value for money. We sat on the stools and enjoyed a cup of tea and elderflower cordial with our food whilst watching the staff bake cookies and more sausage rolls.

Make sure you check the opening times (Tuesday to Saturday 7:00am to 3:00pm) to avoid disappointment.

It is a little difficult to find this if you don't know bristol well.  When you do find it, it is so worth it.  I have tried quite a few of the cakes and the awesome cheese toastie.  Its lucky i don't live nearby otherwise I would come in all the time.  The best is watching the bakers at work at the back of the store while drinking coffee and eating cake.  My fav cake is the sour cream slice.

Keep up the good work.

Review Title: Lovely food, lovely staff, lovely place
Review Text: This is such a great place for lunch and to get take away food and amazing bread and cakes. I visited today to buy bread and cakes to take out. I was having a bit of a bad day and the managed to drop everything as I was leaving. As I was getting myself together one of the lovely people that works there brought me a new bag, picked up all my stuff and wished me a good day. They were incredibly busy at the time but still took the time to help.

Visited for lunch today and what a revelation. Best cheese toastie ever. Fab latte. Really lovely staff. 

Can't believe I didn't go before. It's going to become a regular haunt I feel so I can try the rest of the delicious looking stuff on offer ( a three bean pasty has to be next I think!)

Bought a sour dough loaf to take home as well. What's not to love?!

Review Title: As a great fan of sour dough this was a breakfast treat.
Review Text:
My cousin and I visited Harts Bakery after finding them closed a couple of weeks ago on a Monday and were pleased to find them open on Wednesday morning 6th July.   My regret is we arrived too late 10-30am for the Breakfast Muffin Sour Dough with egg and bacon.  However the offer of Cheese and Mushroom toasted Sour Dough was a brilliant alternative, all washed down with first class coffee.   There is seating provided and we were able to park very close to the bakery as well.   On offer also was a selection of at least 5 sour dough loaves for purchase, I chose one of each and also the huge croissants as well as a couple of apple cream slices.   Whilst I have not eaten all of these at this time the ones I have tried are tremendous.
Superlatives do little to describe exactly how good this bakery is but it does support what I said many years ago and since whilst visiting San Francisco and other parts of the States, that sour dough will be very successful in the UK once launched.   Also whilst the multiples supermarkets are not as good as the ones either in San Francisco or at Harts it shows there is a lot of new demand for this lovely bread once a poor offering for builders of the Sierra Railroad in the mountains and also for miners in California.   It has come a long way since.
This novel and original bakery is one which deserves to be one which is noted by the very discerning consumer of this type of bread.
Another note of history is that the very arch where the bakery is now placed was at one time the stables used to house the Rail horses for the Temple Meads railway etc. 
Also many thanks to our lovely Romanian waitress whose service for us was a delight from start to finish.
My first visit today , great atmosphere and good service. Only had a drink this time but the coffee came highly recommended. Cakes looked amazing, good selection. Will be back

Review Title: Great cakes, nice people, nice atmosphere
Review Text: Not the cheapest but great quality. I got a selection of cakes for work and they were great. Nice staff too. Just come out of the station, head diagonally left, head down the metal staircase and the bakery is on the right in arches. Well worth seeking out especially if waiting at Temple Meads.
Popped in between work meetings on the recommendation of a friend - lovely coffee and cakes - good service and cool vibe. Not for those watching their weight - all very tempting.

Review Title: Must visit if you are in Bristol
Review Text: Amazing coffee and amazing cakes. The place has a great atmosphere and the staff are nice and friendly! will definitely visit again!

I completely agree with everyone raving about this place - it is a hidden gem. I popped in on a friend's recommendation at lunch time, and enjoyed a delicious coffe and an incredible pasty - I think it was red lentil and spiced local sausage. Great value, an obviously local-focused ethic, and great staff. If you are going through Temple Meads, shoudl should definitely step outside the station to experience this little beauty.

We've been here a few times now and absolutely love it. The Pork Sausage Rolls are tasty, the Sourdough Bread is splendid and the Custard Tarts are to die for!

Top Tip - Email Laura with your order for Egg Tarts to avoid disappointment! They go quick!

If you like artisan bakeries you'll love this one , nestled under the Temple meads road ramp is a real gem , the way bakeries should be , smells to salivate over , sweet and savoury , my favourites include , pork and chilli sausage rolls , raspberry brownies, bread pudding,cauliflower pasties,great sour dough and other bread fab soups and real craft in their work ,the best I've been to !

What a lovely place. Went on the previous reviews and we were not disappointed. Ate to much and what we couldn't manage we brought and took away with us to eat later!! Coffee was tasty (flat white) and the breakfast bacon muffin was a firm favourite. Can't wait to be back in Bristol to try it all again!!!
Delicious fresh baked goods and friendly staff. Not 5 stars as some of the cakes are a little on the heavy side. A hidden gem in Bristol.

One of my favourite places to get a descent cake. You can watch bakers while they bake and enjoy a slice of warm cake on your plate.
Carrot cake is a winner.
Worth a visit. Coffee incredible too.

I arrived in Bristol early one morning and told myself that my first stop in the city would be breakfast at Hart's Bakery. Upon entering the bakery, I wished I had a reason to buy one of their fresh loaves of bread because they looked (and smelled) great! But since I was only in town for a day, I had to settle for something else - a coffee and a pork sausage roll. The sausage roll was fantastic! It wasn't a plain pork filling, but rather the pork was spiced and herbed to give it some extra kick. The pastry was wonderfully flaky as well and the sausage roll was huge! It was too filling for me to be able to try one of their sweet treats, but if I'm ever in Bristol again, I'll be purposefully seeking out this bakery to try more of their offerings.

I always love going to Harts. You get to watch the produce being baked in the background, and the cakes, sausage rolls and other savories are always delicious. Lovely pretty little place with a great atmosphere - a great find (albeit a bit hidden in Temple Meads!)

We were staying at The Ibis temple Meads but didn't fancy breakfast there. This place was recommended to us by a Bristolian and I can see why. Himself had two freshly baked croissants whilst I went for egg and bacon muffin. Very tasty and the other bread good on display looked wonderful.
Good cups of tea.

Head down from the station and you will see a metal staircase on the left taking you down to the Arches on that side. The bakery is tucked into one of the Arches and is a great little place to break your fast

Lovely little bakery located just by Temple Meads Station. I have eaten here a couple of times at lunch time and it's always been lovely. The food is great quality and it tastes wonderful. It can be a little expensive, you're looking at about ¬£15 for two pasties, two slices of cake and two cans of drink, but the quality of the food is worth it. A lovely place to stop for a quick pick me up.

We found this bakery by chance on our recent trip to Bristol, we were looking for somewhere to eat around the station and noticed a sign for it at the bottom of station approach, so curiosity got the better of us and we set off to try and find it.

The bakery itself is in one of the railway arches underneath the station approach so it's not easily seen from the road and if they didn't have the sign out you wouldn't know it existed.  We found it and because of its location we expected it to be fairly quiet.... How wrong we were!

The bakery itself is quite small but boy it's busy, whilst we were in there there was a constant steady stream of people coming and going.

We had lunch there on Saturday and we each had the cheese and mushroom toastie, a coffee and a slice of their delicious banana and toffee cake.

Everything was delicious and the service was friendly and quick. 

We would recommend this place to anyone and it is worth hunting out this little hidden gem!

Ticks all the boxes
Great bread, pasties, sausage rolls and coffee. I have been here every time I have been in the vicinity of temple meads and they have never disappointed. Staff are also friendly and efficient. Great addition to the Bristol food scene.

Travelled from Swindon to visit Hart,s Bakery, after leaving the train in temple meads,got of to a great start as the First Great Western employee I asked if he knew where Hart,Bakery was guided me to the door telling me they have the best sausage rolls he has ever tasted, I was really impressed with the bakery and full of admiration for The owner and her wonderful team,love baking myself so can really appreciate high skill levels when I can see and taste it, really makes me want to move to Bristol as Hart,s Bakery is only one of many skilled artisan bakers in Bristol,thats why I would put them up there with great rock stars and worship them as stars,looking forward to my next visit, if you only have ¬£2 left in your pocket spend it here on bread,close your eyes bite into the bread and your in heaven.
Huge collection of cakes make you always confuse in selection. Its very good taste. Trying one time!

Review Title: So it's not a Restaurant, but.....
Review Text:
This is a lovely gem in an unexpected place.  They make exceptional sourdough bread, delicious cakes and pastries, and every day have a number of savoury options for lunch.  

Some of the options are only available on certain days, I thoroughly recommend going on a Thursday or Friday for the Custard Tarts.  It is always worth going early, especially if you want bread or pastries, as they usually sell out.

I've been a few times and the service is always lovely, the lunch specials are wonderful and vary day to day, and the pasties are fab.  You can also opt for toasty made with house bread.

They serve Extract coffee and a number of different teas, all very carefully made.  There is a wide choice of cakes and sweet stuff.  The atmosphere is always lively, warm and welcoming.  

Worth a trip all on it's own, and certainly an essential stop if you are at the station anyway.

Like so many others here, I visited on the strength of all the reviews but left a bit puzzled over them. Busy Saturday morning and praise has to be given to the professionalism of the serving staff. But my cappuccino was poor (and certainly not worth ¬£2.20 for the size of it) and whilst the pain au chocolate was on the large side, it was cold and the chocolate inside hard. The breads did look good though.

Another venue in Bristol that I don't really understand what the fuss about.

I use Temple Meads a lot so pop-in here on a semi-regular basis and was very surprised to see it's ranked number one for restaurants in Bristol.

I find the food a bit hit and miss. I've had an amazing pasty there one time (you could really taste the freshness of the ingredients), but the sausage rolls are consistently poor, in my opinion, with greasy pastry and over-powering seasoning (usually aniseed tasting) that detracts from the meat flavours. I also had some sort of egg/bacon (very fatty bacon) monstrosity that I couldn't finish.

The cakes look good and the bread is standard fare. It is pot-luck what will be available when you go in, mind, and the selection is often small.

The staff are friendly enough and the venue is open-plan so you can see the bakers at work.

It's nice enough and there's no harm in popping in if you're in the vicinity, but don't expect to be blown away.

Review Title: A gem of a find.  Well worth making a visit.
Review Text: So many favourite cakes it's hard to make a choice. Daily croissants delivered to work and great coffee too.

Review Title: Great coffee and cakes, friendly and efficient staff
Review Text: If only all bakeries were like this. Despite being about as busy as they could be (all seats taken, queue at the counter) we were served within minutes. And what we were served with was exactly what I expected - delicious cakes, good coffee and an excellent loaf (or two) to take home.
Everything is made to standards above what you expect. Top quality. No need to say more. Worth a visit, many times.

Went out of our way to visit this "number 1 on trip advisor" . Its ok. Certainly fresh bread and cakes but surprisingly little choice, esp for non wheat eaters. A few tables to stop at and drink coffee/eat cakes but nothing special. I'm sure there are equally good bakeries and Bristol and 10's if not 100's of places more worthy of being "number 1 of restaurants in Bristol"

Just a few words are needed here... Custard tarts, coffee and fresh warm sausage rolls. Oh and very seedy bread. All of which are BEAUTIFUL. Only snag is parking is not easy, no baking on a Monday and custard tarts are only on a Thur, Fri and Sat (I think), however it makes me look forward to the weekend!

I am in Bristol for the weekend and visted the bakery today after reading the reviews on trip advisor. 
The bakery is in full action, you can see bread being baked. If was very busy which to me shows how good this place is. 
The service was brilliant - I had a cheese and ham hock toastie which was delicious, best toastie I've ever had, the bread was lovely. I also ordered a hot chocolate and a slice of carrot cake ( which was also delicious - there are many cakes to choose from it took me a while to make me decision) I would defiantly recomend this place for lunch or breakfast. I will be visiting again when in Bristol. 
The only bad thing I could say is that it could do with some more tables and chairs but I do g know if they could re arrange to have the space.

I learned this bakery from Tripadvisor before heading for Bristol. I have been to Bristol for different reasons for many times but have never explored this hidden gem. I stayed in Bristol for one night this time, and went to this bakery twice (the first afternoon when I arrived and the next morning when I am leaving for Bath). I must say that I have had the most delicious sausage roll in the UK and the Saturday cake is equally delicious! Staff are very friendly and the only thing I want to say is that if the opening hours could be longer...! Must visit Hart's next time in Bristol.

I have followed ms Hart around Bristol for many years and am delighted so many have found her "underneath the arches". Tip top bakery now with great cafe. Don't ever leave us with out supplies life would be diminished.

I'd walked past the sign daily for almost a year when one day I decided to pop in for a loaf of bread. I was blown away at this great underground bunker and wondered why it had taken me so long to find it. A hive of activity with bakers producing fantastic bread and cakes and a great informal atmosphere perfectly suited to the setting. The cheese toastie is indeed superb and being fussy about coffee I'm not disappointed. I now love taking the train from TMs as it gives me the perfect excuse to arrive early! My only complaint - it's not open long enough!

This little bakery/caf√© is situated under the station.  We found it on a rather cold rainy afternoon.  The soup and bread was wonderful and the cheese/ham/mushroom toastie was very tasty.

Coffee was a bit bitter and not hot enough for me but otherwise it was a very warm and welcoming place, they also have a range of cakes and vegetarian sausage rolls and pastries.

Excellent quality bakery, with  some interior seating. I had a very good sausage roll here - plenty of filling, and lovely pastry - but my coffee was only "average"
As is the fashion, the cakes & pastries are displayed uncovered on a table, which customers queue beside to reach the till which is also amongst the goodies. Its very busy, as Harts own video shows, and an awful lot of sputum naturally showers the food before it is served. Some don't mind that - and some find it faintly revolting.

Review Title: seriously delicious, a definite must look up
Review Text: Just popped in this lunch time for some food. Quirky little place, bewared not much seating but i guess a lot of people grab and go. Had a stunning cheese and pull ham hock toastie (would you normally use "stunning for a toastie?!) Followed by a banana and..... (can't remember) cake. I do remember it was lush! The staff are great, very chirpy and cheery. Good coffee too. In one way its nice not many people know about this place as it would be rammed. In another the food and the staff deserve more custom and long may they continue. Its not open on a monday and otherwise its 7am till 3pm. YUMMMM

We stopped at Hart's Bakery for breakfast before walking the Bristol to Bath Railway Path.  Both of us had the cheese toasties and were impressed (the fresh orange juice is also very good).  It's great to see the workings of the bakery in full view while purchasing your items.  The cafe was very popular and my only criticism would be that seating is limited and you may need to wait for a table to become available or order your goods to go.

After becoming completely addicted to sourdough bread many years ago in San Francisco, I've never really been able to find any in the UK that compares... until recently.

A random Google search brought up Hart's one day and I vowed to give it a try then next time I was in Bristol. I'm glad I did. Their sourdough is just incredible. The taste, texture and quality, everything about it is just perfect. It would be quite possible to eat an entire loaf, without any butter or topping, in one sitting. It's that good.

I've since also tried a number of their cakes - including the amazing Almond pastry mince pies - and they're also faultless, but it's the sourdough I now make a point of picking up whenever I'm in Bristol (and, truth be told, it's what makes me look for excuses to go there).

I visit this bakery regularly, when ever I go the service is always excellent, warm and welcoming with a smile, friendly with superb coffee, try the bacon and egg, I would recommend this bakery to everyone
Fantastic artisanal bakery that feels like it has been transported straight from shoreditch! The sourdough loaves put inedible pappy supermarket bread to shame - it's truly awesome stuff.

Great bakery and cafe atmosphere with the smell of fresh bread baked on site, staff very engaging.  Lovely croissant's and sour dough bread.  Only issue was lack of seating as it was very busy. Great for breakfast and lunch.
What a fantastic place!  Lots of customers enjoying lunch at trestle tables whilst watching the bakery action in the back of the arch.  Had a delicious unhurried coffee and cake!

I have to agree with some other reviews this Is a lovely bakery with great bread cakes ect but it is NOT a restaurant so if you are not from bristol please try it for a lunch or breakfast because as we Bristolians say its Gert Lush but if you go thinking a la carte it's not.

But have to say all things are very nice.

... They have a gorgeous cheese toastie! I had mine with ham hock, my husband had grilled mushrooms. It was better than anything we could have bought at Temple Meads for our train journey. It smelled divine and I know people on our train were jealous :) 

We also had a slice of lemon poppy seed cake, which was light and fluffy! Gorgeous!!

Review Title: Lovely bakery- but not really a restaurant!
Review Text: I visited this place as I noticed it was number one on Trip Advisor. I have to agree with the previous comment that it has a lovely atmosphere, great staff and I'm sure the bread is delicious as it was very fresh, but there are much better restaurants with a much greater choice of food in Bristol. I ordered a couple of sausage rolls which at ¬£2.50 each I thought were quite pricey. They were ok, I've had better! I would like to go back and try the bread as that is what seems to get the best reviews.

Through no fault of it's own this establishment should not be the #1 rated restaurant on trip advisor for Bristol. Don't get me wrong I don't want to pick faults as the staff were lovely and friendly and my freshly baked croissant tasted like a freshly baked croissant should, as did the wife's bread pudding cake. It was great to see the bakers at work preparing all the new products but this is not a restaurant. If you want a decent sized hearty lunch or breakfast then look elsewhere.

I've tried several of their various sweet and savoury goods, they're all great. Once upon a time they sold some marmalade which was also terrific.

That bread though, their standard sourdough...it's remarkable. Truly remarkable.

Back in around 2011 when I first saw ¬£3 next to a loaf of bread I thought..."Hmm, really?" Now though, when it's sliced thick, toasted, buttered and marmaladed...it's stunning. Likewise with eggs on top, little chilli jam...it's to die for.

Nobody else does bread as good as Harts. Fact. Try it to believe it.

what a find. loved the sausage rolls lovely buttery pastry & raspberry brownie delicious
bacon muffin good , but too big/rich a little fatty 
look forward to trying other items in future cinnamon  buns & pasty's look tempting

Review Title: Delicious, bread, cakes, savouries and coffee
Review Text:
Been here a few times now and it just gets better and better. Great bread, coffee, cakes, toasted sarnies, soup and savouries. Great atmosphere and staff that care about the people they're serving and the food that's on offer.

The sausage and apple roll this morning was divine; incredibly tasty and moist with a superb pastry covering. Once eaten you'll never want another warmed up frozen sausage roll again.

Food is prepared towards the back of their unit, which is in one of the arches under Bristol Temple Meads station, and it's just great to see the team preparing and cooking the various foods on offer. Only a small menu but spot on. It's a bakery after all and not a full restaurant. 

The bread on offer is various forms of sourdough and the toasted sarnies they make with it are delicious. Bread is also on sale and seems to be going out the door all the time. Just hope they can make enough to keep up with demand.

It's clearly a success story that Bristol should be proud of. 

Tip - if you want to sit and eat get there before 12.00 as it very quickly fills up and has a limited amount of seats. This is not a criticism as it's a bakery with seats as opposed to a cafe. However, you shouldn't have to wait long for a seat as there's a high turnover of people popping in for a coffee and cake etc. and who are not there for a long, leisurely lunch. 

Will I be going back. Yes, time and time again.
Bought myself a sausage roll and pastry here and picked up a few for the kids, they were delicious! So tasty I would highly recommend this Bakery to anyone looking to grab a quick snack.

I had a almond croissant in an espresso bar and was so amazed by the croissant i asked where they got it from. The other couple in the bar had also been and insisted i visit as soon as possible. I was not disappointed, my husband and i have been most Saturdays since. There is normally a small queue (large after 10-10.30) but for good reason. The bread is excellent as are the pastries and 'Saturday bread' is also lovely. Not much seating so get there early if you want to enjoy some delicious coffee as well. The staff are friendly and efficient.
I toyed with not writing a review as it was sooo great I don't want too many queues there next time I go. Great toasties and amazing merguez sausage pasty.

During a two-month period in late 2013 I was on a work assignment in Bristol near the Temple Meads train station. During that time, I must have sampled Hart Bakery's lunch offerings and baked goods at least six times. I always ordered takeaway, but the vibe inside the bakery was always appealing and made me wish I had time for a sit down meal.
I found the food there to be delicious and creative. My favorites were the pasties, tarts, and brownies; not just any brownies...these had Earl Grey soaked prunes in them!
Truly delicious eats at this place and I highly recommend a visit if you're in Bristol.

I went in on the recommendation of all the glowing Tripadvisor reviews, expecting great things and they delivered! I got there too late to get any bread as they had sold out, but instead I had one of their pasties which was delicious, I shall return for bread soon!

This is a truly great place. 

The only problem with Harts bakery is that all other bread pales in comparison! Why would you buy bread any where else?

It's worth seeking out this little bakery, which is hidden away beneath one of the arches in the Temple Meads station approach. Their sourdough is just incredible and they have mouthwatering cakes, pastries, stews and pasties, with a different selection every day.
Found and went solely on the basis of trip advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. Lovely coffee, a brilliant atmosphere and delicious cakes. Well worth a trip.

This place is friendly and unpretentious with beautiful, simple food. My boyfriend recently attended an evening baking course here and I have been eating the spoils ever since! It's lovely to see someone who cares so much about their craft and is so knowledgable. Thank you Laura Hart for showing us how bread should taste!

There's no nonsense about bicycles with no gears, rare bizarre coffee, or many of the style over substance 'hubs' that we see today. This is a really very good bakery and coffee shop. If you drive there is always easy parking outside, a rare thing!

Review Title: Great for breakfast or lunch. Sometimes I go there for both.
Review Text: So easy to overlook this place but already becoming very popular due to the amazing artisan bread, cakes & specials they make. I try something different every time I go there and I've enjoyed everything I've ever eaten there. Really friendly helpful staff. Nice energy in the place. You can see people prepping food and emptying ovens. I love their sour dough, cinnamon buns & cauliflower cheese pasties.

Came as a family a while a go and loved it. Perfect before your train because its just under temple meads.

I recommend to definitely
Go!!!!!!

Low key,  tucked away under the car park. Unassuming front gives way to a friendly relaxed open plan space where delicious food served with v nice coffee. 

Great value and service excellent. 

Recommend you go now before everyone finds out about it.

But it's true, this bakery is 100%. I took the train to Temple Meads from the Severn Beach line this morning and, yes, the coffee is REAL plus the croissants are the best I've had, even in France. Service is attentive and professional, nice people. Highly recommended. Prices are good, it 's tucked away under the car park in front of the station but easily accessible down the steps.

I love the bustly welcoming vibe of this place, whether i'm grabbing something to take out, dining solo, or eating with friends, Hart's bakery hits the right notes everytime.
The delicious pasties are a meal in themselves, and i believe i've found my favourite and then i discover a new flavour- Like Coq au vin, or cauliflower cheese!
I can also recommend the variety of sausage rolls and the sourdough bread, not to mention the dozens of sweet treats.
I love the friendly atmosphere and open layout of Hart's, where you can see the pastries being made for yourself, and all the staff serve and chat...
Be warned once you have a taste of it you'll be back!
What a wonderful place - I found it by accident and I'm now a regular - whether it be for a lunchtime bowl of divine soup, a toastie or a takeaway loaf of fantastic bread. It really is worth a visit.

Amazing cakes, fantastic pastries, gorgeous bread, wonderful warming soup and a lovely warm welcome! Beware....it's addictive!
We'll be back very soon.

Review Title: The best pastry I've eaten anywhere, ever.
Review Text:
Here's my advice: don't go to Hart's Bakery. Because if you do you might get there before me and buy all the delicious pastries, and then there will be none left for me, and I will have to hunt you down and mug you for your doughy goodness.

Amazing croissant and the best Danish I've eaten not only in Bristol but anywhere. 

Coffee is also excellent, and the pasties and other savoury things delicious too.

The staff are friendly, led by Laura Hart herself, and it's great to see them at work in the open plan bakery while you buy/eat.

Working in the area, colleagues had mentioned discovering this hidden gem but today, meeting two friends for a well ovedue catch-up, was the first visit I've made. Oh my God. Arriving half an hour early, the temptation to resist until the last friend turned up vanished literally minutes once we'd got inside. The display of cakes and savouries at the counter, together with the various loaves on offer, proved too much and we simply had to fill the time somehow! By the time she arrived, we were ready for seconds, and were still tempted to buy more to take-away a few hours later. Everything we had was divine, the staff are fantastically friendly, there was a steady stream of customers (some of whom are clearly regulars) whilst in the background a constant hive of activity by the bakers kneading dough and making pasties just added to the atmosphere. An absolute gem of a find - go there soon to find out why all the reviews are so good! I promise you'll go back time and again! We will!

Review Title: Bakery best in Bristol. Coffee and snacks excellent
Review Text: When hart's bakery was round the corner i put on half a stone. Now the walk there and back means i can indulge again. I was a desperate character waiting for the relocation. Back to happiness and satisfaction. Only trouble is getting purchases home without breaking into the bags and scoffing the lot. This is bakery as it should be and dream about. Thank you hart's.

What a find!

Hart's is tucked away to the right of the station approach as you come up the station in one of arches opposite the Bristol and Exeter House under the car park; in fact it is so tucked away that despite being a regular traveller I had missed it for almost a year after it arrived.

However, having found it I have enjoyed its fare regularly over the past fortnight.

It is an awesome bakers selling the most delicious fresh bread but strictly speaking this is a restaurant review so they also sell delicious cakes and coffee.

They serve a range of pastries, cakes and savouries all of which are fresh and great value. I would highly recommend looking out for it next time you are in the area.

I found Harts bakery almost by mistake really; I was searching for a supplier for a future enterprise and noticed they were supplying my competition so headed down to their site near Temple Meads station.

Hart's is a bakery but like most good bakeries they have set up somewhere you can also sample their wares pretty much as it comes out of the oven. A few rustic looking trestle tables and some retro chairs fill the entry to the bakery and are great places to sit and enjoy the food, great Extract Roasters Coffee and watch the world go by slowly outside and the the flurry of baking activity inside. 

The flurry of activity surrounds alchemic creations in each deck of their oven as they produce savoury sausage roles and pasties, alongside fantastic cakes - try the carrot and walnut its sublime. Although the custard tarts shouldn't go without a mention. 

The service is very good and the team seem genuinely nice too.

Review Title: Fresh and flavoursome baked treats straight from the oven
Review Text:
I was in here on a Saturday morning when I was staying at a nearby hotel. I had a cinnamon bun while I waited for my sourdough toast and homemade raspberry and vanilla jam. Both were just perfect. 

It was great being able to watch Laura Hart calmly and expertly mixing up the breads and cakes and pulling out fresh baked goods while we munched on our breakfast. There isn't much seating but there is a good flow of turnover so just be patient. The sour cream and apple cake was really original and I would have it again. I'll happily invent excuses to come to Bristol for this bakery again. Good value too and decent flat white.

I'm lucky to work at Temple Quay, as it means I can eat lunch here regularly. Harts fits all my requirements that food is fresh, good value and local, and that meat is ethically sourced. The preparation area is also very clean, and it is open so you can watch the bakers at work while you have a coffee. The staff are passionate about food and the menu changes daily, but I recommend the toasties, a Cornish pasty or a sausage roll. Things sell out quickly so it's best to arrive early, but there are usually at least toasties left over, and savoury goods tend to still come out of the oven until at least 1pm. Coffee here is also exceptional.

If you decide to eat in you'll probably have to share one of the long tables with other customers, however this is no bad thing and it adds to the very relaxed friendly atmosphere that the bakery has.

Definitely give it a go if you're in the area!

I've eaten fantastic bread many times while travelling in Italy, France and Denmark but the sourdough from this bakery is the best I've ever tasted. (I noticed a stack of bags of flour in the kitchen - Shipton Mill Organic).

The croissants are sublime. The 'toasties' are exquisite. This is a gem of a place - rare quality and unpretentious.

Don't go here for fine dining. Just go for the best sourdough bread,the tastiest sausage rolls and the most innovative cakes in Bristol .Pasties are really good and the sourdough cheese toasties look look brilliant.

Go early,they sell out quickly or phone your order ahead.  Staff are really friendly. If you are travelling from Temple Meads and want a snack don't buy in the station,go down the metal stairs right of the station and buy from the bakery.

After my first visit I was very impressed. And after my second. After my third, it was obvious this bakery cafe consistently produces some of the best products in England (best in Bristol) and the espresso (French style) was excellent.
Hart's bakes high quality bread and most enjoyable sweet and savoury delights. Quality ingredients, skill and a baker's love, gives results you will travel an awful long way to better. 
The pain chocolate and pain aux raison are in the world top 3 (the other two are in Paris [no surprise] and Canberra]. Forget that plastic wrap *rap in the supermarket and give yourself some Hart.

Review Title: I want to give this 10 stars!!
Review Text:
This bakery is right there at Bristol Temple Meads station but a bit hidden away. You have to go out of the station, turn left, go down some stairs and there it is on your right, a bakery and cafe. But, wow, what a bakery!

Everything made there is fresh and delicious. The bakers really love bread and baking. They're passionate about what they are doing and this comes across in the food. This tiny bakery also bakes and delivers to some of Bristol's best coffeehouse but this is the source.

Not to be missed. A revelation. One of the best bakeries I have ever been to.
Lovely staff. Wow banana cake. Great coffee. Just wish it was closer. If visiting Bristol you should go.

Review Title: Exquisite fresh food, and friendly staff one of my favourite bakeries.
Review Text: Hart's bakery is just wonderful! I often worry if the food is made that day, not just left from yesterday! But you see it being made and must I say there kitchen is very clean, and the staff couldn't of been more friendly or helpful! And the food was just heavenly and reasonably priced! There is no disappointing thing about it! Hart's Bakery couldn't be improved!

I had read about this bakery/cafe in Olive magazine and was visiting Bristol for the day (3 August 2013) so decided to visit. It's a little difficult to find, but persevere - it's worth it. 

I have visited hundreds of cafes and none of them compare to the quality of the produce served here. I had a coffee, which was really good - and shared a piece of the banana and toffee cake and the sour cream and apple cake. They were both absolutely stunning. They were so good, that I decided to buy one of the freshly baked pasties to take with me - aubergine, chickpea and tomato - it was also absolutely amazing.

The staff were very friendly. The prices are extremely reasonable for the quality of the food. It's got a really nice atmosphere and you can watch the staff baking.

I can't praise it enough. Well done to the owner/staff - this is what every bakery/cafe should be like.

I walk past temple meads everyday. I have only just made the effort to visit this place. Firstly its very reasonably priced for a coffee place. I had breakfast there and a suasage roll lunch today. Both the cinamon bun I had for breakfast and the sausage roll are the best Ive had. Also super friendly service and nice coffee. I'll be visiting regularly from now on.

This is without a doubt the best bakery in Bristol and in such a great location under Temple Meads arches. Real sourdough bread, cakes and pastries which make you mouth water. The coffee is also top quality. It is all so fresh- you can see the food coming out of the ovens. 
It is a really exciting place to eat, or take away.
Probably the best bakery in Bristol at present. Next to Temple Meads. If you drive then free parking. Also got outside seating for sunny days. Give it a try, see how good baking can be!

Bei coeliac it's hard to find bread which is edible!. OMG I have found the freshest the tastiest seeded loaf on this planet , my first loaf was gone in one day couldn't stop putting a good bit of lurpack on and it was delicious!!!!!
Even do gf Cornish pasties,scones ect
An absolute gem of a bakery perfect food for all perfect warming staff and such a pleasant bakery... WELL DONE!*********
A lovely traditional bakery. Fantastic fresh bread. Lovely Belgium buns and chocolate Viennese. Definitely worth a visit üòä

Review Title: The Absolute Best Gluten Free Bakery
Review Text:
Just to let all you fellow Coeliacs out there, that you must visit this bakery. They offer scrumptious white and seeded loaves, mouth watering muffins, the best sausage rolls and meat pasties that I have ever tasted. I literally tried them all during our holiday over the ladt two weeks. They even offer a delivery service.
Please do visit or try an online order you will not be disappointed üåü

When I lived in Bude some (??) years ago this was the bakery we used and it hasn't changed! Glorious fresh baked bread; incredible real cornish pasties and so much more. Give it a go, you won't be disappointed

Review Title: Best place for Cornish pasties in Bude
Review Text:
We were looking for somewhere to pick up some authentic Cornish pasties while we were in Bude. The sign outside Lansdown Bakery informed us that they've been doing it since 1839 so we figured they probably know what they're doing! 

The pasties were delicious, really full and the perfect lunchtime snack. Their other products also looked great, but we were on a hunt for the perfect pasty, and we got it!

We love this place, the staff are nice, welcoming and super helpful. We visit here almost daily when at my parents cottage and holidaying. The Pasties are the best we have ever had. 
The selection of cakes and gluten free vegan options are amazing (even though we aren't either). They literally cater for everyone and the price is so reasonable. We find cornish pasties anywhere else seem to be too seasoned or bland. If you visit Bude, this bakery is an absolute must. We even called on Friday on the way home to save eating rubbish food at the service stops. We will definitely be visiting again.

Returned after excellent bakery products last year and we weren't disappointed. Had hot pasties last time to eat on the beach. We chose cold traditional pasty and cheese and potatoe pasties this time to warm up at home for dinner. Nice well balanced seasoning cooked &, well filled with authentic Cornish filling heated well in the oven but would imagine quality results if we'd used used microwave.Have tried different bakers in Bude but would highly recommend this small friendly shop.

Review Title: A proper little gem of a bakery
Review Text:
We loved this little bakery.
Great service with in our view the best pasties in Bude.
Also the Bread pudding was to die for 
we had 2 every day of our 4 day stay & our only regret was not ordering some to bring home.
Fantastic, we found they were the best homemade in Bude, yep we tried them all. Bought six to bring home to Derbyshire, froze them, had one tonight, delicious.

Who doesn‚Äôt love some gluten free cake on a Monday morning? Read our 4* review of the Lansdowne Bakery, Bude at¬†coeliacwellnes.com.¬† Range of gluten free cakes, breads, biscuits, flapjacks, macaroons, muffins, pies and pasties all nestled in this little gem.¬† Has some really good coeliac friendly practices, with an extensive range of gluten free vegan/plant based treats. Needs to standardise their labelling but otherwise excellent.
Amazing pasties omg so tasty and flavoursome. Out of all of the pasties I've had these are the best. Highly recommended. Many thanks Paul and Sam from Hampshire
I highly recommended bakery very friendly and excellent  range of bakery and home delivery I have using them for few years now thank you

Love getting our sourdough bread delivered on Friday, yummy.  But on going to the shop the staff are great.

Thanks Andrew.

We liked the pasties and breakfast buns at this bakery. The staff are friendly. Queues outside seem a good sign. The bakery dates from the 19th century and is in a good location. There‚Äôs a good display of their products in the window including lardy cake, Chelsea buns, doughnuts, pasties, cream cake, tiffin and slices.

Great vegan sausage roll - crispy and buttery pastry and a tasty filling.  The cake selection was amazing, as was the hot pies/pastries etc. 
very friendly staff
decent prices

We visit this bakery every year when on holiday. 
Amazing staff amazing food, especially the pasties, bread pudding and treacle tart.
The beat pasties in town.

Very nice pasties, but not quite as good as the Cornish Bakery.
Good ingredients, but not the same level of seasoning. This ends my pasty survey in Bude! Didn't have time to eat any more and now need to lose some weight!!

The selection of cakes is vast. The bread and butter pudding was really delicious and a big portion. We also had a veggie pasty which was Luke warm and a little pale and a curry pasty. However when we looked in the bag, it wasn‚Äôt a curry pasty at all, I would say a pastry slice. I am Cornish and it was not a proper pasty. But the filling was nice.

This place didn't come up at all when I searched fpr vegan food in Bude, but it had amazing vegan pasties which were super tasty, vegan sausage rolls, vegan desserts like chelsea and iced buns and their vegan creamcake is THE best bakery dessert I've ever had!! It was packed to the brim with jam and vegan cream. Would recommend this place for good cornish, seaside style food, would definitely return.

Lovely and tempting freshly made. Wonderful selection of baked goods to choose from. Old fashioned favourites. Lovely, caring and knowledgeable staff. Doughnuts very fresh and moorish, Took us back to childhood days. Meat pies were lovely.

We were made to feel lovely & welcome by the lady serving us.  We bought some fresh baps for our burgers & purchased some buttercream meringues which were lovely.  Small bakery but lovely & traditional.  Well worth a visit.

The only trouble with this place is there's so much to choose from I have to resist coming out with a box of cakes instead of just one.  All beautifully laid out and far too tempting for my own good.  Great fresh baked bread too especially the cottage loaf.

Review Title: The best iced Finger buns I have ever eaten
Review Text:
Lovely bread, cakes, pastries and sandwiches made to order.
Friendly staff in lovely little shop and the nicest iced finger buns I have ever eaten.
We bought a vegetable pasty from here, and it was very tasty. A relief it did not have too much pepper like we experienced from another pasty outlet

Small local bakery with an excellent selection of both savoury and sweet treats. The Sicilian lemon yum yums are absolutely delicious, the sausage rolls and Cornish pasties are pretty good too. If you are staying anywhere near bude definitely pay this place a visit. They even do cream teas to take out in a box

we have been going to this bakery, for a number of years, every time we visit Bude, we always go in and buy, cakes, to take back home, we made a visit on Friday 13th Sept.
my daughter purchased, a cheese and onion pasty, my wife, 2 iced buns and me I got what I always buy, 2 pieces of Bread pudding. when we returned home, pasty was OK, iced buns were a little dry, and the Bread pudding, they did not lie it 99 per cent bread, and i think they shot the fruit in, from a shotgun. from a long distance away, very disappointing. It could have been the full moon?
Lovely Local Cornish delights. really well made & scumpsious. Good prices, lots to choose from. I would love a bakery near me like this place

Review Title: The best cake shop in Bude
Review Text: The staff are wonderful, friendly and will do anything for you. The range of cakes is amazing and the great plus is they bake Lardie Cake too!!!! What more can you want. Be sure to visit this bakers if want, great service with a huge smail and delicious bakery goods.

I visit Bude twice a year and always head here to buy bread rolls as lovely and soft. Delicious homemade pizza too.

Cakes delicious as well!

Struggled to find anywhere in Bude to get a nice sandwich & then we stumbled across this bakery! With it's fresh filled rolls & baguettes & beautiful baked cakes, we left as 5 very happy customers. Only wish I had found this place sooner
Enjoyed the homemade pasties. Plenty of choice from scones to fresh cream cakes. Will return for more.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Good range of pasties, even gluten free. I enjoyed a large Cornish pasty which was really delicious, seasoning was just perfect, plenty of meat too! Best in the area in my view. Large assortment of cakes and buns looked lovely. My Chelsea bun was perfection. All was good sized and excellent value for money. Thank you!

Brilliant variety of bread loaves rolls etc & good selection of cakes 
Hot snacks including pasties 
Friendly service every time & reasonable prices
lovely fresh pasties, sausages rolls and cakes. recommend you drop in when in Bude , the staff are friendly and helpful xx

Review Title: What a bakers should be like
Review Text:
A great variety of fresh and proper bread, the cottage rolls were superb, crusty on the outside but inside soft and fluffy.
A great selection of cakes, and of course we had to try the scones, although it was difficult resisting the temptation to buy 1 of everything!  The scones were perfect- not too big, light and tasty in their own right.  
And then the scotch eggs- yes real scotch eggs not those pale supermarket immitations.  Just enough crumb, a proper meaty sausage meat and then an egg that when it was cut open had a vivid gold yolk.  Oh and of course the pasty- one of the best I tried on this week in Cornwall.  Prcies fair, service with a smile and helpful advice 
Why isn't there a branch in my town?!
They do a great choice for pasties which a very good. They are a meal on there own.Good choice of rolls and bread.

this place is so oldy worldy its lovely you can have a freshly made roll/sandwich made while you wait on any type of bread/roll/bagette, and while that's being done you can have a lovely cup of tea made, excellent value and service with a smile.
