Great little bakery, lots of choice, we had four different flavour pasties and each one was delicious. Went back for cakes and again, lovely.  Staff were so welcoming and friendly, would reccomend

Review Title: Very poor quality bread. Really disappointed as we used this before (3 years ago).
Review Text: Three years ago we used this bakery and loved it. But it has changed. I purchased a loaf of bread and as I cut it is started to crumble? The flavour was bland. Now we have used this bakery before and it was great. But it was not just me but my wife also who felt it was no where near the quality as before. In fact the local Morrisons Bakery was far superior. Dark topped fresh bread that tasted great. Way better and for a bakery to lose out to a superstore is so rare in my opinion. As for the pasties? Go across the road where you can see them being made at Pengenna Pasties. They are way way better. I know as I have eaten from both. Do the taste test if you want. But it will be obvious who is the winner.... enjoy :-)
Went for a walk along the canal and decided to walk through the town. Plenty of little shops and individual shops to browse.

Review Title: ¬£8.50 for 2 small, cold cheese and onion pasties!
Review Text: A work colleague ran a lunch run for us and came back with two cheese and onion pasties, they were cold and not very big either. It cost me ¬£8.50 for two pasties, appalling! My colleague even went back into the shop to double check they hadn‚Äôt short changed them! They didn‚Äôt even taste nice! We won‚Äôt be going back. There is high competition for pasty shops in Bude and I have had far nicer pasties elsewhere. Don‚Äôt waste your money here.
A must do on a visit to Bude, lovely selection of cakes. The iced & chelsea buns in particular are lovely. Worth a visit.

Been here 2 years now, one of the best things we ever did relocating!! Bude is lovely, unspoiled by the usual trappings of a 'seaside' town like noisy amusements and shops selling rubbish.  Lots to see and do, great places to eat and drink, friendly people, its nice and clean (compared to other places I could mention) and is quite obviously well loved, even by us! And finally of course its in Gods own country, Cornwall!!

Only went in for my bread & came out with an armful of beautiful home made Christmas goodies....gift boxes of shortbread bites, gingerbread snowmen & truffles. Then, I just had to get some mince pies. Which to choose ? 3 different sorts ( better have one of each ! )  Thought I'd done....then I spotted the Christmas cake & Yule logs. Oh dear !!
Would have had a coffee, but I couldn't carry it !
Always get my sausage rolls from here - and they're always yum. Also always get a very friendly welcome. Thanks guys xxx
¬£4.50 For a bland cornish pasty which was 95% potato. Not worth the money at all. Should of read the reviews.

Visited Bude last winter for a late break. The beach is stunning and on a windy winter day with the waves crushing again the cliffs and shoreline amazing.  There are plenty of good place to stay, eat and drink and it is an ideal base for coastal walks.

OMG where to start this is the best bakers I have been to for Gluten free goodies, there was a great selection and they all looked so good.  I had the lemon muffins which were really tasty you would never know they were gluten free and a pasty. You do have to wait 30mins while they cook the pasty but they take your mobile nozand call you when it‚Äôs ready and it was dead on the time given.
They have fresh bread as well you are spoilt for choice.
My daughter eats wheat and had the fresh pizza slice and the chicken curry pasty for the 2nd year running it really is our go to place for lunch when we are in Bude.

They also have a cafe further up the road that has waitress service and the girls were really polite.

I had high hopes after reading some of the reviews and having a wheat intolerance I was looking forward to a gluten free pasty. I popped in and was advised if I came back in half an hour I could have one. 

So I did. I was told that it would be another ten minutes. I bought a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù pasty and scones and some gluten free scones, cream and jam and proceeded to wait for another 20 minutes. Eventually the young girl who had been dealing with me from the start came down and pulled a colleague to one side. I heard the lady say well just tell her and give her a refund. The young girl then came over to explain that the gluten free pasty had never actually gone in and refunded me the ¬£4 something it had cost. I said it was ok and left the shop as I felt bad for her. 

On reflection though I don‚Äôt understand why I was told they had checked and it would be another ten minutes of it wasn‚Äôt in the oven. I also would never have bothered buying all of the other stuff and we would have ate somewhere else. I don‚Äôt think the response was anything like good enough once the mistake was realised. I had wasted almost an hour and had bought food for my partner and child and had nothing to eat myself. I don‚Äôt even blame the young girl, she was really nice and clearly mortified. She had asked an older and presumably more experienced colleague, potentially the manager or owner, for help. They should have stepped up not sent the poor girl over to apologise and give me my ¬£4 back. 

I even waited a few days before submitting this review just to make sure I wasn‚Äôt fuming because I was hungry, haha! To top it off I warmed the GF scones that evening to have with cream and jam and they weren‚Äôt nice. Pete and Georgia advised their food wasn‚Äôt up to much either although they could have been trying to make me feel better. 

I may well get some defensive reply but please bear in mind I work with customers myself and I know that mistakes happen but service really fell short here and things could have been dealt with better.

Unfortunately the pasty was a let down for us. Wasn't the best taste and to top it off my husband had what we can only think was a hard bit of white plastic in his! Needless to say he didn't eat anymore of it. How on earth that had made its way into the filling is beyond me, not nice.
Just go in you'll not get better it's all just really tasty you won't know what to have so try everything ( not all at once,oh why not your on holiday)
LOVE LOVE this bakery.  Always have fresh baked cakes, pasties, bread etc every day.  So friendly, always service with a smile, always have cinnamon swirl/danish every time. Good value for money.

We were staying locally at Burn Park and needed fresh bread but did not know the town very well.  However, we had just had super mussels at Scrummies and when we came out we saw the bakery opposite and went to have a look.

My wife dragged me inside the little shop and immediately the baking aromas said 'buy me, eat me' almost like Alice in Wonderland.  Then I saw the range of cakes and the 2 kindly ladies looked on and smiled as they had seen this bemused, 'what do I choose' look before.  

Not surprisingly we went OTT and bought bread and cakes enough for several days.  It was worth it.  

We have happily been back since and we were remembered by one of the ladies! Hugely recommended if you want to spoil yourself!

We stopped here to get pasties for a late lunch one day! The pasties were delicious and full to the brim with fillings! The kind lady in the shop was almost ready to close and offered us a some bread rolls to take away at a reduced price. Their products are fresh and baked daily! Delicious find!

Horrendous staff - very rude Scottish lady and they microwave the Cornish pasties . Go elsewhere !
No customer care and they are in a rush to get you out the shop. There are better bakeries in Bude with nicer products !
This was our third pasty of the week, and have to say it was the best. Lovely pastry, and gorgeous filling too.
Scrummy cakes and great selection of bread.  We are on holiday and they very kindly put order on one side for us to collect later which was very helpful.
Gem of a find..gf pasties, scones & muffins.Bake gf bread on Tuesdays and staff even able to suggest a couple of places to eat in the evening where they could cater for gf.

We popped into the Lasdowne to pick up a couple of scones for our cream tea and they were absolutely delicious. We also picked up the clotted cream and a local jam, with the shop assistant proving wonderfully helpful and friendly.

This is a great 'shopping local' bakery, with a great selection of sweet and savoury. Just a heads up though, they don't take cards!!
As we were in Bude again, a much anticipated revisit to this shop was greatly appreciated by all, as was the delectable edible delights.

I love this bakery just wish you were closer to home.
The lemon yum yums were yummy,
I asked the lady were was the nearest toilet for my 4 year old daughter and was told that I could use there toilet in the coffee shop which was a few doors down. 
The lady even said they would phone them to let them know we were coming.
Excellent customer service and fantastic food.
We only grabbed a quick snack but it was very nice.  The bakery has a lot of variety so most people would find something to enjoy.  The staff were friendly and happy so we couldn't ask for more

service was so friendly and helpful
food was excellent  definitely our baker of choice in the town by far
I seen a local using this bakery so had to try a pastie,turns out best pastie I've ever had a long with the cakes on offer this bakery is one i will be visiting every time i visit Bude.

Having eaten numerous pasties over the years the two Cheese pasties we bought here were bland and expensive. 
At ¬£4.25 each you would expect something  a bit special, but these were no different from a pasty in any village store that would have cost half that price. 
Not impressed.
Local bakery with pasties coming out of the oven, steaming on a tray. The cheese and onion pastie was a real meal and their Proper Pastie is what it says it is ... of course!

Called in the shop looking for a cup of tea (their caf√© is actually up the street).  Left the shop with the most gorgeous pasties!  The pastry! the filling! Everything  tasted magnificent.  While in the shop you can pick up a 10% loyalty discount card for the caf√© up the street.
Ordered a square fruit cake for my Father's 80th birthday.  The cake was lovely and moist.  Bit too much marzipan for my liking but everyone else enjoyed it!

We always use this bakery in Bude when we are staying in the area! Lovely pasties and other baked goodies! Staff are always welcoming and very patient with my children who change their minds about 10 times! 

Look forward to coming back again soon!

Review Title: best of the best for bread
Review Text: been going there for a long time and love the bread and cakes plus they vary friendly servies  and if love you fresh food then this for you
Occasionally pop in for pasties and pastries, nice friendly people and good service! Enjoyed the large steak pastie recently, really hit the spot!!

Went to Bude for the day, had a lovely walk around on a cold but dry day. Popped in for a bun, ended sitting outside with the dog to have my lovely fresh chelsea bun. The 2 ladies in the shop were a credit to the bakery, both were very pleasant...thank you

The  bakery has a cafe further up the road serving a wide range of  bread and cake and pies all prepaired on site
The cafe is small but with seating upstairs and outside. To many cakes and pies  to try them all but after two visits tried a few all delicous

I wouldnt normally review for a takeaway pasty, but this was super disappointing. Imagine a fab tasty freshly baked soft moist pasty with crispy pastry - if only this was the reality. It was in my view probably the worst pasty I've ever had. We had the giant one. Perhaps the others might be better. And it had grit in it. With more time and energy I would have gone back for a refund!
Seemed to provide local items baked locally and the pasties, bread and cake were all very good. Good choice of pasties with curry & beef spiced our favorites.

I pop in 3-4 times a week now, so consider myself a regular ! Loving the tiger bread, & sour dough . If you fancy croissant or pain au choc , they'll make them for you in  15/ 20 minutes.  Nothing is too much trouble, always warmly greeted & I noticed the staff often greet people by name. Such a happy atmosphere, would love to work there, but would eat all their profits !
cream teas and bread pudding to die for,clean friendly shop with lots to choose from.Cornish pasties are great as well

What a fantastic little bakery! Their Cornish pasties are to die for! Many more flavours to choose from you don‚Äôt fancy them! Spoilt for choice with the buns and cakes. I couldn‚Äôt not take some fresh bread back with me too! 
The staff are so pleasant, with a nice warm welcome, and will answer any questions you have.
I can definitely recommend to anyone visiting the area

I have always found the staff very helpful and friendly as for the range of products you are spoilt for choice all freshly baked on the premise's the bakers bring in the hot pasties sill on the baking trays to the shop (smell fantastic) well worth a visit in my opinion
Rude off hand staff and all to obvious defects in basic hygiene would make a return visit a choice to avoid. old building in poor condition, slack attention to detail.
Not much else to say really!  I have been visiting Bude for many years and always get our pasties here, they are always delicious.  Lovely people cooking and selling them as well!

Bought a chicken pasty here,paid 3.95 for it,it was ok,only ok tho,very expensive,i did notsee the price until i was being served,should have walked out really at that price,ask first i would before you order. Chicken was nice it it,it was not very big tho for that price.Nice staff but they dont wear gloves ,which i dont like to be honest.

I visited here to buy two pasties. We came on our last holiday and really enjoyed them. 
Was disappointed firstly when my boyfriend opened the fridge to buy a bottle of water and cleanliness of the fridge was appalling! It was dirty and sticky all up the door and at the bottom of the fridge. You couldn't miss the dirt! Looking around I noticed some obvious cleanliness problems such as the walls were dirty and streaky and the floor. As a chef I'm aware of cleanliness of kitchens and I wasn't impressed at all by their shop or kitchen. 

The pasties are nice, but as soon as I noticed the poor cleanliness I didn't enjoy my pasty as much. A shame because we usually visit this shop when we're in Bude! The Assistant serving us was very knowledgeable regarding the pasties. 
I did look for a Hygiene rating, but one couldn't be found. Would be interested to know the rating.

Review Title: Pasties looked really nice, but was disappointed as they were average.
Review Text: I decided to get a steak and Stilton pastie and my wife and children sausage rolls and was a little disappointed as they looked tasty, but the meat was a bit mushy in all of them.
Love this small quaint independent bakers. Lovely cakes pasties and bread baked on the premises. Always popular with the locals
great scones all baked on premises plus all other breads and cakes they also sell pots of cream so you have all you need to make your own cream tea at home
Lovely bakery - wish there were more like this around. Superb fresh bread just like it ought to be and very nice saffron buns. Kind lady serving. Will certainly visit again - highly recommended.
Love the pasties and bread pudding. We visit every time we're in Bude. Place is amazing and the staff make it even better

I live near Launceston and have given this place a go twice now while visiting Bude and have been disappointed each time.  A rather surly lady serving.

The pasty I had was dry, poorly filled and a bit gristly... definitely not a good representation of a Cornish pasty.

My partner bought donuts and mine was mediocre (not awful), but hers had some strange slightly green matter in it and went in the bin.  We weren't going to drive to Bude to take it back.

It's a shame because it's an old bakery but of course history doesn't necessarily count for a lot.

Lots of people seem happy with it looking at the reviews, and there's not a right lot of competition in Bude, but we've found better so won't be back.

This is such a good little bakery. There is your usual selection of bread, cakes, treats and of course pasties. You can also get fresh yeast from the bakery which we use in our bread maker. The bread rolls are perfect for BBQs. The staff are helpful and friendly. A really lovely place to buy some very reasonably priced baked goods.

Review Title: Gluten free bread , pasties and scones in Bude
Review Text:
Visited Bude for a lovely weeks holiday and found this fabulous bakery. Freshly made bread, bread rolls, pasties,  scones and other cake selections all gluten free. They even baked some fresh to order as they had run out of scones. 
I couldn't believe how good the bread was the best I (coeliac) have ever tasted. Well worth a trip to stock up. 
Highly recommnd.
Excellent & value for money little family bakery. Great bread & pasties. Not tried the cakes, but always pop in when in Bude

What a great little bakery!  Plenty of selection of home made cakes, pies, sausage rolls etc - the bread in particular is very good and if you are watching your waist you might want to look away from the Florentines which are the best I've had in a long time!
Bought 2 pastys and a sausage roll. Pasty looked very appetising but when I bit into it the pastry sank as it was barely filled. I was still hungry after I'd eaten it.

Someone has reported that they came to Bude in 2000  and have returned to find it unchanged. We take that as a compliment but things obviously have changed over the years except  our hope that you will visit us and enjoy your stay.

The Bude Sea Pool is free and cleaned every day by the tide and there are not many sea pools like this one in the country. It is maintained and paid for by local people. There are loads of restaurants to suit all tastes and pockets. Large car parks and wonderful walks along the coast or the canal. The beaches are sandy and the surfing is free. If you just want to sit and look at the sea, you could hire a beach hut and just relax.

Bude is what an English Seaside holiday should be. Playing on the beach, rambling the countryside, playing golf, tennis or bowls, sitting outside a pub or wandering round the shops. Whatever you like it is a quiet, safe beautiful place to visit and YOU are welcome.
Always delicious well cooked pasties, great selection of traditional as well as vegetarian and gluten free, beautifully cooked and delicious to eat, the best bakery in Bude for a Pasty.

Review Title: Great range of pasties and rolls
Review Text: Donuts, Apple puffs and pasties after a good days surf. Don't have to queue in the summer! Friendly service!

I live in Bude and have been here several times. It's by no meals awful, it's quite standard. I've had a few cheese and onions pasties in the past and the pastry wasn't cooked very well and had to chuck it away. I have never bought one since. The staff are friendly and kind though.

Purchased several lunches / light snacks here for some of our coastal walks.  Good quality and value-for-money.
Also have coffee shop 100yds back up the hill.

We visited having seen sum good looking cakes in the window. We purchased more cakes than intended but all where very good , moist and tasty. I was surprised they opened on a Sunday in November , but glad of it. The staff friendly and helpful, and some offers available as well.
Poor attitude and rubish Pasty...I am a Cornishman and know a good Pasty when I am eating one. The Pasty was advised as warm but was cold. Pastry was not cooked and the filling was...what meat?

Lovely fat and full pasties, just how we like them.  I had a medium and it filled me up (and I usually complain that a medium pasty isn't big enough!).  Service is always great in this place, we really must try their coffee shop up the road a little next time we visit.  My husband also had the bread and butter pudding which he really rated too.
Small bakery but pasties and sausage rolls were fab - got some straight out of the oven and they were amazingly tasty! Staff were also really helpful and friendly. Not too far from the beach either.
the first backery we entered and we got a bread for free !!!  And they have very tasty bread ! Very helpful ladies !

Visited from Widemouth to get bread etc for our self catering holiday home. What a treat everything we purchased was exceedingly good, well priced and so fresh. Would highly recommend - staff very helpful even under pressure as every time we visited the shop was full of customers. Large selection not to be missed.

Review Title: 3 ladies who came in for a smell of bread
Review Text:
Ended up leaving with 2 boxes of cake and a gluten free muffin. The cakes were shared with the men back at base, all gone with much munching. Delicious cakes and a very tasty and the GF muffin was lovely and light with a good lemony flavour.
Must try to get back on Tuesday for Gluten Free bread ( I have been infirmed this taste good too).
Read the end of this review and realised cakes gone too quick for a photo!
Ann and 2 mums.

You go to Cornwall and expect a decent pasty.  All the potato was undercooked and the meat was dry, on the whole the Cornish pasties we purchased here (5 in total) were all thrown.  The sausage roll was edible as my daughter ate it, but she said she was starving.
A wonderful family owed bakery. They do a wide range of fresh bread, cakes, pastries, and biscuits. Not forgetting the cream tea scones they also do.
Greats service and delicious pasties! must be one of the oldest shoes in Bude now. Brings back child hood memories!

So picturesque!

It's steeped with history and yet has a modern twist to it as well! It is clean and tidy. There are so many shops with everything you need here! We fell in love with Zuma Jay Surf shop!

Unfortunately I want just after the lunchtime rush so I had to have a giant Cornish pasty, as there wasn't a lot left. When they handed it to me it was GIANT. I'm quiet a big bloke and have eaten my fare share of pasties and this was one of the biggest I've had. It was also packed with filling and wasn't bumped up with pastry. They also had different cakes and rolls but I had no room for them as I had to share my pasty with my dog, and she really liked it.

Went to buy scones to take home, they were warm from the oven and smelled great.
I arrived in the shop first thing in the morning during a very heavy downpour and was dripping wet. The young lad serving allowed me to wait inside the shop until the rain had stopped, he also offered me a cup of tea while I waited. Which was a very kind offer, I was touched by the thoughtfulness. This kind of service is not seen very often these days, so thank you, kind sir.  The bread, scones and pasties we had had earlier in the week were delicious. Go to this little bakery, lots to choose from you will not be disappointed.  Just sorry you are not in our hometown.

No plastic gloves,no serving tongs....assistant just picked the pasties out with her bare hands and then took the money and gave change.Didn't wash her hands ,just went on serving other customers.
FOOD & MONEY....serious cross contamination issue here.

Dylans Guest house 
Stayed here 22/25th July couldn't be more happy it's a very homely warm and welcoming  guest house with hosts to match  beautifully decorated and modern we were shown into the dining room and given all the information  on our stay and places to visit and then we were shown our room which we were very happy with it overlooked the golf course was very spacious beautifully  clean and decorated  with a lovely modern  en suite 
Breakfast was delicious  good selection of cereals, fruit (fresh ) fruit juices  great menu for cooked and speciality yummy hot  toast  coffee and tea  no rush just very relaxing  Glen and Sarah made us feel very much at home  this is a place we recommend  very highly and will be visiting  again thank you Dylans  10/10

A fab town, with every shop you need! Gift shops, Post office,Jewellers, clothes, a fishing tackle shop and many more...There's plenty of food places, restaurants and supermarkets. Hire a boat and row down the river or book in the the glass making shop for a lesson in making your own glazed creation!
We always return ro the bakery to buy sandwiches or psties for a picnic lunch. Always excellend service.

We spent many happy holidays  in Bude in the mid 2000s, so it was with trepidation that we made a return visit to Bude this year, However nothing much has changed. Its still a lovely place to visit. The beaches are superb, there are excellent shops aand its just a lovely seaside resort .
Superb pasties with lots of choice. Lots of different breads etc. A really good bakery with very friendly and helpful staff. Great to see an independent bakery thriving. Well deserved!

Busy little seaside town.  Some unique shops which charge crazy prices for tat.  Nice walk down to the canal which leads to the beach.  Lots of ducks on the canal which is really lovely.  Very busy place in the summer.

It's always a treat when you can find a reliable bakery - especially when on holiday. When in South Hams we always detour to Frogmore to the bakery there with legendary doughnuts!
At the Lansdowne if you want sweet perversion try either a Forest Fruits or Apricot Danish. They are absolute whoppers compared to supermarket offerings & despite the syrup which will run down your arm (you can't avoid it like chewing a pastille) they are not sickly sweet. Just deliciously desirable.
The offer of a freshly baked pain au chocolate got my one adult son out of bed each morning to walk the dog on Summerleaze beach.
None sweet offerings - equally good are the range of breads and traditional Cornish Pasties. 
Do ask for a box if your purchases look delicate (we kept returning with ours to be refilled).
Bought some  lovely scones  and cream here.  Sandwiches and rolls freshly   made while  you wait, the ladies  in the shop wee very helpful

Review Title: Great range of pies and pasties
Review Text: great little place, wonderful choice of pies, cakes, pasties and bread. Friendly staff, had a curried chicken pasty - great
Had a lovely cup of coffee and cake one morning, friendly staff and very helpful, it was clean and very competitive in prices.

We go here for Pasties and pies whenever we are in Bude.

We can certainly recommend not only the pasties but also the strawberry tarts, scones with clotted cream and the apricot crumble.

A wonderful authentic tasting pastie, friendly staff and good value. Tried a rival alleged "gold medal winner" whilst in Newlyn, it did not come close to the Lansdown. Appreciate it is a personal choice thing.
Ordered pasty's for ten people and they were able to cater for us. Most went for the traditional which were very good but I would recommend the spicy chicken or cheese and bacon both very good.

Lovely little bakery with a fantastic selection of pasties, cakes and sandwiches. 

Best sausage rolls in Bude. 

Pasties were okay, bit too much pastry on the outer edge. We missed the hot pasties coming out the oven and were disappointed that ours were warmed up by microwave. 

I would avoid the lamb and mint pasty here, very sickly and left an aftertaste that was hard to get rid of. 

Gingerbread selection was good. 

Staff were fantastic and welcoming.
yummy pasties for lunch . one of the best pasties I have tasted. very large and filling. followed by one of their cakes. no good if you are on a diet.

Excellent friendly bakery, we always buy our bread and bread rolls there, Chelsea buns, Danish pastries and scones, dairy free cakes, freshly baked pasties, so much choice!  They also have a coffee shop up the road where you can sit down and enjoy cake and a coffee.

Hand made bread, home made cakes - all your old favourites & then some - all in this small, but amazing little bakery. So much to choose from, in fact you almost forget what you went in for, as there's so much to tempt you!
I also noticed that they have a good selection of dairy free & gluten free products which I will tell some of my friends about.
The ladies serving were very helpful & friendly & I will be returning on a regular basis (if only to get more "yum yums!")
Always get our pasties, pies, bread & cakes from this place. Very small but worth the effort/wait to get served if they are busy. Great tasting food & not to expensive.

No matter how many times we visit Bude we always enjoy strolling  round the various types of shops, cafes, restaurants that are found in this very busy place. Can be difficult at times to find somewhere to park. Lots of places to find Cornwall's famous pasties on sale & prices vary so check them out before buying.
This delightful little store has a fabulous choice and unexpectedly good quality bakes. Great tasting pasties and very friendly staff.
Never in my life have I seen such a variety of pasties! This was another hidden treasure at a quiet, unassuming end of the street. Thoroughly recommended!
Partner had a very good gluten free muffin, they also had a selection of breads. Was nice to find something that wasn't a coconut macaroon.
This is a great little bakery and the fresh baked bread is really scrummy, a little more expensive than supermarket bread but then this is real bread and you can so taste the difference.

We popped in here on the weekend to buy some piping hot pasties whilst sheltering from the weather. The food was delicious and the lady of the establishment was so chatty and friendly. We left with 10% vouchers to spend at the cafe up the road, and ingredients for a cream tea later, yum!

Review Title: The Best Cornish Pasties in Lansdown Road - period
Review Text: We tried out all the different pasties during our week and put on a lot of weight but it was worth it. They were delicious.
We go to this bakery almost daily they bake the most fantastic bread and cakes . They sell homemade pasties and other savouries . Very friendly people .
Lovely, traditional little bakery, we had a traditional & a lamb pasty & both were tasty, full of flavour & generous with the filling.

Review Title: Great independent bakery - yummy pasties and pastries
Review Text: This is the place to buy home made traditional Cornish pasties and other kind of pastries. Lovely are also the various rolls, scones and especially the butter croissants.

Visited  Bude last  year for a day when staying  in Launceston for a weeks holiday  so this year decided  to stay 5mins  outside Bude in the villiage of Stratton via a holiday  cottage for 2wks.
Bude is a great unspoilt  place that  has something  whatever the weather is & has so many choices to eat whatever your taste or budget.
Also very central  as the A39 runs via it so if you want to carry on down into Cornwall  or opposite  way into Devon more.

Quality homemade products,tried a few across the range but the cheese and onion pasties were the best.made with a flakey puff pastry with no added ingredients to bulk the filling unlike a well known mass producing bakery who are based in the north east of England(I know I worked at one of there regional bakeries and seen them being massed produced)before we left for Home in Manchester we had to make 7 mile detour to bude just so we could purchase to have for our tea back home.
When I visit Bude I buy scones, saffron cakes and saffron buns here, The freshly baked bread is good too. I can freeze the saffron buns too and eat them later at home to remind me of my holiday!

Review Title: Traditional bakery in centre of town
Review Text: lovely little bakery in the centre of Bude town, good selection of pasties and bread.   friendly service and popular with the locals which is always a good sign!

Wish I had read a previous post about the pasties. Let's just say what a waste of ¬£7.00. Bought one chicken curry and a chicken and leek YUCK!! Soggy, greasy and very salty. Both thrown in the bin. So disappointed, probably could have got better pasties from Greggs!
This is one of a kind.i can't fault this bakery,there bread ,cakes,pasty,are amazing,I use it every time I'm in bude,the staff are so friendly,and helpful.try it next time you are in bude.....

If I lived in Bude I would be two stone heavier, the bread is delicious, the cakes looked delicious but didn't partake.  We bought our bread rolls here to make sandwiches for lunch, fabulous. the iced fingers were delicious too, just wished we would have been there longer so we could have tried more!!
We popped in here for some Chelsea buns and a chocolate cookie and bread pudding which were all fab! We would recommend this place for people wanting cakes they were huge for really cheap prices.
Lovely bakery. The bread and cakes we bought were delicious. We also had a 10% off voucher which we received when visiting the coffee shop up the road, which was an added bonus.
Loved this place! Excellent bakery, with a range of breads and pasties. Can recommend the Chelsea buns and Cornish pasties
Lovely little seaside town. Not commercialised at all which I LOVE. Enough to do when the weather is dry, lots of lovely little shops and individual restaurants
Enjoyed walking around Bude.  Not too commercialised.  Hope it stays that way.  People in shops all very friendly.  Everyone has time to talk which is such a nice change from the London way.

Review Title: Great laid back venue in Cornwall
Review Text: We just love Bude,everything you need for a relaxed coastal break.Good choice of places to stay,from camping to top hotels.Adventure hotel for youngsters,surfing,kayaking,you name it.Go walking,surfing,riding you name it or,...just sit and watch the world go by,Bude has it all,shhh...dont tell too many people.

Went with the family for a weeks holiday.
Just not what was expecting , not much to do at all unless you like long coastal walks or sitting on the beach.
Feels as though you are stuck in the middle of no where 
There isn't many pubs or restaurants and the restaurants we did eat at were not good at all we had problems at each one With either bad service or terrible food!
Would not return here for a holiday prefer south Cornwall which is much better with lots more to do

A nice little town, p,entry of good shops, places to eat and nice walks.
Great for people on holiday as well
Bude is a really nice sea side town. Its got plenty to offer, lots of pubs, restaurants and some great beaches in the town. Lots of great cliff/canal walks. And good hotels

Extremely friendly and approachable. I bought the Lamb and Mint pasty, fresh out of the oven, and it was the best pasty I've ever had. 

My wife and daughter also fell in love with with the square white loaf and ringed doughnut with sprinkles. 

We made a few trips that week!

Review Title: Nice Place but not somewhere we would come back to... prefer more up market Padstow area
Review Text: We stayed just outside Bude at Treworgie and drove in a few times. It is a friendly place and feels quite safe.  Shops are mainly geared to tourists and the sea and a few restaurants to try, but so far nothing to rave about.  The beach at Summerleaze is very crowded and it is only May so cannot imagine how busy it must be in the summer months.  The canal walk is very good and there are a couple of supermarkets to stock up such as Sainsburys and Morrisons.  We are having a lovely time and Bude is OK, dont get me wrong, we just have seen other places we like more.
Just moved to Bude and I can honestly say how wonderful and friendly the place is. I have never settled so easily and look forward to our family's future here.
Was so glad to find this wonderful bakery. The bread is top notch. Will have to make sure I go early enough as to not be disappointed.
Six of us had pasties from here and they were fab.  We each had a different one and agreed that they were the best ever!

If you've got a dog, and fancy a winter break, Bude is a good place to go. Good coastal walks, cheap car parking, plenty of pubs and restaurants in surrounding areas. Stayed in Atlantic Cottages, could find no fault! Not much to dislike.
Nice to revisit an old favourite. Very tasty traditional pasty with good level of meat in it. Lots of different flavours on offer, but you can't beat the original!
We always visit Lansdowne Bakery when we're in Bude, we love the Cobb rolls and the cheesey topped loaf. This time we bought pasties as well and they were very good.

Excellent old school bakery offering cakes, breads and pasties all at great prices.After sampling pasties for almost all of the shops in Bude (well what else do you eat in Cornwall). I decided Lansdowne bakery was the best, beef ones nice and peppery and pastry excellent

bude a quiet sleepy place , but the more you explore the more you discover
all people are very friendly
shop staff courteous

Review Title: A visitors town that hasn't gone all commercialized
Review Text: A quaint little town that as I said hasn't got the grocklefied, still got some quaint little shops and services.
I love Bude because it's so lovely and peaceful the time of year that I go.  I recommend it to other coeliacs as there are many places that cater gluten free foods.

we have just come back from spending a week in bude ! tho we was based in widmouth bay ! what a great place bude is ! so many lovely walks by the sea and canal . lots of nice places to eat and drink too cant wait to return.

Nice area for walking along the canal or on the beach easy to get to other places of interest 
Nice coffee shops very nice one along the canal by the bridge

Review Title: What a great place to stay
Review Text: A very friendly place, small but with miles of beaches, cliffs, a river and a canal, a "castle" with a museum and quite a few surfers. It is worth taking a walk along the beach (to the right looking out to sea) to Margaret's caravan cafe- such a lovely woman -a great place to catch up on gossip and have take and a homemade cake or sandwiches. In Bude they have quite a few cafes and restaurants along with great pasties and ice cream. It is well away from the main traffic routes so doesn't seem to get the masses of tourists that descend on other Cornish seaside towns. A charming and lovely place.
Bude has something for everyone, shops, restaurants, Banks etc and of course a number of great beaches

Review Title: A Special Spot on the Coast of Cornwall
Review Text: We were first in Bude in 1998 and back again yesterday.  It is past the busy, busy season but the town was still teeming with tourists enjoying the sunshine and their Cornish Ice Cream cones.  Easy in from the main road, found places to park the car right away.  Walking in and out of the shops is great fun and we chatted with loads of friendly, smiling people.  There is a Co-Op grocery store and loads of souvenir shops, shops for clothing and shoes, camping gear...you name it, they seem to have it.  We'll be in the area for a fortnight and know we'll return to Bude for another nice afternoon.

Beach, canal, shopping, what more do you want, this is one of the cleanest and friendly resorts in Cornwall, the beach is one of the best and dog friendly, walks along the cost, good restaurants and pasties
Had a pasty and cake from this small town centre bakery. The pasty was a good size and not bad, the cake was also good and home made. The gentleman serving was very polite and friendly.

What can you not like about Bude? Perfect beaches. Lovely walks. We find it perfect for us and we are part of a couple with one wheelchair user and we also have a dog. We love walks along the canal or cycle path.
Bude is not for 'couples' too roudy, suits families with children, not those people who want a quiet time

Visited The Bank tapas restaurant in bude  during August.This is a hidden jem sitting next to its sister restaurant on the edge of a industrial estate,the food is fantastic and this is evident by you having to book well in advance to get a table.Worth the wait.!
I live here, I like it all! Especially during the Winter months when we can have it all to ourselves

I have visited and lived in Bude. I have taken 100`s of pictures of Bude look on hoochsweets pictures (on google images). It is so friendly and inviting, anyone who visits will be taken in by the beauty and the sea, get some wine and sit on the beach and watch the sun go down.

Review Title: Great place to take a holiday
Review Text: There`s lots to do even if its raining.Good beach,shops,restaurants,cafes. things to do. Clean and tidy.

Bude is one of those rare places where there really is something for everyone. Two fabulous safe beaches, a sea pool & a lovely town. Excellent for body boarders &  surfers, & lovely walks &shops to browse for the less energetic among us.
We have been on holiday here three times now and still love it. The town is nice with independent shops, there is plenty of choice for food, but it still feels like an unspoilt town.
Brilliant walking area with sea and country. Bude is one of the original surfing beaches in Cornwall. There is nothing to dislike in Bude.

Loved this little harbour town.
Clean and friendly with beautiful beach.
Really liked the area just before the breakwater and canal.
Parking very expensive for off-season and my reason for docking a "green button".
Loved it!

The front at Bude has four parts all different all worth visiting and a wonderful beach in a small bay. The sea pool needs attention but is a wonderful reminder of by-gone days. Lets hope it does not become a relic. Great restaurant"life is a beach"
It is a lovely town, some fairly good shops, always quite friendly and I always end up spending more than I should.
Great little town. Lots of good restaurants. A walk along the canal is a must. Beaches clean and great for the kids. Lots to do.
Great town - great restaurants - great fireworks on lifeboat day all free - very clean gardens and flower beds near the castle - lovely beaches

Review Title: why have we not been before???
Review Text: Bude is a beautiful little place. Everything is easily accesible with the canal, town and beaches all seemingly inter-connected. Lifeboat day was fantastic lots of street entertainment and a firework display. Perfect. Can't wait to return.
Great place for beaches good food in some top restaurants  mind out for the bad ones  lots for everybody to do and see handy for site seeing  other parts of cornwall

Bude is a very nice Cornish town. There is plenty on offer, with a very nice beach and plenty of rock pools to go crabbing in. There is a park at one end, and you can hire out boats or have a go on the adventure course. There are loads of shops with gifts on offer, along with Cafes, Restaurants and Take Aways with an array of food and drink to purchase. Well worth a visit.

Review Title: Brilliant town who does Cornwell proud
Review Text:
We found all we wanted in the town. We particularly appreciated the canal walk and the Bude Sea lock developments where we found a range of shops, market and quality food outlets.  The surfing shop Zuma Jay was especially welcoming and helpful.
The Tourist Information Centre had a really helpful and welcoming staff.
nice ice cream shops, and home made pasty shops, parking could be a bit tricky if you arrive late, but its not too dear,beach is great for families

Review Title: The best place in England (if you ask my husband in the world)
Review Text:
Beaches are fantastic/ The see pool is so great for kids it has to be saved. The canal is just beautiful in the sunset. Great facilities a variety of restaurants to suit all tastes. Great accomodation. Within easy access to other towns. The coastal path walks give amazing views. The people who live in Bude are so welcoming and so proud of where they live it is wonderful.
We have amazing memories every year and have booked for next year already.

when the sun is out it's the best place in the World!
great beaches, great food, great accomodation..............

I've eaten a lot of pasties in my time from all across the country. I've chomped on cheese and onion in Chingford, I've bitten into beef in Beamish, and I've polished off pastries in Paignton. I've also had a fair few genuine, traditional Cornish pasties, but the steak pasties I had here today was a clear winner.

The crispy pastry was cooked to perfection, with no soggy bottom. There were big lumps of dark, tender steak that actually tasted of beef. It was packed out with tasty vegetables, that weren't dry, nor were they overly wet, causing that leakage issue you sometimes get in inferior pasties. For a quick snack, this became a highlight of my life.

We had stopped to ask if there was a butchers in the town, we was told no but you can order meat from here. On the Wednesday morning we went in and asked if we could order 6 beef burgers , and some chicken, the chap took the order and said delivery is about 4, we close at 4.30, I went back at 3 on the off chance it maybe delivered, was told no come back at 4, or you could come first thing in morning, i said we want them for today, he said ‚Äú they will definitely be in.‚Äù I sent my son at 4, the chap said ‚Äúcome back at 4.30. My son went back 4.29 he said ‚Äú we are closed,‚Äù we have come for the meat ordered, He said come back at 4.30  i don‚Äôt know where it is‚Ä¶.another lady also had come to pick up some meat, and was also disappointent, so i wouldn‚Äôt order any meat from here, get what is in the fridge or go to the butchers.

Review Title: Not my idea of a Great Cornish Pasty
Review Text: Award winning Pasties were advertised. The only reason we came. They were the worst we had all week. Wrong kind of Pastry. No pepper. Mushy centre....very little meat.  Will not be back.

Wow! Hands down, the best pasties we have ever had in Cornwall. Warm, tasty, crispy and full of tender meat. The coffee was also fab. But the best thing is the staff, the staff are so friendly. The owner gave us two free tea cakes for being kind and giving up our seats for an elderly couple, totally unexpected but so awesome. What a fantastic, family bakery. We will visit every time we are in St Mawes! Thank you for just being the most awesome bakery!

Review Title: I don‚Äôt like Cornish pasties but when in Cornwall‚Ä¶
Review Text:
You can‚Äôt not visit here if you‚Äôre in St Mawes!

There‚Äôs a great selection of cakes, sandwiches all sorts of treats as well as the Cornish pastie which was what myself and my boyfriend opted for.

So glad we did, it was fabulous, first off it was huge, the pastie was delicious the meat was so tender and tasty it was melt in your mouth!  The pastry was just as good as the filling.  I‚Äôm not a fan of pasties but this was something else.

All the staff were lovely, so friendly and because we visited on a hot, sunny day we took advantage of the tables & chairs outside.

Review Title: A must do while visiting St Mawes
Review Text: Family run business still the same as it has been for years , simple Cornish baking. Highly recommend fresh bread, pasties and sausage rolls. Thanks too all the lovely local staff for the chats and giggles

Absolutely brilliant pasties and the massive doughnuts are fantastic!
This must be the best bakery in the UK and must‚Äôve tried if you‚Äôre in St Mawes!

We have been staying in st mawes for a few days.    Not quite sure what happened today . Pastry tough, not traditional filling.  And jam doughnuts that looked overcooked but trusted experts however with a cup of tea later were overcooked and greasy.
The plain scone was nice.   Is it because it's the end of season.
The food is tasty here, the pasties are great and the round doughnuts lovely. I will be back to sample the other treats, Can‚Äôt fault it, probably ate too much!

Best Cornish pasty ever! Oh my what a delight! I‚Äôve tried many a pie and pasty but this is up there with the very best that I have ever had! Freshly baked and the pastry was just the tastiest along with plenty of filling! Loved, loved, loved it!

Review Title: Wow!!!. A pasty to die for.
Review Text: Quite possibly the best pasty I have ever had. Lived in Cornwall for 50 years and tried them all. The only thing that could improve it in any way would be a greater generosity with the pepper. Pastry was flaky and tasted great. Filling generous,  tasty and baked to perfection.  If you try nothing else when in St Mawes, try one of these.

Great croissants and friendly staff - highly recommend. 
Watch out for the lady adding an extra ¬£2.50 for an imaginary loaf to your bill. It happened to us twice and to a friend as well - sneaky tourist tax or a glitch with the till? Hopefully just the latter!

We came to St Mawes quite late in the day, and spotted this little gem, Jane was so friendly and welcoming, we enjoyed Tea and cake, also purchasing pasties, bread and baps.....this is an absolute little delight, traditional, independent and so delicious...definitely will be on our yearly visit list üòä
Tasty and filling Cornish pasty served warm, friendly staff in convenient location. Would use again when wr are back in St Mawes

Visited on St Mawes Town Regatta Day when there were lots of customers. I had to wait for the second batch of pasties to be cooked but they were delicious! 
I can also recommend their Egg and Bacon Baps.

Review Title: A highly recommended bakery for snacks
Review Text:
Sat outside for a quick lunch and had a really nice 'Cheese + Onion Pasty' and an 'Egg + Bacon Slice'. Friendly service and decently priced too.
Would certainly recommend to others.
Small cafe bakery ,family owned.  Very friendly staff.  Great products, can recommend the cheese pasties, sausage rolls and jam doughnuts.    Good prices too and they will accept cash payments.

Review Title: The best pasties I‚Äôve ever had
Review Text: We took a ferry to St Mawes from Falmouth to do a round trail. We were really stressed for time as had a ferry to catch. However quick Googling recommended St Mawes bakery. It is very unassuming from the outside. Lovely lady assured us that there were still few steak pasties left, only 20 minutes from the oven. We bought one each. Oh my God! It was unbelievably good! Fluffy and crunchy pastry with lots of meaty filling. I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôve had anything like that before despite eating pasties in many recommended places. Really regretted when consumed last piece!

Review Title: Oh dear, really not very good
Review Text: I‚Äôd like to support a local enterprise, but these are not either the best pasties or the best scones in St Mawes.  The pasties suffer from poor ingredients, which probably makes them more authentic (the pasties the tin miners ate originally were unlikely to have contained prime beef), but not as good as others you can get in St Mawes.  Try Mr Scorse at the deli.  He‚Äôll heat them up for you.  For scones, pay a bit more and get them at Da Barra.
Provides an eat in and take away service - the pastries we took out where first class. Not the cheapest but you do get what you pay for

Review Title: Nice and Handy for a Bacon Roll
Review Text:
Ideal for a Bacon roll or Pastry.

Situated on the port right next door to the St Mawes Fish stall which fills the Bakerys roles with Crab for ¬£7

I'd read a review somewhere about these, and by chance we happened to be at the quay at St Mawes at the time we were thinking about lunch. They had little stock left, but they did have their traditional pasties, which is what we would have chosen anyway. Very tasty - lots of meat and veg and a good crust too. Well recommended.
Coffee was bitter, foul tasting and undrinkable. Such a shame as it‚Äôs in a great location right on St Mawes Harbour. Very disappointing. We‚Äôll go elsewhere on our next visit.
Was the  most  amazing  pasties I've  had  . The  staff  was very  friendly  . Would  recommend  it.  It's  a lovely  place  to  visit
Absolutely outstanding pasties from this gorgeous family-run business based on St Mawes pier. We returned today having enjoyed our first pasty there some 20 years ago! As delicious now as then.

Right in the heart of St Mawes on the harbour wall is this wonderful family bakery which has been around there for quite a few years, its charm is not only in its unique breads, pasties, scones, babs, croissants, tea, coffee, soft drinks etc, just waiting to offer these items ready to be filled with fillings of your choice, simple, hot and yummy 
its a place waiting to share the real cornish tastes that sets cornwall apart, making it unique while away from home.  Plus while enjoying your time here you can watch the Ferries as they make their way to Falmouth, plus all the other natural sights and sounds.

Location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield
Review Text:
I had a Cornish pasty and I have to say it was probably the best one I‚Äôve ever had. 

Sometimes pasties can be overly peppery but this was perfectly seasoned with a good amount of meat. Ridiculously filling as well.

No rolls left at 11 am. Told they sell out after an hour after opening. Maybe make a few more? A few poor loaves left.
Belgian bun type  pastries were probably the driest ever .

Lovely pasties full of meat and vegetables right into the crust.
We had them at a wedding at Place Estate they were so good I have ordered 10 frozen to be sent to me!

Poor service was told pasty would be 15 minutes wait decided to wait as good reviews actual time waited for one pasty one whole hour without a sorry you had to wait nice pasty but not worth an hour waiting time

Review Title: Always love the smell walking in~
Review Text:
I have made many trips for the family for a pasty pick up lunch, they always smell amazing and have such great crimping can never resist. The saffron buns are hard not to grab too as they are so juicy. 
Great place to grab a snack or lunch for the beach, highly recommend for the whole family!

Absolutely beautifully tasty steak pasties from the bakery. Really highly recommended. Very fresh. Friendly staff serving. Really enjoyed. Another one today!  (Calories on half rating while on holiday!!!!!!)

We had some pasties from here and they were lovely, great pastry and lots of filling. Very tasty. We also have a selection of their cakes where where very homely and lovely. We will definitely visit again if in the area.
Just eaten the pasty I bought this morning, after a long journey home this was a perfect reminder of a few days away. Proper, very tasty pasties, I will be back !

Lovely hot pasties, bread and cakes.
Get there early as they run out quick. 
Was very covid clean and safe.
Scones were amazingly yummy. Fantastic size and very fresh. Recommend and will be back! Very fairly priced as well.
Really great pasty and great service. Loaf and scone went down well.  Not the first visit and will go again.

We bought some pasties to take home; what a disappointment!  the filling consisted of dry potato and cooked meat pieces - not even mixed together.  No onion; no swede or carrot - essential ingredients.  Not a good flavour overall, and very dry.

The doughnuts and muffins were fine, nothing special.
A visit to St Mawes must include a pasty from this great little cafe, nothing better after a decent walk, a must

Review Title: Any trip to St. Mawes is incomplete without..the original pasty
Review Text: After 60 years of eating the St. Mawes Bakery pasties I declare they are the best in Cornwall - the original, with proper chunks of steak and delicious pastry. Any trip to St. Mawes is incomplete without..

Located on the harbour, next to the short stay parking. There was a bit of a queue, but worth the wait.

We had a steak and cheese pasty. They were delicious!! ¬£7.80 for the two pasty‚Äôs, but they were yummy, large, piping hot and more than  enough food for a lunch. As they now serve at the door, bit more difficult to see what is on offer and prices. They make and bake the pasties at their nearby bakery and transport them to here. 

If you enjoy a pasty, would recommend.
Friendly service, great artisan bread, best pasties I have ever had. My favourite place for lunch in St Mawes. Consistently excellent service and food.

We popped by the St Mawes bakery more by luck than judgement but struck lucky - great pasties which were fresh out of the oven (literally !) and a cuppa. Nice to sit on the benches outside and watch the comings and goings of the harbour.

Review Title: Friendly, efficient service and great bread
Review Text:
During lockdown, whilst we were marooned elsewhere, we kept thinking about Patrick‚Äôs wonderful granary bread and pasties.
When we were finally able to travel we headed to the bakery. What a treat! The bread was just as wonderful as we remembered and the vegan pasties were freshly baked and delicious, as were the steak pasties. 
A real, traditional family business selling bread, cakes and pastries to eat on their terrace or take away. 
10/10
Amazing freshly cooked cakes, pasties, freshly filled rolls. All cooked locally great friendly staff

We got soaked on our walk to the Castle and decided to stop at the cafe for a hot chocolate.  We got talking to the owner and spent a very pleasant half hour.  The bread and pastries looked delicious.
Wonderful pasties and a good cup of tea. Well worth a visit to this little  bakery, with a great view of the harbour. :)

Review Title: Read reviews and thought we would try.
Review Text: Well wasn‚Äôt really impressed.¬£ 7.50 for two pasties (steak) not much meat in them so thought they were overpriced. Didn‚Äôt try anything else so can‚Äôt comment.
Starving on a cold wet day,just the job a hot crusty pasty it was delicious,not as peppery as I'm used to and had more gravy,also took some home baked bread which was lovely.

My husband has never been a pasty 'fan' until the owner walk passed us carrying a fresh baked tray of traditional Cornish Pasty's.. The delicious aroma got to us, we weakened and thoroughly enjoyed our impromptu purchase.  The pastry was crumbly, cooked to perfection, the beef good quality - no gristle, and best of all the filling was made up of lots of potato, onion, a little swede & well seasoned.  The centre was definitely NOT stuffed with an overload of cheap, tasteless root veg.
Was so good we returned 3 times.

A trip to St Mawes is never complete without a trip to the bakery. Near disaster one year when we couldn‚Äôt get doughnuts due to a fire!! Anyway this year the pasties were excellent as usual as was the bread and rolls. But it‚Äôs the doughnuts we always treat ourselves to. Nowhere else ever comes close to being as good!

Every year when on holiday we kayak from Porthscatho to the Bakery for a pasty and sit on the quay to admire the views whilst eating it.
These are without doubt the best pasties in St Mawes.
If you‚Äôre going to go anywhere to get a pastie - go here! Best Cornish pasty I‚Äôve ever had. Flaky delicious pastry. I want another!

Spent a day in St Mawes with our family 4 adults and 3 children under 3  we tried their pasties and sausage rolls they came fresh out of the oven great timing, we have eaten many pasties in our time I have to say these are the best pasties we have ever eaten.
The pastry was perfect we even ate the crimp not something we normally do, the chunks of beef were tender and generous (min specification 12%) the potato onion and sweed seasoned perfectly our grandchildren demolished their sausage rolls so I took that as a vote of confidence, so if you want to eat the best Cornish pasties in Cornwall visit St Mawes.

We only looked in on the first day that we arrived, because we parked our car there. On the Sunday when we went for bread and Pasties to take home it was closed sadly. Everyone told us that it was one of the best places, so next time we will make sure we go there first.
Delicious pastry and full of well cooked meat. Peppery and tasty, these pasties literally walk out of the small bakery on the quay at St. Mawes at an astounding rate.

We ordered our food inside the cafe but chose to eat outside as it was a lovely day.
Despite being fairly busy, our order was delivered to our table quickly and we thoroughly enjoyed our sandwiches [the tuna was particularly good] followed by a variety of cakes including saffron cake and coffees.
The ladies also had a good sense of humour and we recommend.
Just one word of caution - watch out for the invading seagulls!
These are by far the best pasties in Cornwall, and also the best quiche , full of ingredients and flavour

Our recent experience wasn't a great one.  Fresh uncovered pasties handled by staff with bare hands that have also been handling money that has come out of customers pockets, cross contaminating directly onto the pastry.  

Having said this pastry on the pasty itself is good and the seasoning inside is equally fine but the filling was really poor with virtually nothing other than potato in the vegetable pasty which was the flattest and most poorly filled that I have ever had the misfortune of buying anywhere.  

Come on guys, you can do far better than this and please can we also have the option of chicken.  Hopefully next time will be better, and please think about not directly handling products without tongs if you're also handling cash.

See the poorly filled potato only pasty pics attached.
You can always tell how good somewhere is by the ques at the door and it's always busy we have had all they bread in the last 2 weeks and all are wonderful

Review Title: Newly opened and very good for a light meal or snack
Review Text: Friendly greeting and good coffee and cake.   Also have charging units for your phone!   spotlessly clean and lots of space.

Review Title: Worth going just for a pasty!
Review Text:
Pasties vary tremendously in Cornwall.  At the St Mawes Bakery they were truly first class and the best I have eaten for a long time.

Great views and good cofffee too

Review Title: Lovely little cafe in an idyllic spot
Review Text: Went over to St Mawes on the ferry from Falmouth on a beautiful warm sunny day.  Had breakfast sitting outside the St Mawes Bakery.  Delicious sausage, egg and bacon sandwich with a good cup of coffee. Perfect!

Situated right on the harbour with stunning views, we had cake and a coffee here on the most gorgeous day (20th May).

Compared to the price of property in this village, the prices were very reasonable. The lady working in the wee bakery was warm and friendly and the tea and cake delicious! Recommended!

Great quality and also a very good price. 
A veey plain building (shack) on tge harbour side of the road.
I had a Pasty and also a nice Cream Tea which was very reasonably priced at ¬£5.
A nice start to my overnight stay in St Mawes

Review Title: Best cheese pasty I‚Äôve ever had
Review Text: Lovely little bakery, good selection, even takes card. Was probably the best cheese pasty I‚Äôve ever had!
All the bread, really excellent. Pasties exceptional all the year round. Friendly service, what more could you want?
Lovely view,absolutely delicious pasties,a nice place to have a snack in St.Mawed.The lady serving us was so funny she made our day.

Took a day trip with my sister to st makes today , and came across this little bakery by chance , and I‚Äôm so glad we did , one of the best pasties I‚Äôve had in a very long time , my only regret is that it‚Äôs so far away to go back on a regular basis , but will definitely be going back for another if I‚Äôm that way again
Very friendly welcome but the pasty was extremely greasy and the coffee was overly bitter. Such a shame.
Fantastic bakery. Their Cornish pasties are delicious and their squares amazing. Friendly staff who actually delivered to hotel so we could take their pasties home with us. Excellent bakery
Walked the kids down for a pasty and pastry . Warm friendly welcome and excellent produce. We will return!

Friendly staff.Worth the wait-due to the demand, piping hot, lovely pastry,plentiful, tasty filling,accompanied with a mug of tea, whilst enjoying the wonderful view.
Chocolate cake that we had as take-away was also yummy.

Review Title: Just an ok bakery......pasty was just average.
Review Text: Atmosphere was zero as the person serving was more interested in talking with her friends than serving a customer. This was supposed to be the "bees knees" for Cornish Pasties but their product was only average and I definitely experienced better pasties elsewhere in Cornwall plus the atmosphere was zero.
Stayed in St Mawes and called into this little shop a few times. The staff even opened up early when we wanted to call in early before a morning walk. Great pasties.

As a born & bred Cornish person, I absolutely love this little no frills bakery. The lovely lady serving is so friendly & serves with a local flare & accent! Part & parcel of visiting St Mawes. The scones, saffron buns & other local goodies are superb. To savour a saffron bun & mug of steaming hot tea, sat outside overlooking the picturesque harbour & river can‚Äôt be beaten.
Well done St Mawes Bakery a truly Cornish Gem.
Fab bakery with scones to die for and great pastries. Only problem is they sell out fast so get there early.  They do need more selection for vegetarians as very limited.

Review Title: Lovely Pasties When You Can Get One, Very Poor Choice
Review Text:
I really cannot understand these places that don‚Äôt supply to demand.  The Pasties here are lovely but our preference is chicken or veg.  St Mawes bakery only does traditional or cheese & veg as we don‚Äôt eat beef & we have have been here on numerous occasions when the veg have sold out.

Yesterday was no exception so we sat inside & settled for a coffee just as a fresh tray of traditional Pasties arrived to top up the unsold traditionals already in stock. During a period of around 10-15 minutes several customers came in for Pasties & their first question was what flavours do you do & the repeat answer being that we‚Äôve only got traditional left.  We witnessed 11 customers with their families totalling around 20 + people walking back out empty handed because the bakery couldn‚Äôt supply for the demand with only a couple of others buying traditional.

The veg Pasties are nice but it‚Äôs aggravating catching the ferry across from Falmouth looking forward to a nice pasty to find that they‚Äôre out of stock once again.
Great local small bakery. Whilst not a huge selection we all good quality .not a lot more to say now bla bla bla bla bla

This has to be THE worst pasty I have ever tasted. Bland pastry, bland mushy vegetables inside and inconsistent seasoning - in fact all the seasoning in my pasty was delivered in one mouthful. I returned thinking my first impression must have been wrong given the number of stellar reviews on here but my second visit was worse than the first. The one redeeming feature of the pasty is the meat but that‚Äôs not good enough for me to return a third time. Go instead to the cafe opposite where you‚Äôll find a beautifully seasoned traditional pasty that is full of flavour.

We love the pasties a Crispy crust with plenty of meat  in the filling. A bakery run by local family, located on the quay . Ideal for eating on the beach or better still for the ferry journey over to Falmouth .
Freshly baked hot pasties to take away. Meat and also a cheese and potato. They are make a great cheap lunch and keep hot for ages!
Amazing pasty‚Äôs here & great coffee. A young man served us and he was so friendly & welcoming. This place is busy and I know why... a must when in st mawes.

Il locale si trova al porticciolo di questo grazioso e piccolo paese
Gestito dalla famiglia offre dolci e pane
Abbiamo fatto colazione con ottimi dolci, caff√® americano seduti ai tavoli antistanti.
4 briosche e 2 caff√® americani 11 euro
Love this small bakery especially for the Cornish Pasties! Also do great looking cakes as well. A must visit when in St Mawes!
Smashing little bakery for produce or a bite to eat. Very popular shop does good pasties & cakes which sell very quickly in high summer. Situated in a picturesque spot with plenty to watch.

Run by mum and son, we were amazed by the selection and hugely impressed by the quality of the fare here.  Fantastic bread, cakes, pastries, pasties.   They work very hard and make everything themselves which is pretty admirable when they are both in the shop all day, serving it too!!  Not a single crumb is left most days, it‚Äôs the go to bakery for the holiday self caterers and the locals too I would imagine.
Definitely recommend his bakery. The lovely lady and young man who serve are always chatty and friendly. My little boy went every day for a sausage role and we always bought our bread from there too.
Do not miss visiting this Bakery..even if you have to queue for a  while for access ! . The choice of bread, pasty and pastries is amazing .You will be spoilt for choice and the standard is wonderful
Non mass produced pasties, full of good quality tasty tender beef. One of the best pasties I have ever bought. Nice location on the quay with some tables and chairs for customers.

Review Title: Best Cornish pasties on the planet
Review Text: We drive down from Hampshire just to buy these (OK so we're also visiting friends in Portscatho!) - fresh out of the oven they're spectacularly tasty and you gotta be quick to get some. Top tip - ring ahead to find out when the next bake is on its way to the shop! Friendly authentic good old-fashioned service and quality - the bread and buns are fabulous too.
Great scones. Cracking cakes. Good value.  "Proper job" as the lady in the bakery said! Nicely located on the seafront.

Popped in to get the evening meal. Opted just to buy pasties but there was so much more on offer. Hard to resist the treats. The staff were very friendly. The pasties were delightful. Warmed in the oven not microwave. Delicious

We only bought a few pasties here. Only traditional one was available but it tasted good! 

Service was prompt and good. A good spot for a cuppa sitting outside when the sun is out.

Sat outside with our dog , lovely.
Had a cornish pasty which hit the spot! 
Friendly lady serving and bought a crusty loaf for tomorrow's brekkie. 
Will visit again.

No visit to the village is complete without one of their pasties, sure it's me being a cynical grumpy old man but they taste better and have more meat in them during the off peak season, either way the staff are very friendly and the food is great, it's a bakery, what more could you want.
When no where else had opened yet the lovely ladies put on some fresh filter coffee for my early 'fix' - and it certainly did wake me up! ...the bread looked very tempting too üòÄ

A very unique experience had by all... owner had thrown out all her cooked meat but sent a customer up to the bakery for more... came out with thickly sliced bread and a very large bread knife... painful lol we on the other hand had pasties (home made) and fresh soup. Pasties were extremely reasonably priced and full of steak... you could never leave there hungry!

After returning from St Anthony‚Äôs head via the Place ferry, we thoroughly enjoyed some local hot pasties for lunch, and very nice they were too.  Great place to drop into and enjoy overlooking the quay.

Just perfect. Does what it says on the tin. May suprise many but so much better than overpriced, pretentious establishments. Do not expect airs and graces. Wipe the seat down, drink in the atmosphere and munch on fresh pasty, bacon buttie, saffron bun.... the list just goes on..... , best bit . The customer service. Best in Cornwall. Love you guys. Smiling just thinking of you

The contents of our two pasties were not mixed properly. The meat was all together in a coagulated lump and the rest was of course just veg. Possibly it would have been good otherwise. The pastry as such was good.
There are lots of other places to buy pasties, so avoid this one.
As we had bought the pasties to eat elsewhere we could not show them the problem

Every morning picked up, fresh Croissants, bread, pasties, doughnuts and yum yums for the day while staying in St Mawes over the Easter period, beautifully fresh and everthing was super tasty, Highly recommend.
My title says it all.  Simply the best Cornish Pasty we have ever tasted and I have been holidaying in the South West for 60+ years!
Jam doughnuts to die for and their  cornish pasties are the best...Get there early in the day to avoid disappointment..
Fantastic cornish pasty, cant wait for my next one. Has a small cafe, right on the harbour. Bought bread to take home, ok.
Slighlty exentric bakerey with limited range but all goods freshley baked and serviced by really friendly team

Just had coffee and snack but excellent.  The fresh bread looks to die for but as staying in hotel didn't have the need to purchase.  Had we not had such an early start I would have made purchases to take home, but it does open early if you want to take items for during the day.  Nice tables and benches outside.  A pleasure to find such a lovely place.
Little shack on the quay serving very good pasties. Nothing fancy, some little tables and simple but very friendly service. The pasties were gorgeous!

This may be a bakery but they do lovely quiche funny half cups of hot chocolate though, it is right on the quay with a nice seating area and is well worth a try when just off the ferry of waiting for the ferry to Falmouth, we will have to try the pasties next time they arrived as i was carrying the food out this place is a find we will be back

Just a short walk from St Mawes castle this little bakers is a little gem. With seating outside and inside it is great to visit in all weather's.  Really tasty pasty would visit again of we are down that way
We just grabbed some takeaway pastries from here, but they were super! Looked like a lovely spot for pasties and quick snacks!
The Cornish pastie is ubiquitous, but after 60 years‚Äô travel I believe that this is THE original and the best pastie in the world.
We‚Äôve been visiting Cornwall for many years and a great tasting pasty from this little bakery is guaranteed. We love em!
We buy all our bread here whenever we are in St Mawes. Freshly baked throughout the day, pasties, sausage rolls and saffron buns are all worth a try.

Stopped here a couple of times  whilst on my courier round, always a friendly greeting, with prompt service.  Nice big mug of hot tea, and the donuts are baked fresh each day, so always excellent.  Must try  one of  their pasties in future, as these too look very tempting.

Fantastic little shop with fresh pastys and cakes, we went for a pasty each with a coffe and sat on the small decked area over looking harbour watching the boats come and go. Not too expensive and not bothered by seagulls either

A delightful little bakery on the harbour in St Mawes! Sit outside and enjoy watching the world go by whilst munching on something tasty from the bakery! Loved the fresh rolls and Cornish pasties! Totally yummy!

Recommend the pasties - made with mashed potatoes which means they are not as dry as some pasties. Good selection of cakes, especially recommended are the doughnuts, but get there early as they sell out. Yum yums also great and generously sized. Very small seating are inside but can sit outside and watch all the activity on the pier and in the harbour.All served by real Cornish ladies - proper job.

We had just come over on the ferry from Falmouth before walking the Roseland peninsula and picked up supplies from this little place right on the quay. The pasties are enormous with loads of filling and beautiful crisp flaky pastry. My only slight criticism would be that there were quite salty. I also had one of their yum-yums and these were divine - fresh and light and gorgeous! The best I've ever had!
The only trouble is that I live 200 miles away!
Great to pick something up here is you are going for a walk or catching the ferry. What more can I say!
We bought fruit scones which looked amazing. Sadly, we didn't enjoy them, they didn't taste very fresh.

Review Title: Freshly-made Cornish pasties, at their best - right on the Harbour. The gorgeous aromas are their best advert!
Review Text: Waiting for the St. Mawes Ferry, to Falmouth, we were drooling in anticipation, of one of Betty's pasties. Not a vast choice, but all foo, wholesome 'proper jobs' that would keep us going all day. As we anticipated a full-on day, as it was the Fal Week, in early August, we needed sustanance.

honestly i dont know why this place didnt win the best pasty award!!! proper chunks of steak, creamy potato wrapped up in a pastry that wasnt too dry or to soggy... and to sit and eat with the view over the harbour.. amazing.. one of Cornwalls hidden gems.. search it out

one of the key highlights of our trips to St Mawes is always THE BREAD.
Brown/black crusty topped white loaves - the lightest pillowy dough with the crustiest crust...... oh my word!
Why why oh why can i not find proper bread like this in Hertfordshire anywhere??????

This bread is divine fresh on day one and even day two but the toast it makes is legend!

Suffice to say, I LOVE YOUR BREAD X

Review Title: lovely site right on the harbuor front
Review Text: Huge homemade cornish pasty , piping hot and delicious Stsff so friendly and helpful and love the ideanofveating from the bag !
Wonderful cakes and buns including cinnamon buns, blueberry cupcakes, fresh rolls and bread and much more.

I've had many visits to St Mawes over the years and always like to use the St Mawes bakery. This year the bread was wonderful as usual but for some reason the pasties which are usually great were very salty so sadly had to find a new supplier. I will give them another try next visit to see if it was a one off.

Absolutely love the granary rolls from here, unbeatable! Lovely bakery with freshly baked goods every morning, worth taking a loaf up to the place where they actually bake the bread (up a small little side street) to have them slice it for you, then you get a look at the behind the scenes!! Fabulous place with lovely smiley staff. We buy our rolls from here every morning (get there quick as they do sell out) and make them up for lunch. Keep up the delicious baking!

We saw and were told how lovely the Cornish pasties were they were big and very tasty from what we were told.  We had a cream tea, two lovely home baked fruit scones, with clotted Cornish cream, strawberry jam and pot of tea ¬£8, all very nice and we had a lovely view right next to the harbour, would recommend  here.
We've been coming to this bakery for years. The pasties are just delicious and the location on the lugger is perfect.

Review Title: Still the best pasty in Cornwall
Review Text: Having eaten here since the 1970s, I am delighted to report this is still the best place for a pasty in Cornwall - and we tried others.  Make sure you go early as they can sell out.
Tiny bakery on the Quay at St Mawes - there are a few car parking spaces (fee payable).  You can smell the lovely cakes and bread as you approach and all freshly delivered and very tasty.

It was a cold and rainy summer morning at St Mawes in July. We had heard so much about the place and did quite a bit of driving to get there. Unfortunately the weather didn't necessarily appreciate all our efforts and decided not to make it a fun beach day for my two boys. We were disappointed yet still decided to try out the bakery by the beach before we departed. What a nice surprise! The cream tea that I had was simply amazing and the service was quite friendly.
