The boys also liked the pastries. At least the morning ended up well!
Really friendly lady working There. The pasties are incredible,really tasty and reasonably priced. Nice location on the harbour.  I would deffinitely go back
Friendly service. Freshly cooked bread and reasonably priced. The best thing is the Cornish pasties - absolutely delightful and a meal in themselves.

Review Title: Big claim but Best pasty in Cornwall!
Review Text: I am 32 years old, have lived in Cornwall for 25 of those years and this is probably the best pasty I have had. Great salty pasty, lots of steak and nice peppery swede. Perfection and well worth a visit if your nearby. In fact, its worth travelling too for a pasty this good!

Very serviceable cafe / bakery.  The pasties were very good, service was decent and prices reasonable.

Shame about the mouldy ketchup though...
Long queues very popular try the bread. we bought cakes bread and Cornish pasties to take on our homeward trip. Pasties a bit peppery and dry but everthing else good
Best pasties in Cornwall, made about 200 meters from the shop. Buy one before you get on the ferry to Falmouth.
A lovely little place that does wonderful food for a quick lunch. Brilliant service and really delicious food. What a delight to find somewhere unpretentious and full of character. Excellent!

Fresh bread and pasty baked by the sea.
Watch the boats come in and out and the tide, sitting in the sun.
Great way to spend an hour.

Had to do the pasty/scone contest whilst traveling around Cornwall to find the best on offer. This was definitely the outstanding winner!
The pasties were so tasty, plenty of meat & potato & had a lovely peppery taste. They do sell out but if you ask they will let you know if there is another batch coming in & what time, so you could always call back. 
The scones were also great, crumbly & moorish, nice little tea cakes as well. I would love to have had time & an  expanding waistline to have tried everything on offer.

No trip to St Mawes is complete without a visit to St Mawes bakery. We always start with coffee and cake before walking up to the castle and then along the coastal path and arriving back in time for a pastie - these pasties really are the very best. Better still is the greeting you get from Rachael - if your day is not going well then 5 minutes in the presence of her smile and banter will transform it!! Dogs are welcome too. Looking forward to our next visit.

Went in to purchase some scones , a charming young lady informed me that they didn't have any left however there was some on their way and she would put some aside for me this she duly did , very helpful and the scones were delicious, as are there pasties which I can highly recommended

Every visit to Cornwall (let alone St Mawes) has to include a visit to the St Mawes Bakery for my son to buy a jam doughnut.  He says they are the "best in the world".  As adults we love the Cornish pasties - full of filling, nicely spiced and always fresh.  Hi Great
Best pasties on our trip, and there are a lot to choose from in Cornwall. A pity they only supply their own shop by the harbour at St Mawes and nowhere else.

We went to visit St. Mawes on a Saturday and decided to try this bakery following the good reviews. Possibly the best cornish pasties with spices I have tasted. Great recipe! 
They seem to be quite popular with locals and tourists.

Review Title: You cant leave Cornwall without trying the pasty.
Review Text: We were the only ones at the counter ordering our pasties when all of a sudden there were a dozen people behind us all waiting to taste the genuine pasty, and it didn't disappoint.
Small bakery , nice selection of cakes, tasty,nice seating inside and outside, good views,good selection of bread, fresh produce.
We stopped  off here twice to buy their proper Cornish pasties, and both times they were fantastic! Lovely helpful staff.

Review Title: Normally good pasties but these were very salty
Review Text: Perhaps the recipe has changed, perhaps the top fell off the salt pot, but despite always getting good pasties from this little gem on the harbour both the meat and the cheese pasty we had were very salty.  Not inedible, but almost.  Pasties from here are one of the reasons we visit St Mawes on a day out from Bristol, but yesterday they were not up to the usual and expected standard.  A cup of tea and watching the world go by from the deck cheered us up.

Review Title: Does not live up to its reputation
Review Text: We had heard this was the place to go for bread and pasties so we did. My partner is passionate about pasties. We go two hot ones, a couple of scones and a couple of jam doughtnuts. The pasty filling was excellent but the bottom pastry was very tough. The scones were fine, but the doughnuts were literally raw inside. You took a bite and a long drip of sticky dough trailed out and the jam was just coloured syrup. Actually revolting.

Visited St Mawes on Monday & stopped here for a drink. The outside space is small but we got a table & we had a lovely welcome  from the lady serving in the cafe. 3 of us went for the pasties & I had a Yum yum & all were so fresh & delicious.

In fact they were the best pasties we have ever had in Cornwall as they did not have the usual 2 inches of boring dry pastry. The pastry was very good & the filling delicious.

We wish we had bought some to take home & will deffo return next time in St Mawes.

Review Title: Great Pastie shop in the harbour in St Mawes
Review Text: Lovely looking and smelling Pasties, we were feeling hungry so nipped in for a quick Pastie before taking the ferry. With my taste buds well and truly stimulated while waiting in the short queue only for the woman in front of me to buy every last pastie in the shop, more than 20 of the things. She could hardly carry the two carrier bags full of Pasties away, I was gutted!

These pasties are excellent.  The many other reviews are spot on.  They were tasty, large and with awesome crusty pastry.  ¬£3.20 is good value anywhere, but even more so in expensive St. Mawes.
Only steak pasties.
... and yes: get them quickly
Popped into St Mawes bakery and were meet by two lovely ladies. Enjoyed a lovely cuppa and pasty outside. We will be going back again.

Review Title: Best soup, service welcome and more!
Review Text:
Made a pit stop here today and so glad we did! Rachel and Jane were such happy hosts, we enjoyed chatting with the locals and hungry visitors were continually q-ing for their pasties but alas soon sold out despite Jane bringing in more fresh from their oven, [we scoffed em with much enjoyment] having devoured the pasties moved onto Rachel's lightly spiced parsnip soup with buttered granary cob! wow was this tasty.... oh yes! Phew... lightly spiced or was that curry spice! :-)
Thank you both and the other member of the establishment that left half way through our visit.....keep up the fantastic service and hard work girls! 
See you next time we are in Saint Mawes. Andy/Nicky/David/Denise.

Review Title: Excellent Pasty (when you can get them)
Review Text: Really good pasties - get there early though because they sell out fast. They are fairly expensive but they are very good (St Mawes prices I suppose)

On an extremely windy day stopped here for a pasty and a cup of tea to break up our walk. Small seated area inside and several seats outside for sunny days. Took a couple of cakes with us to keep us going on the rest of our walk. All freshly baked and and a very tasty pasty only one small complaint tea pot that doesn't pour most of my first attempt ended on the table.

I nipped in after a very wet and windy wintry walk, cafe was very quiet but warm and welcoming. I had a cheese pasty to take away, best I have ever eaten, highly recommended. The bread and pastries looked lovely too.

The food was good the service was excellent the pasty was the best I have tasted and washed down with a nice cup of coffee.  Fresh bread and cakes available daily 

Lovely friendly staff.

It was cold and damp and we were hungry. We saw the bakery on the Quay and decided to have a pasty. The staff were happy and chatty, talking with locals and visitors alike. As were arrived, the last pasties were sold. The staff apologised and explained that a fresh tray would arrive from the bakery in 5 minutes. Sure enough they did - I have never had such a fresh, hot pasty! We sat outside with the dog for a few minutes then it started to rain and the staff welcomed us inside, including our dog, while we finished our delicious fresh, hot pasties. It cheered up our damp day enormously.
Fresh bread every day - get there early. Lovely cakes and staff very pleasant. Also sitting area outside to have a freshly made sandwich.
Lovely little place. Great selection of goodies. Great place to grab a quick lunch to eat on the beach.
So nice to be able to nip around the corner to purchase freshly baked bread, etc. Will certain;y call in there next time we visit St. Mawes.

Review Title: The great Cornish pasty is alive and well here!
Review Text: Having eaten a really poor pasty in Falmouth, we were looking for lunch in St Mawes and fortunately went here. The pasties are freshly baked, the pastry crisp and golden. Mine was full of cheese and potato, my companion's had large chunks of steak. The staff were jolly and helpful. Just wish I had room to try one of the lovely cakes too!!

Not usually a place I would go for coffee but gave up on rude staff in all the other establishments. Staff really friendly and the lady was telling me (I assume she was the manager) how they deliver pasties for parties all over Britain. Though about about placing an order to be delivered to my house but had already three of theirs (very tasty pasties) whilst on holiday. You can have too many? Can't you?

If you like good quality traditional Cornish pasties, then make your way to the harbour in St. Mawes where you will find this bakery right by the harbour wall. The staff there are very friendly
& their pasties & other confectionary are very fresh & really tasty & very good value for money, well worth a sample.

Yes, there were Christmas tree shaped scones today! Didn't try them but the pasties delicious. 

1 x steak pasty and 1 x cheese & veg - mmmmmm

The whole point of having a coffee/tea and pastry, are the surroundings. Nothing quite like sitting in the sea front of a most delightful place , watching the world go by and enjoying a Cornish tea and cake. PURE HEAVEN>

Die am Wasser gelegene lokale B√§ckerei ist die beste Adresse f√ºr k√∂stliche Scones! Ich kenne keine besseren. Sehr zu empfehlen. Der Kaffee ist dagegen nur "mittel". Hier kaufen Einwohner und Touristen.

Big, wholesome, warm pasties, each one a meal in itself.

Small but well stocked bakery.  Lovely fresh scones (fruit and plain) and usually doughnuts and some pastries.  I had the apple-cinnamon iced one this week and it was lush!
Lovely lemon tart - lush ,  slightly put off by the amount of wasps crawling all over and eating the cakes in this bakery
Lovely morning walk to collect fresh bread and Danish pastry s.in the afternoon the Cornish pasty and scones.highly recommended.nice staff too
A lovely treat eating a pasty looking over the harbour, lovely location, a simple proper bakery offering honest delicious food, highly recommend.

We stayed very near to the bakery and so were able to walk just a few yards each morning to pick up delicious fresh croissants for breakfast. Fresh bread, rolls and cakes all on offer! But the doh nuts and pasties a must ! Proper doh nuts oozing with jam and sugar just like they used to be ! Delicious !!

Review Title: Just a great little bakery shop
Review Text:
This bakery sells a good range of breads, super pasties and a good selection of cakes. Also supplies coffees teas and cold drinks.. Everything is fresh as the bakery is only some 150 metres away. We sat outside on one of 5 tables adjacent to the shop every day of our 1 week stay in St. Mawes just for a snack before or after our travels.Bread and pasties sell out quickly.
Great little pit stop .
Bought bread rolls and cakes, all look lovely and fresh. Very busy so buy in morning as probably sold out by the afternoon.
This is a fabulous bakery in the heart of St.Mawes offering hand made baked freshly goods. The chocolate cake (when available) and doughnuts are to die for
Good cup of tea and wonderful own baked pasties and cakes and good value for money. Everything baked on the day and very fresh.
Stopped for coffee and cakes overlooking harbour and stayed for pot of tea, The young man in the shop gave excellent service,

This is ideally located on the quay so gets a lot of passing trade.  They have a small deck area where you can sit to have a drink and people watch. We stopped there for a drink and a pasty which was delicious. They also serve cream teas which looked good as well.
Super pasties and sausage rolls and friendly service... Will definitely come back and recommend to friends.........
Only visited twice to buy pasties which unfortunately were over salty; and for Saffron buns.  Very friendly chap serving and everything seemed to sell out so must be popular.

we went here for the doughnuts and they had the nicest bread rolls which in turn were great for sandwiches. It is best if you go early so you're guaranteed to get the freshest and softest baked goods.

We bought some saffron buns from the bakery. They tasted lovely and we got them before we boarded the ferry to Falmouth. The shop smells of freshly cooked bread (I could have eaten everything in sight).

The pasty we had was the very worst I've ever had.  Lots of potato,  no swede,  no onion and a blob of minced beef in the centre.  Crust was flakey pastry which was greasy and inedible. 
Come on now, you can do much better than this.  Your sales lady was very abrupt and impolite, I didn't dare take the pasty back with this gorgon in charge

....warm croissants and pastries every morning for breakfast - really top quality. 

Never went in myself as I sent the wife down so I could have a lay in. 

:o)
Zu meinem Tagesausflug geh√∂rt  neben einem Spaziergang durch diesen sympathischen Ort und dem Besuch des St. Mawes Castle der Kauf herrlich frischer saffron-buns in dieser B√§ckerei

On our last day of our holiday in cornwall i had to have one last cornish pasty, we visited st mawes and i had one from here. Unlike many other places there seems to be just one choice of fillings and size at ¬£3.10. I actually got it to eat later on a walk around the st mawes circular walk and so did not eat it until about an hour later, it was still warm and very good.

Definitely recommended.
This little gem gets better each time we visit. Delicious coffee and cakes  - fab bread and scones and first class service by Patrick and his team.
the best i have ever tasted. Amazing light flaky pastry, delicious. All the locals go there, that says it all
The bakery is right on the quay, and they serve fresh homebaked pasties which are the best I tasted whilst I was in Cornwall. There are a couple of tables inside and more outside to eat at.

Myself and my boyfriend decided we wanted to try a real Cornish Pasty whilst visiting.  As was a pleasant day and with and outdoor seating area we decided to visit St Mawes Bakery. We also had a tea and a coffee.  All at a reasonable price. Friendly service too!

Review Title: Breakfast croissants and coffee on the deck
Review Text: A good little unsophisticated place for crispy good croissants with a coffee on the deck in the sun last week. Cheery service from the young man in charge added to the quality of the day.

We always go this little cafe and always sit outside ,but the one day we called in it started to rain and i asked the lady behind the counter if i could bring the dog inside which i was told no, it is a pity you do not  let dogs come in. You will have your reasons but if it is raining there are not many places in St MAWES where you can take dogs with you for a snack, please think about it as  most dog owners are responsible

Review Title: Lovely bakery, good value and very friendly
Review Text: We visited a few times while in St Mawes. They do a good pasty that's a monster! Bacon rolls were a fine breakfast for the day we left and we took a few apple/cinnamon pastries with us. Staff are all very friendly and up for a chinwag if they have the time (it can get very busy in there). I wish this bakery was round the corner now we're home!
Just bought bread and pastys from here which where very good.All the produce on display looked very nice and fresh.

So its a Thursday lunchtime in sunny St Mawes, let's all have a pasty! 
As we live in Cornwall we have discovered lots of lovely baker's and this is a firm favourite when in the area, the pasty's are often seen being brought into the shop on huge racks and then devoured by the waiting queue and are delicious. The cakes are splendid too.
On this day however whilst waiting for our food in the shop, the lady behind the counter was discussing her car which she named and another guys driving skills very loudly with another customer which is fine I like a chat myself,  but her language was extremely choice indeed, the customer who was talking to her had a child and so did we, I had to hold my hands over my 7 year old sons ears! Not at all what I expected in a quaint little bakery in St Mawes. There is also another lady working there who is so very sharp and abrupt she's quite rude, I know your busy guys and these things probably won't stop people buying from you but it's not on really and very unexpected in such a lovely place. Your food is lovely and I would have reviewed you as excellent but for the blue air

Lovely little bakery on the harbour sells fresh bread pastries and the Cornish pastie everything we bought was beautiful grab a few things to take over on the place ferry and have a picnic that's what we did and everything was delicious we had mini pasties and some wonderful cherry cake and a pastry with lemon curd in don't know the name but try it lovely
Fantastic pot of tea and still warm saffron cake. Sunny. Vintage car concourse on quay with celebrities milling around. Where else in the world would you want to be?
Delicious piping hot pasty.  Pleasant outdoor deck area and the young man who served us came and wiped the wet seats for us.  Very helpful and friendly young man.  Watch the seagulls though!?

Review Title: Best pasties and rolls for miles!
Review Text: Every time we come to St Mawes we have to visit the bakery to try one of Patrick's famous pasties! Cheese and onion are my favourite but you have to get in quick as they sell out as quickly as he bakes them! I can highly recommend this lovely cute this shop and cafe. Great to eat in or take away to enjoy sitting looking out to sea! I cannot recommend them highly enough! Very friendly staff too.
Don't think there is anywhere with such great granary  bread.  Fantastic pasties and Lovely bread rolls.  All with a great Cornish humour.
The bread from this bakery is amazing it stays fresh for days. The malted bread, saffron buns and scones are particularly good

Whenever we stay in St Mawes we always ensure we buy their lovely fresh bread an wonderful cakes. They are honestly the best cakes and bread I have tasted - the bread is always soft and stays fresh for days, the cakes are lovely and moist and never dry. Would recommend you won't be disappointed!

Spotless and the smell of fresh hot food.........try the Pasties but if you are not a fan there are many more little tasties to temp you.
Good to see place's like this still flourish.
Can never ever beat a good pastime from this quay side hidden gem have to get there fast 12:00!! So much meat and potato!
Stopped here twice for stocking up on scones and pasties before several packed lunches! Very tasty, friendly staff and well priced.
Fabulous bakery on the harbour, sells the the most delicious bread. The large lumpy white is a winner every time!
Best pasties I had in Cornwall.  Sat on their wee terrace enjoying the sunshine, munching on a just delivered pasty. A little slice of heaven.

This was without a doubt the very best Cornish pasty I have even eaten. Side crimped and packed with meat and flavour. Crisp flaky pastry. Simple yet perfect balanced filling. It just does not get better than this. Apart from The Saffron Bun. A Cornish and Scandinavian delicacy, similar to a tea cake yet very different. The Saffron adds a pinch of luxury and these are genuine and absolutely use no food colouring. You can see flecks of delicate stems in the enriched dough. Recommendation ‚Äì buy your pasty and eat it on the harbour wall. Then buy your bun and repeat. Lovely.
St Mawes Bakery you are sooooo special.  Best party's EVER and cakes fantastic too!  Warmest friendliest service you will find.  Fab!

I always eat cornish pasties from here when visiting St Mawes, no others compare!

The pasties are rather large, which is another bonus!

The place to go for freshly baked bread, scones and pasties .
Staff very obliging and they serve tea and coffee to go with the pasties,

Review Title: A family appeal that's known dear and wide.
Review Text: A small family run cafe bakery that has a big appeal. A number of cozy tables inside raised decking outside, looking south across St Mawes Harbour. Fresh, daily baked bread, pastries and pasties that are a daily staple for locals and visitors alike. The quality of what is served can be testified every morning particularly in the Summer months, by the queue out through the door. Fresh pasties are baked throughout the day and are often pre-ordered. The Bakery has an old fashioned charm, totally family run. It is a place where old friends meet and new friends are made.

Review Title: Very pleasant service and quality at the bakery
Review Text:
Very good service nothing was too much trouble for the chap who served me,
Most other fast food outlets closed, but this little oasis worth a visit, 
Bacon bap brilliant as was the tea, and outside seating on a very mild pleasant late November day

Review Title: Perfect pasties served with a smile
Review Text: we went over to St mawes from falmouth on the ferry and our first stop was the pasty shop. We had to order our pasties as they were being cooked. We returned for them after a walk up to the castle. Delicious and meaty! We also had a buttery cookie and a Danish pastry type of cake - both delicious!
A charming little bakery on the harbour wall. No visit to St Mawes complete without a trip to this bakery.

Stumbled across this little cage on the front at St Mawes. A couple of tables inside and 3 outside on a little raised deck overlooking the water. A lovely lady inside said if we didn't mind waiting 10 minutes she was just 'popping up the road' to the bakery for some fresh pasties.  Sure enough 10 minutes later she arrived back with 12 fresh home made pasties. Word got out that a new supply was available. We had 1 each and the other 10 sold within 5 minutes - they were tasty, well filled and piping hot. Great cup of coffee and a pot of tea all for less than ¬£9! Sat outside in the sun and watched the world go by.  The two teacakes we got 'to go' were so fresh we ate them from the paper bag, delicious and no need for butter.  We'll certainly head back there again!

Called in here after walking from St Just in Roseland along the coast path on a beautiful October day. Bought Cornish pasties to take away having read previous trip advisor reviews. We concur wholeheartedly! Fabulous fresh, tasty pasties served with a smile.

Sat outside the St Mawes Hotel quaffing Cornish Lager in the uncharacteristic September sunshine & we noticed a baker keep walking towards the harbour with tray after tray of freshly baked cake and pies so, once we finished our drinks, we just had to follow him.

A Pasty and piece of Cornish Fruit Cake later and we both wanted more! Great value and delicious. If I was being ultra-critical, the pasty could have had some swede & a bit more seasoning but can't knock the meat content. Absolutely lovely thanks.

I'm already in trouble for the title but you see I don't like Cornish Pasties! So when my partner suggested that I have one I was ready to be under whelmed. What a surprise. The pastry was flakey and moist as well as tasty. I could have eaten the pasty without the filling. Then the filling had proper tasty meat and potatoes and vegetables that were really enjoyable. 
Sitting outside looking at the harbour made the experience even better. I'm a convert. The only problem is that the next pasty from another bakery may not be up to the incredible standard.

We tried the pasties after reading the reviews and they were good but certainly not the best we tried in Cornwall, they were nice and had a good steak content , however they were not well seasoned.
I would say they were the best we had in St Mawes!
We were staying in St Mawes and bought amazing freshly baked sausage rolls and pasties here. Would highly recommend a visit.
The best pasties and yum yums in Cornwall. A must buy whilst in St Mawes! Great service and very fresh produce. Get a pasty to sit and eat it and watch the world go by.

This very friendly family run bakery was definitely the highlight of my visit to Famouth/St. Mawes. I've never tasted a pasty so good in all my life - the crust was so buttery and tasty, while there was plenty of meat in the filling. So so flavoursome! The family who run the bakery are very proud of their pasties and rightly so. The recipe is a family secret and has been in the family for over a hundred years. I also had tea and a scone after my pasty, and again, this was so tasty. The scone was flawless and the Rooda's clotted cream that came with it was probably the best cream I've ever had. Such excellent value too. I'd definitely return to St. Mawes for this bakery alone.

You couldn't find a friendlier bunch! The waiter that served us was so lovely and welcoming. The cakes were delicious and the drinks, just right! It's a lovely spot to watch St.Mawes life go on and would highly recommend! Slight wasp issue but they were doing their best to combat this.

Review Title: Good ranges of freash cakes and pastries
Review Text: Do lovely pastries and cookies here. We popped in during a harbour festival and had a few treats which was nice.
A great way to start the day. Fresh bread rolls from this tiny quayside bakery. Also have seats and hot drinks if you want to have your coffee and croissants out.
Visited the bakery every morning during a recent stay in St Mawes for breads and pain au chocolate. excellent! Also tried their traditional Cornish pasties, very good but I have sampled better!
The most delicious pasties. The flapjack was fantastic too! Can sit outside to enjoy the view. Got to drink your tea quickly in the wind though!
Great bread... Croissants..... and buns. It was good value and cooked to perfection. Do not know anyone who does not like this place.

The four of us went for a cream tea at around 17.30 as the staff were clearing up.  We had some lighthearted banter with them and they gladly put the coffee and tea urns (or however it was done, I didn't pay attention) and four cream teas/coffees were served.  They were truly delicious, the banter continued and everything was superb.  Pasties, pastries, scones, bread, etc are all baked fresh every day and excellent value for money and very tasty.  We would certainly suggest you give them a try.  But be prepared to queue at busy times, as it appears the word has already gone round!

This is a favourite among locals and tourists. The bread is really good quality and very cheap especially if a deal is on. The pasties are fantastic and this is coming from someone who is not a fan of pasties. The staff are very friendly and welcoming as well. 

There are a lot of great places to eat in St Mawes but if you want a cheap and easy quick lunch this is a great option. Buy a pasty and enjoy the view from the harbour

Review Title: You got to try a pasty
Review Text: Was in St Mawes just before Easter so this was a great place to buy fresh and tasty Hot Cross buns. During the week the pasties are also fresh and excellent - more centre than pastry

Visited St Mawes for the day and had lunch at the bakery which is in a central location. Lovely hot pasties at a really good price also had a pot of tea for two served by a helpful waitress whilst we sat at the tables on the decking at the side of the shop enjoying the sunshine. Several other people enjoying what looked to be a tasty afternoon tea.

Review Title: Excellent fresh bread at reasonable prices
Review Text:
We stayed in St. Just for a week and used this bakery almost every morning.
It is always freshly baked with great service and good prices. 
The big grains bread is particularly good.
Fabulous pasties, delicious saffron buns, lovely scones. A warm place for a coffee too, especially in rainy windy Cornwall !

We called in here for takeaway lunch. Rolls were on the small side but delicious and generously filled. Husband waited 5 mins for a fresh pasty and was impressed! Great chocolate brownies and the farmhouse slice was truly scrumptious - could have downed a second slice no problem! Great coffee too and friendly service. Very reasonably priced as well, all in all great value and possibly one of the best locations to stand and drink a coffee in the world!

Review Title: Great fresh bread in the Morning!
Review Text: Unbeatable part of the day in St Mawes of the fresh bread for breakfast, saffron buns for picnics and lots more.  Still running out of the same tiny premises as always, but now that the Harbour Master has a new control tower, there is room to expand a bit.. Looking forward to seeing how it goes, my Luvver!

Review Title: This small shop often has queues out of the door
Review Text: Good food made from good quality ingredients prepared locally.  I discovered this baker over ten years ago and was addicted from the start. The saffron buns are superb and unmatched so far.

Another person actually wrote the exact words that I was thinking: Pastries (or Pasties) Before the Ferry. You definitely need to stop here for provisions before getting on the ferry and walking to St. Anthony's Head. Highly recommended. And, the pasties actually travel surprisingly well; after being carried for a few hours in our daypacks, they were still intact and even more delicious after some exertion.

A must visit  to buy your bread and rolls as well as having a delightful meal, especially the Pasties and Crab Rolls. Great location right on the harbour so eating and people watching is a great way to spend a lunch time.

Great place to sit and wait for the ferry to Place if you're walking the South West Coastal Path. Note that there aren't a lot of seats, but the owner is very helpful and pleasant. Great pastries as well!

Review Title: Delicious, a must for any visit to St Mawes
Review Text: We hopped off the ferry and into the bakery on the quay for a cream tea. The bakery has a couple of tables inside. Very, very affordable delicious and friendly, they also have tons of other yummy cakes and bread that we would try next time. Ideal stop off to get picnic before heading to the beach.

Quite simply that - the best pasties ever, and consistent year on year.

Their bread, doughnuts and saffron buns are fantastic too
Having spent a week on holiday, with pasties everyday, the winner was the St Mawes Bakery pasty - for both the traditional and the cheese and onion vegetarian option.
They have to be selling one of the best pasties in Cornwall! Saffron buns were equally as delicious, cream teas looked fab - I could go on!
Brilliant sat on the Quay drinking coffee and eating a scrummy pasty.  Service with a smile and sense of humour.

Set on the quay side in St. Mawes, such friendly staff and they have the Best Cornish Pasty ever, it was the best I have ever tasted and we have been visiting Cornwall on and off since 1966, well wort a visit.

We called in on a very wet day in June for a cream tea.  The teas were great value and excellent quality.  Scones lovely, light and fresh.  Warm friendly welcome too from lady standing in for the owner.  Due to the weather we sat inside but the outside areas would be lovely given better conditions.
we have pasties  coffees cream teas here on a regular basis and it is allways of a high standard and the kids love the yumyums

As a local lad, Patrick's pasties have been a fairly regular feature for most of my life, especially through the long summers of my childhood! 
Excellent pastry, and good balance of all the ingredients Lovely. 

On other notes, all the other baked goods are awesome, and well priced too! 
The staff are always smily, and don't mind if traipse in in soaking wet sailing gear!

If you are in St Mawes, pop along to the Quay for your lunch!

Had a cappuccino, pot of tea and two gorgeous cakes from here for ¬£5. Very good value, and we sat and ate it on the quay with wonderful views, in the sunshine. The woofs were welcome too, definitely one to go back too.

After 3 weeks traveling in the UK I must say this was my favorite scone, not to mention the friendly lady who runs the shop. It was also the best pasty I ever experienced. It will be difficult to have one from the chain pasty shop ever again!

Review Title: The best saffron buns in St Mawes, probably the best in Cornwall!
Review Text:
We popped into the bakery several time, mainly to pick up saffron buns and picnic items. On our last day we bought a lot of scones to make up some cream teas from friends & family back home.

A friendly team in the shop, always helpful and willing to give advice when asked.

They must supply several of the hotels and businesses in the village as we'd often seen the delivery boy trundling back to the bakery with an empty tray!

Well worth a visit!
Cornish Pasties were delicious, hot and freshly cooked, best I have ever tasted, lots of choice of cakes and pastries as well as Scones with Cream and jam.well worth a visit.
Can recommend the cornish pasties here.  We sat on the harbour wall eating them fresh out of the oven.  Very busy bakery

Review Title: The best hot cross buns ever
Review Text: We stay in St Mawes with our family for a week each Easter. Always stop off at the bakery for our bread and a cake. Disappointed with pasties from here though. The hot cross buns were the best ever

We had a pasty when got there on Friday pm.it was fresh and delicious,when we left on Monday we brought home a pasty for me and the wife and one for the son great one of the best that I have had.also we brought home a flat top granary loaf that had just been cooked,when we got home and had a slice for tea it was stunning.highly recommended

Review Title: Really friendly staff, great customer servuce
Review Text: Lovely staff, the lady greeted me immediately I entered the little shop and called me "Flower" and made me feel very welcome. I bought some saffron buns and a Danish pastry. Great prices and great bakes.
Patrick's pasties are the best, it's worth waiting in line, they are the best, lots of other yummy things as well.  See you next time.

Our family enjoyed some bits and pieces from here for our journey home. 
Cornish Pastie was the best of the week with fab pastry and generous steak filling. Lovely and warm too. 
Belgian iced buns which were super fresh and well iced and a doughnut which my son said was the best he's ever had. 
Brilliant. 
And the lady who served us was lovely too. 
Well done, can't wait til our next visit

Was so excited to tuck into a proper Cornish pasty after reading the reviews on here. Unfortunately, the pasty we got here was decidedly average. Nice and fresh but nothing special at all. Not much seasoning, average meat an unimaginative vegetable mix. We also felt really sorry for the lady working there as she seemed to be struggling to cope even though there were very few customers and no one was in a rush. St Mawes is beautiful and I think it deserves a better pasty!

We love it here and it's an essential part of our annual visit to the area. We even stock up on pasties on the last morning for the journey home. Lovely scones, the best saffron buns and top notch pasties... And always served with a smile!

The smell as you walk into the bakery is divine, brings back lots of good childhood  memories .  The lady who runs it is very friendly and chatty.  The Saffron buns were delicious, and a lovely yellow colour full of mixed fruit as was the sugary rock cake.  A must visit when in St Mawes.
Love this bakery.  Truly authentic delicious pasties,  generous size - we always pay a visit when in Cornwall.
All the food we bought from here was wonderful, very tasty, and the young lady who served us was very friendly.

Situated on the pier at the harbour.  Nowhere in Kernow, in England or indeed the wider UK will you taste such delicious Cornish Pasties ! A meal in itself.  Get there early though as the locals love them too !  Nice selection of bread and cakes too though could perhaps change varieties a little more often.  Pleasant service from lovely staff.

Lovely bakery that produced the scrumtious pasties that we shovelled into our mouths as fast as we could.....hmmmmmmm bought there as much as we could.  Everything just tastes twice as nice in a lovely area of England.  Had to fight the seagulls off though....they too enjoy the bakery !
Great saffron buns and pasties! Take some home with you or just enjoy them fresh on the harbour but don't feed the gulls!
Small but beautifully formed, good selection of breads, cakes and of course pasties. Visited lots of times and once by padding into the quay, easily accessible for paddlers and other boat users.

Can't believe the comments from one person re. staff attitude. A friendlier bunch of folk you could not find, and I'm on holiday too! Food is basic but well done and served with a big smile - and outstanding value for money. As a bloody northerner I like my money's worth, but I have to say I couldn't eat so well for such meagre outlay on the Yorkshire Coast! And what a view! Trip Advisor tip - read the negatives, realise they are sad individuals and get back to the positives - this is a treasure!

Cute little bakery with delicious freshly baked delights.

I'd recommend the pasties - meat /cheese & onion and the saffron cakes.
I see/tasted why!!!!  Loved the pasties, Chelsea bun, fresh bread and Scones!!!!  Lovely friendly lady served me....real basic food, just the type I like..give me more!!!!!

Lovely - the best pasties I had all week, I went back for a second one!  The staff are lovely, friendly and bright. Even though it was extremely busy, the young lady didn't stop smiling and chatting with everyone.  She was watching everywhere and even knocked on the window to me when the cheese  and onion pasty I'd ordered arrived sooner than expected.  The bakers were great as well - very friendly and it was a treat to see them walking down the road with the tray of freshly baked pastries held on their shoulder.  Sat on their decking in the sunshine, overlooking the fabulous St Mawes harbour and looking out at St Anthony's head, you'd think there was no finer place to be!
Pasties and Cakes for a long walk in the woods. Go here! Fantastic. Ignore the queue outside. It only takes a few minutes and is well worth it.
It's a real pleasure to go into an extremely busy but small bakery and be served by friendly and happy staff. The sell awesome pasties, luscious bread & cakes. Happy to queue!

Happy and helpful staff, delicious food, sea air and a sunny day.....bliss!
This is a quality business with staff who work hard and with a smile even though it was very busy.
Pasty,sausage roll, scone,croissant, ice bun and chocolate cookie were all sampled by me and my girls...delicious!
We called to take some home with us at 8.30 am monday and there was a queue! ..say no more.
Love this place, been going for years. Does everything you'd want from a great bakery including superb freshly made pastys.

The best pasties on this planet!! I've been all over Cornwall these last few years and had a few pasties in my time but these are the best! Julie the owner told me she only used fresh ingredients and butchers steak . The pastry was the best! Lovely cakes too. A real little gem of a bakery x

I highly recommend that you get your pasties from the St Mawes Bakery if in the area. They are the best pasties I've ever tasted and I like to sample them from everywhere. Also the jam doughnuts are Devine as are the cookies. Great value for money. My favourite shop in St Mawes.
Great Bakery which also had the option of a coffee/ Tea etc so you can enjoy on the habour. Beautiful baked bread and cakes we used everyday (except Sunday they are closed)

You must visit here when in the area, the pasties are to die for not to mention the cakes which i sampled when waiting for my pastie order (6?) to take back home.
Jane & Pat run the bakery and love a bit of banter - can't wait to see them again next year.

Our annual St Mawes holiday includes a frequent visit to the bakery in the harbour. Lovely scones- could eat them all day, every day! 

Pasties are good, but for me the scones seal the deal. Well worth a visit- but get yr coffee from across the road at the Chandlers.

Saffron buns and croissants to die for. This bakery is part of our tradition, every breakfast of our annual St Mawes holiday involves a trip to the baker before breakfast and the whole family dig into the fresh warm delicious breakfast goods on the return, fabulous!

Local bakery selling great pasties and also has a few tables on the quayside for coffees, cakes etc. Ideal for those wanting to kill time before getting on the ferry, or just to relax and watch harbour life unfold.
Great bread and pasties, get there early to get your 1st choice of bread. Hot pasties arrive later in the morning around 11am

Bought a couple of cakes while walking around St Mawes. Cornish cake and iced bun. Both were excellent and at ¬£1 each good value for what was offered. There were plenty of other options available, all of which looked appealing

Review Title: Great home cooked food, best cornish pasties I tasted
Review Text: We had coffee and cakes/pastries here several times during our stay in St Mawes. The food is excellent, as is the coffee. The staff were very pleasant and sociable. Although the seating area is quite small we were fortunate enough always to get a table and to sit on the quayside, "people watch" and watch the world go by was very pleasant indeed.

Review Title: Still good but pasties not as good as last year.
Review Text: Don't get me wrong, this is still a great pasty. Piping hot, pastry to die for and extremely well flavoured, but the pasty we had here in April 2013 had at least twice as much meat in it. I told EVERYONE about these pasties but would say they have gone from a 9 and half out of ten  to an 8. Also the woman serving was quite rude to the customer in front of us who dared to ask if there was any bread left and whether they sold plain scones. She was met with extremely short shrift. But the pasties are still great and would recommend them highly.

Lovely fresh baked bread, pastries and savouries .... All brought across from the actual bakery nearby, and served from a small shop right on the harbour .... seating area outside it, where we enjoyed morning coffee .... must give the Yum Yums and Large Sausage Rolls a try .... :-)
fresh every day, no additives what more could you want.   Outside seating area on the quay at St.Mawes.

This little hut on the quayside serves the most gorgeous pasties I have ever tasted. When we arrived, they had run out, and the proprietor advised us that some were in transit as we spoke. True to her word, they were delivered, and were still piping hot, gorgeous!  The pastry is flaky, and the pasties packed with filling, and sooo tasty, full of flavour.  Brilliant,and  will return before we go home.

On arriving into St. Mawes on the early morning ferry, we stopped at St. Mawes bakery for a spot of breakfast. We had a cornish pasty and a sweet bun which were both delicious. The bakery has a few tables outside on the pier with nice views of the bay. Worth a visit.

We stay in St Mawes each year as a base and enjoy the ambiance :0)  This little outlet on the corner of the harbour is a little gem.  We use it each year.  This year we were lucky to find a seating spot on their little patio to have brunch.  We had hot pasties and tea (and coffee).  The pasty was delicious and the service delightful (they enjoy their work).  On the patio you have an excellent view of St Mawes.  We have also in the past purchased cakes, bread etc.  Worth a stop even for takeaway service.

Review Title: Patrick`s Perfect Pasties are the best!!
Review Text: Lovely place and definitely the best pasties in Cornwall!!  My son Michael will only eat pasties from here, although he was brought up in St Mawes and born too.  We moved away and now visit when we can.  This is the first place on his list to visit as well as his dad, papa and his uncle of course who still lives in St Mawes.

In a region claiming to have award winning pasties, these are definitely up with the best. Two Cornish ladies offered a warm and inviting welcome and served the best pasties and sausage roll. Whilst small, it serves quality food and you should drop in when in St Mawes.

Review Title: A Quirky little eatery, worth a visit though!
Review Text: Situated on the corner of the quayside car park sits the bakery with a small, slightly elevated seating area next to the road.  We ordered some Cornish pasties but they were out of these. They won't be long, give me 3 minutes said the lady. True to her word, 3 minutes later a young lad arrived from up the road carrying new supplies! Not too expensive, piping hot and very tasty. Odd location and set up, not sure where the actual baking was carried out, but very nice food, worth trying out for a snack.

Was in St. Mawes recently and must say the pasties and saffron buns were excellent. Many firms could learn from the quality of the products in St. Mawes Bakery. Many firms do pasties but you need the good old Cornish ingredients which St Mawes Bakery use.Cant wait to go to St. Mawes once again so we can again sample their products. Well done St. Mawes Bakery.

Stayed at the ship & castle hotel,so this was ideal for a treat,we had the doughnuts and just as we read about they were big and yummy with jam oozing out,best we've had,hubby tried the iced bun (different day)he said it was lovely,I tried a pastor but wasn't keen(just me),will visit again when in St mawes.

Had fresh bread from here most mornings on our holiday and it was very nice quality. Depending on what time you get there you may even be able to get the warm bread fresh out of the oven! Also had pasties one afternoon and they were lovely and fresh with excellent flavours and choice. Brilliant!

Best Pasties in Cornwall!!
This is by far the best place to buy pasties, bread and cakes in St Mawes. 
The cafe part is good too!!
We come to St. Mawes a lot and we have food for breakfast everyday from this bakery. It is amazing food. The donuts are truly irresistable. I would rate this 6 stars if i could.

So difficult to walk past the glorious smells emanating from this place ! The pasties are yummy,as are the saffron buns,scones etc, but my favourite had to be the iced fruit buns which were amazing and my husband loved the jam donuts! A good job I don't live here,think I could develop a sticky bun addiction!

Review Title: gurt lush pastys down here me janner
Review Text: definately one of the best pastys ive had, and thats saying something because i am a pasty afficionado, well worth a visit, lovely place st mawes is too
Great location just as you get off the St Mawes ferry from Falmouth.  We were really looking forward to sampling the delights of the pasties we'd heard tasted so amazing.  Donuts are amazing as well.

Step off the st Mawes Ferry ,as we did on a  sunny cold November day ,and treat yourself to a fab hot pasty. Lovely wholesome British bakery with bags of big squishy jam donuts to take home if you can manage to keep the kids noshing them on the Ferry back to Falmouth.
The most fabulous pasties and sitting on the decking over looking the gorgeous harbour, in St Mawes, Love it!

We just popped in while waiting for the passenger ferry to Falmouth.

The beautifully fresh pasties were really very good and the teacakes we ate at home were also delicious.

Friendly staff, iconic little servery.....
Not the very best pasies we've had (Chough Bakery, Padstow) but very good. Nice location too, overlooking the harbour.
Have eaten their bread and pasties for 50+ summers now and they never disappoint. Have even taken them home and frozen them but they're not the same without the view and the Roseland air!

Review Title: Quick and easy,  but nothing special.
Review Text: We visited the bakery for a quick lunch and had some pasties.  They were OK,  but I didn't find them any better than most others we had in Cornwall.  The seating outside with the view of the harbour was nice though

Review Title: Quick Coffee Stop on my 63mile Cycle
Review Text: Well worth a visit, especially this time of year to avoid he crowds. Coffee and Flapjck - Perfect fuel for my Cycle back to Redruth! Will be here again! Thankyou!
A popular shop on the quay, with some outdoor seating. Good pasties, great bread, friendly service - not much else to say really!
We have been buying pasties here on a regular basis during the summer for some years now. Always dependable with excellent pastry, and delicious filling.

Obviously a local favorite, and enjoying a perfect location on the quayside, this was soon a daily requirement during our week-long holiday in St Mawes. The white loaf was probably one of the best I've had, and the iced buns were light and perfect.

A tiny shop on the quay selling fresh bread, cakes and pasties.
We scoffed pasties, sitting on the harbour wall.  Wish I lived here.

we hunted around for ages until we came across the most wonderful bakery and found it in st mawes. The bread is always fresh (not as hard as a brick that some shops sell you)and the pasties and cakes are wonderful ,we made a special trip to fill a bag up with goodies before we went home . After two days I am still eating fresh bread for my lunch at work that takes me back to st mawes bakery and the cream tea we had ,wonderful. The ladies in the shop are so nice and helpful .

One of the pleasures of traveling is trying the local food and with Cornwall that means pasties. I've tried Cornish pasties from a number of places in Cornwall. Disappointingly at one place I stopped for a lunchtime cup of tea and a pasty they saw fit to use a microwave and I ended up with a perfectly good pasty ruined.At the St Mawes Bakery however, their pasties are first class. A generous amount of meat evenly distributed and well seasoned filling. Apparantly the cakes from the bakery are rather good too.

Review Title: a treat literally by the harbour wall
Review Text: What a great little bakery and service with a cheery welcome.  We stopped for coffee one day and again for tea and each time managed to find a sit at the few tables alongside and enjoyed both the lovely homemade cake but also the marvellous view.

A small shop that is not fancy, just gets on with providing really good baked goods.
Friendly service and even late in the day has not run out of stuff to sell.
Worth going just for the smell.
This little bakery had the best pasties ever, lots of choice and very good quality at reasonable prices fully recommend.
The steak pasties are a delight. Also the saffron buns! They've also started serving coffees and teas, with a little seating area that looks over the sea.

Forget the thousands of outlets selling pasties.  If you want a really good locally made Cornish pasty its got to be St Mawes Bakery.  We first came for their pasties not long after they opened and have been coming back everytime we are in the area.  If you aren't staying near St Mawes, then don't despair, just pop across on the ferry from Falmouth.  On the down side, they had run out of saffron buns!!!

PS.  St Mawes is a Cornish gem, not to be missed on any tour of Cornwall.
Wonderful smiley happy cheerful service!  We sat on the harbour watching the world go by eating delicious cornish pasties and cakes/biscuits.

We popped in here for a cream tea after the St Mawes to Falmouth boat trip (which I recommend)
Sat outside by the quay with a delightful view and had one of the cheapest but best cream teas I've tasted, scones very fresh, Cornish clotted cream and big pot of tea for ¬£3.50 unbelievable ! Staff very friendly ( had to carry my tray out for me as had a cast on my foot) The pasties looked good so will be back to try !
If you are in St Mawes, make sure you time it right for when the pasties are ready - these are the best!!!!  They also do pretty good scones!

We nipped in here for a nosey and ended up buying two scruptious sausage rolls and a mushroom and stilton pie. They were beautiful! Came back the next day for a pastie.  The staff were very welcoming and chatted to us. Brilliant selection of hot and cold food and gifts

Review Title: Great food, but pity about the staff
Review Text: I have always bought my bread, rolls and pasties here, but the service and attitude of the staff could be better. Maybe they are busy and rushed off their feet? Maybe they just don't like tourists? Who knows?

Brilliant quality of food, quirky staff, a true character  part of St Mawes . If you come on a holiday here then buy pasties atbthe bakery on the quay and take them up to the castle, sit on a seat looking out over the bay and enjoy a wonderful food experience.
Also does delicious saffron buns!

Who knew that Yum Yums could be so addictive ?
By the end of our holiday in St Mawes we were being asked "the usual ?" when we entered the bakery ;-)

Remember to arrive for the foot ferry early and pick up supplies for a day trip to Falmouth
On the way back collect fresh, warm breads for tea
Where else would you buy bread and pastries in st mawes ?  Mind you for me its a close call between their pasties and those from the st mawes deli.  I usually have both

Great pasties and scones. A true local bakers based in St Mawes but you'll find their goodies all over the local area. 

Well worth the calories!
This is a proper bakery with excellent bread, cakes and staff. Try a donut or 2 . Always fantastic any time of year - take home, freeze and defrost and still it's delicious.

Review Title: Very google, but not quite the right mix
Review Text:
We've been here before and no doubt we'll be back again. A very busy small shop on the St Mawes quayside, across from the harbour master's office. The staff we're obviously used to being rushed off their feet as their smiles shone through. Supplies were regularly replenished by the piping hot tray load and the taste was just as I remembered from our last visit about 5 years ago - just sublime! The only let down was the lack of meat in favour of potato. At ¬£2.95 each (July 2013) I expected a bit more. For the full immersive Cornish experience, I recommend sitting on the quayside and watching the boats and kids crabbing whilst eating. 

I expect we visited on a bad day, so will return again on this trip for another tasting - just to check on quality :-)

Review Title: Yum,Yum, Yummy !!! Pastie to Die for !!!!!
Review Text: My partner and I stopped by the sea wall in St. Mawes and had planned to take a wander through the town but we were also hungry....we just happened to find an area where people were sitting outside in the warm sunlight....then we noticed a little shop that had baked goods in the window....we ordered some tea for two and some pasties.....we took the pasties and tea and sat down to watch the seagulls flying overhead....my partner had the traditional pastie with beef,  and I had a vegatable pastie.....our first bites convinced us that we had stumbled onto the best pasties we had ever had eaten or that might ever exist in the entire world of "pastie" making.  As an American I had never been all that fond of pasties, but now I am a convert.  I would drive or fly to get to the St. Mawes Bakery just to enjoy the pure delight of eating one of their homemade pasties.
Brilliant food, good service seating area small and used by people not buying from the bakery.  It's just of the harbour but can be tracked down by the wonderful fresh baked smells.

Review Title: Childhood smells revived at Quay-side Bakery
Review Text: My 3penny treat some school days in the 1940s was a Walls Ice Cream in a paper wrapper from this everlasting local shop which now sells the best pasties ever! Dangle your feet over the water's edge while sitting on the Quay side opposite to enjoy your take-away and read my Walkabout St Mawes from amazon.com/author/vivienuff.  It leads you round the historic village sights in a short or extended figure of 8 and recalls my childhood delights.  Let yourself imagine the fun of past swimming galas, rowing races, the greasy pole and diving for plates just where you are sitting watched by countless boats of all descriptions tied up to a rope ending by the Idle Rocks hotel opposite.  Imagine the excitement of the schoolchildren dressed in white for the evening carnival and Floral Dance led by a silver band, dancing in and out of the Rising Sun, the St Mawes Hotel, the Watch House etc.  This bakery has seen it all and never lost its appeal for residents and visitors whether budget-conscious day-trippers or super-rich summer 'locals'.  The sea wall on either side is the perfect vantage point for the regatta on August 3rd where sailing boats come almost close enough to touch the Quay on a high tide - great for photographs of the crews.

Review Title: The absolute best pasties in Cornwall says my Cornish husband
Review Text: Wonderful location on the quay and delicious home made pasties. Have eaten many in Cornwall, and along with some from Pelynt these are the best!
You cannot go wrong with this bakery. The bread and cakes come piping hot from the bakery across the road from the shop. Try the Cornish pasties they are great mmmmm

We visit Portscatho every year and look forward to reaquainting our tastebuds with the delicious produce from St Mawes Bakery. Always friendly staff in the shop is an added bonus. Just a pity it's so far away from home!

we had two weeks touring cornwall in april, visited st mawes on a friday, very friendly helpfull lady,and the pasties were best we had tasted and bread was wonderfull would recommend  service and the food!!

My wife and I were based in Newquay during our visit from Florida at the beginning of the year (Jan to April).

We spent many days 'Exploring Cornwall' and tried lots of different Cornish Pasties from a variety of locations during our explorations.

Without doubt, St Mawes Bakery Pasties became our absolute favourites. The pastry and filling were top quality and meeting Patrick, the baker/delivery guy, was an additional bonus  -  he's a charming chap.

Having decided that St. Mawes Bakery Pasties were our favourites, we would literally drive from Newquay to St. Mawes for a Pasty Lunch and took our pasties up to the Car Park by the Castle to enjoy with the view.

I would also urge potential customers to try those fabulous chunky Sausage Rolls that St. Mawes Bakery excel at  -  best Sausage Roll I have ever had.

As for prices, they might not be the cheapest but certainly represent the best value. 'Quality and Value' are better than 'Cheap' any day of the week.

Well Done Patrick and St. Mawes Bakery, keep up your standards and we look forward to seeing you next time we are in England.
its a long time since ive seen and tasted good old fashioned baked bread but this is just what it says it is. thoroughly enjoyed ferry to ST MAWES + visit to bakers.

We are so lucky to have such a good friendly bakery in the village (but my waistline is not so lucky!) The wholegrain bread and rolls are delicious and really keep fresh for quite some days.  The pasties are excellent and the saffron buns, etc really good. Keep up the good work Patrick, Andrew and family.

Really friendly when very busy, gorgeous bread and pasties. They had run out of white rolls but she provided me with some lovely baguettes. The bakery was full of people with a big queue and she made time for us all! Lovely lady.

My wife and I got cornish pasties from the shop on the quayside, I am sorry to say I was less than impressed, the pastry was the largest part and had to throw most of it away, the filling was not to my or my wifes personal taste, the price was extortionate. on return to Llandudno I went to Asda and got a perfectly good Cornish pasty for 50p. We felt ripped off.

Hot home made pasties delivered to the shop  on quayside by Patric on a very regular  basis, so always fresh and oven hot& Top Quality.
If you are in St Mawes  this place is a must!
Bread and pasties fresh from the kitchen a few yards away. Nothing more than a hour or so old. A long established family business that's a local favourite and loved by holidaymakers too.

My family and I have just returned from a week in Cornwall where we had a plan to try out different take away pasties. The ones from St Mawes Bakery won the competition!! 

The meat was high quality, plenty of filling and lovely pastry.

Well recommended!

Get a traditional meat one and eat it at the harbourside.
Bread and pasties fresh from the kitchen a few yards away. Nothing more than a hour or so old. A long established family business that's a local favourite and loved by holidaymakers too.

My family and I have just returned from a week in Cornwall where we had a plan to try out different take away pasties. The ones from St Mawes Bakery won the competition!! 

The meat was high quality, plenty of filling and lovely pastry.

Well recommended!

Get a traditional meat one and eat it at the harbourside.

Review Title: Always worth the call from anywhere
Review Text: Brilliant, place just called from Florida to get cakes for my Dad's 93 birthday, they told me that they don't make birthday cakes anymore, but still wouldn't go anywhere else, Steve is great and his daughter was wonderful to talk too. See you in September 2024. Nigel, Florida.
Confused if someone doesn‚Äôt give a 5 star review, stunning business and great food. Well worth a visit. Get me a ham salad roll every day of the week.

Review Title: They've got a massive range of goods.
Review Text: That's a real feast for the eyes, and the staff was dead keen to help with the pickin'. Top-notch quality on the products, though there's a few wee quirks in the service. Despite that, I'm chuffed with my buy and would give the shop a shoutout.

Oh dear! Not the place to go if you‚Äôre dieting!
Go early if, like us, you have your heart set on a custard donut‚Ä¶ by 1.15 they‚Äôd all goneüòÇüòÇ
The most DELICIOUS selection of cakes and savoury treats. 
The bread is superb
Cannot recommend this bakery highly enough‚Ä¶great food and fast friendly service.

Absolutely so so happy to see the traditional sausage rolls still Available to purchase at half past one on a Saturday afternoon, 
awesome  super treat , Literally this bakery sells everything off their shelf‚Äôs 
Every time, it‚Äôs that popular, 
I highly Recommend this outstanding top Bakery, LEGENDs 
Always polite ,smart looking ,smiling staff , 
Thank you 
D

Review Title: Rustic style loaves for Medieval Banquet
Review Text: Hi all at Burbidges, just to say the  loaves of bread we collected on Saturday for our Medieval style Banquet party were delicious. Served with stews and casseroles on wooden plates.We had lots of compliments on the bread from the guests and used the bread for Sunday morning bacon sandwiches for the guests who stayed over. Thank you again.
Worth the visit as ever. Great selection and a asset to andover. Bacon baps are well worth it and dohnuts that are huge

Review Title: A weekly visit is a must!!
Review Text:
We have recently moved to Andover and a local friend recommended this bakery.
Well, we have been totally blown away the range and quality of the breads, cakes and sandwiches.
This has now become our "go to" place for Saturday lunch.
The staff are lovely too, very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them.
Thank you Burbidges :-)

Review Title: Ham salad French stick type roll
Review Text:
When I get the chance and they haven't sold out. This roll is so incredibly tasty. If you like mayo its nice with that too. But to be honest this roll needs or wants for anything.
Fantastic job. The Cornish pasties are really excellent and the bacon rolls. You can choose how many pieces of bacon you want. So if you want a top bakery look no further for a great range of products.

Wayne Tester

Not great if I‚Äôm honest!!! Arrived with great expectations but was very disappointed!!!! Maybe there should be variation in price depending on what time of day you arrive. We arrived at 12:45 and appeared to be left with the burnt flacks scraps!!!
Sausage roll was mainly left in tiny particles all over the car as it just disintegrated into dust as was so over cooked!
The pea Pasty wasn‚Äôt much better either. I say pea as 90% of the pasty was Pea!!  There was no moisture inside and the mince was dry as a donkey!!! 
Really disappointed!!!
Not all bad though!! The shortbread and carrot cake were bang on! Likely because they hadn‚Äôt been cooked for an eternity!!!!
Very expensive as well especially for over cooked burnt food, if we were in  restaurants it would have gone back!!!!
Staff were great as well

Review Title: Sandwiches to die for. I felt like Joe from Friends "Joe doesn't share food!"
Review Text:
Purchased one of the bakeries sandwiches from the Texaco petrol station and was blown away, the bread was so soft, thick-cut, and full of filling. I drove the remaining 40 miles home raving about this sandwich.
Today I was passing again and this time had to buy one for every member of the office so they too could experience them. :)

I couldn‚Äôt get to Andover for my regular purchase of the best Eccles cakes in the world . They were so nice and posted me a box containing 4 cakes , arrived next day beautifully packed , tasted just as good as from shop , love you Burbidge‚Äôs x

I can never ever fault this bakery. Every single crumb is served and baked with love. Shop bought pastries don‚Äôt have any comparison to this beautiful bakery. I‚Äôm always eager to pop down for my mid week treat. 
Thank you wonderful Bakers, you make people very happy!!

Wow wow wow hands down the best bakery food I have ever eaten in my entire 45 years in this planet. Buttery crisp pastry, real cuts of tasty meat in the pasties and chocolate that had flavour not just sweet and sugary.
Shall be a regular customer from now on. Keep up the excellent work Burbidge Bakers.

Review Title: This is my local bakery and
Review Text: This is my local bakery and I‚Äôm sorry to say the pasties they sell are really poor. Don‚Äôt try and eat one on the go, you end up with a lap full of dry flaky pastry and garden peas rolling all over the place. Why put peas in a pasty?
Came to get Lardy cake for my mum,  she loved it. She lived in Salisbury and o lives in Nottinghamshire. Purchased two lardy cakes for her and she said it was hercbest Christmas present.

Review Title: THE BEST BAKERY IN THE UK
Review Text: I have lived overseas for many years and always visit when I return. The bakery was there when I was going to school and now retired. It is a quality old fashioned bakery hard to find nowadays. Do not miss this place as people line up to buy there. Pasties, sausage rolls, bread and cakes you will not resist. Just the best of the best do not miss this place. Highly recommended,

Review Title: So disappointed.  They actually called it a Cornish Pasty.  More like a soggy mush
Review Text: With everyone going to Devon & Cornwall for their hols this year, all I could think about was enjoying a traditional pasty. So I though I know I‚Äôll go to burbidges bakery. How disappointed was I.   A soggy pastry mush & they had the cheek to charge ¬£2.70 for it. One mouthful then straight in the bin. Won‚Äôt be going there again.

Mrs. Burbidge took my call requesting a spelt loaf. She didn't know me but suggested I call in early Friday to check if one was available - they're usually baked on Fridays and Saturdays but are only special ordered for large orders. I duly called in at 06:00 (yes, really, the phone was answered almost immediately!) and found out that Mrs. Burbidge had gone above and beyond and ordered a honey and spelt loaf for me to collect on Friday. I arrived at the store at 07:00. Wow! Was it ever obvious how popular this bakery is as I joined the socially-distanced queue outside. Going inside the store is an experience - even down to the TV on the wall showing the bakers at work! The staff were pleasant and efficient. But wait, that's not the best of it! The honey & spelt loaf is awesome, the texture and taste were second to none and I am looking forward to my next one already. On this experience, which I plan to repeat regularly, I have to recommend Burbidge's Bakery unreservedly. I just wished that dietary requirements didn't preclude my purchase of any other items from their outstanding selection.

Just had amazing lunch, everything was so fresh and tasty ... other customers were buying pizza so had to try, delicious!  
We took a detour to go there, will definitely do that detour again!

Fantastic service. I ordered a carrot cake here and they were very responsive and got my order completed quickly. Made it easy to pick up and different options of sizes. It is hard not to buy everything in there. Very yummy! Thanks üòÅ
The best Eccles cake you will ever taste. Bread to die for and the most friendly and community inspired Baker this side of the pond.

By far some of the best items I have sampled from a bakery ever. Their cheese twists when fresh out the oven are incredible.

Highly recommend to anyone although get there early.

Wonderful choice of cakes and pastries. The jam doughnuts are the best ever sampled anywhere. As for the chocolate danish just delicious. The cheese straws and sausage rolls are also firm favourites. I regularly buy a box of assorted cakes and pastries to take as a thank you to the hardworking staff at Winchester Hospital and all are agreed it is the best bakery around.
A traditional Bakers doing a range of quality products. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hot food was very good especially the breakfast rolls.

Review Title: Has to be Hampshire's best bakery!
Review Text: I always hope than my office book me a day in Andover, as that means I can stop at Burbidge's... the baguettes are great and today I had my first Burbidge's mincemeat slice... a real winner!

Best meat and potato pie in the south of England.

And that's from a northern pie eater!!

Wifey has been going there for years, it's an Andover legend.
Best bakery in Hampshire, fantastic selection of fresh cakes, bread and pies, a must if you are in Andover.
The best bakery in Hampshire! Amazing service and prices. A little gem in andover. Recommend to anyone!
A real bakery catering for people who like their food to taste as it should. An old established family firm who pride themselves on their products and their service.

We wanted to treat ourselves to something special, so decided to get so yummy cakes on the way home and Burbidge's did not disappoint, the young lad that served us gave excellent customer service, while the shop was extremely busy
Great ice buns and cheese straws - excellent value I use this establishmentl for take away - good at bulk orders as we use this for our office orders.
Food, cakes & bread are always very good. I love the crusty rolls with various fillings.A credit to Steve & his team.

As I child I used to beg my mum for a cheese straw from burbridges, and 25 years later there still just as yummy. From bacon rolls to cakes and sandwiches never let down with the menu. Recently started getting orders at work for my team and now everyone loves them as our Friday treat. Also greeted with friendly smiles and the prices aren‚Äôt too bad either! Highly recommend if you fancy something yummy and fresh :)

John Burbage continues the family nirvana with a superb selection of bread and stunning cakes - usually much larger than any of the 4 in a pack mass produced supermarket tat. Check the lunchtime trade from the business community in search of hit sausages, cheese pastries and more. Or try the smoked salmon rolls. And don‚Äôt miss the Cottage rolls, still produced daily
Very good food. Well worth a visit. The Danish pastries are excellent and the baps white and granary are exquisite.

Review Title: The baked good here are simply delicious!
Review Text: This is a small local bakery and I couldn't recommend it enough. The staff are friendly and helpful and the goods they sell are just delicious. Everything from breads, to cakes, sandwiches, pizza and cheese straws but made to the very highest quality!
Came across the bakery when wandering what to have as an early lunch after a walk. Such amazing food!

Fantastic family run bakery.  been coming here since I was a child.  I now buy items and drive 2 hours to deliver them to my Father, he still loves the lardy cake at 87 years old.  I myself have a favourite I  the cheese straws.  fresh everyday and friendly staff.

I have been visiting Burbidge's Bakery for years. It all started when I used to pretend to be poorly so I could stay off school knowing that my dad would take me to work with him and we would always stop here to get treats! My dad always had the lardy cake and I would always get an iced bun. Now that I am 23 I still visit often and my favourite has to be the carrot cake, it's the best you'll ever taste! I hope this place is around for when I have my own children so I can create the memories I have with my dad! Burbidge's Bakery will always have a special place in my heart. Thank you for the memories and the amazing food.
The very best ever...   wish you did mail outs... I would have 2 delighted sons .. as of now have cheese straw envy from my first born ....
I love Burbidges - fabulous cakes, pastries, pies, bread and more.  All the staff are really friendly and the prices are good.

As a local resident I have used Burbidge's Bakery many times over the years.  I have always found their friendly and welcoming staff only eclipsed by the quality and excellence of the food they sell.  A visit for a bacon sandwich in the morning quickly becomes a fresh load and cakes for the family - its impossible to avoid it.  

Burbidge's is a joy to visit, and a must if you are in the area.
Very friendly staff and Awesome freshly made cakes, And very good prices, The large sausage in a roll is Maaahhoosssive at a very good price, Highly recommended A ***

I have been using this bakery for many years. They always work to the highest standards, the prices are reasonable for such good quality and the staff are friendly. They also take telephone orders, handy for those working at the weekend. Can‚Äôt rate this place highly enough.
Bought cakes for my birthday excellent selection enjoyed by everyone. The cakes are very big and very good quality

The best bacon rolls ,filled rolls ,bread for miles around
Friendly run business
Famous in andover
We only go to this place for bacon rolls
Cheese & onion pasty for ¬£2.50 must be fantastic - not!  Potato & black pepper was all I could taste inedible after two mouthfuls the rest went into the bin.
As soon as you walk in you cannot resist the smell of the bread and cakes - they are amazing. There is s o much choice you will be there for ages
Love this place! Always fresh goods and anything you buy there will impress you! Staff are happy and helpful too

I can never pass this bakery without buying something a real traditional bakery with amazing bread and cakes and
much more, everything is fresh every morning, hot and cold food available, no parking outside but there is nearby, so worth the stop.

Go here to buy lunch ... often for the whole office.

Great pizza, Cornish pasties, sandwiches, mini quiches and a fantastic selection  of cakes ... enough to make your arteries shudder at the sugar and cholesterol overdose.
Also right next to a mini-supermarket/post office so you can post a parcel and buy a pint of milk or emergency groceries at the same time.
The best bakery products in Andover.  Very flavoursome, favourably priced and served by very friendly people.

Review Title: Fabulous bakery for all your fresh and tasty baking
Review Text:
There is usually always a queue but the staff rattle through very quickly. The fact there is always a queue tells you how good their produce is.
There is a camera through to the back shop showing how the prouduce is being made. Interesting!
Cold and hot foods available. Noticed lots of workmen buying hot products.
Their bread and rolls/baps are scrumptious. Various cakes and buns, huge and delicious.
They will cook your turkey for you around Christmas time but you need to get in early.
Best pizza by far and the biggest cakes you have ever seen without a big price tag. Family run business you can certainly tell

This family run bakery has bern around since I was a child in the 70s and is still as fantastic as ever. 
Friendly service, outstanding fresh bakes every day.  Definitely worth a visit, whether you are after a lunch to take away  or cakes for the weekend it never fails to have you going back for more.

Review Title: An absolute must if in Andover
Review Text:
I have lived in Andover all my life and Burbidge‚Äôs bakery has always been sensational !
The sight of the wonderful pastries, bacon or sausage rolls and the fantastic aroma will compel you to purchase a treat that will make your day complete. Birthday cakes are made to order and never disappoint. A treat from here will always put a smile on someone‚Äôs face .

Easily the best bakery in at least a 20mile radius.
Great value for money.
Really good choices and range of cakes, breads and pastries.
Family love it for lunch too and we often stop there on king walks and bike rides.
Wow, what an excellent bakery this is. The choice of bread, pastries, cakes and sandwiches are exceptional. The staff are very polite and courteous. I would recommend this bakery to everyone.
Bought some Jam doughnuts as a treat amazing.  Their savoury heated it's are also excellent.  Worth a visit.

Great family run business which has been going for at least 50 years. Does a great selection of hot and cold food. And some sandwiches made to order. Used to be a supermarket but cut back a few years ago to concentrate running this smaller shop. People come from miles around for their lunch. Prices are pretty reasonable and competitive. There is no seating at the place, people tend to just park outside for a few minutes to get the food then go elsewhere.
Friendly and very helpful staff, hot bacon rolls and the most amazing cakes in the world. Heartily recommend the jam doughnuts !!

Review Title: Best bakery around, not just Andover
Review Text:
I don‚Äôt have much else to say other than we have lived in Andover for 5 years and Burbridge‚Äôs has become a weekly trip for us.

The staff are all lovely and the choice is fantastic. I particularly like the raspberry eclair and toffee pecan slice. These guys are famous for their danish selection.
