I also am a big fan of the foot long sausage and savoury stuff they do. Oh and carrot cake. You really can‚Äôt go wrong. They even have cans of Rio!
Fantastic food highly recommended appears to be the only bakers in Andover but well worth a visit. Fresh quality food
You‚Äôve changed your flapjack recipe really sad about this as was seriously the best flapjack ever!!!!!! Would travel miles for it...please go back to your original and take out the coconut

They offer best and most delicious cakes in Andover for a very reasonable prices. The only downpoint is that you must do you shopping in the mornings because after lunchtime almost everything is gone.
I love the bread in there all the staff are really nice and helpful there ham rolls are amazing also

good old fashion bread and rolls very good would go there again very friendly staff and wonderful products best bakery in andover and been on britains top bakery done really well so i would recommend them every day
Love burnished for their amazing filled sandwiches and their delicious fresh bakes, a real Andover legend

Super bakery. Only the best baker in Andover. Huge selection of everything that's baked sweet or savioury. Lovely freshly made sandwiches and rolls. Bacon and Sausages cooked and ready to fill rolls to order. Plenty of parking. My husband picks up his "dog walking" roll. Before taking the pooch walking. You can even get a separate sausage for your furry friend. 
Fantastic reputation in the town. Find him on the weyhill road in Andover.

Every time I go into Burbidge's it's like stepping back in time  ( Bread & pastries just like they used to be), I am into my seventy's and have used the bakery since I was a small boy and the good standards are the same now as then.
Super products, friendly efficient staff who know what they are serving and cope with the queues admirably - queues because they are so popular at lunchtime and there isn't enough room formore staff
Burbridges bread and pastries are the tastiest in the area all home baked you couldn't find anything as tasty anywhere else
Fantastic, cakes, savouries and bread, best for miles around. One of the few privately owned shops in Andover.
Average overpriced . Unhealthy , But if that‚Äôs what you are after then it‚Äôll do. Bread is always good

Review Title: Good old English bread served with a smile
Review Text: this is an old fashioned bakers.  always busy which tells you all you  need to know. smily staff good bread and important excellent Danish pastries.
I come here at least once a week for the burgers, they are to die for! Brownies are amazing too xxxx

Didn't want to eat breakfast whilst staying at the Premier Inn so drove down the road to Burbidge's instead.

Was a little overwhelmed by the choice of pastries and pies but I took the number of people queuing as a very good sign.

I eventually settled on a cinnamon bun and it was to die for. Totally amazing. Only downside was that I sat in the car to eat it and ended up with crumbs everywhere.

Bakery was recommended to me. I was there at 08:50am and the queue was nearly out the door. It was worth the wait though. I tried the bread, fruit pie and cakes. All were delicious. The prices may seem expensive but you get a lot more for your money than in other shops/supermarkets.

I was a regular at Burbidge's, at lunch time, whilst employed at the DLO Andover, (2001- 2007) to partake of their enormous sausage in a Torpedo Roll. The lunch time walk justified this regular indulgence. I came in for a lot of stick too from my colleagues, because of these regular sorties. 

I had reason to pass Andover today, en-route to Tidworth, and HAD to make a slight detour, on the return just to sample the delights of Burbidge's once more!

I was not disappointed to be able to indulge, once more, in one of their enormous sausages in a roll. This delight is extremely good value for money, from what i would consider to be the Best Bakers in Hampshire"

Burbidge's Bakery is an absolute gem; a 100% genuine-baked-on-the-premises bakery which has been trading for five generations and offers a delicious range of breads, pastries, cakes and warm snacks.  The shop itself sits in a small parade on a through-road in Andover and, apart from its rather smart outward appearance, nothing  gives away the treasures that await inside.
When I dropped in for the first time yesterday to pick up a snack to eat in the car it was as if I'd been transported to the type of heaven dreamt of by small children ... trays of hand-made cakes, loaves of all descriptions, and the aroma of warm savouries.  All clearly made by people with a passion for the art of culinary seduction, and two lovely helpful staff.  Not only is the shop spotlessly clean and well-arranged, it also boasts a wall-mounted TV; not to watch football or the news, but the bakers in action in the bakery at the rear of the premises.
Being someone for whom the question in such circumstances is not what I should I buy, but rather what should I not, I found myself the proud owner of two of the most impressive lemon drizzle cakes  (one for afternoon tea, one for tomorrow), a pasty which simply oozed quality and an utterly genuine Eccles cake with none of the commercial sugar crust but instead heaps of beautifully spiced fruit in a lovely light puff pastry case.  But before I could complete my purchase a monster Belgian bun simply pleaded to be added to the order.
The fare tasted as good as it looked - my only comment, and this is a tiny one, is that for me the bun tasted even more delicious without the lemon icing, but then I'm not so much of a sweet-tooth these days.
It's a funny old thing, but while so many UK small towns can boast one of more genuine butcher‚Äôs shops, trying to find an equivalently authentic baker is becoming quite a task, particularly since the arrival of the well-known chains.  Burbidge's is a gem ... small and highly polished.  But if you want to sample its delights you'll just have to make the pilgrimage to Andover!

There's so much to say about Burbage's and it all good. From the simple loaves of bread to the bacon rolls and giant cheese straws it all just excellent. That's before you get to the cakes. OMG the cakes are just to die for. There's nothing fancy about any of the products they sell because the food us is on quality and value for money. If I could I'd eat nothing but cakes and sausage and bacon turnovers, but sadly I'd double in size within a week.

Review Title: Yummy bread, pastries and much more
Review Text: Amazing home bakery, freashly made each day. Friendly staff and always patient whilst I ponder over which delights too choose from. A great way to lift moral in the office or to pickup a treat for the children.

I dropped by for my first visit yesterday after an uninspiring choice of lunch items had (well, not) been presented by Tesco over the road.

Left with a jumbo hot sausage baguette, with added mayo and tomato at my request, and an apple pie for pudding later on.  A little tasting dish was also available to assist with future purchases!

Clean, busy, bursting with good things to eat - sweet and savoury and of course loaves of bread - with cheerful and knowledgeable staff.  Nothing was too much trouble and my purchases were very good value.  I was even able to pay by card.  Easily my new favourite 'pit-stop'.  Thank you very much !!
Had and operation in Sarum Road hospital Winchester. Purchased a massive box of amazing cakes. They were well presented in a box. Nurses and staff loved them. Thank you.

Review Title: Most days go there to get fresh baked goods
Review Text: The staff are very good and helpful. The shop has a great selection of Fresh cakes, fresh Bread, fresh Rolls, home made Pizza pieces, Cheese Straws,

Great service with fantastic products of a quality that you could not find in a supermarket
I could particularly recommend their bread and rolls and the sausage torpedo in a freshly baked baggette.
Lovely bread pastries and cakes, they also do rolls and sandwiches. Bery clean. Delightful staff. Wont be dissapointed
best bacon ever and donut  love it definitely coming back!!!! RATE 5 STARS because it is the best always get a sandwich and a cake there all freshly made

Always good, nice rolls, sarnies etc. Try the pizza slice, it‚Äôs naughty but very nice!!üòÇ
A huge amount of cakes to choose from too! 
These types of businesses are quickly disappearing, Andover is lucky to have such a traditional bakers!!
Still an amazing bakery, great staff and food. A good local and independent bakery. Famous Christmas Turkey bake each year is quite an occasion.
The best Granary bread in the world! You should try some. Their range of cakes is delicious and delightful.

Firstly this is not a restaurant but they have an excellent range of hot food to take away. Their freshly baked bread and cakes are very special.  The staff are efficient and helpful.  I would definitely recommend that you call here whilst in Andover.

Always a great selection of freshly baked goodies and some free titbit samples of batches they have just cooked.
Burbidges has been there as far back as I can remember, which is testament for how good it is.  Not many stand-alone bakeries survive out of a town centre.  Staff are lovely and friendly too
We have been using this bakery for 30 years and have never been disappointed. It's always busy with smart attentive staff. The Danish pastries are unbelievably good in whatever variety.

Nothing more to say, only the very best Bakery for Miles. 
Freshly baked on the premises. The smell when you walk in is amazing. 
You can stop for lunch to pick up premade rolls and sandwiches or select from the counter, cooked fillings like bacon and sausage. Piping hot. 
Cakes and buns just glorious. Selection of breads. Plenty of parking. 
Everyone in Andover knows this Bakery.   
When I go in I pick up an extra sausage on its own, my dog loves this place too. 
Walk in the country, hot sausage rolls and a sausage for pooch. Bliss.

This is the best bakery for miles, the array of cakes and bread is fantastic, plenty to choose from. The hot food to go is fantastic especially when your on the go. Great service from staff very helpful when asking about particular breads. The cakes are amazing. Thank you for an ongoing experience.

Have treated myself to naughty calorific cakes at burbidges for many years - and have no intention of stopping, they‚Äôre way too scrummy x the breads are delicious too, and there‚Äôs always a plate of free samples to try while you wait xx 10 out of 10 easily üòä
Hand made proper bread. None of this pretend supermarket bread. Every mouthful is a joy. Cakes are wonderful and they make a grand bacon bap

It was my 60th birthday and ordered 20 fresh cream cakes for work.
As usual they were fantastic and enjoyed by all

Called in today to buy sausage rolls and cakes as my nephew was visiting from Fareham near Portsmouth. Thought I would treat him as he had told be all about this little bakery, how great it was and how the food was so good. Highly recommend it. The staff are very friendly and the place is spotless.

When you enter the shop the smell of new bread is magical,also tempting to spend more than you should,you are spoilt for choice.Burbiges are so confident the have tellivision scene showing the bread and cakes being made.On the whole probely the best bakery in south.
I live close to Burbidge's bakery and pass it every morning going to work and I have to go in and buy something as the fantastic smell of fresh baked bread and cakes is unmissable.

I visit Andover on business two or three times a month. I always make sure that I stop off at Burbiges. The range of Cakes, Sandwiches and Rolls is second to none. 

Today I had a sausage and bacon baguette, which, as ever couldn't be faulted. The staff are very friendly and I'd recommend this bakery to anyone when they are in or around Andover
This place is absolutely brilliant, Their psties are great and i have never had anything bad from them.Lots of locals get lunch everyday.

Review Title: The food is always fresh and cooked on the premises, they don't skimp on the portions
Review Text: I had a bacon roll, a round freshly baked crusty roll with slices of bacon.  Served with tomato sauce.  Everything was fresh and served as you like it

Review Title: So hard to resist a visit.
Review Text:
Simply the best cake shop I have visited. Everything is freshly made and smells gorgeous and it's hard not to come away with more than you intended.
Best of all its friendly and very reasonable prices.

Always excellent cakes and breads, the staff are always friendly but efficient, and just going in there surrounds you in a big blanket of comfortable reliability.  I've been going there for years and years and have never had a bad experience
From French sticks, bacon butties, sausage rolls, cream cakes, breads, hot and cold drinks, Burbidge's Bakery is the number one place to go
Wouldn't go anywhere else, I don't live in Andover but travel to visit this bakery. It's all freshly baked and is blooming gorgeous!
Went to buy pastries for our wedding preparations  breakfast. Lovely selection of pastries. Happy smiling ladies serving...it was very early too!  Great place.

Went there for breakfast before work as I was running late, asked for a bacon roll and was not disappointed. Loads of bacon and a reall good, crispy roll. Would recommend to anyone in or visiting the area.

Anyone who lives in Andover will tell you Burbidges is a great bakery. The staff are helpful and have great customer service. The baked goods are superb. Highly recommend their cheese straws omg !

They even offer an xmas service where you book (well in advance) and they will cook your Xmas turkey for you.

Just an all round excellent bakery.

Review Title: The food is good.... when you can get it.
Review Text:
Like it says in the title. The food CAN be excellent. But I have lost count of the times I've gone into this place to be told "Sorry, we haven't got any of those."

Time. After time. After time.

Or like today, get home to find that the order in the bag is completely different to the order that was given because the staff can't tell the difference between their own products.

The sign in the window pretty much reflects the level of mental activity in rhe place.
"We use eggs laid by real hens."
Because everyone else uses eggs laid by cyborg hens, presumably?

I suspect they mean they don't use eggs laid by battery hens, but mentally overheated trying to produce a sentence that long and so instead produced a sign that sounds like it's on display at a shop in a space station in a sci-fi novel.

I'm finished with this place. Never again.

Review Title: Great Bread, Great sandwiches and baguettes!
Review Text:
They make the best cherry shortbread I've ever had.
For lunch try the bacon and stilton baguette.
They will even roast your turkey at Christmas.

Been going here for years Best cakes around xx not just cakes,  hot pasties as well all made on premises delicious only down side in the morning parking can b an issue but that's only coz they soooo good üëçüëç

Review Title: Best Bakery in Hampshire and Beyond
Review Text: Fresh bread, sandwiches and pastries etc always good quality and value for money I wish it was a restaurant not just a bakery.

Burbidge's are a local family business that has been in Andover as long as I can remember.
You may have to queue if the local tradesmen are visiting as they stock up for the day but it is definitely worth the wait.
Their bread and rolls are the best around  and freshly baked every morning.
Always served with a great deal of politeness and efficiency , good old fashioned bakery a little on the pricey side but it is worth a treat now and again

This is a real old fashioned bakery, in the best possible way.
The bread and cakes (oh the cakes!) do not cost an arm and a leg, but rather a reasonable amount. Guaranteed quality, friendly staff and (sadly) a bit of a rarity nowdays

Review Title: The Best Bakery, superb breads and pastries...
Review Text: This is a family business with the best bread around with friendly, happy staff. Definitely worth a detour, definitely our favourite - almost always sold out by the end of the day.

As a local we have been shopping at Burbidge's for our bread for about 15 years. Always delicious and fresh bread, pastries etc, and lovely friendly staff. 
Highlights must be the heavenly doughnuts - light as air, the granary bread, and the Cornish pasties - oh yes and the cheese straws !!

Review Title:
THE BEST BAKERY IN TOWN
and probably Hampshire!
Review Text:
Efficient and helpful staff
A great choice of products

FANTASTIC HOT SNACKS
Bacon rolls/baps are better than home!

DANISH PASTRIES, Steve learnt how to make them in Denmark
Absolutely love this place, staff are always friendly and the food is always top quality... I often visit when I fancy a treat and it never disappoints. Highly recommend this bakery.

Love this bakery pizza is amazing 
Wish they did other things like sausage rolls and lately variety of cakes is less but it is the best place I find in Andover
It's my sons favourite place 
I would say they are close to Greggs standard
Highly recommend
I Brought two slices of their pizza. It was incredible will definitely return and they were very good value for money!

Absolutely anything you buy from burbridges is delicious.
From the shop area they is a tv, showing the kitchen, so u can see the bread, pizza etc being made and coming out the oven, and onto the shop within minutes.
If you want freshly baked goods look no further.
Staff always cheerful and helpful.
Parking outside.
Great local baker, wonderful bread, cakes, pies and pastries. Bacon and sausage rolls as well as sandwiches made on the premises. An absolute marvel.

Been going to Burbidge's for years and I can safely say that they make the best doughnuts in Andover. I could go on but basically if you live in Andover and have never been to the bakery then you really should get down there tomorrow.

Review Title: As always just what a traditional bakery should be
Review Text: Burbidge's bakery is exactly what a good old fashioned bakery should be. It is not surprising that there is always such a queue
They do a really great bacon roll (nice bacon in a soft roll) Having said that my wife did not like the bacon she said it must have bean cooked in a oven.A bit soft and not at all crispy.

Review Title: You won't find a better bakery!
Review Text: Been coming here for years and not sure why I haven't written a review sooner. Everything is baked fresh and utterly delicious! From the amazing pizza, the very generous bacon rolls (loads of rashers) and massive doughnuts that are like eating a sweet cloud of tasty goodness! This place is always busy, yet the staff are all so friendly and the quality is impeccable. It's well priced and worth every penny. It's a family bakery and you can tell the amount of care and pride that goes into every single product. Thoroughly recommend! Looking forward to my next pastry already.

Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review Text:
If proof were needed this is what being a top class bakery and its products is all about.
Whilst supermarket bread is 'cheaper' its mass produced  with absolutely no taste whatsoever. I have been a patron of Burbidge's for a number of years, and you won't go wrong should you visit his emporium of 'delights' - a credit to his profession.

A couple of our Jaguar owning customers come to visit us not because they want us to fix their cars but because they have joined the Torpedo Club. Sausage and bacon in Torpedo rolls.
Thanks Burbidges

By miles this is the best place for cakes, pastries and bread.  Always a fantastic selection to choose from, the only problem is when to stop. For the early morning boost, sausage and bacon baps can always fill the gap.

The bread and pastries are simply the best. The sandwich white is so crusty and fluffy it should be illegal.  The pasties are full of wonderful tasty fillings. And the cakes a must try only you will be there ages choosing

I joined the Great Christmas Escape organised by the team in aid of charity each year.  Around 150 of us toured the area on off road motorcycles and benefited from great support and even better food.  Primed with a bacon and sausage roll for breakfast, we then enjoyed one of the best pasties I've every tasted and excellent sausage rolls for lunch.  Exactly what was needed after a cold and tiring ride.  Keep up the great work supporting local charities.

Burbidge's Bakery is know for miles around for its fresh sandwiches, sausage rolls and plethora of fresh cakes to choose from. The staff are friendly and very helpful. I can smell the bakery as I type this... lol

Review Title: Great way to start the day
Review Text: If you're passing, pop in and get a sausage and bacon roll. It really is a great way to start the day, also great cakes and friendly service.

Review Title: Quality food from an awesome team
Review Text:
Burbidges helped me out witht eh catering for my office Childrens Christmas Party. 

I was astounded by the quantity, quality and service that I received from the team at Burbidges. 

We had  lots of full, happy children, and grown ups. Compliments were passed on from everyone. 

The team we accomodation, friendly and listened to my requirements. 

We being using them for all future events and would recommend them to anyone! 

Thanks to Stevem Snadra and the team!

Excellent bakery with a wide selection of freshly baked items. The baguettes, pizza and shortbread are delicious and definitely worth having. Staff are friendly and polite. The only down side is the prices are quite steep.

Review Title: Burbages tthe best bakers in town
Review Text: For d bread, cakes, rolls and related goodies, Burbages are the best. With years of experience behind them the quality and value for money never fails to impress. In fact you have to be strongwilled to resist that extra treat and if you give in you can still comvince yourself you deserve to spoil yourself.
Great choice of food. All made on the premises. Great service. Fresh bread made daily. Great bacon rolls.
Nice and fresh tasty cakes.a great selection of rolls and bread and pies filled or just a nice crusty loaf .
Go here quite regularly, always impressed by their products. They aren't however the cheapest place to go, but without question they are the best. Cakes, sandwiches and pasties - yum.
I use this bakery frequently, as far as I'm aware all the produce is produced in house and it's always busy! First class bread, excellent Lardy-cakes, fresh cream cakes and good sandwiches.

Never an issue
Always lovely food freshly baked as u can tell good prices to
An is actually nice to see a good old family business still going! Not barely of them around theses days

Have used the bread at work for ages really really good and consistent. But this was the first time I've been in the shop....wow what a selection so much to choose from and not enough time to keep changing my mind ...so I had doughnuts! My daughter was livid with me why didn't I get carrot cake or lemon drizzle or the fabulous Danish, not to mention one of the cream cakes....or a hot sausage roll......or or or.... next time I will go with a list and blinkers because there are so many yummy choices. Oh and by the way it's a beautifully clean place and you are served by friendly smart staff all in smart clean overalls.

I have just been reading the reviews for Burbidges and feel sad - as a long standing regular customer - about some of the negative comments raised in one. 
I love this bakery, everything is fresh and delicious. Their 7 seeded loaf is gorgeous and don't even get me started on the chocolate Danishes! 
They are always busy, the girls are always smiling and I personally think this reviewer was wrong. I have never worried or even noticed these "hygiene" issues.
Keep doing what you do Burbidges because your customers love you :)

I've been back here this morning to get breakfast and once again I am not left disappointed.  The food is great! The only problem I ever have is not being able to buy it all! Thank you again for your excellent service üòä

Review Title: Delicious looking selections, but not hygenic
Review Text:
A few years ago I heard of this place and went to purchase some goodies. While waiting in line, I could see that the manager behind the counter was serving customers and taking money. However without washing her hands or wearing those plastic gloves she would just reach for the bread products with the same hands use to take the money. 

It did not seem to bother anyone else but it does me so I watch as other members of staff did the same thing. It has been a while (couple of years) but I went in there recently hoping to see improvements and was pleasantly surprised the staff was wearing those plastic gloves. So I stood in line but notice as I got closer to the front that some of the staff were taking money in the glove and then picking up the food with the same glove. 

How difficult can it be for goodness sake, the whole point of wearing those gloves is to keep dirty money away from the food. Using the same hand for the money and food negates the need to wear gloves. Why hand people back their change when you can just drop it in with the bread, certainly not much different than what you are doing now. 

A word to the management, it looks like you make nice baked goods and also sell some of those goods to local stores as there is one near me. If you have a high hygiene standard, not one will be offended but the other way around and you will lose customers no matter how good your products are.

Well made sandwiches & rolls, pizza slices & superb sausage rolls & good pasties.  But .... far too expensive if compared to alternatives for lunch.  So I don't make a habit of going there too often.  They also make lovely birthday cakes with sponge cake.

Review Title: Really tasty bread and helpful staff
Review Text: Tried this bakery for the first time yesterday and am very pleased I did.  The granary loaf is lovely, and the staff were helpful and clear when I asked about their baking practises and ingredients as I have a nut allergy. Was able to pick up a carton of free range eggs too, bonus.
Lovely home made bread, traditional delicious cakes, welcoming , helpful staff. What more could you want?

Burbidge's bakery is a good, old fashioned bakery.
The quality is outstanding, the prices very reasonable and the ladies behind the counter always pleasant.
We must use it or we could lose it

The bread and other bakery products from here are outstanding.  The turnover is incredible as on many days there is a queue to the door to be served.  Helpfully they will reserve goods for collection; we arrived several times to find our favoured product had run out:  "next batch in 30min".  On the wall are two large TV screen showing whats going on in the bakery behind; non stop work to produce all their bread and delicious patisserie.  Highly recommended.
Have always used this Bakery and will Continue to do so. Excellent Bread and Pastries, Friendly Staff.   I would advise going early. have been going there 24 yrs Nbo Complaints
Always spoilt for choice, wonderful selection of both sweet and savoury snacks. Excellent bread that always smells and tastes wonderful.

We moved to Devon 3 year ago none of the bakery's come close , so now we rely on a friend who visits us to bring a tray full of goodies. Light, fluffy, very tasty and a fantastic price. The only place I miss in Andover.

Review Title: Best Baker of bread for miles.
Review Text: As a family we have shopped for our bread here for over 11 years, we will not eat anything else. It is always busy which speaks for its self. The bread is not cheap but I think it's worth going without something else.
I've used Burbidge's Bakery for many many years and it is consistently good - the food and staff are reliably good.  And the owner, Steve Burbidge, is a really nice guy.

Review Title: Wish i could give them six stars!!
Review Text: Used to live down the road, and I can honestly say this bakery is famous for a reason - it's amazing. Altho only small, their offering is large, and the quality is second to none. Unfortunately I had to move over 80 miles away due to change of work location. God I miss this bakery!! :'(

I've used Burbidges for years, as my father did.  Supermarket bread just cannot compare nor the can the chain of 'bakers'.  Yes, supermarket bread is much cheaper but who wants thin slices of anaemic air filled bread!  All other savouries and cake fantastic.  Plus there's always a friendly greeting and a laugh!

Review Title: Typical got the majority so we dont care
Review Text: Bad attitude staff especially when I asked for prices that were more than advertised online. Rude staff who overcharged me and the food was all dried out - so not worth the money or hasstle. Been a mit and miss for a while but now more a miss!

I love this bakery.  The bread, cakes and snacks are exceptional.  I haven't had anything that was bad from this place. In fact the only criticism I have is I sometimes find it hard to decide what to choose. Huge thumbs up!
This is the best place for miles to get fresh and tasty bread, cakes and pastries.  Great service and delicious offerings.   The queue proves how popular it is!

Probably the best bakery in the area. We often get doughnuts and other goodies for birthdays and other celebrations in office. 
Maybe it's not as good as speciality shops in France, Belgium or Cologne, still, you won't find anything as fresh as here in the whole Andover.
Great bakery with a lot of traditional baking to offer, bread is especially worth a visit and only needs a splash of grease and jam for the perfect breakfast

Traditional family bakers wide range of breads and cakes sandwiches and the best cheese straws any where. Their hot snacks are superb my favourite is sausage and bacon in a granary bap.If you're in the area well worth a visit.
A very good selection of bread products and food. Recommend the foot long hotdog! Breakfast in a baguette, filled rolls, loaves and bread sticks all freshly baked for sale.

Love a burbidges sausage roll!!  I no longer live in the area but if i'm passing and I can, I have a sausage roll.  Have been in and out of here for over 20 years and never been disappointed, nor has a member of staff not been polite and cheerful.  It's a really well run bakery, rightly deserving of it's positive reputation.

Review Title: Nice but for us didnt live up to our expectations from the reviews
Review Text:
We visited approx 2pm and there were only 2 savoury choices left. So probably best going as close to lunch as poss
We only arrived in the area at that time and had looked up good places to eat prior to 
There were a number of sweet choices and we opted for a takeout donut and danish as a treat. They were nice but not as good as some donuts we have had
A great feature is a large tv screen showing the back bakery
At the time of our visit they were cleaning it but nice to see how thorough they were being. It looked great - really good idea
An old  fashioned bakery. good fresh food. He also does at Christmas cooks your turkey for a fee. Best time is always mornings as they sell out by the afternoon.

Review Title: It is not a restaurant, it is a very good bakery!
Review Text: I have been buying bread and filled rolls from Burbidge's for a number of years, and the range and portion size never disappoints. That is why it is so popular. I really like the video display showing the bakery prep areas. This place is authentic, and has real character. Very reliable, no nonsense food served fast by experienced staff.

Burbidge's is a good old fashioned bakery.  English bread and scrumptious pastries and croissants, unfortunately crsissons only on Saturdays.  They do a roaring trade in bacon rolls and the queues bear witness to its popularity.
Favorite bakery in and around Andover, everything is always fresh and staff are very polite, would defiantly recommend
Excellent customer service. Food was terrific. One of the best places for hot food and some lovely buns.
Burbidge's bakery sell a good crossection of Breads, cakes & pastries. Their Cakes & iced buns go down well with children as does their sliced Pizza squares, sausage rolls & bacon rolls.

The best jam donut ever, really fluffy & lots of nice jam.. Great sandwich.. Lovely pizza slice with soft fluffy dough.. Nice coffee.. The shop was busy but staff were friendly, fast, efficient & it was all worth the wait.. BRAVO üòç

Review Title: Don't go in if you're on a diet!
Review Text: Gorgeous breads, cakes and snacks.  Friendly family run business who do a gorgeous hog roast at local events

I have been visiting this bakery ever since it was part of the burbidges shop. It's an amazing bakery with a great selection and great staff.

Even though I still miss the burbidges cookie...I am spoiled for choice, the chocolate pastry, the bread and hands down the best cheese straws any where.

In andover you must visit this bakery.

Review Title: Good place for a butty treat.
Review Text: Fortunately I don't pass by here very often otherwise I would surely be a lot poorer and considerably fatter. Not cheap but worth every penny.
Best bakery ever. Hot cross buns are the best and the staff are excellent. A good family busines that is now on 4th generation.

MAny types of bread, cheese straws, Lardy cakes, pies...all delicious.  As well as sandwiches, bacon and sausage baguettes.  The range is huge and it's all delicious.  ANd above all the chocolate Danish pastry cited as the best ever

Once again, I collected a brilliant cake that was made with care. It was beautifully decorated in the colours requested and tasted sublime.
The staff are always very pleasant and attentive.
We will always order our cakes from Burbidge's.
Food is fantastic and always great, the staff can be a little slow but always very friendly. For the price you pay it's definitely worth it and really is one of Andover's best assets!

Review Title: WHAT A GREAT PLACE THIS IS ! YUMMY ...
Review Text: everything is cooked on the premises , the pies are to die for as are the cakes biscuits and savoury slices such as Pizza's and cheese straws and scones , always busy and no wonder !
This bakery is family owned and run, setting quality and service excellence that is unequalled for miles.

Always friendly staff - the best baked goods and reasonable prices
Why shop elsewhere when you can get great stuff here!

Apart from a huge array of cakes,sandwiches and of course bread Burbages do hot pizza, pasties, sausage and bacon baps or whatever you want but the foot long sausages are great and filling and enormous. Try and enjoy

Review Title: Food from here will not disappoint!
Review Text: This is as it says a bakery and not a restaurant. But whether you buy a sandwich, cake, pasty, or anything in between you will enjoy it. All is freshly baked and a screen in the shop shows you whats happening in the bakery kitchen. ENJOY!

This is a brill bakery, their doughnuts are something else... And massive! 
Defiantly worth a visit, and a great treat for everyone!

Family run independent bakery.  Lots of choice and very friendly and helpful staff.  TV webcam allows shoppers to view life inside the bakery, whilst waiting in the queue.  Lots of charity events being promoted.

This bakery is without doubt an excellent example of craftsmanship and variety of choice. There are no negative comments whatsoever all to my miind it is the epitome of the the highest quality local bakery.
We've started visiting burbidges every Saturday morning for our bacon rolls - they're amazing! Lovely staff and their cakes are delicious - would recommend the cinnamon bun!
Best cakes best bread best food. Hot or cold all home made cant ask for more . staff are great always happy to see people .

Review Title: Always a nice experience when parting with my cash
Review Text: The staff are always nice, cheerful and polite. The bread and cakes are of the highest quality and we always order our birthday cakes here as they make them to our order requirements and are so special. Everyone comments on how nice they are.

If you live in Andover this place needs no introduction.

A wide range of different pies, cakes, sandwiches and rolls. All freshly made.

The bread is simply to die for! A true British bakery with family tradition, unlike that Greggs rubbish.
Not for those on a diet!.Such a wonderful array of cakes,savouries and bread.It will make you feel like a child in a sweet shop and spoilt for choice.

Probably the best bakery in Andover?

No - Actually it IS the best bakery in Andover!

Thanks, from a happy customer

Amazing cakes, bread and savouries. Very friendly service and everything fresh to the point where often the bread is still warm from the oven. Can't recommend it more highly as an excellent local business.

I have been using this bakery for many years - indeed when it was in the hands of Mr BURBIDGE Snr. It is nice to still be able to get fresh home baked bread and cakes. The supermarkets try but you just can't beat the real thing from that now increasingly rare thing - a thriving family run bakery. You can even watch it being baked by the bakery camera. It also helps that all the staff are helpful and friendly - something again lacking in the supermarkets. What more is there to like.

Review Title: So glad this bakery is local to where I live.
Review Text: The staff are friendly and there is usually a queue. Everyone in Andover and surrounding areas know about Burbidges and appreciate everything about the place.

A local amenity that sells amazing bread baked on the premises. The shop boasts a bakery cam which shows where the action takes place, so all customers can see where the bread comes from. 
It does a roaring trade in breakfast baps, home made pizza slices and sausage rolls, as well as freshly prepared rolls and sandwiches. The cakes are all a very generous size, a particular  favourite is the fresh cream apple doughnut. 
If you are lucky and ask for a dozen rolls/baps you may find that you get a true bakers dozen, at no extra cost. 
Cakes can be made to order (we had our daughters Christening cake made here and it was superb). 
At Christmas Mr Burbdge also offers a turkey roasting service which I believe raises money for local charities.
The quality of the bread, rolls and other products from Burbidge's Bakery is of the highest order and if making a visit means going out of your way, then do it.
Nice to be able to see the kitchen from the shop front. Food always fresh and tasty. Nice friendly staff
I had a birthday cake made there & it was as always excellent. Also the hot rolls, pizza slices & normal sandwiches are very good.
I go there often the bread and cakes are wonderful so fresh, the hot food is great and the sandwiches too. you must try. great service from the staff
Always good food and friendly service at this bakery which has a good variety of hot and cold food. Highly recommended.
Second to none and reasonably priced.freshly cooked and with a smile.  Whilst the queue out the door is always long it's testament to how good the food is.

Excellent bread, pastries, and pies.
Not forgetting  the fabulous cakes. 
Shame about the coffee ! 
Very important element to get right. Good rigid cups of a good size and decent flat our a must these days.

Review Title: Cheerful staff, and well above average local bakery
Review Text:
This is a bakery, not a restaurant.  However, it does serve breakfasts to take away - bacon, sausage, pastry, and combinations of those, and they are very difficult to resist.

The usual bakery items are for sale, and the danish pastry and chocolate swirls stand out as well above average for quality and taste.  The bread is also good and comes in a variety of sizes and types, from plain white to seeded brown.  The bread is good enough I do not feel the need to make it at home as I used to.
This bakery has been baking proper food at the heart of the community for at lest three generations.

Fancy a quick sandwich, sausage roll, bacon and sausage roll, fresh bread or a naughty but nice fresh cream cake this is the place to go a good traditional bakery serving delicious tasty treats for everyday lunch or special occasions. 
They even do amazing birthday cakes too.
Always good produce and always excellent customer service!! Even converted me to brown bread, but sausage rolls and sausage baps always the best!
Always a friendly service and I love their cheese straws. We are tempted in whenever we pass. You can cut them in half length-wise to make them go round further.

Once again, our cake was specially ordered and was made to perfection.
We shall always return as the bread and cakes are wonderful.
Its a Friday treat! Getting in the breakfast and cakes and fresh bread, you cant beat the food in there and the service with a smile! Steve is just excellent :)

Review Title: Always service with a smile, and great food to boot.
Review Text: I am a regular patron of the bakery on a Saturday morning. Testament to the quality of the food it is always busy, even taking this into account I never seem to be waiting too long. The staff serve you efficiently and with a smile on their faces (this may be my appearance) but everyone seems to get treated the same. I cannot pick out a favorite, needless to same the choice is vast and I am yet to find anything I don't like. There is a well publicised notice offering a no-quibble money back guarantee, something I have never needed or been around when any complaint has been made. There is the ability to phone ahead to place an order and have it ready for collection and a fairly new concept or "offered option" is to pay by Debit/credit card, min spend if ¬£5.00 or 50p if below ¬£5.00.
Lovely Food,from burgers to carrot cake ! .Friendly service all through the day.Worth a visit ,just for the banter !

I go to Burbidge's every morning to buy a 3 sausage bap with tomato sauce.  It only costs me ¬£3.00 and the quality of the product is absolutely superb!  Never once have I had an gristle in the sausages which tells me there of very good quality.  This business is a jewel in the crown of Andover!

We buy Burbidge's bakery products on a regular basis but they made a very special and large birthday cake for me that looked as good as it tasted and was enjoyed by everyone. I received positive comments from all the family. The section that was left over remained moist and was enjoyed for days afterwards.
We have been using this bakery for many years and have received excellent service and good quality produce. The best granary bread I have tasted & scrumptious Danish pastries. Well worth a visit.
We regularly by things here and at a local garage they supply. have never been disappointed with any of their food. would recommend anyone to this bakers.

Tried a couple of times and everyone this is a bakery. Sausage roll repeated on me all day, Pizza dried out and the bacon pasty full of oil and grease ‚Äì what on earth is the fuss about. Also VERY expensive!
The best bread and cakes in Andover , use them all the time and wouldn't get my fresh bread from anywhere else. The staff are excellent always so helpful .
Love the pizza, well priced food, fletcher's service is fantastic. Fletcher and Kalum always have smiles on their faces, which really brightens up my day!

Review Title: The best bakery I have ever visited
Review Text: Quality food for quality prices. The pizza is my personal favourite and is cheaper than Gregg's! I buy my lunch here everyday and would recommend everyone else to do the same.
Use this bakery quite regularly. The staff are always friendly and the sandwiches, rolls, sausage rolls and cakes are gorgeous.

Review Title: One of the best things about Andover
Review Text: As a regular customer for many years I cannot praise Burbidge's Bakery highly enough. Fabulous cakes, wonderful bread and delicious savouries. Maybe not the cheapest but worth every penny.

You can't beat this local bakery.   Without any doubt the best fresh bread, bread rolls, and cakes.

Forget the diet and grab a sausage roll as well..

You can always be assured of lovely fresh bread baked on the premises, plus some "naughty" cakes!! Stephen is a dedicated baker, as was his father before him. He also deserves praise for all of his support with the local Mencap organisation, even cooks your own Turkey in his ovens at Christmas.

Review Title: Excellent cakes. savouries and take away food
Review Text: Excellent cakes. savouries and take away food. Not the cheapest but always very yummy! Can get very busy but worth the wait.

You need to visit this bakery for good quality baked bread and very large tasty cakes, they also do very good hot snacks too from very nice friendly staff. This is a blast from the past when bakeries were where you went for quality break and cakes.

Best Bread ever. Cheese straws to die for. Pies and sandwiches are good and as for the Eccles cakes!!! they are just amazing. Well done to Steve and his team for carrying on with a great tradition... Baking great British bread

Review Title: that was the best backery i have ever meet
Review Text:
he have a very Delicious Cinnamon cake
excellent quality cakes and breads
that was the best backery i have ever meet
Fantastic, could eat the lot. Hot, cold all of it. Been around forever and it's easy to see why. Will need to let the belt out.

Review Title: Love the bread, not the cakes
Review Text:
This place does the most wonderful bread in all forms.

Sadly I'm not sure what it is about the cakes and iced buns, but I just am not a fan. Yes they're great value and massive cakes, but maybe it's just me. I have rated 4/5 as to me I have to rate from my opinion, but most (not all) of my friends enjoy the cakes also.

Cheese straws are noms though

Burbidge's Bakery is, it seems to me, an Andover institution 
The bread and rolls are wonderful, the cake are as good, although I have to say not good for me! 
Many people go to Burbidge‚Äôs for cooked breakfast ‚Äì there is a good range of filled rolls and such like and there is a choice of sandwiches, cooked pies and other yummy things for lunch.
The cut bread is good, although I prefer it uncut. There are all sorts of rolls, personally the cottage rolls are my number one and the French loaves are also good
A great local business that should be used and cherished
Everything that Steve does is excellent, even being on Britians best bakery! Was really deserved, the pizza, sausage rolls and the hot dogs are personal favourites and of course the fresh bread!

Freshly baked and totally scrummy.....never fails to please me!  The daily filled rolls and sandwiches are queued for...their treacle tarts and individual cakes are really lovely.  Whether you are passing through the town and looking for something to eat on the go or looking for somewhere to buy your bread and cakes locally its always well worth the trip.  The service is always great. Can't find anything to say against this place - its highly recommended.  Benn lots and lots of times...

This is one great Bakery over this years we have had family Birthday cakes from them always top grade, also there cakes, bread and also cooked pies are wonderful and the staff are so helpful and full of joy when they are serving the public.  Can give no higher praise then 100% oon all things fron this Bakery.
Amazing pastries, polite staff and premises are clean and tidy.  the range of pastries, cakes, sandwiches and bread is second to none.
Lovely place, easy to park, friendly service, delicious sausage rolls. Kids beg to go there, cakes are a smash, couldn't recommend it highly enough...

I visit Burbidges frequently as its the only place I buy my bread. Their granary is the best and my children will eat no other.  It's always an added bonus when they come home from school and I've bought them either a fresh cream and jam doughnut  or their famously renowned chocolate Danish pastries ,of course the list goes on whether it be savoury or sweet.  
What I love about this shop is their quality of food and high standards. 
They are a happy, professional  team who always welcome you with a smile.  They are led by the man himself Steve Burbidge who you will often find on the premises and working hard. I have often seen him go the extra mile for people to make their Burbidge experience a memorable one.
 Burbidges Bakery has been around for generations and continues to thrive.  Personally I wouldn't go anywhere else, so I highly recommend you pop in and experience it for yourself.
.

Review Title: Possibly the best bakery in the UK
Review Text:
Food to melt in your mouth or to keep you going all day, tried many products from Burbidges, all have been freshly made and taste fantastic. 
The negative reviews on here can only be because someone has an agenda.

I used to use this place and I have given it great reviews in the past which put it very high on TA, BUT  my last experience had me on the loo for hours.

Sausage roll hard and not good ‚Äì repeated on me all day. Bacon turnover ‚Äì full of fat and grease. Fresh cream cake ‚Äì cream gone off and disgusting, should not have been served to a customer.

Try again ‚Äì you used to be great!

We live near Chippenham but luckily I have to make frequent trips past this famous purveyor of fine cakes. 

My other half's parents put us onto this gem years ago and it is far too temping to pass by. I know one should place quality before quantity but what happens when you have both? The size of some of the buns is ridiculous, but in a really nice way! My youngest son thinks he has gone to heaven when he sees the size of the doughnut I bring him home. 

Ok, so to the serious stuff: I think it is really unfair when supermarkets put sweets at the checkouts and the kids go 'I want, I want', but when a bakery puts 'taster trays' on top of their counter and a man over 40 enters... how cruel is that: of course I have to sample it all... it is the law!

So I end up buying the shop and taking it all back to Chippenham for the family to enjoy... again and again and again!

This shop is so good it should be against the law; I am going to have to join Dieters Anonymous.
I used to love burbidge's but last time I was served a really nasty stale cookie and a couple of "fresh cream" cakes which tasted more like bread filled with a weird fake tasting foam! Yuk!
We've been going to Burbidge's for years! Lovely pasties and huge selection of cream cakes, well worth a visit.

Always visiting for a bacon roll or cake for my little one.
Fresh and good quality food / ingrediants . 
Best bakery around

We saw the reviews and thought we will drop in and give a try and did not regret the decision.  The Cornish pasty was delicious and the custard doughnut was soft and not greasy.  All in all, good value and tasty treats.
EVERYTHING is fresh and baked on the premises!  Anything from rolls, bread and the usual to pies, snacks and sandwiches

We have cakes from here each week at work and they are always fresh and tasty. Definitely recommend! The pastries are wonderful, especially the cherry ones and the doughnuts are huge and not at all greasy.
Local baker, good solid british food at resonable prices. All the builders go here and their bacon baps fantastic.
All their food is great, the service is friendly and you are never rushed, even if the place is busy (which it usually is). It is great the owners do charity challenges too.

We used to go to this bakery atleast twice weekly. However three times either me or my husband found a hair in our sausage bap or cream cake. We also had bad tummies the last time which really surprised us because previously we haven't had a problem. Really disappointed, think they need to pull their socks up on the hygiene front. Perhaps someone isn't wearing their hat!

If it's a good quality snack you need, this is the place. If it's the best tasting caramel slice you need, this is the place and if it's a slice of the cheesiest pizza you need...you guessed it.
Everything in the shop is tasty, simply that and not too expensive either.

Cream cakes for special occasions you cannot beat this bakery for value and most of all quality.  well worth a visit if you are passing not good for the diet I expect but cannot be missed if you are in Andover.

This is not a restaurant but a proper bakery and I have been buying their bread for years.
Always top quality and their bacon rolls and cheese straws are to die for.
Treat yourself if you're in the area.

I have bought bread and cakes from this bakery for many (many) years.  The standard of all products is extremely high, and far better than supermarket purchased items.  I particularly like the variety of bread available, and all are tasty, and of course very fresh, being baked on the premises.  Thank you for being there Burbidges!

Review Title: Not a restaurant. Best type of bakery
Review Text:
Of course you could just buy bread here but you would miss out on so much more.
Great place to also buy filling breakfast buns, pizza slices, sticky and sweet treats. Award winning / TV starred deliciousness, so much better than chain bakery or bland supermarket fodder.
Good food is not cheap so don't you be. You are what you eat so dig a little deeper in your pocket you won't regret it, and you will be fuller , longer.
Great service, friendly staff and fantastic bread, cakes, cheese straws, lunch rolls, sausage rolls etc etc etc!

Review Title: If you want great bread and cakes, then you're in luck - if you want a 3-course meal, look elsewhere
Review Text:
Why? Because it's a bakery, not a restuarant.  That said, the bread and the cakes it makes are fantastic, especially the lardicakes (hmmmm!).
If you're in Andover during business hours well worth stopping by.

Finally made it to Burbidge's. For bread!  

I don't know why this is being rated alongside pubs, restaurants etc. Yes, they have nice bread and cakes but it hardly warrants being compared to dining establishments.
Love the bread and cakes from here , so fresh and tasty .THe bread stays fresh for a few day unlike the supermarket rubbish that is dry when you get home . The staff are so friendly and welcoming .
Just get there early as your favourites always march out the door. Excellent value. Parking outside available.

Review Title: The 'Hamphshire Pasties' are the most delic EVER
Review Text: We've been visiting Burbridge's for years and absolutely our treat....Saturday morning treat - the fabulous Hampshire Pasty. The best pastie I've every tasted.

A regular visit,cannot go without my Rolls,such a selection but quality  excellant,quite famous in our area,they do alot for
charity
This is my Mum & Dad's local bakery, the bread is fantastic and the cakes are awesome, you just need to get there early before they are all sold.

The best cakes and bread in Andover and probably Hampshire , this place is well worth a visit. Quick service from the knowledgeable and friendly staff, and you can park for free right outside makes for a busy little shop, and rightly so.
This place is a real gem.  Get there early to avoid disappointment!  The bread and pastries are quite superb!

Review Title: The best cheese straws in the world!
Review Text: We are very lucky to live close by so walk to Burbidges regularly and sit in their cake garden consuming our purchases. They serve freshly baked bread, cheese straws, cakes, sausage rolls, pizza. .... and lots more. I can definitely recommend the chocolate Danishes and cheese straws. There is often a queue inside as it's so popular but always served quickly and service is with a smile. A lovely family bakery that has pride in all it does.

Great local bakery serving bread, pastries and cakes as well as hot food snacks. A bit more expensive than the local supermarket but the quality and taste is excellent and the staff are very friendly.  Well worth visiting if you are in the area. Pies and bacon sandwiches highly recommended

Review Title: Delicious Local  Bread cakes and more
Review Text: nothing to complain about , what a great Bakery and such brilliant choices , friendly staff etc., they even cook your Christmas Turkey for you ! wonderful !

Plain and simple a really nice, independent bakers. Bread is excellent and a great choice too. Cakes are also very good, the toffee cake being a current favourite. It's not cheap but I'd rather buy my bread here than in any of the plethora of retail behemoths Andover has to offer.
It's been there for more years than I care to remember but never fails to get the gastric juices going - always spoiled for choice but I'm not complaining!
Really good bakery, reasonable prices and staff that are always pleasant and helpful. Also hot food, sausage and bacon, pizza slices, a great place to stop and grab something nice!

If you want a treat, then Burbidges Bakery is the place to go!  When business colleagues travel up from Devon, they always buy a Lardy cake, as they cannot get them in their area.  Likewise, business colleagues from London, request their favourite cakes and breads.  I was delighted to see Burbidges Bakery competing in Britains Best Bakery.  Well done Burbidges.

Whatever you buy to try make sure you pick up some cheese straws, you won't find better anywhere else. yum yum All items made and baked fresh every day in this family run bakery, which I make regular delicous purchases.

Review Title: You get what you pay for!!!!
Review Text:
Always great food. Cannot compare with Tesco or Coop locally who are both cheaper but you get what you pay for in terms of sandwiches and cakes. Not the cheapest but I would suggest the best value for money. The staff are always excellent, polite and happy to serve you.
Great food, great service, excellent staff.
No need to say much on this review. Truely is the best in Hampshire, amazing fresh cakes and pastries and they're always busy...what more could you want?!
The cakes and savouries are second to none in this bakery.  The staff were helpful and very pleasant. No wonder there is always a queue!

Burbidge's Bakery carries a vast range of bread products and cakes. It has hot and cold snacks and delicious sandwiches. You can even watch what is happening in the bakery itself via a television screen in the shop. I've never been disappointed by the quality of the bread or cakes.

Small family bakery, one of the few independent businesses surviving the great supermarket takeover...... and well worth a visit. Delicious hand baked bread, cakes and hot bacon rolls amongst some of the delights to be found here....and then there is Fred.......

Superb family bakery with a mouth watering range of hot gods, pastries, breads and cakes. Friendly staff and star baker Steve. 
Tell all your friends but don't tell weight watchers, you're definitely going to come out with more than you went in for - delicious!

Without a doubt this bakery has built up an enviable reputation for one reason, the quality of their product.

The staff are friendly and the proprietor is always happy to engage with customers.

Whether it be a bacon bap, granary loaf or apple turnover that might take your fancy, you won't be disappointed.

Notably, the bakery has featured in the national media recently with regards to their chocolate Danish.

Its not cheap in Burbidge's Bakery, and that is reflected in the excellent quality cakes and breads. I have never had such good granary bread for anywhere else. Worth a visit if you feel like treating yourself!
Really nice fresh bead, cakes and of coarse the bad boy take away stuff - for a treat the sausage rolls and pasties are great!
Just an incredible family run bakery with everything you want and for a decent price. Steve is a gem.

Review Title: Probably the best bakery in the world
Review Text:
I've been frequenting Burbidge's Bakery for the past 13 years and have never had anything but fabulous food and great service.  All of the ladies working in Burbidge's are cheerful even at 6.30 in the morning when the shop opens!
All of the products are made without preservatives etc, are a very generous size and are baked daily - you can even watch the bakery via a large tv in the shop.
Many people come for The jammy doughnuts - not your supermarket heavy stodge - these are light and airy and do not leave that awful trans-fat after taste that you get with some popular doughnut chains.  Also worth trying are the chocolate Danishes as experienced on a The Great British Bakery - they are so chocolaty with the perfect texture.
If travelling along the A303 towards the West Country, please do a slight 2 min detour for not only the cakes but a bacon sandwich - copious amounts of bacon in fresh subs or baps and a cup of tea for a price much much cheaper than a service station and also much tastier.  They're also the best hangover cure in the world.
One final point, if you're not happy with anything, Mr Burbidge offers a money back guarantee not that I've ever had cause to check this out!

I am from California and haven‚Äôt been in Plymouth for 5 years. As soon as possible I came to Jacka and no surprise their bread remains the best ever. Happily I found it is also served in the cafe at the Box museum. Unequalled!

We stopped for an iced coffee latte as it was an hot day and sat outside. The coffee was so nice we ended up getting a second one each. Staff were very friendly.  The croissants on display looked amazing ( I just about managed to resist one). We bought a couple of the deli pies for tea and took them home. They were delicious, really tasty, lovely home made look and not the  mass produced look you get with a lot of pies. Big chunks of chicken in them. Will visit again when in Plymouth for work. Definitely recommend .

Review Title: Omg mouth watering full of flavour
Review Text:
I love my sausage rolls and I can't find a good place for them ,so they are far few theses days.
So I thought I try one from jacka bakery , omg it was amazing tasty, full of flavour and the pastry was just melt in the mouth , I'm a great believer that the pastry makes the product, it will be my only place to go for them now.

The taste of pastries has gone downhill and they are not really value for money. But apart from that I did not like the attitude of the person serving. When I was about to pay I asked how much it was and the person said ¬£7. I asked why and I was told it was typed wrongly so ¬£6.50‚Ä¶what??? It looks like they were just rounding it up to screw me, no apology or explanation, that stinks. Serve with a smile, treat customers kindly and they will be back. Try to screw them and they will not come back. That simple. Think about that üëç

Review Title: The best sausage roll I‚Äôve ever had
Review Text: The best sausage roll I‚Äôve ever had. Phenomenal! The pastry and meat were exceptionally flavourful and the pastry was so flaky. I can‚Äôt wait to try more food here.
Without a doubt the BEST sausage rolls we have ever tasted!! LEGENDARY pastries and coffee keep us coming back, and  nowhere else even comes close!!
I have never tasted something like this, I don‚Äôt know the name but it‚Äôs DELIGHTFUL AND DELICIOUSü•∞ We had both flavours( cherry and caramel) and are both very good ü©∑üíúü©∑

I was surprised to see no bread in a bakery at 10 in the morning. 
All the shelves were empty !
The carrot cake was dry and the choco mint bun was overwhelmingly minty . 
I found it pricy too . The cashier not too friendly either .
Overall quite disappointing compared to the current rating. 
Will not go there again !
This place consistently provides not only amazing friendly service but THE best pastries, without fail! We visit every weekend and are always greeted with a smile and a collection of amazing

Must be the worst sausage roll I have ever had all I could taste was salt and to make matters worse it was ¬£4.50 , It doesn‚Äôt come close to a quality sausage roll you can get better in a Spar shop, Maybe it was a off day as lots good reviews , I worked on Barbican late 80s early 90s for 12 years and this was are go to place and never let us down not sure if trying to be something it‚Äôs not , I was really surprised how bad it was fair enough if ¬£1.50 but if charging ¬£4.50 it‚Äôs got to taste At least ok :-(

I‚Äôve had pastries and sandwiches from here in the past, but last week I tried their steak pasty and I honestly believe it‚Äôs the best pasty in Plymouth.

The pastry was buttery, the filling was quality and it was out of the world. 

You need to try this if you‚Äôre in Plymouth!

Probably the best bakery you will ever visit! The croissants, and  pan chocolate of to die for ! Well stocked deli, and always a warm welcome.

Also, best coffee on the Barbican!
Not sure why this is listed as a restaurant. Had hoped to warm up,  sit and enjoy a pastry.  Bread smelt and looked good .  Got a take away croissant, which was OK but a bit soggy.

We always try and go for a walk on a Sunday morning and always stop here for a Sunday coffee and pastry. Everything we have ever bought from here tastes incredible and the bread is always so lovely and fresh! The staff are all very friendly and welcoming too. Definitely one of the best places in Plymouth for coffee and cakes/pastries. Will continue to make this a regular visit :-)

Advertised as open, but all locked up, with no notice or info.  Dont make a special trip here without ringing first because advertised openings don't mean they are open - even with revised Xmas opening time

This is what you call a " proper Bakery " truly amazing. I have been here quite a few times and especially love and adore the Eccles Cakes. So succulent and true artisan baking. Amazing. The best place to visit on The Barbican Plymouth.

Absolutely amazing!
These are not just cakes or pastries they are more a sensory journey and experience, an explosion of taste and flavours.

First of all and this is not exclusive to this business, I do think that food of this type should be behind a screen for hygiene reasons, particularly if some of it is on a waist level table so it cant be prodded or sneezed on etc by the general public milling around it.    I did however buy and enjoyed a very nice cake and some croissants. The sourdough bread  was substantial of good quality  and well baked.

Every time, I'm in Plymouth, I head here, as early as possible(it sell's out fast, every day!) for their properly made, real bread, cakes, etc.
It is the oldest bakery in the UK, too!!!
It is a must do, when in Plymouth!!!
Every time I purchase anything from this amazing bakery I‚Äôm never disappointed, this morning was no exception. The Pain Au Chocolates are to die for well worth the walk to get them.

Traditional, handmade food - very well baked! There's a good selection of their own produce and local artisan products on sale. The only complaint I have is that there is no longer space to sit inside and enjoy a coffee / cake...

What a lovely place, easy to find, and the smells flowing out of the door meant you were hard pressed not to wonder in and start drooling over the cakes, breads and pastries all of which looked excellent.

We opted for savoury and had a pasty and a sausage roll both decent enough and hot enough to eat.

My mum and I come here at least once a week and we always look forward to it. The coffee is delicious (best coffee I have had) and the pastries are to die for. The nicest croissants and my mum said the sourdough bread is the best sourdough she has ever had since San Francisco. The brownies are my brothers favourites and we always enjoy buying the interesting cheeses other items you stock in the shop.

We were on a City break as it was my birthday, and friend lives'  and work's there.
I had a too do list, which I ticked off, with dog-friendly Monty's for breakfast on last day, as well as Jacka Bakery for their bread & cakes!
Breakfast was good, so on too Jacka for my bread & cakes.
We got there before 9.00pm to get a prime spot, and were in top 4, awaiting my turn to get the tong's out!
I grabbed several paper bags, and filled with two loaves, and many cakes.
The bill was nearly ¬£23.00, and you knew that they were top-end product, too.
The croissants were so flaky, as well as big, and I had the two first slices of Bakewell
Tart which were so damn good, I could have ate the whole tray!!!
Even our French Bulldog love's rich butter bakery products!
He knocked back a load with us in Waitrose car park, too!
I wish it was our local bakery, but it will have to wait until I visit my friend in the future, although I will have to check out Bristol's great bakery near Temple Mead Station which has a big following, due to it's amazing product like Jacka!

This was our go to place for breakfast during a short break in Plymouth. The bread,  croissants and pastries were great and the coffee was very good too.  Didn't try the cakes but they all looked delicious. My only small criticism is that it is really quite pricey.

This has to be my favourite place to go, absolutely beautiful bread and bakery treats all made on the premise. Everything I have tried has been exceptional and they also support local by selling local products. The staff are warm and friendly and have great banter, as I said I love this little place and I highly recommend.
Delicious coffee and baked goods (particularly the chocolate brownies)! The best bakery on the Barbican, would highly recommend.

Review Title: Also open on Tuesdays during the summer.
Review Text: Very useful and well worth noting that this summer Jacka‚Äôs are opening on Tuesdays during the state school holidays.
Just wow! I have never seen such large crossaints and donuts. So tasty, no wonder they have queues. Shame you cant sit in. Decent coffee too. A must for breakfast.

I can only assume this bakery has been taken over in recent years. We used to get delicious savoury foods and cakes etc  from here and it was always lovely and it had an amazing reputation. 

Called in here today at 13.00pm and there was barely anything left, considering it was lunchtime. Paid ¬£9 for 2 small quiches which were nothing special and were pretty much tasteless. Considering today has the jazz and blues festival on the Barbican and the pride festival on the hoe that they would have baked more food so there was more choice. Disappointed.
The pastries that are baked here are exceptionally good. The only issue is they are often sold out! I would particuly recommend the croissants, pan au chocolate & cinnamon buns.

Review Title: A wonderful bakery with great coffee too
Review Text: What a gem. If the aroma of cinnamon and women sugar doesn't do it for you  the sight of the most divine custard doughnuts, oozy brownies and fantastically fresh sourdough surely will. We succumbed within seconds to the best cinnamon swirls ever washed down with excellent coffee. Sat on the Quay watching the world go by feeling like we were in Italy. Wished we were self catering just yo have an excuse to buy more goodies. Wonderful.

Butter croissants, cinnamon roll and jam doughnut, not bad at all, can tell they‚Äôre freshly made. If you go later, a lot of the goods have sold out. Very popular bakery, queues outside even before opening time. Delicious granary sourdough loaf.

Gorgeous crossiants ! Just delicious. 
Didn't eat any bread, maybe next time? Doughnuts, eggs, chutney, coffee .. so much to choose from. Next time I visit I'll try something else. Lovely shop, glad you are open during these difficult times. Well be back !

The queue before opening gives away that this is going to be a pretty good place but I thought it was outstanding. Artisan is a word overused but this place deserves it - you won't find produce like this is many bakers - really good pastries, giant chocolate croissant, decent coffee. I didn't try the bread but it looked very good. Will be going again tomorrow.
Went to the Plymouth Gin distillery had some bread with my starters it was sublime asked where they got it to be told it was from Jaka Bakery well worth going to

Has himself not got us lost looking for the bakery, we would have arrived more than 5 minutes before closing!

Grabbed the last two croissants and a brownie from an almost empty shop.  Croissants were huge, delicious and on,y left me wishing I‚Äôd got there 5 minutes earlier!  Would have loved to try the breads, particularly the sourdough, but alas, all gone!

Review Title: Plymouth‚Äôs best bakery doesn‚Äôt open till 9am on May Saturday!
Review Text: We have enjoyed Jacka‚Äôs output since the present owners reopened and kickstarted it so successfully several years ago. Very disappointing that when we we came down this morning at 8.15 this morning to gat fresh bread, croissants and if possible Eccles cakes. Alas, although inside behind the counter was a hive of activity, the door was locked and a friendly passer by pointed out the sign showing the opening times. Sadly we couldn‚Äôt wait. Worth bearing in mind that this place has been very busy during the lockdown, socially distanced queues strength a long way back Southside Street and the full stock is often gone well before lunchtime.

A small and charming place with delightful coffee and amazing pastries... We had hot cross bun, pain au chocolat, and a croissant... All of them top quality, really filling and melting in your mouth. I wish we could have tried the savoury options and bread... Fantastic products.

Cute little bakery on the Barbican - they have a good selection of pastries and mostly sourdough bread loaves. They only have three little tables and the place is always packed. The drinks were good too. Only downsides are that it‚Äôs so popular there are always people coming in and out so you can‚Äôt really relax, and they don‚Äôt have a toilet for customer use, which as a pregnant lady was quite inconvenient.
Visited this for a tea and pastry.  The pain au chocolat was very good indeed and very fresh.  Staff very information when asked about the baking process.  sour dough baguettes looked wonderful

Review Title: Amazing bread and pastries on the barbican
Review Text: Jacka Bakery is a great local bakery serving food and also homemade bread and pastries. The bread is truly delicious and some of the best we have tasted and the pastries are amazing too especially the cinnamon buns and pain au raisins. We have always had a friendly experience with the staff. All the bread is made on site and it is just a lovely place to visit. If you want to eat in I would book as it is quite small inside.

Review Title: Great for breakfasts and a cuppa with a cake during the day
Review Text: Fantastic home baking.  Found this place by accident but so glad we did.  Had breakfast of croissants, cinnamon swirls and coffee eating outside - fantastic experience.  Wish we could transplant your bakery home with us, we loved your food so much.

Review Title: The best bread, breakfast and coffee in town.
Review Text:
Jacka Bakery is my favourite place for a delicious breakfast. The food is excellent, truly freshly made to order and served with a smile by the friendly staff. 

I recommend the wild mushrooms on toast which is served with a golden-yolked organic egg from a local farm. 

If you like a sweet treat, Owen and the team bake a variety of pastries, cakes, buns and tray bakes every day. Every day brings variety.

Today I tried their doughnut fir the first time and I was astounded at how light, fluffy and springy it was, not greasy, not caked in sugar. The raspberry jam inside comes from another small business and it is available to buy at the bakery.

If you want to buy the bread or cakes, come early because they always sell out.

I enjoyed the eccles but sadly I could never get them when I visited
i used to go in once a week and I was lucky if I got an eccles cake every 6 visits
I have stopped going now as it seems that the staff are very smug to tell me that they don't have them and I started to feel a little uncomfortable actually asking.
I once bought all of the eccles that were on display and I was made to feel like I was doing something wrong..! I even ordered 2 to collect the next day and paid in advance only to be told the next day that they had sold them and they refunded my deposit
Seems like a lot of stress trying to get something you like...!

Review Title: Sourdough baguettes and big part rye loaves.
Review Text: This place never fails and so much better for early morning pick ups when there is usually space to park outside the chip shops. The heroic baguettes go very well with breakfast or stuffed for a lunch snack. The 20% rye mix big loaves taste great too.

Paid ¬£3.50 for two slices of toasted sourdough with butter& marmalade. I questioned that although nice toast, did not taste like sourdough. Staff admitted is wasn't, just from a standard loaf. Staff looked rather embarrassed, premium price, but not what was on menu.

Amazing loved every mouthful of it really delicious.....pastries are my favourite
........excellent service and no time waiting......
Me and hubby went there for breakfast. Lovely food and delicious coffee. We definitely going back. Best cinnamon roll I ever eat!!!

¬£5,yes, a fiver for a bacon roll to takeaway... bit of a mickey take really! The produce all looked lovely in the shop and there were clearly many well healed clientele in attendance happily paying silly money for their breakfast!! I left feeling ripped off however

Review Title: Best bread in Plymouth and probably UK
Review Text: I was a regular here. I bought all the bread they sell there and all is great. Croissants are also amazing. The breakfasts (eggs on toast with many options) are very popular in the Barbican. They close on Tuesdays but anyway they ran out of bread everyday by 11:30-12:00 so you better be there early. You'll probably see 2-3 people waiting at the door at 9 am...

Had a lovely breakfast with my mum; we don't get to hang out and catch up much but this was the perfect environment. The staff were friendly, the environment is lovely, and everything is very tasty. Took home some sourdough baguettes and they went down a treat! A real gem in Plymouth and can't wait to go back :)
Had an excellent coffee & pain au chocolat. Very relaxing place. I highly reccommend. Service is also great.
We passed the bakery randomly. We were so lucky: we had a very delicious breakfast, the atmosphere there was nice and the staff was very very friendly!!

Di passaggio a Plymouth per far colazione sono andato nel panificio pi√π vicino e recensito  da Trip, pane e brioches molto buoni e ragazzo che gestisce gentile anche con chi come me sa poco l'inglese

I grew up in California eating San Francisco sourdough and Is la is better. I have been here several summers now and all year i look for comparable quality breads but I have to wait to get back to Plymouth for the best.

If you visit Plymouth, you have to come here for a croissant and coffee.  We visited today, the staff were super friendly, the coffee was special and the croissants so fresh, they tasted like they made only minutes before.

It was so good, we went back and bought a loaf of bread!

Opravdu nejlep≈°√≠ chl√©b a peƒçivo, jak√© jsme v UK jedli. Sortiment nen√≠ moc ≈°irok√Ω a opravdu se rychle vyprod√°v√°, v nab√≠dce jsou i mal√° j√≠dla, kter√° jsou vynikaj√≠ci a z jedn√© porce se naj√≠ dva. K√°va tak√© skvƒõl√°. Velk√Ω rozd√≠l v obsluze-jeden den rychl√° d√°ma, druh√Ω den velmi pomal√Ω p√°n.
