Whilst spending a few days in & around Plymouth we were looking for a lightish brunch meal.  We chose Jacka Bakery based on the superb looking loaves & filled rolls in the window.
There are 3 tables inside and a couple outside.  The menus all based in the sour dough bread they bake on site - and I have to say it is superb.  My husband had croque madam and I had Slow Roasted Tomato with pesto & feta cream.  The was very good and the staff very friendly and helpful.
Whilst we were eating our food there was a constant stream of people buying their bread which I have to say looked lovely.
We will definitely be back and would highly recommend the bread and food served here.

Review Title: Purveyor of the original ship's biscuits! No weevils included!
Review Text:
Probably the oldest bakery shop on Plymouth and a former supplier of Shop's biscuots to all the maritime fleet. Now a wonderful bakery mot to be missed.
Situated on Southside Street and surrounded by history.
Rember going here when I sailed on a Saturday out of the mayflower club ‚Äîwonderfull still good value why buy from t‚Äôescortait when you can get the real stuff so easy
It was actually nice enough to sit outside. We enjoyed a coffee, croque monsieur and frangipane. Really tasty food and nice staff.

I've bought bakery products here before but recently stayed for a drink in the cafe area and was very impressed with the coffee. It was rich and delicious and I'll certainly be making it a regular stop when I'm visiting the Barbican. The staff are very friendly and there are a selection of tasty snacks on offer to go with a drink. The building dates back to the late 1500s and the interior has been decorated to reflect the historic atmosphere with a contemporary twist.
The smell of he freshly baked bread is irresistible and it's impossible to leave without buying a delicious loaf.

What a priceless little gem this is. So small,  but if you're lucky enough to get a table, you'll certainly not be disappointed. I would've even waited for a table, it's that good. Freshly prepared, tasty and in such historical surroundings, what more could you ask for? Exceptional value as well. You really couldn't ask for anything better for brunch/lunch.....not to missed if in the Baricab area.
I had some absolutely stunning bread from this perfect little traditional bakery on the Barbican. Highly recommend a visit.

I visited here with some friends. First off the bakery is really cute, clean and the staff were friendly. I ordered a bacon sandwich. I was surprised when it came and the bread was fried as it didn't state this on the menu. The side salad was just dressed with olive oil which made the meal just too oily overall. It looked great on the plate but far too oily.

Never disappointed!! 
Slowly working our way through the menu and each is as good as the last. From the warm pan aux raisins to the coffee to the Croque Madame consistently first rate and highly recommended to all.

Review Title: Please make more of your popular items!
Review Text:
Amazing bread, probably the best in Devon, but why do you run out of baguettes by 11.00 am in the morning? And this is at least the third time it happens. I made a special trip this morning on my day off and was really disappointed. 
Having been to France a few times, I think if any bakery run out of bread by midday, there would be riots. I am sure I am not the only one who came in asking for stuff after it sold out on numerous occasions - please take it as a free market research and make more stuff that tends to sell out. And thank you for the great bread that you do make!
We picked up a takeaway breakfast from here: a couple of danishes and hot drinks. There was a good selection of danishes which were fresh and delicious.

Found this little bakery by happy accident. Staff member was so helpful and the food was delicious. Simple but top quality menu. Loved that the owner's cookery books were on a bookshelf for customers to browse through. Really good tea and coffee.

Found on the off chance after looking for a place to eat on a Monday afternoon - everywhere else was shut! Glad we found it as everything about the place was great. Service, food, price, all good! Will visit again when back in Plymouth!

... in fact anything they bake!
Bought filled rolls here (ham salad seeded batch) for a picnic lunch and they were great.  The iced lemon flapjacks were yummy too and so generous in portion they had to be eaten several hours after the batches!
But possibly the best things of all were the coffees and pain au raisins we had for breakfast (twice) in this lovely bakery.
There‚Äôs not a lot of room to sit so we were lucky but there‚Äôs a constant stream of people buying the baked goods.
Clearly serving a need and serving it well.  Long may they continue.
One of the oldest bakers in Plymouth, always a great selection of bread and cakes. Have always enjoyed a pasty from here.

Review Title: Great little bakery and coffe shop
Review Text:
Fabulous home baked style bread, cakes and buns. Always get a great coffee in great building and surroundings. 
Everyone should visit here
This bakery has been on the Barbican for years. Lovely cakes, wedding cakes etc. Support our local community, yum!
Beautiful artisan bread, which I have had on many occasion, but the food for our picnic was amazing! Thank you
I bought 2 loaves of Jackas sourdough bread, it was fabulous and I will definitely buy more. The service in the bakerywas also excellent. I would highly recommend.

The people, the food when you eat in and bakery are top notch.  Very friendly and everything always looks so tempting.  I would recommend if your visiting Plymouth Barbican it is most definitely with a visit.
I had some pasties from here and they where hands down the best pasties id ever had they also do very nice pani chocolate

Review Title: Greatest Little Bakery in the SW
Review Text: Sour dough bread to die for, great cakes, great coffee, fantastic location.  An amazing little bakery which still uses the original old ovens which are about 200 years old.  The most artisan of all artisan bakeries.  A real Barbican gem!!

Amazing coffee best I have had in Plymouth, I search for great coffee. The young barista knows his stuff. So good have one to sit in and one to take away. The sour dough is second to none. Love coming in with my daughter just so chilled. Thanks all.
We had a delicious bacon sandwich but the pastries looked wonderful too. Great cup of coffee and friendly staff. Try it.

At first glance walking by you see a small artisan bakery which generally is very busy. This intrigued me so in I went and found an absolute gem. Yes it is small and booking for a table is advised if you are looking to eat breakfast which looked yummy. We were lucky and while waiting for our coffee seats came available. We enjoyed the most wonderful croissants and a bacon roll. Be early to buy the bread as it is again delicious and sells out. The staff were polite and helpful and the place has a great atmosphere.  Enjoy. Might see you there.
Great staff, made you feel welcome, its only a small bakery with limited seating but the food and fresh bread etc is yummy

Fantastic little bakehouse offering cakes and homecooked pasties and scrumptious doughnuts right in the heart of one of the oldest parts of Plymouths historical barbican just along the road from the Mayflower steps where the Plilgrim brothers sailed to America and also where Sir Francis Chichester landed when he returned from his around the world yacht race.

Review Title: A great start of the day
Review Text:
Had a wonderful breakfast yesterday morning at Jacka Bakery in Plymouth: the best croissant I have ever eaten ( being French I have tried a lot....)
The selection of bread and pastries is amazing , the coffee excellent and the staff very friendly.

If you like ‚Äúreal‚Äù bread; crunchy, crusty with a delicious crumb, then head here. Tasty is not the word! 

Apparently the oldest surviving bakery in the UK and it‚Äôs not hard to see why. All the sour dough based breads are amazing and well worth the slightly high prices. 

I‚Äôm assured it‚Äôs well worth having lunch here as well. Which I shall definitely return this week to do. 

Everyone should try this bakery out, you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Can‚Äôt review the bread or any other of their offerings which look very nice. 
As for the second time in a month we have gone into the bakery only to be completely ignored by the staff whilst waiting at the counter. 
It was as if my partner was invisible and that we were an inconvenience. 
Won‚Äôt be returning for a third try as the staff obviously need some serious customer service training. 
I won‚Äôt be surprised if this small business fails at some point due to the lack appreciation of potential customers.

Excellent food, coffee, pastry and bread. 
+ great, attentive service.
Option for oat milk instead of milk. 
Couldn‚Äôt ask for more. A must when going to the barbican!

Absolutely adore Jacka Bakery. The peanut butter & banana on rye is honestly the best ever, coffee and staff are also wonderful. Such a secret gem of the Barbican and Plymouth overall.
I have the opportunity to explore many places living in London, however I get excited to visit my parents and go to Jacka's, it's a super nice routine :) Thank you!!!
Excellent coffee and great bread and pastries. The place may be compact and bijou but the quality more than makes up for the lack of space

I visit this bakery each time I go to the Barbican.  The food is lovely as is the bread.  I usually have soup which is accompanied by a wedge of bread with melted cheese.  Very tasty.  There is a specials menu in the shop but I always choose soup as its just my thing.   The tea, my usual is Earl Grey, in a tea pot which is my preferance.  It is a bakery with a small eating area to the front.  There are more tables outside in the pavement area for the more hardy amongst us. It is a must for me each time I am down in the Plymouth area.  Bon appetit!

Jacka Bakery is superb...best bread I've ever tasted, super efficient and friendly service and probably the best pasties in Devon and Cornwall. It's my favourite place for breakfast with exquisite coffee and great breakfast menu. How can a place get better than best? I have no idea but Jack's seems to manage it !
Great coffee beautiful food and friendly service. Decor is lovely too, and smack bang in the middle of Barbican. An absolute must when visiting Plymouth

The bread and cakes are excellent at this small cafe on the Barbican.
The snacks are of a high standard
The staff are friendly and it is great value for money
Friendly staff, great croissants but the coffee is amazing..... I think it may well be the best I've had in Plymouth.
Brioche buns are 100% to die for, super cosy, super lovely, bread is amazin, people are amazin, love

I've been going to this place since 2015. The staff is very friendly and the food is amazing - very large portions for lunch. Best bread in Plymouth for sure. The coffee is also very good and the cakes are divine. In my opinion the only limitation is the space and lack of toilets. Otherwise a must visit bakery in Plymouth!

We are regular visitors at the weekend & frequently bring visiting family & friends. However, we were let down on our recent visit as having ordered our breakfasts we waited & waited & had to ask where it was - only to be told they had no record of it. A muttered apology and a refund was given (which you would expect) & that was it! Disappointing as we usually love the bread & bakery products & have often recommended it. Yes mistakes occur but better customer service would have helped improve the situation (having to go to an appointment on an empty stomach!) & I now have second thoughts about returning

Arrived for opening and ordered 3 hot drinks, 2 breakfast dishes and also bought a loaf of sourdough. We got served our hot drinks at a usual speed and over half an hour later we still hadn‚Äôt got our cooked breakfasts. We had noticed other people who had come in a fair bit after us had already got theirs so we asked the waiters serving, whom of both remember us being one of the first customers in the bakery. Despite this and taking payment, they said unfortunately they could not see the order on the system anywhere. As we had important plans after this, we could not wait longer for the food to be cooked so unfortunately had to get a refund and go on an empty stomach. We were disappointed at the service, especially having been regular customers and how we we were not even offered a pastry to take with us for the inconvenience!
Lovely selection of baked goods, friendly staff and fair prices. Seating is limited but adequate for the size of the premises.

Review Title: Lovely coffee, great choice of breads, healthy options
Review Text: I love this place, it‚Äôs like going back in time and offers in house baking to an extremely high standard. Love the breakfast choices. Nice coffee. Friendly and family run
I just had a piece of carrot cake so big it should have had its own postcode and good? It was way better than good! Great lunch options, great bakery and friendly staff

We popped into this lovely bakery whilst on holiday last year and came back again this year. 

We had a delicious egg, bacon and tomato sandwich and shared a cookie afterwards too. All the ingredients are fantastic quality, their bread is the best. 

The lady serving was so friendly and helpful too, which makes a big difference to the usual chain cafes. 

We'll definitely be back when we're in Plymouth again.

Review Title: I search in vain for a proper lardy cake
Review Text:
If you visit the Barbican and fancy a bun this is the place to go. The window display is mouth watering and all the products are fresh.
The only thing I cannot find anywhere in Plymouth is a proper old style lardy cake.
They are probably not considered 'healthy' these days which is a shame as they were bledy 'andsome.
This bakery and coffee shop is a gem of a find. Coffee of the highest quality, Artisan Bread at its finest and delicious cakes available too. Absolutely lovely bakery, not cheap but very good.

The baking in the window looked lovely, so went in and had a talk with a lovely lady about how sourdough bread was made, treated myself to a brownie and a chocolate brownie, generous potions, and so so fresh.... will be back
Great coffee, Great breakfast, Great bread, Great service - what more can I say. This is how to run a qyality bakery/cafe. Well done!
Havent been for a while, but certainly wasnt dissapointed! New menu items ... but couldnt pull myself away from my favourite .. ‚Äúegg n bacon‚Äù with a flat white ... nom nom ...

My dad comes here every weekend to get his bread and now I know why. 

Lovely granary sourdough with bacon and eggs, and the cinnamon roll was out of this world! 

I‚Äôd recommended getting there 10 minutes before opening to get a table as there‚Äôs limited seating and it‚Äôs a very popular place.
The staff are really friendly. The coffee and hot chocolate were great and their pastries are super tasty!

Jacka bakery has been going longer than any other bakery in Plymouth 
Well known for its good quality pies cakes bread ect ,the best in the south west üòã.

A must visit baker's... Lovely beef oysters and a variety of Cakes ( no tiny cakes here). Great value for hearty appetites. No facility to eat in...pity as the seagulls are nearby. I always take mine home.
Dashed in to avoid the rain. Warm welcome and quality food baked in house beats corporate food any day. Back tomorrow as their breakfast looks inviting

Review Title: Greatest Little Bakery in the South West
Review Text: The smell of freshly baked sourdough bread gently emanates through the door to this shop.  Spoil yourselves with one of the best bakewell tarts outside the village of Bakewell.

Review Title: What a gem of a place!
Review Text: On a business trip to Plymouth and had a few hours spare so I ended up in Sutton Harbour. The window display of this bakery drew me in. Croissant and coffee were ordered and without wanting to sound OTT, it‚Äôs the best croissant I‚Äôve eaten in years. Crisp shell, light as a feather and tasted amazing. The coffee was strong and rich with no hint of bitterness. What a great way to start the day! I‚Äôm just gutted it‚Äôs not my local bakery.

Had breakfast here today with my family, we all had different things on toast and they were all absolutely delicious, and the way they were served / garnished was lovely. We also bought some cakes for the car journey back to London and ate them at the service station and they were equally great - I think the bakewell cake has got to be the nicest cake I‚Äôve ever tasted! (Eccles cakes back on the menu next time please!!)
Go here regularly for their sourdough. Sandwiches are great, tiny place so not much seating. Go early in the day for bread as they sell out quickly.

In short the best mushrooms on toast I‚Äôve ever eaten. Wasn‚Äôt expecting to eat or sit but they had space and the smells were too good to not do so!  

Very small seating area and preparation area but well with eating at and buying bread from. Bought the special of the day which was delicious but not cheap. However much better than supermarket ‚Äòspecials‚Äô!

We arrived mid afternoon in Plymouth and were looking for a light lunch.  We spotted Jacka's and popped in to see what was to be had.  The kitchen was just shutting down but they cheerfully heated up a pizza for us to share and made a couple of coffees.  The pizza was absolutely delicious, both the cheese and tomato topping and the lovely texture of the base.  The coffees came with some very professional latte art and were also very flavoursome.  It was easy to see why this place attracts rave reviews, and why their (in-house) baked goods go so fast.  Service was friendly and efficient and the prices were good.  What more can you ask?

Whether you just want to buy some bread or to sit down for something to eat, I cannot recommend Jacka Bakery highly enough. The bread, all sourdough, is excellent (although it would be nice to also have smaller loaves available) and the cafe make excellent use of it with first class snacks. I had toasted rye sourdough with wild mushrooms cooked in tarragon and topped with a lovely poached egg and green leaves. Looked and tasted lovely. Good coffee too. And reasonably priced.

As a family of five we enjoyed a delicious breakfast at Jacka Bakery, service was a little slow as they were so busy, it is a small cafe so staff serving not only the tables but the counter where the most gorgeous looking bread & cakes were being served. Would definitely go back again & recommend.

Where to begin... the croissants, the cinnamon swirls, the coffee, no the bread definitely the bread... 
After eventually deciding the croqu√© madame looked epic (saw one being served to another customer) I can honestly see it‚Äôs one of the best things I‚Äôve eaten for brunch. The b√©chamel, the ham and cheeses a great mixture. Tastebuds wanted another one, even if the stomach needed a tad more time. Brilliant time was had by the three of us.
Popped into Jacka's one Sunday morning after dropping the wife off. Saw the bread pudding on the countertop and was iimmediately tempted. Glad I submitted it was delicious will return for some more
Stopped in there for some brunch. The people were so lovely and friendly and the food was delicious. We also bought some sourdough which they happily held onto for us until we could pick it up!
We stopped here for a quick lunch. The service was good and the food was amazing. They make a lovely sourdough loaf.
Lovely, small friendly cafe/bakery. Fab food- avocado smash and feta salad on sour dough was gorgeous and huge portions. Great prices.
i have been visiting this shop for over 50 years on a weekly or more basis their product are always fresh
Very nice coffee and cake,but very restricted on space with only limited seating.Would visit again especially when looking for Artisan baking items within the bakery section.
Love this place for a coffee and a pastry, small but comfortable cafe with very good staff. Pastries are delicious as is the bread to take away.

Review Title: Best spot for breakfast in Plymouth
Review Text: I've lived here for 5 months and this is the first time I've come for breakfast. The service is exceptional, the staff are friendly and go out of their way to make your visit the best. The food is amazing and I highly recommend the sourdough bread and the cakes. If you're on holiday here your trip would not be complete without a visit to this establishment. The oldest bakery in Plymouth and you can see why it has lasted this long. Bravo guys keep doing what you do!!

I stopped in here for a quick breakfast early in the morning. Fortunately it was a weekday so there was no problem with getting a table. The coffee was excellent, and they had non-dairy milk as well. I had the bacon and eggs and the portion was big enough for two people. There were 3 doorstops of bread, 5 rashers of bacon and 2 eggs; all were beautifully cooked. The bread, as expected, was amazing and was probably some of the best I've ever had. Overall an excellent bakery and I would definitely recommend a visit.

Popped in for a snack at lunchtime and was presented with a freshly made to order ham, cheese and pickle sandwich to take away. This was quite the most brilliant sandwich I‚Äôve ever seen. My only mistake was not to eat in with a knife and fork. However, somehow I managed to consume it on the go without spilling its contents. If you‚Äôre hungry and want some bang for your buck then this is the place to go.

I have tried sour dough from Glasgow to Plymouth (now) and Jacka's sour dough is THE best I have tried.  I previously thought one in South Shropshire was the best, but Jacks's beats that.  Price wise you get a large loaf for your money, so I don't get the comment saying it is expensive, quality foods needs quality ingredients and Jacka's uses these.  The crust is dark, crisp and delicious.  The crumb has holes and the right amount of sourness.  Such a shame I live 275 miles away.....

I found this place for lunch today, not expecting anything special but it was. The coffee was excellent and a simple ham and cheese sandwich was nothing short of exceptional! I'm already looking forward to my next visit
amazing breakfast/lunch for a very affordable price and the best sourdough bread i have ever had!! one of my favourite places to go in Plymouth!

Review Title: Artisan Bakery extraordinaire, you will not be disappointed - unless its late in the day!
Review Text: Called in for lunch on Friday afternoon and ordered the croque monsieur and a side order of the cowboy beans out of curiosity. The croque monsieur was amazing, ham and cheese with mustard served on two thick slices of sour dough, with a green salad it was delicious, guaranteed to fill you up! The cowboy beans were absolutely delicious the best beans I have ever eaten - anywhere. Make an effort to try them ask for a small side order you will not be disappointed. Really friendly delightful staff who were happy to chat about their story of the bakery but would not divulge the cowboy beans recipe despite my best efforts. Bought a sour dough loaf for the weekend which was very tasty. If you want to buy a loaf then make the trip in the morning to avoid disappointment it' worth the effort.

Turned up late morning for a spot of brunch as was met by a wonderful aroma of baked goods. 

Although the seating is sparse as the restaurant is small, we were lucky enough to get a table immediately! Had wonderful bacon and poached eggs in a beautiful Rye Sourdough. 

All goodies are available to take away, and they bake a selection of breads daily that I would highly advise swapping your usual Hovis for!

My partner and I finally decided to try out Jacka and it's safe to say we weren't disappointed; what we ordered was fantastic. Generous portions for a very reasonable price (even I struggled to eat it all) the entire meal was fantastic, fresh and looked beautiful, I spent a lot of the time there looking at other people's food to see what I would get next time. I'd previously tried their cinnamon rolls which was definitely worth the ¬£2.40 price. The only downside is that this place is very small, but it's a testament to their quality how they are always packed! Very happy that this historic and independent bakery is such a success - you'll understand why when you visit!

Simple toast egg and Smokey bacon this is not.  It is top quality freshly baked bread turned into thick slices of toast.  Eggs well coloured and perfectly cooked. About 4 to 5 pieces of quality smoked bacon. Just add a cup of tea. Food presentation excellent. Service outstanding. Good customer interaction.  Go one step further and purchase the sourdough bread or they have a selection of traditionally prepared cakes that taste really nice. I have tried the sourdough and cakes on previous visits.

Although coffee and croissants were very nice they did not make up for fact there is no loo and nowhere to wash hands. I was very surprised as they serve food at tables inside and outside. Will be going elsewhere in future

Popped in over Easter weekend for lunch. I chose Croque Madame -  which was cooked quickly and served piping hot. The bread was beautiful I will say! But the highlight for me was the Simnel Cake - absolutely delicious and took me back to my childhood. 
Excellent service and wonderful coffee. Will be back
Bacon and eggs with coffee and orange juice was exactly what I wanted. There is not much seating but we were lucky.

Love visiting Jacka either to buy bread or very tasty cakes or to sit in and have a coffee.  Love the veggie and vegan options, lovely people that run the bakery too.  Thank you, you are much appreciated.

Ok so first off they allowed our cockapoo in. Small place but fabulous lunch. Portions are large. Pizza wafer thin base. Peanut butter with banana too die for. Best burger I have had for a long time.  Very reasonably priced. Finally the cakes we had rocky road, large piece served 4!  Thanks
Stopped bye for some lunch and had two sourdough pizzas between three of us which was ample. Pizzas were fresh and crisp. Friendly staff and quick service.
A fab selection of tasty rustic artisan bakery products ! I would highly recommend them to one and all !

I had a lovely lunch here with delicious food and lovely atmosphere. 
I took home a cinnamon croissant and a pain au raisin. Both were very good. The cinnamon croissant was the best I've tasted. I'd strongly recommend  this place for a light snack or to buy your bread or croissants.
Brilliant Eccles cakles order in advance if friends visiting. Have recommended several friends. Also enjoyed an excellent breakfast with very good coffee. An interesting menu and pleasant atmosphere.
Great news today, the Eccles cakes were not ‚Äúsold out‚Äù. Best Eccles cakes ever at Jacka Bakery. Bought one to take home as well.

Easily the best bread in Plymouth. Really nice selection of pastries and they do light lunches, too, in this family bakery.
Feel very lucky that I have it nearby and can start the day with a really good French stick

Called in with hubbie for breakfast as the window always looks so tempting.. I went for the smoked bacon and eggs and hubbie had the wild mushrooms with tarragon... both had tea.. great size cups!! A little wait for breakfast but we knew it would be worth it... great taste/flavours.. at ¬£6.50 each well worth the money.. will certainly go again.. also bought a loaf to take home.. so good!!
Had the most delicious breakfast at jacka's! Good coffee, friendly & relaxed service. Bought a brownie and a bakewell slice to takeaway which were also really good! Can't wait to eat here again!
One of my favourite places in Plymouth. There is nothing better to start your day than good coffee and fresh bread. You can have it all at Jacka Bakery! Highly recommended!:)

Lovely little bakery with just a few tables to eat in and get a coffee...

I have been here to eat in a few times, really delicious and satisfying food. Also you can buy real a variety of breads, croissants, cakes etc to take away. 

Ps. Highly recommend the wild mushrooms on toast! 
.

Had the cowboy beans for lunch. They were wonderful and it was so large I struggled to finish it. 
The bread is always good too.
If your after a pasty full of flavour with generous meat portion this is the place.  Forget Warrens with their inferior products and overblown prices.

Review Title: Not as good debit used to be
Review Text:
Went in to get a pastie mid week to be TD they only do them at weekends.
New owners - why change things when they have been working for years.
Probably the oldest surviving bakery in the South West. Fantastic sour dough bread, the best ever Eccles cakes and really good coffee. The only problem, they are closed on Tuesdays.

Review Title: Great coffee, friendly staff and the best bakery in town
Review Text: Mushrooms on toast and the beans on toast were a nice treat!  Also the coffee here is up among the top three in Plymouth.  Nice selection of baked treats in the window too.

I only give this place 4/5 due to the high prices, or else it would have received full marks.
The food is excellent and service is great.

Really scrumptious organic bread and pastries made with Shipton Mill Flour. Great coffee in the Barbican area of Plymouth with indoor and outdoor seating. Super helpful staff (they took a cake out of the oven especially for us!) Not open on a Tuesday.
Lovely small cafe in the Barbican. We were lucky to find a table. Best coffee I‚Äôve had for ages. Wish I could‚Äôve tried the cakes but we had made arrangements for lunch

We visited on a crisp cold but sunny November day.  We had a lovely walk to the Hoe to see the display of Poppy‚Äôs by the war memorial and had worked up a good appetite.  We clocked Jacka‚Äôs on the start of our walk and admired the bread, pastries and cakes in the window.
Great there was table free.  We read the board on the wall which was menu and both chose bacon and eggs on toast.  When they arrived it was so so much more!  The bacon was abundant and crisp without being brittle, the two eggs on top were golden and cooked to perfection.  Two cups of flat white which were made with Origin coffee and really hit the spot.  A fabulous lunch we will be back very soon.
Just make sure you go to this bakery and buy anything. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. And make sure you have a coffee. Superb.
Great cakes and pastries, great staff as well, overall would recommend them. Go on give them a try, you won't be disappointed.
Great pasties, cakes and bread. Baked fresh every day. This shop has always been famous for its bread but now also sells great pasties.
We bought a sourdough baguette from here and it was the best bread either of us have tasted. They sold pastries and sandwiches too, would recommend to anyone. Well worth a visit
There has been a bakery here since the 16th century. Now serving the best pain aux raisins in history. Great place for breakfast.

When a friend heard that we were visiting Plymouth England he told us to go to Jacka Bakery. We were not disappointed. Pastries and coffee were fabulous! And it is the oldest bakery in Plymouth (and south of England I believe). Worth checking out!

GREAT COFFEE
FABULOUS LUNCHES
Down on the Barbican ~ lots of places to eat ~ try JACKA BAKERY
Quirky, tasty, friendly, yummy and very good prices
R E C O M M E N D E D
Popped in for breakfast - lovely! Bread looks and tastes amazing! Will definitely be visiting again!

Was last in Plymouth 2 years ago and we got sandwiches there which where amazing. This trip we planned another visit there. There are now tables and very luckily one became free for us and we both had Croque Madame. They were huge and delicious also made a really good cup of tea.

Have been going to Jacka Bakery regularly since it opened. I am there at least once a week because my family refuses to eat any other bread now. We either eat Jacka's sourdough or no bread at all. Everything they bake has been nothing but perfect. Coffee is the best in Plymouth. Staff is very friendly and even though there are only two tables I never ever felt rushed. Hurry and go early in the day though... They sell out... Yes it's that good ‚ù§Ô∏è

I love it!
Everything is fantastic here!
Even the atmosphere is unique! 
Absolutely to try! 
Great bakery The best for me!

Review Title: A point of JOY in Plymouth!!!
Review Text:
I love this Bakery. 
I am Italian and when I first moved in Plymouth I was so sadly disappointed by the quality of bread. Then I went to visit a friend and found this great peace of bread, that tasted like real bread! Since that point I have been regularly visiting Jacka Bakery. 
The bread is really really good, it's proper bread and not that crap that sell in all the other places. 
You also have a good choice of cakes, brioches and sandwiches. 
I have had pizza there once and it was good. I would suggest the people that make pizza to do it a little bit higher. It's too thin. Trust an Italian :)
I like that the place is really small, I find it lovely, really warm.
I suggest this place to everyone.
Perfect small bakery. Great cakes, coffee and service. Would definitely go again. Tucked away on Southside street but worth the trip.

What a lovely little bakery, the soda bread is delicious and the cinnamon swirls are heavenly. Staff were extremely friendly and it was a lovely place to stop for a treat and a coffee, especially as they still allowed our dog despite the comments on the previous review (on the condition he was well behaved, which he was). Will definitely return!

The bakery has three tables where you can eat in. The food served here is really lovely. Plenty of choices for breakfast or lunch. Top quality coffees as well. On our first visit, We ordered the sourdough toast with mushrooms and tarragon and egg on top, very generous portion. On our second visit we ordered their handmade sourdough thin crust pizzas. The pizzas were quite large, but our 'food snob' 3-year-old daughter loved it so much that she finished her Margherita in just minutes! And she's proudly earned a jacka bakery's sticker from the friendly lady behind the counter. 

Also, they make the most amazing Eccles cakes. Highly recommended!

Firstly let me say the place is quaint and feels great and obviously the bread is impressive.
The food we had was very tasty but perhaps a little expensive. That said it wouldn't have stopped us from returning.
Service was mixed - first guy was happy and friendly, but got our order wrong. The second guy wasn't so happy and friendly but he was in charge! Service was quick and the food was hot.
The problem really was when a slightly overweight Labrador was admitted into this small establishment! The owners tried to keep it quiet but it growled  at other costumers and left my wife and I feeling uncomfortable.
The staff assured the owners that the dog was very welcome! Perhaps more welcome than their paying costumers!

I'd been trying to go here with my partner since the beginning of my pregnancy, as bread has been quite high up on the cravings list! Sadly, the only day off my partner and I had shared for quite some time had been a Tuesday, the day that they are closed!! The fates changed and we have now got two days off a week with each other and have finally managed to make the well-worth trip to Jacka bakery this morning and we were not disappointed. I even woke my partner up early and got ready and dressed in record time to be there right on the dot for opening so that we could sit in and have breakfast, much to his surprise. I had the wild mushrooms and tarragon on toast with a fried egg and he had the croque monsieur, both of which were absolutely delicious on their freshly baked sourdough bread, all I can say though is WOW the portion sizes are insane, which normally I would LOVE but growing a baby means fitting in as many delicious mushrooms as I got was a challenge proved too difficult at this point. I will definitely be back again either to share a breakfast with my partner or after our baby is born so I can devour the whole lot in one sitting with no difficulty. Absolutely delicious food and coffee too (my mocha was the loveliest mocha I've had in a while, nice and chocolately!). If I'd been on my own I probably would've bought the shop out of one of everything on display as it all looked incredible and was selling like crazy but my partner is the sensible one and purchased a sourdough stick instead for us to have for our work lunch tomorrow, which I'm eagerly awaiting too, can't wait to go back again! Thanks for such a lovely breakfast with such delicious bread (and mushrooms).

We stopped here for breakfast -  the pastries are perfect being very light, and the mushrooms on toast were delicious.  Top this off with a very good coffee and you are in breakfast heaven. The shop is small with limited seating - the decor is perfect and fitting for a bakery / cafe.

Called in for light lunch. Baguette and Croque Monsieur were both really good. Sourdough and Granary bread delicious -  crispy crust and good texture.
Try it you won't be disappointed.
One of the oldest local bakers still in business. Lovely traditional hand made bread and cakes. Great shop.
best pasties -doughnuts - cakes and biscuits etc you could wish for.Been established for a long time, as far back as Francis Drake ,and a small frontage belies what is inside.

We came actoss this lovely place by accident. And got fantastic food and drinks. Such good tasting bred..., not expected before. Served by very friendly people.
Wir sind zuf√§llig an dieser tollen B√§ckerei vorbeigekommen. Und haben dann ein wunderbares Essen mit superleckeren Getr√§nken bekommen. Serviert von sehr netten Leuten.

This is a tiny artisan bakery with only three tables, but the coffee is great with wonderful bread and cakes. Small menu but it all seems to revolve around the HUGE sourdough loaves they make, I had mushrooms on toast and it was lovely. I sat on my own but there was a selection of cookery books to flick through so I was very happy. The building is also the oldest bakery in Plymouth, they say there are still original features at the back.

After a very nice night out in Plymouth the next morning we ended up in this bakery. 

Excellent brunch was served. We had a toast with bacon and egg (the bacon was very nice) and a toast with dried tomato and feta cream (which is to die for). 

We were informed that the owner previously worked as a chef for a local high class restaurant, you will really taste that! Further all products used are locally sourced, great!

Fabulous craft breads, croissants, Eccles cakes and more. These guys have taken the oldest working bakery in England and rather than trying to make "old" stuff they are making excellent modern day produce with love and care. You can even get a coffee here which is probably a first for this establishment in its 500yr history

Review Title: Best pizza I've had for years!
Review Text:
Called in on the strength of reviews. Looks nothing from outside and is tiny. Only seats around 10.

My pizza was amazing. Thin, crispy, all very fresh ingredients - best I've had in years. My wife had croque Monsieur on sour dough bread. Also excellent

We shared a chocolate brownie and had some nice coffees too. And bought a sourdough loaf to go

My only disappointment was that by 2pm they'd pretty much sold all their products. I'd have loved to try some cakes. Next time üòÄ

Been here several times now when visiting Plymouth and everything is fantastic. Breakfast or lunch. Bread, pastries or cakes, all good.
Believe the sign outside that says best coffee in Plymouth.
The best flat white I have had since Australia, that's high praise!
What a little gem. Fab bread baked on premises and the breakfasts are fabulous too. Get here on the dot at 9am if you want a table.

if you are looking for fantastic freshly cooked bread you need look no further. Cooked on the premises by an exciting young baker and his team. The range of breads and pastures are really good. if you fancy a coffee and a sandwich which are prepared while you wait drop in
The Sour Dough breads are just superb as are all the breads from this bakery. The staff are bright and friendly and obviously take pride in what they do.
Excellent service of the best bakery products in the city, made the traditional way. Can not fault Jacka Bakery, keep up the good work!

Review Title: The best quality at affordable prices
Review Text:
Had a wonderful breakfast in a brioche bun which was superb washed down with a stunning freshly ground coffee.
I almost escaped and then I smelt the sourdough loaves and had to buy one to take home.
Glad I did , delicious üòã
As a vegetarian looking for lunch can be hard. Found a delicious sandwich and snack. Lovely people serving too

Having read other reviews I had to try this bakery, I was not disappointed. Having bought just about every type of baked delight from the display I can honestly say this is a magnificent bakery with some very talented bakers. The pain au raisin was soft full of raisins he topic was crisp and the laminated layers were stunning. The croissants were fluffy, buttery and crisp. The Eccles cake was full of raisins with a beautifully light crisp outer. Pain au chocolat, simply divine.  The best however I saved til last Jacka's sourdough loaf was the most comforting bread I have had. Fluffy centre with a crust to die for. If you are ever within 50 miles of this shop it's well worth a visit üòÅ. To wash this all down they also sell a wonderfully rich nutty coffee.

Review Title: The best bakers in Plymouth by a mile
Review Text: This is really the only place to buy bread in Plymouth, and to be honest the best baker in the region. Fabulous sour dough bread, very reasonably priced  and excellent pastries too -  it is the perfect place for an early morning coffee.

So many people I know visit this amazing bakery, and I'm just sorry I've taken so long to discover this is the best bakery ever. Most Sundays I now pop onto the Barbican with my little Border for a walk and into Jackas for a loaf and two Bakewell tarts for Sunday pud. All I can say is you got to try them to believe how delicious they are, never tasted any others that come close to these.

I love the fact when you get there and they've been busy the bread you want might be gone, so its lovely just to go in and pick up another kind, if you don't mind that you'll not be disappointed as its all fab.

So much more to try yet, can't wait!

Lovely fresh, beautifully made pastries.
Probably a good idea to come early to have the best choice.
Awesome food and friendly helpful staff100per cent would recommend. They even offer advice on the right product and cater for allergies.

Review Title: great take away bakery buns and cakes to die for
Review Text: great takeaway for cakes buns freshly cooked on premises and pastiest die for great location in old part of historical city barbican

We decided to try out the number one breakfast location in Plymouth. The bakery was small but welcoming. We ordered the traditional bacon and egg on toast and vegetarian version which was pesto, sun dried tomato and feta cream. The portions were large, the bread was beautiful,the coffee and orange juice were the favourites. I enjoyed my breakfast but on a personal note the feta cream wasnt to my taste so i would return but not have that again. I did finish the whole plate though! In conclusion a great place to visit in a fantastic location.
Best bread I've ever tasted, lovely cafe with warm welcoming staff and AMAZING BROWNIES, if your ever in Plymouth it's a must

Review Title: A lovely artisan bakery at the Barbican
Review Text: Organic, freshly produced baked goods, pastries and cakes. Lovely blend of coffee, attentive staff and fair prices.

Review Title: Best coffee in Plymouth- and beyond!
Review Text:
We've long been fans of Jacka's wonderful bread- especially the granary sourdough but after a recent trip to Italy we appreciate their coffee even more. A certain coffee chain uses the slogan "best coffee this side of Milan" but Jacka's could surpass that!
My ultimate taste test is a decaff espresso and Jacka's is "perfetto". My husband rates the cappuccino highly too. Definitely the best coffee in town.

Coffee and cinnamon bun were lovely. Returned later to get provisions for our train back to London.
Looked like a lot of care and attention went into the baking of a variety of breads and cakes. Near London prices though but worth it.

We were heading to the Mountbatten Ferry to start a week on the South West Coast Path and needed a hearty breakfast. We certainly got that. 
I chose the wild mushrooms with tarragon on sourdough toast, my wife had bacon and egg on toast. Both were lovely, and very good value, Our only criticism was that they were so big that we struggled to finish them. The coffee was top quality too.
If we'd been on our last day rather than our first, we'd have been very tempted to buy several loaves to take away.

I love this bakery, the staff are all family and work extremely hard to deliver the highest quality cakes and treats.

Just lovely

Review Title: Good for breakfast on a Sunday
Review Text: Good coffee, tasty toast and scrummy wild mushroom on toast. Nice Sunday treat and they do non dairy milk lattes well.
Really really good bread and a sweet little cafe too. Limited space but well worth getting a take away!

So happy that this ancient place was rebooted as a centre of baking excellence befitting its location- remember the old place from my childhood. Everything I've tried has been superb; coffee, crusty / sourdough bread and satisfyingly British pastries and cakes - at least as good as anything in London and possibly better. dare I say even better than the old town bakery in R W Y?

The Eccles cakes are to die for. Big and buttery, stuffed full of fruit. Took one home to eat and had to eat in 2 stages, half with a cuppa in the afternoon and the other half with my coffee the next day.
The next time visiting the Barbican they had sold out so I bought a couple of sourdough baguettes instead. Absolutely delicious.

Review Title: A must visit for any food lover.
Review Text: Well, where to start. I have visited here several times with both take out and eating in. The bread alone is OUTSTANDING and worthy of all the accolades and awards given. The quality and standard that is constantly achieved is a true testament to the time, dedication and one can only assume love that is put in to each and every item baked. I like the simplicity of the menu only to discover a huge range of depth and flavour with each mouthful that always leaves me hankering for more. The pastries are delicious and the coffee outstanding. Just when you think it could get no better, the staff are excellent, knowledgeable and incredibly customer focused without intrusion. I am not sure how you all do it but keep up the good work. Finally, I have deliberately avoided saying what is my favourite items are or have been as this establishment lets you find you and your tastebuds will always be bringing you back.

My partner and I came here for a bit of lunch when on the Barbican area of Plymouth following the half marathon and a dip in the sea. We had toast with bacon and eggs and a pizza, a cake and a pastry. Everything was delicious and obviously handcrafted with care. I was particularly impressed with the pizza base, which was really thin and light, with a great amount of crunch. This place is definitely worth a visit, and we will return to buy a loaf or two!

Review Title: What you see is what you get
Review Text: A smaller bakery with a limited number of tables serving great food, great coffee and fabulous bread/cakes/rolls. Get there early - the bread is so good and understandably popular, once it's gone, it's gone. Guarantee we will return.

We live local and don't visit here as often as we should. The bread is amazing with the rye sourdough is highly recommended .  The Coffee is also great. 

This is small family run Bakery so be warned when they run out, they run out. For me that's one of the nice things about it. 

I witnessed today (Easter weekend) several people getting heated about the fact there was no bread left to buy!!  As I've said it's a small Bakery, if you want bread after midday go to Morrisons! 

This is a fantastic individual high quality Bakery so get in early.  If you miss out don't have a go at the staff!!
Friendly people and some great bread and cakes, especially the Eccles cakes. Would recommend a visit.
Jacka is a good stop off place for a quick, drink and something to eat and while you are there you van purchase some bread; made on the premises.

Four of us visited some wanted just a coffee and a cake/bun some wanted something a little more - we were all very impressed with what we had. Best hot cross bun ever was one comment and I thoroughly recommend the wild mushrooms on sourdough - take your appetite with you!

I'm visiting Plymouth from Vancouver Canada, and I was looking for sourdough buns for my boyfriend and I. I felt welcomed as soon as I walked in the door. They were out of buns but offered fresh ones made the next morning. Perfect! When I went back the woman from the day before remembered me. She took time to get to know me and even remembered some key points we chatted about previously. The buns were absolutely delicious. 100% recommend :-).

Adhok visit to jacka I brought a pasty very reasonably priced I'm not really a pasty person but got to say I ate this all up it was delicious I even ate the thick crust which if I get a pasty I normally throw it away, the pastry was delightful a lovely buttery taste to it I would recommend Jacka to anyone a gem of a bakery

Review Title: The Oldest Bakery in the UK!
Review Text:
We booked Jacka for a private party in the evening. The staff were excellent, the food was great and it was very reasonably priced, it was a very special occasion.

We had a great time, with stone baked pizzas using local toppings. This bakery makes some amazing bread and mouthwatering cakes!

Jacka is known for being the oldest bakery in the UK, and it does not disappoint.
This bakery is excellent and definitely worth a visit.   The Bakewell slice is highly recommended (if they haven't sold out)!
Popped in for a takeaway coffee to drink by the harbour. Got tempted by the lovely smells of baked goods which they were making on Sunday morning. Lovely coffee and cinnamon bun. Highly recommended.

Review Title: quite possibly the best sourdough in the world
Review Text: I pop in here every 2 weeks for loaves of sourdough bread, it is quite literally the best I have ever tasted.  Wherever I go in the world I seek out local sourdough bread as it's my favourite and I try to see if there is anyone who can top Jacka, especially in the USA where they pride themselves on sourdough baking - I can tell you it's not as good as Jacka, not by a long shot. So pleased to have this quality produce on my doorstep (relatively, I'm in Torpoint).  I have tried their cakes and brownies too and they are rich and luxuriant, just like a cake or treat should be. Really friendly staff and the whole business has a vibrant, busy feel to it.  Just superb.

We found the bakery whilst walking around the Barbican.  A family run business that have taken Sourdough bread to another level !! We had the best cheese on toast ever And would highly recommend the coffee.  If you are around that area you must try to visit you will receive a warm welcome and be assured of a taste sensation.
Called here a few days ago and bought a couple of crusty bread rolls they were so good so I went back for a loaf of bread the next day and wow its good, very good

Donuts tossed in cinnamon sugar - lush

The goods are all tasty, well worth parking up just for Jacka's

We found the bakery by accident when walking around the Barbican. It was quite a small shop with 2 tables outside. But we were so pleased we did find it, the staff were friendly, the selection of bread and cakes was good and although we didn't eat there the food that was being served looked great. 
The sourdough baked on the premises was the nicest we have ever tasted and the flapjacks delicious, but be warned they are very big!!
We now always go there for our bread when we are in Plymouth it was a real find.

Review Title: The best loaf you will ever taste
Review Text:
After living in Plymouth for over 35 years we tried The Jacka because of a friend and boy what have we missed over the years, the bread is a bit pricier than the supermarkets but really well worth it.

Please try it
We had a prefect breakfast of the most wonderful wild mushrooms on delicious granary soda bread. Washed down with excellent coffee and top notch service. A very positive experience.

Review Title: Independent Bakery in the Barbican - Plymouth
Review Text:
This is the best kept secret in Plymouth which everyone should visit. Truly amazing sourdough bread, freshly baked croissants, stunning cakes. Traditional, handmade, and great flavours. I forgot to mention delicious coffee too. 
Thank you Jacka, keep up the excellent work.
Everything was delicious. Eggs and bacon on sourdough toast was amazing, delicious brownie, lovely coffee and friendly service. We will definitely return only earlier so as not to miss out on loaves.
Wonderful range of breads and snacks, the cinnamon swirls are really good.  It's small so only a few tables for dining in but there's a good trade in takeaway. A little quirky and fun.

Review Title: The finest coffee,breakfast, cakes and sourdough bread.
Review Text: I come down to Plymouth half a dozen times a year and every time I have to make a visit to Jackas. I've had good coffee but their flat white is the best you'll get anywhere. Eggs and bacon on sourdough is a must for me and again I haven't tasted better. A selection of cakes to take home is also essential. Considering it takes me five hours to get to Plymouth its worth it just for a meal.I Can't rate them highly enough. To think its the oldest bakery in the country and would have supplied the great sailing ships a voyages just adds to the experience. Fantastic and well done Jackas, we love you.

The window is just so tempting. A wide assortment of cakes including Chocolate Brownies and my favourite ...  Almond Slices are just waiting to be bought and eaten.  Mouth watering. Rich buttery shortbread base with just the right amount of jam finished with a rich golden, almond,frangipan  topping. Scrumptious !!!
Also delicious Artisan breads. A lovely little bake shop/ cafe. Very friendly staff. Highly recommended.

We recently moved to the Barbican and were so pleased to try this new place... finally some REAL bread in the area. Good good good! It is a good surprise discovering how the bakery serves as a coffee. Sitting down sipping a coffee resulted as the best way of enjoying their beautiful pastries.
The place is quite popular around lunch time though we never got the chance of trying sandwiches.

Generally can't fault this place. Probably the best flat white in Plymouth. I dare you to try and enter jacka without leaving with a cake or sourdough. Great to sit in if space, if not grab a take out and wander through the Barbican.

Little gem of a place. Wonderful bread and pastries that are of a massive size. A bit dearer than you would normally pay but worth every penny. I bought a yummy sour dough loaf which I cut in half and shared with my daughter - took three days to eat my half and we used it to accompany soup, just with jam and then toasted. Out of this world! The cinnamon buns are great and too big for one person. There's a little area to eat 'in' and a small menu that is delicious. Food to takeaway as well. Beware of Tuesdays - they shut! There's a real history to this tiny place as well - ask the staff.

C16. Bakery.... Even supplied biscuits for the Mayflower... Family run... Very good coffee with a proper Batista and all the right gear. Bread smells fantastic.

This is simply the best place in the area period!

Probably the best sourdough bread I have had! A bakery with a charming, be it small, cafe - great lunches, light bites & coffee (also v good). Not surprisingly, this tiny bakery supplies bread to some of the better establishments in the area. It is great to see an independent,  family owned, artisan bakery doing well. Every success!

This was our third foray to Jacka's each time building up to this mornings lushness! So it started back in the summer with an impromptu pasty grab for Al fresco lunching on the Hoe .. Well why wouldn't you.. We have the most amazing location. 2nd visit was for breakfast croissant .. And a cheeky little pain au chocolat on the side! Amazing .. So what was next .. Yes it was the sit down coffee and breakfast .. As always the welcome was lovely ( you do it well 'Amy') ... A small table and then simple choices ... Sourdough or croissant or even gluten free with toppings .. Jam, honey, banana, bacon, egg and more ..... So we opted for the excellent granary sourdough toast topped with luscious bacon and a fried egg... Perfectly accompanied with coffee all made with love .. You can tell! These guys all love what they are doing .... So much so we even had 2nd coffees! Oh yes and croissant take always for tomorrow! Ps ... It is a cosy seating area alongside the bakery Aprox 10 seats in total plus outside tables..

They are now part of the local scene. We often pop i for coffee or lunch, but have not. Yer tried their evening meals.
Their Eccles cakes are the best I've ever tasted. The only trouble is that they sell out too quickly. Keep,it up.

I accept that hand made artisan products will vary and that Jacka's have set the benchmark very high but we have been let down a couple of times lately by below par Eccles cakes!  Jacka's is still probably ahead as the best bakery in Plymouth but it needs to stay on its toes. The Column Bakehouse is still very good and parking is easier. If you are on or near the A38 then don't forget the excellent Ella Artisan Bakery in Ashburton and The Almond Thief  near Totnes.
A rainy day.  Dived into this bohemian coffee bakery. Absolutely delicious üòã experience, macchiato and sourdough pastry.
Only bought bread from here but it really is the best bread in Plymouth. Lovely looking place to and helpful staff.
Best bread, old receptur. Jak w najlepszych polskich piekarniach. ChrupiƒÖca sk√≥rka,, zapach m≈Çodo≈õci.

Venu gr√¢ce √† TA, j'ai n'ai pas √©t√© d√©√ßu: j'ai demand√© un cinnamon bun, il paraissait qu'ils n'avaient plus, mais ils ont trouv√© et donn√© deux pour le prix d'un! Vraiment commercial et sympa. Pour 2¬£ il √©tait √©norme et tr√®s bon. Ensuite leur cappuccino pour 2.5¬£ √©tait aussi excellent.

We had our works Christmas party here this year and it was an amazing and unique night, wouldn't of had the same experience any where else. The food platters were delicious and everything was freshly made for the evening. The pizza was the best I've tasted in a restaurant. Great quality food for an amazing price , I would of paid double for the evening we had ! Bring your own bottles also contributed towards a great night !

Heard about this bakery from Treby Arms where Owen Laughton used to work, so we had to pay a visit. The bakery now supplies Treby with bread. We bought croissants, bread, pain au chocolat, eccles cake and bakewell tart to take home with us following a brief visit to Plymouth.  All that we bought was fantastic and the croissant was the best I have ever tasted, along with the eccles cake.  Prices reflect the quality of the baked goods.  We will definitely visit again when we are next in Plymouth and will try the breakfasts next time! I wish the family every success with the bakery which has a lot of history dating back to the 1620's.

A very friendly welcome. We wanted a pasty, it was late in the afternoon and they only had 'Christmas' pasties, i.e. Turkey and cranberry, so that is what we went for (despite it being November and Christmas not starting yet!!) and it was DELICIOUS! Followed up with a slice of Blackberry Bakewell Tart which was also amazing. All of which was good value. Highly recommended.

We love the Sourdough bread baked here. You really must try it. 

Jacka's sourdough beats what I was so used to when I lived in San Francisco. We love it with soup
Staff, food, coffee, atmosphere are all top quality. Was introduced to their  pizza and it was fantastic will be going back soon.

I love bread; good bread, cakes, pastries made and baked well. The Jacka Bakery is up there, in my top 5. The Cinnamon Swirls are to die for and then there was; Chocolate Brownies, Sourdough Bread, White Chocolate and Raspberry Cake, Coffee and Walnut Cake, Eccles Cake, Cherry Blackwell Flapjack. Er, yes - I remember everything that was in the shop window and no, I just couldn't have everything but it all looked wonderful as I tucked into my Cinnamon Swirl. Oh - they do do breakfasts also but I was on strict instructions, light breakfast only (sigh)!!
Breakfast cooked to order in the small kitchen in the bakery. The breads were amazing - had a pain au chocolat the size of a small loaf but soft throughout. Delicious and highly recommended!
The absolute best cinnamon buns I've ever eaten in my LIFE. The staff are wonderful and its just such a lovely small family bakery. I literally go here every Sunday, could not recommend it more.

Simple pasty but with delightful French buttery pastry gave this traditional Devon pasty a unique continental touch. Great ingredients!...followed by a northern  Eccles cake a la Francais, oozing with butter. Took one home along with a sour dough loaf which I can't wait to eat at tomorrows breakfast!!

We popped in here on Monday, tempted by the array of lovely breads and bakes in the window.  A cold, rainy day in Plymouth had sharpened our appetites, so this Cafe and Bakery was a welcome find.

My partner chose a Sourdough Baguette and an Almond Slice.  I settled for a huge Cinnamon Bun and a Fruity Flapjack.

The baguette was rustic and full of rich, sourdough flavour. The Almond Slice was rich and buttery with just the right combination of almond frangipane and crisp pastry.

My Cinnamon Bun was a giant swirly-whirly pillow of soft, silky layers and fragrant cinnamon sugar.  Absolutely delicious! 

The flapjack was also very generously sized.  It was sweet and syrupy without being cloying or sickly.  It was packed with fruit and coconut chips and had a perfect texture.  It had just the right amount of chew, without being a tooth-breaker!

A further bonus ‚Äì the Flapjack kept really well in the cake tin for 2 days.  After the super-sized Cinnamon Bun, I couldn‚Äôt justify eating a Flapjack as well!

This is a quality establishment offering lovely breads and bakes of very generous size.  I look forward to visiting again to try coffee and lunch.

We visited mid-afternoon a couple of weekends ago for coffee and babycinos with our girls, based on recommendations from TA, and we weren't disappointed - the coffee was spot on, and coming from Melbourne we know good coffee when we find it! A tiny shop with only 3/4 tables, but comfortable. We grabbed a loaf of sourdough to take home, it was ok but not up there with the best we've tasted. Service was a little abrasive, not the friendliest welcome but I can't fault his barista skills. Will definitely visit again for the coffee!

I, luckily, visited here just as they brought the pastries out of the oven. The smell was amazing and they sausage rolls I bought were the nicest I have ever had. They have a selection of breads that sound mouthwatering too.

This really is an amazing bakery and their food in or to go is wonderful.  It is actually worthy of a Michelin star I reckon - the bread that is.

Eaten all @ the world in some of the best restaurants and that is the best bread I have ever had.  I will now go every trip to Plymouth and while I'm there get another bottle of the full strength gin from the distillery round the corner - another world beater.

Was visiting the Barbican area and was looking for somewhere for breakfast on a Sunday morning. We were very lucky to get a table as it is pretty small inside with a couple of tables outside, which were occupied on a sunny October morning. Wonderful window display of breads and cakes, all to tempt you inside. I had mushrooms in tarragon on sourdough toast, with a fried egg on top and my partner had the small breakfast which was served with a cup of tea. I had a lovely latte. Staff very friendly. Just had to buy a sourdough loaf which I have to report was lovely and what little that was left after a couple of days was delicious toasted. Will return soon to try more bread. Have my eye on the large cinnamon buns!
Best bread and cake selection for miles around, great coffee and hot food too, it's very difficult to resist this place.
Beard very very nice , Cake very nice ,too . Service not impress . Chai tea latte so nice . The cafe was too busy , good for takeaway .

Really impressive artisan bakery, with an amazing range of huge loaves & variety of breads... plus super-fab pastries.
Bought two loaves that lasted us ages whilst we were on our Cornish holiday !
Also bought giant eccles cakes and cinnamon buns (yum), which were disappearing fast from the shelves - considering we were there promptly for the 9am opening) ...not many left by 9.30 - the locals were coming in and buying them all!
Its a very popular bakery... however the breakfasts were a little bit greasy and we were shocked when the chef refused to cook poached eggs for our full english breakfast... and insisted we had to have fried!?
...even though there is a poached eggs on toast option on the menu?

The waiter apologised and thought the chef was having a wobbly!!
It was all a bit weird.
Everything was OK - just a bit too oily.....mostly fried items.

Anyway we enjoyed our time at the Bakery, as the atmosphere & surroundings were great. Staff were lovely and really accommodating (not the chef), our coffees great.
Breakfasts just a bit too greasy!

Not a restaurant but a bakery with some tables. But, boy, the quality is good. Two small outside tables, next to busy but slow-moving traffic, several tables inside. The bread and other bakery items are just great. Staff are helpful and there's even a water bowl for dogs outside.

Review Title: The perfect evening at a private function
Review Text: One of my best friends organised an engagement party this weekend for me and my fianc√© at Jacka Bakery. I didn't not know this was possible, but they booked out the venue for a fee and they staff allowed them to add decorations and small additions to make it look beautiful, then also stayed, and for ¬£10 each, cooked us the most amazing pizzas. We had a choice of three and all went down a treat! The staff themselves were so welcoming, and made the event great, being on hand in general as well as serving the food, taking coffee orders, and ready to clean up at the end. They also allow the Bring Your Own Booze policy which makes it feel so much more personal, and we also brought our own cakes and brownies. It is small so a group of 15 was perfect, a few more would have worked but over 20 would be a squeeze. We honest had such a great time, we are already looking for an excuse to do this all over again! Amazing!!!
The coffee is first class as is the on site baked bread. I had a breakfast and the smoked beans on toast were really good and very different to your average.
We love this place... The only place in Plymouth worth the money... Go early though because they run out of food early in the afternoon... Yes... ƒ∞t's that good üòÉ

.......ever! Crisp pastry, awesome filling and loads of it. 
¬£3 for a medium pasty (it's huge). Looking forward to visiting again and bringing some more savoury goodness back to Wales.

Review Title: The Greatest Place To Eat In Plymouth
Review Text: This is the best place to have a fabulous breakfast. We have tried a few other restaurants but this is the BEST. I haven't eaten a bread like for a long time (my grand mother was making the bread similar with this one)

Used to call in years ago for their pocket size Malt loafs (awesome).....Just been re introduced to it...... Very small cafe but great coffee .The Mushrooms on Toast are the best and try and get a Side of their homemade Bake Beans in a bbq sauce :-) .... Cooked from fresh so dont be in a hurry......A must Visit and Great Bread & Fancies

I have lived in Plymouth for all of my fifty plus years and Jacka's bakery has been the same since my childhood. The original oven reputedly dates back centuries, but is now in disrepair. 

However, the current staff and owners are committed to doing something 'different', if not unique in producing traditional breads.

The pasties they produce are the best I have ever tasted, but consequently sell out quickly. So, if you want pasties then order in advance. 

There is seating inside and outside for tea and small meals, which are upmarket and popular.

The baker has also kindly agreed to look into the possibility of producing authentic biblical bread of the type used at the Last Supper. Apparently, the bread produced at present is of a type dating back to ancient Egypt!

We found this cafe by mistake on a walk about and the bread and cakes in the window was so attractive it invited exploration. Having tried a coffee, it was one of the best we had tried with a great barista producing excellent coffee and chocolate. The cakes all made in house were large and easily shared, the bread was inviting and had to be purchased if you can buy before it disappears from the shelves along with the pain Au chocolate and croissants.

We stopped by here to have lunch, I shared a sourdough sandwich with my son which had a huge side salad dressed in a lovely balsamic dressing. The tomatoes were incredibly sweet. My husband had the ploughmans which had all sorts of lovely treats. You do need to wait a while, but the wait is definitely worthwhile. We were totally stuffed after our lunch, their prices are very reasonable too. We did have to have a pain au chocolate to walk around with afterwards. Having tasted lots of pain au chocolate in France as well as home. I have to say Jacka's is one of the best that I have tasted. I didn't want to give this review as Jacka Bakery might get too busy but I think the secrets out alreadyüòã

Just dropped in for the smashed avocado and poached egg for lunch. It was wonderful and I will be back. 
If you want bread you need to be early as almost everything was sold before 1300 today.

Visited Wednesday morning after British fireworks evening.  Arrived about ten and shelves were already getting empty, only one croissant left and seven pain au chocolates.  Ordered one each and by the time we had sat at one of the three tables the rest had been snapped up. ¬£2 per croissant but they were the size of two tesco ones and absolutely delicious.  Latte was one of the nicest I've had for a while and the guy serving very friendly.  In the short time we were there they sold all their remaining brown loaves  and only one white remaining.  They were cooking pasties for lunch which sounded nice too.  Great artisan sour dough bread which is very popular with locals and the visiting yachting folk.  If you want to try them get there early as I think they sell out quickly.  Closed on Tuesday.

Review Title: Fantastic bakery and (surprised) the best coffee in Plymouth
Review Text:
One look in the window tells you the quality of this place. Just fantastic bread, cakes and savouries.

However, don't just take-away, go in for breakfast. Their cooked food and hot drinks keep up that high  standard.

So friendly and helpful too.

A la question qui se pose pour chaque voilier desirant avoir du pain a bord et bien cette bakery la plus ancienne du port de Plymouth est la bonne r√©ponse.
En plus du vrai pain, les pasties (tourte a la viande) constituent un repas de choix pour les voyageurs sous voiles.

All I ask is that I can find places to eat and shop which are operated and staffed by people who are passionate about what they do. They are here and it really shows. Thoughtfully made coffees - not churned out by some under-trained "barista" wearing a corporate tee shirt - served by friendly staff happy to chat about what they do, fantastic breads (although admittedly most had sold out by the time I arrived which is testament to how good they are!) and soothing folky sounds provided by John Martyn in their tiny, intimate shop front. 

This is the model for others to follow. Please everyone, stop wasting your money on less than mediocre products pedalled by giant corporates solely interested in prizing as much of your hard earned cash from you as possible. Let's put the focus back on quality, service and HONEST pricing, not on profit margin and satisfying greedy managers and shareholders. 

Apologies for this becoming a bit ranty! I know this is not the place - but it reinforces his good places like this are. Thank you Jacka Bakery for enhancing my day and bringing out the sunshine in my mind on this otherwise grey Plymouth Saturday.

Review Title: One of three good bakeries in Plymouth
Review Text:
Jackas, the Devonport Column Bakery and the Royal William Yard bakery are the only three good Plymouth bakeries that I know. I would happily buy bread in any of them. 

Jackas is in the Barbican and has a very small cafe (a couple of tables) which I have not tried. Their bread is very tasty and varied. I'd strongly recommend it. Their Eccles cakes look good ... I ought to try one...

I always call in here with my dog , for an excellent coffee and snack I like the toasts with tomatoes ,the cakes are delicious and the bread is out of this world!!!!!! but you have to be quick because they sell out fast, the staff are really  friendly I cant find fault with this bakery they make different cakes I had the gingerbread it was the best I have ever tasted !!!!! they have a new snack menu now well worth trying.
Without a doubt the best Cornish pasty I've ever eaten. The pastry is crunchy, salty, and melts in your mouth. And the filling is superb.

I visited the bakery for a quick snack whilst on the Barbican for a walk with my 6 month old baby. It wasn't my first visit and certainly won't be my last. There was a mix up with my order which was rectified with excellent customer service and my three cheese on toast when it arrived was delicious and the salad was beautiful. I was treated to a piece of lemon polenta cake by way of an apology for the mix up and the wait for my order (unnecessary as I was happy to wait but a great gesture all the same) 
My husband visited whilst I was doing race for life this Sunday too and had coffee and a cinnamon bun. Also delicious apparently 
A real little gem of a place
The bread is great too! I'd recommend reserving a loaf to avoid disappointment

First of all well done! its exteramly pleasing to see an independant business doing so well and judging on the reviews here im not the only person to think the same.

The bread is fantastic and the pastries are worth every penny and more.

There is no question where my favourite bakers in plymouth let alone the UK is and next time I'm down...I'll be back!

I've been to Jacka Bakery a couple of times, either to have breakfast or to buy some baked goods. The place is small but it's really worth it, the loaves and baguettes are lovely, and the sweet pastries are amazing, soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. My absolute favourite is the huge cinnamon bun!

Lovely brunch here, watched the weekly flour delivery come in and local businesses come for their bread. Excellent  coffee and the rarebit was delicious. Have previously bought cakes from here as well which were equally superb.

I started using Jacka bakery last year and am never disappointed with the quality and flavour of the loaves and cakes.  I'm obviously not the only one who thinks so as I have turned up in the early afternoon and almost everything has gone. . I now make sure I'm there at 9am.
A fantastic bakery to match and surpass any that I have used in France.

Review Title: Delightful bakery with small seating area
Review Text: Jacka Bakery has had a place in Plymouth's historic Barbican area for centuries serving cakes and pasties to take away.   A change of owners has revolutionised the 'shop' which now has seating for approximately 10 diners.   The bread is baked on the premises and is absolutely the nicest tasting bread I have ever enjoyed.  I have only had lunch, not being 'an early bird' to enjoy breakfast and the bread element features heavily on the menu together with pizzas.  The fillings for sandwiches and toasties are quite unusual ( toasted sourdough bread with 3 cheeses and fresh chilliest is my current favourite).   The cakes are huge .... needing taking away for later enjoyment.  Coffee is hot and the staff are friendly, polite and helpful.  My only reservation is that positive comments (very well deserved) will lead to more customers and may result in my not finding a seat!   Incidentally Jacka is closed Tuesday.

Review Title: A tiny but amazing and one of the most delicious bakery
Review Text:
The service is very good, the atmosphere is lovely and the food was excellent.
We definitely will visit more often. Than you *****

After arriving in Plymouth on Easter Monday we went for a walk down to the Barbican to check out where Jacka Bakery was as we knew it would be closed but we wanted to be able to go straight to it the next morning. Trip advisor had highly rated it as a must and as it was the oldest bakery in England we knew we would be in for a treat.The sign on the door said it was closed until Wednesday. So bright & early Wednesday morning we all arrived down to the Barbican and we really were not dissapointed. The smell when we walked in was heavenly and all the fresh crossiants, Eccles cakes, cinnamon buns, pain au chocolat and various sour dough breads were placed in the Window ready to choose from. The place never emptied with people calling in and as soon as things were took off the shelves more items were replaced. The staff were extremely friendly and the coffee along with the pain au chocolat was to die for. I highly recommend this as a must whilst visiting Plymouth.

We were in Plymouth for a quick visit while on holiday.  We spotted Jacka Bakery when looking for somewhere to eat lunch.  We ordered the Welsh Rarebit, a veggie calzone and the tomatoes on toast.  It was all totally delicious. I had a cinnamon roll with coffee afterwards, and it was the best I have ever had.  I would have taken some away too, but they all sold out while we were there.  The staff were great, and the interior is really well done.  The ONLY very slight negative is that it isn't big enough, but there's nothing they can do to change this, so I've still given it a 5 star rating.  We were sat by the door which was a bit chilly as the weather was so bad, but it was well worth it. Great staff too.
Best hot crossed bun I've ever had, and brilliant coffee too. Would have loved to have tried their bread too, but all 50 loaves had sold out by 11am and I'm not surprised. Great place.

As others have recorded, a great find.
