Although limited sitting area for a snack, which in hindsight encourages inter action with others enjoying their culinary fares (all produced to order) Good standard of coffee. If your tempted to purchase, form the window bread range, buy it when you see it. (Foolishly I thought I'd collect after business meeting - wrong decision- returned to see they had sold out - I'm certain if I'd ask them to keep for me, they would have) . Delighted, French customer, was making enquires regarding a bread purchase, staff member conversd in French, if only other British retailers offered such service! (Excellente)

We didn't know the reputation of this place at all. Until we read that it is the oldest working bakery in UK, period. The new owners are cool. We came one time and all were sold out, that is impressive. The selections are good, my wife likes baking and she was impressed. Need I say more.

Visited Plymouth Hoe and had a very enjoyable walk with my partner and the dogs. We had seen the reviews on Jackas, so decided to see if we could have lunch there. What a fantastic decision that was. The staff are so friendly, there was a warming feeling as soon as my coffee arrived (I was cold from the walk). I ordered a Calzone, meatballs and pepperoni (as good as one I had in Barcelona some years ago and haven't found one decent enough to compare to that experience until now), my partner a Croque Monseur. We were both a little concerned when they arrived, as the portion size seemed a little bit large. Both items were shared and somehow we managed to finish them together with the lovely salad that accompanies them, simply because they were delicious. We were so impressed, that more coffee was purchased and to take away for later on our trip, pasties (simply the best I have ever had), an Eccles cake that is utterly rich and melts in your mouth and lemon curd slices that are zingy and scrummy. Shame I live in Birmingham, because if I lived in Plymouth, I would have to own a pack of hounds to remove the extra calories I would consume as Jackas would easily become a weekly visit. Well done to the bakers and staff. Truly wonderful

Tempted by the cakes in the window as we wandered past Jacka, we decided on a whim to pop in. Had coffee, bakewell slice and chocolate brownie. Cakes were heavenly- perfect flavours and textures and a snip at ¬£2 per massive slice. Excellent coffee and lovely staff. Probably a good thing for our waistlines that we don't live any closer!!

Went there for breakfast and had a croque monsieur which was delicious. Everything in this bakery looks wonderfull. I also had some kind of lemon curd bar, which I regret not getting a second time.  Delicious.
finding somewhere that serves a good espresso is not always easy but they do a top notch one here and the food is cooked to order rather than pre prepared - very friendly service

Review Title: Kindness from staff on a rainy day
Review Text: Thank you so much for the kindness of the staff at Jacka. Basically I had ordered the amazing Margarita Pizza from Jacka's menu. When I realized my mum and I were running out of time with the car parking above in the fort car park. We had only put in ¬£1.50 because we had no cash on us. So I ran back up to the car park and the machine would not accept cards. It had broken down. I rang up the authority and asked them to at least mend the machine for other users. Of course they don't care about whether you cant use the machine. If you are over the time , they will fine you. Anyway. I ran back down to the cafe, feeling stressed, hungry, my elderly mother on her own. The cafe gave me ¬£1.50 to pay the machine. I offered a larger note so they were compensated and they refused. They chatted and were very kind to my mother. More to the point, the food was lovely and I will recommend this to all my friends and family. I left change in their tips jar afterwards, as I will not take advantage of good service and good quality food.

Review Title: Great coffee and bakery treats: brilliant, quaint caf√©
Review Text: Jacka Bakery is a brilliant small caf√© that may cater either a couple, or small group. The staff are always warm and inviting, the coffee is great, and the bakery treats are irresistible. Although there is limited space, Jacka is my favourite spot.

AND WOW! 

I'd come back to Plymouth just to sample some of the food on the menu, we just had coffee and cake which was fantastic but there were a few people eating and the food looked absolutely amazing. I was even tempted to cancel our already booked table elsewhere (wish I had it was shocking *rc!* ) the menu looked brilliant and the bread on display for purchase looked exactly how bread should look. Hats off guys we will be back for food one day. Just a shame it's such a tiny place, reckon they could do very well indeed.

Review Title: Menu little use if you don't eat cheese.
Review Text: Came in today hoping to try the daytime eat in menu but with the exception of the soup of the day there seemed to be no choice that didn't include cheese. My partner cannot eat cheese so sadly she needed to get her lunch elsewhere. Great pity because everything else they sell here is exemplary and tasty, unrivalled locally.

We've been there a few times and both eaten in the bakery and had a takeaway. The food is absolutely delicious and is obviously made to order as it tastes so fresh and flavoursome. The loaves of bread to buy are gorgeous as well, to look at, smell and eat! The service is good but not fast but that's because it's all made on the spot. Good value for money as well. Definitely a must visit if you're in the Barbican.

Lovely feel, great coffee, welcoming staff, and fab sourdough.

The staff even give you baking tips if you ask nicely.

Oh and if they've run out of pasties don't just walk out, try something else and expand your bakery horizons...it's all good!!!

Called in whilst having a stroll around the Barbican and bought an eccles cake which was superb. Really flakey pastry and packed with fruit. The artisan breads looked great and we promised we would take some away next time we visit.

We loveThe Food and coffee here and the staff are so friendly and helpful .
when we can we visit the coffee and croissants are delicious....!!!!!!

We popped in for a hot drink and a croissant before a long coastal walk from Plymouth to Newton Ferrers and it was a wonderful experience. The croissant was huge and flakey, it felt like a little hideyhole of glorious hand made breads. Simply lovely.

Visited Jacka Bakery for breakfast. Toasted sourdough (baked on the premises) topped with saut√©ed wild mushrooms and fried egg! Sublime, especially with fresh coffee and warm croissant. Took away sourdough Eccles cake- best I've ever tasted. Mmmm Mmmm.

Not eaten in here but as a local resident this charming little traditional (with a modern twist) bakery is a regular jaunt for us.  They bake and serve the most deliciously tantalising breads and pastries all baked on the premises.  How lucky are we.  My sons who were home from trendy Fulham visited to. Buy goodies to celebrate my recent birthday brunch and all I can say is they were very very Impressed by the beautiful range of sour dough breads on offer and the delicious and very large croissants and pain au chocolat amongst other desirable treats that they served up at the brunch.  They also said what an amazing cup of coffee they bought whilst they waited for their purchases.  Even the dog doesn't miss out they bake fresh every day including dog biscuits.  I would like to wish the new proprietors well with this venture and hope they are here for a very long time to come.
Just love the doughnuts from here. They are a more bread like yeaty taste and different texture to others, more home made.
as a regular visitor to the barbican over the last 40 years I can say whatever  you want either sweet or savory Jackas  is must always freshly baked

been here a few times now never been disappointed! good ingredients and food small but friendly atmosphere and clean organised place! Bread is fantastic pizzas are great hope your hungry portions are good and its all proper hand made and heritage sourdough ingredients! Highly recommend!

Family run bakery.... in fact the oldest bakery in the UK. Jacka Bakery sells freshly baked on the site Sourdough bread which is wonderful and crusty. 

Plymouth's Pilgrim family often pop in here for cakes and coffee.

Wonderful coffee.
Was so pleased to find this place in the Barbican after an earlier experience of dish water coffee at another cafe! 
Grateful that people are serious about coffee and treat it with respect.
The bread was magnificent too!

By far the best coffee in Plymouth! An amazing little place the food is to die for! My friend and I could not make up our minds what to have so we shared a bit of everything, mushrooms on toast, cinnamon bun, eccles cake and then they brought out their pasties so  . . . would have been rude not to try one of those! All washed down with the best coffee I have had in plymouth, none of this sugary syrup rubbish just good wholesome coffee! Can't wait to see what they do for christmas!

Review Title: The go-to place for coffee in Plymouth...
Review Text:
Finally Plymouth gets a coffee venue which is truly standout, everything here is so well done - the communal table is perfect for the size of the bakery & joining others enjoying their morning coffee is great. 

The baked goods on offer look outstanding, I tried the cinnamon bun & it was delicious - the coffee is great and being able to watch the guys at work in the bakery is really nice. 

The lunch and pizza menus sound delicious, so can't wait to go back & try them out.

Review Title: Morning coffee and a yummy cake!
Review Text: Lovely little find.  Had the best Eccles cake I have ever eaten and took some croissants home and they were fab.  Only in Plymouth for the weekend otherwise would have tried the sourdough pizzas on offer - flavour combinations looked delicious!

Couldn't even try to resist the huge, fluffy pain au chocolat displayed in the window - we were early-ish so managed to perch on the end of the large table in the front of the bakery  and enjoy our coffee & patisserie while watching the busy bread making going on for the day ahead. Busy place with lots people popping in for loaves and lovely treats, local & tourists. After a wet, windy walk around Plymouth, past numerous other eateries we ended up back here mid afternoon and got two amazing sandwiches - hot pressed buffalo chicken and cheese plus two strawberry and white chocolate flapjacks!! (we had the flapjacks for breakfast the next day) ..... Lovely place, lovely staff and amazing food, perfect :)

Review Title: Il miglior pane del Regno Unito!!
Review Text: Se capitate a Plymouth andate da Jacka, il servizio √® eccezionale ed il cibo buonissimo! Provate anche i loro meravigliosi dolci!!

Sour dough baguette was delicious! Not fast food -  you may have to wait a minute or two for it, but it's delicious and worth a wait. Very friendly service and a small place to eat in or out or there's the Barbican... They have a lot of competition within a 100 yards but please give this little bakery a try: they're happy & passionate about what they do and so will you when you've eaten there.

Review Title: National bread award but mindless council morning parking restrictions!!
Review Text:
Firstly congratulations to Baker Laughton on his gold award for the Country loaf. Jacka's is a great new local business that is impressing and proving itself over and over again.

It is attracting regular trade but few of us live within convenient walking or working distance. We need to park, especially in the morning, to buy fresh bread, croissants etc. There is a parking bay just where it's needed right outside but as I discovered today to my swingeoning cost, the whole of Southside St is (and apparently has been for years) covered by a parking ban until 11am except for loading and unloading. No good for bakery customers! Be warned. And my traffic warden would not accept that stumbling in and out to buy armfuls of goodies was 'loading'.

Review Title: A Little Gem Not To Be Missed
Review Text:
Called in by chance upon seeing the gorgeous breads in the window. A delightful bakery with a small cafe at the front of the shop and some pavement tables. Delicious sour dough pizza, the best I've tasted in the UK, and real sour dough doorstep sandwiches.
A real bonus was the delicious unlimited filter coffee topped off with brownies and flapjacks.
Couldn't leave without a large loaf!

Review Title: The best bread in the UK!
Review Text: The best bread in the UK!!! Also they have a little cafe where you can drink very good coffee and eat one of theirs lovely cake. They also have no flour options so something for everyone - health freaks, and sugar lovers :)

I used to buy pasties as a child going up to the Sailing School and when I married moved to Scotland.  I was thrilled and delighted on a return 30 years later to find the same bakery making the same delicious pasties and bread.  I am coming home again to live in three years time and will be the first person through the door to buy wonderful products not least is the Jaka Pasty.  Thank you for making my child hood so special and continuing to ensure my retirement is perfect too. .
Best coffee and bread in town. Great staff with a real passion for their art of bread making. This is a real Plymouth gem you would be fool to miss out.

My friend and I went their just to see what it was like very impressed, the staff are very friendly the bread is amazing and so nice.  One loaf is to much so they will cut it in half for you their is not a bad word I can say they are lovely people and food.  I will go back again all was lovely.

A really genuine  historical bakery, although now part of a small local bakery company. They sell the usual range of production line pasties (Devonshire) plus savouries and a fair selection of pastries and cakes. Good quality value for money.
Mainly a bakery with great bread. Now have added a few indoor tables and an outdoor patio area.  Small menu and now also does pizzas.
Visited the other day and the bread is superb and the staff very helpful. Great range of bakery products and coffee as well if you need it
Popped in to buy a pasty which although a little pricey and not too large was absolutely delicious!! The pastry the best ever tasted . Need to check out their bread next

Recently refurbished and if it's half as good as before you are all in for a great. Situated on Plymouth's historic Barbican and the bakery with the oldest working oven in the town, maybe even further afield. They used to do Nelson Squares (if you're a janner you'll know what I mean) and if they still do, try one, they are the best. Well worth chomping on a pasty from here whilst walking and taking in the views.

Been to the Jacka a few times now mainly for the good coffee and the relaxed atmosphere with the guys behind the counter.   Ollie knows his coffee and is passionate about it and Owen is a true baker who produces outstanding variety of bread.  And the cake is outstanding too with the coffee.

Review Title: By appt to Treeby Arms, Catch 22 and more, not bad for starters!
Review Text: A new business, well established, reaching the highest standards and impressing many including leading local businesses with the quality of its bakery.

Cannot praise this place enough. After visiting for the first time today, we were greeted with big smiles from the friendly and cheery staff as we took our seats at the one and only large table. Myself and my friend ordered the Sourdough Pizza's, whilst his girlfriend and my girlfriend both had the grilled sandwiches. We werent kept waiting too long before our food came out, and every one of our meals looked absolutely fantastic. I had pepperoni and jalepenos on my pizza, and it was hands down the best pizza that Ive ever had the pleasure of putting into my mouth. I also had a Nicaraguan coffee, which was also very tasty. At ¬£6.50 for this pizza, and only around ¬£2 for the coffee, the quality of the food and drink astounded me, and we will definitely be returning

Jacka is a really good bakery and just what the Barbican needs. We have really enjoyed the artisan breads made here that include perfect baguettes with great open texture and authentic flavour.

The bakery also offers filled rolls, hot pressed sandwiches and croque-monsieurs.

We are delighted that the Barbican now has a proper bakery and will be popping back regularly!

Review Title: Best granary bread in Britain! Do gluten free too (not the granary, sadly)
Review Text: This small historic bakery in the Barbican in Plymouth must have the best granary bread in Britain. I haven't tasted such a good loaf since 1974 when I used to buy bread from a bakers in Topsham, Devon, who had actually won the award! Lovely staff and they bake gluten free bread to order ... the gluten free banana and coconut cake was delicious and a change from the usual chocolate brownie or citrus polenta cake that's more widely available

Review Title: A hidden gem disguised as a bakery!
Review Text:
I have often driven passed this small fronted bakery. Well known locally for its breads etc. It had a good reputation and had recently been taken over by a new family - would it be as good?
I was more than impressed when dashing in with a colleague to be greeted by the fantastic aroma of coffee, breads of all descriptions and a new welcoming layout to sit and ponder over the choices.
 Unable to choose, I left it to Carly - whose cheerful manner and welcome made it comfortable and relaxing to just sit back, relax and enjoy the 30 mins lunchbreak we had! Coffe and a spicey chicken "toasted"sourdough sandwich with a mix of salads, dressings etc was presented and thoroughly enjoyed. 
Unable to finish the generous portions, I had my leftovers wrapped and ready to take away.
I am looking forward to my next visit which will have me trying the pizza and purchasing some of the speciality breads

Review Title: Excellent progress from a standing start.
Review Text:
I am very pleased at the early success of this business. For a long time we had felt it was a great pity the preceding owners had let it run down in a bland uninspiring way. The family who have taken it over have thrown their all into the venture, and have increased the staff, the range and the developed not only the retail trade but also started selling to local caterers. I come in regularly, it is always friendly and helpful and they remember faces. My only disappointment is when even late morning they have often sold out of what were probably big stocks of eg baguettes and other loaves. I suppose that that is par for the course even with large scale operations. I think it's a pity they don't have the cover to open on Tuesdays. I hope that they manage to further extend the shelving at the front to include more of the stock. I look forward to news of the viability survey and perhaps recommissioning of the old oven at the back. I think the next challenge here will be whether these delightful and historical premises can remain big enough for a business that seems destined to thrive and expand. Someone ought to talk to the council to see whether the parking bay outside could be limited to say 15m. Although we can walk over from QAB lots of customers must find it almost impossible to find a place to stop and come in to buy fresh daily bread etc. The Barbican needs to treasure first rate businesses in amongst the vast amount of tourist tat. The recent arrival of the freshly cooked fish counter on The Quay is up there with Jacka's. I hope the council and local traders representatives recognise this enlightenment and encourage it.

It is a bit odd that Jacka Bakery is hidden amongst the specialist listings just as a bakery. Although it is also a small cafe it probably ought to appear also on the restaurant and coffee shop lists.

Review Title: Absolutely outstanding croissant and pain au chocolat
Review Text: After returning from Brittany, I was badly missing French patisserie, only to find, in Plymouth some outstanding croissant and pain au chocolat at Jacka Bakery. Not only did the glorious menu live up to (if not exceed) the French equivalent, but the service was warm, friendly and welcoming. My son had the scrambled egg and smoked salmon croissant - delicieux!

Went along to Jacka's to buy some of their magnificent bread and ended up staying for a quick lunch. Had an absolutely stunning pizza - easily the best I've had in Plymouth and one of the best I've had anywhere. Followed by a lovely little 'pastel de nata' or Portuguese custard tart.

Jacka's really are going from strength to strength and were already good at the outset. If this is a part of new Plymouth then bring it on and plenty of it. A great example of how a small business can beat even a well run chain hands down with their attention to deal and their passion for what they are doing.

Review Title: Doing well, and now lunch pizzas.
Review Text: Very pleased that Jacka's seems to be finding its feet and gaining popularity and confidence. And now they do pizza. Not apparently because they are not doing well out of the excellent artisan baking but rather because pizza fits with the premises and the oven. They have table furniture inside, not sure if there are pizzas to take away.

Review Title: Potions bigger than expected and reasonable price
Review Text: Delicious sourdough toasties and croque Monsieur. Pizza would have been better if we had ordered additional toppings. Large portions and reasonable price. Food and 2 drinks only 20 pounds! Fresh ingredients, will visit again to try other baking.

Thanks Suzanne and family for a lovely lunch with Sue yesterday - the beetroot salad was to die for!  Husband is in heaven over the rye loaf I brought back for him! Hope to visit again when I'm back in Plymouth xx

My friend and I met for lunch at Jacka Bakery today & enjoyed a lovely fresh lunch of warm beetroot salad with goats cheese. My friend in particular was delighted as having asked for a gluten free lunch, staff were most helpful & made adaptations to the meal. Very good value & quality food, on Plymouths historic Barbican. We also purchased delicious bread & pastries baked on the premises. Would really recommend this revitalised bakery!

Gorgeous bread, exceptional pasties, delicious croissants! 
So happy to see this bakery open in Plymouth's barbican :) 
Really helpful pleasant staff in a handsome little old building in a great location. 
Lucky enough to live nearby so I can eventually try everything :)

Review Title: A real traditional bakers with added twists...
Review Text: This place has got a new lease of life with Owen a young enthusiastic baker with a load of ideas. The pasties are to die for and the introduction of Nelson Square was a right blast from the past. Also the Eccles cakes are super. I like it for a coffee and a treat. Good place to visit.

I was waiting for a friend (who had bumped into friends) outside the Jacka in the evening when the owner saw us waiting and came out to give us free cakes!  Can't wait to go back and buy some more lovely cakes :-)

I was walking about the Barbican & peered through the window, really liked the new style of this very old bakery. The coffee is super tasty, I had a flat white and it was perfect. The cakes in the window also look brilliant... though I will say even at 1300 they were running low! This place is small & popular, you need to be quick. From what I heard the Eccles cake is the one to go for!

We visited on a wet Monday morning in July and had hand made croissants ,jam and coffees at a leisurely pace .Proper comfort food in warm and friendly surroundings.Friendly staff and business owner.Highly recommended
Good bread great place to get in the morning. Of course this is when it was not sold out as it is very popular and we hit July the 4th in the UK in Plymouth so very popular holiday spot.

Dropped in Jacka Bakery on the Barbican,  as I heard the bread,  pasties and cakes are brilliant. Unfortunately all the bread had sold out,  a testament to how good and popular it must be.  We managed to grab a couple of pasties and 2 cakes,  a lemon curd tray bake and a white chocolate and raspberry flapjack. 
Pasty was excellent,  good sized pieces of meat,  no fat or chewy bits,  plenty of flavour. Shame they didn't have an extra large one! Both cakes were lovely and really delicious . Will definitely by back! 
Well worth a visit.

Read reviews and fancied Plymouth best pasty, pastry was flaky but burnt on bottom not Plymouth best but good. No tables so not even a cafe don't know why in restaurant section on trip Advisor.
Nice looking place and bread looked lovely.

Review Title: Make sure to visit when you come to Plymouth
Review Text:
Lovely Bread and delicious cakes

Went along this Saturday and was so impressed with all the goodies on offer. The bread is of course delicious and the cakes are divine. Glad to see that some are gluten free as well. 
Your hard work has paid off !

Lovely to see a family taking pride in what they do

So much more than just a bakery. Of course the bread is wonderful - our pecan and maple loaf was out of this world. But the bacon rolls in fresh muffins are the best in Plymouth, the chocolate brownies are rich, gooey and baked to perfection. All I'm going to say about the pasties is you just have to try one - the other posts give details of them and recommend them as highly as I do. They do great coffee too. 
Every time we return they've improved something and it's great to see their wares now displayed in the window too. Definitely one to try, it will be even better once they get permission for seating, but right now you can grab a coffee and a pastry or bacon roll and eat it while taking in the sights and sounds of The Barbican. 
A great new addition to this area - it must be the talk of Plymouth right now.

Review Title: Hurray! Plymouth has woken up to real bread!
Review Text: Cornwall has had artisan bakers for years now and I always wondered why the Barbican didn't have one. The sourdough is delicious. I want you to succeed very badly because people are easily satisfied with mediocre mass produced bread in the UK.  However please have a window display which will reach out and grab this untouched customer base. Hand written and correctly spelt labels in italic ink with a little humour would suggest quality and how about a 'Bread of the week'? Good luck guys you deserve to do well!

I bought a pasty intending to share it with my granddaughter, she had other ideas and ordered a sausage roll, leaving me to eat all of the pasty...... I am so glad as it was so delicious I did not want to share it once I tasted it! The pastry was light, flaky and tasty, and the filling was chunks of tender steak with perfectly cooked and seasoned vegetables. The sausage roll was declared by my granddaughter to be the best she had ever eaten. I also bought an enormous Eccles cake to take home for my husband which he said was also delicious. We will definitely be returning to try more of their wares.

Review Title: Good shot, I hope there's the demand.
Review Text: I like tasty bread, particularly sour dough. I welcome this new bakery. I just wonder whether there are enough Plymouth people to buy enough and keep it going. It would be good to see a brisk trade. I have stopped off in the lay by outside but if you do not live or work within walking distance, parking nearby can be difficult. They must do everything they can to make themselves known.

A buttery flakey crust a bit like on some Beef Wellingtons. Inside 3/4 or even 4/5s of the content was made up of big nearly inch cubes of very tender and tasty beef, moist from enough gravy, together with a two or three small cubes of potato and as many of something that was possibly swede/turnip/parsnip or sweet potato. All sensibly seasoned. A welcome hearty snack costing ¬£3 but not what I expected or would have called a pasty. Apparently there will also be a veggie option.

Review Title: Need to show off their wares!
Review Text: The bread and other products here are well made, tasty and good value. They look as good as they are. It's a pity that the artisan bakers have not yet found some way of displaying the bread etc somewhere that is easily visible to passers by. I came in because there was talk of the opening and I was not disappointed. But this was such a mundane middling boring bakery for so many years (until last week) that most people probably still walk by without even looking in. Perhaps the management could get some pictures on here and maybe Tripadvisor could also list this excellent little shop under 'Bakeries'?

Pleased that Jakka's has fallen into new and different hands. Only open about a week but a good simple collection of artisan bread and more. My baguette was still warm and very tasty. Now the Barbican (or even the city centre) needs a decent cheese shop.

Review Title: 5* for effort but please get it together.
Review Text:
Dearly want it to succeed but fear that they may be wavering. The bread is good as are the pastries. Yet to try the pasties. I fear the intent to turn it into a dinky slightly prissy cafe patisserie may distract from the USP which has to be the skilful reintroduction of artisan baking into the Barbican/city centre. Impressed by the first days' loaves we came back on Tuesday only to find the shop shut, a sad note scrawled on a piece of brown envelope stuck inside a window, 'Closed on Tuesdays'. Sounds permanent. What's that about then? Inside the customer area was full, almost to the ceiling with IKEA boxes. 

Please, please guys don't bungle an otherwise very promising start.

Always on the look out for good bread and bakery. Could never understand why Jakka's didn't take advantage of it's history and location. Now suddenly it's begun. Came in this weekend and delighted to see it.  Ot sure that they are pushing themselves hard enough to the public but the formula (which may need tweaking) is not bad. If they try to turn it into a dinky tea shop/patisserie then I doubt it will last but if they use the coffee croissants cake etc to coax peole in to buy bread then it may do well. Who knows they may manage it all? It would be great to come down to Plymouth and see a steady stream of people coming from the shop with armfulls of fine smelling warm bread. Get in there and try it. If you live in Devonport try the Column Bakehouse in the Kerr St guildhall basement. Bread can be so much better than the sliced or supermarket varieties.

Jakka's needs a website and some more pix on here

Review Title: Huge croissants and pain au chocolat.
Review Text: I had the choc pastry and it seemed the size of a child's pillow. Like the spirit of this newly opened place. Friendly staff anxious to be an affable part of the Barbican trade and community. They need to make a positive impact. Get something on to the street, A boards, tables or a wench out with baskets of samples. They need a website and more. What our their opening days and hours? They could even upgrade the owners details on Tripadvisor and get some photos, phone numbers etc. maybe get a multi listing, not just 'shopping' but also in 'cafes'. Get out there! Good luck to them.

Came in today to check out the newly reopened Jakka's bakery on the Barbican. It's very different from at least the last twenty odd years. They are baking here again. Apparently led by a couple of guys who had been baking at the Royal William Bakery who felt that the city needed a very good artisan bakery shop. Jakka's has been boring and basic for a long time but there is always some demand for pasties and bog standard sandwiches/rolls. The fresh idea seems to be to have a daily choice of three or four breads, some croissants and pain au chocolat together with some cakes and a couple of in your face coffee machines. I saw a lot of other enticing stuff on a board but you can only try so much in one go. I took home a big white country loaf that was excellent (approx ¬£3.50) and had a couple of the outsized pain au chocolat (¬£2.40). They also do full breakfasts for ¬£6.50 and sourdough English muffins with smoked bacon for ¬£3.50. It all looks quite interesting. They have put a counter a cross the long thin room and left space for some tables. Not sure whether there is space or they will be allowed to put some out on the pavement.  So far so good, I think it will do very well, especially if people get to hear about it.

I have been part of a small but growing informal unorganised group of enthusiasts who have for several years been pressing for what is claimed to be the country's oldest continuing commercial bakery, to be restored to full on artisan baking on site, preferably using the ancient oven built into the back wall. I can claim no credit. It has just been a communal yearning. But at last others, with skill and resources, are putting the dream into action. Within the next two weeks, roughly the spring bank holiday, the shop is reopening after restoration, as an artisan bakery (with speciality coffees !?) and although they will be using big electric ovens for the time being it seems thought is being given to whether the old oven can be effectively repaired and reccommissioned. I look forward to being amongst the first customers when we are back at QAB for the long weekend. I hope we soon see some new photographs on this thread and that the business can get a good website going or at least a Facebook page.

Review Title: Whoopee, reverting to artisan baking under new owners.
Review Text: Best news on the Barbican in years, Friary Mill industrial bland bakers have thrown in the towel and Jakka's has found delightful new owners working hard to reopen in time for the spring bank holiday as a specialist artisan bakery. Sadly they don't yet have the cash to repair the original wood fired oven at the rear because of expensive Robles with the brick lining but let's hope for the future. Slight pity that they haven't felt able to recreate the old Jakka signage and the new name letters look a bit twee and dinky but what matters is the quality of the bread and other goodies. The excellent Column Bakehouse under Devonport Guildhall will have to look to its laurels.
We tried a pasty in every town we visited in Cornwall and this was hands down the best. Great pastry, packed full of flavour. The smell of the fresh bread in the morning was unbelievable.

Every time we come down to Cornwall, we have pasties and we‚Äôve now had them from all over the place! Newquay, St Austell, Mevagissey, Port Isaac, Perranporth, Bude, Porthleven and more‚Ä¶ but NEVER had a traditional pasty like the one we had from here!! Will be coming pack to possibly do the deal where if you buy 10, you get 2 free!!! Enough to take home for all the family!!!üòÅthank you to the guy who served me today as well! Service with a smile never goes amiss!üòÉ

Our last night in Cornwall I thought I would treat us to a scone, jam & cream. 
With delicious Rhoddas clotted cream, Tiptree jam , I just needed the scones. 
Sadly they were salty, tasted of sodium bicarbonate and when we looked at the ingredients ..... Well palm oil did not fill us with glee! 
How disappointing.  Avoid the scones
Takeaway bakery.  Annual pilgrimage to Padstow leads us to Choughs for a beef and blue cheese pasty. Can't be beaten and we've had a lot of pasties over many years.

Visiting Padstow many times in our lifetime and really rating the Choughs pasty today we became very disappointed. They were our favorite pasty in Cornwall but not anymore..Found very little meat in the pasties bought this morning, more veg than anything else and considering the prices and value for money we rate them no more. In actual fact our favourite pasty in Cornwall is from Gear Farm which we had this week and are stunning.
Following profile for while, hoping to visit when in Cornwall. Visited yesterday and dont regret it :) good pastries, friendly staff, great location, highly recommended.
Chough bakery never disappoints when it comes to pasties, sandwiches and cakes. We dropped by for some pasties and one of their legendary date and oat slices and as usual the quality was outstanding.
On holiday with 3 generations of Family  for a week at Easter. Great Tasty  Pastry ideal for eating on the harbour. Happy Days

Lots of choice for the family apart from only one vegan option for those who are dairy free and it being Merlot and I think vegetables felt an odd choice but that was the only let down. The other members of the party had a delicious array of pasties from traditional Cornish to a blue cheese and steak which was apparently delicious. A wide selection of breads and cakes available too! It was very busy and popular with tourists due to them being on the harbour front but you can see why with the items being delicious.
Pasty Time!  Delicious, home made and so much better than the shops at the "walk of pasties" just at the back.   Very friendly and just right!

Best pastie I‚Äôve ever had. I went for the steak and ale one. Reheated wonderfully in the oven in only 20 minutes (bought at lunch for dinner). Also served hot if you want eat at time of buying just be cautious of seagulls.

Had the pleasure of popping into this little place today , cheerful lad on counter , really friendly. I treated myself to a mature cheese and onion pasty , gluten free as I‚Äôm coeliac. Cooked in its own bag and was handed over separately. It was so hot it was like carrying a little hot water bottle whilst it cooled down. 
Would defiantly stop by again if in the area.

Review Title: Riding on past glories....poor quality, go elsewhere
Review Text: so disappointed today...we had 5 medium pasties....the lad who served us...20's with buzz cut was delighted as he said that was the last so he could go home.   3 of the 5 were gristley and under seasoned.. I went back after and complained...not looking for refund just wanted to say how disappointed we were ...I even took him aside so as not to complain in front of other customers... he literally could not have given a damn....if this is the attitude no wonder they haven't won an award for years and we will be getting our pasties elsewhere in future and telling our friends and colleagues to do likewise.

Nice looking medium size pasties, however the percentage of meat was certainly below the minimum of 12.5% required by the Cornish Pasty Association for it to be a true pasty. They were tasty enough, but the two we had would have been more at home on the vegitarian shelf!
A dissappointing experience!

Always go here for our pasty but on the last few occasions the pasties came out Luke warm nearly cold üòñ. Very disappointed especially when we asked for hot ones!
Will go elsewhere now, like many others have said.
Sorry chough you need to up your game to keep your loyal customers happy .

Best pasty I‚Äôve ever tasted!  Recommended by my brother in law who‚Äôs had their pasties delivered home in the past, so popped in while in Padstow for the day.
Took pasties and scones back to the accommodation for tea and loved every bite.
Beautiful light scones and well seasoned pasties, pay them a visit if ever in Padstow, you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Used to be the best pasty shop in Padstow however, the pasties were luke warm (at best) on our first visit.
Giving it the benefit of the doubt we tried again a couple of days later but they were cold again.

The Cornish pasty was lovely , the little man loved his sausage roll, my cheese and onion and leek one was lovely . But a special mention to the lady who served us , even though it was very busy she was very friendly and helpful (don‚Äôt know her name) even joked about who the gingerbread monster being for dad

We regularly stay in Padstow. One of our favourite things is the fabulous Cornish‚Äôs Pasty‚Äôs bread and cakes from the Cough Bakery. 
We love the pasty‚Äôs that much we ordered some frozen ones to savour at home. 

What a huge disappointment. They don‚Äôt seem to bear any similarities to those we‚Äôve bought hot from the bakery in the town. 
Hardly any meat at all, one pasty had just two tiny pieces of tough meat. No swede or the usual pepper just layers of potato. 
None of the pasty‚Äôs we got were tasty or enjoyable. What‚Äôs going on?

Tried a few different Cornish pasties and this place wins hands down. Beef us tender, potato is sliced and lot of flavour. Tried a cocktail one first and ordered bunch more. Gets busy so beat the rush, pre-order, pay and come back to collect.
Amazing fresh pasties, really good latte and the sausage rolls are out of this world. Would 100% recommend and will go back tomorrow!

Review Title: Two small pieces of meat in my pasty. It used to be so good !
Review Text:
I do wonder whether Alex Polizzi needs to revisit. I have made a point of buying a pasty in previous years, now I‚Äôm not so sure.
Just 2 pieces of meat left me disappointed, and that opinion was shared by at least 5 people eating their pasties on the harbour wall .
Come on guys‚Ä¶ could do better !!
Our favourite bakery in Padstow. From pasties to French sticks and scones. All lovely! Very busy, but worth the wait. Also perfect for takeout cup of tea/coffee.
Pasties don‚Äôt get better than this, highly recommend a traditional Cornish pasty and a doughnut‚Ä¶. Watch out for the seagulls though
The best bakery in Padstow in my opinion! Made a visit especially to grab a pasty and the billionaire brownie and it did not disappoint, had to buy extra to take home with us!

Review Title: Other Pasties just arnt as good!
Review Text:
We've been visiting Padstow, and Cornwall for around a decade. The Chough Bakery produce in our opinion the best Cornish Pasty around. Being from with Wigan area we've had a pie or two in our lives.

They're not cheap, but they're not small either, you're getting a full meal.

The staff serving at the shop are without exception great, helpful and efficient.

Review Title: Still the finest sausage roll in Cornwall.
Review Text: Chough bakery still makes the finest sausage roll money can buy. And the pasties are spot on too. As are the slices of quiche.

Review Title: Very disappointing, not to the usual standard.
Review Text:
Used to be the best pasty in town, what has gone wrong. Had my usual steak and blue and it had a very sour taste. Took it back and to be fair the young man was apologetic and replaced it. I then had a traditional one, but this was just as bad, not sour but very tasteless and the pastry was soft. 
Very disappointing. Will give them one more try, then if no better will unfortunately have to find another place to get them from!

Review Title: BOH Staff on phones - Food burnt, solid & inedible
Review Text:
As I work in Padstow, I heavily rely on the quick services that each and every bakery offer in order to have a comfortable lunch break.
I'm not one for writing reviews. However, after waiting for roughly 16 minutes for something to be warmed up, I am not impressed.
I could easily see 2-3 members of staff standing around by the ovens chatting and on phones while Front of house staff jumped from one thing to another. The only reason I even received my food when I did, was thanks to a lady on the till enquiring as to why I was waiting.

Unfortunately I am now left with a burnt rock solid lunch and no time to eat it.
Needless to say I am unhappy with my experience today and will most likely refrain from coming back unless necessary.

Apologies to the rest of the team that do so well, I wouldn't be writing this if it wasn't for them letting you down. 
Normally 5/5 :(

Sadly, it looks as though ‚Äòcost of production‚Äô has hit Choughs pasties. I had the usual traditional steak as did my partner and another we where with. I just thought I may have got a pastie with an odd and unusual lack of meat but it was evident with feedback from the others that they had the same. Pasties filled with low cost Ingredients and not much of the main shoe (steak).. 
Yet prices continue to rise‚Ä¶

Bacon and sausage rolls burnt to a crisp this morning and so salty it made me feel ill.  They must have known it was burnt when they gave it to us!
If we had been able they would certainly have been returned.
Poor service and general disrespect to visitors.

Review Title: Delicious vegan pasty and other lovely treats for all!
Review Text:
Best pasties, cakes and bread! Super delicious - Highly recommend!

They also serve hot drinks.

Delicious vegan pasty too!

Hold on to your pasties leaving though - the seagulls WILL take a chance and swoop!
There are a number of these shops in Padstow but this one has really great food and is reasonably priced even for July in the height of the tourist season.

Been going to Padstow for years and Chougjs were a regular experience. But this weekend we went twice and both times ‚Äúhot pasties‚Äù were far from hot. Would struggle to say they were even warm! How hard can it me to keep the pasties hot like every other pasty shop!!! Extremely poor. Sort it out Choughs!

Stopped by for a few items for lunch

Ordered two large pasties and carrot cake and tea 

The pasties were fresh and had a good amount of filling but I found they had a strange milky taste 

The carrot cake was excellent 

While walking around the shops I spoke to one of the owners and mentioned this and was told they add clotted cream for moisture? 

Maybe that was the milky taste ?

Not what I was expecting
Not crisp, threw them away. Lamb and mint, and traditional. Other pastie shops are better. They have many in town. Girl working there is very friendly though.
The Cornish pasties are the best I've had!   And I've done extensice research :-)  There is a good amount of filling and plenty of flavour   Staff very helpful and friendly.

Absolutely delicious pasties and reasonably priced. I had a medium traditional, my husband had cheese and onion (THANK YOU for writing which was which on the bags) The filling in mine was beautifully subtle - often you get such a whack of black pepper that it‚Äôs all you can taste. Two pasties and two soft drinks was ¬£11.60 which I felt was very good value these days.

Chough used to be one of the best for pasties but recently not so good and today they were awful.  Not fully cooked pastry raw and absolutely no seasoning whatsoever in them.  More care needs to be taken these pasties are not cheap!

Came in for a coffee and left with a latte, hot choc, almond croissant and cream tea. No regrets! The two women who served us were so friendly, spoke to our young children and even gave them small cups of leftover hot chocolate. All delicious!

Review Title: We came specifically to try the Pasties - on our little holiday we decided to find the best in Cornwall.
Review Text:
We entered the empty Chough bakery and were ignored, so much so a woman walked in after and was served immediately with a smile.

We were treated like we had come in and vomited all over the floor.

We bought the pasty and left. But to be fair it ruined my morning! 

We were served by an older lady who spent most of the time complimenting the shape of her pasties! 

Shame she could be as pleasant to paying customers.
The pasty,s here are fantastic, as is the scones and all the items we got, excellent local bakers, with friendly service

Review Title: Fresh baked bread, pasties and other lovely things
Review Text: Want a superb pasty or a freshly baked loaf of bread, head for the Chough. It's easy to find being by the harbour.
Delicious cakes and generous portions - you won‚Äôt feel short changed here ! Love the Bakewell and treacle tart . Highly recommend .
I think the lid must have fallen off the pepper pot when they made this egg sandwich. The only saving grace was that a seagull stole half of it. I hope it doesn‚Äôt sneeze too badly.

Review Title: Chough Bakery Padstow. Avoid avoid avoid
Review Text: The pasties are that bad even Ginsters laugh.  Recently visited Padstow and bough 2 rather overpriced pasties from the Chough bakery. They were absolutely rotten, very little meat , tasteless and well overpriced. Avoid at all costs

Poor quality pasties with very little meat and far too much pepper.
Pastry wasn‚Äôt great either which is a real
Shame as we were told it was award winning.

This used to be a good bakery but now is just a pasty ang lunch takeaway. I purchased a loaf of bread on 9 October that had best before 4 October I returned it to the shop and it seed all similar loves we‚Äôre out of date. I took a sour dough loaf (unwraped) that was stale when I cut into it. Sorry Chongjin bakery but the bread that you seem to buy in really isn‚Äôt very good
Definitely the best pasties in Padstow, plenty of filling in our medium size pasty, very tasty and not greasy pastry. Just perfect for us.

Review Title: Not the best - hardly average TBH
Review Text: Apparently Chough Bakery won a prize in 2016, but not with the pasties we just had. Pastry partly raw, and some unusually large chunks of steak -  all in all a disappointing snack.

Review Title: First visit to this bakery and I would definitely recommend it to friends and family when they visit Padstow in Cornwall
Review Text: Fantastic customer service. Very friendly and very helpful we would definitely visit again. The food was delicious thank you.

Very friendly staff, we enjoyed coffee and cake for breakfast and pasties later for lunch. Smaller pasty but very tasty. We had a traditional and a steak and Stilton and would highly recommend. Good latte and variety of cakes.
We have had a lot of pasties. The Chough pasties are the best we have had and the staff are lovely too.

Popped in as saw some amazing sour dough loaves in the window and wow what a treat! Firstly the staff were all super lovely and friendly and the lovely lady that served us gave our son a little ginger biscuit and then one for our daughter. And then a gentleman came up and offered him one and bless him our son said he already had one that you and the man said ohhh go on have another as my treat! So lovely. The almond croissant was AMAZING as was the sour dough loaf we brought and our son inhanled the ham ring doughnut! We have already eyed up some scones (they also sell cream and jam!) ready to take back with us one Friday so we shal be returning!

Review Title: Breakfast baps to queue up for! Much else besides
Review Text: We had superb sausage/bacon breakfast baps here  three or so days in a row. We also had pasties, cakes, coffee and other things. The best bakery in Padstow, and mostly because of cheerful and friendly staff.

Review Title: Great place to grab a bun
Review Text: Friendly staff serving good buns and bread in a unflashy bakery (and there are some overly flashy bakeries in Padstow). Grabbed some essential saffron buns which were delicious. Easy to find as they are on the main harbour front. Strongly recommended

Very disappointed by The Chough Bakery. Definitely not good value for money. The pasties are really poor - tough pastry and a filling that is overpowered by way too much pepper. Not much meat either. Won‚Äôt be returning. Not a patch on the various Malcolm Barnecutt bakeries in this part of Cornwall - just unfortunate that there isn‚Äôt one in Padstow!

The traditional pasty had about 3 pieces of meat in it, all of which were grisly and gross. The rest of the pasty was filled with slimy slithers of potato and what seemed like a mountain of pepper. The chicken and leek was rather tasteless. My children both had sausage rolls which they ate without complaint but I thought they looked undercooked, the pastry certainly was. Very disappointing.

Probably the worst pasties we‚Äôve ever had. 3 pieces of meat in the medium, 2 pieces of meat in the small. In both our pasties not only was there very little meat but the meat we did have was so chewy . It was not the pasty experience we were expecting from a pasty shop with so many good reviews. Time to try a different pasty shop in Padstow
Whenever I come to Cornwall I go to this bakery. By far the best bakery by a mile. The sausage rolls are the finest money can by. And the pasties are divine too.

We thought we would try the Bakery again after a rather unpleasant pasty we had some time ago. It was a similar story. The meat consisted of bits of chewy gristle with slithers of potato in a bland pastry. That was about it and needless to say it ended up in the bin. We will be trying the several new pasty shops in Padstow on our return visit.
Popped in for bread and decided to try the cheese and bacon quiche‚Ä¶wow! It was absolutely delicious, the best quiche ever, as was the almond slice! Will defo be back for more!

I've bought pasties from here for years. Had four the other day but they've changed their recipe, sadly for the worse. Less meat which was tough and dry, way more veg and lacking in seasoning and poor cheap pastry. Used to be best in Cornwall.... now just another, very average pasty.
Shame

Apart from the normal bread, cakes and other this is where to come if you want the BEST pasty in Cornwall, or anywhere in the world according to my taste buds. Absolutely delicious but let it cool a little first as can be very hot‚Ä¶..Enjoy!!!

Called in today and bought a pasty. Thought I'd treat myself and go for the large.It was very expensive, ¬£5.95 but I thought it'll be good as they have a good reputation. When it was handed it to me I said I wanted large, the shop assistant said that is large. If that's large I'd hate to see medium or small. It was extremely modest in size. Anyway I saved it to have for my tea. What a massive let down. There was very little meat. The only good thing was it wasn't too peppery. It was distinctively underwhelming, especially for the price. We get bigger and better where we live for ¬£3.50. Will not be returning.

I wen here a few years ago and they were the best pasties I‚Äôve ever had and this still remains. Maybe a little pricy but worth the cost, you won‚Äôt find a better pasty than this. In fact, I bought some uncooked ones to take home.

Visited The Chough Bakery on our last day of holiday to get some snacks for our drive home after staying in Padstow, and I brought a medium sized Cornish Pasty and my fianc√© brought 2 sausage rolls.   We thoroughly enjoyed our choices.  The pasty was completely packed full and was delishous, and my financ√© said his sausage rolls were also amazing.   Definitely worth a visit, with lovely friendly staff who didn't blink an eye at me buying meaty pastry goods at 9am!

Visited for a mid afternoon snack whilst on a cycle ride. We shared a traditional pasty, a brownie cake and 2 coffee's. 
The service from the two female staff was excellent and they could not have been more helpful. Without requesting it they asked if we would like the pasty cut in half to make it easier for us to share. 
We then went to the hot drinks area and had a good chat with the staff member whilst the drinks were being prepared.
Pasty was the best we had tasted for sometime. Tasty brownie and lovely coffee. 
We are pleased we chose this place.
Excellent service by the staff, friendly, polite and professional. Thank you.

Having spent a lot of time in padstow over the years  as my mother lived there for many years thought I would have one the best pastys in padstow .how things have changed orderd two steak medium at nearly ¬£4 each how disappointing this was  did I order vegetarian ones seams not had there peices of meet the size of  penny's inside so next time down that way will be going round the corner for a pasty

Lovely bakery in a great location. 
The Gluten Free traditional pasties were given 10/10 by the Coeliac in our group, it was nice to go somewhere that we could all eat the same thing together.
The regular pasties were also fantastic, so good we all went back on the morning before we went home for a last treat!.
so delicious it is hard to describe. flaky pastry, delicious steaming hot filling, absolutely delectable
For 20 years or more this little place produces the best pasties. Then non traditional options are good, but for the real thing - go for a large traditional pasty and you  won't find better

This bakery enjoys an excellent reputation for its pasties and this is spot-on.
The pasties are well made with light pastry and plenty of filling. They are reasonably priced too.
Good efficient service as well.
Lovely Cornish Pasties served by friendly, helpful staff.   Great value.   I'll be back next time I'm in Padstow.
By far the best pasty‚Äôs we‚Äôve had in Padstow, great chocolate brownie and lovely service. I didn‚Äôt try it but I have to say the treacle tart looked unbelievable! Will be trying on next visit.

Review Title: Rock hard gluten free pastry on the pasty
Review Text: Had heard good things about Chough's so was looking forward to a gluten free pasty there. What a disappointment! My pasty pastry was rock hard and there wasn't much filling. My husband had a non-gluten free pasty and also complained about the lack of filling. Very disappointing especially considering the cost- another couple qalked away when fhey saw the cost.  We had a much better pasty that came with saute potatoes and salad or beans in Cafe Fleur in Looe. Would not boyher with Chough again.
Staff appeared not to want customers‚Ä¶asking for a napkin was like we‚Äôd asked for something outrageous..shame as we always bought our pasties here but that will be the last time.

Review Title: Hands down best pasty I've ever had!!
Review Text:
Amazing vegan pasty - Like a vegetable stew or pie filling in amazing pastry (not greasy or flakey). Family loved their meat and vegetarian pasties too. Returned almost every day while in the area and have ordered home-pasty kits too!

Arrive early to avoid disappointment of your pasty / quiche / roll / pie being out of stock.

Review Title: I don‚Äôt usually eat pasties but....
Review Text: Very tasty, traditional pasty and the steak and blue cheese ( that thankfully didn‚Äôt have swede which I hate). Unfortunately there were no large pasties available and weren‚Äôt able to wait

Review Title: Disappointing Pasties after so many years of being the best‚Ä¶
Review Text:
Pasties at The Chough now lacking meat. We‚Äôve been buying Chough pasties for many many years, now they just seem to contain vegetables with a minimum amount of meat.
I gave them the chance as a one off, but 3 medium pasties in 5 days all disappointing.üòû
We chose to get some takeaway pasties from Choughs and sit and eat them on the water front in the sun. They were excellent, very tasty and had obviously been made with quality ingredients.

We walked into Padstow today and were starving. We had a traditional pasty and a chicken, bacon and cheese pasty.  I absolutely love Cornish pasties when I‚Äôm on holiday in Cornwall. The pasty I had today was the worst I have had. The pastry was pale and stodgy and the potato was undercooked. Both of those things could have been solved by longer cooking. But the real disappointment was the filling was completely unseasoned. None of lovely warm peppery flavour you expect.  My friends pasty was much the same, she found that hers was unseasoned. Such a pity when I have heard such good things and there‚Äôs so much competition. Was it just today‚Äôs cook? Not going to risk it again. Sorry.
We had lovely tasty, well seasoned pasties which are a good price and we‚Äôre served nice and hot with not too much queue time on a busy day.

I'd heard lots of good reviews about the pasties at The Chough Bakery but I can honestly say the pasty I had was one of the worst I've ever tasted - I've had better from petrol stations !!!
Add to that the totally disinterested staff and it not an experience I'll ever repeat.

Review Title: Chough Pasties Disappointed Won‚Äôt be ordering any more
Review Text:
Always been pleased with the pasties from the Chough, ordered many boxes for delivery by post. This last delivery the pasties are now sold and delivered uncooked frozen, pasties. Pasties are defrosted by the time they have been delivered, pasties didn‚Äôt come with any cooking instructions whatsoever. Cooked the pasties unfortunately they are nothing like the pastiesde received pre cooked in the past. Sadly after many years of ordering I won‚Äôt be ordering or buying any pasties of the Chough Bakery any more.
Very disappointed the pasties aren‚Äôt cheap to order and have delivered üëéüèª
Nice bakery goods. Polite staff. Reasonably priced. Would recommend a visit to takeaway and sit at the sea front to enjoy. Plenty of different foods for sale.

Review Title: Chough pasties are tough to swallow..
Review Text:
Disgusting pasties..

We bought two steak pasties from the Padstow shop last Sunday and I have to say they were appalling. The meat was tough, the filling slimy and no discernible flavour. We have had their pasties before but these were terrible. Both tasted cheesy too - apparently clotted cream is a special ingredient, but is your cream off? Sorry to complain, but given the level of competition you face in Padstow you should be aware.  As it stands, we would not return to Chough or recommend to any of our friends and family.

Review Title: Worst pasty ever had in Cornwall!!
Review Text: What has happened here? In the past pasties were nice but now for the  first time ever I had to throw away pasties due to nasty smell(smelt of rotten chesse or something similar) and not a very nice taste at all. Real disappointment, sorry but won't be going there again and would recommend others to try somewhere else before they are disappointed as well.

Don‚Äôt understand the reviews - handsdown the worst pasty ever had ( and have had quite a few ) and only one to ever end up in the bin 

Lamb and mint - zero meat basically minty potato 
Cornish - zero meat strong flavour of swede 
Chicken and Bacon - zero chicken was some bacon and really salty 

It‚Äôs hard to decide which pasty outlet to choose in Padstow but this is definitely one to avoid. Binned all 3 and went to the lovely JoJos instead for sandwiches
Pasty‚Äôs and cakes were good but watch out for being over charged! I was In holiday mode and didn‚Äôt think about it until it was to late!

I ordered a sausage roll and steak and blue cheese pastry. My son enjoyed his sausage roll but the pasty had less meat than  we had on previous purchases from this bakery and what meat there was was grisly.

Pasties poor quality. Not enough meat in traditional pasty mainly potato.

Saffron buns more like rock cakes and can not buy less than pack of 4

If you are in Padstow you have to pop in here.  We always come and pick up a pasty (or two) for our lunch whilst out walking.  Always excellently tasting pasties with plenty of options if you want something different to a traditional one.
THE BEST PASTY ! had the cheese, chicken and bacon pasty and it was delicious! wonderful flavour and brilliant texture - best pasty in Cornwall!
Best pasty ever. Thin pastry light and fluffy. There did appear to be less meat than usual but I still love their pasty‚Äôs would recommend
We were recommended to come to Choughs Bakery and we thoroughly enjoyed our traditional Cornish Pasties.  My husband had a regular one and mine was gluten free and they were delicious.
Received my order of 2 boxes trad pasties and just had a couple with my son. Gutted nowhere as good as they used to be, hardly any meat - very poor

They sell individually-wrapped gluten free pasties, my coeliac daughter would have eaten a whole one (adult-sized) given half the chance. My wife and I had standard ones which also tasted great. The shop was very busy which is not a surprise given the quality of the food.
Great croissants and the apricot crumble slice was heaven on a plate. Friendly service an great value.

The pasties are absolutely delicious! Plus the service is efficient and the staff are friendly - they even offered to re-heat the pasties for us because they‚Äôd started to cool a little. Just watch out for the seagulls if you‚Äôre going to eat on the quayside!

Popped in whilst passing for breakfast take out and we were so glad we did. Very friendly welcome, lovely fresh bread and flavoursome sausages that we could eat overlooking the harbour. All throughly delightful.
Fruit scones are the worst we have ever tasted. Really salty and leave a horrible‚Äôtaste‚Äô in your mouth. Shame because good amount of fruit and well risen

we were recommended to The Chough as the best bet among the many bakeries in Padstow and they were correct, great quality and flavour, they also do a gluten-free option which  "our" coeliac said was very good too.
Bloody amazing. Always come here for the best pasties in Padstow. Have never been let down with this place. 10/10 would recommend

In over 12 years of reviewing and over 200 reviews I‚Äôve only ever given a five star marking to 3 or 4 places but Chough Bakery gets it!

We were in Pladstow during a week‚Äôs stay in Cornwall with the relaxing of the Covid lockdown and were feeling peckish and spotted Cloughs‚Äô on the corner. 

Good Covid protocols were in place and we swiftly conducted our purchases before sitting on a bench opposite the shop and overlooking the harbour to eat.

I have to say this was the best Cornish pasty I have ever tasted!  Most pasties I‚Äôve had have been thick crusty pastry with a small filling and plenty of space within the pasty.

Not this one!!

Thin tasty pastry wrapped around a fully stuffed pasty and I mean FULLY stuffed.  Steak, blue cheese, and onions filled the pasty, it was perfect and very reasonably priced,

If you‚Äôre in Padstow, take advantage!!

I had one of the pasty‚Äôs today from your shop in Padstow. As a Cornishman, I was really disappointed - it was the worse one I‚Äôve ever had. If it wasn‚Äôt for your location, I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôd be selling many pasty‚Äôs. It‚Äôs a shame that so many tourists will get a poor taste of Cornwall.
Tried the gluten free cheese and vegetable pasty, had a lot better. They have a nice selection of breads though.
The pasties here were very good and a good selection. Good take away coffee friendly and helpful staff

Review Title: Simply the best pasties in Cornwall !
Review Text:
We are frequent visitors to Padstow, and Chough bakery are the best pasty makers in the business !

Look forward to returning in December !

Visiting Padstow was extremely excited to see the chough bakery that we'd heard so much about. Having been in Cornwall for 3 days and yet to have a pasty it seemed right that our first one should be from Chough. So we joined he queue and came away with a large traditional pasty.

Unfortunately what I bit into was just tasteless mush with hardly any meat, more like baby food in a pastry casing.

Definitely won't bother again will stick to Pengenna from now on
Stopped off a couple of times.  Once for their famous sourdough bread and then for their cakes.  Can definitely recommend both the Bakewell tart and the treacle tart.

Sent for a box of mixed pasties and they arrived safe and sound by courier.
Obviously had to sample some before freezing the rest for eating later, and they were absolutely delicious.
I am a big eater but found one traditional steak pasty was enough, and my wife couldn't manage to finish her Cheese and Onion one.
Great food and excellent delivery service.

Review Title: Drove for miles to get my annual supply box !
Review Text:
This is the second year we have taken a special trip here while down in Cornwall to Chough Bakery. We always grab a hot pasty to go (traditional always the best) and then a box of large to take home.

I am very picky about my pies and pasties so when I say these pasties are amazing and do not disappoint it is based on trying a lot of pasties in a lot of places and also those who the claim ‚Äúbest party in the world‚Äù.

The traditional pasty is loaded full, made of a proper pastry (not too much puff or too flaky) and not like those ones that begin with G that are soggy, more pastry than filling and not worth a pound ! It is spicy with pepper as it should be and there is a crunch to the veg inside and loads of steak.

Always friendly staff make it a pleasure to choose the box full to take home. They freeze great and are then a really treat to warm up on a winters days !

Well done Chough Bakery for another great pastry and cannot wait time crack open the box when we get home tomorrow and the rest to freeze for a treat later....
The go to place for pasties in Padstow. Nothing flash but good pasties sold from a traditional bakery.

We ordered gluten and gluten-free pasties from Choughs and they were quick, hot and delicious. The gluten-free pasties were heated whilst we waited so they took a little longer but we didn‚Äôt mind waiting because we appreciated finding gluten free pasties so much. Thank you Choughs - pasties on the beach were a real treat!

Probably been family run for many a year Chough bakery sets the standard for artisan bakeries.  Their pasties were 2nd to none and the cakes and saffron buns were pretty good too.  We went there every day and there was always a queue which says it all really.
brought 2 traditional pasties for our trip home. wish we visted sooner in our trip the pasty was amazing full of flavour and seasoned perfectly.

After 2 weeks travelling and touring Cornwall, we had our fair share of pasties to find the best. THIS IS BY FAR THE BEST PASTIE in Cornwall, in the country, maybe in the World!!!!!
Hot, tasty, delicious, well seasoned, melt in the mouth, perfect pastry!!!!! I want to go back for more! I recently saw a sign over 400 miles away in a village that were selling The Chough Bakery and couldnt believe my luck! 
This bakery is a must, not just for their pasties but their service, drinks, the history and supporting a local business and produce.
Bought 2 pasties from here for a snack/lunch. They were very nice but mine was a steak and blue cheese one and had lots of potato but not that much meat and cheese. Cornish pastry was better
Recommended by a local, and bought two regular pasties for the drive home.  Wish we'd tried easier - flaky pastry, absolutely stuffed with flavourful meat and veg.  Total recommendation for others!

Looked forward for many weeks to eating Chough pasties on the next part of our next walk along SW Coastal Path. Waited for them to open and bought four, three traditional and one cheese and onion. Walked for about ten minutes, sat down to eat them and they were stone cold. Clearly ‚Äòyesterday‚Äôs‚Äô but nothing said, no offer of heating them up and full price charged.  The debate is always which are the best pasties, Chough, Barnicutts, Aunt Avice‚Äôs, etc. As far as we four locals are concerned, Chough no longer in the running, purely because of such appalling customer service.
The Chough has always had a well deserved reputation for traditional and alternative pasties. All are quality pasties and a good price.
We been Cornwall many times, and try a lot of artisan bakery, this one is one of the best, their pies are very good , recommended.

My husband loves pasties and states that this is the best place in Cornwall and believe me he has tried many.
They also do beautiful cakes!

I ordered the chicken, bacon, leek and cheese pasty - and thoroughly enjoyed it. I thought it was excellent value at ¬£3.75, and the service was friendly and the queuing efficient, despite a busy lunch time in town. A bit more chicken might have pushed it to 5 stars, but I'd definitely recommend and would come again.

Theres a reason this bakery has won so many awards! The Cornish pasties are gorgeous! Theres a good amount of filling and plenty of flavour! The sausage rolls, lamb and mint pasty and cheese, onion and leek pasty are also worth a purchase as they are just as tasty as the cornish! We always get some to take home

Recently visited Padstow for a week holiday , I'm a celiac and it was great finding a bakery that did gluten free pasties. I had a beef gluten free pastry,  it was amazing - very tasty . Wish I had gone back to the bakery more
Amazing traditional Pasties, best in Padstow. They are baked to original recipes and taste amazing. A must stop for anyone visiting

Do not buy pasties anywhere else as the Chough's are the best by far! Our favourite is the steak and Cornish blue cheese :-) They also do very delicious quiche slices to take away and some very tasty bread and cakes. It's very popular but definitely worth waiting in the small queue.

Having got the adorable ferry over from Rock (fyi, there are serious queues for this so bear that in mind if you're doing the coastal walk from Ponzeath!) we stopped off for lunch in Padstow and I'd heard this was one of the best bakeries. It has been here since my friend visited 15 years ago and is one of the longest standing retailers in the harbour. 

The pasty was absolutely delicious, my friend had traditional but I have to say the chicken, bacon and cheese one (with leeks) was divine. Crumbly yet thick enough pastry and soft, unctuous filling - do not miss this if you're nearby! Mind the seagulls though, and sit on the harbour wall but eat out of the packet...

Lovely pasties. Had chicken and bacon and cheese, leek and onion. Son had a sausage roll and loved it. Only one family group allowed in the shop at any one time and there‚Äôs a queue outside. Very safe. Thanks

These pasties are worth the aggro of car parking in Padstow. The new pasty pit stop window makes things really easy and Covid safe too. 
We always have Chough pasties when in Cornwall and wouldn‚Äôt dream of eating any others. We especially love the vegetarian cheese, leek and onion option too - so tasty and full of flavour!

In padstow for a week and went down to look for a place for breakfast 
Saw the bacon bap and ordered two, one for me and one for my son, and must say that it was the best bacon bap ever, I truly recommend it is a must have if you are in Padstow

This place does get busy the queue was building up! My hubby had the traditional Cornish pasty and said it was sensational. Me being a veggie ordered the cheese and onion however it was so so hot I burnt my mouth and could literally not eat it for 20 mins! Haha.

The place was clean and the food was kept in a hygienic mannor with separate utensils used for vegan products- unfortunately the vegan pasty was very bland and flavourless with a very watery texture- would suggest a thicker sauce and less watery veg as the pastry was actually really nice! The kids had a doughnut each which was eaten in seconds so that was decent. The staff member that served me was very polite and smiley, the prices were reasonable
It was a really busy day, so we ordered through the quick order hatch. Staff were friendly, and the pasties tasted great! Served piping hot too.

Down here on holiday fancied a pastie. Bought one of the vegan ones from here which sounded amazing. I was actually a bit dubious as to wether the pastry was vegan, I had a couple of bites and could see meat. I warned my husband who had a couple of bites and unknowingly he'd eaten meat for the first time in 32 years. We went back into the shop pretty angry and pretty devastated explained very politely to the young girl what had happened and asked to see the owner. I explained to her what had happened she just shook her head and said I'll swap them for you they got put on the wrong shelf! SHE ACTUALLY LOOKED A BIT PUT Out! No apology just looked at us with contempt and reluctantly gave us two vegan pasties which we put in the bin as had lost trust! It is understandable that at really busy times this mistake could have happened but we were the only people in there and was a quiet time. It was just clear that she didn't care one bit what had just happened and didn't realise the magnitude of what had just happened. I would strongly advise all vegans to steer clear of this woman and her business.

BEST Pasties ever 
This is one of my favourite Bakeries it‚Äôs absolutely delicious and everything is amazing. If I lived near here I would be purchasing yummy goods and treats all the time

My other half wouldn‚Äôt buy pasties anywhere else in Padstow! And it‚Äôs easy to see why. My first try, a Mediterranean Veg pasty was so good! They had long queues due to social distancing measures but kept them moving quickly

Review Title: Would like them to improve their conduct
Review Text: I entered the store intending to make a purchase. I was quickly (and not so politely) told I couldn't be in the store without a face mask - even though I explained I had a valid exception. I feel this is discriminatory against customers who are unable to wear a face mask - particularly as no alternative was offered. The management and/or staff really need to look at how they conduct business, which many establishments manage to do, despite current challenges.
Had a couple of breakfast baps and croissants from here on a few occasions - plenty of filling in the baps - croissants were very nice indeed.  Would definitely recommend

Some of the best pasty‚Äôs we‚Äôve ever had. They were really tasty, lots of filling and great pastry. The ordering and paying system was well organised and the staff very friendly and helpful. Will definitely be buying my pasty‚Äôs here in future!

Ordered on line in May very quick delivery postage was a little high we went half‚Äôs with our neighbours so 2 happy customers very well packaged smelt lovely when removed the lid. Very tasty 
My friend order via telephone Saturday for delivery later on in week lovely  friendly lady on phone who took our order 
Thank you
Bought pasties, bread and scones to take back north. Simply perfect üòãüòãüòã love,y, soys and warm shop and staff were friendly

On a walk around the harbour I stopped for a pasty. I have been here before but this time they did not look the same so I went for a Bacon Butty instead. Cooked while I waited and it was brilliant. Tasty and full of hot Bacon on a nice soft bun. Excellent. Hopefully the paies will look better next visit
Called to pick up some pasties. Might be me as they just didn‚Äôt taste like the used to. Too much pastry and not enough meat. Seemed to lack that wow factor.

Visited to buy pasties and a loaf. Bread (large seeded crusty) was outstanding! Pasties not so good, had 2 steak and blue cheese, flavour was good but steak VERY thin (2 or 3 small chunks per largish pasty) on the ground making this almost a misnomer for these pasties. Expected better at ¬£4.50 a pop, will not buy again!

Fantastic customer service
The pasty we wanted wasn‚Äôt available but was in the oven. We were told a few minutes but they were Cornish minutes. The staff were brilliant, found us outside to keep us informed and gave us a little treat for the inconvenience.
The pasties were also amazing!

I haven't had a decent pasty since I was diagnosed with coeliac disease...and then there was Chough's! Absolutely fabulous gluten free steak pasty one day, and then a frozen cheese pasty to take home with me. Perfection.

This happened to be across the lane from our apartment, and was an excellent bakery. Can recommend the sourdough bread, carrot cake and lemon drizzle cake. The cake came in huge slab size portions and was delicious.
My husband had a sneaky pasty that didn't disappoint. We will certainly buy some to take home. I didn't try a gluten free one on this occasion but certainly will next time.

We stopped by The Chough Bakery to try a traditional Cornish Pasty on our tour of Europe, and must say that it has got to be the best pasty pastry we have ever tasted.
