Whilst the filling could have done with a little more seasoning, The Chough Bakery clearly cares about the quality of their food, with high quality ingredients, and a very pretty pie!

IG - @thebeverleybunch

Visited for breakfast, but came away with more!! Got some chocolate bread that I heated up and paired with some Lobster!! Completely mad, but as the picture shows, worked brilliantly! Bakery has great breads, pasties and more. Very busy with locals. Also great coffee!

We have visited Padstow a lot in the last few years and as we now live in the Cornwall area we have been lucky enough to try lots of pasties. I am sad to say that the pasties we had today were very disappointing, bland and flavourless. I had a steak and blue cheese pasty which, to be honest, was void of any blue cheese at all and the steak was quite grisly. My wife had a traditional pasty and again she said it was unseasoned and flavourless. We both agree it used to be much, much better. Not just the pasties but the service, which my wife explained to be very lacklustre and unhappy. It was a huge shame as we had brought family with us expecting to be amazed. More of a damp squib than a roaring bang. Sad to say there are better in Padstow and we won‚Äôt be returning anytime soon.
Second time I have bought their pasties and I rate them the best tasting I have had.so next time I visit Cornwall I will definitely pay them another visit

We went in on a Sunday morning, not busy, and the staff were chatting amongst themselves when serving us.  Unfortunately I didn't notice until it was too late that they had overcharged us by about ¬£5.  We'd bought several slices of cake and a couple of gifts - cakes were good but be warned, check that you are charged correctly!

We had some very good doughnuts in a cafe and when i asked where they were from it was here so off we trotted to sample the pasty!...very good but be careful when eating on the street...Padsow is plagued by seagulls and courageous pigeons!
Known for taking part in Radio 1 Pass the pasty we decided to give it a go. Well we weren't disappointed and have even bought some to take home!

As visitors to the UK, and staying with friends in Cornwall we had to try your " award winning pasties". Very disappointed with the hard tasteless pasty, unseasoned fillings and it was difficult to actually taste the different fillings. Sorry to say our Aussie ones are better.
Visited here on recommendation and I must say I was disappointed, bought a medium sized pasty which was full of meat and veg - if you are in the area can definitely recommend
Were advised to try the pasties and we had the traditional ones which were excellent. There were lots of different pasties and pastries on offer.

Tried this place as wanted to tick the box to eat a pasty in Cornwall whilst on holiday and saw that this place has positive reviews.

Had a medium pasty, it was luke warm and I wondered what all the fuss was about, it was just average and can't figure out wht people like this place so much.

Very average pasties and not cheap at near to four and half pounds a pasty compare with supermarket ones that in my opinion taste the same at nearer to two pounds or even Gregg's.

If you must buy one, I'd ask for a hot one that's just come out of the oven but I wouldn't go out if my way to eat here.

We purchased two medium traditional pasties we did mention at the time they looked a little under cooked but the assistant assured us they were properly cooked however when we started to eat them we discovered the pastry was still raw as were the vegetables we returned them and had properly cooked replacements still not the best pasties we have had but much nicer than the first two
If in Padstow get all of your bakery items from here - great selection of breads and cakes which always fresh and top quality

Great place to buy fresh bread & Cornish pastie.
Right on harbour front so great place to get a snack

I was keen to pop in here as I‚Äôd previously had a very tasty traditional pasty from the Chough Bakery in Port Isaac a day or so earlier. This place is slightly bigger and I did succumb to a piece of Bakewell tart alongside another pasty. Plenty of choice, welcoming staff and everything appeared pretty good value.

There are no better pasties in Cornwall- absolutely delicious. As is their bread and donuts! We go to Padstow every year and walking along by the harbour with a Chough‚Äôs Pasty is part of our holiday tradition.

Still make the best pasties in Padstow and there is lot to choose from.
We keep coming back all the time .

The best pasties in the country let alone Cornwall! First checked Chough out 5 years ago...great and they are still absolutely amazing. Also great to have different sizes to choose from. Still prefer the original Cornish pasty to the other flavours but whatever you choose you cant go wrong with a Chough. Cant wait to return...

Tried various places whilst in Padstow on several occasions now, and this is still my favorite place for a well filled delicious cornish pasty. No pretence just does what it says on the tin. Queue up buy your pasty take it away in a paper bag end enjoy in the harbour. Proper ol job!

Review Title: Delicious bread, rolls pasties and cakes.
Review Text: Delicious bread, rolls, pasties and cakes, helpful staff, always very busy, so it's good to try and get there early.

We got Chough‚Äôs delicious pasties nearly every day before our hikes in Cornwall. We put them in our backpacks and they are the perfect lunch - no utensils needed!  We like them best after they have cooled a few hours.
Great location on the quay in Padstow and they have a super selection of baked goods and the best pastries in town, hard to resist, delicious
Be prepared for a wait. Testament to how good their food is. A must visit for a traditional Cornish pastie.
There are lots of pasty shops in Padstow. The traditional pasty that is sold here is really the best in town. Good range of other bakery items but this is the place for pasty...
We had a 3 cakes from here during a stop in Padstow and all 3 were amazing. Very friendly staff aswell

Review Title: The Best Cornish Pasties in the Land
Review Text: Look no further than the Chough Bakery if you want to enjoy one of the best pasties in the land. This is a lovely bakery with a fine selection of bread, drinks, cakes so get your lunch here if visiting Padstow.
Lovely little shop with good selection of bread, rolls, cakes and especially good pasties and scones.

There are plenty of Pastie shops in Padstow, but Choughs stand out from the rest. The Pasties themselves are total quality, full to the brim of vegetable and meat. Great Value.
Brought 8 home with me and after a week in the freezer they were still excellent. Great Pasties.
Simply irresistible pasties. Don‚Äôt skimp on this if it‚Äôs a treat. Get the bigger one! Padstow is a beautiful but very busy place. We took the foot ferry from Rock as the parking can be difficult.

A great local bakery selling wonderful fresh bread etc. 
No doubt the best Cornish Pasties in the world!

Review Title: Best Pasties Ever & Good Bread Too
Review Text: Their award winning pasties are to die for, and the bread is also excellent. This is a must visit  on a trip to Padstow.

NEVER LEAVE REVIEWS but had such a terrible experience I have to share!!! Took my dad to Padstow for his birthday which also happened to be the last day of our holiday in Cornwall and he had been raving about the pasties at choughs all week. Ordered him a Cornish pasty and myself a veggie one which also happened to be vegan, which I though was great and very inclusive- you don‚Äôt get much of that where we are from! First bite of our pasty‚Äôs not only were they cold but the pastry was still raw inside! We took them back and politely explained, the sever who was a young girl with cropped short hair snatched it out his hand and rolled her eyes ‚Äòit is cooked it‚Äôs just really thin pastry‚Äô... we looked at each other a bit puzzled and I admit tried not to laugh because nothing about the explanation she offered made any sense. With a huff she said ‚ÄòI can give you a new one but it will be exactly the same‚Äô. Tbh at this point we should have just asked for out money back and gone elsewhere but we were a bit taken a back by the whole situation. He got a new pasty and I sheepishly reminded her mine was the same. ‚ÄòWell that ones vegan so it‚Äôs definately fine‚Äô she snapped and turned and served someone else before I could respond. Fortunately, the other lady kindly fetched me another and it was better. (Still cold and not very flavourful though). As someone who works in customer service I am very understanding and the situation could so easily have been put right but this girl had a terrible attitude! If you don‚Äôt like people go and I think you should go and work somewhere else! And if she was having a bad day I still think she needs to be taught a thing or two about how to approach customer complaints and how to rectify a situation... Don‚Äôt tell me I‚Äôm wrong to start with... I have got better things to do than queue up and pretend my pasty isn‚Äôt cooked! Do not recommend getting a pasty here!

Review Title: Based on a pasty taste test
Review Text: We held a taste test between pasty shops, this one was disappointing in flavour, lack of seasoning, quantity of meat (not a lot), however the pastry was good. Cornish pasty company around the corner was better.
Having tasted a few pasties Choughs were recommended..out of 8 we have sampled they came second,  nice and moist with a generous filling.
Best place to buy your bread - sourdough  is exceptional.  Pasties are excellent, as are the sausage rolls.  Also a great range of local produce.

Padstow is a great place to visit and it, in my opinion has the ‚ÄòBest‚Äô pasty in Cornwall. It‚Äôs full of meat as well as other fillings....wonderful and satisfying, brought a box of ten home last week...Bread is awesome too.
There are many good pasty shops in Cornwall, The Chough Bakery is definitely one of the better ones. Great tasting, proper meat, overall excellent.
Been in Cornwall for a week and tried a different traditional pasty from 5 locations on 5 consecutive days and Chough Bakery was the clear winner - fantastic!

We have just returned from another week in Padstow and my favourite bakery! I‚Äôve worked my way through the full offering this week and nowhere beats it. I‚Äôm yet to try a traditional pasty anywhere else that comes close to topping the Chough and don‚Äôt understand any reviews that suggest otherwise. The millionaires shortbread is to die for too! Friendly staff and great location. Can‚Äôt wait to return next year!
Been a few years since we've been to the Chough, still excellent food, obviously rebranded and updated their offering, very impressed. Highly recommended.

Tried the traditional cornish pasties which were quite good, and also the cake of the day which was a victoria sponge on the day we visited this was also very good but I wouldn't recommend the carrot cake. Also try to keep track of your order as we ordered two slices of carrot cake but were only given one which we didn't notice until we had returned to our accommodation outside of Padstow and they didn't give us a receipt so I don't know if we were charged for one slice or two. 

Be prepared to queue as there was a long wait on both days we visited in August.
The gluten free steak pastie is excellent and well worth a few minutes wait while they are warmed. Take away and munch on the harbour side - happy days!

We popped in to try the pasties as we‚Äôd seen good reviews online. 
What we got was only ok. Slightly pale. Reasonable seasoning. Plenty of root vegetables. Very little meat. About three small pieces in each large steak pasty. 

In an era when we know more than ever that eating a balanced diet is important for public health, I think it not unreasonable to suggest a large pasty that costs 5 pence less than ¬£5 should offer at least 50 grams of meat rather than about 20 grams ( half and ounce ) these had

Very, very nice. A large variety of flavours all sounded very tasty. My family and I chose Traditional, Steak and Cornish Blue and Lamb and mint, All amazing. If I had to pick up on one thing, the wait was a bit long but it was worth it. If you‚Äôre around definitely go there!

These pasties are awesome wouldnt go anywhere else. Bread superb. Scones and cakes are lovely any not all creamy and mushy
Would recommend this place

Haven't been to Chough for a while now so was glad to be able to pop in while in Padstow. Had a tasty pasty and wish I'd had a reason to buy more stuff too! Nice to be able to buy the updated recipe book as my original has gone missing!!

Lovely pastries, sausage rolls and morning pastry‚Äôs.   Friendly service and great food.  
Take away right on the harbour.

Was pleased to see their sign advertising a gluten free selection including pasties so tried a steak flavour, which they said would take 4 or 5 minutes. They microwave from frozen which put me off slightly but thought I‚Äôd give it a go. Oh dear. Really thick tasteless chewy pastry and extremely dry mediocre filling. Awful. The worst I‚Äôve tried by far. Searched the shop for the other gluten free items but could find none. Their normal pasties are supposedly good but if you need gluten free, don‚Äôt get excited about this place. Sorry.

We have been coming to chough for years, every time we have been in Cornwall, however I didn't think it was as good as normal! Fresh bread and scones very nice, some of the cakes weren't as nice as usual but still ok. However, pasties have gone down hill, flavourless and not much meat in them! Much nicer places to get a Cornish pasty.

Stopped at the little window got a cornish pastie. Unfortunatelly they would only serve certain flavours told to queue inside same kady served me 20 mins later left with two decent tasting pasties what is the point of the fast track window with such stupid restrictions

We wanted to make a quick stop for lunch. The steak and Cornish blue cheese pasty was most tasty. There was a good selection of chutney jars on sale, which I thought was cool! Would get lunch from here again, if I needed to.

Eassential bakery to get cakes to take on the beach
Really good choice of traditional cakes that are freshly made each day
Best pasties in Cornwall end of story!! Everything they make is great you have to try the pasties though.

The pasties here are the best with great flavour and plenty to choose from
Also the cakes are a dream 
Staff friendly

This bakery has been here for many years and it‚Äôs still my favourite, it serves wonderful fresh pastries and cakes. My favourite bakery in Padstow for picnics and lunch to take to the beach.
We chose cream doughnuts, cinnamon swirls, ginger bread men and fresh sandwiches.
Came down with a friend and his kids, we had the best pasty ever. Definitely worth a visit just for a pasty.

Best sausage roll in Cornwall. I‚Äôd go so far to say the best I‚Äôve ever had full stop! Pasties are excellent too. While I‚Äôm at it the cakes are spot on, not to mention the bread and quiche.  Takeaway only and they also do tea, coffee and cold drinks.

Visited Chiugh bakery after searching Trip Advisor for the best cornish pasties and we weren't disappointed.
Friendly service and made even better when we found out the bakery served gluten free pasties too....my son was made up!
Delicious food, great service and the food worth the money. we will be back.

We purchased 4 items - cheese and bacon quiche, egg and ham pie, Belgian bun and bakewell slice. The quiche was moist and initially tasted very nice until my taste buds were overwhelmed with salt making it inedible. The ham and egg pie was dry and tasteless. The Belgian was dry and flavourless. Bland dough sprinkled very lightly with dried fruit...so dry we didn‚Äôt eat it. The Bakewell tart slice was delicious and the saving grace. Would I visit again? NO. More than half of our picnic supper ended up in the bin.

Bought some pasties to take home at the end of our holiday - the beef ad blue cheese lacked seasoning and there was hardly a whiff of any cheese. Also bought 2 vegan Mediterranean veg pasties but these were bland and the pastry was soggy. Won't be in  a hurry to return!
Great takeaway pasties and sausage rolls and pastries. Really should up their game with the coffee though. It‚Äôs the one thing that lets down.

After been giving some lovely scones, cream and Jam from The Chough Bakery, my daughters and I visited the bakery in Padstow, but I was disappointed with the sausage rolls and pasty we bought, my daughters didn‚Äôt eat their sausage rolls and having tried their sausage rolls I could not eat them either. Everyone‚Äôs taste is different but I won‚Äôt go back their again.
Always call here as soon as we arrive in Padstow. Love the bread and the fantastic range of cakes. Not a pastie fan (sorry) but the rest of the family are and they loved them.
There are plenty of bakers/pasty shops in padstow. If you want a great tasting traditional Cornish pasty then chough bakery is the tastiest I‚Äôve found. Highly recommend.
Stopped off most mornings whilst walking the dog for a great bacon roll. During the day we had pasties and sausage rolls. Busy place.

Review Title: Lovely bakery and do offer other stuff
Review Text: We purchased some fresh bread and fresh sausages and bacon to take back to lodge.  Bacon was really thick and bread lovely and fresh.
We found the sourdough bread a bit disappointing. BUT oh the fabulous crispy bacon baps are fabulous. Soft white bread roll packed with tasty crispy bacon. ¬£3.50. Bliss!

I really can‚Äôt see what all the fuss is about... ok it‚Äôs freshly baked.. that is wonky because of the sheer volume of people who are buying them that they have to bake to keep up. 
It‚Äôs just a very average Cornish pasty. You can get way better pasties in Cornwall and the rest of the country in my opinion.
Les typiques "cornish pastries" sont excellentes. Les gens font la queue pour les acheter et vont ensuite manger sur le port, juste en face. Tr√®s bien.

Grew up in Padstow and have very fond vivid memories of having pasties from here in the 80s as a kid. I wasn't disappointed on our recent holiday here. Had a couple large traditional pasties during our stay and were absolutely gorgeous.

We bought bread cakes and a cream tea from the Clough bakery during our stay - everything freshly baked and great quality and if you time an afternoon visit just right they are selling off the remaining cakes at very reasonable prices üòÄ

Review Title: A sausage roll to help with the walk
Review Text: Lovely bakery selling great food,  sausage rolls are yum, plenty of other delights on offer to satisfy your taste buds too.

Even the seagull refused the meat inside the cornish pasty. Goodness knows what it was. Wonder if the family of this family run business can tell us what meat it is and whether they would eat it. Disgusting.

We've been buying our pasties here for years whilst in Padstow and also from home online. We just had a box of 12 sent up to us, by the very talented Danny o'Flynn, and I have to to say the quality is fantastic as always. Keep up the good work.

Amazing Pasties, easily the best in Cornwall.
Recommend the Beef and Stilton - fabulous flavour and huge!!
Award winning pasties with a good variety of fillings including vegetarian. Well worth the price and genuine family business keep making them

Feel a little cheated. This has always been my favourite pasty shop. Even had them for our wedding reception 13 years ago!. 
However, we were disappointed this time. Not enough meat and worst of all, not seasoned. I will give you another chance as often at Padstow. 
Hope it will be nicer next time

Review Title: Best place to buy a Cornish pasty in Padstow
Review Text:
Excellent Cornish pastry. Had a traditional medium sized steak pasty for ¬£3.75. Very tasty and filling. 

Sat on the quayside to eat it, but had to avoid aggressive seagulls.

Go early for the best choice and freshest pasties.
Really good shop for pasties. One of the nicest in Padstow. Quite small though, so gets crowded in the high season.
Busy all times of the day. What can I say, steak & blue cheese pasty, best pasty I‚Äôve ever had!!!! Ever!!!! Well worth a visit. We will definitely be back!
Best pasties in Padstow. Great bread and very good staff. Would heartily recommend the doughnuts as well.

We‚Äôve been coming regularly to Padstow, and stopping at Choughs for past 6 years. Sadly both our pasties were more potatoe/onion with only couple pieces of meat. After cycling ten miles and previous high standards, we felt a little cheated. Hoping it was just an off day.

What more can one say? It‚Äôs the Chough Bakery! Fresh ingredients and freshly made daily. We always visit Chough  Bakery and it never lets us down. We take a supply back  home to freeze for future use.

I am aware that most of the reviews of this place are really good so maybe I just came on an off day! I visited on Sunday and I was really underwhelmed after having read such good reviews about this place! 
I opted for the cheese and leek pasty and was so excited as everyone raves about this place! 
Firstly I thought it would be lovely and warm.... but it was freezing cold.... and I found the filling was just really bland. The description outside was so much more mouth watering than the pasty itself, I was really disappointed.
OMG, do your selves a favour and indulge.. you simply cannot leave Padstow without having a pasty from here . They are simply scrumptious, delicious, scrummy for words ..

Review Title: Simply the best pasties in Cornwall
Review Text: Best pasties in Cornwall , had such a good experience here, far better than any other local bakeries, will be back again, hopefully can purchase some online
Chough Bakery is an absolute must visit when in Padstow. The brownies are outstanding, as are the scones and pasties for that matter.

Review Title: Great selection of Pasties to chose from
Review Text:
We were in Padstow on a very rainy day and struggled to find many places to sit down and have a snack and. Cuppa so we decided to get a pasty and take it back to the car to eat rather than continue walking and getting wet. 
The choices at the Chough bakery were excellent and included a Gluten free option which was heated up to order. I chose a Lamb pasty with a little mint - it was full of big pieces of lamb and just a hint of mint. It was a good choice and kept me full for the rest of the day!!!
This place is a mandatory stop when we visit Padstow.  The pasties are delicious!  Very popular bakery.

Review Title: Absolutely the BEST pasties in Cornwall!
Review Text: We've been enjoying traditional steak pasties from The Chough for over 15 years - the quality never varies!
Tasty and moist filling with good pastry crust. Lovely. A must try! Maybe give the coffee a miss though (from a machine not a barista).
Almost always busy and understandably so. Proper fresh pasties with good pastry and lumps of meat rather than the usual grey mince.

Review Title: Simpy the best pasties in Padstow!
Review Text: Great, freshly baked pasties, the most delicious shortbread, and so much more!  We have bought pasties from here each time we have visited, and they never disappoint.
During our annual visit to Padstow we always indulge in a pasty from Chough's. This place never disappoints, great staff and the best pasties in Cornwall! Thank you.

Review Title: "Well Choughed " Melt in the mouth Cornish Pasty
Review Text:
We were told when visiting Padstow we must try a pasty from the Chough Bakery. we were not disappointed, well filled pasty with a very nice Pastry, It was pretty much straight from the oven and piping hot. Between us we tried a few types but the traditional was outstanding. Not as much meat as some we tried but excellent favour.
We were disappointed later though as I hoped to take some back with us. but the shop was closed and according to a sign an electrical failure.
a very busy shop with great pasties, I can see why we were told we must try it..

Visited Padstow last week it was rammed... so we decided to grab a pasty and sit by the harbour
I‚Äôm soooo pleased we did because this is by far the best pasty I have eaten. Delicious filling and amazing pastry. We also had the bread and that was delicious as well... definitely recommend and 100% return for some delicious bakery delights
We bought bread and rolls here as well as Cornish blue cheese and other picnic items. All were lovely.

As well as the traditional Cornish, they had a few other varieties to choose from. We tried the traditional and the Chicken and leek. Both were very tasty and not over-peppered although both could have benefitted from more meat and less potato as it did feel like they were skimping a little. The saffron buns were also really good, sticky and moist.
We had cakes and pasty‚Äôs and everything was amazing. Great prices and nice size cakes. It was busy and you had to wait in a que but well worth the wait. Highly recommend the brownies, date slice

Takeaway lamb pasty purchased lunchtime today was only OK for vegetables & pastry, but the tiny amount of supposedly lamb turned out to be only little lumps of gristle - no actual meat at all, so wouldn‚Äôt recommend anyone to buy one ever.

We were in Padstow for the May day celebrations and called into the Chough bakery for a pasty what an experience it has to be the best we have ever eaten, tried Philps in Hayle Warren's and others when on holiday in Cornwall not a patch on the Chough pasties what a feast they are

If we are in Padstow we always go into the Chough bakery near the harbour! It is well worth a visit. The Cornish pasties are lovely. The staff are always very friendly and helpful. We are always very happy with anything we buy in there. It‚Äôs also a great place to pop into and take it away and relax on a bench somewhere. They also have other items in the shop which is locally produced.

Our challenge for our trip to Cornwall was to find the best Cornish pasty and we think we found it at The Chough Bakery. 
The queue was out the door which is always a good sign and the pasty definitely worth waiting for. Fresh, not too thick golden pastry packed full of delicious meat and veg. Not over peppery or soggy like many pasty‚Äôs and really moist. It was also a good size and price.
Highly recommended pasty!!

Review Title: Lovely food friendly staff great cookbook
Review Text: If you want a decent pasty when in Padstow don‚Äôt go anywhere near the Padstow pasty shop go to the chough they always have the very best cooked to perfection in house. Plus many other bakery goods well worth the money if you want a proper Cornish pasty not a plastic nasty replica
Best pasties and scones I‚Äôve ever tasted. Oops dieting now but worth it.  Will definitely be back on our next visit.

Great bakery on the quayside in Padstow. The fresh bread is excellent and we even bought a loaf to take home after our stay in Padstow. I must single out the sausage rolls though as they are fantastic!
I have always hated pasties until I tried the lamb and mint one bought at this bakery in Padstow harbour!! My husband said the traditional was equally fabulous

Good place for a quick pit stop, the almond croissant I had was good and fresh. They have machine made coffee at a self service space right in the back, which is cheap and cheerful. The staff were lovely.

Had a great week in Cornwall and went back to this bakery time and time again to stock up on Bread and Scones!  Would recommend.

What more can I say - the best doughnuts and bread I‚Äôve tasted in a long while!  Huge range of homemade cakes and rolls and bread and pastries and..,.. so much more!  Try it - you‚Äôll not be disappointed !

You can't come to Padstow without a Cornish pasty from Chough's. It's an institution. The staff were really friendly, which must be tough with all the tourists, but they managed it.
Great food.

Review Title: The best pasties in the world
Review Text: A trip to Padstow would not be complete without a pasty from The Chough Bakery. They are simply the best pasties in the world. The pastry is light, the filling is ample and sooo tasty. There are also lots of different pasties to try if you're fed up with traditional Cornish. Their bread and cakes are fabulous too by the way!

Having been to the Chough Bakery for the last 30 odd years we are now very disappointed with the quality of the traditional steak pasties, they are more like vegetable as there is hardly any meat in them, but the price stays the same, one of the most expensive pasties on the market, time to try other options ü•ü.

Fabulous pasty - packed full of Cornish wonder - several to choose from - I went traditional - didn‚Äôt fail to hit the spot and only ¬£4.95. It lasted quite a while on my stroll around the harbour. Simply yummy
We had the traditional Cornish pasties as well as the one with Blue Stilton. Both fabulous and highly recommended.

Whenever we have a day out in Padstow, I make a beeline for the Chough Bakery.  Sausage rolls are generously filled and delicious. The Brownie's... well, making my mouth water just writing this... the best I've ever tasted.  Lots of different breads to choose from, alongside other products such as chutneys, pickles & jams.  Yet to try a pasty (the shame). Always a busy place, so says it all! Looking forward to another visit soon!
Great place as they do Gluten Free Pasties: steak: and also cheese ones, they have lovely array of breads and cakes and a deli collection of other foods and drinks
Had several different pasty‚Äôs over a week by far the best . Even better than a Phillips one as I remembered them from previous visits as a child .

Cut through all the hustle and bustle and find this bakery on the far side. A lot better than rivals with lots of different types of pasties. 

The lamb and mint was gorgeous and preps you well for a walk up the coastal path.
We asked around for the best Cornish pasty...directed here. How right we were. Excellent choice. Light pastry packed with beef steak. Enjoyed

We had a bacon roll and a few cakes from The Chough Bakery during a recent week in Padstowe and it was lovely.

The cottage we stayed at left us some scones jam and clotted cream from here and they were delicious.

Never did work out how every Pasty in Cornwall was Award Winning, but they certainly looked great.

I felt compelled to write a review having literally just left the shop and eaten a pasty, and seeing the damning reviews of the customer service. The ladies were very friendly, offered to warm my pasty despite it being in my hand (I changed my mind about wanting it warm). I had a cocktail pasty, it was absolutely beautiful. So tasty. And a gingerbread man, and treacle tart. All delicious. Cannot be faulted.

Whilst visiting Padstow last weekend went into bakery and bought two large steak pasties ¬£4.50 each. Don't know how they can offer them as steak pasty as we only had three pieces of meat in each. What a let down to visitors when they buy what they think is a steak pasty in fact an insult to a Cornish pasty

A friend recommended you guys. It was lovely to see you offering gluten free options too. I first went in and couldn‚Äôt see any gluten free products but after seeing the sign outside advertising it I decided to head back in. The gluten free products are not out on disable, they are kept separately was is good to hear. 

Fantastic value and the best gluten free scone I‚Äôve ever tasted! It‚Äôs a shame I live 3hrs away otherwise this would become a regular treat. 

The doughnuts that were reduced at the end of the day were fantastic too from what my partner said. They get so soft and fresh.
Tasty, well filled traditional Cornish pasty. Not bad price either, ¬£4.50 for large one. The bread and cakes in this shop look fantastic too. Would have bought some but we were on bikes. Next time.

There is a sign outside the bakery saying that their Pasties had been voted the best in the world and they weren't kidding

Lots of choice of pasty shops in Padstow, but these are definitely the best we have tasted
great location, friendly staff, slightly expanded since last visited has some deli produce along with hot drinks. great tasting pastys.

The Chough Bakery will forever hold a special place in my heart for the warm and friendly service, the kind explanation of what a pasty is and how to eat it, and the scrumptious original pasty I enjoyed (still warm from the over) overlooking the Cornish coast.  They even open early on Sunday (9am) so you can grab another pasty for your drive home.  Highly recommended!

Review Title: What has happened to the sandwiches!!!
Review Text:
What a shame no soup and now the sandwiches are disappearing too!
No white bread sandwiches and now the ham salad with salad cream have disappeared.
I even made an early appearance for my daily sandwich (just in case they had all been sold) but no. Shame.

I was in Padstow, though l would try a pasty from Chough......l was amazed with taste, the filling..l enjoyed it. So much, l discovered they freight them  fresh.....don't have to go to Cornwall....now !!       LOL.

All good stuff so carnt fault the pasties, bread and cakes. Queues form at busy times and staff are sometimes to busy to smile. One of those places that leave you with the feeling that you are only a tourist so won‚Äôt be back...
Good quality bread in a well renowned small bakery on the harbour side- what‚Äôs more to say! Shame we‚Äôd just had a cake at the Cherry Tree Coffee House or I‚Äôd have bought a pasty.
Lovely pasties. Would fully recommend these to people. We have had them before and would go back. Lovely tasting.

At ¬£.3.50 its certainly not for your pound bakery budget but probably the best cornish pasty weve ever eaten.the pasty was absolutely rammed with meat and veg and was worth every penny.glad we dont live in padstow as eating these on a daily basis would certainly hit the waistline as well as the wallet

There is so many pasty options, but these are my favourite. Great choice of bread and other baked items. Nice offering of other goods too - jams, chutneys. If you ever go at Christmas, they do the most amazing mince pies!

Pasties were yummy- we had 2 traditional steaks and 1 Mediterranean vegetable pasty. The MV was a little spicier than we thought but still delicious! The staff attitude and unity could be improved, as they didn‚Äôt seem to communicate well and took a while getting our pasties... however, we understand it was Sunday afternoon so this can be forgiven. Thank you.

Arriving in Padstow for a late lunch after working up an appetite at The Eden Project, the Chough Bakery greeted us as we approached the harbour.  Having read about their award winning credentials, we joined the queue.  Our hearts sunk when we realised there were only 4 traditional pasties left and still plenty of people ahead of us, but by some miracle they all made alternative choices!

We sat an ate them by the harbour wall, crisp pastry protecting the tender peppery filling.  Warm to the end.  It's a good job we had got the last ones or I might have been tempted to rejoin the queue...

Bumped into a mate of mine wandering around Padstow on 2nd Jan, he was just finishing a pasty, I said that look good and asked where did he get from? Choughs he said down on the quay, they really good, nice and peppery, so went to the bakery and got in the queue (always a good sign) and listened to other customers saying "I"ve come to pick up my order of this and that", a fine selection of products were available and I chose a large traditional, it was excellent, Ive had a number of good pasties in Cornwall over the years I've been visiting and this one is right up there, I've since looked at their website and I see that I can order them online, happy days.
What can you say ? Definitely lives up to its reputation. We of course had the Cornish pasties .Delicious, great pastry, tasty filling. Can totally understand the crowds filing through the door!
Probably one of the better pasty makes in Kernow. Loved them that much I had 2. One traditional one and one Mint and lamb bloody gorgeous.

Review Title: lovely cornish pasties, and home made mincepies
Review Text: This shop is so quaint. Such tasty pasties, the medium was filling, but the large was heaven. Got mince pies also and froze them, they are just like home made, and very moreish. bread was good to. a mail order is available, a good alternative  for dinner by post.
Excellent pasties, but stay away from the seagulls as they will steal them. Obviously the local gulls know how good they are.
A family bakery in the centre of the town selling a variety of local food and drinks as well as Delicious pasties!!!  Must visit if you go to Padstow.

What a lovely bakery.
This is a real cornish gem! Friendly staff and great products. First glass cornish pasties!

Of course we had to try the infamous Choughs Pasty. What did we think though? We have tried a few around Cornwall over the years and some have come up better than these sad to say. We served by a guy who we deemed to be slightly rude, and a bit arrogant. He obviously hated small talk about Choughs itself and please of Thankyou did not come easy either. I though it best not to comment on pasty Christmas tree or ask if I could take a photo of it in case he said something other to me I did not like. A sad thing on the supposed tasty pasty front but I feel a little laurel resting may be happening.

Lovely bakery , can recommend bread, almond croissants, Chelsea buns - it‚Äôs really busy and well used by the locals which is always a good sign.

Everything is baked in the shop .

It‚Äôs a grade one listed building - so full of character on the quayside

Popped in because of the clear sign on the street. My wife isn‚Äôt always a pasty fan and requires gluten free diet. We were very impressed. I couldn‚Äôt tell the difference in the pastry between gluten free and not. Really impressed. Also came individually wrapped.

Had pasties from here having walked down the beach to Padstow. 

The pasties are made by the bakery (and are available at some other outlets in the area).

They are larger and a bit rounder than most - good value for money.

As a family trip out to Port Isaac to potter  around shops and see the sea, The Chough bakery was the perfect stop! We went inside the lovely warm shop and ordered some Cornish pasties, sausage rolls and of course a cute gingerbread man. They all tasted absolutely amazing and I‚Äôm glad we stopped there instead of any other shop. This bakery  truly makes the most amazing traditional Cornish pasties!

if you want a real cornish pastie , this is the place to go , get there early ,as the queues form very quickly , but the service is quick so you do not have to wait to long ,but its worth it , we drive 8 miles just to go there to get lunch , its only take away , no eating in ,

In the prime position in Padstow giving it the advantage over the many other 'Pasty' bakeries. 
Sadly there was a rather disinterested member of staff, grumpy really, which was a pity as the two ladies were bright, cheerful and enthusiastic. 
Our order was taken and heated up in their ovens for us. Only when we returned to our accommodation did we find that the gluten free pasty was the wrong one and the lamb and mint was rather gristly and not particularly flavoursome. 
Maybe because it is in the prime position it does not have to try very hard.

We visited Padstow for the day and wanted to take some pasties home for dinner. The bakery were really helpful and kept some back for us to collect later. They were certainly the best pasties we‚Äôve had this holiday and for a very long time. The fillings were delicious and there was plenty of flavour. Don‚Äôt go to the chains around the corner, this is great.

Visited to grab a bite to eat on the go.
There's always such a great selection I struggled to make up my mind, eventually we had the cheese, onion and leek pasty and smoked ham and mushroom quiche.
The pasty was absolutely stuffed full to the brim and was delicious!
The quiche was surprisingly filling without being too dense and is one of the best I've had.
Finished off with a slice of treacle tart that was huge!
Just as good as the food was the service by Chanel, mischief managed!
Thank you, recommended!

Love the bread and scones and pasties 
Now selection of drinks etc improved, but still just go for the bakery 
Will keep returning and enjoying
After hearing Pass The Pasty on BBC Radio 1 earlier this year, we had to sample an original Cornish Pasty and they did not disappoint. Absolutely handsome pasties!

Need to get here early as it's in a prime location right in the corner of the harbour at the front.
Had a couple of loaves-lovely taste. Cakes also. Don't expect much to be around after lunch. Very popular and they close early if they run out of produce.
Best pasty‚Äôs ever, tasty tasty tasty, don‚Äôt miss it, did I mention tasty. !!  Busy place busy staff but still pleasant.

Best pasty's and friendly service with lots of sweets also on offer.
It was busy but they were getting through the customers efficiently.

A busy Sunday. Lots of visitors around the harbour but ask though bakery for a traditional pasty at lunchtime to be told..sorry we don't have any standard ones ready. 
Oh dear..loads of potential customers and no stock ready to sell...
I was the second customer I saw to walk away dissatisfied only to then visit and purchase a ready product from a nearby outlet. Can you afford to see customers walk away to buy someone else's products ? Obviously you can. So Unlike Arnold Schwarzenegger...I won't be back.
Had a traditional  Cornish Pasty and it was to die for piping hot fluffy pastry   I can see why they won best Pasty award. First class
Really good authentic pasties. Delicious! Right on the harbour so easily found. Various flavours and good availability. Seem to supply most of the cafes and bakery's in the area

Always visit this establisment when visiting Padstow.  Absolutely delicious shortbread we also bought scones, clotted cream and strawberry conserve to make our own cornish cream tea.  The produce sold in this bakery is out of this world.  Always bring shortbread back home as gifts for friends and family.
Ordered carrot cake, lemon drizzle cake, Chelsea bun and a Victoria sponge cake. Carrot cake and Victoria sponge filling tasted of butter, not a pleasant taste at all.
Had the original Cornish Pastie and very nice they were. This bakery was very busy but well worth the wait. Great location in town centre
good overall to much pepper in cornish pasty but lots of meat,very good for a quick snack, would give it 8 out of 10

Perfect pasty! Best so far. Went en route (kind of) from Newlyn to Tintagel and was not disappointed. Only had the steak and blue cheese so got original in the car for later but perfectly meaty with perfectly flaky buttery crust. Yum yum yum! Wish I bought more. I feel a mail order coming along.
Had it pasty at May Contain Nuts and love it. There are a range of things to buy back home too. Bought back raspberry curd since it is interesting. Nice stuff here surely.

Got to the bakery just as the closed sign was placed in the window, they reopened and served up freshly baked pasties.
Great taste will go back for more.
Literally the best pasties ever! Couldn‚Äôt find any to rival them all week so we went back & bought a box of 10 for the freezer on our last day of our holiday. Still taste perfect now!

What a fantastic place the pasties were the best I've ever tasted pastry thin full of tender steak we also had the quiche moorish will take some home for the freezer staff so lovely and chatty 
E

Review Title: Thank you for my special pasties!
Review Text:
A newly diagnosed onion allergy left me feeling desolate that I might never eat another pasty again. An email to the Chough Bakery to enquire wether they could whip me up an onion free batch made my day, my week, my holiday! And they were delicious! Thank you sooooo very much! 

My weird issues aside, the rest of my family could attest to the deliciousness of their other baked goods - the saffron buns and treacle tart in particular were big hits and multiple purchases made.  The extra calories should keep them all warm this winter anyway ; )
Great bread and great pasties.  If you are looking for something quick in Padstow you cannot go wrong here.

Bacon baps to takeaway are delicious. 
We tried others in town but not a patch on this bakery. 
Cornish pasties are tasty too. 
Very friendly service.
We popped in for a snack and walked out with an array of fabulous Cornish spiced rum and beers....A wonderful advertisement of producing Cornish products....plus the pasties are top notch !!
This is a small but high quality bakery. Sensibly priced we always buy something here if visiting Padstow.
Traditional bakery made even more famous by the TV but still manages to produce great Cornish products.

Can't beat perfectly cooked warm pasties to start a long walk from Padstow to Constantine Bay.  He had the traditional medium with robust end crust and I went for the diary free vegan meditarean which kept its crusty edge with a tasty roasted vegetable sauce centre.  Couldn't resist the bread pudding for bench stop lunch later so he took a large hot sausage roll with crispy pastry.   They also had these adorable pasty looking dog toys that looked like the real thing I brought for my mum and dad's dog.   Topped with fast speedy service we were set for the day ahead.
Great pasties from this lovely traditional bakery in Cornwall, well worth the wait (as the queues can be quite long). Try the sourdough bread it's fab.

Over the years I've eaten hundreds of pasties and always found the Chough's the most authentic,tasty,reliable and well filled.I've always found the staff helpfully and cheerful.The limited range is just right .I like the steak and blue cheese pasties or the large traditional one and my wife likes the Mediterranean Vegetable one. There are at least five shops that bake pasties but the Chough is the best.

Open at 8 in the morning serving freshly made bread and pastries and PASTIES!
The 2018 Pasty Baking Champion. Good service and friendly people. On the harbour front and well worth a visit.

On our little weekend away we wanted to try a pasty and we was pleased to find this little bakery.
We visited at 4pm so there wasn‚Äôt much left (cake) but I‚Äôm guessing it was nearly sold out because it was so yummy.
I had a Cornish pasty which was cooked to perfection, nice and hot with the nicest pastry and bursting with filling.
Hubby had the cheese onion and leek which he said was delicious.
Would definitely visit again

Very popular place just on the harbour front. 

We got here early 930 ish just as the Cornish pasties we‚Äôre coming out of the oven. 

We purchased 2 and 2 almond croissants plus a dog sausage. 

The quality of all the products was very good.

Review Title: Still the Best Pasty in the World... But also best Jam Doughnut
Review Text: For years I have told people of the Holy Grail of Pasties. How this is the one. Should anyone wish to know the true meaning of Pasty come here. Today again my beliefs were reaffirmed. EXCELLENT. However, today a new legend was tasted. The Jam Doughnut... Fluffy, lovely tasting dough and just right quantity of Jam. Next week I fear will be an email pleading for them by post! Keep it up great work

Review Title: The Best Pasty and best scone award goes to.....
Review Text:
..... The Chough Bakery!

Believe the hype.... both were really very good - the best I‚Äôve had bar none!

The person who served me was also very helpful and genuine.

All round I was equally impressed with the service, pasty and scones!

Straight to the point!
The best pasty in Cornwall bar none.
We have tried others all over Cornwall and none come close...end of!
Nice lunch break takeaway. Fresh food at a reasonable price.  Would recommend you try them.  They seem to be the local bakery of choice.

Was advised to try this Bakery by another Bakery in town as they thought they did "Gluten Free", well they were right! Ready and waiting to be heated through, no having to wait 30 minutes whilst they were made up out the back etc. Really good, full of ingredients and a lovely pastry, I removed the pasty from its plastic bag it had been heated in to cool it down in its paper bag and it fell apart so had to juggle with it to eat it but it was excellent.  As others have mentioned the staff also chose to ignore us when we entered for a good few minutes, not a good way to welcome customers at all, but if you are that popular and have people queuing then perhaps there is no need to smile or be engaging, so if you are the gentleman with the "black earring" you are the one that eventually served us, leave the sultriness to Polldark.

Having been all around Cornwall and an avid pasty lover myself and my wife can say their Cornish pasty is up there as the best!  Full of quality meat ( unlike some full of potatoes ) beautiful pastry . Ace location by the harbour . Worth the visit and at times the queue !

Walked in shop totally ignored by staff looked at you as if you were invisible eventually got served got a large &medium pasty for me and my husband his had gristle in it and both where over peppered had a better pasty from the pasty shop in port Isaac two days earlier won't return
Simply the best pasty‚Äôs in Cornwall, the service how we can be a bit haphazard when it‚Äôs busy but I guess this is to be expected.
I will keep this very short and simple... This place makes and sells the very best Cornish pasties I have ever eaten.

We had Mediterranean pasties as we‚Äôve just gone mostly vegetarian. Very nice indeed. Nice and spicy.
Although there was a queue we didn‚Äôt have to wait long at all.
Easy to find as it is right on the Quay front.

This is the first time I've ever found a VEGAN pasty in Cornwall and was SO impressed that I went back and bought 3 more!! I will happily live off these next time I visit Padstow! Thank you Chough Bakery!! ‚ù§Ô∏è

The pasty that we had from here excellent and the i love the deli items in the shop, the reason for 3 stars is because of the rude staff who just choose to ignore us for a few minutes while they had a chat about what they wathced on telly last night

Review Title: Seriously the best Scones I have ever eaten.....And I have eaten a lot!!!!
Review Text:
We have visited Cornwall for the last 5 years and every time we come I have to have scones from here.
They are like little fluffy pillows of joy.I can not eat them fast enough.....think of the Cookie Monster with cookies....well that‚Äôs me with there scones only I don‚Äôt drop any bits!!!!
I love them.
Thank you and who ever makes them and how ever you make they should be made a Knight or Dame.
Big love always.

Review Title: Why is this Pasty so good
Review Text:
It is just a pasty, it is not complicated. You can even buy the recipe, there are no magic ingredients. 

Maybe the others are just not trying.

Review Title: Best pasty we have had in Cornwall
Review Text: We have eaten quite a few pastry for our lunch  whilst in Cornwall. We both thought this was the best,good size lovely pastry and lots of fillings. What more is there to say .

Review Title: The best so far by miles
Review Text:
Smiling staff, the smell of baked goods and quite simply the best pasty I have ever eaten. I went traditional but a number of other options.
Tip: they are very hot. I recommend biting the top off to allow steam out and browsing the shops for ten minutes while it cools.

Review Title: Little gem in tucked away location
Review Text: Called here for rolls and look at the range of local spirits/ wines. Very busy little shop that operated 2 till queue system which helps. Products looked good and at a good price for Padstow. Go on give it a try.
So many pasty shops in Padstoe and although we haven't tried them all, ehat we can say is this is one of the best Cornish pasties we've eaten... Very yummy! Prices are very reasonable too!

Visited every day, often more than once, during our Padstow holiday.
Bought bags of hot breakfast rolls for the family every day which were huge and stuffed full of bacon etc. The bread and scones are lovely. The carrot cake was light and delicious, best I‚Äôve ever had- but the Victoria sponge was heavy and the brownie far too dark for my teens to enjoy. Croissants very good. Traditional pasty very peppery but not unpleasant. 
Also loved the jar of passion fruit curd- had to buy more to take home. Look out for the sandwiches which are fresh, and very good value.
Very friendly older lady serving.

Review Title: No visit to Cornwall without Chough!
Review Text: Anything they make is lovely‚Ä¶ pasties, sausage rolls, ALL the sweet stuff! Always bring a selection home with us...brownie, millionaires shortbread, tiffin, (husbands favourite, bread pudding!)

Review Title: Best cheese and onion pasty ever
Review Text:
What more can I say I had to have 2 . No vile mashed potato mush , sliced potatoes with lovely seasoning cheese and onions. 
Amazing

People were queuing outside the door, but we were served quickly. 
The award winning pasty is delicious! 
My son assembled his own ‚Äúsweet and savoury‚Äù pasty as it seems impossible to find this mythical delight these days in Cornwall!

Continues to produce exceptional items however the sausage rolls are soooo salty it‚Äôs unpleasant have had this before but thought maybe a one off. Now convinced it‚Äôs not a one off and definitely needs looking at.
Sad to see other bakery‚Äôs expanding around the area and where you used to be able to buy a choughs pasty now it‚Äôs another and not as good :(
We walk down to the Chough bakery every day for all our bread and croissants. ü•ê deliciousness!! Very reasonable prices too.

Cornish pasties to die for!
Beautiful plain scones which I prefer. Everything they do is amazing, well worth a visit for bread, savouries  & scones

Very good pasty.
Visited early on Bank Holiday Monday.
As others have mentioned, I could see one member of staff was losing patience already on what was bound to be a very busy day.
To be fair, I would gladly suffer a couple of minutes of surliness for a good pasty.
Better than a crap pasty and a smile.

So thus is mainly a bakery but it also offers local produce including spirits, such as Cornish gin. Gluten free pasties were available and they are very tasty indeed. Service was excellent and staff very knowledgable. Highly recommended!

A good bakery, but the main reason to go is the pasties. However, the quality can vary. Normally we've found them to be delicious, but there always seems to be a risk of too much pepper having been added to a particular batch

This bakery was incredibly busy when we visited it on a summer day in Padstow. Therefore, we knew it would be good! The pasties were hot, fresh and full of filling. The chicken, bacon, leek and cheese is my personal recommendation. The cakes are also super- try the jam doughnut. Amazing!

Really enjoyed our pasties from here - nice pastry but lots of filling too. Just right. Obviously a popular place but we didn't have to queue for too long and the lady who served us was really friendly. Definitely recommend.
Love these pasties - and I am not a big pasty fan.  But these I can't resist!!  buy them every time we go near Padstow and have brought a box home this time to enjoy.   Buy 10 - get 2 free, ¬£34

Got pasties for the whole family here and was very pleased to find they do great traditional pasties plus great vegan pasties so could get lovely food all in the same shops to meet all our needs. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the price was very reasonable, we will be coming here again next time we are in Padstow

Review Title: Lovely pasties, not so lovely staff
Review Text: Have visited padstow a number of times over the years and always gone to chough  bakery, it‚Äôs always packed out with customers, pasties are the best in our opinion they are peppery and full of veg and meat which we like , but the staff are really rude and miserable which I can only account for it being so busy, never been in and been served with a friendly face, so we order and go, shame really as it has a good name but not for customer service.

Went here because there was a que , and lots good reviews.but it just shows service does count , and here there is non !
The facts -  the much raved about pasty , are ok , no better no worse than any of the numerous and much friendlier places selling them , the range of deli produce including chutneys and preserves are much more affordable than rick steins that is clearly evident , what is seriously lacking is any hint of politeness, customer service or  hint of civility!
For the sake of tourism and hype long may the stack them high approach keep choughs till ringing in the money , my advice is be clever spend your money elsewhere and enjoy the product and service,
Perfect pasty EVERY time!!! Friendly helped staff!! Perfectly located by harbour. Kids loved taking their pasty down the slip path.

Review Title: The pasties, bread and cakes are amazing .. but when it comes to a jam doughnut ...!!
Review Text:
Oh my ! The best I have ever had !!! 

You really cannot beat the speciality breads etc here and the hot sausage in roll for breakfast was pretty good too!

Had to have a pasty in Padstow and so choose Choughs because of its reputation and we were not disappointed.  Lovely pasty with a good crust which can sometimes be not nice to eat.  Good value for money and a really good traditional pasty.

We popped in for bacon rolls prior to a boat trip, produce all fresh and delicious, importantly staff all friendly, quite a feat this late in the holiday season.Going back to buy local ales and spirits which are also on offer.

Review Title: Great bakery, all local and properly local
Review Text:
This is the place to get you home grown, hand made Cornish pasty. Good variety all made on the premises and very tasty.

A huge queue is a good indicator of quality.

I live in the North so I know a thing or two about meat & veg encrusted in pastry. This place was without-a-doubt the best Pasty shop I have ever been to. Over our week-long stay in Padstow, we worked our way through the standard Cornish steak pasty, steak & blue cheese and Chicken & Leek. All were outstanding. Much like us trying to find a seat in the busy harbour frankly.

Ignore the people moaning about the staff, you'd be a bit grumpy if you had to spend 7-days a week serving tourists too. Some people are just not people people. Whatever. It doesn't detract from the delicious wares on offer and they were so good we got a dozen to take home with us (that, I might add, filled the car with a heady aroma of meat, pepper and pastry. I'm surprised I managed to resist eating them all on the hard shoulder of the M6).

Thank you Chough Bakery, you moody, beautiful, delicious people!
My husband and I had a cheese and onion pasty. It was so nice to have a decent quality and tasty vegetarian pasty. Served warm, plenty of filling and pastry wasn't dry. Loved it!
Tried all the local pasties and these are the tastiest. Excellent, friendly service. Also good to support a local business.

Pasties were lovely. But wished we had gone in yesterday as a previous reviewer one day ago said staff were very friendly. We are friendly polite people and purchased a box of mixed pasties and a couple extra. Bill came to nearly ¬£70 - which is a bit pricey, but we wanted them. However we were served by the rudest off hand young lady you could possibly imagine. You might think this was a one off, but sadly not, we were served by an older lady a couple of days ago who was equally uninterested - had to wait in the empty shop to be noticed, after being given a stiff ignoring. Yes the pasties are nice, but we bought some lovely pasties from a lovely lady in the Padstow Pasty shop just around the corner on the same day. We went to the Chough Bakery again today to taste an award winning pasty. They may win awards for their pasties and indeed are trading off of their 2016 award winning pasties, BUT they certainly aren't going to win any awards for their customer service. Avoid unless you don't mind being treated with distain.

Lovely to have the option of a vegan pasty in padstow. My partner had the Cornish pasty and said it was one of the best he's ever had but mine was a little squishy if not lovely. Really reasonably priced for such a good location though.

Lovely filling pasties and tasty produce. A little on the pricey side though. ¬£4.20 for a steak and blue cheese pasty! Queue was out the door but service is super quick. Would still recommend as the food is good quality.
Not just absolutely brilliant pasties a great bakery, excellent sandwiches. Second year going to bakery still very high standards

A great bakery. They also do fantastic sandwiches which are great for taking to the beach. A good selection, with very generous fillings. Cakes are also good, the best thing I had though, the almond croissant! Has to be the best I‚Äôve ever had.
First lunch had to be a traditional Cornish pasty. This one didn‚Äôt disappoint - just the correct amount of pepper and really tasty and lean beef. Spot on!
One of many bakerys in Padstow but we beleive the best, but only by a short head. Bread and Cornish pasties freshly made and served, would be good to see the odd smile from some of the young staff.

Wanted a quick bite to eat after walking from Wadebridge and all fancied pasties so amongst the busel we spotted Choughs. Good selection so two traditional, a steak and blue cheese and a lamb and mint and all were delicious and fair to say amongst the best we've had in Cornwall.
This isn‚Äôt just any pasty it‚Äôs a chough bakery pasty, large queue and a long wait for the gluten free option. Nice food if your happy to wait.
First time in Padstow, first creme tea.  Scones were lovely and clotted creme was amazing.  Also had the pleasure of eating a traditional Pasty, which was fantastic.

When you have been outdoors in the fresh sea air either walking, swimming, sailing or just beach combing, and you're getting hungry - then there is no better satisfying option than a Cornish pasty from the Chough Bakery. The lamb and mint is especially fine! But all the classic versions are excellent. Just a point to note that one of our group was a vegan and she chose this option, however the lack of flavour was not only surprising but disappointing to her as we had made a special trip for this. Keep up the good work, but please do some spot checks on the vegan pasty - Cheers
Can see why they have one awards.  Had many pasties in Cornwall however this was loaded and also slightly spicy.  Highly recommended

Review Title: Lovely Pasties, and great sausage rolls!
Review Text: I‚Äôve been to Choughs a many times and it never disappoints, ever! The pasties are traditional and full of that traditional taste, and good value for money too! If you want a pasie in Padstow, defiantly come he
Thank you for providing a tasty vegan pasty.  As far as we know, the only vegan pasty in Padstow?  Friendly staff.

Was attracted to this place the first time round by the numerous awards they seem to have one, and the queue out of the door!

I wasn‚Äôt disappointed. After queuing for a few minutes, I was greeted with a good choice of food and ordered two pasties (¬£8). Both were excellent and we will be going back. Well recommended!
We had a couple of pasties whilst we were visiting Padstow last week. They were excellent and would recommend them if you are visiting.

Popped in for a lunchtime pasty, always busy and always has a queue outside and can see why, had a large Cornish pasty that was full with filling and flavour, highly recommended and puts chain outlets to shame

As a family who regularly come to Cornwall we have frequented the Chough many happy times. Sadly the traditional is far too ‚Äò peppery‚Äô for my kids. We bought traditional for the kids and both were left as they said they were too peppery. After a taste I couldn‚Äôt eat it either. I gave them the benefit of doubt and tried again later in week thinking it was probably a bad batch and sadly too peppery. Shame as we love this place but will now be looking for another pasty venue x ps the Cornish blue however is lovely x

This place always has big queues outside but I am at a loss to see why. We boycotted it a couple of years ago after buying very expensive pasties and pastries that actually weren‚Äôt very nice. For some reason I decided to give it another go this visit and bought the kids sausage rolls and I had a piece of quiche......the sausage rolls were desperate.....I don‚Äôt know where the sausage meat came from but it was it was bright pink, the kids aren‚Äôt fussy but by the time they‚Äôd reached the little park by the car park they were asking to throw them away. I ended up buying them both a sausage roll from Tesco (¬£1 each as opposed to the ¬£2.20 the Chough charge) and they were wolfed down. The quiche wasn‚Äôt much better. I won‚Äôt go back, there are far nicer pasty shops in the town.
Freshly baked home cooked pasties . Excellent gourmet burgers and steak baguettes .Bostin fittle . If in Padstow a must to visit .
A staple for your daily bread (and pasty!) in Padstow. Excellent sourdough. Delicious cakes/ pastries, and the traditional Cornish pasty is a winner

We were recommended the Chough Bakery buy the people who we rented our cottage from. They were hot with great tasting fillings. There are other pasty shops, but we think we found the best. Prices are reasonable when you consider these are like a main meal.

You can see why they have won so many awards for their pasties.   They really are amazing - crisp pastry and a great quality filling.   The bacon baps first thing in the morning take some beating too.
Great saffron loaves and buns, and sliced granary. Pleasant shop with friendly staff. A good range of pastries available at a reasonable price too.

probably the best pasties in the world as Carlsberg don't do them!!
they also have a large selection of gins and other stuff.  I could spend a fortune in there every time I go in!

In Padstow for another attraction and wanted to buy a selection of pasties for dinner.  I was lucky to be there as a fresh batch came out of the oven.  They were too hot the hold.  The queue looked long but we were served very fast.  I want to go back and taste their cakes.

I always head to Choughs for a large Traditional Pasty. Their recipe is fabulous with one surprising ingredient which makes it. The Pasty is full of excellent meat and the quality is second to none. The only thing i dont understand is WHY! Do all pasties makers mess about with the ingredients....the only TRUE pasty is a traditional

We made 2 visits to this shop, both early afternoon (1 - 2pm) and they were sold out of vegan pasties.  This was not in the busy season.  The shop was very busy but they were obviously sold out of lots of other things too.  Very disappointing.

These are hands down the best scones ever - they are so fluffy, buttery and rich and blow every other scone out of the water. Their pasties are also fantastic, delicious with a lot of filling and the pastry isn‚Äôt too stodgy or dry! Will definitely be returning.
Loved the pasties,in our opinion the best in town,poor staff run off their feet most days as so busy,not the best laid out of shops due to size and shape so be prepared to queue.

Just popped in here at lunchtime to pick up a few of their famous traditional pasties.  They may cost a little more than some others, but they are well worth it. My teen kids and I all had the large pasties, which were packed full and tasted great. We certainly didn‚Äôt need any more to eat that afternoon!
Had a few Chough bakery pasties on my trip round Cornwall and they are definitely the best! Lovely pastry and generous, tasty filling.

We were told to try the best Cornish pasties at The chough bakery.  I opted for the lamb and mint which wasn‚Äôt great but the others in our party chose the traditional and they were excellent.  So much so that they went back the next day for more.  Be prepared to queue at lunch time.
Really yummy pasties with a few different ones to choose from. Beef & Cornish cheese and Lamb mint & veg the best ones. A bit pricey though.

Wanted a pasty to tide me over between lunch and dinner. Had a large traditional steak pasty for ¬£4.50.

It was delicious and was piping hot. 

Ate it on a nearby bench.

Padstow is not cheap, but this pasty was good value.
Sorry but I've had better custard tarts from a supermarket. Very soggy bottom with very little taste.

Chough in my mind produce just to best Pasties ever. Not sure why but they do win awards and the taste test will confirm. You will often see a queue , I wonder why ? . Sausage rolls for me although a salt fan too salty.
Wonderful Croissants and bread-excellent food. Had a makeover too since we last visited a few years ago. Cakes looked amazing too.

Review Title: Poor service but the male cashier.
Review Text: Went to Chough‚Äôs to get a pastie at lunchtime following a long bike ride. Could have gone to 1 of 5 or 6 bakeries in Padstow. Went to Chough‚Äôs because it was recommended. Won‚Äôt be going again. Walked through the door to a sign saying ‚Äòuse both tills‚Äô so walked up to the right hand till managed by a man. The man looked up and said ‚Äòthere‚Äôs a line over there you‚Äôll have to get to the back of it‚Äô I said the sign says use either till. He said ‚Äònot when there‚Äôs a line‚Äô. His manner was rude, off hand and aggressive. I went to stand behind the line he had pointed at. The woman on the other till looked up and mouthed ‚Äòsorry‚Äô and then served me. She was extremely kind and helpful. Why do people have to be like that. I suspect he didn‚Äôt care given the number of tourists that used the shop. I certainly won‚Äôt be going there again and I advise others not to as well.
Highly recommend the traditional and steak & blue cheese pasties. Light pastry and plenty of filling! Jam doughnut was crisp in the outside and fluffy on the inside with just the right amount of jam!

Review Title: best cornish pasty  I have ever had
Review Text: had cornish pasties before but these are the best I have ever  tasted fantastic I will never go anywhere else when in Cornwall

Interested to read the review posted here earlier today as I had a very similar experience. Walked into an empty bakery save for two sales assistants who both saw me. A woman they knew came in and proceeded to gossip with both of them while I waited and waited to be served. The guy could win prizes for ignoring customers rather than the so called award winning pasties. Another group walked in and he asked if he could help them, seeing me, they invited me to go first. He looked through me and then resumed listening to the gossiper not serving any of us. At this point I walked out and we bought some delicious pasties around the corner. Reading some of the reviews on here though we may have had a lucky escape.

On my first visit to this bakery I was studiosly ignored by the chap behind the counter (reminded me of the actor Tim Curry), who eventually called someone over to serve me. A bought a loaf and very nice it was too. I visited again a couple of days later to buy some bread and this time he was on the phone and again completely ignored me; I was the only one at the counter. Shortly after three younger, well dressed (in polo casual style) came in and he immediately stopped what he was doing and asked them what they would like. I piped up that I wanted some bread and he still carried on looking at them. One of the young men gestured to me 'you first', but the guy still didn't come over and called me to the end of the counter. At this point I just shrugged and walked out. I went to Steins bakery around the corner for bread and saffron buns (fantastic) and the service was charming.
Best (traditional) Cornish pasty I‚Äôve had anywhere at anytime. Beautiful bread baked fresh in the mornings too

Stayed in Padstow for my husbands birthday and was really looking forward to having a gluten free pasty as they advertise they sell. We went in Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday and paid a special trip on Tuesday before leaving and there was no gluten free pasty in sight ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è they simply advertise something they don‚Äôt sell. Would love to have rated the food but can‚Äôt. The service however needs improving, rude staff.
Easily the best pasty i've ever had. Just watch out for the Seagulls outside as i think pasties are a delicacy for them.

Review Title: A must for daily fresh bread
Review Text: Opens at 8am, we have fresh bread every day. Always served with a smile. The apricot crumble is delicious. Bought the cook book as well. I can‚Äôt wait to try and recreate the recipes when I get home.
Been here several times, Cornish pasties (was a 2016 winner) cakes are good and it's also worth having the coffee which is lovely.
Great pasties and great range of chutneys and foods. Reasonably priced, right on harbour front. Went late in the day but they still had pasties left as they bake throughout the day.
Great bakery that does some wonderful breads. I bought a sourdough and honey loaf. Delicious and healthy too.

Cracking little shop opposite the harbour serves cracking pasties and lush sausage rolls ect, best in padstow and they do a bacon bap and coffee for ¬£4,just what you need after an early morning cycle from wadebridge

Normally buy pasties from shops in the main drag in Padstow but this year, after being a bit disappointed last year, bought them here. Very nice too, lots of meat and great seasoning. Really enjoyed them, but the only thing I would say is the local seagulls make eating them by the harbour a nightmare. They are consistently looking to dive bomb and some are the size of cats. They have no fear, so keep an eye open for air raids, particularly on your youngsters. Not sure what the council can do about them but they are becoming a major nuisance here, taking away some of the enjoyment.

We‚Äôve been buying pasties from here for years and each time, like yesterday we buy them the taste just seems to be even better. These pasties are world beaters and they can prove it. They have a secret ingredient which you can only find out if you go and buy one. Always very hot and deformed always scrumptious.
Nicest pasties we had during our week in Cornwall. Also tried some excellent bread and cakes , the apricot crumble was delish!
Tried them all in Padstow, Chough‚Äôs by far the best pasty.  The traditional ones are fantastic and the Steak and Cornish Blue simply melt in your mouth.  They also do a fantastic sausage roll.

My wife and I paid a visit to this establishment on 5th 
June 2018 and ordered 2 pasties. They were delicious , tasty and  appetising  I would recommend this place.
By far the best pasties in Cornwall. Consistently good and voted world pasty champions for a reason. Don‚Äôt waste your time elsewhere
Great bread, pasties and cakes. Everything is beautifully presented and tastes lovely. Not overly pricey considering the Padstow location. Just be prepared to queue at busy times in peak season.

Review Title: Quite simply the best pasty ever
Review Text: These award winning pasties are well worth queuing for. Cornwalls finest. You can now but other local products such as gin, jam chutneys etc.
We love Choughs and have visited many times. This time, as always, the pasties were hot, and delicious. Packed full of wholesome local produce, they can't be beaten

My husbands priority for our trip to Cornwall was to have a cornish pasty and he was not disappointed. It was delicious!

Would recommend this bakery if you want to try an authentic pasty.
The best pasty I've had  very busy but worth the wait.! And you can see why they are world champions!
Nice spot for a Pasty - was freezing when we visited but the pasty warmed me up. One of the better ones in the area.

Popped in for a couple of loaves and some Doughnuts and got to say the bread is fantastic.

Loved it!!

I always find choosing a pasty place difficult. They all make great claims. 

Here however, the claim of World Championship winning Pasties made my decision easier when In Padstow. Had to check it out. 

And I agreed. Good pastry - firm and structurally sound, no collapsing here. Meat to potato ratio was well balanced, and a fantastic about of pepper. 

Best pasty I've had all week!

If you fancy a real Cornish Pasty then the Chough Bakery is the place to get them. All types are sold here including vegetarian pasties. Delicious pastry and side crimped the Cornish way. Lovely staff and lovely pasties right by Padstow Harbour.

Down again to visit grandmother. We‚Äôve been coming here and sampling their delicious pasty for years. This time I was blown away by the service behind the counter. My 3 year old wanted some tiffin but they had ran out by the time we went back 15 minutes later (must be popular). Not to worry as the Lovely lady behind the counter made sure she went away happy with a ginger bread Man. Have a wonderful summer everyone! Thanks again and see you soon.

Very good pasties, good looking cakes,
They are the best tasting pasties that we have had in padstow.

When in Cornwall you have to have a pasty and a cream tea.  We went to Choughs on recommendation from a local  and found the pasties to be very tasty with lots of meat and nice pastry.  I had a traditional and my partner had a chicken, leek and cheese.  Both nice and a good selection of bread also.
Seemed like a "must do" eatery in Padstow but the pasties were just average and just warm. The pasties at the National Trust were the best.

We visit Padstow every time we visit Cornwall. One place on our things to do is Choughs Bakery. 
The pasties are exceptional. The staff wonderfully friendly.
A visit is a must.

During our week in Cornwall we tasted a few pasty‚Äôs and these were our favourite. My husband had traditional Cornish and I had chicken, leak, bacon in a creamy (made with clotted cream) cheese sauce. It was delicious. Just the right temperature as well.

Location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield
Review Text: Best prawn sandwich ever eaten!  Pasties were cooking - fab smell.  Would recommend.  Friendly staff.  Great position.
We took two pasties home for tea. The standard Pasty was very meaty but also very peppery (which it should be) and I would say we like the one with cheese best of all although both were delicious.

Blue cheese pasty was nice. Traditional was good (although championship winning title is debatable I must say - little meat content). I didn‚Äôt like the organic pear juice. Carrot cake was just ok. Good service.

I‚Äôll keep it short and sweet, I refuse to give my money to people if they cannot even be polite back. The man behind the counter is so rude and obnoxious, zero customer service skills. It‚Äôs quite normal this day and age to actually say hello, service with a smile and of course the occasional please or thank you. There‚Äôs plenty of other bakery‚Äôs in Padstow so it‚Äôs no loss to me not buying from here!
good tasting pasty. gluten free options available. good prices. well worth a visit. didn't have chance to try anything else but it did sell a variety of buns, sandwich etc
