i can confirm from the locals (my in laws!) that this is the place to get your pasties from! Veggy and vegan options available.
Tastiest Cornish gluten free pasture that I‚Äôve ever tasted. That I had to have two haha. You‚Äôll not be disappointed.

If you visit Cornwall you will see a hundred claims for the best pasty, but in my experience this is the best one I‚Äôve tasted. It was the award winning one. I found it full of meat and veg with delicious pastry. It was quite peppery...beware. Eaten opposite listening to lovely street music on a harbour wall bench on a sunny day in the lovely town of Padstow. Bliss.

Review Title: I highly recommend their Cornish Pasties
Review Text: Having had many Cornish Pasties over my 70 years of existence Chough Bakeries Pasties are by far the best! The vegetables are well cooked instead of being lumpy and this, along with their specific recipes makes all the difference. I'd definitely visit Padstow again and again if only to devour more Clough Cornish Pasties!

Pasties are fab here - they come in medium (which is quite big) to large (which is pretty big!).  My favourite is the cheese, onion and leek.  Good service and right on the harbour at padstow so easy to get to for us from the biking trail on the camel estuary

I have been buying pasties from here for some time and they have gone from strength to strength. The Steak and Cornish Blue Cheese is sublime. Plenty of steak and a goof "hit" of blue. So good I have brought some home with me.

5 different pasties purchased. Only 1 of them was hot the rest were all cold. Pretty disappointing as this was recommended as one of the best in the area. Plenty of other shops available serving hot produce

Review Title: Worst pasty ever - and that includes Ginsters.
Review Text: So, enjoying the May Day 'Obby Oss celebrations and thought I'd buy a couple of pasties for me and the missus. What a mistake! For a start  they aren't cheap and then  the example I was given couldn't be described as a pasty. Being May Day I guess they were just turning them out as quickly as possible as mine wasn't properly cooked and fell apart in the bag. Unable to eat it I returned it to the shop with a description of what I thought (unprintable). My wife didn't even try to eat hers and that went back as well. I was so angry that I didn't waste my time asking for a refund but rest assured I will not visit the Chough Bakery again. This type of poor service will not go down well with tourists or indeed us locals. Probably best avoided as others we spoke to today said they were at best 'variable' in quality and sometimes only partly cooked which is what we experienced. Badly done Chough, badly done indeed.

Review Title: Now that‚Äôs what I call a Pasty!
Review Text: Just had a large Traditional whilst looking at the May Day decorations and all I can say is amazing! The pastry and the filling were so nice I ordered a box full to take away. The Choughs reputation is well deserved.
Went here on day we left Padstow as had brilliant reviews and won awards. Was not disappointed as they were gorgeous so much meat in them. And the most tasty pastry. Would recommend.

Review Title: Quite possibly the best pasties in Cornwall
Review Text:
We visit Cornwall several times a year and are always on the search for the best pasty in Cornwall. In this part of North Cornwall the competition is between Chough's and M Barnicotts. These pasties are the best in Padstein! The competition is not available in Padstow but are in Wadebridge so visit both while in the area.
Chough's in Padstow are often queued out the door so be patient.

Review Title: Fab Pasties but please sort your scones out!
Review Text: The pasty‚Äôs are always the best, so tasty! But we have been coming to Padstow for a few years and I noticed this yesterday and last time we were here, when you open the scones you are hit by the smell of margarine, and you can taste it as well. I‚Äôm no star baker but I do make scones and I would never in a million years use margarine!! All butter scones please! I know it‚Äôs probably more expensive but using margarine that smells and tastes that strong is just sacrilege! A cream tea in Cornwall is an institution, but in future I‚Äôll make my own or buy elsewhere. Sorry
recommend the traditional and the steak and blue cheese. Lamb and mint also very tasty. Lots of meat and filling. Great service. Opens on a sunday too!
Great bakery and pasties. Lovely fillings and reasonably prices pasties.great for taking on a walk along the beach

Review Title: Best Pasty I Have Ever Had
Review Text: Woah... just had a Traditional Pasty and it was amazing!! ¬£3.25 for a medium (you don‚Äôt need to get the large unless you are really hungry) which is stuffed to the brim with locally sourced ingredients... that is what makes them the best, definitely going to try and come back here while in Cornwall this week!!
Takeaway bakery in the heart of Padstow. A must for scones, sausage rolls, cakes and pasties to die for ! Wonderful food at a good price.

The Chough used to be THE BEST but to my utter dismay they had the nerve to MICROWAVE a pasty I ordered!
Guys, You already know, NEVER ZAP a pasty!!!

Lovely pasties and cakes 
Go for an original pasty bloomin lovely 
Choc brownie n cream slice later 
2 choughed customers üòÅüê∑üëçüèº
Bought the box of 12 pasties to bring home, outstanding as usual, the staff were helpful and very efficient

We only had two scones to take away - one fruit & one plain.  The addition of a sprinkle of sugar on the top made for very tasty scones.

The person who served us even opened a sealed packet so we could get the ordered we wanted.

I haven't tested a pasty as good as the ones on offer at the Chough bakery. They are simply superb and you can see how they win many awards. The fillings are tasty and plentiful. Good selection of other baked goods too. Lovely chocolate brownie
Great wee deli and friendly service.  Lots of choice but our friends recommended trying here. Looking forward to having our pasties! We bought muesli.
The crossant were amazingly good, the Cornish pasty and the cheese and onion were disappointing the pastry was very tough and dense and the cheese and onion version had a very small amount of filling

Went here today to get some lunch and noticed that they had Leek & Potato soup with a roll for ¬£2.50 - such a bargain! The soup had pieces of potato and tasted cheesy - it was absolutely amazing and such a bargain! We also had a delicious Chelsea bun. Would definitely recommend :)

What a brill place! We were staying in Padstow so often had a lunchtime stop here.  The one day we were a bit stuffed and saved our pasties; I‚Äôm ashamed to admit (secretly don‚Äôt care!) we reheated them and had them for breakfast!!!!!!!!!!!! Get in! they were gorgeous. Google the story of the bakery too, well worth it. We will be ordering from your mail order service! We are a family of Cornwall fans and these were the best pasties ever! My next family buffet will rock! xxx

Review Title: A decent pasty, but not to my taste.
Review Text: While the other Bakery item are usually very good, the traditional pasty served was a bit doughy and the filling not quite up to other standards in the area.
You are likely to see people queuing to purchase things at this bakery as its very popular. The pasties, bread and cakes are great.
Lovely Cornish pasty, shop mentally busy but be patient it‚Äôs worth the wait. We sat at the harbour and ate ours was our best lunch spot !!!

we were staying in Padstow for a few days last week, and purchased 2 pasties from the Cornish pasty shop, as we walked along the harbour the local seagulls decided that my pasty was their choice of lunch, so one seagull took the pasty out of my hand and before it hit the ground a flock descended upon it.
I decided to buy another one to eat in the car and as we were by now outside Chough's bakery i went in to purchase another pasty, i explained what had happened to my original pasty and to my surprise the Saturday girls working there refused to charge me for my new pasty, which i thought was absolutely amazing, so thank you ladies for your fantastic customer service.
The down side for me was the pasty was absolutely fabulous,and my wife decided she would share it, so i only got half of the best pasty i have tasted for years
If you want a great Cornish Pasty stop here.  Tried the traditional and the cheese and onion both were excellent.  Will be ordering some online when we get home.
This by far is the best place to buy pasties in Padstow very nice. Plenty of filling not too much pastry and lots of different ones
If you want a authentic proper pasty then this is the place just the best really tasty and huge . Highly recommended a must if you like quality.

We‚Äôre sorry to say that the steak n Stilton we had this time around was not its usual good eat. What a shame that this was our third best pasty whilst away - we only had three. Let‚Äôs hope they‚Äôre back to their best next time we visit
If you come to Padstow, don‚Äôt hesitate to buy your bread, rolls or pasties etc from Chough bakery. The smell alone says it all! Brilliant!
I love Cornish Pasties and the traditional pastie they serve here is a delight. Taste is lovely and it is clear it is baked on a daily basis.

Staying in Newquay for Christmas, we ventured into Padstow on Christmas Eve and wanted a drink. Not knowing the area we followed a few people clutching coffee cups and pasties and found this little gem. Outside, was a table offering 'free' food in exchange for a voluntary Donation to the local Air Ambulance. I headed for the excellent Millionaires Shortbread, my husband chose a wedge of Treacle tart. After him saying it was the best he had ever tasted, I went inside and bought two more huge wedges to take back to our Hotel. Five days later, back home in Newton Abbot we have just had the last scraps, STILL yummy. When we 'cross the border' again we will be back
Very popular place and sells out very quickly so don‚Äôt delay in passing by. Pasties are to die for. Totally recommend a visit.
Visited in December - still the best pasties.....bring some home for the freezer......good selection including a Christmas version - delicious
Totally love this bakery... food is amazing and it's always so busy... the jam doughnuts are to die for..üíï

I have tried the pasties here before, as part of wider research you understand. The pasties always stood with the best, and have been voted best in the near past. 
My second visit to the shop this trip was prompted by Chough‚Äôs presence at the Christmas festival, where they were giving out tasters of pretty much all their wares. We ended up coming home with a box of 12 pasties, 4 of their scones, a big cob loaf of their lovely bread, and jars of sweet chilli onion relish and piccalilli from their chutney range - so be warned, the shop is packed with temptation. If you only want a pasty it‚Äôs best to send someone else in! A recommendation also goes to their stollen cake which, might only be available at Christmas but has to be tried. 
The shop only loses a mark due to the indifference of the staff whenever I visit, but they‚Äôre in no way rude, and I suppose the fact is that the food is so lovely they don‚Äôt have to try too hard.

Went to padstow as a birthday trot around while it‚Äôs quiet we decided to have a pasty or 2! We also bought quiche however the quiche seemed a little undercooked so didn‚Äôt finish it the pasties were tepid and I have to say as a proper Cornish maid brought up on proper home made pasties I don‚Äôt not think my stomach was quite ready for a chough winning pasty üôàin my opinion it‚Äôs not for me but don‚Äôt let that put you off it‚Äôs something you have to try yourself, the staff were lovely so for that I recommend the bakery however there are numerous places to try don‚Äôt stop at the first one you come to as did I!

We always stop off here for bread and savoury items when in Padstow.
A variety of breads have all proved good. 

Cakes look enticing. Very popular for pasties at lunch so you may have to queue. For us the stars are the big slices of homemade quiche. We buy slices and take them home.

Always well-baked and a variety of flavours. Fab!!

Lovely produce and very friendly helpful staff. 
The cakes and Pasties looked amazing. We purchased some local beer, chutneys and Jams as presents.
Decent pastry for both mine and my wife's pasty. However, mine was scolding hot so I couldn't taste anything at all. My wife however said hers was very tasty and the meat was tender.

Great pasties from the ward winning Chough Bakery.
These pasties are made in the traditional Cornish style putting a blob of cream in the pasty just Prior to the oven!

Review Title: The best place for Saffron cake
Review Text: As soon as I mention to my family that I am off to Padstow I start getting orders for saffron cake. The morning we leave involves stocking up at the bakery. A good range of authentic pasties, scones and breads. They also sell Cornish Sea Salt at a better price than most.

Review Title: Fine bakery and v good coffee
Review Text:
This bakery is renowned for excellent pasties and bread but I have to recommend their take away coffees - really really good!

The cakes and sandwiches are yummy - I have been working opposite Chough during the summer and have had to exercise a lot of self control each day when I called in for my daily caffeine dose!!
We bought 6 pasties,2 packs of scones and 1 loaf of bread,all of which tasted very good.The shop has a new display area since the last time we visited.

Always use Chough‚Äôs for all our bakery needs ... some interesting breads and of course, the excellent pasties and pastries.
We are frequent visitors to Padstow, having first being there 50 years ago.
We took some of these pasties home ten years ago so bought some more this month. They are just as good as we remember. Plenty of filling and very tasty. Book them up the day before to be sure.
Pasties had to be warmed up - very salty - bit disappointed - plenty other places to try. Soup was good.
We went here for lunch to try the pastys and were extremely disappointed by the cold tasteless pasties that we ate

Review Title: Not as good as it was.
Review Text: Have visited the chough bakery for many years but we felt that this year the quality was not as good. Pasty was good but the filling too heavily seasoned. Disappointed .
We have had all sorts from the Chough and all is great but the Bacon Baps are the best you will ever try. Go and thank me later.

Review Title: Sell a mini pasty under the counter!!
Review Text:
I always visit the Chough Bakery whenever we visit Padstow.

You must get in earlier for the bread, but this time we wanted cake!  Made an interesting discovery whilst queuing - a local asked if they still sold 'mini' sized pasties - and there they were, tucked under the main display on their own tray!!

Can recommend the Bakewell tart - the standard slice was huge, and could have easily done for two.

We recently visited Padstow and called at Chough's Bakery for a pasty. They weren't big for the price, but well worth the money once tried. The pastry was excellent, the meat was really lean and spread out well across the pasty, not in one big clump as with some. They were very tasty and being Cornish and eaten many from different bakeries, I can honestly say, they are one of the best I've eaten. We also bought a loaf of bread, a sliced farmhouse. It was excellent, soft bread with a good crust and very tasty. We will definitely be returning to Choughs on our next visit to Padstow.
The best pasty I have had in Cornwall, and the best Doughnut I have had in ages! Highly recommend and lovely service from the lady on the till!

Stopped to pick up some pasties and delicious bread to take back home. The bread was amazing and we bought the same whole grain as was served in our hotel. The pasties were lovely and I am interested to see the online delivery service , could be something for a different party snack at Christmas. Great place , you do have lots of choice in Padstow.

We always buy our pasties from the Chough Bakery and have never been disappointed. Plenty of filling. A delicious lunch to take on a walk up the coastline. You need to ask if you want a hot one though as some people buy to take home so they're not worried if they're cold.

The best doughnuts !!!!!!! they were so good i actually had to leave BIN2 wine bar later in the day to secretly eat another in the street much to the embarrassment of my wife who was left in the window still drinking her wine probably wondering why she married such a loser !!!! ;-) but seriously , those doughnuts are the business !!! 

also the pasties are fantastic !

No visit to Padstow would be complete without visiting the Chough and buying their award winning traditional pasties.For me it is the large traditional or the steak and blue cheese  and for my wife the Mediterranean vegetable. The Chough also bakes delicious farmhouse and granary bread and for sweet has the likes of bread and butter pudding and treacle tart.Also delicious quiche.Please pop in .You won't regret it.
We had the traditional Cornish pasty, it was lovely. Very interesting to read the information on the bag about the shop!
Called in to pick up a loaf of bread. Very nice,  freshly baked that day on the premises. Lots of people raving about the Cornish pasties.

Review Title: Harbour-side local bakery with outstanding Cornish pasties
Review Text:
The Chough Bakery is located next to the harbour of Padstow, a historic Cornish fishing Port. It is a traditional local bakery, serving a wide range of excellent breads and buns. However, it's exceptional attraction in recent years are its awarding-winning traditional Cornish pasties; these won the World Championship in 2016.
The Chough Bakery on the quayside is its retail-shop; it also has a wholesale business, distributing bread and Cornish pasties to a wide range of other outlets in North Cornwall.
One of the great delights of visiting Padstow is to buy Cornish pasties or sausage rolls from the Chough Bakery, and to eat them by the nearby slipway and quayside of the harbour. You'll be in good company!

We have been coming to Chough's for years.

Always had nice pasties and sandwiches although they were always significantly more expensive than the other pasty shops in Padstow of which there are at least 5!

This year we saw a new paint-job and counter extension. 

This meant that there was even more of a price hike! The pasties were all ordered at lunch time and were clearly from the previous day.....they were burnt, greasy and really chewy. My daughters was scorching hot but the rest of ours were treated to stone cold ones. My sons sausage roll was raw in the middle and the pastry was still under cooked. When we returned it, the man behind the counter was loathe to exchange as my son has taken a small bite......shocking !!!

The overall experience from miserable, surly staff for overpriced rubbish food has convinced me to go to the much better, cheaper shops available 10 yards round the corner.
We tried various pasties, cakes and scones over the week we were in the area.   All of them were very nice but the chicken, bacon and leek pasty was particularly good.
Had some croissants, weren't the best but ok. Had some other local bits that were cheaper than other places (gin for example).
We only viewed the produce at the actual bakery, however sampled their bread several times accompanying meals at various local pubs/restaurants - superb stuff!
3 of us picked up our lunch here for our walk along the coast path. Best sandwiches we had all week was our common agreement
Staff very friendly and helpful. Produce very fresh and tasteful especially their chocolate croissant.

Review Title: Yes, one of the best Pasties eaten
Review Text:
Beautiful food in the traditional bakery.
Very friendly staff
Plenty od choice, and staff will box up larger orders and keep them on one side while you stroll around the town

Call here in on the morning of 21 September and bought pasties from the most surly salesperson (young lady) I had the miss pleasure in encountering and discovered they were cold. Called back in to get them heated and my goodness I'm sorry we were such a problem,she was brusque, curt, gruff, blunt, churlish and then gave us the silent treatment. To top it all the pasties were ordinary, but maybe that's just me. There are loads of places in Padstow selling hot tasty pasties with a smile and a Cornish welcome. My opinion is, try somewhere else.

If you come to Padstow for nothing else do try these pasties out, they have earned their reputation. Excellent filling and perfect pastry; ate them out of the bag whilst sitting on the sea wall; perfect!
Helpful friendly staff, Lovely pasties and goodies worth a visit. Visited on more than one occasion and would definitely return. In fact I may mail order some home.

Review Title: Doughy Croissant, OK bread and moderate Pasties
Review Text:
The Chough boasts to have won medals for its Pasties and bread etc. so we were keen to try their produce. 

When I arrived soon after nine there was only one Croissant left, which I bought along with a loaf of bread and a jar of strawberry conserve. (This was the best thing we bought that day!)

Needing two Croissant I purchased another from a certain Chef's patisserie. I thought it would be interesting to compare the two. The one from Chough was doughy and barely ok. Indeed have had better from one of the supermarket chains!  The other was as close to those purchased from French patisseries as I have ever had. Indeed I could have been in France. 

The loaf was ok but nothing overly special. Of course being sliced and wrapped in a poly bag probably did it no favours, and on reflection I should have asked for a fresh unsliced loaf as I suspect the sliced loaves were from the day before. 

We bought Pasties on another day and were disappointed as the pastry was only so-so and the filling lacking in punchy flavour. Indeed I had a better one at the cafe at Kynance Cove!

So all in all a business resting on past success? I'm afraid I rather think so. Or maybe swamped by its success and losing its quality coping with demand?  Perhaps a kinder thought and maybe hope for the future if so.

1 steak n stilton  and a cheese onion n leek pastie with a loaf of bread to go. Yummy. there is plenty of choice when it comes to 'local' food however, i prefer to support the indies such as this one.

Credo che questo forno abbia ricevuto il premio per il miglior Cornish Pasty per l'anno 2016 e l'abbiamo testato per uno spuntino pomeridiano. Buono, molto frequentato....c'era un po' di fila... Non proprio simpaticissimo il signore che ci ha servito. Cmq se siete da queste parti provatelo.
If your in Padstow or the surrounding area you just got to come here to Chough Bakery for your pasties,best in the area.

After skipping breakfast at the Inn we were staying at, we went in search for a coffee and a pastry.  Freshly baked croissants, with ground coffees were perfect whilst we waited for the pasties to finish cooking.  Light, warm and crisp.  The pasty, whilst being hot, was cooked to a traditional Cornish recipe and was simply delicious! Did not need to eat for the rest of the day as it was so filling.  You can see why it is an award winning bakery.

You really need to try their traditional Cornish pasties; they're amazing. Had to go back the following day for more to take home and will probably use the website at some stage in the future to order more. The other food looks good as well although we were too focussed on the pasties to try any!
Chicken leek and bacon pasty hot out of the oven...chocolate croissants. Oth crispy and tender. A little bit of heaven in a paper bag, all warm and delicious! What more can one ask for!

visited twice and the cornish pasties are beautiful   absolutely packed with filling and very well seasoned and baked on tge premises lovely service from the staff and a very well recommended for great food

Review Title: Best pastys and jam doughnuts in Padstow (and probably Cornwall)!!
Review Text: Title says it all really. We also had bacon rolls on a couple of mornings. Plenty of bacon!! Delicious :)

We visited the shop by the harbour in Padstow a couple of times during our week in the town, and found that the goods on display were really high standard and at excellent prices. We especially loved the pasties, which were probably the joint best ones we have ever tasted and we also sampled a couple of cakes, which again were delicious. Service was quick and friendly, just as well as there are often queues out of the door!

Review Title: The best croissants in the UK?
Review Text: Arrive early and buy some plain, almond or chocolate croissants freshly baked and still warm. Delicious pasties and fruit scones too.
We bought a loaf and doughnuts. Very nice and would return again if back in padstow. There was a wide selection available.
This is a famous bakers that sell proper traditional Cornish Pasties. Also great selection of bread and cakes. Nicely situated on Padstow Harbour
This was my first pasty and it was so tasty! Definitely a must stop while in Padstow and make sure to get the Traditional pasty!

Review Title: Very good - average / normal price - one of three we tried in Cornwall.  We would return!
Review Text:
This was the first of three pasties we tried in Cornwall, with the help of Trip Advisor reviews.

We had a large traditional pastie at around 2.30pm  

They were able to heat it up (In an oven type system, NOT microwave) and after heating, the pastie still tasted like it had been freshly cooked (NOT soggy in any way!).

The amount of meat in the pastie was enough, as were the other ingredients.  It was filled as much as it could be with tasty ingredients.  It was huge!

The staff were friendly and the shop was very busy with prompt service.  A queue outside the door took around 1 minute, before they got to us.  Adding the heating of the pastie, we were away within a few minutes from queuing outside the door.

The outer part was a shortcrust pastry, but not as hard as some pasties we tried else where.  This was neither good nor bad for us as we like both types!

Cons
I would have preferred more seasoning.  However, I appreciate this being a difficult one to try to please everyone.

Summary:
Based on our experience, we would have no hesitation in recommending this shop and would happily return back.
We had cheese, potato and leek pasties. We queued for ages, the service was abrupt and we were disappointed with the pasties. The potato was very grey and the cheese overpowering.
As a vegetarian the choice is usually cheese and onion, here there were a few options. I had the meditteranean veg which was DELICIOUS! Only wish I'd had some to take home back up north!

Review Title: Very good value and great cakes
Review Text:
We stopped here just before we came home and picked up four cakes. Priced at around ¬£5 for four large cakes I didn't think this was bad at all considering most of the cakes in the surrounding shops were around ¬£2.50 each. They were super delicious as well. Can highly recommend the millionaire slice. 
This shop does get very busy so be prepared to queue or go in early.

There is no shortage of pasty shops in Padstow.  We tried many of them!  We started with the Chough bakery as it lay claim to being winners of the World Pasty Championship.  We subsequently tried other bakeries but soon became loyal devotees of Chough pasties - the addition of cream to their traditional variety was indeed a winner.

Padstow. In  a sea of eateries and associated Rick Stein owned or endorsed places to get food, The Chough bakery is a welcome change. Its small, always busy but always produces the most fantastic pasties .
We have tried pasties from several places in Newquay and Padstow over a great many years and we keep coming back to The Chough. The pasties are tasty and price wise on a par with most other places in and around Newquay and Padstow. you do get what you pay for. Try the Steak and blue cheese - lush!
If you are looking for bread and pastries you can get them here too
Stopped here whilst visiting padstow for lunch best pasty so far in Cornwall, would definitely recommend

Review Title: No award winning pasties found today
Review Text:
3 pasties purchased by our group , non of which were pleasant . A traditional Cornish which tasted of cheese, they reluctantly changed it, another traditional with hardly any meat in and a lamb and mint cold and chewy. 
Their bread is great and tastey but pasties fall short of the expected quality given their award winning status .

Review Title: Not as good as previous visits
Review Text: This once was our go too place for pasties and pastries but on our visit this time it was not quite as good. Pasties were good but not mind blowing and in my opinion there are better in the town now. The main thing was the lack of range on sale. We visited on a number of occasions and there was an empty cabinet. Great for business but others manage to offer a large range with seemingly constant supply.
The best pasties in Cornwall. Super choices and delicious. Steak and Cornish blue cheese and the traditional are just gorgeous. A must visit.
Stopped for a quick pastie from the Chough Bakery in Padstow and was very disappointed.  Queued for ages in view of their reputation and the beef pasty was tasteless.
There is no other bakery which compares to The Chough. It is THE best in Padstow. Don't take the test elsewhere, just buy here!
Really nice granary bread, reasonably priced. Well stocked deli area. Worth a visit.they also sold the bread off at the end of the day, although, I doubt there would be much left as it is so busy!
I have never tasted such lovely crusty bread. Always so fresh and tasty.Wish I lived next door to this bakery.
Fabulous staff and the best pasties in Cornwall as far as I am concerned. Good choice and then there is the bread and the scones...delish

The award winning Chough Bakery is regarded as one of the best pasty shops in the area. Well I must say they are not far wrong. Imagine it in a pasty and they do it. The real Cornish pasty is a meal in itself. Would I recommend it YES

There's a reason why this place has won awards for best pasties! Go there! Seriously... they are the best ever. The traditional one is peppery and the crust is heavenly. The sad thing is it will make you crave them and no other pasty can now live up to these standards.

Review Title: There's a reason why there's a massive queue outside........
Review Text: Best pasties on the planet , and a good number of varieties is the bog standard traditional pasty doesn't float your boat !
Still the best pasties in cornwall. We both had traditional pasties and they were amazing and seasoned to perfection   Thanks for a delicious lunch

Review Title: A great bakery generally with fantastic cakes and pasties
Review Text:
As a regular visitor to Padstow for over 40 years, I have seen many changes and the most disappointing of these is the loss of decent butchers, greengrocers and other local stores in favour of numerous branded clothing and other equally pretentious shops.

Thankfully, the Chough bakery remains, and goes from strength to strength.  The pasties are second to none, as are the quiches, cakes and pastries, including bread pudding, tiffin and millionaires' shortbread.  You can't go wrong with their wonderful breads too, which are a staple of our packed lunches and snacks whilst on holiday.

A proper bakery and well worth a visit.
For the best pasties and bread this is a must while in padstow. Expect long queue's at lunch time but well worth it

Well I think the title speaks for itself! These pasties are so delish, I had some sent back home for my family to try (holiday gift - for looking after the dogs) Yes, they actually do mail order! You really must try one, I recommend the medium size. Find a lovely view overlooking the harbour, get a pasty and just simply eat it from the bag! The perfect lunch, you won't be disappointed. The staff are really pleasant too! We'll be back next year. Enjoy

Review Title: Great pasties and cakes but lacking in quality hot drinks
Review Text:
Fantastic bakery for pasties. I had a traditional and my partner had the steak and cornish blue cheese. Both were amazingly tasty amd well worth the small queue. We also both had a cake which was also really tasty.

Shame about the hot drinks - you get given a cup and get it yourself from a machine
Padstow was very busy and I don't think they rely on return custom thus very average pasties and cakes.

purchased some bread and a couple of pasties  from here for a day out.Pasties were amazing and no compromise on the fillings and the bread was fresh and tasted really good.Dont be put off by the queues.Well worth waiting for.

Review Title: Great pasties, but Malcoms are better
Review Text:
The whole family group(12) stopped and ate and everyone was happy with their choice.
I had a traditional Pastie, but I must say they are a close second to Malcom Barnecutts, sorry to mention the competion, and it could just be personal choice, after all the Chough bakery did win the best pastie award.

Expected to go and get a pasty from here but noticed they did a steak baguette so had this instead and i'm so glad I did!! Could of had some fancy sauce in it but i just had steak and onions and it was lush. Thank you!

Padstow it's self, while lovely, is waaay to busy! and not an overly pleasant experience.  However we had a pastie from Chough Bakers.  I had Bacon, chicken, cheese and leek while hubby had traditional steak.  Absolutely fab!  Lots of cakes etc also on offer.  We had treacle tart between us.  It was monstrous.

Review Title: Yummy Yummy Yummy!!!! Best Bakery in town!
Review Text: Yummy food, excellent service and reasonable price. Lots of choice, friendly service, even though busy they serve quickly without you feeling rushed.

I'm not a pasty expert ( my husband is!), but we picked up a couple of pasties to take with us on part of the coastal walk. The perfect lunch, & they were so tasty we went back for more a couple of days later.

Long queue and good reviews we thought would bode well. Steak and Blue Cheese sounded good but first one was cold and the second (replacement) was still not completely cooked through. A shame as the others all looked and smelt delicious. 

Can't fault the service, they were just very busy so perhaps explains it.

Review Title: How hard is it to keep Pasties hot????
Review Text:
Been coming here for years but whilst Padstow has increased in popularity the Chough pasties have risen in price but reduced in quality - despite the best efforts of Ms Polizzi.

Now the staff have never been the friendliest -verging on the grumpy, but what really grinds my gears is their complete inability to keep their pasties hot once out the ovens.

They are simply put on trays and served. Now if you time it right you may get a hot one but 99 percent of time they are luke warm or cold. Awful!!!

How hard can it be in this day and age.

Sort it out Choughs!

For nearly ¬£5 a pasty at least serve them hot!!!!!
That's it..... Scones to die for. Get them fresh, load them with jam then cream (The Cornish way) and enjoy!
Just the best pasties in Padstow, probably the whole of Cornwall. Ate far too many in one week! Great quality, worth waiting in the queue.
This bakery is always busy and once you have tried their pasties and millionaires shortbread then you will see why !  The only advice I would say is get there quick before they all sell out ! .
We had a Cornish Pasty from here and couldn't belive the price they charged. The Pasty was okay but nothing more. We won't be going here again.
The aroma as you queue to be served is outstanding and these have to be the nest ever Cornish Pasties available.

Review Title: Family ritual for the best pasties!
Review Text:
We visit Padstow regularly and always buys our pasties from Chough bakery, then eat them on the harbour: delicious! Twice in two years we have had people join us who have never had pasties before...and loved them! 
This is our family tradition, and we wouldn't change it for the world. We have tried different flavours, and all have been worth it. My favourite is still traditional beef with peppery onions and crisp pastry...mmmmmmmmm.....yummy! 
We will return!

Bought a big batch of pasties for family and friends - every other shop in Padstow is a pasty shop but this one was recommended by a local. They were really good - lots of steak and lots of pepper - very tasty and everyone (aged 6 to 46) loved them! They dropped a star only because they got my order wrong and forgot the only Chicken and Bacon pasty (but she ate a Traditional without moaning so it must have been good). It is busy and often has a queue for good reason.
Deserving winner of the best Cornish pasty 2016 with lots of flavours to choose from. Great service if you don't mind serving yourself with coffee. Good Cornish produce available

Beautiful pasty easy to see why they are award winning straight from the oven the pastry is  lovely crunchy and the filling is lovely chunks of meat well seasoned very tasty slightly juicy really good beat pasty I've tasted x
Always a lovely cornish pasty. Cone here every year. Always a queue but worth the wait! Very very tasty!

I didn't have chance to look around at the other items offered in this shop due to the sheer volume of hungry holiday makers. I do think the prices are very steepy:- for 2 pasties, 3 small sausage rolls, 5 jam donuts and 3 bottles of cola it was almost ¬£30! Although the food was nice this establishment in my opinion should not appear on trip advisor as a cheap eat
Perhaps it was the time of day and year when the tourism boom is on but we struggled to find very much bread variety.  Shame.  Nice location and staff were fine.
Family enjoyed our pasties. Original and beef/blue cheese. Didn't have to wait long. Veggie meals seem to disappear quickly.
We had a couple of simple hearty cakes, date slice and a bread and butter pudding, to eat by the harbour. Lovely!
We grabbed some quick lunch from here a few days ago. The pasties are amazing and service was quick and friendly.

Just what you need on a nice day 
Enjoyed the great choice of food so much to select from friendly staff and great service .
Visited bakery every morning to purchase the freshest croissants for breakfast.  Fantastic start to our holidays!

Review Title: Great pasties.  Always a queue but don't be put off
Review Text:
Visited a number of times over last 10 years.  Last visit a couple of days ago.

Pasties are wonderful.  Great taste and eating.

There is always (always) a queue but hey that's a great sign isn't it.  Staff are always pushed so don't expect a warm effusive welcome but you are only there to buy a pasty for heaven sake!

4 pasties for ¬£15 is a steal.  It can't be a coincidence that just about the only place in Britain that doesn't have a Greggs is Padstow!

Yummy! Had homemade pasties & jam doughnuts which were enjoyed by all the family.
Lovely friendly staff.
Stopped off for Cornish pasty and can well understand why they have won so many prizes ! Great friendly bakery prices were good and a cracking traditional Cornish pasty

Everywhere we travelled around Cornwall, we were told to go to Chough's in Padstow, the best pasties ever, full of genuine beef, great flavours, we even decided to go back and take a box of 12 home with us for the freezer.
A must visit,

Probably one of the best pastries in Cornwall and would highly recommend it to any one visiting the Camel Estuary Area. A proper pasty is well seasoned one with a nice peppery nast and fresh ingredients. Not factory produced mush which a lot of places are selling now sadly. I had the lamb"n"mint very nice dad was not impressed has forgot to leave him some. He had the traditional which was great also. Enjoyed them so much we brought some more to have later. I know how greedy of use. Buns are nice also. Enjoy

Always have been, hopefully always will be the best!
2016 world champion winners. Needless to say, very popular.

Visited again recently and was impressed with the shop refit and new deli section where you can pick up coffee, sandwiches and other goodies for a picnic or to take home.
As usual the pasties were great, we visited quite early in the day so the full range was available.  The traditional, the lamb and the steak are our favourites.  They re-heat really well too so made for a good supper back at the holiday cottage. Also tried the jam doughnuts this time, which were fab.  The scones are also some of the best we've tasted, and we've tasted a lot on our visits to Cornwall.  By far the best place to buy a pasty (and much more) in the Padstow area.

Does what it says - delicious pasties, went down a storm with 8 hungry people.  Judging by the queue (which were served extremely quickly) obviously the most popular pasty shop.  I enjoyed a traditional pasty which was simply yummy and my children had the steak and blue cheese one, which also got a firm thumbs up!

Been coming to cornwall since I was 3 loved the Chough but slightly disappointed this yr it's modernised and lost that family touch of simple but tasty cakes and savourys and fresh bread just plonked on the deep window sill shame things have to be upgraded in such a way infact it looked a little stein effect going on.

Always call here when in Padstow. It's the best bakery in the area.
The shop has had a refit which is lovely but it's still kept it's charm and appeal.
I'm not a pastie fan but my husband and Daughter tell me they are the best (they've sampled enough).
The scones are delicious and the bread and cakes lovely. Also reasonably priced. 
The farm shop next to our holiday let stocks chough goodies which is an added bonus for breakfast Croissants.
Lovely family run business.

Always used to come to chough bakery as a kid and I love it! It gets better and better. Personally, I don't like pasties so I always go for a sweet- they are to die for! The bread is lovely and there is a good selection of cakes
Pasties absolutely worth the calories! Just delicious! Also croissants for breakfast, fresh and still warm were a real treat.

Tried the traditional pasty. I went large - which was a mistake as it was enormous!  The pastry and filling was excellent: held together well, seasoned correctly and tasted really nice. 
Ordered a box to take home.

The place was always busy but the service is quick. Not too much hanging about, which is just as well as trying to get parked in Padstow is a nightmare :)

First day in Cornwall thought it appropriate to have a Cornish Pasty, as a visit to Padstow was organised, some TripAdvisor research suggested this family run bakery was a good choice. Was not disappointed. I had the large traditional pasty. The pastry was light and not heavy. The filling was packed from first bite to last with meat and veg. Apparently this bakery is approved by the Cornish Pasty Committee for producing the genuine Cornish Pasty. I am no expert but it was great.

Review Title: Choughs at Padstow - best in town
Review Text:
We enjoy Choughs at 8am in the morning - piping hot coffee and an early morning
traditional pasty each. Sit by the harbour before the crowds descend - its really worth an early rise.
Tasty and hot off the counter. Even the Seagulls were trying to swoop for a taste. My Partner had the cheese and Leek and loved hers.

Recently got back from a tour of beautiful Cornwall and visited Padstow on Sunday 16th July. We decided to try one of the award winning pasties, and it was clear the place was popular as very busy. 

We walked in and stood by the till, only to have a very sullen older lady from the other end of the counter bark " I am serving over here as well you know" with a miserable expression on her face. We apologised and stated that we didn't know as it wasn't very clear at all. 

My friends  cheese and onion pasty turned out to be cold, so she went back and asked for it to be warmed up. When approaching the man behind the counter she told him the situation and his response was "Yeah?" when she explained it was cold. He did get her another one, and my pasty was very nice,  but as I am stickler for good service and given the hundreds of pasty shops in Cornwall, I wouldn't return to this one. 

I get they are used to tourists, but we weren't rude, and I am a firm believer if you are polite, others should be aswell. Not impressed.

To be honest I didn't find Padstow - as pretty as it is - a particularly friendly place in comparison to other Cornish towns. We went into The Teddy Bear shop round the corner and my friend asked to look a bear in window display, the woman there was also a ray of sunshine. 

Maybe we just went on a bad day.

Review Title: Consistently good, award winning traditional Cornish Pasties !
Review Text: Same as my review two years ago. Superb, tasty traditional hot Cornish Pasties. This place is a mecca for the Pastie connoisseur. It's a production line to keep all those hungry tourists well fed. I would love to know how many this place sells a week - it has to be into the thousands ! Thanks to The Chough. Love it.

Bread and scones are scrumptious but also fancied a sausage roll which was really disappointing. Pastry on outside yummy it filling too salty and not great quality sausage meat in my opinion. Will stick to the bakery products.

Think you know a Cornish Pasty? You know, that doughy undercooked crimp and bland over spiced filling with too much potato? Try a Chough Pasty, the benchmark Cornish pasty, which personally is as good as any Michelin starred meal that I have ever eaten. Light pastry, filling filled crimp, a filling which has good meat content but even better a balanced content of meat and vegetable where the mixture is the delight. Chough sell these by post, albeit 24hours old - they still taste 10/10 compared to anything else. Don't think that you know a Cornish pasty until you have tried a Chough - amazing
What's not to like. Great pasties and bread an iconic establishment which has to be visited. Eat the pasties warm as soon as you get them. Serious taste sensation

All I can say is can't wait to visit again.  The Cornish pastie was easily the best one I have had for ages.   Big chunks of steak, vegetables and nicely seasoned.   Sausage roll and cakes were all great too.
The best pasties in the Westcountry, absolutely loved my pasty, good job I live 2 hrs away or I could be tempted on a daily basis lol.
Fab bakery. Friendly staff. Lovely fresh bread and a wide range jams and condiments. Lovely fresh cakes.

Lots of lovely bakeries in Padstow but Choughs does the best pasties by far! Lots of choice and a nice little deli section at the back which my partner says wasn't there when he visited before. Good price and lovely, friendly service.
Never had a bad cake or pasty from here. Now has its own deli to rivalsome of the Rick Stein establisments.

Review Title: Fantastic Bread - reputation spreads around the area
Review Text: Popped in to a very busy shop for a loaf but noticed the campsite we used had deliveries from here so thought it must be good.  Staff friendly and bread kept for days - very nice

So nice 
That's all I have to say 
Easily nicest breakfasts pastries I have had in a while.
Great location 
Grab a takeaway and enjoy!!
Definitely the best place to get a pasty in Padstow. Can totally see and taste why they have the awards for them. Divine !!
Must say it was the best ever I've had. Tasty and full of meat. Had a few in my time but padstow is the best.
Tasty, peppery, pasty goodness. We all had a medium traditional which was more than enough for a good lunch after an unsuccessful fishing trip.
Had to try the 2016 Champions Pasties. Fresh, hot, and good amount of filing. By no means am I an expert pasties eater, (I'm american). But what's not like about beautiful buttery, and flakey pastry.

I do live to eat local when away and no wonder this place has soooo many awards
Their Cornish pasties are just lush

Tried various pasty shops on this visit.
Chough Bakery came out tops ( in my opinion ) so much so we bought pastys and bread to take home !!
The best pasties you will taste In Cornwall! We come to Padstow every year and a visit would not be complete without a pasty or two from Chough bakery!

Not a lot to say really ‚Äì apart from most definitely the best Cornish Pasties that I have ever had.  The pastry is absolutely fantastic and the traditional filling is excellent.  There really is only one place for your pasties in Padstow ‚Äì think about going elsewhere but don‚Äôt, they really cannot be beaten.  They freeze really well as well.  Visited twice and both times were excellent.
Popped in to  buy Cornish pasties, Millionaire's shortbread and Chelsea buns. All freshly made and delicious. Yum!
Perfectly placed bakery on the harbour selling lovely bread, delicious scones and the most amazing pasties!

Easily the best pasties in Padstow - We are only here for a fortnight every year but regularly sample the steak and cheese -and onion pasties and sausage rolls - definitely the best !  Only problem this year is the queuing system - is there one queue or two ??
Decent selection of pasties packed with meat and flaky pastry. Just under 4 quid each but really filling.

Popped in on a day trip and brought a large and I say large! White loaf to bring home with us.. lovely and crusty and soft within just wish I had brought some pastries. Shop was very busy and lots selling.
Best Pasties in Padstow, I had the cheese,onion and Leek and my partner had the traditional one, Yum Yum

Tried to buy some bread but door was shut and locked 5 minutes before advertised time, pleanty of bread on display in window, bread on shelves in shop, staff tidying counter, but waved away and ignored. Poor. And yes we did check times.
Best Cornish Pasties ever. We picked a couple up on our way to the beach. Great tasting filling and pastry. They also now have a small deli on site. Wonderful Family run business. Well worth a visit.

You could be forgiven for thinking Padstow is all about the fish. But if you like bread, pasties or pastries then this bakery is a great place to go. Took away an apple pie for a self-catering dessert and it was really good quality... lovely fruit and delicious pastry. Super with ice cream.

It's a good place to get some provisions, a snack or something for lunch to take out. Or just stand outside and gawp at the amazing food through the window.

I did not visit The Chough Bakery in Padstow as  they deliver  to Mother Iveys Bay Camp site, twice a day, During a two week stay I sampled thir Bread, Pasties and Croissants all were fresh and delicious

Stop your search for a decent pasty you have achieved the pinacle of pasty making. Delicious flavours. Jammed with fillings. Made on site by hand. Delicious.
Can also highly recommend the Treacle Tart if you have room!

Proud of their pasty awards but their other baking is probably even better :)

Dropped in for croissants and pasties for breakfast. Blue cheese and steak has to be a holiday favourite and the pasty is pretty good.. but the croissants were excellent.

Coupled with their unusual and very tasty black currant and slow jam, I recommend this place whole heatedly
Pasties are delicious and a real treat. Filling is tasty and the pastry is absolutely divine. Recommended.
The best pasties we had during our two weeks in Cornwall. Shop is right by the harbour and always busy.

Pasties were amazing. Nice shop with so many different pasties to choose from and tasted so good. They deserve to be classed as the best in Cornwall. Right in the centre of the beautiful town looking out to the sea.

I have been coming to Cornwall for 30 years - in that time I was not a lover of Chough pasties - BUT this time I tried the new chicken bacon & leak. WOW it is wonderful. I used to love the chicken & asparagus slice from Rock bakery they closed - then I liked the pork & swede from Barncutts they replaced that with pork & apple not as good. Now the Chough with chicken bacon leak SUPER.

Review Title: Truly The Best Cornish Pasty Ever!
Review Text: named Champions of the best Cornish Pasty of 2016, they truly live up to their reputation!  My partner and I bought a large and went back for a medium and shared them.  Served fresh and hot and absolutely amazing!
We come to Padstow once a year and make sure we go to the Chough for everything. Their doughnuts are my favourite but the bread, flapjacks, brownies, everything is delicious.

I have been making a point of coming here for several years, the pasties are great ( although i can only comment on the proper ones, not any of the different fillings ), and I've had paties from all over Cornwall over 40+ years
Best Cornish Pastys and tray bake cakes.  Definitely recommend that you try.  Great location in the harbour.

Fantastic bakery on the Padstow harbour. Variety of pasties from the traditional to those with a more modern twist. Reasonably priced, prompt and friendly service. There can be a queue to get in but it's worth it. The pasties are delicious. Good selection of bread and cakes roo.

We tried several different makes of Pasty and Chough's was by far the best. Apart from that, the bread range is really good and the pastries look lovely. Don't leave it too late in the day to visit as they sell out of most items quickly. Staff really helpful too plus good value.
I recommend the Lamb and mint very tasty with vegetables. Walnut bread is to die for all we have eaten while down.

Queue was out the door and waiting time for pasties was 10 minutes despite there being other pasty shops in the area. The quality and taste defined why people Q here. Hot straight out the oven they couldn't bake them quick enough. Well worth the wait thanks.

Review Title: Two very good Cornish pasties to take away
Review Text: I hopped into this place on a very busy day in Padstow with the car running outside.  Luckily there was no queue.  I took away a chicken and leek pasty, and a steak and blue cheese pasty.  We had them cold the following day, and they were tasty with firm pastry as a Cornish pasty should be.  Worth trying if you happen to be in Padstow.
Lovely shop with loads of choice...probably the best pasties ive ever had in cornwall . great cakes and pastries you will be spoilt for choice
Raw veg, very little meat and undercooked pastry. Came 5 years ago and the pasties were the best. So disappointed. Maybe different owners.
After a wander around the wonderful Padstow, it was time for a snack. So glad we decided to get some pasties from Chough Bakery - delicious, but then again they were World Champions!
The best Pasties in the area, we tried a few while on holiday.  You can get a box of 12 to bring home for the price of 10.  A really good variety, I recommend the cheese, onion and leek, to die for.

Visited here after reading the reviews and we were not disappointed! Between us we had the cornish and chicken pasties, and they were both great. The pastry was yummy light and loads of filling. Definitely worth a visit, a lovely shop too.
Being hungry at lunchtime, we bought delicious pasties at the Chiugh Bakery. Inexpensive and full of vegetable pieces and meat chunks.

Often years between our visits to Padstow but we always make our way to this Bakery and enjoy their great peppery Cornish Pasties whilst sitting looking onto the harbour. Quality never changes and not beyond me to sneak back for seconds whilst my wife wanders around the gift shops!!

Do try the stake and Cornish blue cheese. It is fabulous and full of flavour. Another great eat is their apricot slices: full of apricots and very moreish. Avoid eating your pasties in the harbour just outside the bakery as it gets very crowded. Take them instead past the harbour and up the park following the path to the beach. It is 6-8 mins walk but there are plenty of benches to seat on and the views of the town down below are superb. Plus there are no seagulls up there.
If you like a good pasty this is the place, I would recommend lamb + mint or steak + stilton. Also for a large group you can get 12 for the price of 10. An essential for a coastal walk!!!

Best cornish pasties we have ever eaten, hot, filled with tender beef, potato, swede and a dollop of cornish clotted cream seasoned with  pepper. The shop was busy but staff were friendly and efficient. Even better you can order pasties and cream teas for delivery to your home via their website to bring back good memories.  The bakery is a real asset to Padstow.

Amazing pasties (& they're huge!!)!

Everything was delicious...the same astray, veg and meat all beautiful! Reasonably priced. We ll b back!

Try the chicken and cheese one too yummy!

Usually buy pasties on our last day in Cornwall.
We take them home and freeze them.
Took advantage of the special offer and ended up with a box of twelve large traditional pasties. Thanks to my family discovering how tasty these pasties are I have to report that I only have two left to freeze ! Had to fight to retain those !!
Says it all.

Enticed to this bakery by the awards for their Cornish pasties. Traditional and cheese and leek really tasty. Pastry not too thick and lots of filling. Piping hot and eaten on the side of the harbour - what's not to like?! Whole meal bread and bread rolls also delicious.
The Chough bakery sell my personal favourite Cornish Pasty. They are well  seasoned and contain a lot of meat. The large pasty will sustain you for a long time. Recommended if you are in padstow.

Review Title: Great pasties the best in North Cornwall.
Review Text: As above the pasties are the best in Cornwall.  To be able to stand out from the others in a sea of pasty shops is remarkable.  Long live the corniche pasty.

There's a lot of choice for Cornish pasties in Padstow but Chough's are a Padstow institution.  We bought traditional Cornish pasties for lunch.  Good amount of filling and very flavoursome. What's not to like?

After being slightly sceptical by the award winning pasty sign I decided to sample one of the medium Cornish pasties. If you are ever near a Chough bakery you have to step inside and try one. The best Cornish pasty, ever! Topped of by the stunning scenery at the harbour in Padstow. Well worth a visit.
We always stop by The Chough to get a few things. Pasties, Scones, bread and whatever other delicacies they have that day. Superb range of beautifully cooked bread and pastries
Enjoyed eating pasties from here at the harbour front.  Definately good but not great! Disapointed they were over salted, good ingredients don't need masking.
What is not to like here? Big selection of pasties with different fillings, but it has to be the "original" one. Place gets very busy but we were served quickly.

Popped in while in Padstow n picked up a couple of pasties for lunch - the older lady that served me was really off hand and rude - to the extent that I wouldn't like to visit again - BUT the pasty was delicious and totally enjoyed it - so, providing you can put up with the poor service- the food is so worth it - shame - but donning my crash hat I will be back !

Review Title: Best Bakery in Cornwall, specialising in Cornish pasties.
Review Text: Excellent bakery, not a restaurant, takeaway hot Cornish pasties, or cold!  Wonderful bread and scones. Very busy and patient staff serving.  Can also order on line and delivered to your door.

Best pasties in Padstow with a good range of cakes and breads all prepared freshly that day. Always very busy so be prepared to wait but well worth it. Staff sometimes a bit standoffish but usually pleasant. A must visit for pasties and scones for your cream tea.

On arrival at Sandbanks we were met by fresh scones,clotted cream and jam for afternoon tea.These were purchased from the bakery.
As a result we frequented the shop for more scones and pastys during our stay.we were not disappointed?aowas a queue which is a good sign
Great place for home baked pasties in Padstow , famous for what they do and you can even order on line for home delivery

We always use Chough Bakery whenever we visit Cornwall. Have done for years.
The quality of their pasties is amazing. The pastry, the filling and the crust on them tastes amazing. My whole family love them.
We always place an order to collect on the last day of our holiday so we can bring some Pasties back with us. 
Also we have the scones from there too and they literally melt in your melt. Such a lovely taste! 
The only downside to this place are the staff. They are so miserable. And considering the one day we ordered 12 pasties to bring home and bought 4 for us to eat then, an order that come to over ¬£60 you would be grateful for abit of good customer service! But unfortunately you dont seem to get this. Visited twice whilst on holiday and both times. Same person. And bad service.
Sort this out and your bakery would be even more outstanding!
Very fresh bakery and helpful staff.  We bought bread, saffron buns and pasties from here and all were made with quality ingredients and were delicious.

There must be 100"s of different Pasties made in Cornwall most people will have their favourite and the reasons why. However the Chough Bakery must be in the top 5%, the Oggie was hot full of Taste and Flavour and keeps to the true Cornish recipe ingredients of Beef, Potato, Turnip etc. We bought some and sat by the Harbourside in glorious weather munching through them and we were not the only ones. Simply heaven.

Review Title: Excellent bread, pasties, sandwiches and cakes
Review Text: Always freshly made and the staff are very helpful and friendly.  There is often something to try on the counter, which you can they buy if you like it.  Lovely fresh sandwiches, some made to order.

We read on Tripadvisor about this bakery.  Can they really be as good as people were saying? The answer is YES!!! 

We had the award winning traditional Cornish Pasties - oh my word  they were SUPERB! They were already warm, but we were asked if we wanted them warming more, which we did and they were just delicious.  Always a queue, but definitely worth the wait!

Stayed in Padstow for many years now, always thought the chough bakery was one of our essential shops to use, well never again will I spend any of my hard earned money  in there again, they may be award winning but it's not for their customer services, rude rude rude, shocking staff and unbelievably un welcoming
Chough Bakery won the best Cornish Pasty Award for 2016 and they must have a great chance of repeating that success this year. Best pasty I have ever had
Popped in to buy some pasties to take home at 14:00 on Sunday. Virtually run out and told would have to wait for 30 mins. Worth the wait the Pastys were very tasty.

Review Title: Best pasties in Cornwall live here
Review Text: Every time we go to Cornwall I'm on the lookout for the perfect Cornish pasty. I may have found it at the Chough bakery. Lots of meat, amazing shirt crust pastry and delicious.

After needing somewhere to eat following a wet walk around a busy Padstow on May Day Bank Holiday, I caught eye of people eating what looked like a tasty pasty just outside the shop front. This alone tempted me to convince partner and friends to grab a bite to eat here, and it didn't disappoint. Lovely pasty with a good crispy edge and lots of gorgeous filling. However I could be bias as not had many pasties in Cornwall to compare, but this would be a strong contender I recon!! Loved the little shop of local produce in the back, so much so we took a loaf back to our holiday let for breakfast the next morning. Highly recommended.
Lovely filling on  the pasty but pastry too thick.Cakes reasonably priced.Good to be able to buy a hot drink to take away.

I've loved pasties all of my life but hadn't eaten one for some time as have been disappointed. Tried a traditional one from here and was delighted to find that it was just how they used to be! Well filled and great pastry! Another one tomorrow!!
Been going here for years and feel quality has gone down hill, price gone up and staff very disinterested. Go to one of the many other pasty shops in Padstow

One of the best bakeries in Padstow! We purchased some sour dough bread, a gluten free chocolate cake and one of the famous big meringues! All scrumptious! We always visit here when in Padstow to get  some yummy food items.

We were recommended to buy the award winning Cornish pasties and were not disappointed.....by far the best of the four different versions that I tried during my visit.

Won't be eating anymore Cornish pasties until I visit Padstow again!

If there was a 6 rating this Cornish pasty shop would get it!!!! Definitely the very best Cornish Pasty in the world!!!!! Excellent! Pastry excellent and crispy and tasty. Filling exceptionally good full of well cooked tender meat and vegetables just the right blend of both. No soggy bits at all! We drove a long way for these pasties well worth the 400 miles!!!!
Called into Choughs last month while on holiday in Padstow , been coming here for years always great Quality , far better than the local competition.
Simply the worlds best pasty. Come here every time we visit padstow - 2/3 times a year. Lots of flavours, original is the best!
Had quite a few bits from here during our stay , and bought bread to take home , recommend the large granary loaf .

As soon as we arrived in Padstow, we made a bee line to Choughs to stock up on bread and pastries. All without compare (well maybe Pump Street but that's the other side of the country !). A must visit.
Great place to pick up snacks for the family and all freshly made. Good selection of different flavored pasties plus lovely cakes/bread and biscuits.

I bought traditional pasties and sausage rolls from the van positioned at the beginning of the Camel trail in Padstow. My son said it was the best sausage roll it ever ate. Pasties are filled plenty with vegetables and meat and the right seasoning

We visited today as it was our last day in padstow and thought we would treat our selves to a pasty from this bakery, we had one minted lamb and one traditional pasties. 
The minted lamb pasty was very cold which we took that one back in to either get a hotter one or warm ours up, they warmed ours back up which is okay but we would of preferred to have a new hot one, then the traditional pasty had plenty of filling but it was like 5% or less of meat and the other 95% veg etc.
The pasties then repeated on us both all day, to which we both agree we will try another pasty shop in padstow rather then this one. We have had chough before and it was nice but on this occasion it has put us off. We know they are busy but doesn't mean they can serve cold food.

On the front at Padstow. Very handy to buy a delicious Cornish pasty and sit by the harbour to eat ( avoiding the seagulls! )   Beautiful cakes and bread. Wonderful Simnel Cake.  Slightly more expensive than usual but worth it.

Had sold out of Cornish pasty's. Had to choose other option! Still the best I'd ever tasted! I did arrive late so my fault they were sold out!! Other shops still had lots in their windows which speaks volumes about the quality of Choughs

This award winning bakery is great. We called on for a couple of traditional pasties for a lunch on the bench overlooking the harbour and ended up buying a dozen to freeze for home. Lots of flavours and we had three types. They were glorious and the best bit they do mail order do we will be ordering again from Yorkshire. Nice pleasant staff very efficient.
Great pastie eaten on the harbour - good veggie options too. Bought croissants another day - which had a distinct whiff of pasty about them - not quite so good!

They were the 2016 World champs and their traditional pasty deserves the nod. They have many other varieties but I cannot vouch for them. For those of you with a traditional, but international foodie bent, the alternative is Lawry's Pasty Shop in Marquette in the UP. They proudly leave out the swede (rutabaga). Cornishmen  would be horrified. They also have a lot of other good stuff including fruit pies.
Always get our fresh bread here when staying in Padstow and also take pasties home - they freeze so well.  Nothing comes close to choughs, thats why most of the local restuarants use their bread too

Purchasing some goodies to take home from a short break , lovely bakery as soon as you walk in , clean and well stocked . Bread was great and loved the hot cross Buns, the best pasties we had all weekend too.

Yup called again tried opposition....no brought another boxfull from chough bakeries.
They cannot be beaten think price has risen slightly but quality and taste remain top of the tree.
Thanks again see you in june
Went here and got a few things absolutely amazing. The bread is to die for.Shame I can not go there every day. Love this bakery.
The traditional pasties are the best we have tasted. Thoroughly recommend a visit, lovely breads too.
We bought delicious bacon bites and lamb and mint pasties, both equally delicious! Really great customer service too.
Great bakery with definitely the best pasties we have ever had (and we are local).  Good range, good prices, friendly staff.
The bread is out of this world, all the pubs and restaurants use Chough Bakery bread and rolls and its not difficult to see why. Delicious
The best pasties around...forget the others ! You can tell it's good by the length of the waiting line outside. Been going here for many years and never disappointed. !
Very good produce , but get there early for the speciality breads . Pasties are excellent and its difficult to pass by without going in , because of the lovely baking aroma

Review Title: My First Cornish Pasty Experience (Under recommendation:D )
Review Text:
We each got a traditional Cornish pasty from the Chough Bakery to take back home and eat with some soup for dinner and we were not disappointed. They were massive pasties! One was more than enough for each person. 

The fillings were packed to the brim and the pastry was delicious. 
We will go back next time we are in Padstow. 

Tip: Get there early as they do sell out quickly, its a popular place :)

2016 Corniche Pasty World Champions. Not surprised. My wife and I love our Pasties and these were most certainly the best ever. The pastry was perfect with a nice crust. The filling was delicate and full of flavour. A light sprinkle of pepper gives the perfect seasoning. And was it full. You bet it was. They also do bread and other bakery items. We bought a wholemeal and it was very nice.

Hearty ..flavoursome REAL Pasties ! üòç 
Good value ..Award winning !
Plenty of choice...Other fresh pastries and bread avaliable
Lovely pasties, came in daily over four days to order the pasties, my favourite was the traditional, plenty of filling & taste.

Review Title: They said they were the best and they are!!
Review Text:
Beef with Stilton and Traditional pasties were purchased for lunch and the whole group felt that they were the best pasties that they have ever, yes EVER had.
Beautiful pastry with tasty filling what more can I say - just remember the name when you next visit Padstow -The Chough Bakery, you can't miss it right on the harbour - enjoy!

This Bakery doesnt do lots of weird and wacky pasty flavours what they do is make the very best pasties in Cornwall. Not just my thoughts they have the awards to prove it. Very good Value - if there is a queue just be patient.
There are pasty shops and then there is chough bakery. These pasties will not disappoint. Reasonable priced and hot. Highly recommend.
Excellent piping hot pasty  with plenty of filling.Hot drinks available as well .Service very good and reasonable prices.

Review Title: Lamb and Mint pasty - not disappointed
Review Text: The Chough Bakery is a small family run  bakery based at the Quayside in Padstow which has been around for nearly 30 years. Their multi-award winning pasties are made using locally sourced ingredients and are famous for their 'extra dollop' of clotted cream.  From artisan breads to homemade cakes, this bakery prides itself by sourcing only the highest quality local ingredients from seasonal vegetables, meats to cheeses, especially 'blue' cheese.  Try their 'world champion' Cornish pasty as I did by buying a large lamb and mint - devoured with orange juice, whilst sitting down by the Quayside opposite.

We went here twice and really enjoyed both visits. I had a traditional which was super tasty and my wife had the lamb and mint. I would have given 5 starts but my wifes pasty was on the cold side!

Worth a visit if you're in Padstow!
A nice choice of bread and cakes but by  far the best pasties in town. Lots of meat in the pasties and nice pastry.

Whilst strolling around Padstow in the afternoon sun we realised that hunger had beset us. We were fortunate to come across Choughs and indulge in their excellent pasties, my wife had a cheese pasty which she said was one of best she has ever had. I had a medium steak and I had to agree. We used to frequent Steins but no more, it's Choughs for us from now on.

They really do the best most mouth watering pasties.
Beware though as it is so popular you may have to queue but the good news is you can order on line

Ordered 12 steak pasties and a cream tea for delivery to my home. Arrived exactly as promised and absolutely scrummy. The pasties were full with meat, juicy and succulent. Have yet to try the scones (pronounced SCONES and not SCONS!) but the strawberry conserve, Cornish butter, saffron cake and clotted cream await. Would not hesitate to recommend and if your only experience of a pasty is a factory produced mush then you will have a very pleasant surprise. Thank you Chough Bakery.

By far the best pastys you can get in Cornwall and have been all over the place many times, live in Taunton in Somerset about 2 hours away and can safely say would go down to The Choughs just for their pastys.

Lovely cakes and pasties. Can't knock it. Go every year we're there. Lovely helpful staff. Gets busy in the summer but still fairly busy in the winter months when we're there. Before now I've had to order a load of pasties to take back for my dad and sister.

The most friendly bakers ever 

I loved the Mediterranean vegetable quiche and shortbread. Sensible prices
On holiday with family, phoned through order weeks before, asked to collect before 12pm xmas eve, which we did. Fantastic different types of breads, mince pies to die for, pastry were super tasty.

The shop has won many awards for their pasties and the awards do not lie.  The pasties are really excellent plenty of steak in the regular pasties unlike some providers that are just full of potatoes.  We have recently used their home delivery service and the pasties arrived early in the morning on the day that they had specified.  They tasted amazing, this service is highly recommended.
We love Chough pasties and have tried all varieties during our stays in Padstow. The best pasties in Cornwall - say no more!

Once again the Chough Bakery pasties have gone down a storm at our annual Pasties and Prosecco Party! 
The mail order delivery is fantastic, the website is easy to use and a little taste of Cornwall turns up at your door the next day! They arrive well packaged and still very cool, the pasties can then be warmed through or frozen for later. 
As other reviews have said these are proper Cornish pasties, packed full of tasty good quality filling and beautiful pastry on the outside. They disappeared as fast as we could get them out of the oven! Everyone loves them.
Special mention as well to the office staff who were incredibly helpful when I messed up my order (completely my fault). When I called though, they went out of their way to get the pasties to us and saved the day. 
We can't wait to be in Cornwall and grab a pasty fresh next year, but in the meantime we have a couple in the freezer to savour one dark winter day!

Review Title: You cannot visit Cornwal without a visit to the Pasty Shop
Review Text: Good pasties and great experience buying them. Lovely old bakers shop on the quayside at Padsow....Pasties are not just pasties here. All sorts of varieties. A very pleasant lady explained all the options we bought two and then we sorted out all the World's problems. How relaxing. We enjoyed eating our pasties ....in the car as it was raining....delicious. So we have been back from Cornwall a week now and the fragrance of Cornwall still lingers in the car
A nicely seasoned pasty and lovely pastry. Didn't try and cakes but they did look lovely and were reasonably priced!

In a harbour town where cornish pasties abound.  Three shops in a row !!! I would recommend this bakeries pasties however if you want to eat them straight away check they are warm enough or the bakery will warm them up again

Review Title: Simply the best pasties - don't go anywhere else
Review Text: There are many places selling pasties in Padstow, but the Chough bakery is the best.  A small, family-run business, they make everything from scratch every day unlike some other chains who simply re-heat from frozen.  Because there is a limited supply, some of the more unusual flavours such as lamb and mint, run out quickly, so get there early would be my advice.  A Chough pasty has become a bit of a tradition with my family and there's nothing better than eating one straight from the paper bag overlooking Padstow harbour.  I do know that they also offer a postal service, although I've never actually used this.

Although stressed with the volume of people from the festival, the team did their best to meet customer expectation. We ordered ahead to ensure croissants and sourdough were available for our breakfast and scones were available for tea - delicious!

We popped into Choughs to grab a lunch of their fantastic pasties during the Padstow Festival weekend. As good as ever. A fine selection of different pasties are available, but the traditional is still my favourite.

the restaurants main claim to fame are its cornish pasties.  I found them ok but not was not over impressed.  I always feel that the pasties produced in ones own home area always seem the best!

That being said the shop was very friendly, the pasties tasty and the seagulls certainly enjoyed the pieces of crust that i spared them.
This bakery has a wide selection of food including Cornish clotted cream. The staff are very pleasant and helpful

Been going to Cornwall for quite a few years and have still not found a better pastie that the ones from here......the steak & blue cheese pasties are to die for......also bought some home to put in the freezer - well worth a visit

Having seen this bakery 'turned around' on the Alexi Polizzi programme a couple of years ago we couldn't resist a visit. Still a bit chaotic inside the shop we thought but the pasties were fab, so what the hell!

Review Title: Traditional pasty - so good we went back for seconds!
Review Text: We were on a mission to try a variety of traditional pasties but we arrived too late and Chough were the only ones not to have sold out. Still hot from the oven, our medium traditional was stuffed with properly seasoned potato cut into squares rather than cubes, layered with good chunks of beef. The pastry was firm but thin and held the filling well to the last bite. So good, we went back for another. Just checking for consistency!
