I either have the sausage roll or steak and stilton pasty.WONDERFUL.Full of flavour and delicious pastry.

We went to the chough twice on our visit to Padstow. The first time we brought a box of mince pies recommended to us by the really friendly lady in the shop. The mince pies were amazing. Because of this a few days later we decided to pick a couple of boxes up as a gift for family. 
But when we got home we realised that they were burnt on one side and tasted nothing like the first batch. 
On the same day we got steak pasties. We got told they had cooled down we could have them reheated. While waiting for them to be reheated we could see fresh pasties coming out of the oven. The bakery should have offered us fresh pasties or a reduction in price on the cold ones. This isn't what I would expect from an award winning pasty shop. 
If you get this bakery on a good day it's great but sadly yesterday wasn't a good day.

This was our first trip to Padstow and was fascinated by the number of Pasty shops in close proximity of themselves. In fact there were 3 next to each other in one street. We decided we would try one for lunch and bought one from Chough's and sat around the harbour eating it takeaway style!

It was very tasty and full of meat. A first class pasty.

I have been traveling down to Padstow for many years, and always feel the need to have a pasty at some point. Look no further, the quality of the ingredients is superb, and the prices remain good. A nice variety of options which as far as I can tell are authentically cooked.

On entering the shop "that apparently has award winning pasties" we were met by a very matter of fact and disinterested owner (the mother I think). Who asked if she could help. We asked for a cheese and leek, onion pastie. Would you like that warm she asked.. on saying yes please she promptly headed off and placed the pastie in a microwave. 
While waiting for the pastie to be heated. She then returned to the shop asking if she could help us?? 
Another minute went by and a hot pastie was handed over so we headed off to the nearest bench for our award winning snack.. Now if there's an award for uncooked pastry read hot filling with a disgusting texture they win hands down.
We returned the pastie to the shop and didn't get any comment from staff when advised of the poor quality.. However this was expected considering how we were met at time of purchase .. 
It's only ¬£3.. But next time I would rather put the money in a charity box and give it to the needy not the unwelcoming greedy..

We went into this quirky little shop and bought their bread to take home it's the best bread around just wish we had a shop that sold bread like this it stays fresh for quite a while also their teacakes are to die for

This bakery has become No. 1 for pasties in 2016. The quality of their pasties is second to none with not only the traditional pasty available in 3 sizes, but also several other varieties are available.
The pasty itself consisted of a thin pastry crust, unlike many where the main ingredient is a thick crust, filled with a good blend of meat, potatoes etc. Again so many pasties are full of potato, and lack hardly any meat.
Reasonable prices are charged for this quality product.

This bakery makes proper pasties! 

It's traditional bakery and we visited frequently during our weeks stay in Padstow for snacks and treats for our apartment and packed lunches for the beach.

Top tip is to visit late afternoon or early morning for reduced price treats!

Took a trip to the bakery after reading the reviews and seeing that they'd won awards for the pasties and they didn't disappoint! Amazing. Very reasonably priced and really worth a visit. Apart from as soon as I walked out a seagull biting my finger and nicking some of the pasty!

Good location in Padstow, you can't miss it - right near the harbour. A good selection of fresh bread in the window which caught our eye. Good selection of breads, cakes & pasties. Purchased a nice looking seeded uncut loaf and four scones. Delicious.

Great Pasties, best in Padstow. Friendly and fast customer service and pasties tasty and hot.
I would go there again.
Small bakery right on Padstow harbour side. Great choice of fresh bread and pasties of all flavours. Winner of the gold medal in 2016 Cornish paste championships.
A very busy pasty shop with a high turnover and queues at the door. Pasty was hot, fresh, well seasoned, great to takeaway for a picnic!
We queued out the door but it was worth it. They are 2016 winners for their pasties and we now know why. We took them to a bench overlooking the harbour and enjoyed them!!

Review Title: not sure we had one of the winning pasties!
Review Text: We stopped at Chough Bakery when we saw they had won the best pasty in the world competition and bought a traditional pasty.  However, we were very disappointed to find it was more onion and potato than meat, which was very sparse.  The pastry was nice but we were disappointed overall.  Unlikely to return, especially bearing in mind the queue in the first place!!!

Amazing service, was helped a while back in sorting out a birthday gift for an elderly relative and he was so grateful and happy will never forget it and would always re moment. Nothing was too much trouble and a great selection of goodies which went down a treat!
Best bakery in the world!!! Everything is yummy!! We keep coming back year after year. Busy place but the staff are always smiling - thank you!
Was looking forward to our pasties as we have in the past,but alas we were disappointed.The standards seemed to have slipped,pasties were only average,lacking the usual seasoning and crispy pastry.

Had the traditional pasty one afternoon while visiting Padstow and ate sat around the harbour. Cannot begin to explain how delicious it was! Beautiful pastry, traditional filling with swede, potato and tender chunks of meat. Nothing like the Ginsters experience of pasties I've had before. We made sure to go back and stock up before heading home. Also tried the chicken pasty made with leeks which was also yummy!!
Onion bread was great, wished local bakers did bread like that.  Pasties and doughnuts reasonable value.  Shame that there was a wait for some pasties so took different flavour than had planned.
The prize winning pasties were as good as stated albeit most pasty outlets seemed to have had their turn at winning!

Walking the coastal path , we tend to find a local bakery to buy a sandwich for lunch and the cheese and salad sandwich, and bread pudding slice from here were delicious. My companion kept on about his sandwich being one of the best he's ever had but then he's like that . Staff were very cheerful early in the morning
PERFECT PASTY, They use cream in the recipe, always cooked to perfection. My 1st destination every time I visit Padstow!!!  Eat it overlooking harbour, cant beat it!!  10/10
We called in to buy some of the record holding Cornish Pasties and boy we were not disappointed. The food is excellent and the sausage rolls are lovely too. We will be back in 2017.

There's no wonder the Chough bakery wins countless awards. 

Bacon sandwich, pasties, quiche, savoury and sweet bakes are all outstanding. 

You shouldn't ever visit Padstow and not visit the Chough.

I blummin love a good pasty. I've searched high and low for a better pasty than those available from Chough's... but nothing compares. Steak and Stilton is my personal favourite. I just wish I lived nearer... my waistline is eternally grateful that I don't.

Always visit the Chough when in Padstow. Pasties are probably the best I've ever eaten but it's the sausage rolls that are the winner for me!
Try the millionaires shortbread and tiffin- amazing and very generous in portion size.

Called, no, drawn in by the wonderful smells of fresh pasties baked on the premises. great choice of bread etc. perfect to eat on the hoof or picnic or save for when you get home and want something tasty.
2016 pasty maker of the year, we bought 10 for supper. Truly epic short crust egg glazed proper tasty oggies

Review Title: Good location, reasonable price, good service, nice pasties!
Review Text: Always stop here for pasties in Padstow! Very tasty and reasonably priced. Central harbour front location. Always popular. Would recommend!
There was always a queue so decided to try. Absolutely the best pasty's ever and everyone can't be wrong. Award winning, rightly so. Beat your way in the door and indulge.

We have visited many times over the years - Alex Polizzi did a fantastic job of waking the dormant potential of the family and raising its confidence. Their bakery products are delicious - we always take a loaf of bread home with us as it is so good.
Popped in to pick up a pasties for a picnic lunch and couldn't resist the cakes either! Good value, very tasty and apparently the 2016 World Champions for pasties üôÇ

This truly is the best pasty I have ever tasted! 

I have tried many in my time and consider myself a pasty expert so it must be true.
All l can say is " best Cornish pasty in Britain" outdoor lunch at its best, eaten on the quayside in Padstow in the sunshine

Whenever we are in Cornwall I only ever have a pasty from here there's no point in paying money to be dissatisfied with an inferior pasty just go to the chough and have the best pasty in the world the large pasty is big enough to satisfy the hunger of the podgiest amongst you 5*****

Review Title: Worthy winners  of the Pastie prize
Review Text:
I am a fan of the traditional Corniche Pasty and make them myself. Chough bakery makes better ones than me ! Succulent and moist, only Worcester sauce needs to be added. 
Bought also onion bread and fruit scones. Both excellent. However disappointed that their recipe  book is ¬£10 in the shop and ¬£7.50 on line .  Best bakery shop in Padstow.
Great selection of pasties that are already cooked the only trouble is that when you order they re heat them which made myself and husband very ill,

The Chough Bakery in Padstow is The Cornish pasty world champion.
Without doubt this is the best pasty I have ever tasted.
Plenty of meat and potato  light textured pastry .Great tasting.
In the bakery very quick friendly service too.
We'll worth a visit if in the area..We will be back

As an amateur baker myself I have tried to make original recipe  Cornish pasties with some success. However after a Chough pastie I realise I must do better! It was fantastic, and good service from the nice lady in the shop who showed me the Chough book and pointed out that a pasty should not be filled too full so the edges can be  properly crimped.

Advertised as World Champion Pasty Maker 2016. If they were world champions, then I wonder what the rest were like? Although the pasty was hot and full of meat and veg, the pastry was very tough and chewy. Sorry.

It was late I know and they were busy but the pasties I asked for where cheese and onion and Mediterranean vegetable and I got stilton and steak and the other was a bit unrecognisable.  They advertise best pasties but I don't think so.
We took pasties home for the family and apparently they were gorgeous.   Wished we had taken more home.

There were other pasty shops (seemingly plenty of them) where we could have got a pasty without having to queue but had been told this was the best. I don't know if it was as I didn't try the others but I'm willing to believe it was given the pasty (traditional) was absolutely fantastic.

Make a big thing about having the best pasties and do you know what, I can see why. They are delicious! Alright so they cost a bit more than your supermarket 'gin*ter', but they are miles apart in taste. These pasties win everytime. They have a delivery service as well so I might have to order some...but don't tell the wife.

Quite simply the best pasty in Cornwall and they have an award to prove it too, lol. Had the Cornish blue pasty and it didn't disappoint. Staff were friendly and the premises were spotless. Highly recommended!
We all dad their prize winning pasties ,eaten straight from the wrapper .Tasty for our lunch. Great Time .

Review Title: Hot tasty lamb pasty and bread pudding - yum
Review Text: A breakfast on the go that got our day walking to a great start with a huge crust holding tasty lamb and onion filling warmed up to eat straight away whilst my guys steak and cornish brie went down very quickly.  I also had a bread pudding for later which had a firm texture holding warm spices of cinamon and soft cherry and raison fruit.

love this bakery, lovely friendly staff. 
always have a great selection of breads, although always best to get their early. 
we always look forward to going to chough bakery on our annual stay at padstow.

Review Title: Best pasty for a long time
Review Text: World champion 2016 pasty maker so we had to give them a try and we were not disappointed. Choice of pasties and sizes, lovely filling in the large traditional pasty. Fantastic - we had 3!.

Saw this shop on TV getting advice and a make over a couple of years ago. People queuing  to get in but very efficient service and two good veggie choices of pasties. This is a shop so why people would expect toilets and seating is a bit odd. Seating around the quay.
The classic pastie is excellent but they do a good rainbow alternative fillings,including vegetarian

Great bacon sarnies in the morning! Generous with their bacon and rolls are nice and fresh. Reduced section is a great idea and the reduced tiffin was amazing! Pasties are good. Great location on Padstow harbour.

Review Title: Good food but beware of a severe lack of amenities
Review Text:
OK, so the food (at least so far as the pasties are concerned) is very good, as is the service. Be aware that this establishment has neither on site seating (inside or out) or toilets. Parking also a problem (same applies for most of Padstow) 

The lack of amenities is what has dragged this review to 3 stars.
A proper cornish pasty...peppery/steak/turnip  lovely and the best in Padstow.  Baked on the premises rather than shipped in. Highly recommend.

There are tons of places to buy a pasty in Padstow but Choughs is by far the best! If you're not keen on pasties then their sandwiches and quiche are also divine. The cakes are delicious and worth the wait if you end up in the inevitable queue in the school summer holidays

Review Title: Very good pasties - not so good carrot cake
Review Text:
Had a couple of their standard cornish pasties and they were lovely - plenty of filling but not too thick a pastry crust.

However, tried their carrot cake for mid morning coffee break and it was very dry (may be it was stale) and would not bother again.

The rating is for the pasty, if it had been for the cake, it would have only been 2 stars
Great pasties a real variety to choose from ,well filled and tasted great ,good range of quiche s pastries etc and cake too

Review Title: AWARD WINNING BUT NOT THE BEST
Review Text: Bought vegetable pasties to take away. Have to say they were not the best. The pastry was very thin which meant it quickly went soggy making it unpleasant to eat and with a tendency to fall apart. The filling was good though. If eaten at once it will be great but dont hang about

Visited on 16 September 2016 as seen the bakery advertised on The Fixer with Alex Polizzi some years ago. Traditional  pasties were very delicious and exceeded expectations. Not cheap at ¬£3.00 each for medium but well worth it and afterwards we wish we had bought more. When trying out others in Boscastle they were similar price but no where near as good.
We had a Chough Bakery pasty from here and, although I still prefer Warrens, this one was moist, tasty and had a good meat content.
Bought a traditional pasty which is apparently 2016 award winner. Tasted good but a distinct lack of meat!  What meat there was, was in very small pieces. Disappointed.
went in with my family and brought pasties for the whole family the price of the pasties is a reasonable price and the pasties was lovely

A welcome from an award winning Pasties   bakery.
The smell of just cooked as you walk in.
Small pasties to large traditional to lamb and mint.
A very small queue to get through a small front door .
Friendly persons serving. Doughnuts and bread.
Recommend to try. Pasties were delicious just right pastry. Not over peppered, can order on line too.

Had a cheese leek and onion pasty from here on my visit to Padstow.  I was there at lunch time, the queue was out the door, very popular place slap bang in the middle of the harbour area.  Pasty was to due for, so tasty.

Not the best I've had, but not the worst. I was quite excited about the addition of leek in my cheese and onion pasty but I think it was Stilton or another blue cheese that was used. I wasn't expecting that flavour so it put me off a bit. Good pastry though so it was quite enjoyable.
You must have a pasty when you visit Cornwall and this is the bakery to provide you with an excellent local version.

During our weeks holiday in Padstow we purchased items from Chough's on a number of occasions.  The butternut squash quiche was a particular highlight. We had super  toasted tea cakes for breakfast, tasty sausage rolls and very nice pasties. I would recommend using Chough's bakery.

We had heard so many nice comments about this bakery before our visit to padstow so couldn't wait to try them not exactly the wow factor we were expecting 3 pieces of dry tasteless meat and tough and lots of veg no seasoning I had a much better one at wells market town in Bristol the week earlier much more nicer and tastier as with most things in padstow everything is over priced a shame prices hyped up for tourists

A lovely little shop full of pastry delights. 
The pasties are second to none. Ample fillings with a crisp golden pastry coat around them, what could be better.
Be prepared for a little wait, we waited approx 10 minutes on what seemed to be a quiet day but it was well worth the wait.
Plenty of varieties to choose from and all reasonably priced.
Don't stop at the pasties.... The fruit scones are just as good.
Well worth a visit.

Review Title: If this is the best don't bother
Review Text: Just had a lamb and mint pasty from this bakery.  Had no taste. Three pieces of lamb that were as tough as a pair of old boots.  The girl threw it in a bag and it was stone cold so we asked for it to be heated.  It was as if I had asked her to give up her life for me (checking her phone obviously more important than customers).  Apparently just won an award.  The judges must have had an off day or they put more effort into pasties up for awards.  There are plenty more pasty shops in a small area. Go to one of those instead. Awful.

We tried the vegetable pasty and a traditional cornish pasty.  Both lovely, although the veggie option was my favourite of the two.  Only regret was not buying one of the cakes that were on offer as they looked delicious as well.  Be prepared to queue - we waited ten minutes on what seemed like a not particularly busy morning, but it was well worth it.

Review Title: Excellent pasties as recommended by staff in Rick Steins patisserie
Review Text:
Highly recommended 
A variety of fresh pasties delicious and reasonably priced
The cashier in stick Steins patisseries recommended it

Good selection of pastries and such like, however grumpy service and broken lid on my coffee!! Average prices, perhaps a tad overpriced for the coffee. However, food was hot and quite welcome on a wet morning!

Six of us had pasties sitting on the benches on "the bandstand" on the quay on Saturday as this has been our favourite past shop for years.  Three had the traditional steak and three the delicious blue cheese and steak variety.  The only drawback was that they weren't really hot.

Today we went to Rock and walked along the sand nearly to Daymer Bay with the dogs.  On returning on the ferry, we again ha pasties and coffee.  We were assured they were really hot and they certainly were and the coffe was too hot to drink.  Top marks this time!  The dogs enjoyed a couple of pastry corners.
Have been here countless times now and will continue to visit each & every time we go to Padstow. Love the pasties, literally the best ever!!!
A lovely range of bread and croissants. Have tried various items at the B & B where we stayed in Trevone Bay

Shop is in a prime position by the harbour. Baking going on in the premises. I could rave about the meat pasty for several pages. Good meat, fantastic taste, succulent filling with a thin but crispy pastry. Best eaten on a headland along the costal path with excellent sea views.

A good selection of this traditional Cornish delight, the Cornish pasty at its best. They also offer a good range of breads, cakes and other delicious offerings. Well worth a visit and a good choice to sample the world famous Cornish pasty.

Review Title: Staff attitude and a flat pasty
Review Text: Being local here since I was a baby after this busy summer season I thought I would go down and get a pasty as I had other things to do i thought the cough would be nice as we always buy from there. My sister got hers first and then a lady pushed in front of me however the young girl with blonde hair serving had clearly seen me waiting. The young girl serving then looked at me and walked off out the back where she was just doodling around the shop started filling up and she came back out. Obviously embarrassed that she had made me wait she asked what I would like no manners included mind. She then gave me one of the flattest pasties I've ever seen in my life, she did not say please or thankyou when taking my money and straight away asked who was next. I said well can I have a bag then please and she just put it I front of me. Shame that locals are treated so poorly in the town, I think I will stay away from the cough from now on.

We were attracted to this bakery after seeing an advertisement for prize winning pasties. The pasties were lovely. However, the service by the young lady was discourteous. The shop was busy but not packed and she neither greeted or thanked any of the customers.

If it's a Cornish pasty you're after this is the number one place in Padstow.  Winning the best pasty competition in 2016 and with queues for pasties during the summer holidays, the other pasty shops simply cannot compete.

The super looking loaves of bread and rolls in the window drew us to this bakers and we bought traditional pasties to eat as we walked aroundown the harbour. They were excellent well filled lovely pastry very enjoyable
We stopped off for 2 of their award winning pasties and they didn't disappoint. I'd definitely go back next time I'm in the area

I am a connoisseur of all things encased in pastry, whether sweet or savoury. In short, I know a good pie when I taste one. and these were fine pasties indeed. From memory we sampled the traditional ones and the chicken and bacon ones. I would say they were the best we had all holiday, from 4-5 different outlets that we tried.
We were recommended to eat here and the traditional ones were lovely! However, the chicken and bacon ones were cold which was really disappointing.

A regular stop for us. High quality cakes, pastries and of course the ultimate Cornish Pasty. Apparently winners of the best Pasty competition for 2016 .
Their fresh sandwiches are as good as you'll get any where.
Really worth a visit for the Cornish pasties and different types bread. At busy times there is a queue - it's worth joining it.

Review Title: No surprise they do the best pasties
Review Text:
Always good quality
Never disappointed
Always go back
Top quality and very fairly priced
I bet they win next year

Goodness! No comparison between these EXCELLENT pasties which are made on site and others which are brought in by van. Full of meat and flavour with no scrimping. I'm going to be using their mail order service as they are so good. Service with a smile from the helpful staff makes an all round great experience.

Review Title: Padstow institution, but the cakes could be better
Review Text:
A Padstow institution, having been around for forever and a day. However the cakes could be better for the price as they're just average.

Malcolm Barnecutt's bakery which can be found all over Cornwall has much nicer cakes, and at cheaper prices.

The queue outside the door was a good sign - why queue if the pasties are no good

The pasties were served straight form the oven and were unbelievable - the pastry wasn't too thick and the filling tasted delicious .

We sat on the sea wall and enjoyed the moment 

Another pasty later in the week in St Ives was awful in comparison 

If you are in Padstow you must try

I had a pastie every day for lunch, they are super. You can have small, medium and large with all different fillings. I love the original one. The cakes are to die for. My favorite is the apricot cake, fantastic.

Currently on holiday in Cornwall, I searched online for Cornwall's best pasty... How could I return home without trying a real pasty? After finding the Chough Bakery on TripAdvisor and reading the amazing reviews, we headed down there yesterday.

I had a chicken, cheese, bacon and leek pasty and I have to say... It really was very good. The pastry was delicious, as was the filling. I can see why they win awards!

Been here a few times, always a good quality pasty, I would strongly advise you to  get there at about midday as queues grow and the range of pasty choice reduces due to popularity.  Always good quality and tasty.

Review Title: Not the bakers they used to be.
Review Text: We have been visiting the Chough bakery for over 20 years and have praised the pasties for ever! However over the last few years, especially since Alex Pollizi encouraged them to become more commercial, the quality of the pasties has dropped. I get the distinct feeling that need for volume has affected the quality of the product. I will no doubt try them again next year with the hope of improvement.

It seemed as though everyone visiting Padstow harbour were eating pasties when we arrived there on a lovely Spring day earlier this year. We joined in buying one each from the Chough Bakery, delicious they were, with a great selection of flavours to chose from. Not cheap, but well worth sampling, we would again.

Tried one of their award-winning Cornish Pasties on the last day of our holiday, and it was so nice, I had to give them a cheeky mention on my radio show. It was lovely!

Staff were friendly, food was amazing and it's just worth a visit when you're in Padstow! 

Top Marks! :-)
Had the large Cornish pasty, nice pastry and filled with meat and veg. Very well seasoned, it was that nice I had one next day lol

Stopped by for a bit of lunch following a recommendation. We had traditional Cornish pasties which were huge and delicious, well worth the money. We went back for more. It's easy to see why this has been awarded "World's Best Cornish Pasty 2016" We didn't try any of the other pasties they do but definitely would next time we visit.
3rd pasty of the holiday and this trumps the lot, including any on previous holidays!!! Perfect balance of meat and veg, nice pepper kick and hot! Pastry was just right... hard to fault.

Lovely pasties, worth the queue... Even our fussy 12 year old enjoyed one! 
Nice location close to harbour, very busy though!
The pastie was hot after being freshly cooked. The ratio of filling to pastry was excellent, not too much pastry and the filling was tasty, well seasoned with a good amount of beef.
The pasties here are award winning.  i found mine to be average.  Not the best, but not bad.  Very convenient for grabbing a quick bite if the line's not too long.
How this place has won awards I will never know. Rude staff, raw meat in pasties, clearly focused on fleecing the holiday trade. AVOID.

Horrible pasties- overpriced and undercooked. The meat in one was practically raw- my daughter took it back and got a refund but barely an apology. They were very busy with holiday makers, and obviously didn't care about quality. I know good pasties- these are not good and really not worth the money.

Review Title: if you have to queue - just do it !!!
Review Text: They didn't win world best pasty for nothing, quite simply you have to try them. Took a box of 12 freshly baked pasties home with us, but order these in advance! The scones are also excellent.
Called in for lunch and had some of their award winning pasties. Very tasty. Good service and plenty of choice of flavours. But very busy
Bread, pastries, pasties etc all baked to a very high standard. All delicious very reasonably priced excellent portions. Can recommend worthwhile visit.

Review Title: A visit to Choughs when you visit Padstow is an absolute must!
Review Text: Best Cornish pasties ever, excellent, friendly service.  Also serve bread, pastries and love.y quiche.

Our annual holiday to Padstow always involves trips to the Chough Bakery in the harbour. Seems a holiday tradition to have their delicious pasties and homemade bread each morning. We even order their pasties as they operate online pasty deliveries so we have them in Oxfordshire. Definitely the best!
I heard that that was the best place to go in Padstow for a pasty. I have to say I was disappointed. The pasties tasted ok but I expected more flavour considering the prices they charge.
Highly recommend the steak and Cornish blue pasties. Delicious and good quality filling. Taste lovely sitting by the harbour watching the children crabbing.
By far the best pasties in Cornwall. Don't go anywhere else, you won't be disappointed here. They also supplier to most the farm shops in the area.

Everything is fresh. Straight from the oven to the customer. The pasties are apparently the World's best and I can believe it. You often have to wait while they bake the next batch but they are worth it. Scones, Baps and the loaves are all baked to perfection.

Review Title: If your getting a pasty, this is the place
Review Text: This Bakery does what most locals would call the best pasty around, there handmade pockets of loveliness delight people everywhere. This place is very delightfull and delicious.
This was recommended to us by a local and yes the pasties we had were amazing. Full of flavour and taste.

No wonder there's always a big queue outside seeing as it's August and they've won so many awards. I've been coming here for a few years now and the pasties are really good. I'd highly recommend the steak and cornish blue.
It's definitely worth trying a few other things too because the scones are fantastic as are the various pastries. 
It's best to get there early to avoid the crowds.
great bakery right by the harbour in centre of Padstow.  large range of takeaway food. bright cheerful service

This place serves up the best pasties in the world!  Nothing can beat them. Nutritious, delicious filling and light, non greasy pastry. It's the first place that I head when I arrive in Padstow. Cakes are lovely too üòÄ
Voted the best pasty shop 2016? Very busy and always people queuing outside. Had the same quality pasties in the other bakeries too though.

Tried a few different pasties at various locations we visited while on holiday in Cornwall and it has to be said that we all agreed the Chough traditional pasties were the best of the bunch and well deserving of their award. The bakery also sells amazing scones for cream teas and delicious artisan bread. Highly recommended!

Review Title: Perfect Bakery - never leave Padstow Choughs!
Review Text:
Return every year for bread, scones and pastry treats.
Main shop of Padstow, I do got into another big named patisserie when here but Choughs can't be beaten for bread and of course pasties!
Wouldn't be Padstow without Choughs, service is always good. Helps that I don't tend to go in when super busy as the queues are mad sometimes but that's because it can't be beaten for pasties, once you've had a Choughs you won't go for pasties anywhere else. Thank you Choughs team your brilliant x
Good tasty traditional meat & vegetable pasty, polite staff with quick service. Well stocked shop, nicely situated on the harbour.

Review Title: Go for the large traditional pasty
Review Text:
Overlooking the Padstow Harbour. 

Great position and really busy. 

But you understand why and the fact they won Pasty of the Year 2016 comes as no surprise either. 

Went for the large traditional and it was excellent. Served in a paper bag and packed with meat and veg. Not a grease spot to be found. 

Really worth a visit if you are in Padstow but also read they do mail order too!!

Review Title: Not the best pasty I've had!
Review Text: Apparently this is supposed to be one of the best pasty shop in town with award winning pasties. I found that the steak pasty didn't contain much steak although they were good value for money and a good quality and the staff in the shop were friendly and helpful.
Still delivering - usually a queue which is always a good sign - but moves quickly - efficient and cheery staff - always need a Chough Pasty on our annual trip to Padstow

Greta shop with authentic local foods such as Cornwall Pasties and local bakery items. Fresh, clean and well stocked. Opens at around 8am so you can get your breakfast needs early. Well positioned  right in the middle of the harbour walk near the bandstand.

Had a pastie on the way to the beach as they are 2016 champions lovely so on the morning we left I went there early and bought a box of ten get two free I bought the giant ones left over from the night before and you get them half price ate one on the way home freeze the rest individually yum !!

Had a steak and Cornish blue cheesy pasty from here and it was very good. My partner had a traditional Cornish pasty and loved it. Especially as we took it and sat by the water to eat - lovely location!

Delicious pasties, very busy but thats usually a good sign. Reasonably priced. We bought sausage rolls, brownies, cheese, bacon, chicken and leek pasties and traditional pasties and all thoroughly enjoyed them. Highly recommend.

We tried pasties from here during our recent visit to Padstow, and we all loved them! We tried the traditional and they were spot on. We live a long way away but I'm seriously considering the ¬£12 delivery fee so we can have them again....nom nom

Pasties were brown of the outside but the eat inside was raw!!!  By this time we had walked to the other end of the village and seeing as the place is under-staffed we didn't bother taking them back.  The disgusting travesty of pasties went in the bin. Avoid this place.... There are better!
Had heard so much about Chough pasties. Lived up to reputation and expectation. Just terrific. Pasty was hot and full of flavour.

Review Title: Imagine what you could put in a pasty
Review Text: At average of ¬£3-¬£4 each, these pasties are a meal. If you can imagine what could ever go into a pasty, then they do it. Grab your pasty, relax at the harbour edge and watch the world go by.

Many a bakery have signs outside endorsing the medals, awards and records they've won. But the pasties here definitely are worth queueing up for. What's more, for taking home don't pass up their saffron loaf. It will keep for at least a couple of days depending on your self-control. They also sell local honey and jams so plan ahead or be calculating if you want to make that queue pay off!

Review Title: Top marks best pasties in Cornwall
Review Text: First visit for a few years...all the pasties were still exceptional. Unfortunately the vegetable pastie was a tad soggy underneath but understandable as it's not everyone's first choice so they don't sell as many and may sit longer.  The filling however more than made up for it as it was devine ... best tasting vegetable pastie I've ever had... top marks, keep up the hard work folks

Review Title: World class pasties and great service with a smile
Review Text: Delicious pasties, breads and cakes - especially the scones with cream and jam. Sandwiches are amazing and they don't scrimp on the filling.  Very clean.
Picked up some bread from Chough Bakery. Best bread I have tasted. So fresh and full of flavour. Pity we live so far away or Id be thee every day

Recommended to me, I visited Chough Bakery in Padstow with the sole intention of stuffing my face with a traditional Cornish Pasty. I wasn't disappointed, but I wouldn't say it's the best pasty I've had. Maybe the 'dollop of cream' mentioned in the recipe is an acquired taste, it certainly wasn't to mine. Not peppery enough, but I'd have another any day. Not so impressive was a Chicken, leek and bacon pasty which didn't have anywhere near enough chicken or bacon in it. "Leek and Potato" would have been a better description and, again, not peppery enough. 
Next time I visit Padstow I'll do a survey of all the bakeries and see which I like best.

...pastry was nice, good tasting filling, but could've done with a little more meat in the filling.  Friendly staff.
Happy to try again one day, satisfying late lunch snack.
We have visited Chough Bakery several times over the last few months. We have sampled bread, pasties, brownies and rolls. All are excellent quality! Definitely worth joining the queue for!
Everything is fresh and yummy. We buy bread, cakes etc here. The softest donuts. Not cheap but great quality. Always queues and very small.

Review Title: Says worlds best and they are!
Review Text: We called into the chough bakery for a pasty whilst on holiday here in padstow and they say they are the worlds best and they are! I had a traditional Cornish pasty which was moist inside and very tasty. The wife had cheese and onion pasty which she said was the best she had ever had and our son had a sausage roll which he enjoyed! Well worth a visit
1st class pastries and pies. All cooked fresh and the queues show just how popular they are. 2016 award winners and well worth the money.

An excellent family run Bakery priding itself on a superb range of baked products. We visit Padstow frequenly during the summer and enjoy their bread, scones, pasties and pastries. This establishment is top Class by any standard, We are always required to bring the Chough's prize winning pasties back to the Midlands on our return home. These are shared amongst four hungry families. Concensus is that their Steak and Blue cheese pasties are to die for.

We had 2 of the supposedly award winning Cornish pastries..... They were dry with no flavour
I had a chicken, leek, bacon parsty had no chicken to speak off
Traditional one just had no taste
A real disappointment all,round

Advertising World class, award winning pasties - can someone tell the staff!
Couldn't care less service, tasteless food and over inflated prices. 
However there were queues so either everybody is as disappointed as me, the position of the place is key or they don't keep the same quality for there everyday pasties.
Has it put me off pasties - no way!
Made in Padstow cooked in Padstow, not shipped in from afar. These pasties are great. The cakes are also very good as the queues at the door show!

After queuing outside for over 5 minutes we were told when served that they had no large pasties of any type left! I then ordered 2 small ones which were very very average and not worth the money!! 

Would never go back here.
Apart from many freshly baked and prepared items the pasties here are excellent - as indicated by being a 2016 award winner
I had the beef and blue cheese pasty. Not very happy as the was very little beef, even less blue cheese and lacking in seasoning. Not what I was expecting from the pasty champions.
Tasty sandwiches, bread and pasties. Prices are slashed at the end of the day so you can pick up a bargain for tomorrow's breakfast or lunch :-)

Went here as it had a good reputation for all of its products, what a shame it has not kept that up, we had pasties and scones from here several years ago which were great, no moans at all. Not so much as of last week, we had scones and pasties again but feel the same as another reviewer about who actually said they were the best pasties??? We had 12 pasties in  total, Traditional was disappointing, not much meat, lacked seasoning. Chicken,bacon & leek this looked lots better with quite a lot of filling. Lamb and mint was ok, so all in all not much to shout about unfortunately. Scones were not up to what they were either, small in portion and looked a bit anaemic, tasted ok but would not return to purchase anything in a rush, would look elsewhere. Such a shame this was a fab place some years ago with brilliant products, how things change!!

Called in for a loaf of bread mid afternoon, I was the only customer in the shop, waiting to be served. A staff member who I thought was the manager as she appeared to be talking to a supplier at the end of the counter saw me waiting to be served for a number of minutes, along with other staff members who kept walking in and out of the kitchen. Eventually the manager shouted for someone to come and serve. I got my loaf which was very good, however I wouldn't go here again due to lack of customer service and for the rest of my stay I bought my bread elsewhere. Manners cost nothing and first impressions count!

My favourite pasty on Cornwall, but beward the queues, my advice is get in there early and beat the crowds that come with Padstow. These pasties are great hot or packed away and eaten later in the day after a long day in the sea. We go back every year!

Sampling a pasty in Padstow very tasty. Pastry light with plenty of tasty filling. Can't wait to try another flavour. I had a problem with a seagull attacking me while I was eating it and it stole it straight out of my hand so went back to the bakery for a date slice absolutely delicious. Will be visiting again before we go home!!

Enough said just eat one "delicious"
These are award winning pasties which need eating also the bread is very nice and freshly baked

Supposedly the best pasties in the world - according to whom? The very long queue out the door full of customers ready to try these prize winning goods says Chough are doing very well indeed out of their pasty fame, but sadly the two pasties we had (both traditional) were nothing special. Very very little meat in them and a bit bland in our opinion. No better than any of the competitors. Shame as I remember Chough bakery 15 years ago and it was great; much more authentic. Padstow itself has changed too and seemed busier than ever. We won't hurry back.

Review Title: Super bakery but on occasion let down by 'can't be bothered staff'
Review Text:
We visited the bakery several times during our stay in Padstow.  The bread, pasties, and cakes are all lovely and very well presented.  Unfortunately during one of our visits, the lady behind the counter was too busy to serve us.  She knew we were stood there, but failed to acknowledge us and instead carried on her gossiping with her delivery drivers.  All she needed to say was I'm so sorry, I'll be with you in a minute, but she didn't.

Eventually after a few minutes we got fed up and took our business elsewhere.

It is lovely to see how this bakery appears to have flourished over recent years. Delicious pasties are a favourite, as is the apple and raspberry pie! Interesting to see they now do pasties by mail order from the website.....!
Freshly baked, great thin pastry, stuffed with good quality beef and potato/swede. Juicy and well seasoned. All you want in a pasty
As the head line says... Best pasties in Padstow, just need to find somewhere to eat them as the seagulls will take one out of your hand!
Very good Cornish pasties which, incidentally, are now sold by the beach shop at Porthcothan Bay.  The best we have had from the town.
By the amount of people queuing out of the door you will understand why .The pasties here are heaven .But you must try the cakes ,scones and bread as well because they are all superb

We arrived in Padstow early in the morning ready for a boat trip. The smell from the bakery was amazing and we couldn't wait to try the fresh baked pasties as it was award winning. We were not disappointed, the queue was way out the door but we stood in line and enjoyed our pastie for lunch.

Lovely traditional pasties, superb pastry packed with a delicious filling of beef, onions, potato and swede, with just the right amount of seasoning.  Also superb quiche, the shop was very busy but well worth the wait, lost a star because they had run out of large pasties at lunchtime.

We bought 12 pasties to take home and didn't get out of Cornwall before one was eaten. They say they have won awards and you can taste why. Make sure you have room to take a little of Cornwall home you'll not regret it.

Delicious traditional cornish pasties from Chough's. Tried a few since being in Cornwall and these were definitely the best - fresh from the oven, good pastry and generous filling with plenty of steak. Also very nice scones from here too!

They are indeed the best cornish pasties you can find anywhere. The scones are remarkable. Get there early in the morning for best and freshest selections of baked goods and cakes. In the afternoon during tourist season, lines are out the door.
I can quite believe that their pasties are the best in the world! Good range available but traditional Cornish takes some beating

Our pasties were cold in the centre even after having them reheated. Shame they were not fresh.

The pasties were okay we weren't wowed. 

The shop did seem a little busy so maybe it was a bad time.

All that we bought from here was delicious. also sell their bread off that is left at the end of the day at a good price too.They are open at 8:30am on a Sunday morning which was great for us as we were leaving that day so stocked up on pasties,cakes and bread for home.
Lovely caf√© by the harbour with self serve teas & coffees plus good quality hot food. We had teas, coffees and herbal drinks plus free hot water for one of the adults.
A good choice of delicious pasties - highly recommend the chicken, leek and cheese. beautiful bread.  We will definitely be using their mail order service.

Review Title: The Chough Bakery - Cornish Pasty World Champions 2016 - not!
Review Text:
My friends and I were staying in Polperro but decided to take a trip to Padstow during our week away and chose The Chough Bakery to buy some Cornish Pasties.

Apparently,  Alex Polizzi helped them in a BBC programme, I never saw it so can't comment on if Alex did a good job or not.  I can though comment on their Cornish Pasties and their service.

The guy who served us was friendly, smiley, but did seem in a rush to move us on so he could serve the next customer.  As for the Cornish Pasty itself, there is a board outside claiming the bakery won the '2016 Best Cornish Pasty In The World' competition.  I did not agree, and neither did my friends.

The pasties we bought from The Chough Bakery were horrible, their pastry was thick and doughy, the filling was not moist but dry and so tasteless..  How they got the coveted title of 'Best Cornish Pasty In The World' is a mystery.

Would I recommend The Chough Bakery for their Cornish Pasties?  NO.  I would suggest the customer travel to Looe and taste the Cornish Pasties at Sarah's Pasty Shop instead, then they will know how good a Cornish Pasty is supposed to be.
best Cornish pasties in cornwall. They also sell the best strawberry jam which is boddingtons. All the bread and fruit t cakes are lovely infact everything they sell is yummy

Review Title: Best pasties in the world - official 2016 winners
Review Text: Really good pasties, really good everything. Best pasty I have ever eaten, rich flavour and lots of filling too.
For our holiday we knew we could rely on  Chough bakery for all our needs We had delicious. Bread , pasties , date slice and apricot slice also the most amazing Bakewell tart .
Excellent pasties, try the large traditional, its very good indeed and is streets ahead of its competition.

On hoilday in Padstow our third time in this lovely place 

We always make a point of visiting here ... Tasty pasties filled to the brim with meat and potoato succulent , tasty and great value  and the quiche is very good too!

Lovely staff very pleasant and helpful

Me and my family had some of the delicious pastys that have grease free pastry and a selection of very tasty fillings. The scones are nice for an afternoon treat too. Highly recommended if in the Padstow area.

Fully deserved World Champion pasties. Had the medium for ¬£3 which was packed with veg and huge chunks of meat.

No trip to Cornwall complete without a nice pasty.....not that s*** Ginsters try and fob off!!!

Top marks!
Bought a couple of classic pasties to eat whilst out & about - absolutely superb, excellent pastry, nicely seasoned, chunks of beef.

I really, really do not normally like Cornish pasties but my husband and I were a little peckish and it was a bit too early to go for dinner, so we popped into this bakery (it was voted as the best Cornish pasties 2016) - gosh!! We shared a pasty and it was AMAZING!! Not peppery at all - great quality beef and just delicious! You need to taste one:)!
We was on holiday in padstow and decided to buy 4 pasties and rate them. Unfortunately chough bakery came last. This could have been because there was absolutely no meat in it !!!!!

I'm a very fussy pasty eater.  I saw the sign saying they were world champions and decided to give them a go.  We had a medium cornish pasty.  It was just right.  Lovely flavour, good balance of ingredients. I would definitely recommend.

Review Title: Award winning Pasties, I can see why
Review Text: So on our long weekend in Padstow we made a point of trying most of the Bakeries pasties in Town. This was our favourite by some margin; Absolutely lovely, so good we bought loads back home with us too.

This is our go to place for pasties in padstow. We have visited each year for 4 years now and found it to be consistently good. 

Cakes are lovely also and very reasonably priced:)
Traditional Cornish pastys and proper sausage rolls  absolutely wonderful bakery definitely advise going

Visited Padstow today and bought a bacon, chicken and leek pasty here for lunch. It was packed with chicken but it was completely tasteless. Neither the pastry nor the filling seemed to have any seasoning. The man who served me needed some customer service training too.

My partner and I went on a search for cornwall best pasty and as far as we are concerned, we found it right here!

This bakery has won 2016 best pasty bakery and lots of other awards and I can definitely agree they have the best pasty i have tasted in a very long time!

Full of nice chunky meat pieces no fat or sinu and the pastry was perfect. Sometimes they are very soggy or doughy elsewhere but this was the best so I 100% recommend the chough bakery padstow if you want a real cornish pasty and to feel satisfied you actually had a real pasty! We had the traditional pasty as seen in photograph.

There are loads of places offering genuine Cornish Pasty but Chough Bakery says theirs is a world champion. So it was worth a try. 
I don't know what a world champion pasty should be like but this was excellent, tasty and filled to the brim with good chunks of meat. The pastry was light and crisp and in no way soggy.
So if you want a pasty and can't choose between all of the options, try Clough's.

First day we were in Padstow we had traditionally Cornish pasties (medium size ¬£3 ) and they were hot and very good, next day we had a steak and blue cheese, (¬£3.25) and a chicken ,bacon leek and mild cheese sauce,( ¬£3.75 ) the steak and blue cheese was warm and nice ,but the chicken one was cold and not very tasty, I did ask for hot pasties ! I shared it with Mr sea gull  and he liked I so it wasn't waisted, long que, avarage price,
The pastries are the best I have tasted and I can see why they have so any rave reviews - but the sponge cake was like a big brick, albeit with tasty icing,  which as a bakery lets it down.

We always go in here, when we visit Padstow, the Pasties, bread, and sausage rolls, are the very best you can buy. My wife asked me for some money to go shopping in the town,as I can sit and watch people, being disabled, it is great to just sit out side the choufs bakery. after some time, my wife came back with three smaller pasties, why didn't you get 2 big ones, I asked. She said, she had run out of money, the two big ones were such and such, and it was cheaper to buy three smaller ones, well then she didn't have enough money, but the assistant said take them it is only 20p and have a nice day. 

Well done that lady, we won't forget, Rick Stein take note !

We came here to get some scones and clotted cream as it was pouring with rain and we had the dog so we couldn't get a cream tea from a tea room. We brought some freshly baked scones and clotted cream from local farmer and they were just delicious!! The scones were nice and light, not thick and stodgy and were a lovely end to a very wet day! Service was quick and friendly and all the pastries and cakes in there looked just as yummy!

It's official; the best Cornish pasty in the world 2016! 
Yep Chough bakery has won the golden pasty award for the best overall pasty!
They even deliver anywhere in the UK!
What's not to like...

Oh, in case you wondered; they specialise in pasties but do sell other products (scones, cakes, breads etc)
Superb pasties, esp blue cheese ones, friendly staff, would recommend if you want I filling lunch on the go.
The sausage rolls are to die for and apparently they are the 2016 best cornish pasty winners. Best bakery in town by far
I worked in a local bakery just around the corner, but I would venture around to Chough on my lunch break as their pastry is so nice.
Everything from this bakery is excellent that I've purchased. Bread, cakes sausage rolls bacon and cheese turnover and the pasties are fantastic.
Great place by the Harbour for pasties, bread and cakes. Fantastic choice and not overpriced. It appears they have won Best Pastie in the World again! Try them.
Award winning pasties taste award winning! Really worth the visit just for those. Interesting little bakery right on the front opposite the harbour.

Review Title: Nice food - but watch out for pricing
Review Text: It only dawned on me about 15 minutes after we left that I had been ripped off! ¬£19 for 2 pastys and a sausage roll and 2 bottles of water. I checked the prices in their the next day and what they charged me was way off. The food was nice - but watch out - clearly because they thought I wasnt a local - but my wife is!

The bakery offers a great range of products . No doubt it's finest is the award winning pastie, which unlike all others on sale in Padstow is actually made in Padstow!  The cakes are great but very bad for the waistline. Friendly and helpful staff secure a top rating .

We used this bakery on 3 occasions for bread while on holiday. And twice for pasties. Superb quality bread and world champion pasties for 2016 is very well deserved. Extremely popular, with long waits during busy periods but worth it.

We picked a few of their legendary Cornish pasties to take back to our B&B in St Austell.  We were told that we wouldn't be disappointed and we weren't.  Very tasty indeed.  If I could have returned to this classic little Padstow bakery for more, I would have.
Staff friendly and pasties superb.with so much choice difficult to choose but those we tried were perfect

Determined to find the best Cornish Pasty in the county I decided to try this of at least four proper Cornish Pasty shops in Padstow having previously tried one of the others.

It read well on the shop's description great with just the right ingredients even with a dollop of Cornish Clotted Cream on the ingredients prior to cooking.

I was a little disappointed as the vegetable content was a little on the 'al dante' side and there didn't seem to be the right amount of meat.

Perhaps it's me! as this bakery has received 2016 awards and good reviews from customers.

Last year we found a very good Cornish Pasty in St Ives but sadly so far this year have not been able to match it. 
Will keep trying to find the elusive best Cornish Pasty.
ideal for the holiday maker for meals and picnics, If you do not get there early they will have sold out, reckon they come a close second to Rick Stein's
Make sure you stop here and pick up some bread. Croissants are spectacular. Foccacia was perfection.  Wish I lived closer!!

Review Title: Terrific pasties and butties - worth the Q
Review Text:
This bakery has been here for a long time and the bread has always been good but since Mary Portas' visit (the effect of which/TV influence might be misleading) it has a higher profile and there are often queues out of the door! It is worth the wait!
Pasties are full of decent meat as well as the trad vegetables which do not overwhelm.  Sandwiches are reasonably priced, my Cornish Blue, smoked bacon and cranberry (¬£2.90) on their delicious brown bread were delicious.
Heard so much about this place so decided to order some to take home - not been disappointed at all they are the tastiest pasties I've ever tasted, you can order online too for home delivery
delicious pasties packed with well seasoned meat the millionaires short bread is fantastic well worth a visit if your in the area
this is the best pasty we have ever tasted and no acid indigestion afterwards, it's a winner, it's a must
This is our sixth visit to Padstow. In our opinion, and having tried pasties from the other local outlets, Cough's pasties are simply the best.  Long may you continue.  We will be back.

Delicious and s Definately must! 
Packed full of braised beef and veg...
Great crusty pastry...
Won 2016 Best Pasty...
Grab one early or be disappointed! 
Your loss!
Recommend for most bakery products. Bacon roll in the morning, pasties, cakes etc all lovely. Well worth a visit when in Padstow.

Sign outside saying the best pasties and they truly were. We bought a few to take back to Essex and they travelled really well. Friendly staff with lots to buy inc chutneys doughnuts saus rolls and lots more. Friendly staff great place.
Great pasties for all and a wide range of bread. Though this bakery has been here many years the standards have not dropped.

We got pasties here for lunch & got the boat over to rock to have them on the beach. 
Everyone really enjoyed them (even though we ended up sat under umbrellas) & as a vege the med veg one was a nice change to the cheese & onion option vegetarians are usually offered! Would def have again!

Review Title: Just a good, old fashioned family owned Bakery.
Review Text: This modest little Bakery sets the benchmark for its range of baked products, particularly their Cornish Pasties. Have only tried around 5 of their pasties. All were tasty and a substantial meal. Steak and blue cheese my favourite.

We always come here before the end of our holiday. ....best pasties in our humble opinion.  
And we always bring home a saffron loaf as gifts for our cat sitters .

Right at the seafront, a delightful little store with many yummy looking products. But, we were there for their award-winning pasties and we were not disappointed. Sat at the harbour enjoying our purchase and noted the queue at their store!!
Wow, melt in the mouth scones, lovely. Not very large but well tasty. Pasties were well good too, one of the best tasted during my visit to Cornwall

Review Title: Great selection of Bread and cakes
Review Text: We popped in to take some bread back to our campsite and were pleasantly surprised by the huge selection. As we called in after 16:30 all breads were reduced in price which made our choice taste even better.

Review Title: lovely bakery,friendly staff, worth a visit
Review Text: lovely bakery,friendly staff, worth a visit very highly recommended,yummy treats-something for everyone
We have visited this little bakery many times and we have NEVER visited without having to queue! It is well worth the wait too, the pasties are delicious, very filling and incredibly tasty. A must.
visited and bought cornish pastys. great location on the harbour, good value for money & lots of different products breads, cakes, scones, drinks etc. friendly staff too

Review Title: Great bread and award winning pasties .. And they were!
Review Text:
The pasties were very good and ideal for eating by the harbour. We also much enjoyed the cakes and sourdough bread we purchased from here several times during the week. 

Good quality at a reasonable price.

Chough's are famous for their award winning pasties which really do live up to expectations. They have a lovely home made  taste - I believe they make them from scratch on the premises - and a medium sized pasty is as satisfying as a meal.  Their scones are delicious also , they melt in the mouth.  Yum.  Highly recommended.
I had been recommended by a friend to try a pasty from Choughs as they'd won awards and he raved about them.It was very flavoursome and filling !

We have tried all the pasty shops but always come back to the Chough Bakery as in our opinion, they are the best. The pasties are made at the shop and are full of first class ingredients cooked to perfection. Their bread, cakes and scones (with clotted cream) are also very, very tasty. The shop is right by the quay, so buy your pasty, sit on the harbour wall and enjoy!  I understand that they have just won a national award. Well done!

Right at the seafront, a delightful little store with many yummy looking products. But, we were there for their award-winning pasties and we were not disappointed. Sat at the harbour enjoying our purchase and noted the queue at their store!!
Wow, melt in the mouth scones, lovely. Not very large but well tasty. Pasties were well good too, one of the best tasted during my visit to Cornwall

Review Title: Great selection of Bread and cakes
Review Text: We popped in to take some bread back to our campsite and were pleasantly surprised by the huge selection. As we called in after 16:30 all breads were reduced in price which made our choice taste even better.

Review Title: lovely bakery,friendly staff, worth a visit
Review Text: lovely bakery,friendly staff, worth a visit very highly recommended,yummy treats-something for everyone
We have visited this little bakery many times and we have NEVER visited without having to queue! It is well worth the wait too, the pasties are delicious, very filling and incredibly tasty. A must.
visited and bought cornish pastys. great location on the harbour, good value for money & lots of different products breads, cakes, scones, drinks etc. friendly staff too

Review Title: Great bread and award winning pasties .. And they were!
Review Text:
The pasties were very good and ideal for eating by the harbour. We also much enjoyed the cakes and sourdough bread we purchased from here several times during the week. 

Good quality at a reasonable price.

Chough's are famous for their award winning pasties which really do live up to expectations. They have a lovely home made  taste - I believe they make them from scratch on the premises - and a medium sized pasty is as satisfying as a meal.  Their scones are delicious also , they melt in the mouth.  Yum.  Highly recommended.
I had been recommended by a friend to try a pasty from Choughs as they'd won awards and he raved about them.It was very flavoursome and filling !

We have tried all the pasty shops but always come back to the Chough Bakery as in our opinion, they are the best. The pasties are made at the shop and are full of first class ingredients cooked to perfection. Their bread, cakes and scones (with clotted cream) are also very, very tasty. The shop is right by the quay, so buy your pasty, sit on the harbour wall and enjoy!  I understand that they have just won a national award. Well done!

Everyone should go to this bakery. The pasties are the best ever full of meat and great pastry. They are full of flavour We had yesterdays pasty which is a bit cheaper and it was lovely and very good value. I just wish we could buy them locally.
Loved their pasties, not too expensive and lots of other nice goodies in their store too. On the harbourfront, well worth a visit!
Great pasties. Arrived in the afternoon but had pretty much sold out, thankfully they had a large traditional left and we were not disspaointed! Would recommend (and to recommend to go early!)
It's well worth a trip to Padstow to sample the Chough's pasties. They are truly delicious, well filled, good balance of steak and vegetables well seasoned and proper pastry. Excellent!
Had to try a world Cornish pasty winner.  Very good pasty.  GREAT pastry - watch out for the seagulls though... they like them as well !!
The best Cornish pasty , in fact they are award winning. Lovely selection of cakes and bread. Recommend traditional pasty but several other flavours available

Review Title: One of the best cornish pasties I have tasted
Review Text: I wouldn't normally review a bakery on the basis of a Cornish Pasty. I had a few pasties on my visit to Cornwall and most were OK. However the Pasty from Chough was delicious with tasty tender steak, juicy vegetables and perfect pastry. I am getting hungry writing this review. I want another pasty from Chough!

Popped into the Chough bakery with a view to picking up a couple of sausage rolls, one for now and one for later. Are the first whilst sat beside the harbour, before I realised I was halfway through the second. Oh well - luckily the bakery was still open so grabbed a couple more, that's supper and tomorrow's lunch sorted - if you haven't tried one of these sausage rolls you do not know what you are missing.
what can one say but the award winning bread and treats are amazing. make sure you have a room for a few extra loaves. worth the visit.
Far better than mass produced pasties purchased from chain pasty shops up and down the country...we were very pleased!

Saw the sign outside saying it was voted best pasty in 2016. I'm having a large one of those I thought.   Well......bland bland bland tasted of generic mush. Promptly chucked it in the bin. No idea who voted this was the best pasty but they need a slap for voting this place.
Probably one of the nicest pasties I've eaten. Full of nice pieces of meat, not overloaded with veg. Good pastry too, not too thick crust.
Great bread, very busy, friendly people.  Ticks all the boxes for me.  Selection was excellent with pasties, cakes and breads.
Visited on 5th May and treated myself to a traditional pasty, and sat and ate it at the harbourside "ANSOME,TWAS"!!

We have been holidaying in Cornwall for the last eight or so years.  We have been visiting Padstow on each of these holidays.  We first came across the pasties in the Chough Bakery the first time we went.  It is now a family tradition when visiting Padstow to have a Chough pasty.  Chough pasty and a bottle of coke sat on the harbour wall with the sun on your face.  What could be better?
Had many a pasty from the Chough Bakery over the years and they have all  been great. I have also had bread, pastries, cakes etc. and the quality has always been very good.

Review Title: Some of the best pasties in Cornwall!
Review Text: Don't be put off by the big queues! There are plenty of staff to serve the hungry masses with a discerning palate for tasty bakes. The popularity of this place is testament to the delicious cakes, breads and award-winning pasties...voted the Best In Cornwall, 2016. Fresh foods, sold out each day, continually being baked.
Bought scones from The Chough Bakery and we were not disappointed.  Found staff very friendly indeed.  Wish this Bakery was local!!!!!
Delicious award winning pasties and pies. Worth a try, though I thought they were a little on the expensive side!

The chough well and truly deserve their win at the world Cornish pasty championships this year. Their pasties are gorgeous. They also do lovely fresh bread that seems to pop up on menus in many restaurants around Padstow. They do a pretty mean sausage roll too. Keep up the great work and keep feeding usüòú

Don't go anywhere else for a pasty.  This bakery is right at the front of the harbour and they serve the best Cornish Pasty.  Several types to choose one, but really the traditional one is the best.  After you've eaten it, take a walk along the coastal path - you can't beat it!

It was lovely. Nicely seasoned, moist, not to much pastry. 
Would love to try more varieties on offer.
Not much more to say but need to hit 100 characters.
Consistently high quality! We love the pasties, bread and saffron buns also great. Our holiday to Padstow wouldn't be the same without this treat!
The pasties are to die for, especially the Cornish Blue -  BUT the bread is just - the BEST. Tastes like bread should and lasts for days. Yippee!

Review Title: They have just won the 2016 BEST PASTY MAKER IN THE WORLD!
Review Text:
Proof of the pudding is in the eating so they say !!
Worth the drive to Padstow |: After we tried two, we Bought a BOX of mixed 12 pasty's,to freeze at home.
"Proper Pasty" as described by my Cornish wife.... Handsum.
Pasty was light But NOT heavy, filling was traditional and not all veg with no meat.
Pasty was tasty and seasoned well, full of filling, Will be returning.

The traditional (large) Cornish pasty from Chough's was simply divine! We were really looking forward to this experience during our weekend visit to Padstow and it did not disappoint with this regard. However, the cheese, leek and bacon pasty we had the next day wasn't so flavoursome - this was a little disappointing, so stick to what they do best.

According to my husband who was brought up in Cornwall they make and serve the best traditional Cornish pasty.  I haven't tried one but I do really enjoy their chicken, bacon and cheese pasty ..... yum!

This bakery has just won the 2016 title for Best Cornish Pastie and having tried the beef and Cornish Blue I can vouch for the judge's decision. It was the best ever pastie I had ever tasted. The bakery also has a full range of home made bread, cakes and rolls

We have been visiting the Cough Bakery for many years when we stay in Padstow and it has become a ritual to buy their fresh bread and sandwiches or pasties for lunch each day!
Their pasties are absolutely delicious and have won a national award this year too!

Fully recommend!
Great bakery to pick up that early-morning croissants and bread for breakfast.  Reasonable prices as well.
The best Cornish pasties in Padstow and there are quite a few of them!  Didn't try anything else so can't help otherwise.
Just love their pasties and cakes.  The shortbread is divine.  We have been been visiting  since 1993 and have to have a pasty here on every visit.
Brilliant pasties, really friendly staff. Took a dozen home for the freezer ( pasties not staff ) Also clotted cream and scones for gifts. I'm very popular now!

My pasty was stone cold,  took it back,  they microwaved it for a few seconds and gave it back stone cold.  One of the worst pasties I've ever had, went straight in the bin,  wouldn't have fed it to seagulls.  Avoid,  go to one of the better bakeries around the corner.

I'm not usually compelled to write reviews but having holidayed in Cornwall many times and eaten my fair share of pasties I thought the Steak and Cornish Blue was the best one I've ever had, and my wife agreed!

I also thought the young lady serving was excellent. She was happy, friendly and exactly you would want in someone front of house.

I wanted to send our elderly grandfather a birthday cake so phoned round some local bakeries and ended up going with the chough bakery. I don't know the ladies name I spoke to but she was so super helpful she couldn't have done any more for me. I ended up ordering a little hamper for him which he should be receiving tomorrow. Very impressed. Thank you!

Location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield
Review Text: Bought a cheese, onion and leek pasty.  Very pasty and reasonably priced.  No complaints at all.  Worth a visit when in Padstow
This place seems to get the highest rating for its pasties and I can see why - they're terrific.  They also have a good variety - try the lamb with mint.
These are the best pasties in the country, always tasty and warm. Staff seem very helpful and willing to help

Review Title: Excellent pasties and cakes spoilt by surly staff
Review Text: Great vegetarian pasty bought in this shop,  and lovely cakes from the Chough bakery, bought at our campsite shop. Staff in the Padstow Harbour shop were plainly having a hard day and not very happy about it.  Shame.
We've been coming to padstow for many many years and tried all the bakeries and this is the best. Not only for pasties but their bread and sandwiches are fabulous

Great Traditional Cornish pasty. 
Fresh and piping hot. Yummy!
Great service, was very busy with a queue but well worth the wait. 
Might try the blue cheese and steak one next time.

Most locals swear by Choughs which in a town with multiple purveyors of Cornish pasties is worth knowing.  Situated right opposite the harbour it is the best bet for a reasonably priced and filling take-away lunch.  Various testimonials adorn the windows, including one proclaiming them as Pasty Champion for 2016 and as soon as the shop opens you will see customers bearing away boxes and boxes of the prizewinning item.  The smell and sight of trays of passes emerging from the ovens is intoxicating and I defy you not to be overcome by the urge to indulge.  Unlike the greasy products on every high street, the pasties here are made with chunks of meat and vegetables, not the industrial sludge to which you may be accustomed.  Be warned if leaving town on a Sunday: Choughs is not open and you will need to plan ahead.  Fortunately, past experience tells me that they are still delicious 48 hours after purchase!
I'm not a pasty lover but am assured these are absolutely delicious by my honest foodie hubby.  Many return visits made during our 10 day holiday!!

Visited Padstow on a lovely sunny Spring day. Fancied a pasty and saw the Chough had recently been crowned World Champions no less. Tried the large traditional pasty, very tasty, fresh from oven, reasonable price, quick service: job done!

Topped off a lovely day, will return when next in Padstow.

We visited here on recommendation from someone else and were not disappointed. Their cornish pasties are truly lovely with lots of tender meat inside and tasty vegetables encased in delicious pastry! Definitely visit here for your pasty.
Called in for a Cornish pasty no wonder they have won an award was amazing, we decided to go the full way and get a large.... This is not for the faint hearted kept us going for the rest of the day

Been coming to Padstow now for 15 years and Choughs has always been a cornerstone of our trips. The pasties are consistently excellent (we always get a box to take home too) and their myriad of other baked goods are always a treat (the fruit scones are especially recommended). 
The staff are friendly, helpful and chatty, making sure to give you tips on which pasties have just come fresh out of the oven. Yes, the pasty selection is small, but wide selection does not necessarily mean good pasties (I'm looking at you Pasty Presto). Choughs know and love what they do, and they do it brilliantly. 
Handily, they also do a bulk delivery service if you ever want pasties for parties etc., which is well organised and reliable. 

Thanks Choughs for the memories. We'll keep coming as long as you remain open.

We visited a couple of times when in Padstow recently and loved the pasties. Big and chunky with good quality meat.
Don't know how they compare to the other bakeries in the town but they tasted pretty good to us!
very good breads ,scones and there pastys are better than anywhere else in padstow but they sell out very quicky cannot understand why they do not bake more
Visited this bakery on the harbour and we had a most amazing traditonal cornish pasty, the filling was very meaty and tasty. As a result we ordered 12 pasties to bring home.

Review Title: We love the Cornish pasties and the treacle tart.
Review Text: This bakery has an excellent range of breads, cakes, quiches, pies and pasties. Top Quality food always.
We purchased scones and bread and clotted cream. The produce was very good quality but a bit of a shock on price when we came to pay.

We had just come back from a walk from Rock to Polzeath and needed something substantial to eat but not too much to spoil dinner later that evening. Large traditional 'WORLD CHAMPION' pasty from here was just the ticket. Great taste and good value for money
Enjoyed a take away hot sausage roll for a mid-morning snack, but it was a little expensive at ¬£1.85, still this is a holiday place.
Tried an award winning pasty - a medium steak variety . Certainly very good and narrowly missed sharing it with a seagull!
One of the best pasty shops around.  Good presentation and packaging, Small paper carry bag is excellent if you don't want to eat on the go.

If you are visiting Padstow, you must grab a pasty from The Chough.
Also a great range of breads available.

Review Title: Yummy baked goods and top tip!
Review Text:
We've been here a couple times during our stay and enjoyed everything we have had from Cornish pasty to croissants. 

Top tip, if you are in the harbour at around 3:45, the baked goods that haven't sold go for ¬£1. We got a pack of three croissants and focaccia for ¬£2! Yum!

This place is always the best pasty in the country, forget about the 3 shops in the backstreets all next to each other, this place tops them all. Good local firm, producing top quality food! 

Staff always friendly and welcoming!
Went on a recent trip and they had just won the "best pasty in the world" award the day before. They were chuffed in Chough. Lovely pasty, very tasty and not too much pastry.

Review Title: The best pasties in the world
Review Text: Having won the "best pastie in the world award" a couple of weeks ago it's clearly not just me that thinks their pasties are fantastic! We have been coming here for four years now and have always found the pasties to be consistent and the staff to be very friendly. There are numerous other pasty shops in Padstow but I don't know why you would go anywhere else!

Bought 2 cakes, sliced bread, sausage roll and one of their award winning pasties this morning. We arrived home thus afternoon and with our first cup of tea had cake, definitely the best cake we have had in a very long time. Later we had another cuppa with slices of bread and butter, definitely the freshest and tastiest bread I've had. Can't wait now until tomorrow's lunch to enjoy the sausage tool and the worlds best pastie. Should have brought back more, will have to return soon.
Have ordered pastys on 2 occasions now, perfect in every way. Haven't actually been to the bakery yet but seems loverly.
My wife and myself tried one of their Cornish Pasties, well it was barely warm and we neither of us enjoyed it, in fact I do believe the seagulls ate most of it

We visited to pick up lunch to take away, food great quality and a reasonable price. I had the Steak & Cornish Blue pasty, delicious! My other half had a sausage roll (also great) and we ended up going back for jam donuts. Would visit again.
The Chough makes the best pasties in the world. I was "forced" to bring home a dozen large traditional plus a small one for our little grandson.
