Ever since seeing a TV documentary about the bakery, when in Padstow we've always try and buy Pasties from Choughs, sometimes to eat on the day but often to take home. Yesterday was the take home variety which I've just heated in the oven for 30 minutes and as usual - DELICIOUS.. Not due to start the loaf till tomorrows breakfast but I'm sure we won't be disappointed !! Well done Choughs, see you again soon!!

This bakery came highly recommended by friends and it didn't disappoint! Not a pasty lover (I'm ashamed to admit!) I am now converted by the non traditional chicken, bacon, leek and cheese pasty! Gorgeous and my husband says the traditional pasty is one of the best he's ever had - and he's had a lot in his time! The scones and bread were also well worth the purchase! Very friendly and helpful staff.

My wife has just eaten a traditional Cornish Pastie.I had a sausage roll O.M.G 
Could not believe how tasty they are. Going back 2moro and eating them there and taking some home.Pity this bakery is over 200 miles from home as we would be regular customers?Perhaps this is just as well because people would be saying whose ate all the pasties lol
Great pasties, lovely pastry and tasty fillings. Available in 3 different sizes. Good value and friendly service. Would definitely recommend.

Had walked past three pasty shops to get to the "Award winning" Chough bakery, whereby we were presented with a microwaved pasty. A  wet and soggy disappointment by a business that obviously wanted to close early (It was only mid morning) and the place was getting busy, I do not understand it and I bet the owners neither.

The tastiest pasty I've eaten. Great service, lovely food. Every mouthful was delicious. We drove down from Wales and made a concerted effort not to eat anything as it may spoil our appetite. It was well worth it!

Probably the best pasties in PADSTOW, but they never seem to make enough, so invariably end up buying 2 or 3 pasties in chough and then have to go round the corner for the kids to get their preferred pasty!

If you don't fancy an expensive meal, pub lunch or fish 'n' chips - you won't go wrong with one of Chough Bakery's Pasties - made fresh, full of flavour and bursting with goodness.  Grab one, sit on the dock-front and enjoy - but watch those seagulls!!
Good old fashioned bakery and service. The bloomer we had was perfect but the icing on the cake was the massive apple and blackberry pie.

I must say that I bought these sausage rolls, expecting to taste just like any other, they are the best I have had so far.    I had to make another trip to Padstow just for their Sausage rolls, do try them they are delicious!

Visit this shop every time we are in padstow.
The quality of all there food is exceptional.
The staff always smile and are polite.
Prices don't break the bank either.
Daughter and I love the sausage rolls. Great flavours to the pasties as well!!
Whilst there are several establishments that serve pasties, there is no comparison. The Chough Bakery is the best!
Wish I had room for a pasty, as they have award winning ones. An excellent bakery with loads of choice and great smells! Situated right by the harbour.

Whilst looking around the harbour we spotted the bakery and it would have been rude not to pop in.

The smell was amazing and the cakes delicious. The bread was fresh and plentiful.

A nice stop to stock up on essential holiday treats.

We have been regular visitors to Padstow for a number of years now and my husband has, from time to time, bought a pastie at The Chough. We have had no complaints until now - the pasties have always been tasty and they were served up on request or it was made clear that they would be ready in 10-15 minutes. We have just spent another week in the area and invited a close relative along who wanted to try a traditional Cornish pastie. We recommended The Chough, of course. We went in at about 12.30 p.m. - there was one customer ahead of us and another to follow so it was very quiet at that point and our order was pretty straightforward. We stated our order clearly to the assistant and waited, and waited whilst she then ignored us and just stared into the kitchen area. We assumed that she was waiting for fresh pasties and was dealing with our order. At that point, my husband left the shop to wait outside as nothing appeared to be happening. As more people came in, we could see that they were being served ahead of us by another younger assistant.  I presumed at that point that they had asked for other types of pastie.Then the assistant who was meant to be serving disappeared, then started dealing with other customers whilst we were still being ignored!!! I protested (politely) that we were still waiting for our order. I phoned my husband who had, by then, given up and had gone back to the car to wait. We attracted the attention of the younger member of staff (yet again) and she apologised and assured us that we would be attended to as soon as possible. Fine - only to be told that there were no traditional pasties left and that we would have to wait another 10 minutes for the pasties that we ordered well over 20 minutes ago! We went elsewhere.  Having read earlier reviews, I can see that we are not the first to experience this shoddy level of customer service. I left the shop feeling angry and let down and vowed never to go back.
Pasties, bread and scones to die for - definately one to visit for any traveller to Padstow - watch out though as the Pasties filling is like lava!!!

Called into Padstow whilst on Xmas holiday in Newquay,close by,as we had seen the Chough bakery featured on a TV show,decide to try the goodies on display personally.The pasties we sampled were,indeed,delicious,we ate them at the harbour wall,surrounded by seagulls,wonderful experience.
The disappointment did kick in at the bakery,the staff were not very interested in customer relations at all,it appeared that they did not want to be there ! Let alone serve customers.
Padstow it self was completely spoilt by the huge amount of dogs paraded throughout the town,,possibly more dogs than tourists ! ! 
The pasties were very tasty though.
The best place in Cornwall for home made pastys and the staff are very friendly and always a busy shop and that tells you it's a great place

Give it a miss; there's plenty of other choice in Padstow
Staff rude, couldn't care less attitude, mutter about customers while they are serving them.
Simply gorgeous Cornish pasties. The lamb one was perfect. Loads of filling, really tasty, and piping hot.
Great pasties, special Christmas version is unique.must be the best bakery in the area, love it, and we even buy stuff to take back from the holiday
Not impressed at all . Scones and bread ok but pasties tasteless and dry . Would not go back . Preferred pasties from round the corner .
The Chough is a regular stop off on our annual Cornish visit. Fantastic meat & veggies pasties, and yummy treacle tart (and you can buy the clotted cream too)!
Sent cream teas home for my family and friends excellent service they received their goodies within 2 days of ordering
Bought their "special" Christmas pasty, luke warm, given the wrong change then begrudgingly corrected after two attempts. Very disappointing.

This place was once my favourite Cornwall pasty shop. It got to the stage that I'd pop into Padstow just to get one. Whilst in the area earlier this week I ended up doing it again.

Sadly my medium sized traditional pasty significantly failed to live up to expectations.

The pastry was heavy and dry, the filling was bland and ordinary, the whole product wasn't a patch on its former glory. Truly disappointed.

Even in winter time Cornwall is awash with numerous pasty entrepreneurs, competition is fierce. I've sampled both ends of the scale over recent times, some pasties are rubbish, others, such as Sarah's at Looe, are truly wonderful. As for my old favourite in Padstow I'm afraid on this showing the best reference I can provide it with is under average. When you consider the cost it somewhat fails the value for money test.

Shame really as I genuinely liked this place in years gone by.

Nice woman serving but utterly useless, sorry to say. Eventually bought two pasties but the pastry was horrible, heavy and bland pastry. They were fed to the seagulls.
Really, ¬£7 for two pasties is a lot and you expect a bit more, especially considering how many other pasty shops there are in Padstow.
Very poor, very disappointing and would recommend giving this bakery a miss.

My partner and I stopped off here on a very wet Saturday morning, and had two large pasties.which were devine. The staff were all very helpful and chatty. The pasties even filled us up until tea time! Well worth a visit.

Review Title: Excellent Cream Tea delivered to our Holiday Cottage
Review Text: Either the owners of the Holiday Cottage or Harbour Holidays had arranged for a Clough Bakery Cornish Cream Tea to be delivered to us upon arrival. Great surprise and even better eating experience, so good we went to the shop in Padstow harbour, stocked-up on more scones, Pastes and freshly made bread, oops! there goes the diet for a week!
We were surprised to find that we were still able to buy some fresh bread at 3.15pm on a very wet Sunday afternoon. And happily surprised to discover " proper" tasting bread.
Still the best pasties in North Cornwall.  Shop can get very busy though.  Get there early to ensure your order.  Have also tried their breakfast pastries too.  Recommended.

Review Title: Nice Pasty but needs service with a smile
Review Text: Can only base my experience on the short visit today to purchase two medium pasties.  Upon entering the shop a young person was serving the customer in front.  An older lady was stood by the till chatting to staff in the back and by now there were 5 other customers behind me, She finally stopped talking and acknowledged myself and the other customers but only after one had left and I was about to leave.  I did purchase two medium pasties which were quite enjoyable but the service leaves a lot to be desired and with all the other pasty shops around I think I will try a few of the competitors before returning
Had a box of traditional pasties delivered last week.  Absolutely delicious and will definitely be ordering more.
Good pasties, fresh breads and bacon rolls for breakfast. Also the first place open in the morning (8.30am) so has the edge on the other places to eat in town

We have to say that is has begun to deteriorate of late. Today we found again that the pasties were bland and tasteless. They lacked any real flavour, the meat was chewie and the vegetables undercooked. We threw them away and then went round the corner to find three Cornish pasty bakeries and were delighted by what we had.
We always get pasties and bread from here, they really are great, always freshly baked on the premises and served piping hot. A hot pasty on the quay side can't be beaten

We went here to buy Cornish pasties they were the best yet , we sat outside by the harbour and ate them and enjoyed every mouthful, we cant wait to go back next year to have another however you can order by post so im sure this is what we will do, lovely bakery friendly staff and everything very fresh. The smell inside is gorgeous

When visiting Cornwall from Somerset we always stop in Padstow and get our bread here. A few days ago I read about the World championships regarding pasties and discovered how well Choughs had done. Just collected half a dozen to bring home y'day for my Daughter who loves them, could'nt resist of course and I must say............
Absolutely Fantastic!!! Also, before I forget, if you go on there website you can get them delivered, great if you miss Cornwall and can't get there.
On Padstow for a short break, if you want a pastie or any type of cake or bread then you need to come here, top quality baking, reasonable pricing, good service, enjoy
I  really enjoy the scones and rolls from here. My other half loved the pastys. The staff and polite and cheerful and the place is always spotless. We always nip in when we are about :)

Review Title: The only place to buy a pasty in padstow
Review Text: Cant come to Padstow without stopping off at The Chough, the pasties are a good size, good quality and always nice and fresh,you wouldnt need anything else, mind you i do also like the millionaire shortbread.The staff are always friendly and polite
Centrally based at the edge of Padstow Harbour this bakery has friendly and helpful staff and a great selection of freshly baked bread.
Another visit to this superb bakery. Lovely pasties, sandwiches & scones. Not the cheapest but really good quality so worth the extra cost.
Stopped at the Chough Bakery for pasties and coffee for a quick lunch while in Padstow.  The pasties were huge and very tasty.

One of the best pasty's in Cornwall.
We go to Padstow every year and have to have a Chough pasty.
One slight complaint though is that the shop staff are not very friendly, I was there in July and the service wasn't great but I put it down to just a bad day, however I was there again last weekend and the staff were just the same which is a real shame because the pasties/cakes/bread are first class.
Bought a pasty to take home to Hampshire for our son, enormous but quite expensive at ¬£4.95.  He said it tasted great though!
The best Cornish pasties in Padstow and great for taking home for the freezer only pity they don't do gluten free pasties
Its got to be the best pasty bakery in the world. We always have a pasty here on our visits and take a dozen home with us for future lunches as you can freeze them.

don't bother going for a pastie anywhere else (in the world) - these are the best you will ever have ... order up some to take home too (buy 10 and get 2 extras FOC).  freeze them up and enjoy that taste of Cornwall while you pine for summer.  The pasties (traditional) are fantastic - good mix of veg & meat with lovely shortcrust pastry.  Absolutely heavenly!

Review Title: the place to buy your bread from
Review Text: lovely staff, open early, you will never eat bread or pasties from any where else, was a shock coming home to the normal bread

When I booked my holiday in Padstow, one of the items at the top of my list of things to do was to try a Cornish Pasty.  Chough (pronounced 'Chuff' apparently) Bakery seemed to be the highest rated in the area so we went there first.  

The bakery is situated right on the harbour in a wonderful old blue and white building. 

We both had a traditional steak pasty, which contained beef, swede, onions and potato.  They were huge and I think they must have just come out of the oven because they were really hot and remained hot all the way through.  

The pastry was lovely and thin and soft and didn't overpower the flavour of the meat and veg.  My only disappointment was that mine had very little meat compared to my partner's pasty which was absolutely packed with it.  Mine seemed to mainly contain potato and swede with just a bit of meat here and there.  Nevertheless, it was cooked to perfection and was still the tastiest of the three pasties I tried while in Cornwall.  I am very tempted to buy a box through their mail order service.
We purchased some Cornish pasties to bring home and I must say they were excellent. As you are able to purchase these on line and have them delivered I will definatley be trying this out

Review Title: Just the right place to get a cornish pasty
Review Text: It's situated just on the harbour and is always worth getting a traditional cornish pasty from here every summer holiday

the pasties were thrown across the counter to us - literally slid across by a young girl serving. The pastry was hard, it was only luke warm and the meat was bright red. Wished we had gone to the bakery around the corner. May be it was just bad luck today as previous visit was good
We always buy a pasty from Chough's every time we visit Padstow and have never been disappointed. Very tasty.

Cornish pasties have evolved over the years to provide for so many varying tastes,but I believe that a true test of fresh pasty making is by tasting a traditional recipe. 

How many times have we been disappointed when we tuck into the pastry to find so little meat we could almost call it a vegetable pasty or even swede and onion pasty!

Well, not with the Chough Bakery certainly in my experience anyway, I've never been disappointed (except once when there seemed to be a lack of Pepper) but I've had so many over the years that have been just perfect one could hardly complain. The filling is generous, and yes there IS meat inside.

Their skill in producing a traditional pasty is the foundation they have to produce excellent variations both savoury and sweet but I will always return to the meaty Cornish variety.
We have been coming to Chough's for years. We even put an order in for the day we go home so we can have some in the freezer. They put clotted cream INSIDE the pasties! Amazing

Fantastic pasties the best in town 
Freshly baked and delivered all round Cornwall the sausage rolls are to die for
The Chough Bakery is just off Padstow harbour. Lots of freshly baked goods. The scones were lovely and soft and the bread was lovely too. Well worth a visit.

The best Sausage Rolls in Padstow.
Lovely friendly staff that made up a sandwich for my little boy without any butter & fillings he loved!

Over the course of a week we had bread,croissants,saffron buns,pasties,apple pie and bacon baps from this bakery.None could be faulted and we all agreed the bacon bap was probably the best any of us could remember eating.Good job we dont live in Padstow for the sake of our waistlines
Really is that simple. The best Pastie I've ever had!!! There are loads of hand made Pastie places nearby but this was easily the best tasting and piping hot. Well worth trying.

Do we get a cream tea, or shall we buy the scones and make our own.... The latter! 

We bought scones, rolls, cream and a pastie... All really good! In fact the clotted cream was better than  Rodda's (spelling?)
Fantastic scones and they sell jam and cream to go with them! If you want a cream tea at home get your stuff from here
Can't see what all the fuss is about. Sales assistant was yawning all the time. It's just a bakery. Nothing special
Beautifully seasoned, tender beef, full of veggies, peppery and perfect pastry and available in 3 sizes and great value.

We visited the bakery just as they were closing as it had been recommended by friends. The lady said that the pasties would have cooled and so I initially thought they would be quite solid, boy was I wrong. 
The pastry was light and the filling was lovely. I have had Cornish pasties all over Cornwall and this was the best I have tasted.
If you do nothing else - buy your pasty here.  The traditional steak pasty.  Fabulous.  Best ever.  Well worth queuing for!
a local bakery that does provide those naughty but nice cakes and patries as well as the wide variety of pasties.
Great Cornish pasties - just hit the spot. You could tell they must be good from the queue that was out of the door!

We didn't eat here. The bakery is really well placed in Padstow.  We bought bread which looked delicious. The others seemed very happy with it but I imagined it had additives I it. I prefer a sourdough bread so maybe I was just feeling fussy. Perhaps they do other nicer breads.

Best Cornish Pasties in the world. Simples....

Great place for Cornish Pasties, fresh delicious bread and the sandwiches are tasty fresh and wholesome.

Very friendly staff too, Nothing at all to criticise, everything to applaud.

Tried the cornish pasties as watched the TV programme where Mary Portas gave them advise on improvements.  They have taken on board her suggestions and the service is good and assistants friendly.  However, the actual product did not live up to our expectations.  We warmed them up for our evening meal and disappointed to find thick pastry which we left most of and very little meat inside.  Perhaps if you are very hungry it might hit the button but not for us.  M&S cornish pasties which cost a fraction of the price (a 3rd less) are gorgeous with lots of meat and seasoning.
Quick easy and cheap as you would expect for a genuine Cornish pasty. Genuinely the best pasty I have ever tasted and the freshness was spot on. Flapjack wasn't bad either
Not a lot to say here. Freshly made produce in a building steeped in history. Nice Cornish Pasty served with a friendly smiling face. Mind, they're hot !
Best pasties in town ( sorry Rick ) pastry crisp not too thick and lots of filling  first batch cooked at 8 am
Came just to buy a loaf of bread and was slightly put off by the price.  Wasn't overly nice as a tad doughy and undercooked. Staff all seemed slightly bored.

After rather disappointing fish and chips, my boyfriend and I were left feeling hungry. However, we went to Chough bakery and were spoilt for choice! I opted for a caramel slice (the best I've ever had), and my boyfriend a large sausage roll! Both were delicious and reasonably priced! Staff very friendly! Will go there first next time.

Review Title: Amazing Pasties. Cakes not so good.
Review Text: The pasties are superb which is the main thing as this is a pasty shop first and foremost. I also purchased apple pie and brownies. My husband enjoyed his brownie but i was disappointed by the apple pie. The pastry was lovely but the apples were rock hard. I think you should consider pre-cooking your fruit fillings.
Popped in had hunger pangs best  pasty ever!!! real steak  excellent pastry highly , 3 sizes got  a medium should of got the large highly  recommended.

Review Title: What a way to run a business!
Review Text: This business must occupy the premier position in Padstow. Literally everyone passes by it's front door and most of them are in search of a pasty. Every time you attempt to purchase one either they haven't got them ready or the one's on the shelf are cold and need heating up resulting in an inferior product. I suggest they take a trip round the corner and see how Pasty Presto manages to have a constant supply of quality, hot pasties available at all times of the day and actually serve them with a smile, something which seems to be in short supply at Choughs.
Bought 2 pasties today to take home, both were tasteless, no seasoning and the chicken and leek had 1 piece of chicken and no leek. Such a shame as previous visits have been great.

Review Title: !!!!!...... ABSOLUTELY SHOCKING....!!!! STONE COLD PASTY'S ETC @ 1PM
Review Text:
Absolutely disgusting 1pm on Tuesday 18th August 
4 x cheese pasty's
4 x sausage rolls all stone cold as they would be if they came out of the fridge at ¬£4 each.
If I had someone come in my shop and something wasn't right you do your upmost to correct the problem I thought but that means you need to have customer service.
All I got was well that's tough isn't it...!!!
So I won't be telling anyone to go there and waste ¬£20 odd quid on rubbish.
They all forget how long the winter is. SHOCKING & CRAP
We always get our pasties here and so do lots of others. On the day of our departure we buy a dozen of the yesterdays bake which are much cheaper but fine for freezing when we get home

I spotted at least four Pasty outlets in Padstow but this one makes the best, so good that if you had room for another you would have one. Nice large meaty chucks and flavoursome veg, I ate every crumb.
We visit here quite regularly,and every time we do we buy a box of pasties to take home and put in the freezer, they are amazing and would highly recommend.
As if we hadn't eaten enough on a short stay in Padstow we bought some scones to take home. Divine!! Really light, buttery and utterly delicious. Highly recommended.
Standard cakes and pasties, nothing special but just incredibly expensive .. save yourself some money and walk a few yards from the edge of the harbour
Fantastic bakery responsible for several pounds gained BUT it's worth it! Sensible prices and hot tasty food! Enjoy

We had a pasty from here on the off chance of it being ok, turns out it was excellent! We went back for supplies to put in the freezer for after our holiday!!! 
Would definitely recommend
We thought we would grab a pasty from here , and well I have to say it's the best pasty I've ever tasted, it was a award winning blue cheese and steak. Definitely would recommend to anyone .

Superb, tasty, hot, huge and hot. Do I need to go on?
I ended up buying a whole box!
Totally stunning. Fabulously lovely staff. Young man with face fur was particularly helpful.
Best pasties, quick service, locals love it and so do the visitors. They have a plentiful supply so you are sure of buying what you want throughout the day
Best pasties in Padstow.  And yes I've tried most of the pasty outlets! Recommend the blue cheese and steak.
This place dose the best Cornish pasties in Cornwall. I've taken 18 back with me to Yorkshire. You also need to try the sausage rolls.

Review Title: Probably the best pasties in town
Review Text: Probably the best Cornish pasties in Padstow, and made locally by this family owned long established bakery business
For the best Cornish pies in Cornwall.Freshly baked on the premises, a variety of pies all day long. Do not wait to long, as they tend to get busy in the afternoon.
Good, reasonably priced bread. We also enjoyed the fruit pie and treacle tart. As good as Rick Stein's bakery and better value.
These are the best pasties in Cornwall and we tried loads. We will definitely back for more. I especially loved the steak and blue cheese and my husband the original. Very friendly staff as well.

One of the best pasties we tried whilst on holiday. My husband had two so he obviously liked them! We also found out that they sale off their bakery items at the end of the day, cheap bread and scones etc which we also purchased. We went for the traditional pasty and would highly recommend!
This is the best place to get a proper Cornish pasty you will not get a better  pasty in the whole of Cornwall!! They also have a great range of breads and pastry's. Their flapjacks are amazing!!!

The pies, pasties, bread and savouries sold in this bakery are super and we used it on a daily basis throughout a recent week in Padstow.  My wife thought the pain au raisin was the best she has ever tasted.
super quality tasty pasties, good choice of size and flavours - including vegetarian options, friendly ,helpful staff, sensible prices, right on the harbour front
Great pasties - I had the lamb and mint. Fantastically thin and crispy pastry, with a great combination of veg and meat - the mint was quite subtle.
Amazing chicken leek & bacon guys but I must say the saffron fruit buns were amazing the following morning whilst camping! Thank you for the recommendation lady in the line behind me!

Review Title: The best pasties in Padstow and possibly in the whole of Cornwall
Review Text: This is a must stop if you are visiting Padstow, they make the best traditional Cornish  pasties in the area, we have always enjoyed them and they also do a variety of cakes and other pasty's if that is your thing. The only issue is finding somewhere to sit, but even in high summer a spot can usually be found on the quay side overlooking the estuary a couple of mins walk.

Review Title: Best Chicken Bacon & Leek Pasty in Cornwall
Review Text:
After sampling pasties in Looe, Newquay, St Merryn, Treyarnon and other outlets in Padstow I'm pleased to announce that in the 'Chicken' based pasty category, the Chough wins hands down.
Extremely tasty, lovely crust and the greater part of a well cooked chicken breast. Fabulous!
Lovely local bakery with delicious bakery offerings. friendly service and good advice on keeping the pasties
We have been before and it never disappoints. The food is always fresh n tasty and when we visit padstow again this is always on our must visit list.

Review Title: Excellent - the scones are too die for
Review Text: Visited here On Sunday 9th August whilst in padstow the queue was out of the door, the scores were lovely and not at all dry, we also bought a sliced loaf and this was just as good,highly recommend this shop well worth the queue for! Would use again if ever back in padstow !

it's years since I have tasted pasties of this quality and it serves to remind that the pastry encased sludge so frequently presented as Cornish around the country is not what we should have to put up with.  Every day we went walking we bought Pasties from here for our lunch and they were consistently excellent .... well done Chough Bakery
Always get our pasties here! We usually have the traditional ones, full of meat and flavour. Scones are pretty good too. Just watch out for the gulls if you're eating your pasty outside!

Review Title: One of the worst pasties I've ever had!!!
Review Text:
Whenever I'm visiting somewhere I always try local produce, which brought me to sampling one of these pasties!
I read that their traditional pasty had clotted cream in them and as I can't eat cream I had to decline. Others in our party had them and said they were pretty tasteless and had a weird flavouring to them.
I had a cheese,leek chicken and ham pasty! One chunk of chicken, 2 tiny bits of ham, and a tasteless bland cheesey filling! 
After reading other peoples comments I'm thinking are we all eating the same pasties? Maybe if you're use to supermarket own pasties, in comparison, these are ok?!
The pastry was quite nice though!!!
To say we are addicted to Chough's pasties is an understatement as I guess we eat them almost every day we are in Cornwall and none other compare - they have a secret recipe which is scrumptious!

Although the bakery is quite tired, this place has good and friendly customer service and services a continuous stream of hot, fairly priced traditional Cornish pasties. 

This seems to be the place to buy your pasty.
What is so good about the Chough is the quality of all it's products such as the bread, scones, saffron buns etc.

Review Title: Better than other famous chef owned deli pasties
Review Text: Our family asked us for our opinion on our recent visit to Padstow, who makes the best pasty in town? After trying Steins which are very nice, our favourites are Clough bakery pasties. The taste shines through, meatier chunks, tastier vegetables and great seasoning. In fact, everything from Clough is great, try their scones and you will never eat another.
By far the best  in the harbour. We had tried the others and wish we had tried these first as would not of gone anywhere else. Want  Cornwall pasties then these are the place.

Review Title: Lovely food but building looking a bit weary
Review Text: Food wonderful here but need The Hotel Inspector back to do another paint job on the building!   It's a prime site in lovely Padstow so no excuse... business seems prosperous enough to have it ready for the summer season.

No trip to Cornwall can be complete with a steak pasty from The Chough Bakery.  I still believe they're the best, if not one of the best in Cornwall.  This year I decided to try a Blue Cheese variant (along side the excellent steak of course) and I was not disappointed.

Next year we're focusing on the Penzance area so we're not going to be local but I will happily make the 80 mile plus round trip for my Chough fix!
Went back twice and both traditional and Cornish blue were both delicious. Veggie option and sausage roll were also good as tried a bite of other people's. The service was also really friendly

Very good pasties with lots of lovely flavours! I would recommended the Stilton and steak pasty very good! I would also recommend the fruit scones light and fluffy! One area for improvement is that the pasties could do with some more steak inside! As some had lots of steak in and others didn't! Overall very good!

There's really not much else to add.  These pasties are just wonderful.  The best we've ever had.  And the Apple and Raspberry pie .. Mmmm.   The kids loved them.  All served by very helpful and cheerful staff.  Great.
To say we are addicted to Chough's pasties is an understatement as I guess we eat them almost every day we are in Cornwall and none other compare - they have a secret recipe which is scrumptious!

Although the bakery is quite tired, this place has good and friendly customer service and services a continuous stream of hot, fairly priced traditional Cornish pasties. 

This seems to be the place to buy your pasty.
What is so good about the Chough is the quality of all it's products such as the bread, scones, saffron buns etc.

Review Title: Better than other famous chef owned deli pasties
Review Text: Our family asked us for our opinion on our recent visit to Padstow, who makes the best pasty in town? After trying Steins which are very nice, our favourites are Clough bakery pasties. The taste shines through, meatier chunks, tastier vegetables and great seasoning. In fact, everything from Clough is great, try their scones and you will never eat another.
By far the best  in the harbour. We had tried the others and wish we had tried these first as would not of gone anywhere else. Want  Cornwall pasties then these are the place.

Review Title: Lovely food but building looking a bit weary
Review Text: Food wonderful here but need The Hotel Inspector back to do another paint job on the building!   It's a prime site in lovely Padstow so no excuse... business seems prosperous enough to have it ready for the summer season.

No trip to Cornwall can be complete with a steak pasty from The Chough Bakery.  I still believe they're the best, if not one of the best in Cornwall.  This year I decided to try a Blue Cheese variant (along side the excellent steak of course) and I was not disappointed.

Next year we're focusing on the Penzance area so we're not going to be local but I will happily make the 80 mile plus round trip for my Chough fix!
Went back twice and both traditional and Cornish blue were both delicious. Veggie option and sausage roll were also good as tried a bite of other people's. The service was also really friendly

Very good pasties with lots of lovely flavours! I would recommended the Stilton and steak pasty very good! I would also recommend the fruit scones light and fluffy! One area for improvement is that the pasties could do with some more steak inside! As some had lots of steak in and others didn't! Overall very good!

There's really not much else to add.  These pasties are just wonderful.  The best we've ever had.  And the Apple and Raspberry pie .. Mmmm.   The kids loved them.  All served by very helpful and cheerful staff.  Great.

You won't get a better, fresh, traditional Cornish pasty - I'm convinced of that.

Peppery, full of vegetables, juicy tender steak, and delicious pastry. The queue out the of door during high season should tell you all you need to know.
My wife always has at least one each year, well worth the short wait and really great pasties every time.
Another one if our favourite places, we stop here fir pasties, we have tried all the others. It they seem to be the best here and they also do really nice coffee too

Excellent pasties!! We had pasties everyday from this lovely bakery. We tried both the traditional cornish and the steak and cornish blue! Both were excellent. We liked it so much we bought a box of 12 pasties home. A must if you are visiting Padstow!!

Bought freshly cooked bread from the bakery early one morning - tasted lovely - also bought a Cornish pastey from there and it was the best one we had whilst in Cornwall - found some very disappointing

The Chough Bakery is the only pasty company I've found in Cornwall that has been able to make me a vegan pasty! The pastry used vegetable oil and was unglazed so the Mediterranean veggie pasty was 100% vegan. And it tasted AMAZING.

Well done for being so accommodating, chough!

A trip to Padstow is not the same without a snack from the bakery. I am more of a cake face and the cakes are reasonably priced and tasty. The millionaires shortcake is gorgeous. I have made this for years and my kids tell me that the chough version is better than Mums !!!!. I have invested in their bakery book and it was nice to read about the family behind the bakery.

Review Title: worst pasty I ever had & so disappointed !
Review Text: Chose this place after seeing it on tv in a baking competition. Wish i had not  bothered. ¬£4.25 for 'luke warm'  large traditional Cornish pasty with lumps of gristle  & undercooked veg ! I would've complained but the queue was so slow moving I wasn't prepared to waste anymore time. Quality control needs a serious overhaul.

After enjoying a Chough past here last year I was determined to have another one this year and avoid the other pasty outlets in Padstow.  I am afraid it was the wrong move.  The pastry crust was hard and chewy and not up to the usual standard.  My son in law bought another on a different day and was also disappointed.  What have you done Chough Bakery to spoil your pasties?
Delicious traditional pasty. I don't usually enjoy pasties but I'd eat them all the time if I lived here. They only had the traditional flavour available fresh early in the morning
Fab pasties - just the right balance of beef, veg and seasoning for us and a tasty pastry that manages to seem 'light'! Genius to do 3 sizes too.
Stunning pasties, perfect croissants but get there early. Fresh bread to die for and cakes highly recommended . Also do great take away coffees

This bakery has been featured on The Fix it. And they have I bought the wholemeal baps and they were very tasty so much so I bought several packets to put in the freezer. Yum. My only criticism  is the Mediterranean pastie it is a little soggy. Much prefer the cheese & leek flavoursome delish
Popped in today for some pasties and sausage rolls only had 2 sausage rolls left and was toldthe pasties were yesterdays gutted was a lot better last year....

We tried several of the varieties of their pasties during a recent stay, and loved them all. The traditional Cornish Pasty had a lovely, peppery touch to the filling, and the Beef and Cornish Blue Pasty - well, just fabulous. We also bought some of their scones after having been served them as part of the cream tea at Prideaux House - wonderful, some of the best I have ever had. Can also recommend the cakes. Friendly staff, reasonable prices. Great!

The are any number of places to go to find your lunchtime pasty in Padstow but The Chough Bakery is one of the best and offers very good value. Serving not only a range of pasties but also other savouries, pies and sweet pastries as well as a range of breads, the bakery also offers freshly made sandwiches and a selection of soft drinks. A one-stop shop for the family lunch.

Review Title: Cornish pasty. the original and best
Review Text:
Forget the Ginsters  or any other so-called Cornish pasty once you have had one of these there is no going back.

Excellent value. Big means big.

Going back to Padstow VERY soon, Chough's will be on the list of things to do.
The best pasties in Padstow! They offer a small range of fillings including a veggie option, chicken option and standard, and they also offer a range of sizes; small, medium and large.

The queue to get in this place speak for themselves - we saw the queue and literally joined it.
So glad we did, it was the best Cornish pasty we tasted ever !
They do of course do many things like great pastries and other pies but you MUST try the pasties

It is hard to believe how much this place has improved from years back. The pasties are some of the best I have had in Cornwall with plenty of filling and a nice spicy flavour. Great tucker on a breezy day out in Padstow.

We've holidayed in Cornwall for several years now and have tried out numerous pasties in our quest to find the best. All of this has played a little bit of havoc with my waistline, but without doubt these are the best we've had. Generously filled, perfectly cooked meat and veg, and the important bit, beautifully moist. Not the longest pasty menu in Padstow, but this year we've had the pleasure of traditional steak, lamb and mint, along with my own personal favourite, steak and Cornish Blue cheese. I think they do a couple of veggie options too and we've also tried the bread and scones and been thoroughly delighted.

There's generally a queue to be served but plenty of staff who all work efficiently and exchange pleasantries, so the aromas from the ovens don't tease for too long. This is a bakery and so although the pasties are hot, you need to find a bench or a wall, or avoid unwanted attention from the gulls and take them back with you.

In the commercial empire that Padstow has become, it's really good to find somewhere that offers something traditional at a reasonable price. Something for the people. Of course, clearly some prefer a chicken tikka filling, or in line with the current trend, pulled pork. All of this is available around the corner. At the other end of the scale, I'm sure you can find a 'proper' restaurant where a delicate pasty is served on a lovely china plate with a little garnish of limp leaves. I bet you'll pay a lot more than we did (circa seven quid for two pasties to go). But for me, it's a bit like fish and chips at the seaside tasting  better in the newspaper they're wrapped in. A hot pasty, a glorious view, some fresh air and a gentle breeze. Perfect.

Called in for two traditional large pasty's on the 29th.

Fantastic.

They do a range of other flavours here and it seems to be a very popular spot to buy a pasty.
Had seen this bakery featured on Australian TV and were keen to sample their fare . We bought some pasties to take back to our B&b and had them rather than go out to eat.
As you can imagine, there are quite a few bakeries in Padstow selling pasties but we found this one to be the best and mst traditional.

Review Title: Amazing pasties and fab customer service
Review Text: Just popped in for our annual pasty box on the way home from Cornwall and met with such friendly service. It was busy but nothing was too much trouble. Pasties tasted as great as usual too :-)

Chough's bread is fabulous. We purchased a loaf on the last day of our holiday, got it home to West Berks and it was still fresh. The scones that were purchased were for a gift so I am unable to comment on these.
I believe that Choughs is a family concern, if so they are doing a fantastic job as on both visits to Padstow they were busy with people queuing out of the door!
What an amazing place well cooked well presented lovely staff and you must try the pasties. Everything about Chough Bakery is quality. Thanks for many happy lunch times

Visited Padstow last week whilst on holiday, popped in the bakery for some lunchtime sandwiches.  Had the roast beef and the chicken and bacon, they were absolutely full of filling, they are so deceiving and the price of under ¬£3 was an added bonus.  Will definitely be getting the sarnies from there again.
There are a lot of pasty shops in Padstow, but somehow this seemed to be the best "traditional looking" shop. Plus it was always busy. We purchased the traditional Cornish pasty and it was excellent.
Amazing shortbread! What more can i say. I come here every year. I know its sad but the shortbread is beautiful!
Traditionally made delicious pasties among the best in Cornwall! Great bread and cakes too! Consistent quality wherever you buy them.
we have only tried their bread and found it to be very nice and resonate priced we will certainly go again.
Their pasties are as good as ever. The outside of the building could do with a tidy up, but that should not distract you from what is on offer on the inside. Lovely pasties, cakes and bread.
Simply the most delicious pasties you could wish for, ooo and their cakes are truly gorgeous. Even the vegetarian pasties are divine.

Ordered some pasties on line for our son's birthday. They arrived on time and were well packaged.
Correspondence was prompt and professional.
The pasties were competitively priced.
Haven't tried them yet. Friends are coming on Saturday - but so far so good!
Best bread and pasties in Padstow all at a good price. Open early closes late well worth a visit. Try the scones and treacle tary

Visited last year after seeing this place on TV with Alex polezzi helping out . I think she may need to pop back. Last year pasties were lovely but this year we were very disappointed as they were soo peppery. So poor we threw them in the bin. Will think twice next year!!

As this was the first time we had pasties, it was exciting to try ones by the bakery that had been featured on TV. We had a 'Traditional Cornish' and a Beef and Blue Cheese. Both came in 'medium' which was HUGE, both were very tasty for a meal which wasn't pre-browned, and the meat was obviously top-notch because it melted in the mouth. What we must not ignore too was how mouth-wateringly good the Chough's Millionaire's Shortbread was for 'afters'! Plus, we successfully avoided getting bombed and robbed by Padstow's resident seagulls by staying close to a wall. Eat these on a bench out in the open at your peril! The seagulls WILL get your lunch. Improvements? More 'small' pasties please. The medium was too large.
Really enjoyed some delicious traditional pasties at very reasonable prices and cheerful, friendly staff. Highly recommended!
The pasties from this bakery are delicious - what more can I say?!  They supply many local shops and restaurants.  It has a prime position within Padstow and is well worth a visit.
The best pasties you will ever have, go for the small steak pasties and buy two instead of the larger ones - amazing!

Always always always pick up a bakers dozen of traditional pasties before I head back to Hertfordshire! End up doling them out at the pub and all I end up being left with is a car that smells like pastry for the rest of the summer! Not complaining...
Great food; freshly baked and delicious especially the Cornish pasties, sausage rolls and fresh bread and cakes!

Review Title: Vegetable pasties are full of grit
Review Text:
We noticed last year that the vegetable pasties were very gritty. After a number of complaints the owner told us that he had changed suppliers of his leaks as he thought this was the cause. We returned agin this year and my wife tried one again. She said it wasn't as bad as last year but she still crunched on a gritty sand like substance. I had the traditional pasty which was absolutely fine but indistinguishable from other pasties that I have had further down the coast. 

Something had to be done to sort out the vegetable pasties at Choughs!,,,,,,,

Been coming here for years. Usually when we visit we end up ordering 40 pasties because we get so many requests from friends and family. They are jam packed with meat and vegetables. Extremely tasty and the pastry is perfect. Do not go to the big chain pasty shops as their pasties are mass produced and tasteless.

We only visited this bakery to purchase a few pasties to take home, the staff were really friendly and helpful.  We had the pasties when we arrived home after a long drive and they were really nice, would definitely return.
Very good pasties with friendly service. Best pasties in Cornwall go to porthleven but would definitely recommend this one!

Review Title: Great pasties and such friendly staff
Review Text:
Grabbed a few bits from Chough bakery when heading to the beach in Padstow. 

We were nearly put off my the queue but glad we waited it out. The staff were really friendly and chatty even though they were rushed off their feet! We had a selection of pasties, sausage rolls, a sandwich and some shortbread. All were lovely.

Well it's okay for a pastie and a loaf but the coffee is certainly better from Stein's Bakery I'm afraid.

Listen, you aught to choose the traditional place but don't expect mind blowingly amazing, that's all really.
Lovely proper pasties. I bought some to take home as we live 11miles away which tells you how nice they are, if a little expensive!

After arriving in padstow we thought we would go to the local bakers for some fresh bread and croissant. I googled the local bakers and found the chough bakery. First page said it was in trouble and it was being rescued with the help of the lady on tv. 
So i thought "lets go and help them too "rather than go to ricks bakers. 
Well.. A lady kind of served me. More interested with wrapping someones quiche than actually talking to me. I asked if they had any croissants as there were none on display. The lady asked the baker and she said no we didn't put any in the oven, As it was raining and we thought nobody will want croissants. So i said ok and is it possible to order a few for tomorrow ?
Yes she replied and took my order and i left.
The next day i arrived to collect my order and i was told there was a problem . They only had two plain croissants. And one was an almond one. So i said thats fine. I don't mind . "Really!? Do these people actually want custom? "I got the impression they dont want the custom and took my custom to ricks all week instead.
Had takeaway pasties from the shop to eat on a walk along the cliff path - very tasty, good size (I couldn't finish mine!).

As always in busy times you will queue for these, well worth it though. 
They also bake delicious breads too. 
Not so sure on the sausage rolls a tad salty..

We bought a selection of their cornish pasties to take back to our cottage and they were very good.  On our second visit we bought
bread with olive oil and rosemary topping, again delicious
fab bread, fab pasties, fab cakes, says it all, lol. glad I dont live next door, I would have a serious weight problem, ha ha

What a delicious bakery!!! We bought 3 different flavors of Cornish pasties & they where all absolutely delicious, home made pastry & packed full of meat. Voted the best ever Cornish pasties by all the family!!!
We also bought their home made fruit & plain scones & a jar of full fruit strawberry jam,they where as light as a feather & very yummy!!!
Very clean shop & friendly helpful staff.
just had a week in the area and i am very fond of good pasties these are the best in padstow just ahead of all the others in the village

You'd sort of hope this family bakery would do good pasties as that's what they are famous for, having been on TV with Alex Polizzi sorting out their problems.

Four pasties and a drink came to ¬£14ish so not too bad. We had a traditional, a steak & cheese and a veggie one. Pleasant staff served us and we sat on a bench overlooking the harbour in the sun munching in the Cornish air.

We were hoping for a nice traditional Cornish pasty .
The pastry on our traditional pasty was nice unfortunately the filling was extremely bland .
We would not buy another Cornish pasty from coughs .

Been using this bakery for quite a few years. Pasties are among the best I've tasted and I think they're the best in Padstow by far. The shop is also full of delicious cakes and savouries to tempt you as well as traditional bread. Thoroughly recommend it.
Best pasties by far, great staff super helpful and knowledgeable about their product.  Rest of the bakery products are first class as well, try the saffron cake.

Review Title: Great pasties and very good scones
Review Text: The Cornish pasties here really are mouthwatering. Hot from the oven, wonderfully light pastry (even the crimped edges are delicious) and chunky well seasoned moist filling. The veggie pastie that my partner had was good too. We also bought some scones to take home. Normally I do not like bought scones finding them too heavy and dense. These were delicious.
Lovely small backery with everything you need for a quick bite. We had bread and pasties which was fresh and tasty. Will come back when next in padstow

We ordered some Cornish pasties, cream and scones to take back home, and I must say it was all very tasty. There was plenty of pieces of meat and just the right amount of seasoning in the pasties and the scones have to be the best I've tasted in along time.
The  food is wonderful and so much choice. We had some apple pie, which is probably the best we have ever had. The service is also great and staff so friendly.

Review Title: As most of the reviews suggest!
Review Text:
Excellent pasties and sausage rolls. Quiche also worth a mention!

Food was lovely, if a little cold, although they do offer to reheat for you.

I guess I'm being picky in that the other well established chain always has piping hot pasties ready for sale.

The meat content in these pasties are a lot better tho with proper chunks of meat.

Very tasty indeed!

Bought medium and large steak pasties from here. Very tasty filling with chunks of steak and veg, and nice soft pastry, but could do with increasing the amount of filling. Also would have preferred my pasty just a tad hotter. Would happily buy a pasty from here again if in area, but I'm afraid it wasn't the best value/tastiest pasty I've had in Cornwall before. However, the staff in the shop were very polite, courteous and friendly. The pastries on display looked delicious.

The traditional pasties are so good here, lovely chunks of tender meat, very tasty.
the cakes are amazing too; especially the chocolate tiffin, bakewell tart, apricot snd date slices:- huge pieces! great value for money and lovely service.
Fantastic bakery, best pasty to be found in Padstow, also try the sausage rolls, scones are also the best I've ever had.

This is the only place in Padstow to buy your pasties from. It's a traditional baker's shop rather than somewhere that offers only pasties (of which there are a lot in Padstow). The pasties are delicious. The traditional ones are the best I've ever tasted, they aren't cheapest in town but they are the best. The sausage rolls are incredibly generous and the scones a treat. Can't recommend enough!
Very nice selection of bread, pasties and cakes with vegetarian choices too. Polite and friendly staff and good value.

We always visit this bakery when in Padstow. Everyday fresh bread and it smells and tastes delightful. They queue out the door for the pasties and sausage rolls and it's easy to know why. You have to try something from here!
Everything they sell is excellent and the pastys are the best ever. I always take some home with me.

Really good pasties, had the mediterranean vegetable and, of course, a traditional and really  could taste the difference between your processed supermarket offering and good tasty freshly made pasty.

Buy one and go for a walk :)

The Chough Bakery is probably one of the better pasty-sellers in Padstow. A lot of the other ones are a bit decrepit and shifty-looking but the Chough Bakery was lovely. Deliciously cooked pasties at good prices. We had the traditional and the ham and leek one-although honestly speaking the traditional one wasn't as yummy as the ham and leek!

A nice little bakery, very near the harbour.

A good place to get pasties for lunch.

Recommend that you get a snack from here unless you want to pay the over inflated prices in the local restaurants - especially if it is a sunny day and you can snack outside

On a sunny Easter Monday with a fairly busy Padstow we decided on a pasty lunch!

Very tasty pastys with lots of steak and a lovely peppery taste.

Recommended for a traditional Cornish Pasty.

Review Title: A bit of a queue but worth the wait
Review Text: We ordered 2 of " yesterday's" pasties which were being sold for ¬£2.00 each as we were walking and would be eating them cold later. Gosh, they were good and knocked spots of others we'd had "straight from the oven". Enjoyed sitting on the cliff top looking at some of the finest scenery in the world and we were in paradise.
Been here 2 years in a row‚Ä¶great pasties, really delicious. Would recommend. Not too much pastry, plenty of filling.
Over the past 20 years I must have bought close to 300 pasties from Choughs... They are so delicious. My favourite is the Steak and Cornish Blue.
Very nice selection of bread, pasties and cakes with vegetarian choices too. Polite and friendly staff and good value.

We always visit this bakery when in Padstow. Everyday fresh bread and it smells and tastes delightful. They queue out the door for the pasties and sausage rolls and it's easy to know why. You have to try something from here!
Everything they sell is excellent and the pastys are the best ever. I always take some home with me.

Really good pasties, had the mediterranean vegetable and, of course, a traditional and really  could taste the difference between your processed supermarket offering and good tasty freshly made pasty.

Buy one and go for a walk :)

The Chough Bakery is probably one of the better pasty-sellers in Padstow. A lot of the other ones are a bit decrepit and shifty-looking but the Chough Bakery was lovely. Deliciously cooked pasties at good prices. We had the traditional and the ham and leek one-although honestly speaking the traditional one wasn't as yummy as the ham and leek!

A nice little bakery, very near the harbour.

A good place to get pasties for lunch.

Recommend that you get a snack from here unless you want to pay the over inflated prices in the local restaurants - especially if it is a sunny day and you can snack outside

On a sunny Easter Monday with a fairly busy Padstow we decided on a pasty lunch!

Very tasty pastys with lots of steak and a lovely peppery taste.

Recommended for a traditional Cornish Pasty.

Review Title: A bit of a queue but worth the wait
Review Text: We ordered 2 of " yesterday's" pasties which were being sold for ¬£2.00 each as we were walking and would be eating them cold later. Gosh, they were good and knocked spots of others we'd had "straight from the oven". Enjoyed sitting on the cliff top looking at some of the finest scenery in the world and we were in paradise.
Been here 2 years in a row‚Ä¶great pasties, really delicious. Would recommend. Not too much pastry, plenty of filling.
Over the past 20 years I must have bought close to 300 pasties from Choughs... They are so delicious. My favourite is the Steak and Cornish Blue.

We've been coming to Padstow over for over 15 years as a family, and in that time many pasty shops have opened up to compete with Chough's - none have come even remotely close, and frankly it's a wonder any of them stay open for more than a year.
The best by a mile.

This bakery on the harbour side is a must visit every time I'm in Padstow, despite having 3 "high street" pasty shops in the street behind, these are the genuine product and a box always returns home to keep the Cornish memories alive.

Delicious saffron buns, bread rolls so soft and delicious and the most indulgent scones! A trip to Padstow is never complete until I've had a trip to the Chough....Pasties are the best in Cornwall, in my opinion!
We came here for some bread and local offerings. A good variety of bread and cakes and a friendly, local staff. Substantial in its food and in the centre of town for convenience.
Wasn't in Padstow 10 minutes before we got one of these fabulous pasties, no need to try anywhere else.....superb!!

Review Title: The best pasties and chocolate brownies!
Review Text: We always come to the Chough when we are on holiday in Cornwall, whichever part of Cornwall! Quite simply the best Cornish pasties, and last time we visited we bought a chocolate brownie. It was the best chocolate brownie I have ever tasted. And I've had a fair few. If only they did delivery...

Pasties as good as I remember from having lived in Padstow a long time ago. Quite expensive but soooooo good. Ate them on the bandstand with hopeful seagulls hovering. Best food in Padstow. Eat your heart out Rick Stein

Take away pasties for lunch on a beautiful sunny spring day. Also gorgeous pies & pastries & doughnuts on display. Quick service by good staff, prices fair. Good choice of different flavour pasties. Attractive, juclean premises.

Review Title: On a cold winters day it's the refuge of refuges.
Review Text: What a place, pasties straight from the oven. OMG how tasty. Worth the drive to get them for the drive home. Service is typically "kernow" and super friendly. Best ever pasty.
Can't go to Cornwall without having a pasty, and these are delicious, good value for money too. We ate one walking around and took a dozen home with us too
Great location, do not be swayed by the many other pasty shops nearby. These are the best!!!! The chicken, bacon and leek are superb. Also many other good products on offer.

My daughter's had the traditional cocktail pasties, I were lovely and didn't last long. The enjoyed them on the walk along the coastal path. Reasonably p
riced
Frequent visits to Padstow and generally have a pasty from here and a pint at the London Inn, perfect combination. Also very good cakes as well

Review Title: You have to try a pasty
Review Text:
Saw this place on TVs 'The Fixer' a few years ago, and had to try the goods for myself! 
I had a chicken pasty and my girlfriend had the 'cocktail' sized traditional. 
Pastry was flakey but not dry, meat was moist, seasoning was excellent and the value outstanding. 
I hope they up their prices a bit for the high season. As a tourist from London I'd have happily paid more. For our 2 pasties left us with change from ¬£5! 
Quick service, good eatin'.
We always buy our Cornish pasties and cream here  on our return home, helpful and pleasant staff There is a wide range of food to purchase

Review Title: Bought a load of pasties then couldn't help warm a baby bottle of milk?
Review Text:
Pasties were lovely 4/5 but service was a little poor and a let down.

So, I had a burger van in Treyarnon Bay help me heat up a bottle but when I asked these guys if they could help me heat up a bottle of milk - I even asked for hot water in a cup - we don't have that. Yes I know about health and safety but other places have done this without question.

Bearing in mind I'd just spend over ¬£20 on pasties (and I reminded the young lady of this) she said they couldn't do it. I left 'bemusedly' with tasty pasties.

Quality bakery with lovely treats to be had. 

Service was pretty good, although the one gripe was that the door is often open on a morning and you can go in, but they can't serve you until a certain time, although this wasn't shown anywhere.

Not the end of the world though.

Some of the cakes were especially good.

Revisiting Cornwall you can get a little disillusioned by the number of outlets claiming to offer the 'world' s best Cornish Pastie'. After many repeat visits I am convinced that this is the place with the most legitimate claim.
We've been visiting Padstow for over 30 years and have tried pasties from most places there but the best pasties are from the Chough.
opted for a piece of their Bakewell tart.  Huge portions (should have really shared it!).  Very very nice.
Wonderful pasties, the bread is fantastic too. We always come here when we visit Padstow and we are never disappointed. Why aren't all bakeries this good?!

We always pick up pasties to take home from here even though we stay over in the St Austell area.  Its well worth the drive for the best pasties.  Today we picked up bread too and some divine bread pudding.

Best pasties , great variety and freshly baked. We all opted for the traditional steak and were not disappointed. Located in the harbour area it is easy to find and although there are several pasty shops, we think this was the best.

Review Title: If in Padstow, you must try a traditional pasty
Review Text:
You must try a freshly cooked traditional Cornish pasty, ideally from The Chough Bakery if in Padstow because as a family we have always enjoyed them and they also do a variety of cakes and other pasty's if that is your thing. The only issue is finding somewhere to sit, but even in high summer a spot can usually be found on the quay side overlooking the river a couple of mins walk.

Padstow is very busy, but I would recommend a visit and we usually park up in Wadebridge, cycle along the Camel trail, stop off for a pasty at the Chough. I would also recommend a trip over to Rock for a walk along the estuary to walk it off.
In our opinion the best pasties available in Padstow, hand made in the town, excellent fillings and flavours and reasonable priced, far better than many others available in the town
Simply the best been here 3 years on the trot and you can't beat their pasties just look for the queues on harbour front and you will have found it
The bakery was recommended by the receptionist at our hotel, we had the one with blue cheese and it was very nice indeed.
If you want a real Cornish pasty or some wonderful walnut bread this is THE place! They make really tasty loaves and cakes too.

On a recent visit to padstow we grabbed an amazing pastie from the cough bakery. That's how you do a pastie, straight from the oven. Every mouthful was a delight and we both said that it was by far the best pastie we had experienced in Cornwall. Excellent.

Went here last year as read the rave reviews
Second visit and not disappointed brilliant pasties, one of the best I've had :)

We were having a morning in Padstow, and decided to have a look in the Chough Bakery on the harbour.  We had to queue around the corner to get in, so we knew that it must be a very good bakery.  My friend couldn't get me out of the shop, the choice of pasties, cakes and the wonderful bread was fantastic.  Having bought a selection and trying the wonderful pasties, they were the best I have ever tasted, and cant wait to visit again when in the area.  In fact I think I am going to venture on line to order a quantity for the freezer.
Delicious pasties, possibly the best in Cornwall, but watch out for the gulls - they will jump onto your shoulder and steal your food.

We we're recommended this bakery for pasties but I was very disappointed. My traditional pasty had next to no meat in it and I had to spit one piece out. Mostly potato and onion, nothing special. Will be trying one of the other places next time.

We have just spent a week in Cornwall and sampled a few pasties along the way.
These were pretty good with ample filling.
Just bought a sandwich and a slice of egg and bacon pie for my lunch how wrong!!! The bacon was dried out and grey, the sandwich was soggy wont be returning I'm afraid appalling!

Tried pasties from here on two occasions. For me the filling is too dry and can make eating them hard going, the amount of pepper also varied hugely between the two pasties, the first having too little and the second being almost too much. Not sure I would spend them time queueing to have them again, have friends however who would go back every time, clearly down to personal taste. Our four year old had a sausage roll which was really tasty, although the filling was quite pink.

On a recent visit to Padstow I purchased a 'genuine' Pasty from Choughs. The pastry was not cooked properly The vegetables inside were under cooked PRE AL-Dente, the meat was chewy. All in all very disappointing. Just out of intereEmailed them no Response.Out of curiosity  went to other shops and purchased and the products sampled were far better. By the time i had done this Choughs were shut. Left a phone message for their comments but no response.
Couldn't return next day as returned home.
Not Recomended.
Awesome cakes and unfortunately on our last day we sampled the bacon rolls scrummy shame we didn't sample you sooner. Will be back soon brilliant bakery.
Visited again this morning for our breakfast bacon rolls - one word yummy - friendly staff too. Treacle tart a must. Will be back.

So, why a queue of people outside the door of Choughs bakery?  Because the pasties are brilliant that's why.  Full of pasty filling and very tasty!  Good value too at ¬£2.49 for a medium size.  

The pasties are freshly baked all day long. The original is the best in my opinion but my husband had the  steak and blue cheese and said his was the best. Worth queuing for and then go and find a perch and watch the world go by.

We were having a morning in Padstow, and decided to have a look in the Chough Bakery on the harbour.  We had to queue around the corner to get in, so we knew that it must be a very good bakery.  My friend couldn't get me out of the shop, the choice of pasties, cakes and the wonderful bread was fantastic.  Having bought a selection and trying the wonderful pasties, they were the best I have ever tasted, and cant wait to visit again when in the area.  In fact I think I am going to venture on line to order a quantity for the freezer.
Delicious pasties, possibly the best in Cornwall, but watch out for the gulls - they will jump onto your shoulder and steal your food.

We we're recommended this bakery for pasties but I was very disappointed. My traditional pasty had next to no meat in it and I had to spit one piece out. Mostly potato and onion, nothing special. Will be trying one of the other places next time.

We have just spent a week in Cornwall and sampled a few pasties along the way.
These were pretty good with ample filling.
Just bought a sandwich and a slice of egg and bacon pie for my lunch how wrong!!! The bacon was dried out and grey, the sandwich was soggy wont be returning I'm afraid appalling!

Tried pasties from here on two occasions. For me the filling is too dry and can make eating them hard going, the amount of pepper also varied hugely between the two pasties, the first having too little and the second being almost too much. Not sure I would spend them time queueing to have them again, have friends however who would go back every time, clearly down to personal taste. Our four year old had a sausage roll which was really tasty, although the filling was quite pink.

On a recent visit to Padstow I purchased a 'genuine' Pasty from Choughs. The pastry was not cooked properly The vegetables inside were under cooked PRE AL-Dente, the meat was chewy. All in all very disappointing. Just out of intereEmailed them no Response.Out of curiosity  went to other shops and purchased and the products sampled were far better. By the time i had done this Choughs were shut. Left a phone message for their comments but no response.
Couldn't return next day as returned home.
Not Recomended.
Awesome cakes and unfortunately on our last day we sampled the bacon rolls scrummy shame we didn't sample you sooner. Will be back soon brilliant bakery.
Visited again this morning for our breakfast bacon rolls - one word yummy - friendly staff too. Treacle tart a must. Will be back.

So, why a queue of people outside the door of Choughs bakery?  Because the pasties are brilliant that's why.  Full of pasty filling and very tasty!  Good value too at ¬£2.49 for a medium size.  

The pasties are freshly baked all day long. The original is the best in my opinion but my husband had the  steak and blue cheese and said his was the best. Worth queuing for and then go and find a perch and watch the world go by.

Review Title: Don't come here for the food
Review Text:
This bakery is in the middle of Padstow. It is situated in front of the harbour a prime spot. I went to this bakery as I saw a fly on the wall documentary about it on television.

The bakery looks good in terms of the frontage and inside it has a cosy rustic feel. It is very inviting. However the staff were stand offish and the guy I spoke to lacked communication skills. I imagined this to be a premium establishment from the look of it however I was disappointed. I expected a conversation about the various pasties on offer but I got unhelpful one word responses. He just was not interested in talking. I wouldn‚Äôt have minded ordinarily but the place was empty.

I also had to wait a long time for the order to arrive. Anyway I bought some Cornish blue pasties and I distributed them out to my family. We sat on a bench in front of market square. We were all disappointed by the taste and texture of the pasties and wished we hadn‚Äôt had them. There were lots of other people having there lunches which looked more appetising.

It would have been better to bring our own sandwiches. Although this bakery looks the part of a high class establishment it isn‚Äôt. It is just a greasy fast food outlet beneath the lovely fa√ßade.

Bought a four pack of scones which were very nice and fresh. 
Only problem was the long queue to be served as the pasties here are very popular.

A Chough Traditional Pasty is a must if you're in Padstow. The pastry is cooked to perfection and the filling seasoned just as it should be.It must be good,because when I sat by the harbour to eat it,at least 50 seagulls tried to pinch it from me!!!!
After I'd finished my original purchase, I went  back and bought a couple to take home with me.
LUSH!!!!

Review Title: Wanted a traditional pasty, but fell short....
Review Text: We had seen Choux bakery at the Bath &West show as a winner so thought we would have their pasties. They were deeply dissapointing. The filling was under seasoned and short on meat. The pastry was good, but again, lacked flavour. The price was ¬£11 for 2 x leg pasties and 1 x child, so not cheap. Service was slow and disorganised. The cake selection was very basic.

A visit to padstow wouldnt be complete with a Chough pasty. They are the best pasties around. I have also used their delivery service in the past which is great. This year we have brought 2 boxes of pasties home with us.

If you like a good pasty this is the place, the traditional stuffed full of steak and veg, the pastry beautiful.
We also tried some of the breads they make.
It was good to get some pasties and sit by the quay.

The bread we bought was just delicious,it come highly recommended and did not disappoint.The staff were really helpful and friendly.They certainly deserve the praise and reviews they get.Will be back to buy some more!!
Saw this bakery on a tv show so thought we would try it out. Very tasty Pastys and cheese and bacon quiche. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Tried one of their steak pasties on recommendation and must admit that it was very good indeed. Served really hot and plenty of seats outside near the harbour to sit and eat, but watch out for the pesky gulls ...saw one pasty pinched from someone/s hand !! Well worth trying this place for your pasty whilst in Padstow.

We bought two cakes to take back to our cottage to eat with a mug of tea - we were too full from lunch! The carrot cake and almond slice were not only large but delicious.
We bought pasties and bread here. All very good.

There are pasty shops‚Ä¶ and then there is The Chough Bakery. It really is that good. If you are a pasty lover, this is the place you must try. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, Cornwall has some great establishments‚Ä¶ The Chough Bakery however is something else.

Walk through the door, order a regular traditional, pay the few quid and sit on the harbour. Heaven!
Purchased a granary loaf looked good, tasted of nothing. As sold at a premium price need to do much better

During our visits to Cornwall , a lot of places claim to be award winning for their pasties , but this has been the best one we have found . As previously mentioned in other reviews the queues speak volumes . Lots of fresh filling and just the right amount of seasoning . I had chicken bacon and leek this time for a change and it was superb . Take care with the seagulls when eating around the harbour though

Right on the quay in Padstow harbour.
Bread and cakes look tasty but ....
Try their proper pasty with visible chunks of steak, bulging with vegetables beautiful pastry piping hot and nicely seasoned.

Lovely setting and you'd hope the traditional pasties were good. 

Sadly they weren't. Very average, poor pastry and the filling was a complete let down. Tasteless and lacking any form of seasoning. 

Fairly sure you can get better in Padstow.

The title says it all. Great local traditional bakery with some of the nicest bread and scones. 

I look forward to visiting every year.

One of five places to get a Cornish Pasty in Padstow - nothing will come close to my Mum's steak pasties but the large steak one here gets an 8/10 from me!  It uses Cornish clotted cream in place of butter.

Having a Cornish pasty is a must when in Cornwall, but often there is lots of pasty and not much filling.  Choughs offer different sizes of pasty which is great if you have small children or a smaller appetite or just want a snack without feeling too guilty.  They also offer a variety of fillings.

The standard steak pasty is great, you can see the meat in it and its nicely seasoned, and served piping hot.

Service isn't always with a smile though which is a shame.

so many pasty shops in Cornwall, but there is only one that stands out from all the rest and thats the Pasty from Chough's, when ever we are down in cornwall we always make sure we get some to bring home

With so many shops claiming award winning pasties and the best pasties in Cornwall it becomes a bit of a lottery as to where you buy your pasty.
But in my opinion this is the best ive had in Cornwall packed full of ingredients and really full of flavour.The queue outside speaks volumes.
Superb pasties and must be eaten fresh and warm to get the true taste of Padstow.  Service was prompt and although busy they were very courteous.
We always get our pasties from The Chough Bakery & have never had a bad one.  Yesterday I had the cheese, onion & leek one & my brother had steak & blue cheese.  Piping hot & delicious!
Forget all the rest these are the best party's in Cornwall reasonably priced and just the right size brilliant. They also do a mail order service if you are missing them when you get back home

Review Title: The best pasties always come from Cornwall
Review Text:
It's the law that when in Cornwall you must buy a pasty!!!
Well maybe not, but it should be. It's strange that you can buy a decent pasty from most proper bakery/pie shops but it's only in Cornwall that you'll get the best. And The Chough in Padstow is up there with the best.
Enough said.
Called in to padstow on our way home from holiday in Newquay had a traditional cornish pastie was amazing baught six more to take home my daughter hsd one if their sausage rolls which was huge.

We had bread from here on holiday and it was ok, so we thought we would have a mixed box of Cornish pasties to take home for us and other family members we were all of the same thoughts , not as good as we have had else where, far to much pastry and so dry. 
Try somewhere else.
We always go there, everything is always so fresh. AND DID YOU KNOW THEY PUT A BLOB OF CLOTTED CREAM IN EVERY PASTIE?! Amazing. Keep it up, we love it.
Freshly made food with quick service all very tasty! The best chocolate brownies ever made and they make the best sandwiches I have ever had!

There is no shortage of pasty shops in Padstow. The Chough was our choice on this occasion and my steak pasty was disappointing with the meat pink and under cooked. The pastry was also on the dry side giving an overall disappointing lunch experience. Still, another dozen pasty shops still yet to try!
The best Cornish pastie I have tasted. Look at the contents and you can identify each ingredient. I have one each time I visit.

Review Title: Traditional Cornish Pasties and the like
Review Text: I always try to buy local, being on holiday is no exception so how lovely to find a bakery that sources everything within Cornwall, cooked on the premises and served by lovely shop assistants.
