The pasties are to die for, especially the chicken one ...proper chunks of meat and really tasty. Well worth every penny

Review Title: A bakery that can't slice bread?
Review Text:
Went in to buy a loaf of bread. Asked for it to be sliced, to be told that they don't do it at this shop but they do at their other shops.
Suffice to say I didn't make a purchase.
Had a few Choughs in my time. Have to have at least one of their award winning pasties when on holiday to Padstow. The dollop of clotted cream added to the Traditional Pasty is a winner.

Despite its cramped space, service is quick and friendly. There are 3 competing "bake off" chain pasty providers in adjacent shops but The Chough is the only outlet on the harbour which is baking from fresh using local ingredients. There is a range of choice including a Mediterranean vegetable pasty. A range of bread and cakes is baked in their nearby unit - just before closing time every loaf is sold off at a ¬£1 a piece. Well worth visiting for the quality and freshness of the food.
Nice pasties but some of the staff were rude to us. Not what you would expect on your holidays! Could learn about customer services. Prices were good too.
Highly recommend for the cornish pasty, we had two and were the best with the very thin pastry and very tasty filling.

When visiting Padstow there's only 1 place you should consider for a great Cornish pasty and that's chough bakery. Hot and fresh and generous filling the traditional steak pasty is a real treat at any time of the day!

Review Title: Some very good some not so good
Review Text: Traditional meat pasties were excellent but vegetarian option was bland, lacking both flavour and seasoning.  Will stick to the traditional next time.
The best pasty I had for a long time!   Very clean and a great selection of bakery goods freshly cooked. Service with a smile.

We went while at we were on holiday in padstow. It's in a great location on the harbour and they had the best pasty I've ever had. Absolutely full to the top with beautiful meat and potatoes. Will definitely be going to this bakery again. Also try their brownies (very chocolately) yummmmmm

A visit to  Padstowpadstow isn't complete without a visit to Chough's bakery. It doesn't matter if you wait for a bacon roll and coffee or a loaf they are all delicious. Our favorite for a picnic lunch is the egg and bacon pie but we can't resist the saffron rolls either.  The queues are there for a reason,  so just join it and wait your turn.

A really great bakery in the middle of town.  Prices were very reasonable and the bread fantastic and fresh.  Staff were friendly and helpful. Bought flavoured cornish sea salt here as well  (BBQ and smoked) so good we had to buy some more.
The queue tells you all you need to know - consistently great bakery - pasties to die for - like the newish cocktail sze
delicous pasties. we had the traditional pasty. big and full of deliciousness! affordable as well! yummy!!!!

This place is great. Always busy, clean, authentic pasty and family rn. 
Love the origanal pasty and the blue cheese and steak is DE LIsh !! 
Cakes, quiches and other bakery delights also available. 
You must visit and its wirth the queue. 
Lovely
Proper bread and cakes and lovely pasty but if you don't get there early enough you will be disappointed because they sell out very quickly

No trip to Padstow is complete without three things.

1. Crabbing
2. Struggling to park
3. Traditional Cornish pasty!

I am happy to say that number three on that list was well and truly satisfied.
At first, I was a little disappointed at having to queue for our food, but it was clear that the wait was because this place made excellent food.

My traditional pasty was delicious, perfectly cooked and piping hot. You could tell that the ingredients used were fresh and prepared that day.

The kids all had a sausage roll a piece and I am practically drooling now just writing about it.

Thank you Chough Baker!

We had a lot of pasties in Cornwall, all from local bakeries, but this was by far the best. Both the steak and the cheese and onion were juicy, tasty and perfect. Even the sausage roll was excellent, rich puffy pastry and good sausagemeat inside.

Lovely pasties just disappointed that we had to wait so long for a steak and cheese one!  We thought we'd have an early morning in Padstow before continuing elsewhere but there were none cooked by 11.  We were advised to go back at 12 when they still weren't available ............. it was about half past 12 by the time we got them so brunch became lunch!

We had sandwiches and pasties every day from the Bakery. The pasties are real Cornish pasties. They do make chicken and other flavours, but all good tasting. What is good they make a cocktail pastie for the children which is just perfect. Before we went home we bought a huge box of pasties to take home. Also, sandwiches are lovely and fresh.
Do not leave cornwall without a pasty from this place . Delicious none of this cubed vegetable !!!!!! Loads of meat and pepper best pasty we have ever tasted !!!!

Review Title: This is Pasty heaven 10/10 at least.
Review Text: A freshly made pasty still hot, excellent pastry, hearty filling and what a setting to sit and eat it look out over the harbour. If your a veggie do not worry they have ample options for you too.

Review Title: Very very expensive for what you get
Review Text: Went in here to to a standard size sausage roll costing ¬£1.75 and had absolute shock at the cost of six saffron buns costing ¬£3.90 was in absolute shock paying out ¬£5.65 in total I felt that I had been robbed this place seems to think since being on TV to turn a business around that the owner feels that they can charge celeb prices in Cornwall will never set foot back in this shop again
Top quality bakery at reasonable prices and staff are also really friendly and helpfull.  Top notch place in centre of padstow. Would definitely go back
This little bakery does brilliant pasties all within a stones throw of the Sea - a good variety of flavours without sacrificing quality for he sake of having hundreds!
Great place for takeaway breakfast. Great bacon rolls and croissants. Oh yes, and bread and pasties !
The Chough has won loads of awards, and for good reason...the only reason they get a 4* and not a 5* was the lack of seeded burger rolls when we visited. Darn!
An excellent little bakery. Don't just buy pasties here. They do fabulously tasty quiches and lots of different bread too!

Cornwall is full of establishments offering, the best, award winning, oldest, pasty and over many decades we have tried them all.  In our view the Chough Bakery's are the best.

Nicely layered inside with the swede, potato and beef  - perfectly seasoned and encased it perfect pastry.  Unlike some pasties which go for the method that has a hard dry ridge of crimped pastry, here there pastry is crimped in such a way that it is always thin. (The crimped edge, which may have been used as disposable handle for the Cornish miners dirty hands, might strictly be more traditional, but it has no place in a modern pasty)
best pasty in cornwall! have eaten quite a few in the interests of research and the beef pasty was the best

Regret yesteday's pasty was tepid and meat barely cooked 
Unusual for Chough perhaps but it means we will not buy pasties from them again!

We have been returning on holiday to Padstow for the last 20 something years and have a true love for the harbour.  We have always made a point of getting our baked goods from The Chough as we love the quality and the prices. 
This morning we went into the bakery to satisfy our sweet savoury craving and were though roughly disappointed by the selection and the service. 

Standing in front of the counter looking at the lack of baked goods which seems to be more restricted at every visit in particular the apple baked sponge, the young girl serving said "what can I get you" no good morning no smile, I responded asking what was inside the doughnut which to that she replied sarcastically "jam" her lack of smile and customer service instantly put me and my partner off and we walked out of the shop without a purchase. Very disappointed as usually the staff and the bakery are superb.

Review Title: Good selection of Cornish pasties and bread.
Review Text: This place is right at the harbour. They have limited selection of cornish pasties but they are all freshly made and absolutely delightful. The breads are also freshly made. There are other shops around the corner with more choices of pasties but the meat and blue cheese pasty was so good, we went for the second time. Thoroughly recommended.
What to say - delicious pasties particularly when eaten up near the Monument overlooking the Harbour.  Very friendly staff and efficient service.
Big tasty hot pasties on Padstow harbour , what more could you want ? A few different types , we visited twice whilst on holiday , so one meat and one cheese and leek sampled , both excellent .

Saw a sign about "world pasty awards" so thought we'd give it a try.  The lamb & mint pasty was really lovely - plenty of filling, lovely veg as well as meat.  My husband had the cornish and said it was lovely.

We live hundreds of miles away but whenever we are in the area we make a point of calling in to The Chough Bakery.
The breads are varied and vey tasty.
Croissants and sausage rolls delicious

There is so much on offer here you need to come down & enjoy their products.

You will not be disappointed.

There are quite a few bakery's within a stone throw of each other but this one is worth a visit for the Quiche, being a veggi i can not comment on the cornish pasties but my partner said his was very tasty but expected more meat filling inside so was quite dissapointed. My quiche however was very filling and very tasty.

This shop is highly acclaimed in Padstow, so naturally, I had to test this. While I cannot speak for the famous sausage rolls, being a vegetarian, I love the apricot crumble bar and the brownie. Worth a visit!
Nice pasty, good flavour. One of the better pasties. Only problem is finding somewhere to sit and eat them. Beware the seagulls!!
Had Bacon Bap and Coffee, also had some bread and other items from here and the freshness and quality was superb.

Having read the other reviews I'm definitely trying the pasties. However as this place is just over from our holiday house I've walked across and tried the croissants and the bacon rolls and both have been totally superb. The cakes and quiches look really good too.
Called in for take out , staff very patient with an indecisive group of four x have used recipe book to with good results

On any visit to Padstow we have to get steak pasties from the Chough Bakery. They are THE BEST! and always have been. Sitting on the harbour wall in the sun, eating a Chough pasty out of its paperbag is my idea of heaven.
Had two pieces of the Mediterranean veg and feta tart, took it back to our holiday accommodation, where we had it with a salad, very nice, but I think one portion would of done two of us.

Review Title: Truly the best pasties in Cornwall!
Review Text: The cornish pasties here are the best in Cornwall!   It is worth waiting in the queue.   They had run out of the blue cheese variety which was disappointing but the standard, classic pasty was wonderful and - piping hot!
the selection was plentiful , ihad a red onion marmalade and cheese sandwich , it was so tasty ..... I got another and a pasty for our tea as we were camping  .

Try Choughs for fantastic pasties but also delightful carrot cake, sausage rolls and pies.

They really are the best. Swift service too for a busy establishment.
Best pasties in Cornwall. Margot's round the corner do not do pasties - why? - as they say - buy them here
The large steak pasty is, in my opinion, the best in Cornwall...although I will continue my in-depth research :-) Service was quick and friendly, as always.

These really are the best pasties in Padstow.
We enjoyed the non meat ( me) and the traditional pasties (my husband).
I think it is the pastry which makes it so special.
Their bread is also delicious as are their cakes and their Christmas cake is fab.

Looked this place out especially after seeing it on trip advisor. Ordered the pasties but was disappointed with them-found them lacking in taste and content. No better than you can buy at any of the chain pasty shops anywhere in the UK
Called in for pasties for my husband and daughter which they both said were delicious. I had a BLT sandwich and it was one of the nicest I'd ever had, well worth a visit for a snack on the harbour.

It's delicious - light and fluffy - not doughy like so many of the supermarkets.

I bought 3 loaves to bring home for the freezer ....
Simply the best bread in Padstow. Opens early, friendly staff, and superb cakes etc. The pasties are excellent as well, freshly cooked on the premises.

Review Title: Very nice bread rolls and flapjack
Review Text: Very nice bakery with tasty produce for our picnics on the beach. Always fresh bread and bread rolls and very nice cakes.
No trip to Cornwall is ever complete without sampling a Cornish pastie or 2 and the pasties on offer at the Chough Bakery are simply the best in Cornwall.

When walking round Padstow all you can smell are Cornish Pasties cooking, follow your nose and head for the Chough Bakery. The original cornish pasties are to die for and we had to go twice just to check you understand. All other bread products are good as well including the Saffron buns.
Staff are friendly.

Please note this is not a restaurant but a takeaway shop therefore some of the choices below don't really count, but I have put lunch as that it was we bought the pasties for.
This is the best place I've ever had a pasty. You have to try it. Chicken and leak is my favourite, with a delicious chocolate brownie to finish with. Yum.

The pasties believe they have a spoon of clotted cream in them!   Brilliant  range of bread!
Friendly staff, even on Mayday, when they were rushed off their feet!
We go to The Chough whenever we go to Padstow. All their products are delicious but the millionaires shortbread is outstanding. The service can be variable though.

Review Title: Tried to buy but couldn't bear the scrum
Review Text: Earlier this year we bought a couple of pasties which were OK in taste but varying in temperature - one too hot, one too cold. The service has always been variable, and the attitude of some senior staff sometimes quite surly but today, despite giving it another try, we removed ourselves from the scrum without having bought a thing. Admittedly it was a bank holiday but there was no order in the serving, staff were not welcoming and avoiding eye contact and, whilst waiting in the shop, we were barged out of the way by customers who were also frustrated by the complete chaos caused by lack of organisation. This is in stark contrast to the other pasty/bread outlets in Padstow. We were not the only ones to leave and, like them will not be trying the experience again. It's a pity because only a couple of years ago Choughs couldn't be faulted. Our advice is to try other places first - the pasties are comparable and the manner of the service definitely better!

Review Title: You'll never buy a pasty from anywhere else ever again.
Review Text: Please don't think the title of my review is extreme, it's not. Once you have a pasty from Choughs you will never want to eat one from anywhere other than here again, they are AMAZING. ¬£2.65 for a regular & ¬£3.65 for a large with cocktail pasties available too. The pastry is beautiful & the fillings (of which there are a selection) are extremely fresh & well seasoned. Oh and there's also cakes & bread as you would expect however we can never seem to get past the pasties!! Miss it & miss out. 10/10.

Had plenty of pasties during our week around Cornwall. Visited here and had their Beef and Cornish Blue, this was in fact the best one of our trip. My wife was envious when she tried mine after she had gone elsewhere for one. 

Went back later and got a brownie which was as equally as nice.
Heard that the Chough serve the best pasties in Cornwall - I concur but be warned they are extremely hot, keen as I was to taste this pasty I burnt my mouth in all the excitement.

Stopped here for a lunch break.  Very good service with a smile.  Our pasties were of good quality ahd piping hot.  Ate them at the bench seats opposite the shop - what better situation could you wish for overlooking the harbour.  Pasties were of very good quality = thoroughly enjoyable and reasonable priced.

The pasty wasn't too bad and I would have scored this place higher but the customer service from the staff member who served me was abysmal. I visited this shop last Sunday 18th May. I enquired as to the price of sauces, the shop assistant replied with the price and mumbled something I did not hear. I replied  "sorry" and she consequently got some sauces threw them down in front of me and said in a aggressive tone "I asked you if you wanted me to get them". Good pasty but poor service.
The place to get your Cornish pasties. They are the best in town and the harbour is a nice place to eat. Just watch out for the sea gulls as they like pasties too

If you are looking for a decent pasty then look no further. 

The meat is of high quality and they are baked to perfection. Pads tow is swamped with pasty shops nod I have tried them all but find this venue produces the freshest most delicious ones.

Love this tiny, family run bakery. They don't do a lot, but what they do is near perfect. The steak pasty is simply Devine, better than anything else you'll ever taste. Even better than steins. 
If the chough bakery purchased an up to date Italian coffee machine and served great coffee it would clear up.

We visit Padstow a lot  but I can honestly say the so called boss lady who failed too serve me had such a rude attitude. I asked her for the cakes I wanted, she totally ignored me walked out the back continued to put aprons in a bag for a member of staff who was stood by her giving him instructions. I was stood there like a lemon. She then came back to the counter picked up a paper bag looked at me then turned her back on me and carried on her conversation with this colleague.  At this point I walked out the shop. So so rude I will never shop there again. I walked round the corner to Presto pastys such a friendly helpful shop.

Had bacon rolls from here on 2 occassions whilst on holiday for breakfast.  The best I have ever had ! Lovely bread roll packed with perfectly cooked crispy bacon.  Bargain.  I also bought items for a picnic which were tasty and well priced.  Try it out !

We were visiting Padstow and decided to have an 'outdoor' lunch break.  Popped into the Chough Bakery.  A very good selection of breads, pasties and cakes.  The pasties were of exremely good quality and very fresh and hot.  Pricewise very economical as well considering the ingredients.  Well worth a visit.

After the television series, we were keen to see it. In my opinion, the decor is far superior to the food.
Disappointing.
Great staff very friendly the home made quiche is amazing and the desserts. Would recommend to everybody. Absolutely wonderful.

We were on holiday last week at Mother Ivey's Caravan Park. The shop on the site sells Chough pasties and bread. I had two pasties during the week and they were both superb. Most pasty makers in Cornwall put the beef in one large lump but the Chough beef was mixed in with the rest of the filling which means that every mouthful contains both beef and vegetables.
My wife and I visited on Sunday 4th May and purchased 2 traditional steak pasties, they were the best I have ever had but the second one was overkill.
The title says it all really, if you like a good, well filled pasty with plenty of meat, then this is the place to go. Their scones are also fantastic. Well worth a visit.

Review Title: Cornwall pasties - in my opinion the best in Padstow
Review Text: Just come back from Padstow and still the Chough bakery are delivering excellent pasties. The only thing not allowing me to give a 5/5 overall was that all their pasties on both times were cold ( whether they were having problems with ovens I don't know) however that certainly didn't detract from the excellent quality of the product. Good to see that they have introduced some different flavours to attract a wider audience. See you again next your Chough Bakery
Very good pasties, worth coming back to Padstow just for this!! Decent selection and its right in the centre of town overlooking the harbour.

Just a quick review, this. The pasties are simply the best ones you can get anywhere. I've been to about six pasty shops in Padstow alone, and this one on three occasions. Never mind my waist line, I know a good pasty when I see it and these people know their food.

Thank you very much - keep up the good work!

Review Title: The best pastys in the west!
Review Text: All i can say is that Choughs pastes are the best I have ever had, no scrimping here they are loaded with beef and vegetables and the pastry is fantastic.

Visited Padstow on a very damp 22nd April, would highly recommend purchasing some of the delicious cakes at this bakery.
If you want a sugar boost buy a caramel shortbread slice. Mmmm!!!

Me, my husband and our 2 kids visited Padstow for the day on Easter Monday. It was our first time to the area having been on a mini break in North Devon. We used the park and ride for ¬£4 at the top of town next to Tesco which took us right to the centre on a double decker, which the kids loved. Buses were every 10 minutes.  My husband had been looking forward to a pasty from here for ages before we came and he wasn't disappointed! We both had a traditional steak pasty, which were both excellent, well seasoned, with good pastry.  Top notch!  Typically being a Bank Holiday, the bakery had sold out of most things, but from their website I see they do mail order, so we'll get a chance to try out the others!

Had a Cornish Pasty from here over the Easter Bank Holiday and I thought it was one of the best ones I have had, not just in Padstow but in Cornwall. Perfect balance of ingredients, well seasoned and great pastry. Being in Catering myself I was left very impressed. Wish I could make one like that!
Love this bakery - always pick up hot cross buns and bread when in town, excellent value for money and a wide variety.

I won't say it's the best pasty in Cornwall...but only because I haven't tried them all.  This was the best I had during a week of intense pasty eating.  

Some reviews indicate bad service, but what does it matter?  You order a pasty, they give you a pasty...easy peasy.

If you are in Padstow walk past the other pasty places and go to Chough.

We have been coming to Padstow area for years and no visit would be complete without several visits to the Chough bakery for fresh pasties and scones. The staff are very friendly and the food is always delicious! Thank you very much!
Fantastic pasty, piping hot delicious. Service was a bit lacking but it was busy. Will be taking some home with me :) :) :)
Pasties still as good as ever...what is lacking is friendly Familly customer service rather than hired staff going through the motions ..

We bought pasties on 7th April. Clearly this outlet has lost its way, Traditional Pasty was almost devoid of meat in the 5 we purchased. Very average and clearly not to the same formula as their claim of Prize winning pasty.

My wife and I had Cornish pasties here yesterday. I opted for a traditional beef pasty while my wife chose chicken and leak. 

We both loved our pasties which we ate on the road outside as we were famished. It was not until we got near the end of them that we realised that we were eating each others, but it really did not matter.
This place serves the best bread and cakes. The shop smells delicious when you walk in and you will walk out with more than you planned!

I have been going to the Chough for countless years and have always dismissed new pasty shops in Padstow. My pasty this time was luke warm and average tasting. The staff were not friendly and there wasn't a huge choice. Tried a different shop the following day which was LOVELY, pasty was hot. loads of different flavours even gluten free, staff couldn't have been more friendly, sorry but you have lost my custom.

Ordered online and picked up from store and you get charged full price and not the price advertised on the website which I felt was misleading.
Responses to queries are very slow.

loved the pasty! go for the traditional one- large,meaty and tasty. A good filling lunch was had by the harbour. The steak and blue Cornish cheese pasty ( I had a taste of my wife's) smelled lovely!  Great breads too!

A generous pasty filled to bursting with best quality ingredients. Great value considering what goes into these 'meal in itself' pasties. Also, have had perfect bakewell tart that was generously sliced and a really gooey brownie. Love the Chough Bakery.
Great bread and the perfect pasties. Both freshly baked daily. If only I lived closer I would get all my bread here, but 250 miles for a loaf is just not feasible
Served hot and delicious, we ate them by the quay watching the world go by. We had steak pasties. You could have a choice of three sizes.

Review Title: Loved this bakery ! The pasties were amazing !
Review Text: If u visit Padstow you must try the Chough Bakery! I tried the cheese, leek & onion pasty & the next day a vegetarian pasty !!! They were absolutely scrummy ! Wish I'd have tried their cakes.

Review Title: The best pasties in the UK
Review Text:
I would normally advise anybody buying a pastie:  "always buy a pastie from a butcher, not a baker".  After all, we've all seen the pastries filled with grey peppery mush from Greggs et al.

But, these are heavenly pasties, with real, recognisable pieces of meat in there.  

The Chough clearly deserves the awards it has won in recent years:
"World Pasty championships 2013 Winners and Winner of 2013 & 2012 British pie awards"

Wow.

Review Title: Wonderful bakery, very nice staff, well worth a visit!
Review Text:
Wonderful authentic baking, excellent cookies and brownies (my children will attest), and extremely friendly and helpful staff.

Sandwiches looked lovely as well but I did not try as we were spoiled for choice in Padstow for places to eat!

Will be a regular stop when visiting Padstow‚Ä¶.
Lovely pasties, a good selection of fillings, right by the harbour, a perfect stop for lunch, This is the bakery featured on The Fixer.
family run, great value, great selection of fresh produce.Try going down early for your fresh  morning croissant , then back to the cottage for coffee. You can't beat it.
Have just ordered a dozen pasties for an Xmas present.  Arrived promptly, well packed and tasted great, what more could you ask for?

Bored with pasties? We tried the chough bakerys egg and bacon quiche and what a lovely change it was. Good portion and very tasty. We went back for 2 lattes and a tea and was charged ¬£4.80 (drinks) compared to ¬£8.95 at the clipper tea room. We know where we are taking our business in future.

Award winning pasties lived up to their reputation with their new steak and Stilton pasty a real winner.  We just had to get some freshly cooked pasties to take home for the freezer.  A true taste of south west England.  Pasty costs around ¬£3.95 for a large one.
Great pasties, memories of home to a southerner living up north. Good service and arrive in post as planned.

Now I'm a big pasty fan and regularly visit Padstow and I can wholeheartedly swear that after long deliberation I've found that the Chough's are the best in or outside of Cornwall. A visit to Padstow wouldn't be the same without one!

Visited Padstow on the way back to Bristol. The little town was heaving with us grockles. The queue at Rick Stein's Fish and Chip shop was immense (and he doesn't do the cooking) and so we went to Chough's for a pasty. 

Now there's pasties and then there's PASTIES. I've eaten pasties before but this was my first PASTY. Just piping hot, full of meat, cooked on the premises and as fresh as fresh can be. Absolutely the bestest pasty ever to be had in Cornwall.We both had the lamb with leek and mint gravy. Large chunks of meat with slices of leek cooked to perfection and a gravy that was just so.

If you want food on the go and you don't want to wait for Cod and Chips go to Chough's and ¬£3.45 for a large pasty you'll not be disappointed.
Bought home some very tasty treats for the rest of my family. Lovely scones and gorgeous pasties all ready to take away.
There's a queue outside for a reason! Delicious, meaty pasties. Cakes & bread just as good. Proper job.

When I set off in cornwall to find the best pasty and bakery I found this one I had recently been to malcom barnecuts and you couldent pay me to go back there it was that horrible. The pasty is absolutely delish so is the sausage rolls and cheese and bacon bites along with the scrumtious brownies. also at a lovely location I would highly recommend this bakery to others.
My partner brought a sausage roll and said it was the best ever. People were queing up outside the door to get in and that was from opening! Very popular place.

As we walked back to the harbour past The Chough Bakery I noticed a sign in the shop stating a bag of yesterday's baking for ¬£1. Well we had to go and have a look!
 A couple of minutes later we emerged with a bag of millionaires shortbread, 4 large pieces and for ¬£1 an absolute bargain.
When we got back to where we were staying it was kettle on and shortbread out. I expected them not be at their best as it was old stock but I was very wrong, delicious!
We shall make sure we remember this late in the day when it's near to shutting up time.
Been several times and one of my Dads favourites. Good variety of food, all well cooked and good value. No complaints.

Don't bother with the other (at least 3) pasty bakers in town. The Chough bake one of the best pasties I've ever tasted. Full of superb quality ingredients in a pastry case to die for, and it won't break the bank. Don't leave Padstow without having one.

We went into the Port Isaac branch. As there were no toasties, sandwiches, rolls left we had a chicken pasty. It was awful, watery,had a strange twang and the pastry was burnt. As we walked further down the road we were gutted to find another pasty shop that unlike Chough was heaving.
Great slice of bread and butter pudding.  Excellent granary loaf.  Great choices all round. Very busy which must say something.

If your not full after eating one of these pasty 's your probably to large and should consider a salad the Pasty's are awesome and the best I've ever eaten the staff are great everything in the bakery was hunger pang inducing tempting recommend a visit

Review Title: Now this is what I call a bakery
Review Text:
In these days of homogenised supermarket bakeries, its good to find a local one that makes really good bread and has a wide variety that you only seem to find in foreign parts these days. The bread is not cheap - ¬£1.95 for a small walnut loaf sounds expensive - but just compare it with the offerings at Sainsbury or Tesco.
Go on spoil yourself - you are on holiday!
We only tried the veggie pasties here, but they were the nicest I've ever had. Friendly staff in the shop too.
Always Always get my pasties from The Chough they really are the best, full of meat and traditional vegetables.  They also have a fantastic range of bread and cakes. Simply the Best!!!

Having seen the TV programme featuring the family I was keen to try their pasties, and was not disappointed. I had them two days running - warm on the first day and nearly cold on the second, but both were tasty and well seasoned. I found the small were just right for me and the medium for my husband - the large looked enormous! In fact I've bought some and put them in the freezer to give us a taste of Padstow. We tried a pasty from another shop and were not so impressed, as it seemed to have less meat in it and the pastry wasn't so good.

I drove over to Padstow from Port Isaac just to try the pasties. I was lucky to meet the owner who shared some of the history and techniques of how these pasties got so famous. They make them by hand and use traditional ingredients such as steak and veggies - plus a touch of clotted cream! No wonder!! I try hard to only use locally owned businesses when I travel which always pays off for me. Chough Bakery is a family run business so it's all local.
You really do have to try one of their pasties if you want a meal . The large ones are really that. Plenty of meat. Will definitely return.

Review Title: Staff knowledge of products should be better
Review Text: I popped into the bakery mostly to be nosey since I saw Alex revamp the business on TV. I walked into the shop with a pretty vague reception which is fine as it was nearing the end of the day. As I paid I was asked if I wanted to buy a pasty and as I'm vegetarian I asked the lady if the pastry was suitable for vegetarians, her response "I don't know" she had to ask someone in the kitchen. It didn't fill me with confidence so I declined. An average shop with average offerings - I really wanted to be a fan but unfortunately not.

After visiting Padstow and the chough bakery, I kind of feel, why isn't every body doing this. 

Take a great location, have hot, delicious pasties coming out of the oven all day long and serve them with a smile straight off the baking tray! Looks simple but it's obvious a lot of hard work and planning goes into it. 

Super flapjack as well.
Sampled pasties, croissants & cakes, all nice & fresh & not too pricey.visited most days for croissants for breakfast.
Fantastic pasties, speciality breads and cakes. All fresh and well cooked. Great staff, the queues at lunch time speak for themselves.

We visited this bakery last year on holiday and could still remember how delicious the scones were. We bought a selection of their bakery products and the must have scones with a carton of the essential clotted cream. The scones are incredible as they as so buttery and light as a feather. I have now found out you can  order a cream tea and pasties online. How great is that? It is quite reasonably priced but the postage is quite expensive because it has to be express. I would still order online and give somebody a special treat with a true taste of Cornwall. The pasties can be frozen on delivery which is great. If in Padstow and you love great scones visit this bakery.

This is the real deal...pasties how they should be made with real meat in strips, good swedes and other veg....all wrapped in a lovely brown crispy pastry that is not soggy but hot and peppery ( not chilli peppery ! )
The other bakery items available are all good... afamily run bakery that produces top quality at normal prices.

Have had pasties from the bakery before Alex Politzi visited and have recently been back. What a difference,the pasties are now full of filling unlike before and the different flavours are an improvement. The latest Steak and Blue cheese is superb and well worth a try. 
Well done Chough Bakery you took the advise.

Decided to take some pasties back as presents for the family (last of the big spenders) and called into Chough's near the harbour.
They were VERY friendly and helpful and chatted away whilst a new batch of pasties was ready.
They were delicious and filling, best pasties around?
We were advised by a local that these were the best pasties and we did agree with that.   We went twice and enjoyed both times.  It was nice to sit in the sun and enjoy them.

Review Title: From bread to scones to pasties to sausage rolls... Amazing
Review Text: We stayed at the Potting shed (unique holiday home) and within the welcome hamper was a loaf of bread from Chough bakery so when in Padstow we thought we would call in and see what else was on offer.  Wow glad we did we bought another loaf of bread, 2 pasties (1 bacon, chicken, leak and cheese and 1 tradition), 2 sausage rolls, a slice of quiche and a slice of carrot cake for tea and what amazing food it was the pasties contained real chunks of meat and the sausage rolls were the best we have ever eaten we will definitely be returning before we go home to take some pasties and sausage rolls home.  If you are in Padstow go to this bakery for your pasties best one around.

The only thing missing is a card in the window with opening times and loose rolls and scones to buy rather than plastic packs of 4 ( we are only 2!). I visited here 4 out of the 7 mornings we were at Padstow - I strolled down to the village in time for this place to open 8:30am (every morning). They also serve Bacon rolls and tea/coffee for those wanting a quick breakfast on the go. Always a smile and a quick natter if you want one - lovely place to visit and stock up on bakery goodies!
Chough bakery makes the best pasties in Padstow - and other goodies. Their walnut bread is the best I have ever tasted.

Review Title: The best pasty you will ever eat
Review Text: They have this amazing award winning chicken, bacon and leek pasty. If I didn't have to drive 5 hours to get there for this pasty, I would be eating it every day! The steak and blue cheese is also really yummy!
Bought 3 pasties here this week (2 x steak and 1 x lamb, leek and mint) Queue not too long and the pasties were good. At ¬£2.95 per pastie - that's not bad at all considering how big the pasties are.

Review Title: Alex Pollizzi did improve this bakery
Review Text: We buy from this bakery each time we holiday in Cornwall, the produce has always been good, the premises has improved since Alex went in!

Nicest cornish (or any nationality) pasties I've ever tasted 
We sat in the harbour to eat them and the seagulls didn't get a look in !!

lovely pastry and plenty of filling what a Cornish pasty should be
lovely clean and inviting shop right on the harbourside perfect !!!!

Review Title: in the words of the locals, bleddy ansum pasty's
Review Text: A very well stocked local bakery that has won all manor of awards and been on TV. The staff are very organised and serve thousands of people every week in the summer, Here you will find the best pasty in Padstow and thats a flat fact.

Review Title: Lovely Cornish Pasties, worth a visit
Review Text:
Well even though they were still baking my favourite, a creamy chicken and bacon...sheer delight, I had a traditional pasty, steak, potato and an array of other finely chopped vegetables.
At ¬£3.25 you get good value, and mine was enough for two.
Go and have a look, you will be pleasantly surprised.
lovely shop and helpful staff.  Bought lots of things, bread, cakes, pies, scones, pasties.  Pasties heated up later, very dry and tasteless.  Scones great taste and flavour.

Drove from Newquay to Padstow one day during our summer holiday, just to visit Choughs after seeing the place on Alex Polizzi's programme. Well worth the journey. One of the the best pasties I have had, but have to agree with some of the other reviewers that the service is far from good.

This bakery has always been favoured by us on our holidays with their meaty Cornish pasties.  I'm glad to see that since their appearance on Alex Polizzi's show that the shop front has improved and the business seems to be going great.  Plenty of pasties and cakes to choose from.  I only hate that the queue gets so long as I feel under pressure to choosing what I want although the end product is worth waiting for.

Absolutely B.E.A.utiful pasties.......
Don't be fooled by any others, these were the best
The crust is just right & the fillings are so flavoury
Watch out for the queues tho

This bakery I think has again lost its way. Been here a few times and the service seems to be getting worse. The food is so good, pastry and cakes but no one wants to serve it to you with a smile, and in summer too. They were featured on the restaurant inspector on telly and Alex Polizzi took them to task and apparently it worked for a while, but sustaining it is what matters after the cameras have all gone. Bit disappointing given the position and the quality of the merchandise on sale.
a small shop near the harbour ,mind your head if you go in the shop ,plain and fruit  scones are very good ,nice sausage rolls....
We reserved pasties and saffron cake and they'd totally seemed to have no idea about it when we arrived to collect. All ok in the end and collected fine but slightly annoying.

Review Title: Delicious quiche but staff looked miserable
Review Text: Popped in to buy a quiche for a picnic which was delicious.  Let down by staff who looked sullen, showed no enthusiasm and a can't be asked attitude despite the shop not being very busy at the height of season.  They should be sent round to Rick Stein's for training.  Mary Portas recently visited this shop in one of her programmes.  Maybe the customer service part was ignored by Chough's.  A pity because the pastry is fantastic.
Bought some large traditional pasties to take home, well filled and very tasty. Good choice and fresh.
There are Pasty shops a plenty in Padstow. If you want a great tasting pasty you'll be more than happy having one from here. Gorgeous.
We've been coming here for years this is definitely the best pasty shop in Cornwall, a great variety and always fresh. A must not miss stop on holiday

Review Title: Gorgeous food but staff could maybe be happier!
Review Text: We visited this bakery yesterday.  I live in Cornwall and had a cream tea sent by post from here to my mother in law in Yorkshire for mothers day this year.  She thoroughly enjoyed it and as they are down visiting we thought we'd go there for a pasty.  Loads of choice on the lunch front, they do your regular cornish pasty in 3 sizes, a lamb + mint one, steak and cornish blue cheese, chicken leek bacon and cheese, cheese leek and onion, vegetable and a couple more I can't remember!  they also do sausage rolls, quiche, lots of different breads, cakes and scones (we bought some to bring home).  On the whole it was delicious, the only very slight negative was when we asked if the bread we had bought could be sliced and we were answered with a very blunt no.  Nevertheless we bought it anyway and the in laws sliced it up themselves.  I would definitely visit here again as the pasties are scrummy and I look forward to wroking my way through the flavours!

After trying pastys from all the shops available in Padstow and Rock we have found these to be the best. A lot of the other shops ship them in and they are not made fresh in the bakery however you can see the pastys being made from the counter at Choughs. 
I would particularly recommend the lamb and mint pasty.

Wonderful tasting cakes and bread and at the right price!
Visit last thing in the day for the bargains. 
Gives Steins Patisserie a run for their money!
Easy to find right on the harbourside you will have to go along way to find a better tasting pasty!! Reasonable prices too. The kids had sausage rolls which were bursting with flavour.

We went with the ratings on Tripadvisor to lead us in where to go for a lunchtime pasty and I'm so glad we did.  The only reason I didn't give it full marks was because at 11.30 they didn't have any of the cheese and leek or fresh vegetable pasty's - surely approaching lunchtime there should be supply all the time of all the varieties?  Other than that my steak pasty was chock full of tasty ingredients and even the crust didn't seem thick and doughy - just fantastic.  I can see why there are such queues and I'm glad we got there when we did but just a shame about the lack of variety available when we were there.
If your a pasty lover look no further than Chough pasty's, they are the best. You could taste the butter that they'd sauted the onions in. They just taste so good.  No wonder they win so many awards.

Review Title: Perfect pasties and other delicious treats
Review Text: Come back year after year, don't agree with the poor reviews not convinced they got the right bakery. Amazing pasties, our favourite, also get them delivered to Sussex when home as and when have freezer space.  Other baked food is v good can recommend chocolate croissant, mushroom quiche and treacle tart.  One server is more grumpy than the rest but u think she's just too busy, our whole family love choughs and wouldn't have it any other way - well done team choughs
We went after seeing the hype for this place. We was dissapointed. Nothing spectacular and we had eaten better party's in others. Wouldn't return
We went every day of our week stay for fresh bread and the occasional pasty. Delicious! You must go if you are visiting Padstow!

I absolutely love this place. If I worked there I would be huge. The pasties are wonderful, but the cakes are so gorgeous you want to try them all. One of my favourite was a fresh apricot crumble which was delicious. The boys liked the flap jacks. I visited most days to try out something new. Yummy.
Best pasties in the whole of Cornwall, good value for money and they are big enough to eat as a hearty lunch.
Best pasties in Padstow, and probably the world. Great location, but difficult parking: you have to walk around the harbour, which is no chore at all!
Pasties so good - we even get them delivered home when we aren't in Cornwall !! Much better than the chain pasty stores.  Plenty of freshly made breads as well !

I'm not usually a pasty fan, too much pastry and not enough filling but Chough's Pasties are superb, the pastry is just right and is packed full of the most delicious filling. This is definitely the best place to buy (we have tried the other pasty shops in Padstow and they were rubbish in comparison!)
We had the Lamb, Mint & Leak and the traditional Cornish Pasty both were amazing.
We will definitely be back next year and will recommend to everyone.
I wish I'd thought of bringing some home with us!

Whenever I visit padstow I am sure to get a delicious pasty from here everytime. It's pretty obvious it's the favourite as there is always a short queue. As for the price, it's not over priced at all. 
I didn't go for the generic traditional pasty, but feasted on a lamb and mint and It was very good. I would recommend going to this bakery as its the best :)

Padstow is a wonderful place, and i fully understand the need for businesses in holiday areas to make a living when the sun shines ( I am in the industry myself, so fully understand the situation). However ¬£3.95 for a Cornish pasty is outragous!! 

My home town of Bideford has Blackwell Pasties who have been in constant business for 25 years, and their offering is half the price. Shame on you Choughs!!
The best Pasty in Padstow in my not so humble opinion.Yummmmmmmy! Best eaten hot out of a paper bag watching the world go by.

I've known this place for years and seldom pass it without buying something when on holiday. The pasties are the best I know and the medium sized ones seem best. All manner of baked things are on sale here. Saffron products are also good. I wish my figure would allow me to buy more from here!

Review Title: not as good as the hype
Review Text: We had heard about the award winning pasties, but were sadly disappointed, the pastry was really hard but chewy at the same time! Nice flavour filling, but definitely not the best in the town

The Chough Bakery make the best Cornish pasties I have ever tasted. That also have a great range of breads and cakes that all homemade and cooked on their premises. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

What can I say, this bakery is the best, my daughters loved getting their breakfast from here every morning they loved the bacon baps, chocolate croissants, the cakes and the traditional cornish pasties are delicious.

Like most visitors to this bakery, we queued up to buy cornish pasties to enjoy by the harbour. After eating pasties at various places during our one week stay in Cornwall, I can definitely vouch that the steak pasties we had here were the best we have had. 

The display counter area of the bakery was quite busy. It being a beautiful sunny day at Padstow, there were many visitors at the harbour. The staff were very professional - answering customer queries, being quite welcoming and giving sufficient time for the customers to make up their mind. At the same time they were quick to serve, trying to keep the queue short. 

Being a keen home baker, I couldn't resist the temptation to buy a slice of bakewell tart. This turned out to be the best decision of the day! The tart was baked to perfection. The bottom was not soggy at all in spite of the pastry base being very thin. The texture of the pastry was just perfect. The almond flakes were generously distributed, yet the taste wasn't overpowering. The hint of raspberry left a sweet lingering aftertaste that lasted in my mouth for a long time after the slice had vanished. 

I would love to learn how to bake a perfect tart the way they do at the Chough Bakery. I wish they offered some cookery lessons.

Review Title: The best caramel shortbread (and we have tasted a lot)
Review Text: Everything in this bakery is to die for, at the average Padstow price. As mentioned, no savoury is complete without a caramel shortbread and if a sweet catches your eye just have double dessert. I promise it is worth it!
Fantastic pasty - great service. Smiles all round! Steak pasty is just perfect.. Great location too!!
We got breakfast here when we were on holiday in padstow. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was so much choice! Can thoroughly recommend the croissants and the afternoon tea kit.

Ignore any recent negative reviews, at last I have discovered the perfect Cornish pasty after years of searching - no more soggy, excessive crust nor gristly meat nor over-seasoned, peppery filling here at last is a delightfully satisfying pasty with an extremely generous abundance of potato, swede and beef skirt wrapped inside a crisp and flaky casing. One is enough to satisfy the heartiest appetite and my advice is to take as many home as will travel well and fit in your freezer, Recommended unreservedly.
I was looking for a proper pasty and buy gosh I found one! Golden pastry filled with perfectly seasoned meat and vegetables. Pasties were still warm when we ate them and were delicious.
So being on telly makes you a star. Well these are not star quality. Small and over priced . Mass produced filling mixed in a bowl. And the boss serving could at least smile
Stopped in to get a sandwhich at 10:30am what a poor selection. All day there are people out the back so why don't you have them making more to stock the fridge up!

I've been coming to padstow for over ten years and all ways head for this pasty shop well not anymore I'm sorry but you are ripping people off your pastys have reduced in size in the last two years and the price has gone up two for a smaller size . Just because you were on telly it dosent give you the right to rip off your customers . I've all ways recommended you to friends well no more I'll tell them to go to the pasty line in helston bigger and better pasty and a cheaper price and more flavours then just four . Sorry but you had this coming !!!!!!

Lovely pasties...succulent, plenty of meat. Not a 5 star as they were not quite as good as a butchers we visited in St Just near Penzance, but thoroughly enjoyed them, thank you. Would be nice if you could sit in or outside given the fabulous location right in the middle of the harbour, only take-away service.
I went for the large traditional at ¬£3.95, not cheap but undoubtably the best pasty I've ever had and a meal all by itself so actually pretty good value.

The best Cornish pasty I have ever tasted.  After seeing it on the tv I just had to visit.  Not disappointed.  Only wish we had bought a load to bring home to freeze, unfortunately our little fridge in the caravan isn't efficient enough to keep them fresh.  Their bread is delicious too.  The only thing is my waistline has expanded - good job my Weightwatchers leader wasn't anywhere near!!!!

Review Title: What a corker - pasty for breakfast!
Review Text:
We were very fortunate to have booked a little apartment, just around the corner from this bakery. Having seen the reviews on Trip Advisor and having tried some of the other pasty vendors, this is the best in my opinion.

Most mornings, I would pop down about 8:30 and get a selection of buns and breads. By the 3rd day we were on the Traditional Pasty breakfast! We just couldnt resist. The loaction ensures that it gets the maximum footfall possible and for this reason it is a very busy little shop. Don't be dissapointed if you go looking for that glorious baked item and find the have sold out by mid afternoon.
Great pasties and cakes, great service! Superb location in the harbour, you can't miss it! Also sell great cream teas to take away and much cheaper then expected.
Popped into the bakery yesterday for some sweet treats! The cakes from the bakery were delicious although service could of been abit more friendlier, the cakes definitely saved the day! :)

Review Title: delicious olive bread (and pretty good blue cheese pasty too!)
Review Text: we are staying in port isaac but fortunately the local bakery was supplied by this padstow bakery. We had the olive bread several times and it smelt and tasted delicious- so yummy and perfect texture, not too light not too heavy. The pasties were also good, the blue cheese steak one was very nice indeed and the blue cheese not too over-powering. But its all about the olive bread for us!

Always pop in here and guaranteed to walk away with a good supply of sweet treats at a really good price!  Absolutely amazing treacle tarts etc - found this to be so much more of things you'd expect than Rick Stein's Bakery (paying for the price there) so would recommend a visit!!

Recommended to us when staying near Looe and thoroughly enjoyed whilst sitting by harbour.
Now considering their long distance delivery service.

Nothing better than a Chough Bakery Pasty, winner every time!
We love sitting by Padstow harbour watching the world go by, and we always take pasty's back for our family and especially the grandchildren.
see you next time..

Bought pasties here yesterday and had them tonight for dinner- they were really very very very nice. This shop deserves to do well as they are turning out very tasty pasties. Quite pleased that they are not  round the corner to where we live otherwise we would be the size of a house within a month! Great to have as a treat though and  will buy from them again next time we're in Padstow

Great bakery that offers delicious pasties, I so wish we could buy pasties like these back home as  judging by having a taste of my Husband's pasty they are are divine with a proper steak filling and plenty of it . I noticed in another review a reviewer commented on the cheese and bacon quiche, I had the quiche instead of a pasty and it was delicious too again with lots of filling. As well as pasties and savoury items the shop has other types of cakes and different kinds of speciality breads. A very popular bakery and I can see why. Recommended.
Opted for the new flavour Steak&Blue... Delicious! Great service too. One of the best pasties I've had in Cornwall!
As in the title we have had many pastys in cornwall but i must say these were absolutely scrummy, really tasty and good value for money.
Great pasties and cakes, great service! Superb location in the harbour, you can't miss it! Also sell great cream teas to take away and much cheaper then expected.
Popped into the bakery yesterday for some sweet treats! The cakes from the bakery were delicious although service could of been abit more friendlier, the cakes definitely saved the day! :)

Review Title: delicious olive bread (and pretty good blue cheese pasty too!)
Review Text: we are staying in port isaac but fortunately the local bakery was supplied by this padstow bakery. We had the olive bread several times and it smelt and tasted delicious- so yummy and perfect texture, not too light not too heavy. The pasties were also good, the blue cheese steak one was very nice indeed and the blue cheese not too over-powering. But its all about the olive bread for us!

Always pop in here and guaranteed to walk away with a good supply of sweet treats at a really good price!  Absolutely amazing treacle tarts etc - found this to be so much more of things you'd expect than Rick Stein's Bakery (paying for the price there) so would recommend a visit!!

Recommended to us when staying near Looe and thoroughly enjoyed whilst sitting by harbour.
Now considering their long distance delivery service.

Nothing better than a Chough Bakery Pasty, winner every time!
We love sitting by Padstow harbour watching the world go by, and we always take pasty's back for our family and especially the grandchildren.
see you next time..

Bought pasties here yesterday and had them tonight for dinner- they were really very very very nice. This shop deserves to do well as they are turning out very tasty pasties. Quite pleased that they are not  round the corner to where we live otherwise we would be the size of a house within a month! Great to have as a treat though and  will buy from them again next time we're in Padstow

Great bakery that offers delicious pasties, I so wish we could buy pasties like these back home as  judging by having a taste of my Husband's pasty they are are divine with a proper steak filling and plenty of it . I noticed in another review a reviewer commented on the cheese and bacon quiche, I had the quiche instead of a pasty and it was delicious too again with lots of filling. As well as pasties and savoury items the shop has other types of cakes and different kinds of speciality breads. A very popular bakery and I can see why. Recommended.
Opted for the new flavour Steak&Blue... Delicious! Great service too. One of the best pasties I've had in Cornwall!
As in the title we have had many pastys in cornwall but i must say these were absolutely scrummy, really tasty and good value for money.

Review Title: There's a reason they are award winning pasties....
Review Text: Just back form Cornwall and the lovely Treyarnon Bay, whilst we were there we popped over to Padstow and as usual stopped off for a couple of pasties from Chough. We took them back to the apartment and despite the gorgeous smells emanating from the bag we managed to resist as my mum had cooked us a meal. As a result we're back home in Kenilworth and have just heated up the long awaited pasties and they were definitely worth the wait. Full of steak, flavour and the taste of Cornwall whatever that means, basically just very tasty. Saw a review saying they were cold and soggy but if they got them cold from the bakery (quite tricky as they usually have a fresh batch on the go) they should have waited and heated then up in the oven when they got home!
A very nice selection of bread and pasties. They also sell traditional Saffron Cake which is scrummy

Bought pasty today from Chough's mainly because of the television programme. Very disappointed as pasty was cold, soggy and any meat was almost nonexistent.
Won't be going back.

Down in Padstow for a couple of days, went the Chough Bakery after a lovely walk on the beach,
And bought 2 medium traditional pasties. Absolutely brilliant, definitely buying some tomorrow to take home.

Whenever we fancy a pasty this is where we go! You often have to wait for them to come out of the oven due to the popularity of this place - but that just means you always get a fresh and hot pasty. The pastry is delicious. The service is good and it's also reasonably priced. If you want a good cornish pasty walk past the chain shops in the town and go here!
The bread is pretty good too!

We often visit Padstow and have bought pasties here before which were good. On the most recent occasion the range available was small and we were told we'd have to wait 10 minutes before the next batch of steak pasties came out (surely a best seller?) and even then they couldn't tell me if any would be available to buy as they had an order waiting. i explained I'd like to know if they could or could not fulfill our order there and then as I didn't want to wait 10 minutes only to be disappointed. They were rather short and said they couldn't tell me and I'd have to wait. Obviously it wasn't possible to open the oven door and see how many they had in!! If the staff had been a little more pleasant I probably would have waited. As they were rather arrogant I went round the corner to The Pasty Company and bought 6 excellent steak and tribute pasties which were gorgeous. A case of needing a little work on front of house I think.

We recently  had a pasty from here and it was terrible. It was bland, lacked salt, not much beef. Dont know whats happened here . We had one in the summer and it was lovely. To top it off a seagull flew down and grabbed my hubbys. pasty. Maybe that was a good thing on the occasion. Please improve or you will lose customers

Review Title: My first pasty in Cornwall was a great experience
Review Text: My last day in Padstow I was determined to find what looked like a shop selling traditional pasties and not a chain store. I stumbled upon this place, and it looked the business, so I ordered two meat pasties to take back with me to Portsmouth on the train.  The smell filled the whole train with the wonderful aroma, that I gave in and ate mine before I even got home.  It was wonderful and everything I had hoped.  Going back down in February and will be buying some more of this Cornish wonder!
I love pastry so it was fantastic, I had the cheese and bacon quiche and it was delicious, lots to choose from also had cakes and scones etc, good quality and great to eat walking round the harbour.

Excellent bread and even better pasties.
I would recommond the chicken, bacon, leek and cheese pasty - sheer heaven in pastry!

We took them back to the apartment and despite the gorgeous smells emanating from the bag we managed to resist as my mum had cooked us a meal. As a result we're back home in Kenilworth and have just heated up the long awaited pasties and they were definitely worth the wait. A very nice selection of bread and pasties. They also sell traditional Saffron Cake which is scrummy

Won't be going back.

And bought 2 medium traditional pasties. Absolutely brilliant, definitely buying some tomorrow to take home.

The pastry is delicious. The service is good and it's also reasonably priced. If you want a good cornish pasty walk past the chain shops in the town and go here!
The bread is pretty good too!

On the most recent occasion the range available was small and we were told we'd have to wait 10 minutes before the next batch of steak pasties came out (surely a best seller?) and even then they couldn't tell me if any would be available to buy as they had an order waiting. i explained I'd like to know if they could or could not fulfill our order there and then as I didn't want to wait 10 minutes only to be disappointed. They were rather short and said they couldn't tell me and I'd have to wait. Obviously it wasn't possible to open the oven door and see how many they had in!! If the staff had been a little more pleasant I probably would have waited. As they were rather arrogant I went round the corner to The Pasty Company and bought 6 excellent steak and tribute pasties which were gorgeous. A case of needing a little work on front of house I think.

We recently  had a pasty from here and it was terrible. It was bland, lacked salt, not much beef. Dont know whats happened here . We had one in the summer and it was lovely. To top it off a seagull flew down and grabbed my hubbys. pasty. Maybe that was a good thing on the occasion. Please improve or you will lose customers

Review Title: My first pasty in Cornwall was a great experience
Review Text: My last day in Padstow I was determined to find what looked like a shop selling traditional pasties and not a chain store. I stumbled upon this place, and it looked the business, so I ordered two meat pasties to take back with me to Portsmouth on the train.  The smell filled the whole train with the wonderful aroma, that I gave in and ate mine before I even got home.  It was wonderful and everything I had hoped.  Going back down in February and will be buying some more of this Cornish wonder!
I love pastry so it was fantastic, I had the cheese and bacon quiche and it was delicious, lots to choose from also had cakes and scones etc, good quality and great to eat walking round the harbour.

Excellent bread and even better pasties.
I would recommond the chicken, bacon, leek and cheese pasty - sheer heaven in pastry!
Veggie pasties were horrible pastry looked delicious but tasted like cardboard .. Filling really slimy and nasty and unseasoned ! Go to pengenna pasties in bude much much nicer !

Having holiday'd in Padstow for around 20 years, we've tried all the pasties but somehow, never from The Chough.  We rectified that this time, and they are the best to be had in Padstow - proper, traditional Cornish Pasties, full of beef and potato and plenty of pepper.  Nothing fancy, no extra ingredients or flavouring, just a pasty as it's meant to be.
The ready made sandwiches are sublime.
I found the staff cheerful and willing.
We bought our pasties to take on our walk so we enjoyed the tasty traditional pasty near pol earth overlooking the estuary:) excellent pastry, tender meat and tasty vegetables...mmmm

Do not buy your pasties from anywhere other than Choughs. I have been coming here for 4 years now and have bought pasties, scones, bread, rolls, bacon breakfasty things and they've all been lovely! Pasties from elsewhere just do not come anywhere close!

Having seen this bakery on the TV I was eager to try there Traditional Pasty....
On entering the shop 2 lady assistants were present and although they saw me they were busy in discussion and did not seem happy... eventually they served me..."service with a snarl"   anyway the pasty was consumed sitting in the sun by the harbour... delicious...best pasty I can remember!

Review Title: Tastiest pasty I had during week in North Cornwall
Review Text:
Once we'd checked into our B&B we strolled down to the harbour to get a snack. Had a quick look at a few of the many pasty shops around the harbour (there are three next to each other not far from this one!) and just decided that The Chough looked the most appealing. Both choosing the traditional steak pasties, we found them very tasty, with good quality meat, well seasoned and thoroughly enjoyed them.

Our only problem was finding somewhere to sit and eat them in the middle of Padstow on a Sunday afternoon that wasn't packed with people and their dogs!

If there is one good reason to visit Padstow then this must be it. Been here on and off over last few years and the newly made over shop front drags Choughs up to date. 
Pasties have never disappionted with my personal favourite the steak and blue cheese although the traditional is also very well received with good mix of steak, root veg and seasoning. 

Its also good to see the bakery supplying some other local outlets! Their bread is wonderfully fresh and tasty as are their scones and buns.

We went here in preference to the myriad other pasty shops in Padstow as we had seen the family who own it being ripped to shreds by Alex Polizzi on the TV. Not a particularly sound reason, granted, but it proved a good choice anyway! My wife had the steak pasty and I had the cheese, onion and leek version and they were both very nice indeed! Not bad value either - one large and one medium for ¬£6.50. Highly recommended, as the queue out of the door and down the road will testify!

We have had the pasties before and were lovely then - now they taste (I suppose what they are ) mass produced and the pastry was horrid. Sausage roll was fatty too. BUT the bread is lovely, the shop spotless even late on a busy day.  Sorry to be negative

THE most amazing traditional pasties. Simply a must have whenever you see a Chough Bakery.

They are always hot, perfect quantity of filling, perfect pastry and good value!
Excellent Cornish pasties. Definitly the best pasties I ever had. They tasted absolutely delightful. A tough act to follow for anyone else.

The queue coming out of the door enticed us in! We were not disappointed. I had the medium traditional pasty and it was delicious. Maybe I was lucky but it was full of tender steak. My husband and teenagers went for the chicken, smoked bacon, cheese and leek pasty which they said was 'okay' but nothing special.
The other goodies in the bakery looked lovely and would definately visit again if in the area.
We bought sandwiches and cake, all lovely and reasonably priced. Carrot cake soft and yummy.  Polite staff.

Review Title: Best pasties in the world (according to my hubby!)
Review Text: My husband fancies himself quite the pasty connoisseur, and after extensive testing during our recent trip to Cornwall, he concluded that these are by far the best!

Everybody is reviewing the pasties...Well we just spent a week in Cornwall and not a pasty in sight! 

What I can say is that the Chough serves some tasty cakes. We bought the brownie and millionaire shortbread for a walk on the coast path - the shortbread was very good but the brownie was nearly the best I've ever had. I can't say the best because if my girlfriend reads this then I'm in trouble. We did think it was on the pricey side (¬£3.20 for two small cakes) but I suppose this is what you get with a harbour-front location.

Unfortunately we didn't get a chance to pop back and buy their recipe book but we'll look out for it on a later trip.

Whilst on a trip to Padstow and having read all the reviews we headed here first at lunch time.  But I must say we were a bit disappointed.  Not the outstanding pasties we were expecting.  We had the traditonal cornish pastie, which was expensive and mainly just full of potato, not much meat at all.  Also could have been tastier.  I am guessing the only reason it is popular is it's position right on the harbour front.  If it was in one of the streets behind, like the other pastie shops it wouldn't have the queues.  It's just that it's conveniently placed.  Also the service was lack-lustre.  We would head somewhere else next time.

I have been coming to Padstow for around 35yrs and have had pasties from the chough bakery I would say at least 50 times. The only issue I had this year was that the traditional pasty I selected seemed to be an almost vegetarian pie as i only found 3 pieces of small steak in it.

My wife however had the cocktail version and found a lump of steak almost half the size of the pasty??

A little more quality control is needed I think.

Having only used the Chough sporadically over a number of years we visited this year following their appearance on a well known TV show having a catering business makeover. 

We were welcomed into the attractive premises, were told in the street that their pasties were fantastic by a member of the public and we bought scones, quiche, cream and sausage rolls.

All were of fantastic quality and the sausage rolls were the best we as a family have ever tasted. The scones were equally as good......we done to The Chough Bakery for their turnaround and the queues are a clear sign of the success.....we would highly recommend!!!

Just fantastic! We actually found their pasties stocked in a little coffee shop in Port Isaac before finding their shop in Padstow. There pastry is really great by itself, not just a casing for the filling like so many others. The traditional Cornish pasty filling was really good quality, large chunks of meat, not a mass of minced junk. Big thumbs up Chough - we saw you on TV earlier in the year and were not disappointed. Will be ordering from you online now too :-)

Review Title: Average, there's better round the corner....
Review Text:
OK, so while in Padstow you have to have a Pasty and after watching Alex Polizzi doing her stuff on The Chough we thought we had better give it a go.

We had a traditional and some cheese and onion pasties.  I have to say that we were really dissapointed.  Don't get me wrong,  they were OK and filling but pretty tasteless.  too much veg and not much meat in the traditional.

My advice? Go round the corner and get a better and cheaper one from Pasty Presto. Have eaten from there over many years and never faulted their pasties.

High recommend, possibly the best pasties in Cornwall - the queues at lunchtime pay testament to this fact. Everything about the pasty is spot on, from crisp pastry to ample, tasty filling. Don't go anywhere else in Padstow, these are the best - take it from a sel-confessed pasty expert.

Review Title: Don't know what the fuss is about
Review Text: We got two pasties from here. They were fine nothing great. I really don't see what all the fuss is about really. The staff were not the friendliest. They were not very tasty didn't find anything spectacular about them.

Best pasty I have ever had! 

This bakery is a popular spot, right on the harbour in padstow. 

What made this different from ever other pasty shop I have tried when visiting Cornwall was the pastry, really tasty, and the really well seasoned filling. We all thoroughly enjoyed our lunch!
A busy little shop, but friendly and some nice pasties to choose from.

Nice wholesome pasty and sauagae rolls for lunch. Busy entrance but staff were doing what they could. Perhaps a dedicated till point rather than all staff working tills might help? Overall, the food was nice and it was good to see they have turned a corner :)

Review Title: Not as good as the hype
Review Text: No, in my opinion, it does not have the best pasties in Padstow.  Far from it.  I've tried these twice just to make sure it wasn't an off day and found the pastry to be hard and the meat had a fair bit of gristle on it.  There are far better pasties to be had in Padstow than at the Chough.
tasty pastys... freindly staff.... right on the harbour...

Review Title: A nice bakery in a nice place
Review Text: Me & my family visited Padstow today after going on the Jubilee Queen boat.  The staff in the bakery were friendly & attentive, also making sure that different cakes went in different bags, something other establishments like this could learn from

Review Title: Nothing prepares you for the wonderful taste of a choughs pastie
Review Text:
As soon as we arrived in Padstow 
Forget Rick Stein go to Choughs bakery for a pastie absolutely delicious 
Highlight of my trip
... and big and hot and really good value. Served with a smile too.
Beautiful Cornish pasties. We took loads home with us including some sausage rolls and bakewell tart. The bakewell tart is to die for!!!!!! I don't think it will last long in our freezer!
Visited after seeing them on the telly, not let down with the pasty!

Excellent pasties, I had to take orders from family to bring them home!! The smell in the car driving home was fabulous. We will certainly take up the online offer! Good customer service, very friendly.

Bought 2 Pasties from the Padstow Pasty shop this week, one large steak and one mint and lamb. In both pasties it was a case of 'hunt the meat'. Not much in the lamb one and just 2 small chunks of mostly fat in the so call large 'steak'. There are many good pasties to be had in Cornwall - this is not one of them.

When I wrote my review saying how good the pasties were I noticed a review about the mail order,I ordered some and they were superb,high quality and excellent delivery as good as fresh in the shop. However I ordered some after the T.V.show about The Chough , very little meat and that was mostly gristle I have tried to contact them but no reply.This is a great pity,I did not mind paying ¬£12 for delivery but now I can buy as good in the shops in Worcester.
Whenever in Padstow I always get my pasties from Clough Bakery - highly recommended
Recommended by a friend and we were not disappointed. A selection of meat and vegetarian, all were excellent.
These pasties are award winning. Full of meat and potato, wrapped in a light pastry. One of the best pasties I've every had.

Good wholesome food, but not always the most flavorsome.  I used to crave chough pasties, but I think that the quality is not as good as it was a couple of years ago.  Back in May, my pasty lunch seemed to totally lack any form of seasoning!!
Some of the best well seasoned pasties we've ever had in Cornwall.  Even if you're not particularly hungry or money is tight the cocktail pasty is worth having

Great breads and cakes of a very high standard, but sadly let down by a your girl who works there who seems disinterested and very poor at serving customers, which is a shame. This was on several different visits and not an isolated "Off Day".

Fabulous bakery. All freshly baked on the premises with so much choice and top qulaity ingredients. Buy the cookery book its so worth it to recreate that taste of Padstow at home during the winter months.
The title sums it up.   Delicious and just sorry that I didn't get a chance to taste anything else.   It is a take away though.

Not only does the Chough do excellent pasties - much better quality and variety than all the other generic pasty shops - it is also an excellent bakery with lovely bread, cakes and quiches etc. You may have to queue for a few minutes, but it's well worth the wait!

Such a delight to find good quality, value for money food in Padstow.  Well it's not hard as long as the word Stein isn't stamped anywhere near it.

We had the standard steak pasty and it's definitely the richest we'd tried all week.  A very strong kick from the pepper, very welcome.  Let the kids share one of the pasties together and they were at loggerheads!

Visit Padstow, visit Chough!
Nice fresh food, great tradition, right in Padstow Harbor.
Lovely Pastys Lovely Pastys Lovely Pastys Lovely Pastys Lovely Pastys

Lovely, light pastry with a variety of delicious fillings.   Many pasties I have had have been more pastry than filling, but I hardly noticed the pastry when eating my pasty, it was so light.  We also tried a couple of cakes and croissants which were absolutely delicious.
Without question, the tastiest, most perfect pasties in Cornwall, served with a smile to be enjoyed on the quayside. fresh baked before your very eyes by a dedicated family team.

This is now a celebrity shop having been on national television for a businiess makeover but this hasn't gone to their heads. The pasties were lovely with a pastry slightly different to others we have had during our holiday. A medium pasty was ¬£2-50 which was good value, there is a lot of competition  foro the pasty consumer here, with at least 3 other producers within sight of this shop, Choughs was the only one with a queue, which normally indicates a good take-away.
The best pasties we have ever tasted and great value.Well organised shop with smiley service. Could not be bettered for a takeway lunch at the harbour.
Visited last week twice !!!!! Possibly the best pasties in Cornwall and their cakes are nice too especially the eccles with plenty of filling !!!!

during our week stay in Padstow we visited Chough Bakery several times, and if you've ever been you will know why! pastries are amazing, and the puddings (although we didn't get to try any) looked incredible!

Review Title: This is a Pasty shop not a restaurant !
