Review Text: Noticed this on the Padstow "Best restaurants" list it's a shop selling good produce but offers nothing else

These were by far the best pasties we had on our trip to Cornwall.
Lots of filling, and lovely pastry, especially the crusts.
Go early in the day, because they do sell out quickly.
Ring to order if you want to bring them home with you.
Staff not very friendly, only downside.
the best pasties from the original pasty shop, always busy so dont go too late cos they sell out
Dropped into Chough early one morning and had a traditional pasty.  Generous filling that was quite nice, not the best pasty I had all week but still quite good.
Probably the best pasty that you will ever eat. Tasty , slightly peppery, with real meat and swede, not mince.

Review Title: The Fixer - not sure it's fixed but definitely improved:)
Review Text: I've coming to Padstow for many years but always gave a miss to this bakery....Then BBC2 The Fixer came along and I thought I will see how good their Cornish pastries are. So I had the Cornish pasty .... and it was decent, enough meat and vegetables but it lacked pepper & the pastry was still uncooked. Do not get me wrong, I do not make a better pasty myself but my conclusion was: pasty from Chough bakery or Ginsters? I'm sorry Eade clan, for me it will be Ginsters. It might be commercial but it is made in Cornwall and tastes like home made:)

Situated in a prominent position on the harbour front at Padstow, here you will find a top quality bakery, they have all kinds of  fab breads, rolls ,plus a large selection of quality pasties, eat one and it will spoil your evening meal. well laid out , always busy, we visited twice whilst here on holiday . Recommended..
If in Padstow, this is the place to buy your pasties, alway get ours from here,even take a box home with us.

My Husband and I visit Padstow every year, the new look Chough is very smart an easy to find, as well as having friendly staff.
 We would recommend the bread, millionaires short bread an of course the pasties.
We also purchased the take away cream teas as gifts.

Review Title: If you visit Padstow you HAVE to go to the Chough Bakery!
Review Text: Everytime we visit Padstow we all head to this bakery on a daily basis!Fabulous pasties and scones and cakes!!
Really tasty pasties especially the blue cheese & steak!

Popped in for a spot of late lunch and ended up with a steak and Stilton pastie! Yum! Is all I can say! Definitely the best pastie of the holiday.  Have purchased one of their lovely seeded sour dour breads for breakfastso watch this space...
The only bakery (or so we were told) that bakes pasties in Padstow itself. The best we had, by no small distance,¬†during our stay in Padstow. But get there early - they sell out fast!

Review Title: Superior Pasties that Surpass All Others!
Review Text: After sampling various pasty joints in our visits to Cornwall Choughs Bakery is far superior! We make a point of going here - even if we're not eating them there and then (which is hard to resist) we bag them for later! FULL of quality meat and not overdone on the vegetables. Pastry consistency spot on and not too doughy, nice balance of all ingredients and nicely spiced. You can mail order them which we are going to do later in the year when we need our fix - sorry but a Ginsters from the garage is nothing like these beauties! A must if you're in town!
We loved these generously filled pastys and would recommend them wholeheartedly.
Great name, great pasties! The large steak pasty is a meal in itself, plenty of meat, plenty of veg and fantastic pastry. They also do mailorder.

Review Title: You've never had a pasti unless you've been to Choughs!
Review Text: Forget the diet!  This will be the best pasti you will ever have in a lifetime.  The pastry and filling are perfect.  The queue out the door and down the street says it all.  Yummm!
Love all the produce on sale here, great bread, pasties and cakes
Only had the bread served at the bedruthan steps hotel at breakfast,it really is brilliant,very fresh,soft,wholesome and fragrant,did not have the time to eat a pasty,maybe next time.
The bakery is well worth a visit to sample one of the superb pasties.  There is also a fantastic selection bread and cakes to enjoy.  Buy a pasty and sit at the harbour chilling!
Excelleny selection of cakes, pasties, and other pastries..... Try the steak & blue cheese pastie, very moreish!
The best pasty I have ever tasted. Buy a pasty, sit on the harbour and enjoy both in a great location.
Brilliant! This family run bakery is a legend, and well deserves the reputation that it has. We stocked up on scones and sourdough bread before we travelled home, they cannot be beaten.

After watching the programme on tv recently about the bakery I had to pop in and see for myself and the pasty according to my new hubby was the best he has tasted (has won awards apparently) and the young female owner was friendly and helpful with recommendations of where to try for dinner that evening. Def worth a visit to sample the local produce

As someone who was born and bred in the Southwest of England, and an avid party muncher, I feel I know an awful lot about pasties. I have looked at many of the other reviews who appear to think the pasties are "the best in the world"

Sadly I beg to differ. The ones we had were good, although not the same temparature throughout. A little less than hot in parts. Sadly my wife and I got very bad indigestion and couldn't een eat in the evening.

The least appealing part of the experience was the attitude of the staff, which we found rather unfriendly and curt. A shame as I was looking forward to our visit after the TV programme. I think there's still a long way to go.
................to die for, freshly baked and great service. Should have brought some home.

Review Title: His and hers pasties - a little hit and miss
Review Text: We did find we preferred the pasties in another shop in the end, but can't recall the name! We did have tasty pasties from here, but mine (beef and stilton)  was stone cold, and given they are served half out of the bag and ready to eat I would have liked it hot! Sorry to say, we didn't go back. As I say, tasty but I was disappointed :-(
Go with the classic, its unbeatable. There are a lot of places to chose from in Padstow, but this is by far the best, You won't be disappointed.

If you are looking for the best pastie in Padstow then look no further than The Chough Bakery - over the years I have probably had pasties from pretty much all of the bakeries in the town and in my view this is the number one.
The pasties are great - the best we have tasted and they do some great bread

Review Title: The Best Pastie in the World
Review Text: The best pastie in Padstow and probably the world.

Chough's Cornish Pasties are worth the trip to Padstow, regardless of which bit of Cornwall you are holidaying in. Crisp, yet buttery pastry, not too crumbly, not soggy. Even the thick crusty bit was edible, not to thrown to the birds like some Cornish pasty crusts. Loaded with fresh filling and hot. Again, not soggy or  dry-moist and flavoursome. Minor complaint, meat to potato ratio was a little under par but other than that, spot on. We got served quickly even though Padstow was heaving and there were folks in the shop. Reasonable price for such a huge pasty. I was very reluctant to give my salivating dogs a taste (I did nonetheless).

Review Title: Publicity on The Fixer ensures that this place is suddenly busy
Review Text: From 'walk on by' to 'must visit' in a week - the power of television in a town already made famous by Stein.

Review Title: Was a good pasty not the best I've had though!
Review Text: The steak pasty was very good and quite light and the special flavours they had in were very tasty and a different take on the traditional pasties. Was very tasty but not the best pasty I've had!

My wife and i have been having Pasties from Here for at least ten years and i have not found better anywhere in the world keep up the good work Elain & Family 
Dave & Ann Essex
Veggie pasties were a little bland. More seasoning needed but nice and fresh. Good choice of cakes and breads. Friendly and good prices for Padstow.
Ordered take home pastys day before our journey home.   Staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs.  Needless to say we came home with pastys, scones, cream, mincepies and stollen cake!!!

Review Title: Best pasties in Padstow, we went back numerous times in 2 wk stay
Review Text: Great pasties which we took for lunch on walks, ate for breakfast etc. Tried other places around the harbour, nothing came close.

How many shops sell pasties in Padstow - I've lost count.  The Chough was here first though and nobody matches it.  The pastry itself is good, not flaky or greasy, and there is plenty of filling with a delicious peppery flavour.  Also to be found at the bakery are fresh breads, cakes, ready  made sandwiches and ice creams.  Some of the cakes are so large that one will suffice for 2 peoplel.  Don't forget to get your scones here for your cream tea, you won't be disappointed.

If it wasn't for the fact that I live over 300 miles away from this place I would be getting my lunch here at least every other day - the best pasty's in Padstow for certain and quite possibly the best pasty's in Cornwall.
These are the daddy of pasties, go for the big one. Great taste, value for money & totally Cornish, Oh yes.

traditional pasty which was very large,excellent taste aqnd very good value a must if you are in Padstow,especially if you cannot go into a restaurant because you have a dog with you and need to eat outside.Friendly staff who are pleased to see you.

If you only have time for one pasty whilst in Padstow, then it must be from Chough's.
The choices are amazing and quality sublime.  Chough's bakery is single handedly responsible for gaining a good few pounds to my waistline, but I don't regret a single one!
Fabulous bakery with gorgeous setting. We bought pasties and scones from here and they were delicious. Do yourself a favour and head here to treat yourself!
Not sure that this is a restaurant but excellent fresh, very meaty cornish pasties to buy in the shop.  So impressed that we ordered some online for home and they arrived the next morning !!
Bought a pack of 4 scones to takeaway, 10 out of 10! They must use a packet of butter per scone, we will be back!

If you want a real cornish pasty look no further, we often head down to Padstow for a short break camping and love the Chough Bakery for our lunchtime pasty.  The traditional cornish is spot on while I would highly recomnmend the steak pasties which are simply delicious.  I would never buy a pasty in Padstow from anywhere else, a must try.

My family and I have been visiting Padstow at least once a year for four generations and, despite trying other bakeries, still think that Choughs bake the best pasties around.  There are a whole lot of new pastie shops opened in Padstow - please avoid them and try Choughs - you wont be disappointed.  I have just returned with 24 to distribute to various members of the clan!

Review Title: You can stick it up your chuff mate!
Review Text: Popped in for 4 pasties and cakes with the family when here in August - would probably have been as cheap to sit down in a cafe (not much change from ¬£20). My pastie was fine, nothing to write home about and not a patch on the one I'd had in Newquay earlier in the week, but fine. My Mrs on the other hand had a mixed veg version and found a piece of metal in hers which cut her gum - ok, she wasn't about to bleed to death but not what you expect. On taking the pastie back to the shop, the assistant said "oh yes, that would be off a tin" (so, all this guff about "only the finest fresh ingredients"...). The really annoying thing was that at no point did my wife receive anything that sounded like an apology and only when she asked for it was she offered her money back. Won't be trying them again!

Review Title: Excellent pastie But staff are a let down
Review Text: Walked in to order my pasties three large steak. The staff at the counter didn't great or even say hello just asked what I wanted with no smile shame because the pasties were amazing but uninterested staff let it down

Review Title: Great for pasties and sandwiches too
Review Text: Went here for pasties on a short visit to Padstow as if was recommended by our guesthouse owner. Lovely crunchy pastry filled with huge chunks of beef in delicious gravy and loads of potato. Returned as we were leaving to get some pasties to take home and as an afterthought we grabbed a couple of sandwiches for the journey. These turned out to be really delicious too so obviously pasties aren't all that they're good at. Can't wait to return for another fix.

Without a doubt this is the best bakery for Pasties in Padstow. We have been there twice this year and on each occasion brought back 24 LARGE ones. They are made on the premises and what I particluarly liked is that the traditional ones are really well seasoned, and have a subtle kick. Unfortunately we shall be visiting South Cornwall next year and shall miss out on these but I guarantee for those who are in Padstow get along to Chough's for the best pasty experience!!

as a company we buy fresh croissants from Choughs daily!! they are fantastic as they put a smile on everyones face !! talk about a lovely start to the day & the service by all the staff is so friendly .

Please dont both with any other bakers in town as this place serves the best pasties in the world.  We got ours first thing in the morning and let is rest for a couple of hours.  The pastry was light and soft, not hard or thick like others and the filling wasnt that often grey looking meat, but was burstly with fresh chunky steak and veg and not too much pepper.  Perfect.  The scones and cakes are good too.  I wish this was my local bakery.

I must admit Im not the biggest Pastie or Pie man, but when in Rome you must do as the Romans do.
In Padstow alone there are four Cornish Pastie shops, plus many many others selling pasties, so the choice is plentiful! because of the three excellent ratings on here I opted for the Chough Bakery where there goods are made and baked on site rather than delivered.
The choice is limited but that to me is where the strength lies, this is a cornish shop selling traditional pasties so the words breakfast, thai, chilli, and bannana and chocolate pasties are no where to be seen un like in the other less traditional bakeries Padstow has to offer.
My pastie itself was divine beautifulyl light pastry filled with wonderful steak and vegetables seasoned to perfection, a real pleasure to eat. 
On a final note I also had a wonderful piece (sorry 2) of the fabulous chocolate caramel shortcake without doubt the best I have eaten !
Visit the Chough Bakery for a wonderful taste of homemade Cornish delights!
If you want a proper pasty freshly made in the village with good ingredients and to a genuine Cornish recipe this is the place to go. The bread and cakes are good too.

Whenever you visit Padstow, this is where to get your Cornish Patsy from. It's made, cooked and sold on the premises unlike other Padstow shops that buy in or bring in their pasties from other shops / factories from other towns. I have been a very happy Chough's customer for many, many years!

The Cornish Pasties really are to die for here if you are in Padstow get a pasty from here, my little girl had a sausage roll and she loved it. 

This is not a restaurant, its a bakery shop.
Pleasant bakery with good scones, cakes, bread and the like. Enjoyed tea and scones. Nice location too.
They served the best lardy cake me and my husband have ever tasted. My husband would also recommend thr milkshakes. It is a little pricey, but it is a lovely treat.

Conveniently located, with some coffee table inside.
I got a toast and two salty croissants spent ¬£22.
Not bad sandwiches, but the dirt of the tables unacceptable.

Patchy service, staff need more training. 
Long wait times and felt disorganised behind the counter.
Managed to get 3 drinks wrong twice with no apology.
Amazing! Excellent products and generous portions! Very good ambience. Staff very attending in a such beautiful place! Something to remember forever!

In this charming town of Cotswolds, there's a bakery where we can make a quick meal.
The products are not delicious, but fill the hunger!

Review Title: Poor quality ingredients and slow service
Review Text: Popped in for some breakfast, queued for 10 mins - not  problem - however we waited 20 minutes for our drinks (even the bottled water which could have been given to us straight away.) Our food came out within 5 minutes so had already eaten it by the time the drinks come! The sausage bap was awful, the quality of the sausages were terrible. They also added on a 12.5% service charge (wouldn't mind usually but we had to order at the till ourselves! Will not be returning.

Before you go to Bourton-on-the-Water you will surely have heard of the bakery. Good products but we were misinformed: watch out for supplements that are not advertised. For a moment we thought we were being compensated but the staff never came back. For the French do not expect to find bread as you know it.

Review Title: A poster in their window says they won an award in 2023 - not true this award was given to the previous owners!
Review Text: This cafe has recently changed hands and not for the better.  They are displaying in their window about a Trip Advisor award in 2023 but this award was for the previous owners.  I have only been once after the new owners took over and i won't be going again.

Waited about 15 minutes to get served as there was  a queue and only one person at the till. Couldn‚Äôt see the prices for the Cornish pasties so came as a shock when I was charged ¬£5.80 for ONE to take out, really wasn‚Äôt worth the wait. Don‚Äôt see how they can justify their prices, I will never buy from here again, there are cheaper and better bakery‚Äôs in Bourton. If you don‚Äôt like getting ripped off like me then I would advise you to shop around.
Our lovely bakery has become v expensive but with a decline in quality. Very disappointing. Often bread over baked. Service not so good- far less friendly than with previous owners.

A Brilliant Bakery. 
The food and coffee were 10/10. 
Living in Manchester City Centre we are no strangers to paying a premium for things as you do here. 
The setting is fantastic and you can see why there's a premium, but you certainly get what you pay for and therefore do not mind. The staff were polite and friendly, the shop gets busy and we're queuing out the door but was very well managed. 
Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the village, will definitely return.

Bourton-on-the-Water is a very attractive popular tourist-town in the central Cotswolds.  The river Windrush, complete with lovely low bridges, runs right-through the main commercial centre.  As you would expect there are many eateries here, offering snacks and meals, so the competition for tourist ¬£¬£¬£‚Äôs is/was bound to be fierce.  There are many eateries offering afternoon or cream teas.  After looking at several; with quaint d√©cor, and (most probably) waitresses in lacy pinafore dresses; I doubted that these would provide a satisfactory quality snack for our outlay.

I was very aware that my Partner was getting weary of looking at prospective places, to find the one that offered good, and fairly-priced wholesome food.  My yardstick was simple: were other customer going there, and did it feel like a tourist-trap?  Eventually we turned a corner in a back-street, and there it was, this artisan bakery shop caf√©.  The queue wasn‚Äôt huge, and the place was bustling and busy.  There seemed to me that there was a mix of locals and tourists sat at the tables.  The food in the glass counter cabinet certainly looked good.  There were plenty of staff and they were all busy.  Yes ‚Ä¶ this was the place!

We ordered a cheese and ham toastie each, plus a pot of tea for two.  The food counter cabinet had showed (amongst other delights) prepared, but uncooked, toasties; the bread was really thick, and the filling looked plentiful.  My expectation was that the toasties were going to provide that good quality snack.

Seating was an issue, but a very pleasant switched-on young lady behind the counter advised us to retreat to a (we felt dull) anteroom where there were unoccupied tables.  We would then be advised, if and when, a table in the main, very atmospheric, dining area became free.  That worked for us, but before we were notified about a free table, we saw a party leave, so we grabbed their table before it was re-taken.

We sat down, but the table was covered with used crockery and cutlery; so we cleared this to one side of the four-seater table, where it was promptly taken away.  Our tea soon arrived and we let it steep, as we do prefer strong tea.  Our plates of food arrived after a few minutes and the toastied did look good.  The very chunky bread was lightly toasted and packed with the ham and melted cheese filling.  The plate was completed with a small leafy salad and some crisps.  This was good tasty rustic food and thoroughly great to eat, and not at all expensive at a total of ¬£25.52 - really great value for a snack that satisfied.

Service was really friendly and efficient, as befitting a family business.  As I left I saw the young woman who served us and gave her the thumb‚Äôs up for what was an excellent quality snack with memorably attentive service.  We‚Äôll be back.

Review Title: The Best Quiche in the UK!
Review Text:
This bakery and cafe has a great vibe. Staff were busy but cheerful and efficient. The bakery display is all very tempting!

We bought quiche, a sourdough loaf and Victoria Sponge cake. The quiche was genuinely the best we've ever tasted in the UK and equal to that we've tried from artisan bakers in France; crisp, light pastry and packed with a delicious filling. Perfect!

The sourdough was excellent and the Victoria sponge a real treat (and we're quite fussy!).

It's worth paying a bit more for top food quality. We highly recommend and will return when next in the area.
This was a lovely experience and everyone was smashing, good food, good service, will go back when in the area, was so pleased

Walking in Bourton early on Sunday and fancied a coffee, I was really pleased to see the Bakery on the Water open. Walked in and asked for a coffee, the girl took my order, There was 1 other person in the cafe and 2 staff serving. 
The one lady served the other person, very slowly and the girl who took our order wandered around and eventually started to make what we thought was our coffee. 
We were completely ignored and felt quite awkward to be honest. I have to say it was painful to watch how slow the coffee was made. The girl seemed like it was a first day and the lady seemed to not know we were waiting even though we were right in front of her. She was just messing around and singing. Anyway, 14 minutes later I asked if our coffee was coming as my wife had to be somewhere. I got a sarcastic reply and felt quite insulted. Then finally given my coffee. Looking at other reviews I guess we drew the short straw when it comes to staff as there are lots of happy customers but some very similar to our experience. A Real shame. I'll be checking who's serving if I go again... IF.

What a joy this little caf√© is. We had quiche, pulled beef sarnie (with wonderful gravy on the side, veggie toastie. All were just excellent and we will have the same again when we get beck to the cafe. I can't fault anything about our meals, the staff or location. Please just give it a go, it may seem pricy but all the produce is very local and believe me, it all tastes wonderful.
Lemon, lime and coconut cake is divine!!! Would have again!! Cream tea was okay‚Ä¶wouldn‚Äôt come again to have it. Not much space so you are on top of each other üòÖ

Review Title: Excellent cream tea in a friendly bakery
Review Text: I took my wife to Bourton-on-the-Water for a special birthday and had contacted the Narda, the owner of Bakery on the Water, in advance to discuss a booking for a cream tea.  She was very helpful and when we arrived gave us one of the best cream teas we have ever had (and we've had plenty!). She and her staff were very friendly and attentive and the atmosphere in the bakery on a rainy February Tuesday was bustling and cheerful. The bakery is located just off the High Street and right next to the River Windrush as it makes its picturesque way through the town.
Great coffee, excellent brunch all served by friendly staff. The location is ideal and sitting by the river in the summer is a real Cotswold experience.

Came here today for some sweet treats to take home . The queue was out the door but moved quickly . Lovely server who although was rushed off her feet , served with a smile and nothing too much trouble . I ordered a few different things which were packaged nicely in a box . 4 cakes came to nearly ¬£17 but they really were delicious . Thank you !

Review Title: Not worth the money or the wait
Review Text:
I grew up in Bourton when this was the wonderful Norths Bakery. I haven't been since then as the village tends to cater for tourists not locals these days. But my family still lives in the area so I thought I'd take a chance and call in this morning to grab breakfast for them. 

I ordered three bacon, sausage and egg baps and two Christmas toasties. Despite being the only person waiting (though people came and went with instant orders), I had to wait over twenty minutes for the toasties, which meant the baps were cold by the time I left. Coincidentally, the toasties were also cold as they had been sitting on the kitchen side from even before the baps and, despite someone checking what I was waiting on, only one lady thought to connect the dots and exclaimed "oh my god these have been sitting out for ages, I'm so sorry." An acknowledgement which was appreciated.

The cost was ¬£39 (just under ¬£8 per bap) which seems like daylight robbery for what we got, particularly as there wasn't even any egg in the baps.

Safe to say, I'll leave this place to the tourists.

Absolutely shocking! Popped in to pick up a few snacks to eat by the waterside in this beautiful little village. The shop was very busy so I took that as a good sign, I purchased 2 small pasties and 2 small sausage rolls and was completely stunned when I was told my total was ¬£18! 
¬£18! I asked the server whether I had been given the correct bill and was assured I had. ¬£5.80 for a pasty and ¬£3.20 for a small sausage roll! 
I paid but left feeling very shocked and a little violated. Not a pleasant experience and sadly only mediocre food. Such a shame as I walked past another cafe/bakery in the same village just afterwards with better looking food at a much more reasonable price. If only I‚Äôd seen that place first.

Review Title: Stop for coffee on a walk
Review Text: Nothing needed to make this a 5 other than the quick service and the latte being the best I have had. Croissants delicious too.

What on earth has happened to this lovely bakery /cafe??  Prices have exponentially increased at the same time quality has reduced.  I bought a ham salad bap to take away... It cost ¬£5.70...maybe a ¬£ dearer than last week.  I'd have taken it straight back only that I had driven 20 miles before opening.  I ditched it because the bread was hard and stale, the tomato obviously old, and the ham, which used to be so fresh, and cut off the bone, was wet, and mass produced.  Shocking!  You've lost a customer here.  Not returning.

Review Title: Nice place for drinks and cakes
Review Text:
Conveniently placed in the town - we sat on the outdoor rear patio until it rained and then we moved into the glass greenhouses.  We arrived just after 3pm when their lunch service had ended.  It was still busy so we just had drinks and cakes.  The cake selection was limited at the end of the day. 
 Service was fine

Absolutely fabulous place . Very popular. Great coffee, breakfast and fantastic cakes. We went everyday for either breakfast or coffee and cake. Plus came home with lots too. Their sourdough is lovey but make sure you get there early or order it the day before. Added bonus dogs allowed and greenhouse to sit in outside if raining !

Wonderful croissants, buns, breads. 

An absolutely adorable place to get your morning (or anytime) goodies. 

The staff was very friendly and the shop is very pretty.

My husband and I came into this bakery hoping to order a nice afternoon tea on my birthday. Nobody acknowledged us when we entered even though there were lots of staff around. We found a table and asked where to order and were told at the counter. My husband patiently waited to be served while not once being acknowledged by anyone. One lady was serving at the takeaway counter, he waited until she had finished serving every one else even someone that had come in after him. He then asked for two teas and the lady looked at him blankly and then looked around to see if anyone else was waiting. At that point we got up and walked out and we‚Äôre told we were in the wrong queue even though no one had told us where to go.

We had just arrived in Bourton and was looking for a sandwich etc for lunch and came across this place. Quite a queue, i went thro shop and found seating outside with a brolly as it was so hot. We had Artisan sandwich was very very nice,l lovely bread. Only downside was we ordered bottles of  orange which had not been in a fridge. great place and food

Gave order. While waiting a man went to complain about the poultry amount of cream with his cream tea. Staff said they‚Äôve never had a complaint about it before. The owner offered more cream which he accepted. When he was back at his table the staff started rolling their eyes , laughing and one of them held their little finger up and made a gesture with it. In the meantime we were still waiting for our coffee and scone and canned drink. I went to staff and said I wanted a refund as I was still waiting. She looked at receipt and said you‚Äôve only been waiting 9 minutes!
My order was only one coffee, one scone and a canned drink. This was hardly a big cooking job. 
They had a further complaint as I was leaving another customer wanted to know why he hadn‚Äôt had his order.
Excellent staff, service and helpful, huge range of fresh cakes bread etc but be there early as it can get busy, the wasps  love it to so be careful, highly recommend this bakery
Super popular bakery, and easy to see why. One of everything please! Great location and great food offering. Happy customers.

Husband popped in several times to get the almond croissants for breakfast during our weekly stay in Bourton-on-the-Water; said they were the best he ever tasted!!  We also sampled their traditional pasties  very tasty & several of the other cakes too.  Would highly recommend as a great place to pick up items to take out for picnics etc.

Whilst on a trip to Bourton on the Water we chose to visit a local cafe for a cream tea

Chose Bakery on the water 

Lovely staff but an average cream tea 

Scones were dry and slightly over their time
Only a small portion of clotted cream

Sadly just an average cream tea

Review Title: Visiting Burton on the water for a day!!
Review Text: Excellent customer service and good staff. Super location we enjoyed breakfast. We had different dishes but cheese pastry was absolutely delicious.

Review Title: Lovely bakery, fresh tasty products- well worth stopping at
Review Text:
Bought, pasties, scones and eccles cakes for a picnic by the river. Quite pricey but it is a tourist hotspot.
They were all fresh and so tasty. 
Well worth stopping at and sampling the great variety of baked products

Excellent stop for delicious pastries and coffee. We have stopped many times at this bakery. The pastries are delicious as are the Cornish pasties we purchased for our picnic lunch. It does get busy but it‚Äôs worth the wait.

Review Title: Not as good as previous visits
Review Text:
I was really looking forward to returning to this bakery as everything we have bought previously has been delicious.
On this occasion I was really disappointed.
The raspberry and custard turnovers were rock hard the croissants had been burnt on the edges and the pastry on the strawberry tarts was rock hard.
The pasties however were lovely.
Perhaps it was just a blip. It won‚Äôt put me off giving them another chance.

Review Title: Nice enough but expected a bit given the prices
Review Text: Two of us had coffees and between us a Bacon and egg bap and a quiche, both of which were ok but not outstanding, quiche was not fully warmed through.  We shared a sausage roll which was quite tasty.  It‚Äôs not cheap though and we felt it fell short of being worth it‚Äôs value, thought not unexpected in a tourist honeypot.

La miglior bakery di Bourton on the water o forse di tutte le Cotswolds.
Ottimo anche il caff√® e tutti i prodotti da forno che vengono sfornati ogni giorno

Review Title: Bakery on the Water is the best bakery in the World!
Review Text:
Having visited many bakeries, for me, Bakery on the Water is the best bakery in the world! Their bread is so fresh and tasty. 

As a local, I look forward to buying fresh bread from the Bakery on the Water and at the same time, I like to treat myself to coffee or tea and a snack inside the delightful relaxing cafe area of the Bakery.

The staff are always friendly and welcoming, it's always a real joy and pleasure visiting the Bakery on the Water.

We‚Äôve visited over five times now and every experience has been excellent. The breakfast baps, granola and pastries are all delicious. The breakfast baps are made fresh so there‚Äôs a bit of a wait, but it‚Äôs worth it!! We‚Äôve had the fruit turnover, croissant, pan au chocolat and all of them were scrumptious!

We Thursday 22nd June. Served by a young lady in glasses, she was extremely polite and also made our coffees for us. Two flat whites with beautiful swan patterns, the best coffee I have tasted since visiting the Cotswolds - bravo! We had scrambled egg on toast and a bacon croissant, it was delicious. All the staff were super friendly! If you‚Äôre looking for a cosy cafe with brilliant service, this is the place to be. However come early as it gets very busy! Could not recommend this place more..

Review Title: A good choice for replenishing the appetite here‚Ä¶
Review Text:
Situated very close to the Motor Museum and adjacent to the river, this cosy cafe has seating inside plus a small courtyard at the back. 
Lovely food and coffee. Always busy but plenty of staff and friendly service.
Take away service too and home made bread is delicious

Was really expecting an artisan bakery so expected a decent bread but their sourdough at ¬£3.80 for the small size was unlike any sourdough I have ever tasted! It would be best described as a feather light white loaf so maybe the girl had made a mistake! Another negative was that the assistant was also the cashier and before touching my bread she had been handling a lot of change so I did mention this was bad practice and she did go and quickly wash her hands and got a new loaf for me.
On a grey Monday there was a line.
We also had a Tomatoes basil soup at ¬£6.50 and a Cornish Pastie at ¬£5.80 both disappointing.
We were lucky and got a table by the water. Lovely setting. A lovely range of pastries and the coffee was really good.

Called in for tea and cake as we walked into Bourton from Naunton on Wardens Way. It was handily positioned off the main thoroughfare as we entered the village. Very happy we stopped ! Welcome cups of tea from lovely friendly staff and delicious cakes. I can recommend the pecan pie and the almond petal cake.

Review Title: Refreshing light lunch in Bourton on the Water.
Review Text: Lovely flavoured quiche with fresh salad. Hot sausage roll, slice of victoria sponge and a flat white....bloomin lovely thanks.

Review Title: Fabulous bakery best bread and cakes ever
Review Text: We came here every day on holiday superb breads and cakes and cafe really good location by bridge over the river by the museum , breads when purchased still warm would recommend strawberry tarts there the best,.

A hidden gem in the village 
The coffee is very good and the choices for breakfast is very varied

It is worth a visit and like us , we visited every day
The staff are friendly and I felt like a ‚Äúregular customer ‚Äú when on my third visit the girl knew exactly what coffee I wanted
Great place, staff lovely, food excellent, bought cakes to take home and the five of us rated them very highly. Strongly recommend.

Just love this bakery, everything is freshly baked and they have a really good selection.
How I wish we had one back home in Exeter.
I ordered a birthday cake for my husband, it was ordered over the phone so it was bought without seeing it.
He loved it, really lovely jam and cream filling and nicely decorated.
We will be back to sample more goodies in the summer.
This is an excellent bakery in the heart of Bourton on the Water.  They sell a wide range of sweet savory, and plain baked goods, all excellent.

Reviewer Name: Charlotte Beauvoisin Diary of a Muzungu
Review Text:
Very good. One of Bourton's best.
Staff are friendly and helpful. Just look at those cakes! üòã
Outdoor seating area at back of shop as well as inside.. ‚Ä¶

We visited several times to buy bread and/or cakes. The small granary was often sold out or missing quite early in the day. We also witnessed a customer complain that her usual bread was sold out - seems quite hit and miss.
The worst thing was the way the staff look at you and when you start to give your order they look away to start a conversation with colleagues. This happened twice to us, and on one occasion the server apologised realising how rude this had been. 
They really need to realise they exist because of customers and start treating them as such.

A lovely vibe in the bakery, nice and warm, delicious cakes and coffee, always a warm welcome, great outdoor space by the stream at the back and clean toilets. Highly recommend as a local resident. L perfect for lunch or coffees!

We called in here while staying in the hotel over the road and I would have to say the coffee was some of the best I have ever had.
The cakes however were somewhat disappointing with my wife‚Äôs Strawberry Tart seriously lacking custard filling and my Eclair ok but not earth shattering, given the quite high prices.
Thanks to Bakery on the water for helping us to organise a beautiful celebration cake for my mum's 60th. Absolutely delicious perfect for what we were after! Scones are also the best I've tasted!

Review Title: Visit for the view and scones!
Review Text: Visited in a Sunday afternoon and was seated without issue. They have upstairs seating, which provides a beautiful look of the water and passersby. They have homemade scones with clotted cream: simply delicious with English breakfast tea. We also had a panini, which came with a small side salad. It was average but served as a good snack (split between two). I‚Äôd visit again for tea and scones simply for the view upstairs.

We called in this cafe just down the road from the motor museum to warm up.
We ordered a pot of tea for 2 a bowl of soup and crusty bread and a Cornish pasty. 
It was very busy and hard to find a table. We managed to get a table in the back room however it had not been cleared We moved all the pots to one side of the table. The staff were very busy and it did take a while to get cleared. There were also pots on the side where you ordered. 
The food came and me and my husband shared both. The corniche pasty was very full and tasty abd the soup and bread were very nice (leek & potato). The drinks did take quite a while to come We was already half way though out food. 
Over all a nice cafe but a little cramped and  very busy.
Stopped by for a coffee and breakfast - lovely coffee and delicious pastries, especially the almond croissants.

Review Title: Lots of choice but burnt and expensive
Review Text: This is the cheapest place for a pasty but at ¬£4.50 for the cheapest one, it certainly is very expensive. Despite the prices, I was going to buy some breakfast items but walked back home due to everything being so burned.

What a delight to find a real bakery, you open the front door and the aroma of freshly baked breads and pastries fills the air.
Lovely choice, my favourites are the apricot and custard turnovers and the traditional pasties.
It is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.

This really is a little gem. What a brilliant addition to the village. Although no longer local and just call in when visiting family, this is a great new discovery. Wonderful selection of fresh sour dough bread, pastries and cakes. Also really good coffee. Call in and support this wonderful new venture.

Tuesday afternoon about 2.30 visited the bakery asked for two cream teas. that was a pot off tea for 2 and 4 scoones. 
the good bits - the scoones were good - the bad - the cream teas were bought over on a tray  consisting off 1 tea pot, 2 take away plastic cup, 4 scoones on 2 small paper plates, 2 very small thimbles off cream, and 2 very small thimbles off jam. I complained about the gups only to be told they had been very busy and had not caught up with the washing up. We drank our tea barley getting 1 cup each, we ate 1 scoon each and took the oter 2 home.
For this hounor we paid just over ¬£13 talk about a rip off.
Next time we are in the area we will NOT be visiting the Bakery on the Water

We really enjoyed our fruit scones with cream and jam which were served in a cute little box and had a disposable knife for us to use to prepare. We took them to eat by the river as the cafe was full and thought they were delicious. Staff were all lovely so will definitely be retuning in the future!

Review Title: Fab-u-lous and super fresh and tasty
Review Text: Had a really difficult time choosing what to have! It all looked scrumptious. Decided on quiche and coleslaw salad (amazing). Fruit tart (soooo good). Hubby had cream tea (yum). Lovely little courtyard out the back that looked on to a brook. Was the perfect sun trap. But for colder damper days they had a couple of old style greenhouses. Really enjoyable. Would defo recommend.
No meat in your tradional pastie!!! There was only potato in it at first I thought you had given me a cheese pastie but NO cheese either. It cost me ¬£4.50 and spoilt my Pastie and Beans for tea!!!

Got the order wrong simple cheesy chips and sausage.Went to ask where order was assistant sat.on floor eating got up and seen order was wrong.Went to fridge and got out part cooked sausage and hacked them in half proceeded to put on grill pressing them down with hands.Did not attempt to wash his hands before handling food or wearing gloves remembering he got up from the floor Wouldn't  eat there again needs to be inspected by the food hygiene department and staff trained properly l
Very good baked items, cakes, coffee, tea and snacks. A few small tables for sit in consumption, it gets crowded inside with line up on the outside, but worth it.
Absolutely great place to eat, super delicious and great members of staff, friendly and warm welcome to all

Fruit scones the Cornish way‚Ä¶jam then cream.  We just ordered take-away and found a bench along the water to enjoy the scones.  It is very relaxing watching the kids and dogs and adults romping on the green and splashing in the water.

What a cute little bakery! I found out about this bakery before visiting Bourton-on-the-Water and swore not to leave without trying something from here. Bought a fruit turnover and 2 almond petals which I enjoyed eating by the river. Everything was absolutely delicious! Friendly service too.
Our first food experience in Bourton did not disappoint! The service was good and the food was excellent.
Really lovely bakery with good food and coffee. Would recommend and visit again. Good selection of treats

We were traveling with 4 children who became experts on the bakeries in town and hands down! This one was the winner! From chocolate croissants to sausage rolls, they tried just about everything and loved it all!

I am here in the Cotswolds from Scotland for a week! I went to catch up with a good friend who is also staying here for lunch, she has always had so many good things to say about this place. It was very busy but the food was delicious. I then went back up to queue for another pot of tea and when I went to pay with ¬£5 cash, I was told they did not accept Scottish money as it may be counterfeit!!! I was totally humiliated, and if I was going to launder money I don‚Äôt think I would be doing it with a ¬£5! Absolutely disgusting way to treat people, I checked in other shops I went to today and they were more than happy to accept cash! So if you are Scottish and visiting with cash, avoid this place like the plague!

Review Title: Freshly Baked Goodies Fill The Air
Review Text:
What a lovely bakery this is when you open the door it smells just like it should with all the delicious goodies being baked on site.
Just love the raspberry and custard turnovers and so many different croissants. If you go early they are still warm.
Friendly staff as well.
Service tick. Price tick. Food quality tick. Return visit tick. Same experience as first visit tick. The only bad thing is we do not live near by...

This bakery would have achieved a 5 star review if solely based on the food but unfortunately greatly let down by the service.  
The good - we ordered several toasted sandwiches, cream tea, baguettes etc. and all were delicious.  Wish we had this as a takeway to avoid what was to come. The location was good, facilities clean and has more seating at the back.
The bad - service started out ok, staff were polite.  We had 4 children with us under the age of 5, including a 1 year old, who was throwing food on the floor around our table.  I understand this is frustrating but one of the servers then has the audacity to come over with a broom and dustpan and brush and ask us to clean it up as apparently they had lost several customers because of this mess.  This mess was literally under our table and not elsewhere in the cafe, which makes no sense as to why they would lose customers when there were plenty of tables in the back garden.  I cleaned it up but never have I been more insulted, especially after we bought over ¬£60 worth of food and drink.  
My advice, don't bother sitting here if you have young children or staff should put a notice that young children are not welcome.  Have a takeaway instead.

Review Title: Amazing bakery in a picturesque setting!
Review Text: The warm friendly staff serve up fantastic coffee, pastries and baked goods along with hot breakfast selections. It was the perfect way to start the day in this beautiful village along the waterway!

Ordered breakfast, tea, coffee and orange juice. Breakfast came fairly quick, but after 20 minutes I had to complain that we were still waiting for our beverages. They didn‚Äôt know anything about it until I showed them my receipt. 10 minutes later they brought the tea and orange juice, but not the coffee. Complained again and they brought a 2nd tea instead of coffee. Disaster. And not cheap.

The restaurant consistently has a waiting line of local people. The bacon & cheese croissant and mushroom croissant were "amazing". Coffee was also nice. I would recommend this for breakfast or quick lunch.

This place looked very popular and we queued for some time to be served. The food on offer looks great and to be fair it was very tasty. The issue came when I went back in to buy my son a cheese straw we forgot from the first order. I have emailed the bakery the below which explains the situation and sadly they have not responded. I only wanted confirmation that I was correctly charged ¬£4.20 for a cheese straw.

"We visited Bourton on Water last week and stopped by your bakery to pick up some lunch to enjoy sitting by the river. Firstly I would like to say we thoroughly enjoyed all the produce and it was very tasty. I forgot to order my son a cheese straw so I went back in to get one and at the same time thought I would have one myself as they are my favourite savoury snack. I asked for 2 and the girl said ¬£8.40, I said sorry I only want two she advised me there are ¬£4.20 each. She did apologise and remark how expensive they are.  In comparison to the sausage roll that I recall was ¬£2.20 and a loaf of bread for ¬£2 there seems little justification. As I had waited about 15 mins I purchased one for my son in the hope that at ¬£4.20 it would be the best cheese straw he had ever eaten. Sadly this was not the case and the .90p one he had from Penganis in Cornwall was far superior he told me. I was obviously devastated but managed to not let it affect the rest of my holiday.Since returning I have had time to reflect and I just want to confirm that the price was correct at ¬£4.20 because having researched this it just seems incredible. I have found that Cheddar Gorge Cheese company can send me a box for ¬£4.25 that won the great taste award in 2021."

Review Title: Excellent service and quality, if a bit pricy.
Review Text: Ate here twice, sausage baps the first time and pastries ( almond croissant and pain au raisin) the second time. Excellent quality but pastries seemed expensive at over ¬£3 each. But it wouldn‚Äôt stop me returning!

Review Title: Despite my high expectations I returned a verdict of just 'Average'.
Review Text: Visited Bouton-on-the-Water on Saturday and it was a warm day and thus very busy.  I had already read great things about the 'Bakery' and so we headed here for an early lunch (by early I mean 11:45am).  When we got inside there was not a great deal of choice (the only filled rolls were tuna and cucumber) and service was quite slow.  I had a slice of the Fresh Cream Victoria Sandwich and to be honest the cream tasted like it was on the turn and the cake seemed a tad dry and somewhat stale, (not light, moist and fluffy).  We had take-away and to be honest if we'd been eating in I would have returned it for a refund.  The coffee I had was good though.  So all in all I was sadly disappointed and I wouldn't visit again in a hurry, opting instead to try one of the many other cafe's in Bourton-on-the -Water next time.

excellent service, excellent sausage rolls if you get the chance pop in ...treat yourself
eat in or take away
good value

Lovely little bakery but was let down by lack of stock. We came in on 8/5/21 just after 12 and had 2 pasties with salad and 2 coffee's the pasties where lovely but coffee wasn't great and expensive for what you got. The lady behind the counter was lovely she did apologise to say we have ran out of a few things but sure with it being lunch time you would have items to sell other than pasties and sausage rolls. There was no quiche, no soup, no sandwich of the day and very little in the way of cake.

Review Title: Oh the smell of those freshly baked croissants!
Review Text:
It was the smell of fresh baking that drew me to this memorable little bakery. Light crispy and wickedly buttery; these were croissants to cherish and remember. Like in France.
The quiches looked delicious too but as it was quite early they were still under production. Their pastry cases looked good and thin and crisp. Can't wait to return and try more.
Thanks you lovely little bakery! Allez-y!

Visited daily when staying in Bourton.  Opens in time for breakfast.  All rolls, hot x buns, cream tartlets, pain au choc, etc. were excellent.  Baked daily on the premises. Best part of our stay in Bourton!

Tried twice to have coffee here but it was very busy. Third time lucky! Staff were friendly and chatty despite being busy and they were able to cater to different food intolerances and the differing age groups in our party. Some cakes were a little on the dry side but that could have been due to it being towards the end of the day. Their bread was very good! Would strongly recommend for a lovely friendly atmosphere, good food and great coffee.
What a superb local bakery. They totally support local producers. The hot cross buns were superb. I also tried the Frangipani tart, Almond croissant, and purchased local honey. Highly recommended

The aromas of fresh made food hit you as you enter. Very simply stated it's a little gem of a cafe right in the heart of the village. Excellent food and friendly and cheerful service. Great atmosphere to accompany delicious coffee and scones. Home made sausage rolls were very tasty.
Clare and Richard the baker are running a little treasure in this cafe.

Review Title: A must go to. Best in Bourton-on-the-water
Review Text: We found this on trip advisor before we came and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. Fabulous, fresh and really tasty food. Friendly staff. 5* all round

On a visit to Bourton-on-the-Water with family from America we wanted a light lunch before visiting Birdland and chose the Bakery on the Water
A little crowded but we managed to fine a table for four
Traditional Cornish pasty's followed by lovely home made cakes went down with our visitors
Excellent service by friendly staff

La colazione pi√π buona fatta nel Cotswolds e in tutta L Inghilterra! Posto adorabile, personale altrettanto, cibo dolce e salato squisito, caff√® sensazionale! Vorrei farci colazione tutti i giorni !

We had breakfast and had to sample a few things. The eclairs, bacon and cheese croissants, sausage roll, raspberry turnover were all terrific. We stayed at our table for over an hour and the place was always busy. Lots of locals and tourists. We‚Äôre coming back tomorrow!

I contacted Bakery On The Water to see if they would
be able to make a birthday cake while we were staying in the area, they were so helpful and accommodating on the phone and even better in person. 
The cake was both wonderful to look at and delicious to eat. 
I would happily have sat in the cafe savouring the delicious baked goods on offer and watching the world go by for some time. 
It‚Äôs popular and often seemed to have a line of customers out of the door on the weekend we visited, but the staff are quick and produce worth waiting for. 
If you are visiting I would highly recommend checking it out.

Absolutely fantastic coffee and the best Eccles cake I‚Äôve ever had. We took our goodies out to eat by the river but the service was incredibly friendly and welcoming, we‚Äôd definitely have gone back if we were staying in Bourton longer.

Soup amazing.
Sandwich amazing
Quiche awesome.
Coffee super smooth.
Brilliant bakery with wonderful customer service.

It seemed like a popular choice, as the queue of patient customers spilling outside indicated, on a chilly Saturday afternoon. The traditional Cornish pastry was delicious, lots of flavour, not too much crust. The dessert pastry, made up of flaky puff party, lightly crunchy with a sprinkle of baked sugar, and baked raspberries and just the right amount of custard, made this a perfect the snack in the Cotswolds. Highly recommended.

Wanted to escape the rain so popped in for a cuppa.  Just off the main street and good choice of pastries and cakes which looked delicious.  Only had drinks but good service.  Dog friendly, brought out towel and water bowl for customer with dog. Nice touch.

Arrived and stood at the counter waiting to get someone's attention which proved difficult. Eventually was able to ask if it was table service, a surly 'No' was uttered by the far too busy lady to serve customers behind the counter. Ordered 2 bacon rolls & 2 coffee's which was ¬£17! Coffee was poor & bacon rolls not fresh. Would not return.

Great find but thought we were out of luck as no seats left inside and too cold to sit out side, when we were offered to sit in a heated greenhouse out the back. We agreed and placed order for coffee and pastries which were brought out to us. The greenhouse was clean and warm enough room for 6 people. Very COVID safe. Pastry was very tasty as well as coffee. Staff very friendly and efficient. Highly recommend, view from back garden of the river and museum

We popped in for coffee and a scone. We waited outside as requested but not a sole came to assist us so we decided to seat ourselves at a table for two. The coffee was good as was the scone. The staff were friendly in fact they were the only people out of all the shops we went to that were friendly. The town is gorgeous but oh the folk are not at all welcoming.  Such a pity!
My partner and I both had a Victoria sponge slice and it was absolutely beautiful, we also tried the hot chocolates and they were delicious. Highly recommend.

7 of us visited this delightful cafe . We sat in the courtyard. The savoury treats were delicious and the coffee piping hot. Despite being extremely busy, the staff were calm, polite and friendly. Thank you. We would thoroughly recommend this bakery as a welcome sanctuary whilst exploring the Cotswolds.

We joined the queue behind a small group who were buying takeaway pasties. We saw an empty table waiting to be cleared and so went to sit down. The server came over to clear the table and without even saying hello proceeded to tell us this was not how they do things here, we must wait until we were allocated a table from the queue when we place our order. We left. This may be how you do things however there are polite, welcoming ways of conveying that message which would not make your customers feel uncomfortable and awkward. We won‚Äôt be returning.
Went early in the morning before the crowds started. Great selection and we liked out coffee, tea, scones, and croissant. We were able to grab a table out back which was the highlight!
Great choice. I think they overcooked the croissants the day we went but I'm sure that isn't normal. Will ho again tomorrow and check it out .

Picked up a couple of coffees, pasties and cakes for lunch to eat by the stream. The pasties were tasty but cold , much prefer them served warm. The cakes were delicious , our choice were fresh cream Victoria sponge and almond petal cake. 
The coffee was very good too . 
Quite expensive though , the above for take out was just shy of ¬£20 but do think anywhere in Cotswolds is dear. 
Lovely staff and clean toilet facilities on site for customers.
Had a waterside brunch on a lovely autumn morning. The all day queues should tell you how good this place is. Great price, quality & staff.

Lovely cafe, filled with charms.

Sat in the backyard, we changed table 3times due to the wasps. I see wasp catchers that are so close to the tables hence why so many wasps. Wasp catchers needs to be hung away  - preferably outside the courtyard boundary‚Ä¶. Makes sense to keep wasps away. 

No toilet sign to be seen so couldn‚Äôt use the loo. Thought it was up the steps but staff only. Couldn‚Äôt go back indoors - had ‚Äòno entry‚Äô sign. 

Best scones!

My wife, I and two friends originally wanted to sit out in the garden to have tea and cake, but after seeing the difference in price for eat in and take out we decided to order to take away and eat on the grass beside the river. The queue was not particularly long, but it took an inordinate amount of time for us to get to the front of it. This situation came about due to the very slow staff none of whom seemed to have any oomph about them - one of whom spent more time on her mobile than serving customers. We were actually going to give in and go somewhere else, but everywhere we passed had queues, but I'm guessing none were as slow as this establishment. Even when we got served it took quite a time to get our drinks, and even then one of them was incorrect. Not a place I would use again when visiting Bourton.
Very convenient to our holiday cottage. Very popular- hence the queue before opening time.. Lovely rolls! Shame not open on Mondays.

We arrived here after a two hour drive from Kent and queued to get in so we had high expectations, they were justified, what a lovely place, food was delicious and we sat outside by the little river at the back in the sunshine and it was wonderful.

So yummy pastries and cakes really enjoyed every bite‚Ä¶ could go on and on‚Ä¶ however try to get there before they close someone told us they‚Äôll put all food on special offer as they want to get rid of it! Now that‚Äôs a bargain üòÑ

We visited in August 2021. There was quite a large queue to order, which took around 20 minutes. Once we ordered, staff were friendly and polite. We sat in the outside garden, having ordered two cream teas. The scones were lovely, and we were given a good portion of clotted cream and jam. Unfortunately we were very quickly surrounded by a lot of wasps which, although there is not much the bakery can do about this, did spoil the experience. The gardens themselves are really pretty, situated near the Motor Museum. Would definitely return.

We visited this cafe quite early on a Thursday morning having eaten here before about 3 years ago and I remembered it as a really nice place. I have to say that this time, we were really disappointed with both the food and customer service. 

We were 4 adults and a baby in a buggy so we opted to sit outside to prevent causing an obstruction inside with the buggy. I was called back when I started to walk through to get a table and told in no uncertain terms that I had to order before sitting! I explained that I wanted to make sure there would be enough room and left my daughter to order. She was then asked what table number she was at‚Ä¶‚Ä¶!! I am puzzled to know how we could provide a table number if we have to order BEFORE getting a table??

Once we were finally seated, the food came quite quickly but the egg was overcooked and bacon greasy.

So reading the other reviews it look as though we were unlucky. I suppose everyone has a bad day but we won‚Äôt be back.

We visited this beautiful bakery, where the staff were so pleasant and helpful. We had cream tea. The scones were so so light and delicious.. we love our cream teas.. and must say this one was very high up in the list.My husband had a cappuccino and that came out nice and hot too. This place is a must for people visiting Bourton on the water. 
The manageress was so kind, just like her team. We sat outside. Beautiful location, delicious food.

We wished we lived closer to this amazing bakery. We  found it difficult to choose from the wonderful selection of cakes and treats on offer. We didnt  purchase any bread but the bread choice looked really good.

This is the perfect cafe offering good coffee and an excellent choice of both savoury snacks and cakes.
We enjoyed the Cappuccino and Flat White with delicious moist Victoria Sponge and a cheese scone . It was just ¬£13.

Review Title: Average late afternoon cream tea. Great location.
Review Text: Ordered cream tea. Late afternoon and scones were a bit dry. Tight on cream and jam offering. Was given a free loaf of bread which was nice. Great location next to the river. Nice staff.

Visited this Bakery a few years ago as Trip Advisor recommendation so went back on this visit to Bourton. Great little cafe, lovely staff. Decent cuppa, cups and saucers! Lovely eclairs,  as it was late in the afternoon offered a free loaf of bread. Gratefully received and having toasted this morning!
What a lovely old bakery.  Had to have a load of cakes and bread from this shop.  Clean.  The staff were quick and friendly.  Wonderful smell of bread when you walked in. I would buy from here again
I always need an apple turnover to help me on every mission, this place does the best ones. However, this is not your only option and you will have lots of treats to choose from.

Lovely little bakery. Had fresh coffee and pastries to take away and was still warm when returned to our air bnb. Despite restrictions lifted, staff continued to wear masks and enforce social distancing, which was reassuring.
We tried the fruit turnovers as part of our picnic by the river and they were delicious and well-priced!
WE ate here both mornings for breakfast and even had a cream tea here too. The staff were friendly and the food was lovely . Would recommend

If your coeliac than I would recommend looking at other options of tea room.  This place say it has gluten free options but all they had gluten free was chocolate brownie and that was very dry.  I would say call a few tea rooms  before heading down to see what selection of gluten free they have.
A bit disappointing because I was really looking forward to some scones and cream to celebrate my anniversary.

The outside courtyard is gorgeous with the water running past. The Petal cake and scones were 10/10! 

The goats cheese and cheddar cheese were incredible and served with really nice pesto. 

Would 100% recommend

Popped in to buy cakes for the journey home . as soon as i saw that they had Bread pudding in the window . i had to have some . I can only say this was/is the best bread pudding i have every had. better than my own mother made. moist. sweet . thick.
I went straight back un and brought more to take back as presents. wonderful and thank you . compliments to the cook

Stopped at Bakery on the water whilst I waited for the family visiting the motor museum. Great venue as seating outside in the garden there are a couple of glass houses and other seating.  Very relaxing, lovely cakes,  especially the frangipani tart. My son on another day had the bacon baps & coffee which he said was excellent too. We brought home one of the sourdough loafs which is delicious toasted. Definitely worth a visit, always a queue of people waiting but worth the wait.

I came here on Tuesday 22nd June at 10am. It was nice and quiet. (getting busy after 10.30am)...  Needed to do Track & Trace, ordered and paid at the tillI then waited at my table. I got a table in the lovely back garden with chillax atmosphere. Pretty cute decor. Great fresh orange juice, eclair and fruit tart. Hot Latte was ok. It was only 12¬£ for all. Reasonably priced. Excellent services tho.

I came for breakfast with my partner and puppy before heading home from our stay in Bourton-on-the-Water. We sat outside with a lovely view of the stream, the staff were very friendly and the food was amazing! One of the best bacon sandwiches I‚Äôve had. A little bit pricey but worth every penny!

We just wanted coffee and cakes and thought to give this bakery a try. We were asked if we will like to sit in back garden (which you can not see from shop front) , hesitantly I said YES. What a great choice it was üòÅ.Cakes were fresh  , coffee was great and river was amazing. So much I liked the setting that I ordered extra cake to spend more time by river and enjoy food .

We were actually recommended this place so went for breakfast. However, at 08:30 in the morning, ran out of salmon so couldn't have this and scrambled eggs. So opted for bacon and egg roll, extra bacon, bacon roll tea and cappuccino. But no Gluten free option. What we did get was reheated bacon, dry overcooked and a cold egg. All for the princely sum of just under ¬£20!! If we had taken the time to walk further on, we could have had a full English breakfast with tea between ¬£6.95 and ¬£8.95. Folks work it out, this was expensive in anyone's book. Defo a tourist trap can't comment on the breads sold as didn't purchase.

We stopped here for coffee and a snack based on the reviews I'd read on Tripadvisor and it exceeded my expectations. They'd made every effort to make the place Covid safe both in and outside. Most of all the Chelsea bun was by far the most delicious Chelsea bun I have ever eaten. My husband had a sausage roll which was warmed up for him and we sat in the courtyard garden at the back with the sound of the water rushing by. Try it, you won't be disappointed.
Very nice bread and cupcakes. Good staff. One way system kept the customers safe with minimal contact. Will defo visit again.

Such a lovely little place. Worth going to a bakery just for the absolutely delish scones.  All 6 of us had a cream tea and at ¬£6 each seemed quite reasonable. The staff even gave us a takeaway box to transport one of the cream teas away with us as unfortunately a party member was not feeling well.  He gobbled down the scones eagerly once we had left and he was feeling better! They also brought us water and there felt like no hurry to rush out whilst we lingered to allow time for our poorly family member to try and shake his migraine. 

We were sat in one of the back courtyard greenhouses which felt very cosy and kept off the odd spot of rain. Beautiful river rushing through next to some of the tables too and away from the crowds of Bourton for a little bit. Perfect.

Review Title: Lovely place and home made food.
Review Text:
Lovely place. Had a coffee and pasty ( so tasty) here, sat in the garden‚Äôs by the river.  Very friendly and lovely service. 
Pleasantly enough we couldn‚Äôt book here, we had to take a chance......pre-Covid days !! Much better in our opinion. 
All this booking spoils the spontaneous experiences but times are different
Couldn‚Äôt eat in other places as fully booked....2 days in advance. Shame but a sign of the times.
Had a lovely Victoria sponge and tea in the  little garden at the back by the river.  Really tasty, lots to pick from, nice friendly staff.
Delightful drink and cake. Service excellent. Nothing too much trouble. Definitely worth a visit. Very good value.
The quality of the produce from this bakery is always very good and the staff are very helpful and friendly.

A dark damp day for an essential family reunion BUT next to a rushing stream a furnished , ventilated and heated greenhouse where the pleasure of meeting again could grow. Great food and service by those who clearly cared for their human 'plants'. So many thanks!

Nice place. Nice coffee. Nice scones.
CANT USE THE TOILETS!

All the other cafes have their toilets open but not this place

Review Title: Delicious food, Great service and Individual warm greenhouse pods to eat in
Review Text:
Had some beautiful sausage rolls, cornish pasties and cakes today at The Bakery On The Water. Raining (as it often does in the Cotswolds!) and was offered a heated plastic greenhouse pod in the garden which was warm and fun. We had 2 dogs with us, so it was a blessing to sit and relax to enjoy the food. 
Exceptional experience to be repeated.
The sausage rolls were amazing! Definitely recommend. Beautiful little cafe.  Have proper procedures In place for COVID.

I bought some rolls, scones, raspberry and custard pastries  and a large sourdough bread.  All tased fantastic, su much better than any bread bought in a supermarket.  They also served cream teas inside their shop, but we did not try this.  Staff were helpful and polite and area felt very safe to shop in.

Review Title: Number one on tripadvisor for a reason!
Review Text: Two creams purchased,simply one of the best we‚Äôve had. And for the money we thought it was very fair considering the quality. Big choice of cakes as well, Highly recommend!
Aranyos p√©ks√©g j√≤ k√°v√©kkal √©s friss √©telekkel. √ârdemes beruh√°zni a kenyer√ºkre is. N√°lunk pont volt sor, de ez a jelenlegi szab√°lyok miatt.

Popped in for a cream tea to find the till operator with the most awful attitude. Terrible RBF, didn‚Äôt manage to smile at any customers, looked really put out at having to serve people and when I asked for Earl Grey tea she said unapologetically that I would have pay extra and she can‚Äôt switch the tea bags over!! 

Eventually after a while and with other customers chatting with us to express their shock at the shop wanting to charge us extra the guy at the back came over to apologise and rectify the situation. The food was tasty, shame smiles, polite attitude and conviviality were missing.

Popped in after a visit to the nearby Motoring Museum and grabbed some Eccles cakes - they were a little on the pricey side but excellent quality and delicious so I guess the old adage applies, you get what you pay for!
Visited here last weekend and you know by the queues outside that it is very popular . Really good choice of goodies on view. Food was really tasty .

First morning of our Cotswolds trip we visited  and had a lovely experience.  Breakfast is simple but tasty.  Second day we visited the staff made us feel as though we were a complete nuisance.  So we didn't go back thereafter.  Shame.

Soooo delicious!
Amazing range of baked goods & they were some of the best we‚Äôve tried. The staff were friendly, too!

On our first visit in Bourton on the water, we decided to grab some pastries from bakery on the water and enjoy a light lunch by the river. The sausage roll was delicious and the bread roll with cheese and chutney was so tasty. There is always a queue but its really worth to wait!
Excellent scones with cream which is light and fluffy. The quiche is so delicious.  Although the queue is long it is worth the wait.  Must go and have you lunch if you are visiting the area.

Visited for a late lunch on a glorious sunny day; we were initially worried that there would not be a lot of choice left given the time of day plus the large numbers of people visiting Bourton that day. However, we managed to grab a shaded table in the little garden and had plenty of options to choose from - I opted for the On Toast which that day had goats cheese, pesto and tomato on and was absolutely delicious. Everything seemed to be very fresh and the team were obviously working very hard, in the heat, to keep the food to such a high standard.
Will definitely visit again on our next trip to the Cotswolds.

Had some coffees and shared a few different cakes and pastries (all delicious - especially the frangipane tart!) in the beautiful patio here. Friendly and welcoming service with lots of covid measures in place to keep it a safe visit!

We stopped here for a snack and had so much to choose from!  We shared a sausage roll which was delicious and then had the cream tea.  The scones were so good, light and soft, they practically melted in the mouth.  There is good Covid controls in place, it was just annoying that not everyone was abiding by the rules.

Review Title: Worth the wait in the new
Review Text: Worth the wait in the new Covid world and the cost. Quality products freshly made don‚Äôt come cheap. After a week on holiday I am now addicted to their bacon croissants and Choux buns.

This bakery had a very long queue outside on the weekend so we didn‚Äôt get to try any of the delicious looking bread and cakes till during the week .
The bread and croissants were excellent.
We went back another day to get cakes , savoury pastries and choux buns filled with fresh cream +  topped with chocolate .
I‚Äôd like to get a chance to sit outside in the garden to have coffee ‚òïÔ∏è and cake

The cakes looked absolutely delicious from the window and they did not disappoint. we only bought a few things (sweet and savoury) to take away and eat and it is pricier than other bakeries but I think worth it based on the quality.

Great croissants and coffee.

While on holiday this little bakery has become part of our morning ritual.

We went for lunch at 1 ish and they had already run out of quiche.  Tables cleaned and Covid secure venue. Service good and food was tasty but definitely need a wider variety on the menu. Bread to buy looked delicious.  We sat inside as they said there were loads of wasps outside by the river. Inside is small - only 3 tables max 10 in total.

It's very beautiful village to have a walk with nice coffe , restaurant and icecream shops . Very less free parking available, it's good to take some change for parking fee ( ¬£5 all day) . It will get busier quickly during weekend . The disappointing thing was nobody was maintaing distance ( covid) .

I came with my mum, dad and little sister and we really enjoyed what we had. We had a take-out but that was fine. I had a Cornish pasty and it was delicious. Recommend to anyone in the area, thank you! üòäüëç

Lovely setting, with cute stream in the garden seated area. Strong COVID compliance. The compliments end there.

Staff knew there were 8 of us seated in the garden about to order cream teas. However, we wanted to wait for the last person to join us before ordering (she had to find a place to change her daughter‚Äôs nappy).

Upon her return we went to order - only to find out that there were only four scones left (at 4pm). No staff member could take the initiative to ask us to order as they were running low on stock, or keep some back for us. 

The cream teas that came were average, the tea in the pots was not very hot and the waitress was more agitated and interested in telling us to stop a 4-year-old eat some outside chips than in catering for the ¬£65 order we had placed for the adults seated.

Overall, deeply disappointing. Terrible service. Go elsewhere.
A sausage roll and a coffee in the sun. Perfect way to dodge the crowds by the river but still have the river babbling by! Cakes and pastry heaven.

Review Title: You're losing out if you don't visit here!
Review Text: Great setting and you can sit outside in the back which is right by the water. Its a ridiculous thing to say but Bakery on the Water serves the best scrambled eggs on toast and even just the plain toast is delicious - not your run of the mill average slice here! The scones are delicious but they are a bit pricey for the portion you get. The cakes are delicious, we loved the petal cake, which was a sizeable portion! We visited twice for a sit down and twice for takeaway! The staff are delightful and extremely polite and helpful.
Popped in while in the town for a snack had 3 sausage rolls which were nice and warm but a bit pricey suppose it's because of where it is
Called here while driving round the Cotswolds and sat outdoors at the back of the building. Excellent cheese and onion pasty and hot chocolate and good service. Would call again.

We stayed in a cottage just outside Bourton on the water and our host left us a welcome hamper mainly from this bakery. After one try of the scones we were hooked and out searching for more! The sourdough loaves are delicious and so were the pastry's we tried! But hands down the most delicious scones we've had!

The meanest ham salad bap for ¬£4.10 and an appalling warmed up bacon bap for ¬£3.90.
Greedy, greedy people !

So pleased we chose to have lunch here while visiting. We didn‚Äôt eat in as we wanted to go and sit by the water and enjoy being out in the sunshine but I must say the food was so fresh and so tasty. Really lovely place and served with a smile.

Truly a must when visiting Bourton in the Water. I purchased bread and eggs as well as flour to try baking some homemade bread. I was so excited to also purchase some fresh yeast!! Haven‚Äôt done so in years. They have a great array of sweet treats to accommodate your sweet-tooth wishes. A visit here should be top of your list. Definitely recommend a visit.
Everything we had was delicious - if we lived nearby I'd buy the sourdough bread there every day!  The coffee was great too.  All the cakes looked delicious.
Visited here on several occasions during a trip to Bourton. Popular place, great food, superb location, amazing staff.

Review Title: This is a ‚ÄòMust‚Äô visit to Bourton on the water
