Review Text: The staff were brilliant, cakes were Devine, the shop and public adhering brilliantly to social distancing .  Had coffee (great), cake selection (tasty concoctions) eaten by the water on a bench with family in the sun.  I love that shop and love the place

Just returned from picking up a fresh loaf.
The service was fast and friendly.
The pastries and breads on display all looked amazing.
Back home to enjoy an amazing bacon sandwich made from one of their large white bloomers
Pastries were quite dry. As they weren‚Äôt covered up stood at the counter waiting to be served for about five minutes well the young girls were just chatting away, on the upside nice clean place

We visited this beautiful local cafe with my girlfriend and we were surprised by the quality of coffee and desserts. 
Very polite and friendly service at a warm and relaxing atmosphere.

We popped in during a brief visit to the town and were glad we did - excellent coffee plus lovely cakes. Friendly staff, as were some locals we talked with - the fact that they make it a regular 'treat' says a lot. 
Happy to recommend, though I expect it will be mega busy during high season.
We were not able to stop or take away cakes and we were walking. Brought bread which was excellent and will go back when we have more time!
Some exceptionally nice breads and cakes on sale and a very pleasant cafe area. Rather pricey though.

Lovely little bakery with a wide variety of bread, cakes and coffees.
Service is good.
The bakery is very small if you want to sit down you may need to wait around although worth a visit.

Had couple of bacon baps. It was expensive for what we actually had. 
The reheated bacon tasted not great, the size of it was pretty small. I don't mind paying the price for the quality but it wasn't there.

Great food and coffee, super friendly service and a dog friendly area at the back of the caf√©. We stopped for coffee and a snack later afternoon on a Saturday, the cafe was busy when we arrived but a staff member quickly cleared a table for us in the dog friendly area.  They had finished serving lunch but there was still a good choice of cakes, pasties and sausage rolls at the counter.  My partner chose a Cornish Pasty which he said was delicious and we both had coffees which were excellent. We ordered at the counter and despite being busy we‚Äôre served quickly.  We were even given a free loaf of homemade bread to take away.  Would definitely come back.

Had planned to eat eslewhere but the Bakery looked very inviting so we decided to try it for lunch. A really lovely welcome from the staff made us feel at home and we were lucky to find the one empty table. Ordered at the counter and food and coffees came really quickly. The artisan sandwich was a meal in itself and my companion had a goats cheese concoction which was equally good. A very busy place with many people enjoying coffee and cake/scones. Would recommend if you want home prepare food at reasonabe prices in a very quaint Cotswold village.

Made me a raspberry and plum petal cake to take home for our new year meal .. it was delicious..guests were very complimentary about it .
Excellent valve and well packed for our drive home.
Popped in for tea, was absolutely delicious, would go back again and again. Large portions and friendly staff
Popular bakery , lucky to get a seat inside. Delicious quiche and salad, lovely warm scones just out of the oven, good selection of cakes and breads to take out too

This bakery was the highlight of our afternoon in Bourton-on-the-Water!! The tomato & basil soup served with bread was some of the best I‚Äôve ever had. The almond lace cake was also devine. My husband had bread & butter/jam and loved it. The hot cocoa was made with real cocoa powder (good if you prefer that, not as good if you don‚Äôt). Would absolutely recommend this bakery!!
Establishment similar to this are unfortunately becoming increasingly rare. Do drop in for a cup of chocolate on a winter Sunday afternoon

Review Title: Bread fresh as a daisy every day and cakes to die for.
Review Text: We bought fresh rolls every morning and they were the best. Eclairs to die for and we even took a couple of sour dough rye loaves home with us.  Very quick and very polite. Nothing was too much trouble and customer service and quality were first class.

Lovely and charming family run bakery with great selection of freshly baked goods. We had a buttery mince pie and a cream tea which came with two beautifully fluffy scones. The decor was elegant yet cosy.
simply amazing , you guys are doing everything right. i simply love it.will be visiting many more times:)
Always busy with locals and tourists. Convenient central location alongside stream with patio seating. Enjoyed the fresh baked breads and pastries.

Fabulous bakery a stone‚Äôs throw from our accommodation. Friendly staff provided info on the local delicacies. open from 8am for breakfast treats, cakes and sandwiches. The freshly baked Cotswold loaf was still nice and soft the next day. Will definitely pay another visit when next in the area!
Really nice baked items really friendly and helpful staff. Family run business and the love and passion shows.

We visited the pretty village of Bourton in late October and my wife and I were really hungry and wanted something savoury. We tried Bakery on the Water for a quick take away bite. We got what we wanted, a Cornish pasty each but it wasn't amazing. The service was quite average, the staff seemed to be going through the motions. An average place but we enjoyed the setting outside by the stream.
Super place with cosy atmosphere and good choice of bakes, cakes and light lunch options. We had soup which was delicious followed by a little bit of yummy cake üòã
My wife have been craving for good scones for a while and she really enjoy the scone  here.. They served really good scones! Recommended..

Popped in for tea and scones. This place was busy but I‚Äôm glad we waited for a seat - the home made scones were yummy!
Very family friendly too
Freshly baked and delicious. As good as a bakery gets. The sweet treats are fantastic as are the pies.

Review Title: Avoid if you have Scottish banknotes
Review Text: Visited here one very rainy Sunday morning. Thought it would be a nice place to have coffee and cakes. Tried to pay using a Scottish banknote but assistant told me they wouldn‚Äôt accept Scottish notes of any denomination. Luckily my husband had some English notes. The cakes were nice enough but we visited many establishments in Bourton-on-the-Water and many other towns and villages all over The Cotswolds and this was the only place that had a problem with Scottish money. I never went there again

Review Title: Very busy so much be good
Review Text: Everything is fresh and baked fresh. You can get a really nice cake from here would recommend üòçüòçüòç
Love everything about this bakery we stay in bourton every year for a week and one of the highlights is the bakery

We stayed for few days at a cottage 3 minutes walking away from this bakery. It was a pleasure every morning to walk up there and get the Best bread, pastries and sweets we have had una long time.
Everything we had was great. Go and have some bites of indulgence.... enjoy
Best bakery we have found in the UK

We popped in here for an afternoon tea and cake. The staff are so welcoming and attentive, giving us recommendations to see/visit around the local area. The quality of the food is amazing and was great to support a family run business.
Really enjoyed the choice of cakes and lovely coffee. It was really busy so we were lucky to get a seat, but the cakes are worth it

The scones we had with our cream tea were the best scones I have ever eaten...thank you!! The patio setting next to the river was a lovely place to sit and relax with a good friend...lovely experience

A beautiful family run bakery. When we visited there was a queue out of the door. The pastries were delicious and the coffee excellent! Due to the popularity be prepared to wait and maybe share a table with someone else (we did, it wasn't an issue).
A fantastic place to spend some time or to just buy bread and cakes.  Best bread I have ever eaten and the staff are super friendly.

We hebben een dikke week op een camping in de buurt gestaan. Eerste dag toevallig naar deze vreselijk leuke bakkerij geweest en daarna elke dag wel een reden gevonden om er weer heen te gaan. Heerlijke sandwiches, quiches en helemaal top zijn de scones met clopped cream and jam. Dat weten ze onderhand in China en Japan ook dus er zijn vaak rijen dik aan het wachten buiten. Ondanks de drukte soms blijft de bediening hartstikke aardig. Dikke pluim! Ga 's ochtends vroeg, als de toeristenbussen en merendeel van de toeristen er nog niet zijn om te genieten van het authentieke Bourton on the Water en deze fantastische bakkerij!
Sourced take away breakfast from the bakery on several days during our holiday. Excellent bread, pan au chocolat and croissants. Only downside is the queue out the door most mornings.

We were visiting with friends and after our drive decided on stopping here for a cream tea before a walk along the river. Everything in the bakery looked lovely. We ordered 4 cream teas and asked to change one tea to coffee and was told in a very ‚Äúfed up‚Äù tone the coffee would cost more. That was the start of what I would call very poor service. The only pleasant member of staff was the girl that bought out our food. My friend went in to ask for some butter, was told he would have to pay for it and as he agreed the girl just ignored him and walked off. I know they were busy but that was no excuse for their poor service. I will add the scones were lovely and fresh.

Entramos por recomendaci√≥n de una pareja de locales. Se puede desayunar ah√≠, tomar un caf√© o bien comprar algo rico para llevar a algunas de las tantas caminatas que se pueden hacer. Excelente calidad de todo lo que se vende all√≠.
We just dropped in to the bakery on the morning we were leaving Bourton on the Water to get some bread to take home... Lovely staff and wonderful bread which we couldn't stop slicing and toasting.

Review Title: Breads, cakes and pies oh my.
Review Text: A nice family run bakery that has everything you need to serve with a meal or as a dessert. Conveniently located near the river Windrush.
We found this place on morning number 1 and went every morning after for coffee and pain au chocolate and croissant lovely and fresh every morning

Looked at review but wasn‚Äôt as good as people say. Got an almond croissant one of my favourite things hardly any almond paste and tasted rather stale üòûwhat a let down. Over priced for the quality. Won‚Äôt go back .

The cream teas are lovely, delicious light and airy scones.
Tiptree jam and cream.shame about the wasps but the food was delicious

My hotel room window looked directly across from this bakery, and it was busy from the time they opened each day.  We ate there two mornings and would eat there way too often if we lived in Bourton!  Both savory and sweet items are top notch.  And the staff is cheerful, quick and helpful.  The perfect place for a nice breakfast and chat with others.

The bakery is tucked away just off the main street and is worth hunting for.  We had to queue outside although it was lunch time!

The cheese and onion pasty and sausage roll, warmed for us to take away, were very tasty.  We wanted a ham salad sandwich but they were too busy to make one for us so just had one from the pre made ones available.  It was lovely and the bread delicious.

The eclair was so light and the chocolate topping really tasty.

There is seating both inside and outside on site, which again was very busy.  Seating outside next to the river is also available and several families were having a picnic on the river bank, complete with rug and picnic basket!  The bakery would be an ideal place from which to buy the picnic.

Staff were friendly and helpful.  Prices what one would expect.

Gluten free food is also available. 

Would definitely recommend and call again.
A lovely little bakery by the river. We enjoyed a nice lunch of soup and fresh bread roll. Great location.

ÂèØÊÑõ„Çâ„Åó„ÅÑ„Éë„É≥Â±ã„Åï„Çì„ÄÅ„Ç§„Éº„Éà„Ç§„É≥„Åã„ÉÜ„Ç§„ÇØ„Ç¢„Ç¶„Éà„ÅãÊ≥®ÊñáÊôÇ„Å´ËÅû„Åã„Çå„ÄÅ„Ç§„Éº„Éà„Ç§„É≥„Å®Á≠î„Åà„Çã„Å®„Çµ„É©„ÉÄ„Å™„Å©„ÇÇ„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„Åè„Çã„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇË¶≥ÂÖâÂÆ¢„Å´ÊÖ£„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅÆ„Åã„ÄÅÊãô„ÅÑËã±Ë™û„Åß„ÇÇÊ•Ω„Å´Ê≥®Êñá&‰ºöË®à„Åæ„ÅßÁµÇ„Çè„Çä„ÄÇÂë≥„ÅØÂÖ®„Å¶good!!„Åè„Å©„Åè„Å™„Åè„ÄÅÁîüÂú∞„ÅÆÈ£üÊÑü„ÇÇËâØ„ÅèÊ∫ÄË∂≥„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

Review Title: Lovely place for afternoon tea or coffee
Review Text:
We came here after lunch for some much-needed coffee. A latte, Americano, and flat white were ordered. All were enjoyed. Because we had just eaten lunch elsewhere, we didn't take part in any of the baked goods, but the smells alone were delicious enough! I think it had to be the Cornish pasties they were baking that smelled so delicious. Wish I wasn't so full to have tried one. 

If you are one to prefer the outdoor seating, be wary of their wonderful little wasp forecast, noted both at the till and on the menu board. The day we visited was "severe to lethal" so we happily stayed inside.

The coffee and the cake were not super good. 
They don't take Scottish notes. Is it normal/legal ? 
The staff is polite but ... I did not like the atmosphere, too chaotic .

Went in  to order  3 sausage baps, 3 Lardy  cakes and 3 coffees sat on table 11 that was  outside the rear of cafe , loads of wasps but that is not there fault. Coffees where nice and the lardy cake but how they can get away with serving a bap with 2 very thin sausages cut in half I don‚Äôt know, the sausages were the width of a mans little finger , I know you pay more in these places but the profit margin they must make on a sausage bap is extreme, please use some nice thick sausages at least, not take the micky

We had a lovely cream tea here and a sausage roll. Best scone we had in Bourton (and we tried a lot!). It was pricey but not extortionate compared to others in the village. Lots of wasps outside though that's not the bakeries fault!

Excellent place to have your breakfast when you are at Bourton on the Water. They serve all type of breakfast, cakes, cornish pastries and hot drinks. All served with an excellent service. We also bought some bread and it was delicious.

Review Title: Great bakery and fantastic cream tea
Review Text: Stopped in here at the height of the tourist season. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Cornish pasties were really good and the cream teas were delicious - the best that we tasted while on holiday. Only very minor point would be that with 2 full size scones with every cream tea, you need more jam and cream. Thought it was very reasonably priced for what we had and I felt it was value for money. I would definitely recommend going in. The place had a really good feel to it and seemed very clean.
We stopped in for coffee, hot chocolate, and pastries.  All were excellent! Since it was the end of the day, they kindly gifted us a loaf of bread which we thoroughly enjoyed!
Not great. Really expensive for what it is and food was just ok.Tourist trap and service was a bit tired.

We were instantly attracted to this cafe for its delicious smell of baked goods and artisan style indoor eating. The food was lovely: from the sausage rolls, sandwiches and soup to the freshly baked scones with clotted cream and jam. And all for a reasonable price! The only downside to this place is the wait for tables - there is no organised control or management of tables. We waited approx 30 mins for a table for 5 as this cafe only sits about 25 people. We had to stay standing near the counter and it was very crowded. A better reservation list would work well. We were also really swarmed with wasps! So beware.
Best place in Bourton for fresh rolls and sandwiches on great bread. You may have to wait but it's worth it.
wir haben es sehr genossen. sympathische  bewirtschaftung, guten capoucino und feine geb√§cke. w√ºrden wieder gehen
The food was nice but very expensive. The bakery was full of wasps and even though they had fly curtains up, they did not seem worried about the amount of wasps near the food.

visited for breakfast in july 2019.ordered a bacon roll scrambled egg on toast and tea and coffee.Bill was just short of ¬£16.Very small bacon roll.Only i slice of toast with very bland tasting egg.Possibly powdered.All in all very poor value ad tiny portions more suited to small children rather tha adults.

This is a mixed review hence the average rating. In reality, Lunch / Service should be rated 2 and Bakery products 5.

Didn‚Äôt eat lunch as the sandwich options were limited and not to our liking.
They also had a lot of wasps in the garden and it was too hot to eat inside.

They were turning away visitors requesting cream tea, as they had no scones - yet there were scones on display in the window #confused!

Did return, later, for a takeaway blueberry sponge cake and a white loaf which were delicious.

Travelling in tourist land Cotswolds can be a tricky business!   If you're looking for class in this potential tourist trap,  try the Bakery on the Water!   Really delicious food and a vibrant atmosphere of hardworking committed pleasant staff.
Enjoy!

Review Title: Lovely garden away from the hustle and bustle
Review Text: The best thing about this cafe is the river side garden hidden behind the cafe dancing a little river. Great place for lunch and coffee.

Popped in for a cappuccino and sat in the garden out the back. Lovely garden with loads of flowers and nice view of the stream tucked away from the crowds. Cappuccino was really good and service was great too - would definitely return and try their cakes.
Stopped for coffee and a cake! Lovely coffee and the cakes were great quality. Small seating area at the back by the stream. Ideal for a coffee break

This was a return visit following our visit here last year; sadly on this occasion we felt let down. We ordered a delicious pasty & decided to pay quite a bit more for the addition of salad; i was astounded to see that it was just a little bit of salad garnish. And the young lady who served was very rude - from taking the order through to eventually getting it to our table (there seemed to be confusion of what we had ordered & we were even accused of changing tables). And the extra plate we were told would arrive ‚Äúin a moment‚Äù had to be collected by myself resulting a scowl by the same young lady who found a wet plate & dried it on her food stained apron. Cannot fault the food - delicious.

Stopped here for a pasty. ¬£3.80 for a cheese and onion pasty - not the worst price. After being asked if we were eating in or taking away, we said eating in. The price was now ¬£6.20. For a pasty???? I realise there‚Äôs a 20% hot food tax, but this is daylight robbery. The pasty was good hence the 2 rather than 1 stars, but still, not worth the money. Disappointing.

Great little bakery. Bread and cakes are top notch. Bakery is located centrally and close to the High Street.
Loved it.

Stopped by a few times in the week we stayed in Bourton. Dog friendly outside. Great selection of savoury and sweet pastries. Good coffee. Friendly staff, great location especially in the rear garden next to the river. Highly recommended.
I always love visiting here. Bacon sandwiches, scrambled eggs, bread, pastries and cakes are all fantastic here.
Cute little bakery . We all enjoyed the Lardie Cake as none of us had ever had it before.  Delicious!!  Try to get a seat outside.  A bit cramped inside. No complaints with the food or the service.
Good service, good choice, tasty food, good location and with a small garden next to the water. Reasonable prices. Recommended for breakfast and a lunch stop.
Giant scones, to-die-for flaky, and a lovely back patio next to the river. All the other pastries and bread looked equally delicious.

The best cream tea ever! Tea was smooth, scones were freshly baked and served warm, and when I put clotted cream and jam, it was so good, it made my day.
My husband and friends had soup, beef sandwich and quiche with salad. They are delicious as well. The cafe is small (but looks spacious) and cozy. Service is great. They also sell honey, scones flour, bread and cake flours, too bad all will be adding weight on my luggage, so I did not buy them.

English bakeries don't get any better than this. Its not just the quality of the food but also of the staff and the care of generations of bakers, Clare, leavened with a converted farmer, Graham, turned enthusiastic baker.

Warm like their scones, friendly like their staff and helpful with recommendations of places to eat dinner, Clare and Graham are the real thing, genuine nice people.

And if you want to add to the fun, ask the staff which you should put first on your scones, the jam or the clotted cream.  "Jam, no cream.  Cream, no jam," say different members of the staff.

"We nearly had a fight at a table here a few days ago as the debate  raged over the  jam or cream question," Graham told me, with a big smile. 
Must be nice to know your customers are as passionate about baking as you are. 

If you are within 50 miles of the place, it is worth a detour!
Wonderful bakery in great surroundings. Not cheap but quality products. Eat in or takeaway. Just grab something and sit in the beautiful surroundings.
Great bakery with a nice courtyard out the back. All of the cakes look amazing and the coffee is really good.
Beautiful cakes. Fresh bread. Great choice of product. Lovely staff.  Eating in is also a treat toasted soft white bun with delicious bacon has to be a favourite. Well worth a visit.

Decided to takeaway scones and compare with the Cornish shop. 
Didn‚Äôt tell my husband which was which but we both agreed that these were the best.
Cakes are lovely and I have come to the conclusion that I need to keep away as I don‚Äôt have the willpower for this bakery.

I just spent nine days in Bourton on the Water and the Bakery on the Water quickly became one of my favorite spots. I was lucky enough to have one day without rain during my stay and enjoyed the garden seating. Very lovely and secluded out back with the water running by. The indoor seating is cozy and comfortable as well and the bakery selections were delicious. Everything that I ate became my favorite.

Had a delicious baked treat and coffee at the Bakery on the Water. Beautiful spot, as the name suggests, on the water. There is a little bubbling stream out back next to the patio. You order at the counter, they give you a wooden spoon with a number on it, and you stick the spoon in a little hole in the center of the table so they know where to bring you your goodies. Everything was delicious! Quite busy when we arrived but we were able to find a table in the front area. There is also a little back seating area (not quite as charming), and we discovered upon leaving, much to our chagrin, that there is a beautiful patio out back. Great place.

Our first stop in the Cotswolds and Bourton on the Water. In search of good, strong American drip coffee. Didn't find that and pour over coffee just isn't the same. The coffee was good though it could have been hotter. They looked at me strangely when I asked for cream instead of milk. One of the employees went in search of cream which took a few minutes and I thought this a bit strange given it is a bakery making all sorts of delicious treats. Sadly, we didn't avail ourselves of any of their lovely, yummy looking pastries but all looked delicious. A charming place with a very clean washroom and a lovely setting by the water.

What a lovely place. We got some cakes from here to take home as we had all been in the Cornish bakery earlier. Eccles cake was superb and the iced finger was given a 10. I had a banana cake with walnuts. I thought I'd gone to heaven when I ate it. Don't go if your on a diet but worth taking a day off to enjoy all on offer.

Truly gorgeous pastries and artisan breads....plus a sweet back patio for enjoying coffee, tea and whatever deliciousness is on offer. Incredible staff. A Must see for visitors to Bourton on the Water.

We sat outside in the tea garden at the back of the bakery. It was a lovely spot to enjoy our tea and cakes - beside the Windrush river. All of the cakes and bakery items looked delicious and the staff were lovely.
Lovely scones good coffee and bread excellent come here every year when on holiday for the bread sour dough and country loaf

As a bakery, this place looks and smells fantastic. If I lived closer I have no doubt I'd pick up fresh loaves from here all the time!
The cream teas though......really average, geared towards the hoards of tourists that I presume they don't think would know the difference.  Especially disappointing The scones were stone cold and doughy, the clotted cream did not seem at all fresh, and the jam came in the single portion mini jars. For the heart of the north Cotswolds, you'd hope they would take a bit more pride in making the cream teas as good as the fresh loaves looked.

Review Title: Love the lardy cakes and the fruit boats YUM YUM YUM
Review Text: Fourth generation committed bakers and it shows. Wonderful flour and quality ingredients make for delicious loaves, fresh tasty rolls and cakes that make my mouth water. Always a queue and it's worth the wait. You will be back again and again

Review Title: Two visits for the delicious cakes!
Review Text: We visited Bakery on the Water due to the good reviews  and were not disappointed.  We were lucky as on both visits we got to sit in the garden area to enjoy our rather large cakes;  this is certainly worth a visit!

This was our first stop each morning. Delicious bake goods. Wonderful stone meal and white breads, French patisserie Eclairs, fruit tarts, croissants, scones and other British favorites. Eat in options were scrumptious. Friendly staff. At times a line out the door- that tells it all!

Just got a seat at the back near the river. Soup hot and warming. Also scones gorgeous. Some plates left out but staff looked rushed off feet

Everything is homemade in this bakery and you can taste it! The scones are absolutely amazing and croissant and pain au chocolat are the best ones I've had in the UK so far! Lovely and efficient staff.

„ÄÄ„ÉÑ„Ç¢„Éº„Åß„Éú„Éº„Éà„É≥„Éª„Ç™„É≥„Ç∂„ÄÄ„Ç¶„Ç©„Éº„Çø„Éº„ÅßÊòºÈ£ü„Çí„Å®„Çã„Åì„Å®„Å´„Å™„Å£„Åü„ÄÇ„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ„Åï„Çì„Åã„Çâ„ÅØ„Åì„Åì„ÅÆ„É¨„Çπ„Éà„É©„É≥„ÇÑÂ∫ó„ÅÆË™¨Êòé„ÅÆ„Å§„ÅÑ„Åü„Éû„ÉÉ„Éó„Çí„ÇÇ„Çâ„Å£„Åü„Åå„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆ‰∏≠„Å´‰πó„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„ÄÇÊúÄÂàù„ÅØ„Éë„Éñ„Å´ÂÖ•„Çç„ÅÜ„Å®ÊÄù„Å£„Åü„Åå„ÄÅ„Å°„Çá„Å£„Å®ÊñôÁêÜ„Å´Áôñ„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åù„ÅÜ„Å™„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÁÑ°Èõ£„Åù„ÅÜ„Å™„Åì„Åì„Å´ÂÖ•„Å£„Åü„ÄÇÊ≥®Êñá„Çí„Ç´„Ç¶„É≥„Çø„Éº„Åß„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„ÅäÈáë„ÇíÊâï„ÅÑ„ÄÅ„ÉÜ„Éº„Éñ„É´„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶ÂæÖ„Å§ÂΩ¢Âºè„ÄÇÂ∞èÁîü„ÅØ„Çπ„Éº„Éó„Å®„Éë„É≥„ÅÆ„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„ÄÅÂ¶ª„ÅØ„Ç≠„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„Å®„Çµ„É©„ÉÄ„ÅÆ„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„ÇíÊ≥®Êñá„ÄÇ„Åù„Çå„Å™„Çä„Å´„Åä„ÅÑ„Åó„Åã„Å£„Åü„Åó„ÄÅÁôñ„ÇÇ„Å™„Åè„Å¶ÂÆâÂøÉ„Åó„Å¶È£ü„Åπ„Çâ„Çå„Åü„ÄÇ
Cheese, ham, tomato and chutney sandwich was very nice. Price was the norm for BotW but on the high end for other less tourist places.

Freshly made bread cakes sandwiches quiche and soup. Slice of Quiche, a cheese roll and soup cost over ¬£12, but very tasty.
You may have to queue.
Had a cream tea which had two scones the scones were large and fresh and very nice service, this time was very quick and the staff friendly.

Two scones, jam, cream and drink choice.  Very nice.  Scones maybe a little undercooked - bit doughy in the middle.  Lovely garden out the back by the river - you can't tell its there from the front!  V clean place, plenty of seating.

ÁèæÂú∞„ÉÑ„Ç¢„Éº„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ„ÅÆ„Åä„Åô„Åô„ÇÅ„ÅÆ„Éë„É≥Â±ã„Åß„Åô„ÄÇË°å„Å£„Åü„Å®„Åç„ÅØ5-6‰∫∫„Åè„Çâ„ÅÑ‰∏¶„Çì„Åß„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÊ≥®Êñá„Åó„ÅüÊôÇ„ÄÅCornish pie„Åå„Å™„Åè„ÄÅ20ÂàÜËøë„ÅèÂæÖ„Å°„Åæ„Åó„Åü„Åå„ÄÅ‰ªä„Åæ„ÅßÈ£ü„Åπ„Åü‰∏≠„Åß‰∏ÄÁï™ÁæéÂë≥„Åó„Åã„Å£„Åü„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç§„ÉÅ„Ç¥„ÅÆpastry„ÇÇ„Åä„ÅÑ„Åó„Åã„Å£„Åü„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

Been visiting this shop for years, great cakes, believe everything made on premises, staff cheerful and polite even when busy.
Lovely little spot, very friendly staff. Offer milk alternatives, really good coffee. Cakes all look fresh and delicious. Would go back for lunch.

Great little find in this beautiful place. It was quite difficult to find a space, but people were really kind and moved up so that my wife and I could sit down.

Food and drink were reasonably priced and service was good.

We were drawn to this little cafe primarily for its lovely riverside garden but were blown away by the quality of the cream teas we had. Absolutely without a doubt the best scones I‚Äôve ever eaten. So light and fluffy. Highly recommended!
Popped in for coffee before heading into Motor Museum.  Great selection of bakery goods and smells delicious when you walk in.

Review Title: Best sausage rolls in the UK
Review Text: Oh my giddy aunt. I was thinking cheap sausage roll... will be tasteless...wrong. These were amazing. I really don‚Äôt like sausage rolls BUT this place has completely converted me. Their Victoria sandwich cake is to die for . Real strawberries and raspberries , just delicious!

Excellent coffee.  Beautiful cakes.  Very clean..attentive staff.reasonably priced. 
see.....  that's how it should be done. Quite a simple concept really..
Knightsbridge pub..take note.

We were drawn by the aroma of the freshly baked Pasties and we all had one. Delicious and served with a green leaves with a fab dressing. The lady who served us was very pleasant and had a smile for everybody. We will return!

On a recent visit to Bourton on the Water we discovered this family bakery. We enjoyed a perfect pot of tea here and the best hot cross bun ever! Lots of choice. It was just how bakery shops used to be in the past rather than the limited choice we get in a supermarket bakery. We also purchased a huge loaf of bread to take home as a reminder  of our visit again they had a great selection of bread all at very competitive prices. Well done.
Called in for a bacon bap and a cup of tea. Not cheap but amazing bread. There was constant footfall for bread and cakes that shows how good this place is.

Review Title: The best hot cross buns ever
Review Text: My husband and daughter declared the toasted freshly-made hot cross buns the best ever. The baking here is homely and lovely, the staff are friendly and the coffee was excellent. And we have high standards when it comes to coffee. No wonder it‚Äôs a busy place.
This bakery is extremely busy most of the day & open on a Sunday  treacle tarts &. Chocolate eclairs are lush!
Great spot to stop for tea of lunch as you take in the sights of the town.  Family owned artisinal bakery.

Horrid, rainy day in Bourton but a warm welcome at Bakery on the water. A fantastic selection of yummy cakes (didn‚Äôt have room for any sadly!) had soup of the day with crusty bread - delicious. Friends had the artisan sandwich which looked delicious.

Enjoyed a lovely lunch here today,sitting outside in the sunshine.
Ordered chicken sandwiches and cream tea, both was very good and freash but would have preferred it if sandwiches were bought out before the scones and cream as it was so warm had to eat the scones first 
Also had to go back in and as for serviettes and a knife
But still enjoyed it

A sunny day in February brought us to this really good little bakery with a cafe. We enjoyed delicious vegetable dhal soup with freshly made bread. We were lucky to get the last table for two in the back room. When the weather is good there is an outside area at the front where customers can eat. A good experience would recommend

Went for a breakfast with my family based on the TripAdvisor ratings.
Positives - Free parking close by. Clean premises. Freshly baked everything. Quick service. 
Negatives - Cramped. uncomfortable chairs. Mediocre customer service. Very chatty to the locals but not the tourists. Very expensive. 
What we had was nice, 2 sausage baps, 2 bacons baps, 2 lattes, 2 kids apple juice but for ¬£27.40, that‚Äôs half my weekly food shop! There are plenty of other eateries nearby that I‚Äôm sure would be better value.
Had a lovely experience here, only popped in for coffee but the food looked so nice we ended up eating. Would definitely go back
We had a sausage bap each this morning. The bread was so fresh and the two were a great size. Great value!!
This bustling little bakery in Bourton was a culinary highlight in our trip to the Cotswolds. Please, don't overthink it and just order the raspberry cheesecake. Best cheesecake of 2019 (so far) :)
Bakery with cafe.  Friendly warm welcome, despite being busy.  Lovely array of breads and cakes, plus tasty meal to order.
The fresh bread smell hits you when you walk through the door,Coffee tea and toast lovely .Well worth a visit.

While visiting the Cotswold town we had a coffee here, it is a lovely establishment with a large selection of teas and coffee's plus lots of cakes and snacks to eat all freshly made here, two lovely staff that made us feel very welcome, well woth a visit and drink.
Stopped off for a bit of lunch, ended up having soup, cream tea and 2 drinks each, truly delightful little spot with great atmosphere and delicious bread, even bought a loaf home.
We had everything on the "* of the day" and I must admit I can't wait to go back again. The bread is indeed a class on its own

Review Title: Delicious friendly Bakery at Bourton on the Water
Review Text: We loved this family owned bakery at Bourton on the Water. Such a friendly place to go for delicious baked goods, in such a delightful position.

Review Title: My Wife and I came across this Lovely Bakery on the Water
Review Text: My Wife and I came across this Lovely Bakery on the Water whilst walking slightly away from the really touristy part of Bourton on the Water. This bakery is a certain gem. We stopped here for coffee on a busy December afternoon. They bake everything and the service is wonderful. What a treasure the quality of their produce and the lovely staff make it well worth a visit. We were staying close by so decided to take away a sausage roll (Best we have tasted for years) and a slice of Victoria sponge with fresh cream were both to die for.
Just the most perfect loaf and friendly service.Wonderful cakes and afternoon tea.Stunning location.
Great visit top quality food and service, a must visit if in Bourton. A little gem hidden away. Retail side also very good with plenty of choices.

Visit Bourton few times ,1st tried here base on some good review . Good location ,friendly services , homemade feel bakery . Windy and cold so no sit on the back garden riverside. Tasty of meals no bad . A place for short rest chatting with family . Approx ¬£5 person with piece of bread & cup of tea/coffee ,tourists area . Reasonable price .
Fresh hot cornish pasties were lovely. Really tasty and you could tell the food quality was good. We also bought some cakes and likwise they were very scrummy. Well recommended for eating!

Nice location and good coffee. Picked a great day with the sun shining on us so sat outside enjoying the view.
I‚Äôve visited the bakery a number of times and have never been disappointed with the quiches or cakes I‚Äôve tried.
Not much to say but the bakery smelled amazing and the goods looked excellent we purchased Bread and a selection of goods. Good service .friendly and would recommend and quality product, delicious.
We stopped here for lunch. We had tomato soup with some delicious bread and butter! This was a perfect place to visit for a bite to eat. Service was good; staff were friendly.

I bought the cheese and broccoli pasty. Coming from Cornwall my expectations was low and it was even worse tasting. Could not finish it even though it was small, was more of a croissant than a pasty. Very dissapointed.

Sweet little bakery. I was pleased to discover they had some vegan options - I enjoyed their vegan sausage roll, very delicious. My feedback would be that I would love to see them expand on their vegan range, to make the bakery a more kind and conscious choice for consumers ~ reducing their contribution to animal suffering and lowering their carbon footprint.

Review Title: Small sample size, but I don't get it
Review Text: After reading all the good reviews, we had to give this place a try.  I got a sausage roll and my wife got a bean roll.  I know this is a small sample size, but neither of these rolls was anything to write home about.  My sausage roll was taste less, kind of like some you would get at the gas station and the bean roll was not much better.
No longer offers Gluten Free unfortunately stop GF  they said not economically viable t produce products

Some people have a 'thing' about wine, others about cheese, others about bread. I'm in the third group. A few years ago, I bought a loaf from Burns the Bread in the High Street in Glastonbury. It was, to say the least, beyond perfect. I was there, again, this Monday, so I treated myself to an 800g granary tin that cost ¬£2.80 (yes, that's right; I had HIGH expectations for that price, as I could purchase the same at Asda for ¬£1.30). 

To say I was almost in tears when I came to eat is it an understatement. The 'crust' was wrinkly soft and the entirety too firm, tell-tale signs of an old or stale loaf. Having cut off ALL 6 crusts, I came to something that would be deemed barely passable after two days given a bog-standard loaf. This 'Burns' loaf had NOT, I repeat NOT, been baked the same day and was being sold from the previous day's leftovers. I can tell, I just can, because I have to have real, fresh bread.

The only positive is that I took a closer look at the Special Bread section in Asda today. I bought a 400g fancy kalamata olive loaf (¬£1.95). It was gorgeous and HAD been baked there that day. Needless to say, I'll be going through the rest of that Special Bread section.

Burns the Bread in Glastonbury is now a farce. AVOID at all costs.

Burns the Bread simply sells delicious baked goods. And that's it. :D 
I've known them for a couple of years now and whenever I visit Glastonbury I enjoy one or another thing from their bakery. Absolutely delicious!

Found this by accident strolling back to the car from the Abbey, The sandwiches available were such good value compared to where we live, fillings were large. Tried a couple of cakes as well - delicious
Fabulous cakes and pastries. The Eccles cakes are delicious. As too was the carrot cake, apple danish, Viennese finger and the pasties! Crisp pastry. Just out of the oven.
This bakery makes the best whole grain bread ever!  I truly wish they'd move to San Diego, California.

This is not a restaurant... It's a bakery and they make the most delicious rhubarb muffins, which we like to think are a healthier option :0} Nothing more to say... Except, leave us some for our next visit ;0)

Popped into here for a quick takeaway of sausage roll, pasty & doughnuts. 
A great traditional bakers with great tasting food. 
Sausage roll & pasty were nice & warm & packed full of filling. 
Noticed they also do a fab collection of vegetarian & vegan savouries. 
Great üëç
Burns the bread is a proper old style shop , not many left nowadays.  Everything is lovely and quiet often run out of certain things " sign of a good shop in my view.

Absolutely the best bakery we've visited for the whole package!!! Amazing choice (vegan/gluten free/regular diet) breads, Buns , filled sarnies, savoury pastries, cakes, sweet pastries! The cherry Danish and bread pudding - oh my goodness just delicious! Staff so friendly.  Prices more than reasonable! Such value. Just discovered there is a shop in Wells too so will be visiting tomorrow üòÄ
Really tasty filled rolls which was just what we wanted... Also a couple of the best loaves we've had for a long time. Friendly guy serving who offered to slice both loaves...
I attended the course back in March, I learnt so much.  Bob was a fantastic teacher with Anne as his side kick.  I would recommend this course to anyone
Te veel zoete & hartige lekkernijen om op te noemen. Kleine keurige winkel met vriendelijk personeel.
Lovely pasties and sausage rolls. Excellent service! Right in the heart of Glastonbury. I was pleasantly surprised!

We tried the famous Torsy Moorsy Fruit cake and for the price it certainly was nothing exceptional. There are other bakers in town whose produce is juts as good.
The savouries were ok but for a treat try the butcher at the bottom of the high street for a very good prok pie.

This Bakery sells the most delicious lamb and mint rolls (they look like sausage rolls) and they taste heavenly. I have never had or seen these anywhere else. If you‚Äôre in Glastonbury you must visit and try these, yummy!

Pastry Making Course. Great fun, covid-safe & brilliant direction ensuring all that attended took home lots of tasty wares!
A very tasty lunch and all refreshments included.

Review Title: Best Flapjack I have ever eaten
Review Text: Visited on Saturday 28th August 2021. Parked in the car park outside the Abbey and picked up some traditional pasties to eat then and a great offer of 8 mini pasties for later. The pasties were fabulous but that didn't prepare us for the wonderful nutty flapjacks we picked up too which were sooooo good we made mmmmmm noises after each mouthful as we ate them in the car during our onward journey. We bought these just before closing time so no drop in quality even though it was the end of the day.

Stopped off on the way back from our holiday. They do gluten free muffins which were so so good, had to be one of the best gluten free muffins I‚Äôve had out. My boyfriend had a bacon savoury which was served warm and tasted amazing. Cannot fault the food or the price, we were even tempted to go back and get some more food for the road trip back. Would definitely revisit.
Used this bakery lots on our recent holiday to Glastonbury , excellent choice , friendly staff and good value for money. Particularly enjoyed the muffins

Very refreshing that they are still taking the Covid threat seriously.  There was a short wait to get in and limited to two groups at a time.

It was worth it.

Excellent selection of sweet and savoury.  Lovely pasties.  Lovely steak slices.  Reasonable prices.

Will go again.
Best pasty ever! Lovely staff, excellent selection of mouthwatering goodies. Only difficult thing was choosing! They have certainly earned their awards.

We drove over 5 hours from Suffolk to visit Glastonbury and we were starving by the time we arrived. We saw Burns the Bread bakery and popped in to buy some food. We bought a sausage roll, a pasty and 2 apple turnovers. OMG, everything was amazing. I've travelled all over the world and have never tasted anything so divine. After we wandered around town for a few hours we actually bought more food before leaving just so we could eat it again for dinner. The staff was super friendly and helpful and the food, well as I've said, it was amazing. Can't recommend them enough. Thank you.

Every time we visit Glastonbury, one of our first calls is to Burns. Bread is great, sausage rolls are very good, cakes are lovely. Basically the bakery is the best, wish we had one at home. Friendly staff. Can't fault it.

I have just spent the weekend in Glastonbury and one lunch time had an eccles cake, it was something else.  I told my husband on the phone that I had one and was ordered not to return home unless i brought an eccles cake with me. He said he had not had an eccles cake that good for 30 years. Lamb and mint savoury was delicious too.  Excellent covid restriction in place too.
Always a good experience. Lovely baked goods and sandwiches. Freshly made and good. We return on every visit to Glastonbury!

This is a convenient place to grab a snack on the go, whether you're going for a hike or simply don't feel like having a full dinner. They serve a warm or cold , decent selection of pastry , sweet and savoury and have vegan options too. 
This is a bakery, not a restaurant, they only do take away.
We ended up going in to get a bite to eat for lunch and got 2 x coffee's and 2 x Pasties, which were quite small ... tasted ok , but not great!
Great products and lovely staff....you really can't find a better bakery in the area. Takeaway sandwiches are great and cater for gluten and dairy free requirements.

Review Title: Don't like products to be touch with bare hands
Review Text: Outstanding products, but always has been in my mind why staff touch the products with their hands. They handle money touch their face nose bacteria is everywhere and after touch your bread. I think staff should be trained to not touch anything with their hands anyway.

Un visita obligado es este panader√≠a, al entrar no lo sabes donde mirar, ni hablar del olor entre el pan reci√©n hecho y los pasteles.  Aqu√≠ puedes comprar te tambi√©n alg√∫n pie o sausage roll para comer paseando.

We'd been advised by several to try the local bread and were confused as generally, when visiting a tourist spot, many don't recommend the local bakery. When we tried the corn bread, we could understand why! Absolutely delicious!
I eat here almost every day. I'd probably starve if they didn't exist. Delicious pasties. vegan options

great bread and wares - pleasent staff - worth a visit
easy parking at the car park  for the abbey......................................................................................

Delicious, wholesome flavours, excellent range of choices, and a convenient location right in downtown Glastonbury. Parking on the High Street can be iffy, but the car park is conveniently nearby. Not to be missed!

When we go to the Glastonbury Carnival we look forward to visiting Burns the Bread for the muffins that have differant flavours and nicer than supermarkets offer. Tried the mince pies this year and these are very good. Good selection of other bakery items.

Stunning bakers, amazing selection of treats to eat on the go, including vegan and vegetarian savoury's.
  if you are about just shopping in Glastonbury. along with of course good range of daily breads and buns etc. not to missed
If you did manage to park in the marketplace, we recommend the coffee & scones etc at their nearby shop
Great slection of cakes and good bread My favourite loaf is the small branary at ¬£1.30 which is good value in my view
It is a excellent bakery, the staff are very helpful and polite and know their products, they did a bread order for my pagan wedding and it was excellent and would recommend them to everyone.

Great take out treats both sweet and savory. The filled meat and veggie pies are superb. The location in the Abbey pay and display has a few tables outside for customers. The traditional gingerbread men are a great dessert. Very friendly staff and fair pricing. A great break from restaurant lunches.
Strongly recommended. Great bread and pastries. Try the pasties or the vegan sausage roll. Excellent service.
Bought some pasties for a picnic at the Abbey... they did not disappoint. Beautifully cooked and delicious. Quick service too.

Review Title: Great place for breakfast on the go.
Review Text: We stayed in Glastonbury for a couple of days, wanted a quick breakfast at a reasonable price quite early in the morning, a lot of the cafes weren't open before 9am which was a bit rubbish and Burns was open from 7am so we went there both days.  A wide selection to choose from and even had sausage and bacon sandwiches.  So four of us got well fed for about ¬£16 and that included a cake each too for mid morning!  Well worth a visit.
The bread is amazing as are all the other foods they sell. This is a must shop when in the area.There are shops all around the area so you should get what you are looking for. Enjoy

Very busy but on the whole quite nice items from the baker half way up the High Street. Vegetarian options to be had from the hot counter too.  Pretty good if you want to get something from a bakers to eat en route.
Oh , these pastries are the best. The sour dough is a must and we bought 3... that‚Äôs 3 THREE fruit cakes to take home as they are scrumptious ...... YUM

With two outlets in the centre of town, as well as several others in the local area, it is good to see Burns now expanding their range of delicious offerings, with a vegan sausage roll and a spicy sweet potato pasty in particular being the savoury highlights. They are cooked fresh every day, so you know the products are at there best. It is not always evident exactly which products are vegan (although the aforementioned are labelled as so), so it is always worth asking the staff or requesting to look at their allergen book which lists the ingredients for every product they sell.  

This is a well established local company, and while the products are not as cheap as some of the "chains", the quality is very good.
Very tasty treats. We tried several items while in Glastonbury including pasties, eccles cake, mocha meringue, almond croissants and shortbread and all were very good.

My husband and I only popped into grab some bottled water but ended up buying an amazing selection of treats, all of which were So tasty!
I have to eat Gluten Free food and did not expect much as it appears to be a good old fashioned bakery but they did have two lovely little choices of muffins, one in cherry and one with chocolate chip.  I got the chocolate chip and I have truly never had a better GF muffin, it was delicious!
Prepackaged to keep it safe from contamination, it was moist, tasty and a good size!  A nice change from the regular prepackaged stuff we can buy.
Recommended for anyone who fancies a treat.

Very often as vegan it is difficult to find a vegan delicious snack. Burns the bread  is the answer for that in Glastonbury. I love the vegan sausage roll and get quiet addicted to it. The price is also good  , service is good and it is fresh .. very fresh..
Quality baked goods we devoured for our lunch! And ask them how they got their name- awesome story and I hope it's true?
Nice bakery in Glastonbury near the Abbey.  Large section of tempting pastries, scones, muffins, etc.  I had a Viennese Finger, which was tasty.

Never been before, staff were friendly and it looked clean; however...

We bought a number of 'steak slices', the quality of all slices was dismal. Mainly very fatty puff pastry, hardly any filling. What filling there was was thick mushy, but tasty, gravy, a hint of mince and literally only one (or, in one of them two,) tiny pieces of meat per slice.

Maybe they also do some good food but not sure I want to try again.

Review Title: Burns The Bread: the poet of bakers
Review Text:
The staff were wearing straw boaters with a black ribbon. I saw this also in the food hall at Harrods, but subsequent Googling leaves me still unsure if it is a British tradition or what. I liked it though.

The staff were friendly and attentive, but also patient and willing to talk about the products. A bakery is where I would recommend people go when they want a quick bite in the UK; they had all sorts of savoury pies and rolls and butties and pasties and all those things, and they were all amazing. They also have delicious loaves of bread, that they will slice for you while you wait, and all so reasonably priced.

I made quite a few "dad jokes" and puns about Burns The Bread's store name, but my favourite is the most accurate: "Burns the Bread is the poet of bakeries."
Very tasty sausage rolls, friendly attentive staff, clean surroundings, great location just out of the way but can still see all the hustle and bustle

I grabbed. snack from here almost every day and was continually delighted. 
Onion and cheese pasties, triple chocolate slice, sausage rolls, savories, sandwiches: all of it delicious.

And the service was helpful and patient, which was good because it was hard deciding what to get!
My friend and I went in this bakery and the food was just fantastic! Pasties, pies, cakes, pizza - all freshly made. We both had a pizza and it was delicious - highly recommended!

My Mother and I come to Glastonbury every year for a week. At least once we have a lunch from here and its always really good. They try new things all the time and you might not see certain things again next year but new ones instead.
Local Glastonbury bakery excellent bread/ savouries & cakes! Called in to buy savouries for a colleague
D√©pannage tout √† fait correct en ballade le midi dans cette √©trange cit√©. Du choix et une qualit√© tout √† fait recommandable...
I loved the variety of the breads available, the sandwiches and cakes for sale. I loved the muffins and bought a few almost every day ! But they sell out fast!
A small store with a nice selection of sandwiches and baked foods served by polite friendly staff. Great for when you're on the go!

I have fond memories of Burns the Bread from back in the late 90's when I lived in Glastonbury for a time. I was delighted to return nearly two decades later to find that the delicious, top notch baked goods that were a nostalgic memory for me were not only stlll there, but even better than my memory! Such a great place to grab lunch to take away for a picnic, or a decadent treat for whenever. Best pain au chocolat ever!

Came here as per our tour guide‚Äôs recommendation to try the Torsy Moorsy fruit cake. Apparently this is the only bakery that can make it as per (very) old recipe. We were told they found the actual old recipe paper stuck inside a wall while they renovating the store. Indeed the cake was nice. Bought it as a gift for a friend of mine as well.

Burns have always been the kind of bakery everyone wants ‚Äòjust around the corner‚Äô.
As a company they seem to be doing just that, appearing everywhere around the corner!. They don‚Äôt seem to have lost their mojo yet, I‚Äôve never had anything I didn‚Äôt love from them but they haven‚Äôt lowered their prices either and they were never cheap!
I‚Äôve stopped in multiple times on the way to work staff are always very friendly and helpful. Food is great! Pastries sandwiches cakes etc have always been fab.
We bought several of out meals from this brilliantly named bakery - pizza, pastries and cakes are yummy, the bread so nice  I bought some home and filled my freezer :)
Pasties, savory rolls, sweet treats, and a sandwich - everything was fresh, tasty and excellent.  Lovely!

We stopped in on our way to the Tor to pick up supplies. Everything was delicious. We bought a Glastonbury pasty, a lamb and mint pasty, an eccles cake and a raspberry muffin, and I can highly recommend all of them. I wish we had a bakery like this near us!
So many treats to choose from. Great quality at great prices. Highly recommend a visit. Don't be too greedy though.
Great cakes and bread always clean and tidy and serve a great  selection of bread and cakes and hot food

Review Title: a must for any trip to Glastonbury
Review Text: We go to Glastonbury at least once a year, and this is always a must to pick up a few things for lunch. Hot items are fab. I wish we had somewhere like this where we live!
I call in regularly for spelt loaves and they are superb. Very clean, pleasant staff in easy location.
All ways head for Burns the Bread if in Glastonbury, the bread is fantastic and so are the savoury items, and great selection of cakes.
Wow you must come in these shops because they not only sell great bread they had deserts as well. There is so much bread you have to visit.
Omg. The bestest vegan pasty ever! Makes me want to live here though my waist-line would suffer. Enough said.
Excellent service and excellent place to buy bread, biscuits, pasties!!! I love their Glastonbury pasties!!!!

Burns the Bread has been around since I was a little girl, and their chain is expanding, which is great!
They always have fresh homely savoury and sweet pastries and cakes that taste amazing, and they also do a variety of Vegetarian/Vegan options :)
This bakery will always be one of the best, helps that the staff are always really lovely! 
Hands down the best bakery around this area! (Street, Wells, Glastonbury...)

Lovely bakery. Fantastic sandwichs, pasties, filled rolls! Yum! The bread delicious. Great coffee to take away.
Nice staff.
Excellent products always available and so tasty. Enjoy the best in town and the surrounding area. Burns Is Best.

Review Title: Had heard great things about Burns the Bread
Review Text: Came here based on recommendation but left slightly disappointed. Bought some sausage rolls that had lovely buttery puff pastry but the pork filling was rather bland. Needs more seasoning !!
Nothing like the supermarket bread. So so tasty bread, rolls and cakes. Just has to be sampled. An absolute treat.
Fabulous range of bread, cakes, hot snacks and the Glastonbury pasty, as well as Torsy-Morsy cake. Recommend the lady cake.
Pretty nice service, good food, good prices. Some desserts are better than others but the good ones are delicious! Recommend the apple danish.
The best carmels and sweets ever! it was hard to pick just one so we got several to share. a MUST when on High strret shopping at all the witchy stores.
This is a place to indulge your love of sweets and bread. All fresh and delicious with way too many choices. Love it!
We bought snack lunches every day here, some amazing pastries and bread to choose from and not over priced.
An old fashioned bread shop selling real bread and cakes. What is not to enjoy. There is a wide range of different breads to choose from.
We enjoyed a lunch here then we had to get cookies to take away they were fantastic, this is well worth the stop make sure to buy lots they won't last.Gingerbread excellent.

Review Title: good food, good price, excelent service!
Review Text: Best ginger bread man ever!!!! The guy who works there is very, very nice and speaks a little spanish, so he could understand our portuguese. I would go no further. Here is the place to stop to eat somehing at the Abbey's parking!

I really liked the veggie roll from here one of the best I've had. We also had Chelsea buns which were really nice. Down side they could of written on the bags which were veggie and which were real sausage.
Loved the name of this little bakery. We took time to go in and look at the wares. Then we could not resist purchasing a few small tasty looking offering. A diet after stop on our journeys.

Sold out of bread before 11:00  in main car park shop
Lots of other shops in the area but didn't want to carry bread around town

We bought both bread and cakes here.  Because we like to share, we asked for the cakes to be cut in half, and each time, this was not a problem.  One time, the woman even split the portions up for us so we had a share of each in each paper bag.  Thank you.

Genuine family run business with excellent sweet and savoury items; great place to pick up supplies for your walk up Glastonbury Tor!  There's another branch in the Abbey car park, close to the shuttle bus stop.

Review Title: This is a bakery not a restaurant
Review Text: Excellent cakes ,bread and biscuits and absolute wow pasties.Snack and meal size.Very fresh,you can smell the delicious aroma when being served.Everyone should try the fantastic Lardie buns and Tor Fruit Cake.

Really great selection of bread and pastries plus a local special cake in a tin - tipsy cake ? Or topsy ??? 
Anyway great gift and staff very delightful and helpful

In my 28 years on this earth I have quite simply never had a sausage roll this incredible. Utterly life changing baked good. The pastry was buttery, flakey and perfectly warm. The sausage flavour had an unrivalled depth to it. Honestly, if I could pay someone to follow me around feeding me these sausage rolls for the rest of my life I would. Absolutely big up yourselves, I will be back.

They did plenty of vegetarian options but nothing for vegan üò≠
A lot of people are turning vegan now so it would be good for business if Burns realised this

Real baking using the best ingredients.  The Glastonbury pasty is delicious, Mr Burns' bread is real bread, the vast display of cakes and savouries looks impressive and very tempting.  My particular favourites are the Lardy Cake and the Apple Slice.  Not sure whether he still makes them but his Marmite Chelsea Buns are/were amazing.  If you want a treat to take away or give as a gift, the Torsy Moorsy Fruit cake is delicious and made with Somerset Cider and Cheddar cheese.

Review Title: Eccles cakes like I remember as a kid
Review Text: We bought two eccles cakes (¬£1.10 each).  They were very large and reminded me of the ones I had as a child where the fruit and sugar have made 'toffee' bits in the bottom of the pastry.  Only wish we'd called in earlier because they did veggie rolls etc.
Lovely place to purchase lunch. Large selection. I had the Glastonbury pasty and my wife had a tuna sandwich. Both were very tasty. Staff were nice and chatty

I used to love getting out for lunch, meandering down from Roy Simpsons place mooching down to Burns the Bread and getting myself some yummies to fill me up and eat out the bin whist typesetting Global SMT & packaging... riveting read.

One of the best bakers in the UK. Mr Burns has won national awards and deserves every one of them!
His bread products are without equal and the confection products are simply wonderful. Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to sample their products especially the Glastonbury pasty.

Review Title: The Delicious Smells Draw You In
Review Text: We walked past this bakery twice trying to resist the delicious pastries and hot and cold sandwiches on offer.  Alas, we just had to go in and grab some delicious cookies and sweet rolls and some coffee.  The cherry Danish and jelly donuts are wonderful and their sausage rolls and other hot sandwiches are delicious.  So we purchased a hot sandwich and Danish and cookies for dessert.  Burns the Bread has several locations scattered around the area.  Prices are reasonable and service is friendly.

Bought some cakes to take way.  Got a rhubarb muffin and a toffee apple muffin.  Would have to say they were the best muffins I've ever had.

A brilliant bakery selling wonderful products.
Happy staff great service.
It's very busy but worth the wait.
I didn't want a big lunch, so I got 2 different veggie pies or maybe pasties which were delicious, particularly the cheese and bean one. Inexpensive too!

Outragously expensive and bland, I'm sure their other products are fine and the pastry was okay. The filling was disgusting, worst sausage roll I've ever tasted. ¬£1.75 was the clue. I took 1 bite and put 75% in the nearest bin.
I got a salad from here and loved it, the cakes looked delicious, their lardy cake looks supburb and I will buy some next time I visit
Best baker around for miles, goods baked on the spot in Glastonbury High Street, and they keep opening new outlets in the area - a very good sign of the quality of what they make.

Review Title: Its a bit hit and miss to be honest
Review Text:
Quite expensive, ¬£2.15 for a pasty, the last one I had I ended up feeding it to the pigeons, it was grey and mushy and had a peculiar aftertaste.
Iced currant bun went the some way, it was really heavy and doughy..
the doughnuts are nice  and so are the apple slices, if they have them, not seen one for ages so dont know if they still do them.
T/hbread is quite good, they have a good selection

We have had things from Burns in the past and found them to be tasty. Yesterday we had a sausage roll from here which was bland and tasteless, also at ¬£1.75 i thought it was quite expensive anyway. Very disappointed on this occasion and, having read the review about the bin, will think very carefully before returning. Not sure they deserve to be so high up in the restaurant category, there are much better places in Glastonbury.

All my reviews are based on genuine first hand experience, if this has been helpful to you less gives me a helpful vote, thank you üòä
Fabulous selection of cakes and pastries at the shop in the bus station. Hard to choose what to have.

I'm a long standing burns the bread customer, many years I have been buying from you and I love the street store, they are so friendly. Sadly the Glastonbury store isn't the same, the staff can be rather blunt and it all seems too much hassle. And when I saw someone wiping a bin down out the back (including the floor pedal) and then wipe the work surface down, I felt rather sick. I was a massive lover of the Apple salad sandwich but sadly it's not as tasty as it used to be - such a shame. But the your cakes are rather yummy üòã

The shop is not so big and there doesn't seem to be a queue but the bread is really good so it's worth going in to get it. There are lots of other snacks to try and the quiche is gorgeous. We always come here when in the area.

Visiting Glastonbury I was looking for somewhere to have a quick bite to eat and came across this bakers shop. There was a lot of people waiting to be served but the staff were quick and pleasant. I tried the Glastonbury pasty more out of curiosity but was surprised how tasty it was, along with a cake it more than filled the gap and a great price too. Recommended.

Bakery that offers a superb variety of food. 

Sandwiches are fresh and very pleasant, alot of food choices taken into consideration, 

Prices are very good, staff are polite, helpful, and is a credit to the high street.. 

So much better than the national chain that blights most areas, thankfully Glasto seems to have escaped such invasion

Needed something to keep us going while wandering round Glastonbury. We got a cheese and onion quiche which was really light and tasty, a mini pasty which had lots of meat in for such s teeny tiny pasty, a strawberry meringue which was really really nice and a spearmint devil which was really yummy! I can only recommend this place as everything we had was great.

All my reviews are based on genuine first hand experience, if this has been useful to you please give me a helpful vote, thank you üëçüèª

We love to buy our lunch or picnic eats here whenever we're in Glastonbury. There are a really good selection of hot, freshly baked pasties, slices sausage rolls etc which always have several vegetarian options. There are also delicious cakes and sweet pastries, hand baked breads and rolls.

This bakery really needs a dose of inspiration and innovation. All the breads and pastries I have tried over the years have been bland and mediocre. It would be great if they could bring in some products suitable for 21st Century Glastonbury, local and organic ingredients and new interesting varieties of artisan type breads and better ingredients in the pies would  help this old fashioned bakery to survive in the modern world.

This is the place I always go to for my baked goods and pasties.
A fantastic local firm with lots of lovely freshly made items every day.
I especialy love the Glastonbury Pasty, a definite must when I pop in here!

There are two main outlets selling bread in Glastonbury ‚Äì Earthcare and Burns the Bread. Burns is a specialist bakery, in contrast to Earthcare, which sells a large variety of ethical consumables. We preferred Burns for bread ‚Äì there were quite a few interesting varieties of loaf, as well as cakes ‚Äì all infinitely better than the supermarket varieties. We shall certainly continue to use it when we are self-catering in Glastonbury again.

Review Title: Where to go if you fancy a nibble!
Review Text: This is my favourite bakery in all the land! The spelt broccoli and cheese pasties and spelt shortbread are divine. I even stock up on mince pies at Christmas time to take home (a three and half hour drive away), because they are so nice. A trip to Glastonbury is not the same without a trip to Burns the Bread.
Popped in a few pasties for me and the family. The pasties were average and ¬£11 pound for four average sized pasties and a bag of crisps in my eyes is over prices.
This place is a godsend to locals and travellers alike.  Great for summer picnics too.  Great choices of pies, pasties, cakes and lots of bread!

Burns the Bread offers an excellent range of bread, pastries and cakes. I popped in recently to buy some cakes. They were all delicious. The rhubarb muffin was particularly good. Moist and substantial. It could quite easily be warmed up and eaten as a pudding with fresh custard.

Burns the Bread prides itself in baking wholesome bread, pasties and muffins.  Whilst driving through Glastonbury, 36 km south of Bristol, we stopped by Burns the Bread Bakery to have some snacks.  I must say the spelt vegetable pasties and the beef pastry were delicious and wholesome.  I also tried the blueberry muffin which was bouncy in texture and not too sweet compared to muffins baked by other well established stores where the texture tend to be too pasty and sweet to the palette.

Review Title: The Best Bread in the UK
Review Text: If you want to taste the best bread in the UK visit Burns the Bread. having been a lover of bread for most of my 80 years this business supplies my all time favourites. A great selection of snacks and pasteries also available.
Baked on the premises, fab cakes, bread and savouries. Gluten fre items, vegetarian savoury snacks, hot food, sandwiches and drinks.

Review Title: Great bakery not to be missed
Review Text: Well so glad called in here! Best bakery been into in ages. Good selection of breads and cakes, home made sandwiches and rolls and hot food. They do a great choice of veggie options which I find rare in bakers nowadays. The veggie sausage rolls were amazing as was the cheese and bacon slices for my other half.

Review Title: Great snack food, sweet and savoury!
Review Text: Found this bakery while walking around Glastonbury. We wanted a quick snack, the Glastonbury pasty was hot and tasty, followed by an iced chelsea bun. The food was well prepared and very tasty. The place was very busy - always a good sign - the queue was out the door. Try if you're in the area!
Every time we are in Somerset,we always go to Burns the Bread fantastic bread,cakes,pies & sausage rolls.very reasonably costs,everything is fresh
Helpful staff, great bread, queue almost out of the door always a good sign, would definitely return

My favourite must have stop..
Affordable good quality food. Sorry no photos as i ate it all. Cheese straw, fruit and seed flap jack. Plus florintene.  Good friendly customer service.

Review Title: Great for Food on the Run
Review Text:
Lots of choice both sweet and savoury. Always busy which is a good sign.

If you are looking for a snack lunch or some lovely cake to take home, try here.

I am wheat intolerant, so I buy their spelt bread, spelt cakes etc. Their spelt bread is the best that I have had. I am also vegetarian so I am pleased that they have spelt veggie pasties etc. I really like their carrot and sultana spelt muffins.  My husband is an omnivore, and is quite partial to their bacon sandwiches. If you go in before lunchtime you can have your sandwiches made for you, exactly how you like them (butter or no butter, sauce or no sauce etc). The staff are polite, friendly and helpful. You can also get a coffee, although I have not tried their coffee, my husband tells me the coffee is good. They have a good choice of gluten free cakes, but I have not tried them.

Review Title: El mejor pan que he probado
Review Text: No me suele gustar el pan, pero cuando prob√© el suyo fue incre√≠ble. Cada vez que alg√∫n amigo viaja a Glastonbury le encargo un pan de semillas y cereales. Riqu√≠simo.
Now this bakery is wonderful full of the most tasty pastry's cakes and biscuits great prices oh my  kind of heaven

Excellent variety of breads,hot snacks to go, made on the premises.
Ideal for picnics up the Tor or in the Glastonbury park .

Love their food which is not cheap since it Southern prices and I am from the North!!!  but delicious..  Plenty of vegetarian food to choose from  but disappointed that no gluten free, wheat free food for my daughter.  Loved the cleanliness.  The outfits of the ladies serving made it more upmarket too.
Visited Burns the Bread for a lunchtime pasty. The recipe is deferent to a traditional Cornish pasty, containing mince meat. The staff are friendly, and there's always a queue, a good sign!
Remember the bakers of yesteryear the smell of hot fresh bread, friendly staff, good quality food . That's Burns the Bread. If you visit Glastonbury take home a loaf from Burns.
