„ÅäÂÄ§ÊÆµ„ÇÇÊâãÈ†É„ÅßÁæéÂë≥„Åó„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
Great range of breads and cakes baked on the premises. Cannot be recommended too highly,  and so good to be able to support a local business.

We popped in here on the 1st of January. We were offered a sample of their amazing Somerset pasties and no sooner had we swallowed it we were buying 2. We also tried their rhubarb muffins and millionaire shortbread - yum yum!
Their bread looked great.
We would definitely make time to revisit this shop and make a number of purchases.

Also the staff were lovely and friendly giving good service on a Bank holiday
To a great selection of lovely bread and cakes (including sourdough bread) the owners add vegan sausage rolls and Jamaican patties (beautifully spiced and not over-hot).

Lovely little bakery nestled in Glastonbury... Very pleasant staff and they make a lovely cup of tea.... if you are a meat eater then the Steak Pasty's are very good... But I opted for Cheese and Onion Pasty and they were great....

Review Title: Check out the carrot cake with bacon slice
Review Text: Most amazing thing on the menu is carrot cake with bacon. These people have a sense of humour and the sign outside always says something humorous. Magnificent bread and pastries. Even have gluten free and spelt. Highly recommended.
I visited the shop in the high street for a quick bite after the way up to the Tor. The staff was very friendly and the croissant brilliant! Will definetly go back soon.

Review Title: No wonder this is an award winning baker!
Review Text:
The bread in particular but in reality all their products are too a very high standard.......including their hot sausages rolls if you passing and need to eat on the move!

Been buying their bread here and at other outlets for years.
Enjoyed gluten free brownies and muffins. I was surprised to find them. Best l have tried so far. Will definitely be stopping by Burns the Bread next time lm in Glastonbury.
So much choice for both bread and cakes and it's all yummy. Really good prices too. The Florentines were my favourite

Read the good reviews so thought I would gives this a go. Firstly the time it took was painful. Only 2 people ahead of me but the service was slow. By time I had been served the queue was out of the door.

I went for the Lamb and Mint Savoury which was nice although not very minty. However it was tasty. I also had a pizza slice which I didn't enjoy. My friends went for the mini Glastonbury pasties which they recommended!

Food was ok overall though but need more staff or those working to be a bit quicker.

Best pasties in the shire, sausage rolls, sandwiches & cakes!!!
Reasonable prices always looks clean & smells amazing
Good bakery, lots on offer and good prices. Staff are friendly and service is good. Would return again.

Places like this are a thing of the past where we live so always try local bakers when we can.This shop did not disappoint,the bread was top quality and the Glastonbury pasty was delish. Will defiantly pop in when we are next in the area.

Depuis des ann√©es cette boulangerie assure le ravitaillement en pain et simples gateaux de toute la ville et au-del√†. Il y a toujours la queue, mais √ßa vaut la peine d'attendre. Monsieur Burns fais maintenant aussi les sandwichs et autres 'd√©jeuners portables' et tr√®s mangeables. Ce n'est pas le pain √† la fran√ßaise, mais c'est certainement ce qu'il y a de bon et sain dans la tradition anglaise.

I came here following a bad experience perviously with another baker in town. We ordered a mix of savoury food and it varied. The pasty was nice but rather salty, sausage roll was very tasty, steak slice was clearly not homemade and was just like a shop bought one, lamb and mint was okay. Service was fine but to the point, I would return but was not wowed.

A proper bakers shop with a great selection of breads, pies and cakes baked on the premises.
They have fresh sandwiches and warm savouries too.
Well worth a visit.
Good food. Friendly staff. Great rum truffles, cant wait to have a merangue anow man again! And the ham and pineapple pizza is out of thia world!
Bread made with love - and much of it is organic and made with sourdough. Cakes and cookies of high quality.

This is a proper, old style independent bakery that sells the old fashioned cakes, fresh bread and vegetarian sausage rolls - all of which are highly enjoyable. Every time I visit Glastonbury, I cannot resist a visit to this place for a snack. 
So superior to Greggs; I wish I had one of these in my home town. 
The staff are very nice too.
Not sure I can write 100 characters but I'll try. Very tasty well priced lunch. Sandwich and pasty were good quality.

What a joy it is to see an independent bakery.

We are fed up of Greggs destroying bakeries across our country.

So we were keen to get in here and we went for breakfast, as all the caf√©s were not open yet (7.30).

We had a veggie sausage roll which had to be microwaved, and Cornish pasty (called a Glastonbury pasty) which was warm.

Pastry excellent on both. Fillings not great, but OK. Pasty filling tasty but too mushy. Veggie sausage nicely herbed, but not enough of it.

Eccles cake and choc chip muffin were both delicious.

We will be coming back!

Review Title: NEED BREAD. GET BREAD and Cakes
Review Text:
What more to say other than good bread made by a more than competent baker.
Good variety of choice and nice confections to boot.

This place is consistently high in quality and we always visit when in Glastonbury. We particularly love the pasties but like most other things they do.
Makes me hungry just thinking about it!
lovely pies and cakes . i always go whenever i am in glastonbury as tastes like homemade food rather than factory churned out .
The smell drew you in wasn't disappointed with the pie , salad & cake all made freshly also a good vegetarian choice .
Was recommended by our guide to grab a quick lunch on the go. I had a spelt vegetable pastie which was delicious. Friendly service.

Review Title: The best bakers in the UK - you have to shop here.
Review Text: We were only in Glastonbury for the day, but had breakfast and lunch from Burns.  The food was so fresh and tasty.  Great vegetarian options.  Wish you had a shop near us, as we'd use you every day.
Sono stata due volte a Glastonbury e sono sempre tornata con piacere in questa panetteria: sia i dolci che i fagottini salati sono una bont√† quindi vi consiglio senz'altro di andarci! :)
I love Burns the Bread, they make great sandwiches & rolls and I always bring some of their fresh baked bread home!

Review Title: Been coming here for years, great local bakery
Review Text: This is a great, friendly local bakery that now has a few more branches in Glastonbury and Street. I'm a vegetarian and there are always plenty of options, and the cakes are great. We always make sure we visit when we go back to Somerset to visit our family.

Review Title: Glastonbury pasty was more like a sausage roll!
Review Text: My sister and I have bought a pasty in this shop a few years ago and loved them, so decided to buy more on this recent trip. We both bought a Glastonbury pasty, which was basically a sausage roll filling in a pasty casing. Very confusing, and not very nice! Wish we had bought at the Tin Pot Pasty shop, which we only noticed on our way to the car, and looked nice!

Review Title: Mr Burns got an MBE for services to breadmaking this yr. A great independent baker
Review Text: This a bakery shop not a restaurant. He does lots of different loaves, pasties and cakes even low sugar, non wheat etc and they will slice them for you if you desired. A very handy place for a takeaway lunch, sandwiches. Various hot meat or veg pasties, cheesy ones, spelt ones. Their spelt mince pies are yum. And most famously their Tosimory cake, a local speciality.

We were so looking forward to trying Burns when we visited Glastonbury - and we were looking forward to our bacon roll for breakfast! On Saturday morning, at 9.30, the young man told us the bacon wasn't on yet and didn't offer to put any on ... we went across the road instead.
Go here when we visit Glastonbury,always quick service and reasonably priced,the only place I've seen hobgoblin crisps too!

Really nice place and a must if you get the munchies during the day. It is just a top notch Greggs really, selling similar stuff but the quality of it all is off the charts - all of their food is amazing and their cakes to die for. if you want a take away snack - go here! And if someone from Burns the Bread reads this review then please bring one up to Leeds! Thank you!!

Review Title: One of the best bakeries, I've been too!
Review Text: I believe there are a couple of Burns the Bread in Glastonbury, but my sisters and I went to the one which is off a car park area by Glastonbury Abbey. Its quite small and simple, but the best bakery goods we've had. We went right after leaving the Abbey and took several items back cottage in the Cotswold. So funny, my sisters and I will be in that area again this coming Spring, and have already made it a point to go to this specific Burns the Bread bakery. Highly recommend the drive to experience its goods.
Took my children here for goodies for our picnic The staff were so warm and friendly and even gave the children extra treats! What  lovely service  - all too rare these days !
Bought a bag of their famous mini Glastonbury Pasties to eat while walking through the town.  Very moreish and well liked by all members of the family!

We just popped in for a sandwich for lunch and came out with much more. Everything is fresh and tasty. Also fresh salads that are out of this world. If you don';t want the hassle of restaurants and the weather is nice just grab a sarnie and go alfresco.
Heerlijke broodjes! Overal zag je mensen op bankjes zitten met broodjes van deze bakker! Volop keuze in dit kleine grappige winkeltje.

Simply BRILLIANT, fanastic collecion of savoury and seet produce with inviting Local Savoury of  he day! promoion.
he day I went he glastonbury pasty was my choice in short or spelt pastry (Different type of flour and suitable for veggies). definitely not burnt!!! and a sandwich in hand cut slices of white bread large enough to sink the titanic ... well worth a taster visit.
Local bakery to my business. Staff always friendly and helpful and very efficient . Good choice of cakes and savoury bakes.
An institution in Glastonbury, Burns the Bread has my very favourite Eccles Cakes amongst other great breads and cakes. The staff are patient and pleasant.

Lovely choice of pastries and cakes, Very clean shop, gets a bit crowded. My hubby purchased a sausage and bacon sandwich got to be the biggest sandwich ever thick sliced bread to die for, I had a lovely spelt cheese and broccoli pasty wish we could get this in Yorkshire as never tried it before Cakes to die for. Well worth a stop shame we missed out on the lamb and mint sausage rolls.

Review Title: Get your lunch before walking the tor.
Review Text: We always get a vege sausage roll here to take up the tor, cakes are pretty good as well. Not your average bakery.

I visited this shop on a recent holiday in Glastonbury, along with my two sons. We bought warm pasties, bread and a variety of cakes. Everything that we bought was absolutely delicious - melt in the mouth perfection. Also, the young lady who served us, Alice, was lovely and charming and made our visit so much more pleasant. I will definitely go there (more than once) the next time I visit Glastonbury.
Famous for years, you can get great quality pies, bread & all manner of eats to take out. Expect to queue, but it's worth it, good quality food

I absolutely adore their spelt products. There is a specific taste to spelt which is not there in wheat based breads. Their spelt baps, toasted with goats cheese is so easy to prepare and taste so out of this world.
I just have to order spelt bread otherwise I can't guarantee there being any left.

A brilliant selection of hot and cold food, drinks, cakes, bread rolls etc with a few veggie hot snacks. shame they don't open til 11am on Sundays, as locals wanting  to buy bread first thing and have to go to Morrisons.

If you visit Glastonbury a visit to Burns the Bread is as necessary as going up the Tor. 
The quality of all bakery products at Burns is and always has been of the highest quality. I have Never had anything from Burns that wasn't enjoyable. I personally recommend a Glastonbury Pasty followed by a scrummy Lardy Cake or basically anything followed by anything. Burns have the art of making calories fabulous.
I didn't have a meal here but the Glasto pasty was really excellent, full to the brim with filling and the taste was out of this world. Worth going to Glastonbury just for Burns pasties.
A business with a long history in the town, catering for your usual run of pies, buns and cakes. unfurtantly you pay the price of been in Glastonbury.

If you are visiting Glastonbury Burns the Bread is a must. The French Grain Bread is the best I have ever tasted you have to get there early to get one as they go pretty quick.
Great collection of cakes pasties sandwiches quiches. The staff are very helpful and friendly.
Excellent independent wholefood baker on Glastonbury high street, try their Pasties and at only ¬£2 each, a real bargain
Popped in for a little treat for the afternoon. A wonderful array of cakes/sandwiches. I opted for an Apricot Muffin. Prices very reasonable, the muffin was simply delicious

Our tour group of 44 actually stopped at the St. Dunstan's Car Park Shop. However, we were told by our tour leader that the bakery goods here are the same, and just as delicious as the one in the center of town.

We only had a few minutes here, so my spouse and I dashed in and selected a cappuccino bun so soft and moist I thought that I had died and gone to heaven. Had we known the baked goods were this fantastic, we would have purchased a whole bag full to take with us on the tour bus!

We wanted to pack a few goodies to take with us for a picnic at Wearyall Hill, so we ventured into this bakery and were pleasantly surprised. Not only are the pastries, pies, cakes really yummy but also well priced. We even got to try a vegetarian sausage roll which was pretty good!
The gluten free chocolate chip shortbread was divine and so was the gluten free muffin. I went back there a second time and could have easily gone there everyday.
The banana bread was superb, and the fruit flapjack excellent. There is a good variety of savory and sweet, and reasonably priced.
I bought carrot cake and flapjacks. They were good. There were also gluten free options available.  Prices were very reasonable.
A good selection of breads and pastries, sweet and savory. Daily specials for only 1 pound. Coffee excellent and one of the cheapest in town. Great sausage rolls. You must try them.

We bought a large white loaf, and requested it be sliced thickly, which to get the thickness we wanted the shop assistant was more than happy to cut the bread manually instead of via the cutting machine.  We also treat ourselves to several of the tray bakes on offer - flapjack, blueberry yogurt flapjack to name but a few.
Good range of cakes, pies, pastries and breads.  Gluten free loaves are tasty but no other choices.  Very fresh as locally baked

How do you review a bakers! Well I must say their Multiseed loaf is probably one of my favourite breads ever. Its the sort of bread you can eat on its own. With butter its astounding and add some local cheddar cheese and some local Wilkins cider and thats it! The perfect ploughmans .. Other faves are the Caribbean Pattie, the Glasto Pattie, anything spelt and on certain days the fab cornbread. They have 5 outlets dotted around the area and all subline. I do love Somerset and mainly caus 'Burns are the Best' .. well done guys an dolls

Ideal for picking up a snack to take up the For
Freshly made bread on the premises...lots of variety
W
Always get my bread here!
Excellent pasties and pastries are served here and these are fresh every day so make sure you take some home with you.

We were attracted by the lovely aroma and had heard good things about this bakery from friends. Great selection of goodies. Good hearty sizes. Friendly service.Everything we bought was absolutely delicious.
Burns the bread is a local chain of top quality bakers, this one in the high st selling, probably the best Pasty in Somerset.... take some home....
We tried several cakes here: a chocolate florentine, an almond croissant, rum truffle, carrot cake and a custard slice.  They were all exquisite!  Will definitely revisit.
One look in the window and you have to go in! Cakes are beautiful. So many yummy delicious things to buy, friendly staff too. Highly recommended
If you fancy a little treat, go on! Lovely pastries and cakes with some interesting varieties. The name itself is worth a five rating!
Lovely breads and cakes. Great selection, friendly and helpful staff who were very patient when we could not make a decision.  Scrummy
Tasty and all good quality ingredients, you can't go wrong buying from Burns The Bread. Their veggie sausage rolls and the spelt broccoli pasties are gorgeous.
Try their walnut & cramberry bread , its devine. They do an aray of fine breads & cakes, all freshly baked daily.

Review Title: ¬°Comida muy rica para salir del paso!
Review Text: Burns the Bread corresponde a una cadena de puestos que se centran en la venta de "pastries". La mayor√≠a de los locales no corresponden a un restaurant propiamente tal, sino a locales de venta. La comida que venden es exquisita, y barata, por lo que pueden ser el perfecto complemento para una tarde en la que quieres visitar, sin detenerte mucho para comer. Excelente!

Delicious, pasty, good thickness of pastry, and mildly peppered filling in the cornish style pasty.  Good value too.  The florentines are a triumph.  Chocolate, sultanas, nuts, in a crisp and chewy merging that is yummy.

Bought sandwiches & pasties to eat for lunch, very good. Great pastry on the pasties, and unusual fillings & breads in the sarnies. The Stilton with apple & plum chutney in low GI bread was really tasty!
Ci siamo fermati ed abbiamo comprato un p√≤ di cose in questa tipica panetteria. Prodotti tipici inglesi che ci sono davvero piaciuti.
Nice little bakery with a wide selection of fresh and tasty pasties, sandwiches pastries and cakes. Friendly and chatty staff. Thank you!

Happy helpful staff, who are willing to make up delicious sandwich combinations on request.
Delicious pasties, sausage rolls and a great selection of cakes and pastries.
Burns The Bread doesn't live up to its name. The bread is baked to perfection and the cakes are delicious. They also offer a great selection of pasties and savoury slices.
So good to still have a local bakery. Always have to get some of their corn bread and walnut and cranberry. Can't leave without an apple danish my favourite.

Review Title: Great bakery and take away food.
Review Text: The cakes and bread are excellent. Lovely take away food with good veggie options. Regularly visited during our stay in Glastonbury
Always a good place to get bread, cakes and sandwiches when in Glastonbury. Always popular with locals and tourists alike.
The meat in the pasty I bought was raw! Service was ok but lack any chat at all and the food was pricey. Not impressed.
My husband and I split a meat pie here in the afternoon and it hit the spot like nothing else - piping hot, with a flaky crust, and delicious veggies and meat.  Try this little gem!

Popped in here whilst walking around the town. We ate pasties and pies which were fresh and tasty. There was a lot on offer and we could easily have left with our bodyweight in bread products! Great to see a local, independent bakery still doing well (amongst the high street equivalent). This local bakery have shops dotted all over the area so chances are if you miss one, you will catch another nearby!
Bread as it should taste, great selection of breads, and many other goodies to eat, just across the road from the George and pilgrim
Stopped here for a bite of lunch. We were served by a pleasant young lady who had good product knowledge. We chose the Cranberry and Nut Flapjacks, and Cheese and Spinach slices. All very yummy

Review Title: Best baker in the whole of the world?
Review Text: My first experience of this bakery was some years ago when I was lured in by the sight of lardy cakes.....   Since then I have visited the shop regularly whenever I am in Glastonbury and have found consistently delicious cakes, pastries, and bread.  This is a proper bakery, it is wonderful.

The service here is amazing the staff are very accommodating and are willing to cater to your needs I don't like people cleaning their hands with alcohol gel as the gel leaves a taste on the rolls and so the staff always wash their hands instead the rolls are fantastic they are my absolute favourite with ham salad and the sausage rolls are amazing too the whole stock is amazing and very well made great place great service great food basically

OK - I ordered 5 different baked items the first time and we split them 5 ways - and we couldn't decide what was best because they ALL WERE.... really, I don't think you could go wrong. I just wished I had time to go back often enough to try everything..... yum, just, yum.

It seems simply a bakery, but like all the places in Glastonbury, there is a story behind the place.
	You can taste here the Torsy Moorsy cake, a rich cake, with fruits, added scrumpy, a alcoholic beverage, produced from apples original from Somerset and cheddar cheese. Is sold in a special tin, and has become a popular ‚ÄòGift from Glastonbury‚Äô product.
	We have a cake with chocolate chips, powder with sugar and another one, with fruits, nuts and almonds, covered with white chocolate, both delicious.

Always delicious cakes, always nice staff, the Glastonbury pasty is amazing!

The best. I accidentally liked a 'poor' review! Love Burns the Bread, it's a local institution

The only bakery i go to, not mass produced crap delivered of the back of a lorry like Greggs.
The staff are friendly, the bread and pastry's are always amazing. The only down side is that their a tad expensive.

Superb range of breads and cakes as well as spelt pasties and other specialities. I heard one young man order a piece of carrot cake with two slices of bacon on top of it! They also have an iced bun with a slice of bacon inside it on the menu.
A little over priced but always good quality food and i highly reccoemend the Galstonbury pasty. I always visit the branch in castle cary when there too.

Having seen the price of pasties elsewhere in the town it was nice to see sensible prices here. I asked for "A Cornish Pasty" and was immediately told that they were "Glastonbury Pasties." I purchased - and enjoyed.
Twice visited during stay in area. Strongly recommend the Lardy cake, similarly cheese straws. Superb selection available.
Love the honey spelt bread here . Not the cheapest bakery around but the produce is superior to many . Would highly recommend it.
Quality bread from a quality baker. Worth the 10 mile round trip for this sort of product. Best to get there early in the day.

Review Title: Great Bread - Cakes - Biscuits and takeaway food
Review Text: Burns the bread is an institution in Glastonbury. Great for your weekly bread and cakes or for hot and cold snacks. Long may it continue. There is also another branch in the industrial estate behind B&Q.
The window had terrible decoration, it was just a bit of salad! It looked really poorly done. The iced doughnut was nice but they don't have it on a sunday. :(
Who does not love a good English Pastry! My daughter entranced me to enter daily while we stayed here.. she bought a gingerbread man each day.. wonderful goodies inside.

Great selection of sweets and breads. "Push button" coffee only,  barely passable as coffee.
Highlight was the delicious muffin we had. Also stocked sandwiches which would be perfect for a cheap eat.

Review Title: Very unfriendly and no help at all!
Review Text: We were in Glastonbury on the 4th and 5th July doing a workshop. We only had a few minutes for lunch and popped into the bakery to pick something up. Unfortunately two of the staff members who served us were very unfriendly and unhelpful. When we asked about certain products the replies were abrupt and we ended up not buying the extras. We were made to feel as we were hassling the staff and they obviously didn't want to be there. Not sure why we were so stupid to go back the next day for exactly the same treatment. Such a shame, as I would rather support the local bakery than the supermarkets. However, I will be spending my money elsewhere in future.

Review Title: Great range of Gluten Free products
Review Text: Has a great range of gluten free products, rolls made to order, and daily specials, many specialty breads available on the weekend
I bought some bread, cakes and gluten free products for me and my partner.   Friendly service in both their branches and good value for money
Torsy Morsy cake.Baking alchemy! It's got cheese in it amongst secret ingredients.Spelt savouries an absolute delight and no short cut lazy flavourings such as chilli- just great ingredients.

Eine sehr gepflegte und saubere B√§ckerei mit einer √ºbersichtlichen Auswahl. 
Leckere Sandwiches, die gleich vor Ort hergestellt werden, sollte das gew√ºnschte Sandwich einmal ausverkauft sein. 
Die Preise sind fair, diverse Produkte zum halben Preis vor Ladenschluss, freundliches Personal.

Review Title: A proper baker is more than just bread.
Review Text: And this is a proper bakers! Great bread, Glastonbury pasties, good variety of sanwhiches and cakes. Ask to sample the "Torsy Moorsy" - any fan of fruitcake or bread pudding is sure to be impressed and take one home! The staff were friendly and helpful.
Fantastic range of locally baked cakes and bread - even a diabetic fruitcake. Marvellous, there is nothing we wouldn't recommend.

We visited Burns The Bread in Glastonbury after this year's festival. It's a lovely little family run business, I think they have a couple of bakeries. We bought a couple of cheese straws, sausage roll, slice of carrot cake and Millionaire Shortbread. All really good and freshly made. If I lived locally I'd go there alot!

Burns bake the best Spelt loaf I have ever had, its not dense and heavy like most are  and I have sampled Spelt products all over the place. The Spelt Muffins and rolls are good too. The staff are lovely in all the  bakeries, always friendly and happy. well done Burns the bread!
Really nice place, staff and cakes! We bought a couple of caramel chocolate slice, and a carrot cake slice. Amazing! And it was really cheap. Quality and good price!

Oh my - friendly staff and very yummy treats. Addicted to the caramel chocolate shortbread. I brought home a Torst Moorsy fruitcake and sadly, we just finished the last crumb. I think I'll have to go back!

Love the bread rolls they are really nice I used to like the Glastonbury pasties but the last few I've had have been unpleasant for some reason same with the donuts the sandwhiches and rolls are lush so is the bread however I don't like the fact  they use alcohol gel on their hands instead of washing them which makes the sandwiches taste like alcohol gel other than that it's a great place

Cakes and sandwiches were really nice. Young lad that served us should be plying his trade at the Comedy Store. Customer asked what was in the Chai bread, woman's face a picture when he said Chai!!!! Excellent response made me laugh anyway.

Fica ao lado do estacionamento da Abadia e foi recomendado pelo nosso guia. Peguei um salgado para comer na viagem e estava delicioso: glastonbury pie, √© uma esp√©cia de empanada com recheio de carne e batatas. Estava bem fresca e o tempero era muito bom. Deu vontade de mais!
What can I say, it supplies good bread, cakes and various hot pasties/sausage rolls. Affordable and busy.
Super bread cakes sandwiches and savouries... been here for years and everything is freshly made every day....
One of the most excellent bakers in the region. Savoury and sweet - all delicious. Particularly good are their stollen and carrot cake!

Love this place - no visit to Glastonbury is complete without a veggie sausage roll!!

Staff are always friendly and go out of their way to help.
The queue was out the door when we called in there, and we could see why! There was a lovely, fresh selection of cakes and pastries at very reasonable prices. Delicious and worth queuing for!
Love the food love the rolls although the pasties and donuts which used to be amazing haven't quite tasted right not sure why sure it's just a blip the foods usually lush service is great
Good variety of freshly baked produce including many vegi options. Perhaps slightly expensive but good quality.
Caters for all tastes and eating allergies. A great variety in very clean surroundings the staff are friendly and helpful and prices are reasonable. Will buy here again..
You must try their cakes, finished off 3 for my birthday treat. Absolutely stunning. They do a cake that's traditional to Glastonbury well worth the money.
lovely little bakery with a good range of vegetarian options, scrummy cakes and pastries :). Am sure I'll go again the next time I'm here!!
I love this place. Excellent small bakery on the high street &  on the abbey car park. Freshly baked bread and cakes. Hot take away food. Veggie options & spelt/ corn breads etc. Well worth a visit

I visit Burns the Bread mostly for lunchtime items and cake treats. Always have the spelt items if I can. Sandwiches and filled rolls are a little pricey, but ingredients are fresh, and still cheaper than eating out! If you want a quiet lunch take your goodies into the Abbey grounds and soak up the tranquility and view. Good selection of cakes and hot pastry snacks, which look and smell totally lovely but unfortunately I can't eat. Sometimes gets very busy, so be prepared to wait. There is another branch in town, although the one in the abbey car park has slighly less choice, but has parking. Well worth trying the fare!

Great bread and fantastic cakes nothing fancy just good cake. I'll never be skinny coming here!!

They do such a wide range of specialty bread including gluten free. 

Staff are really friendly and prices are affordable.
From traditional Somerset goodies to decent bread, many a fine lunch has been had inexpensively from Burns!

This is a excellent bakery, wide range of tasty breads delicious cakes and takeaway items.
As residents of the area we use Burns on a daily basis and have never been disappointed.

Review Title: Bread rolls and a Torsy Moorsy
Review Text: Lovely bakers, haven't tried the Torsy Moorsy yet! ‚Äì A fruit cake with a difference. Good background story to this cake recipe.
I have been buying cakes, pasties and bread in this bakery ever since I was young and the eccles cakes are by far the best anywhere. I am never disappointed with their delicious food.

I have popped in here a few times when visiting Glastonbury and have always enjoyed one of their warming pasties. The cheese straws are particularly tasty too. The food feels fresh and home cooked and is most satisfying. The cakes look great also!

Burns the Bread have outlets in Street, Glastonbury in two places and on the road between the two.
If you are a regular, you get a card which is stamped every time you spend more than ¬£5 ... we always do because I have at least two pies.
My favourites are Cheesy Bean and the spelt pasty.
The shop on the Abbey car park is so convenient, and even though small, usually has all the necessary choices plus you can park there whilst a customer.
Lurvely!

The most delicious selection of hot pasties and cakes and fresh bread. The vegetarian sausage rolls are especially good.
I never go to Glastonbury without getting a snack from here. 
My husband says the steak bake is the best any where !
I wish we had a bakery like this one where we live !

This is a good quality bakery located right in the centre of the High Street. Good quality bakery fare is always available and open seven days a week ! Difficult to resist as you walk up the High Street !
Popped in for Glastonbury pasty and did not disappoint.  The nicest pasty ever and we've tried a few!  The authentic treacle tarts were delicious too, much better than the supermarket versions!
Excellent date crumble cake (yes, unusual isn't it!), to go with a warming hot chocolate after a winter walk up the Tor. Can see why it is so popular.
Burns the Bread gives a really authentic feel to the lasonbury pasties and the other baked meats on offer.
Being in Glastonbury would not be the same without a trip to burns. Delicious cakes, hot foods. Lovely cakes to buy and take away.....fruit cake in a tin.....wonderful
You won't find a  better bakers around. High standard of snacks on offer. Slightly expensive but well worth it. Customer satisfaction guranteed.

Review Title: Not The Day for a Diet
Review Text: A Somerset pastie, wonderful sandwiches and rolls. All fresh daily along with the bread - and as for the cakes - well I have tried just a few - probably all of them in time - but don't tell the wife. Great place for picnic supplies - or for a treat.
Good food takeway their soups are worth a try as are their cakes and breads the staff is very pleasant and always eager to help
this bakers is defiantly not to be missed the bread we brought was excellent and the cakes and pasties were better than that  we wish we could eat more we must stay longer on our next visit

Review Title: Best bakery in the UK, no doubts !
Review Text:
It's always a pleasure and my mouth is watering, when i enter Burns the Bread! 
Great brownies and pastries, delicious veggie pasties and of course the Torsy Moorsy cake, mmmmhhh highly recommendable! :-)
Great place for pizza, treats, and sandwiches.  Lots of offer the hungry traveler or those of us who love anything bread!
Popped in for Glastonbury pasty and did not disappoint.  The nicest pasty ever and we've tried a few!  The authentic treacle tarts were delicious too, much better than the supermarket versions!
Excellent date crumble cake (yes, unusual isn't it!), to go with a warming hot chocolate after a winter walk up the Tor. Can see why it is so popular.
Burns the Bread gives a really authentic feel to the lasonbury pasties and the other baked meats on offer.
Being in Glastonbury would not be the same without a trip to burns. Delicious cakes, hot foods. Lovely cakes to buy and take away.....fruit cake in a tin.....wonderful
You won't find a  better bakers around. High standard of snacks on offer. Slightly expensive but well worth it. Customer satisfaction guranteed.

Review Title: Not The Day for a Diet
Review Text: A Somerset pastie, wonderful sandwiches and rolls. All fresh daily along with the bread - and as for the cakes - well I have tried just a few - probably all of them in time - but don't tell the wife. Great place for picnic supplies - or for a treat.
Good food takeway their soups are worth a try as are their cakes and breads the staff is very pleasant and always eager to help
this bakers is defiantly not to be missed the bread we brought was excellent and the cakes and pasties were better than that  we wish we could eat more we must stay longer on our next visit

Review Title: Best bakery in the UK, no doubts !
Review Text:
It's always a pleasure and my mouth is watering, when i enter Burns the Bread! 
Great brownies and pastries, delicious veggie pasties and of course the Torsy Moorsy cake, mmmmhhh highly recommendable! :-)
Great place for pizza, treats, and sandwiches.  Lots of offer the hungry traveler or those of us who love anything bread!

Because the other caf√® were closed, I took a fast breakfast composed of a delicious cake and a chocolate to drink.
The service was impeccable even if this site is clearly only a bakery and not a caf√©.

Called into the bakers during day trip to Glastonbury and so glad we did. The products are all so tasty especially the Danish pastries which were divine! We have eaten them all now so need to take a trip back there!! 
Definitely worth calling in and trying their products, I never knew a simple bakery would impress me so much.
The bread here is very very good and it seems to last a long time, I bought a big roll and was eating it 4 days later. There are numerous cakes as well but this time didn't buy any, just the bread.
Good customer service for a bap and cake take away. Bread was very fresh and tasty, with a lot of filling.

I often visit the burns the bread in both Glastonbury and Street and have never been disappointed. 
I am not generally a big pasty fan, but the glastonbury pasties ate delicious. I am also a big sucker for their apple slices, when I can get my hands on one, as they are almost always sold out (yep they are that good) 
Really friendly staff, always seem to be happy in their job. I also really like the fact that they also offer a fresh sandwich making service too.  
Definitely worth a visit :)

Review Title: Brilliant selection of cakes and bread
Review Text: A really good local bakers. With an unusual selection of bread made with several types of flour. This is not just your usual bakers these are master bakers with knowledge of how it's done. The sandwiches are great especially the new selection of gourmet filled in lovely brown crusty bread. The hot food section has yummy pasties and pizza slices. The staff are always pleasant and it's always busy. Very clean and well kept. Go early as  they run out of everything very early and after 12 you will be lucky to find anything but cakes.

I didn't know what a Pasty was before we popped into Burns the Bread, but I ordered one and it was delicious! The Glastonbury Pasty was filled with beef and had a nice light, yet crispy shell. Someone I was with ordered a pastry (like a donut) and it was buy one get one! All around a great place for a quite treat.

Stopped off and had a steak pasty and can honestly say the very best lots of meat all the way through and a vey crusty pastry, also wasn‚Äôt all running with juice inside , beautiful !!!! üòäüòäüòäüòä

Review Title: Best breads and pastries in the area
Review Text: Everytime i‚Äôm in the area on a walk I have to pop by for a pastry on the way back - honestly the best pastries and breads from Quay Bakery. They open nice and early too so if you‚Äôre staying locally it‚Äôs handy to pop over for extra breakfast bits!  I was staying in Fowey last week and their Carrot Cake was delicious!
Best pasty in Cornwall? I think so. Freshly made throughout the day so always at their best. A bakery I wish I had close to home

The most fabulous bakery, worthy of positive comparison with the very best. 
The breads are delicious, as are the pies and cakes. I doubt you can pass this place, even from just looking in through the window!
We stayed opposite Quay bakery so visited each morning for bread and pastries for breakfast. Everything was delicious and freshly baked - the bread made the best toast ever

Review Title: The best of Cornwall in a Crust
Review Text: We can only echo the glowing reviews. You can taste the quality in every mouthful. My husband loves Cornish pasties, but so many these days are disappointing. Those at the Quay are exceptional. No searching for steak with a microscope, unlike so many others. Lovely chunks of quality local ingredients in both varieties of pasty, encased in delicious buttery pastry. They clearly stick to what they are best at and only sell top products, which they obviously love when you talk to them about what they make.  We tried one of each and then had to go back after an hour or so to get more to take home! Such a treat.  We're sad that we can't get some delivered, but possibly just as well for our waistlines.
Saw the window display and could not walk past. Everything looked amazing. Settled on a Cinnamon bun and Pain au Chocolate‚Ä¶both delicious. Had I been able to eat more I would have spent a fortune!

You need to try a Almond Cruffin! 
So so tasty & better then a Waitrose croissant! 
Also the bread is delicious and soft especially the ciabatta loaf!

Bought a traditional pasty and a cheese and onion pasty for tea that evening, got home and cut them in half, ate the traditional first, very nice, good gravy even when cold, great pastry too, very crisp.
Now the cheese and onion pasty, hands down the best cheese and onion I've had, the crimp tasted like a cheese straw, so good, will be back soon.
The best bakery in Fowey, we visited here in a couple of times. Delicious bakery treats and good prices! Would certainly recommend to others

We stopped in early in the morning to pick up for snacks for our hike. Our experience is that when you arrive early to a bakery you are able to purchase what what fresh baked that day. I was given items that were left over from the previous day, when I asked for the fresh ones I was told that that is not how it is done, that everything isn't made fresh daily and that I had to take the one she was giving me. In the end, the items that we purchased were above average. I had simply hoped for items that were fresh baked.
We used the bakery for fresh rolls whilst staying in Fowey. The malted rolls were very lite and flavoursome. The chiabata rolls complemented the lasagne from Kittoes oerfectly

We found it impossible to walk past this bakery and I'm glad we didn't. The best pasty we've had all week, buttery pastry and chunky steak & veg. All homemade on site (out the oven at 11am) clearly with a lot of love. 
The rosemary and salt focaccia was also very yummy, a great 'side' to my pasty :)
Honestly the best pasty I have ever had in Cornwall. It‚Äôs filled to the brim with chunky veg and meat. I honestly wish I lived in Cornwall as I think about this pasty every time I‚Äôm home!

So wonderful to find a bakery in which the bread and pastries were cooked and prepared in house. 
Loved the bread, cakes and focaccia
When I go to Fowey I get so excited because I can go to this amazing bakery. The food is always  freshly baked and there is a great selection of baked treats. My favourite !

This bakery should come with a health warning, you just cannot resist once you have tasted their Cinnamon buns, and treacle tart. Had to call in again at 8am and take extra supplies home after our holiday !

We had their traditional pasties for lunch today after reading the rave TA reviews.
Yes, they are large, but are nowhere close in taste to those from most others we have eaten in Cornwall - the filling was dry and the pastry was so so.
Maybe this was an off day for the bakery.
Recommend this bakery all the choices are top quality . We had pasties and walnut and rosemary loaf - wow !!!!

What a fantastic bakery, great choice of fresh produce. Had the best Cornish pasty ever, obviously home made, great pastry with great filling, potato, suede, and beef, very traditional.... yum yum üòã
Fantastic local bakery, with delicious bread, croissants, scones, pastries and of course pasties. The meat pasty is very good and huge! They have a veg option too.

Review Title: Fowey is extremely fortunate to have this bakery
Review Text: Bread, morning goods , pastries and pasties all baked in the premises. Extremely popular with locals and visitors alike. Fowey is extremely fortunate to have this bakery
A great place to buy a wide variety of bread, cakes and pasties of course. We returned home with a sourdough loaf as used  for toast in our hotel
Delicious selection of pasties, cakes and scones served by friendly, fun staff. We called in on 3 occasions; the snacks were so good.

Had my first traditional Cornish pasty in Cornwall today. Couldn‚Äôt have picked a better place to try. The pasty was the size of my head (I have a massive head) would definitely get one from here again. 10/10

Excellent top quality bakery with wonderful sourdough and a good selection of speciality breads and sweet treats. The "cheesy feet crackers" make a delightful addition to any cheeseboard and their friendly staff make a visit to Quay Bakery a very pleasurable experience!
The best pasties I‚Äôve ever had üëçüëçüëç what can I say,  they are absolutely massive üôÇ we bought 2 steak and 2 cheese and onion. Both were delicious and very filling
This little bakery makes the biggest pasties I‚Äôve ever seen! I bought a cheese and onion one and thoroughly enjoyed it. Absolutely delicious. I look forward to a return visit.

Review Title: A hot tasty treat & supporting local.
Review Text: The best bakery with the most delicious Cornish pasties. You have to try one. They‚Äôre huge and tasty. We sat in the rain watching over the harbour with a hot pasty. Can‚Äôt get better than that !

We bought pasties to keep us going on The Hall Walk. About halfway round we ate. I managed only half of mine (they are large!), and saved the other half until we were sat outside The Lugger in Polruan with an earned pint. Lots of mat and veg, and very tasty.

On another day we bought fruit scones for a cream tea, we found the scones to be a good size and light, not at all dense which you sometimes find. 

Their loaves look traditional and very good, but we didn't have the opportunity to try the bread.
Ignore any signs at other bakery's, this one has the best pasties! Traditional pasty and saffron bun ..... lunch done!

We tried so many of their products but my favourites in order were the cinnamon bun, the carrot cake and the steak pasty.  The cinnamon bun was moist and mouth-watering.  The carrot cake was rich, sticky and the icing creamy.  The pasty did have hard edges but who eats that anyway, it's the centre full of chunky veg and large pieces of meat which was juicy that I enjoyed.  I cannot tell you which my lurcher liked as he didn't turn his nose up at any of them.  If I wanted a reason to return to Fowey this bakery would be the reason.
We were passing and couldn‚Äôt resist getting some goodies to take back to the lodge with us - lots of choice - snacking flavours. The pasties we had were huge!

We are Fowey regulars and have seen this baker move from smaller premises into their current location. Their bread is fantastic (especially love the rosemary and walnut loaf) as is their millionaires shortcake. Strongly recommend a visit!

We only ever had bread and treacle tart before.Had steak pasties for the first time today.
Having visited Cornwall for many years we have eaten or tried a great many pasties.
Quay Bakery pasties were  excellant and our favourite.Lovely golden pastry not thick and stodgy,plenty of steak,loved the new potatoes,tasty swede,well seasoned.Scrumptious
Lovely pasties amongst other things. Good to see a small business continue doing well at this time and should be backed-up by residents and visitors.
Popped in for a loaf of bread, very tasty and fresh. Would recommend a visit as well worth it. In fact I am just about to make some toast with last bit of this loaf - yum
Pasty was very nice. Huge! Thick crust but the filling had plenty of meat and nice big chunks of veg. Walnut & carrot cake was great and the scones were lovely too. Friendly service.
Queued up for ages to buy 4 very mediocre pasties . Two steak two cheese . All very dry and lacking in taste . Had far better and paid far less .
Definitely the best Pasties in Fowey and so far probably the best in Cornwall would highly recommend

Friendly service..... saffron buns, scones and the sourdough bread are worth trying. 
Everything freshly baked.
Local bakery with a good selection of goods.  We had scones and saffron buns - no complaints - delicious.

I am in Canada and my mother is in Cornwall, I like to support local when I can. I wanted to order a banneton kit online but it was out of stock. I emailed and Nicola immediately made another kit available. I ordered it and then she emailed to offer an alternative delivery to make things easier. She was super helpful and fun to deal with. Thanks again! Next time I am home and in Cornwall, I'm coming in to say Hi! :)

The plain sourdough is excellent, keeps really well and makes brilliant toast. All the cakes we tried were superb, especially the Millionaire's Shortbread (of which we ate far too much!). We went in every day we were in Fowey... don't miss it!

We brought items here a few times to take with us for picnics.

We esp loved the bread pudding, paradise slice and sausage rolls.

Items were flying off the shelf when we went in the morning.

Visited several times over our stay, tried many items! Sourdough loaf was lovely, great selection of other breads and rolls too. Sampled the Billionaires Shortbread (rated family favourite) millionaires shortbread, bakewell tart and scones. All very tasty. Noticed they also sell jams and chutneys. Yesterday‚Äôs bread offered at a cheaper price too. Very friendly knowledgeable staff, would definitely recommend ‚ù§Ô∏è. Contactless payment available.
Stayed for a few days in a holiday cottage opposite.  One of the daily highlights was the warm saffron rolls with my coffee, absolutely best way to start any day!!!

Popped in for a snack and had veg saucesage rolls. Confirmed carnivore loved them.

Very friendly staff.

Really tasty sour dough bread. So glad I bought here rather than in a chain!  Friendly staff and one-customer-at-a-time policy to keep everyone safe.  Look forward to next trip here for more great breads
Great selection and quality at the best prices in Fowey. Bypass the ones closer to the quay and head for North Street
Great COVID queing system, very quick service, and huge pasties ... went down a treat on a sunny summers day

Review Title: Fantastic Food, severely let down by lack of COVID-19 protection
Review Text: I always get a pasty from this bakery whenever I'm in the area and it was phenomenal! There really is nothing like a genuine cornish pasty. I was served on this occasion by a polite and nice young man (I didn't get a receipt so I didn't get the name) who was more than happy and helpful when answering questions we had about the town, on a different visit I was served by a nice young lady by the name of Daisy (as it says on the receipt), and on a visit in March was served by another warm staff member by the name of Hannah. I could not fault these members of staff as they were polite and friendly. However, really unfortunately this bakery is severely let down by it's COVID-19 protection. Only the young man who served me was wearing a face mask, even after it was made compulsory to wear a mask in shops. Within the shop there was little to no care for virus protection, there was a social distancing square for the shopper to stand on (that wasn't enforced by staff) and a hand sanitiser dispenser that was empty. On a previous visit I was told by a friendly member of staff that she believed that wearing masks was ineffective and that the coronavirus was a myth, which I think was the mentality when re opening this bakery. Fantastic food, but this bakery needs to realise that a pandemic is currently happening and protect their customers.

Sorry but must have been unlucky today. When we cooked the Pasty there was virtually no meat in it. Incredibly disappointed having seen the reviews. If I was staying in Fowey I would have gone back to complain.

Pipped to the last few traditional cornish pasties by the visiting Royal Navy, so forced to take a couple of Cheese ones..... all I can say is Thank You Royal Navy.... ü§§

AM.... AZ.... ING!

So much so that without tasting the traditional, I happily put in an order for 20 to bring back home, along with 8 Cornish Gouda... only stopped ordering more due to the size of the pasties and limited car and freezer space back at home.

Other highlights include the bread pudding, bakewell tart and scones.

A must visit if you're in Fowey.

Caveat, these pasties are hand made, so a little rustic in appearance and if you don't like chunky filling, go for the mass produced, wafer thin sliced content of other establishments.... and leave these pasties for those who appreciate heartily filled and lovingly crafted fare.

Review Title: A pasty the size of your head!
Review Text:
Always have to get a past from here when going past, they are amazing! 
Great value for money and taste is incredible! 
Quite often get stopped and asked where I got my pasty from!

One of the best pasties we have eaten.
A little bakery down the main street, with a hdddle of people waiting outside, is always a good sign. 
Freshly baked pasties sat in the windos enticing you in. We bought a traditional pasty and a Gouda and onion pasty too. 
Takeaway only, which is the perfect excuse to go find a place to sit and enjoy the surroundings your in. 
A light, buttery pastry with good size chunks of meat and veg inside. Did I mention, the pasties are huge, very good value. 
Other bakes, such a breads, sausage rolls and sweets also available, they looked very lovely too!
This is a must visit when you go to Fowey
Lovely fresh bread and delicious freshly baked pasties. We also like the Cornish saffron buns! Friendly staff.
Fantastic bread and a wide choice.  We picked up a fresh loaf every day over our weeks stay in Fowey, didn't go anywhere else.

The quality is quite outstanding.  The bread is perfect, it melts in the mouth, I also bought a couple of their overnight bread rolls which were so light but with real flavour.  I suppose that as with many it is their pasties for which they are best known.  I had the Cornish Gouda and onion, which was huge and packed full of tasty veg, it served as my main meal of the day.  I was staying opposite and as soon as I saw them appear in the window I crossed the road to buy one.  It was wonderfully hot and still was as I got towards the end.  Helpfully they put a notice up to tell you when the pasties will be out of the oven.  Oh as a treat before coming home I bought a piece of their bread pudding and I suppose that it goes without saying that it was the best bread pudding I have ever had, no skimping on the fruit with this, wonderfully moist and flavoursome.  Quay bakery is simply one of the best bakeries I have ever come across.

Best Pasties in Cornwall....a must always when you‚Äôre in Cornwall and I‚Äôve had a few over the years, however, these are the best I‚Äôve tried. Massive chunks of tender beef, delicious vegetables and seasoned perfectly! Will come here again to take some home with me!!

I visited here in November 18 and then again recently in Sept 19. We stay in Looe but make a visit here to buy some banana and five muffins but unfortunately they didn‚Äôt have any. We tried the pasty instead and wow - best pasty I‚Äôve ever had in Cornwall! We will be returning again in February during our stay in Looe.

Well. What can we say. What a lovely little bakery this is. I can honestly  say that we had never had a Cornish Pasty this big ever. And it was packed with flavour. It was a meal in it's own and after eating them we had to skip dinner untill very late. Best pasty by far so far.

I walked all around Fowey looking at the many pasty offerings. We were drawn into this bakery by a) the fact that it was an independent b) the generous size of the pasties (with - hallelujah! - a non-traditionally THIN pastry 'handle' ) and c) the variety of pasty. We had Cornish Gouda and red onion pasty and it was absolutely delicious; the cheese was tangy, the onions generous and the pastry thin and crumbly. There were lots of other enticing-looking things like sourdough baguette and bread and butter pudding. A real bakery is a delightful thing.

Lovely little bakery ! We had a delicious ‚Äòstill warm‚Äô traditional Cornish Pasty - enormous ! Plus I was piggy and got a slice of their Bakewell tart meaning to save it ‚Äò for later ‚Äò ( no chance ) it was so light ! The pastry was perfect the filling was perfect !
Highly recommend!
I'm giving it a good rating as we got there round 4pm and it was pretty empty thus I assume it must be good. We managed to get a rosemary Foccaccia though and it was delicious.
Excellent bakery in the heart of Fowey. Their traditional pasties are amazing, perfectly seasoned and will definitely not leave you hungry! Treacle Tart and Brownies were delicious too.
The fresh bread is fantastic and would strongly recommend their seeded loaf- the chicken pasties are out of this world though! If only I could get these now I am back home... well worth a visit

I thought that the Christmas panettone was flavour fantastic (I bought 10 of them for friends). Then we tried the Bakewell tart last week which was superb - nice short pastry not too much jam lots of almonds. All this and best bread for miles.
Nice choice of freshly baked goods - Sourdough loaf soft when fresh and made great toast later in the week.

Fresh local produce, the bread, rolls, saffron buns and bread and butter puddings were delicious, to name just a few few of the freshly baked delights on offer. The staff were friendly and helpful and the homemade jam to go with their scones was lovely.

Visited here several times during my stay in Fowey. All the bread and pastries were baked fresh on site (several other bakers would get daily deliveries instead) - starting with the bread early in the morning, about 9 for pastries, then the pasties about 10! Staff were friendly and informative, and the produce was simply stunning.
I wish we had had bought more products. This is the most super unassuming bakery. the quality and range of products is just superb. We willmost certainly return one day to sample more
Ambachtelijke bakkerij met echt ovenVERS brood van vele verschillende soorten. Daarnaast uitstekende patisserie. Prachtige presentatie van alle artikelen. Vriendelijke en snelle service.

Excellent bakery, wonderful bread, and pastries.
Staff friendly, and patient.
A must visit, any time you visit Fowey.
Fantastic bakery the bread is so fresh and tasty and the carrot cake is a must.If you buy anything it must be this.

Good job we found this bakery late in our holiday or it would have been a temptation to try everything. Freshly baked each day that's why pasties not ready till 11am but worth the wait and they are huge.

What a lovely bakery.   Everything we bought from there was delicious - just what bread should taste like.  Never tried the Cornish pasties but they looked amazing. A definite place to visit when you are in fowey.

We read reviews saying how lovely the traditional pasties are at Quay Bakery. We waited for them to come out of the oven and boy was it worth the wait! DELICIOUS. Good job we do not live in Fowey as we would certainly gain weight!
I bought a Bread, pasties and an impulsive purchase of bread and butter pudding.  Great produce and it's always good to invest in local businesses.  Should have bought another portion of the pudding!
This is a little gem.  All bread is baked on the premise.  A true artisan bakery, offering all kinds of cakes, bread etc.  Wish it was our local bakery, Fowey is so lucky
Lots of lovely bread and cakes to choose from and very tasty.  Pasties of different size and filings to choose from.

The best bakery in Fowey,  everything is great, Treacle Tart amazing.  Walnut and Rosemary bread another favourite - taken back from holiday to freeze for times when we need to remember what we are missing.  That leaves the regular bread which is also really good !

For my 50th Birthday my partner ordered a carrot cake from Quay bakery, knowing it was my favourite. 4 years on and it has become a tradition. If you love carrot cake, you will not be disappointed. Hands down this is the best carrot cake EVER !!!

This is buy far one of the best fresh bakers I‚Äôve ever come across. The taste of and softness of the bread I bought was outstanding. 

They make all the bread fresh on sight and one of my favourite things were the freshly made iced buns. Again exceptionally soft and delicious. I only wish this bakery was near my home. 

Will definitely return!
There is a really good selection of different breads here. The one we bought was really tasty and so fresh it was unbelievable

Worth visiting first thing in the morning for their freshly baked bread. Really friendly and I‚Äôm glad I don‚Äôt live nearby as I would be in there every day and putting on a lot of weight!!! Not that it‚Äôs unhealthy at all, it just all tastes too good!

Queued up for Pasties before lunch, had one traditional meat and one Guoda and onion, both delicious and huge. Also had a Saffron bun and the monkey muffin on a separate day which were also really tasty. Friendly staff and good atmosphere, you can tell they love what they do!

This bakery sells various cakes, even gluten free cakes, bread, pizzas and other Items too much to mention. The hot cross buns were extremely fresh, soft and of course delicious. You must visit when in Fowey. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Review Title: Delicious bakery with a range of mouthwatering breads, muffins , hot cross buns and many other delights.
Review Text: Went there every day of our stay. Fantastic breads, buns and pastries served by very friendly local staff. Don‚Äôt miss it!
A great bakery selling delicious bread, cakes and amazing Cornish pasties. Great for picking up lunch on the go when pottering about on the river.

We visited the Quay bakery during a short trip to Fowey.  The beef pasties were stunning and the seeded loaf we bought was beautiful, fresh and wholesome.  The staff were friendly and helpful.   We would thoroughly recommend it!
Buy their marmalade - you won't be disappointed!  Amazing bread and cakes, but it doesn't stop there.  Their preserves which they make themselves are out of this world.
Wow, we are sooooo lucky to have Quay Bakery in Fowey. Love everything except the small white tin. Rosemary and Walnut loaf personal favourite

Want  good bread?
Want exceptional bread?
Want bread that's better than anywhere else?
This is the place!
If you think the bread is good, try their pasties and cake!!!!
Always great selection of tasty flavoured breads and pasties.Staff always friendly and helpful.  diet starts when i get home.
All the bread is made and cooked in House they also make the best pasties I‚Äôve ever eaten, on top of this their cakes and buns are delicious too.

Review Title: Tastiest Pasty in the West Country
Review Text:
I consider myself a connoisseur of pasties (hahaha) and I'm from Devon, but the pasties from the Quay Bakery are probably the best I've ever tasted anywhere.

Also the bread is magnificent, and the service is so friendly.

Thank you!

I have been enjoying the breads since this place started, and thoroughly recommend them!

They have recently started doing pasties, the only ones actually baked in Fowey. These are the best I have ever tasted ‚Äì the pastry in particular is amazing, perhaps unsurprisingly! Careful though, the big ones are massive!

The best bakery I've ever been to, by a country mile! Has anything anyone could ever want from a bakery, all fresh and prepared on the day! The cakes were to die for, especially the billionaires shortbread, which I have never had anywhere else and is now my favourite treat! Can't get enough of this place! Every town should have one!

Visited Fowey whilst staying in Looe. They have the Biggest pastry‚Äôs  I‚Äôve ever seen. We tried the banana and fudge muffins..  absolutely amazing. I would deffo recommend this place and will be returning. Very friendly staff too.

Bought walnut and rosemary round loaf here; long trip home to Essex and still fresh and soft but with lovely crust next day.  Kept half in freezer, just as good when defrosted.  Beautiful bread, huge pieces of walnut and rosemary not overpowering.  Recommended.

That‚Äôs it, the title says it all.........Beautiful Bread!
The giant Pasty‚Äôs have too much pastry and not enough meat but did I say the bread is beautiful!!

Had a pasty here whilst in Fowey. Large size, tad expensive at ¬£4.50, but nicely made and filling was very tasty. Would have been five stars except for the price and that it wasn‚Äôt very warm. Staff member very friendly.

Saw the HUGE pasties in the window & was instantly tempted in.
The pasties are made on the premises & wow, they are superb!
Would highly recommend.

Excellent food, their traditional pasties were one of the largest in town, their pastry is perhaps a little bit short, but the filling is excellent good size chunks of everything.  The saffron buns were really good, the Eccles cakes just a little bit flat but really nice.
Finally the staff were very cheery and helpful what more could you ask for.
Warm from the oven, couldn‚Äôt get home fast enough to cut the crust and enjoy with butter and jam. Can honestly say the best gluten free bread I have ever had. Delicious. Thank you.

have now popped in a number of times, and tried a few different breads and cakes, have settled for rosemary and walnut bread, plus bread pudding slices, just once a week. the food is great just like the service,

Fantastic bakers, sourdough is my favourite. The price is very favourable compared to London prices and the quality is better. Wonderful traditional pasties , we had the occasional treat of bread pudding

Many good points to this place, firstly came here with a friend who requires a gluten free diet and after ordering a loaf for the following day, they specifically baked one that was delicious. I usually hate trying gluten free bread but this was very edible!
The buns and cakes are delicious. Particular favourite is their iced buns. Legit!
Finally - they did a great thing helping fowey regatta with the pasty eating competition and giant pasty. Kudos!

What an amazing artisan bakery selling a good selection of breads and sweet and savoury treats. I had to resist buying one of everything, really, it all looked so tasty. I opted for some bread, lardy cake, saffron bun, bread pudding, scones and a sausage roll ( obviously not all eaten in one go! ) and nothing disappointed. I just wish they had a shop close to me.
Fantastic bread, fantastic scones, fantastic bread pudding, fantastic fresh pizza and fantastic service. Only regret is I didn't buy form here earlier in the week. Forget the rest and go to the best.

During a week in Fowey the Quay has become the subject of my morning preamble.

Croissant and pan o chocolate are tasty, also very large with a focus on flavour rather than perfect looks.

We had various types of bread and rolls, all good, while the pasties are large, flattish and encased in a delicious short pastry.

We tried other baked goods and nothing has disappointed!

Staff are very friendly and if you need a carrier bag then you can have one after donating to one of four charities with boxes on the counter.

I think we bought too many things from the bakery but all were amazing. We sampled the billionaires shortbread (creamy and not too sweet) the chocolate chip cookies (bit more like a shortbread but still perfect with a cup of tea) the sour dough (tastes fresh and has a good crumb) and a saffron bun (lovely taste but perhaps a few more currants would be good). My only disappointment is that it's too far from our home!
Been calling here for some years now whilst sailing in the West country.  Great bread and fantastic muffins - especially the monkey muffins.

We were staying just up the road and got into the habit of getting our breakfast from here. The bread was out of this world, absolutely gorgeous and far too ‚Äúmore-ish‚Äù! We also tried the saffron buns and cakes all of which were delicious! We will miss our lovely breakfasts very much but probably for the best to save our waistlines!

After walking around and enjoying a boat trip my teenage son inevitably hungry, went for this shop as lovely smell wafting out.  Pasties very generous sized, not too peppery and very tasty. The iced buns also very good but had to save them for later as too full after the pasties!!

I just don't have the words to say how fabulous this bakery is. We had the.monkey muffins for breakfast. Don't leave Fowey without trying one! The olive ciabatta is probably the best bread I have ever eaten - unbelievably light and tasty.

Nice enough place, very Kidsonesque. Quite expensive but you do expect to have your pants pulled down at this time of the year.
We found the pasty‚Äôs ok, they‚Äôre large, sparsely filled with minimal meat & woefully under seasoned.
Lovely bread but the best treacle tart ever!Friendly staff.Such a pity it is too far away to visit more often.Unfortunately Fowey is a very long drive from where we stay.
Excellent food and service. Lovely breads and cAkes .highly recommend if visiting fowey at any time.
Love going here.  The bread is to die for.  Especially like the focaccia rolls....yummy.  Can‚Äôt wait to go back tomorrow.

Just love this bakery.  Gigantic pasties that are big enough for two people. And their millionaires shortbread is just like you used to get at school. Not too sweet. Just perfect.  (Although they have taken to using dark chocolate on them, where I like milk chocolate).  I go here every time I am in Fowey.

Delicious traditional pasties and freshly baked breads and other treats.

Reasonably priced with friendly staff.

Be quick as the cornish pasties from here are extremely popular and seem to sell out fairly quickly.

Recommended.
Fab bakery, best I‚Äôve ever been to, freshly baked artisan breads and cakes, well worth a visit, best bakery in Fowey
We bought sourdough, bread pudding and treacle tart here - very tasty and well made.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Would use this bakery again. Thank you.
right in the heart of Fowey, on the main street..the bread, buns, cakes, croissants   all fresh and smelling just mouthwateringly good!!
Very friendly, everything fresh. Now reading all the other TA reviews, I wish we had bought more when stopping there!
This is just an outstanding bakery shop. For all types of bread and pastries. All made on the premises.

A true artisan bakery in the heart of Fowey. They serve a wide range of breads and cakes, all seemingly cooked fresh throughout the day. On the day we visited they had just baked trays of hot cross bun which must be the most sumptuous we‚Äôve ever tasted!

Want REAL bread? 
This is the place to go!
No chemical rubbish....real craftsmanship here. The bakers really know their trade.
And their pasties fresh from the oven are heavenly!

I had pinned my hope on finding a great pasty for lunch somewhere in Fowey. Quay Bakery weren't the first pace I checked out but they certainly delivered what I was looking for!

I (foolishly) didn't waste any time in devouring said pasty, so don't have any photographic evidence, but I did grab a snap of some of the fantastic breads on offer at very reasonable prices

Artisan bakery, friendly staff, professional service and great value...there is no substitute for serious quality versus the price you pay...here you have a mix of these attributes..great taste, value, quality...don't hesitate..go in and buy what you fancy...pasties from the oven at 11am...great cakes and pastries ...I defy you to find better quality breads..! DO NOT MISS THIS BAKERY ..it will be your loss if you do!!

This is a superb, small bakery who bake fabulous breads whether light and crusty, sourdough or others. Just to peer into the shop window is to salivate. If you can regard real, first class bread as the basis for a feast then this is the bakery of choice. I would prefer to dine on this bread accompanied by Montgomery cheddar  and farmhouse butter than go to some of the expensive restaurants in Cornwall.

And I'm not exaggerating. The rosemary and walnut bread is our fave but then again, I love the soda bread ... But then again, the croissants are beautiful, but then again, the treacle tart - amazing. You get the idea. 
Fantastic food, see you soon.

Went on a mission from Newquay to Quay Bakery looking for the perfect Cornish pasty.. As it came up on Trip Advisor with great reviews we thought it would be the place to go and worth the drive.. Got there at 2pm and only one steak pasty left in the shop, disappointing for a family of 5, more annoying was a minimum ¬£5 spend to use a card.. Pasty was ok when warmed up, not the best, personally not a fan of large chunks of meat and veg, I prefer the fillings small diced, but it was not offensive and tasty enough.. Customer service was very good, just a shame there wasn‚Äôt any food.. Very tight streets for a large car, parking just opposite but plenty had parking tickets so be aware...

Popped in for the always delicious Rosemary & Sea salt focaccia bread- DELICIOUS. 
Also treated us to a bread flute/stick, freshly baked.  Light & fluffy inside with a delicious golden crust perfect for a slab of cheddar & ham.  
I also bought 2 hot cross buns, not tried yet but gleaming & full of fruit.
The best treat was the Treacle tart , gooey & heavy perfect with a dollop if Cream it custard.  We only bough 1 slice then had to share  We will be back to purchase more. 
Very friendly lady who served me a fantastic little shop, we always pop in when in the area.
Food is fresh and very tasty. Staff were helpful choosing items. Gluten free items limited but available.

They cool good fresh proper pasties, saffron cakes and the like.
No messing around, if you want the proper stuff this is as good as any
Lovely bakery, great bread and cakes. I recommend the banana muffins! Right in the centre of Fowey and friendly staff.
Popped in today looking for a quick bite... Wow amazing, clean and amazing food served by clean helpful staff... What more do you need... Definitely worth a visit for the monster pastys!
Excellent choice, great bread and pastries we always pop in for bread and a slice of bakewell tart when we visit Fowey. Great people as well!

Review Title: Bread baked on site. Beautiful local specialities
Review Text: Bought bread to bring home with us. Beautiful range of flavours. Wide choice, in fact we were spoilt for choice!
Lovely staff and food. Certainly worth a trip. Will go again next time im in town. Well done guys   fabdabudochas
Must try their bread and cakes - really very good.  Very fresh and well priced also good customer service.

Review Title: The best gluten free bread I've ever tasted!
Review Text:
I discovered the GF bread at this bakery when on holiday a couple of years ago. We come every year and it's become a highlight of the trip. 

This might sound daft, but if, like me, you've been gluten free for 15 years you really appreciate these things!

My wife says that the regular breads are exceptional too.

The best place in Fowey for Bread - but not the cheapest ! They continue to do a range of bread, pastries, Cornish pasties and other delicious goodies (Saturday is Monkey Muffin day by tradition) . Savoury or Sweet tastes will be accommodated. The taste experience never fails to be satisfied.  
The staff are always happy to please and explain the various tastes, fillings and treatments.

Good steak pasty. Excellent saffron rolls and baguette.  There are a string of bakeries within 50 yards of each other on the main street. The service here was great and it looks like the owners take their authentic baking seriously.

Review Title: You have to order gluten free
Review Text: Trip Advisor mentioned this bakery as a place that does gluten free so we visited. Unfortunately they only do gluten free if you pre order which is no good for travellers

You cannot get better bread anywhere else but from Quay Bakery. Try the fabulous walnut and rosemary loaf, the pasties and muffins. Saturday's see the delicious Monkey Muffins a treat to die for. When my family are down in Fowey we often buy 20, they are so good.
Soooo good, you could spend so much in here, I just wish I had one in my town. We bought wonderful breads and pasties several times whilst on holiday.
Pasties are a joy, as is the overnight raised bread and everything else! They do gift vouchers, too!
Best bakers in town. Freshly prepared, friendly service and good prices. You won't be disappointed. Difficult to recommend just one thing so try anything you fancy. It's all good quality.

Review Title: Realy good bread and more tempting things too
Review Text: Bought items here nearly every day of our stay. Staff always friendly and polite as well as knowing their products. Really good
There are cheaper, (mass produced food) bakeries but if you value quality, this is the place to shop.

This bakery is just the best .Tastiest bread and baked goods ,super range ever expanding and changing . Lovely service . Authentic  premises baked goods satisfies global tastes in a local little shop you must visit

I brought 2 pieces of bread pudding and ate them while walking around fowey . I was so impressed by the taste,texture and moistness that I popped back to buy some more. The experience was so great that I had flash backs of my childhood from when my nan used to make it. So thank you so much for the pleasure and I will be returning.
Great food, the saffron buns in particular, but basically everything we'd had from here was a dream. Freshly baked on site, and served from breakfast time onwards

We visited this bakery as it is an independent outlet, and being bakers by trade it is always interesting to see what is on offer.

We were not dissapointed, all products are freshly made on the premises and look amazing. What we purchased was very yummy.

The presentation of all the products looked very eye catching, and were very reasonable in price. The cleanliness of the shop was very good and the sales assistants were very friendly.

You must visit and try!!!
Honestly fantastic. The muffins are really rich and yummy and they're always different and fresh. The bread is still warm from the oven and it is the best bakery in Fowey. Highly Recommend!!!
This bakery now located within the main street of Fowey is a great place to buy a vast range of great breads and cakes.  the various breads are really nice and we always buy some when visiting Fowey.
We enjoyed 2 enormous steak pasties from here. They were delicious. They also do cakes,  we had the millionaires shortbread..it was AMAZING.
By far the best bakery in Fowey offering a very wide range of breads cakes savouries including excellent pasties, this high street bakery bakes everything on the premises, nd id Highly Recommended

Fantastic bakers for your breakfast necessities  or lunch!  Fresh bread, croissants, pastries!
Visited most days of our holiday
Simply the best for flavour and such variety . you must go there. Every thing is cooked the night before so get there early before they run out !!
Popped in to this bakery picked up some cheese scones,treacle tart and farewell tart lovely friendly staff and all the bread etc looked lovely and the choice was hard.

Really excellent pasties, I can recommend the steak and Stilton pasty it was so delicious!

Really good cakes too

I fell in love with Quay Bakery. The bread is fabulous, with so many different varieties. We had rosemary and walnut bread and a rye sourdough. I would have visited every day if I could! We shared a slice of treacle tart which was delicious but the sweetest thing I've ever eaten. The baker has a real talent. Wish it was in my home town!

Review Title: On a envie de tout go√ªter !
Review Text:
Les diff√©rents pains, brioche.... en vitrine donnent envie de pousser la porte de cette boulangerie. Le choix est difficile car on a envie de tout go√ªter ! L'accueil est tr√®s chaleureux.
