Les scones aux fromages sont d√©licieux, les foccacia aussi tout comme les brioches au safran et orange confite. Le pain est aussi tr√®s bon, bien qu'un peu lourd.

Just grabbed a fruit scone from here for the car upon leaving Fowye. Didn't have jam or clotted cream but it was very light and so tasty! Did not try anything else but would highly recommend. They clearly freshly bake everyday, but this was about 2.30pm and it still tasted great which is a mark of a great baker!!

Looking for a traditional Cornish pasty, you are faced with quite a few options in Fowey.  We chose to go into a local bakers, rather than the 'chain', and take them home.  What stood out for us, is they gave the time the next batch of pasties would be ready on a blackboard outside the shop!  
Buying them when they were still warm, we actually took them home, and heated them up the next day.... and they were delicious!
NB, we had one traditional steak, and one cheese and onion (veggie).
I visited here when on holiday the cakes are amazing and the bread so fresh. Highly recommend if you are in fowey.
Excellent fresh baked bread and cakes. We bought our bread from Quay whenever we passed. Good choice with friendly service.

Review Title: But as many cheesy feet as you can!!!
Review Text: We search far and wide for the best cheese biscuit and quay bakery has won the title!! We wish we could buy 100 packets and take them back to Australia to copy! Thank you quay bakery!!!
Recently started to make pasties- they are the best ever! Large, well filled and top quality ingredients.
They are open very early selling their just made breads, muffins, croissant, foccacia - wild garlic/ caper.  they also sell a range of flours, jams, honey, etc.
The bread here is amazing and the staff are lovely. They also sell baking equipment and a variety of flours. Good to not just have another chain.
Pasties are delicious so it is well worth a visit. Doughnuts and cream cakes look amazing! Freshly baked bread smell hits you before you see the shop.

Love this bakery,  such a great selection of bread and cakes it was hard to decide what to have.  One day I went in 5 times!! It was getting embarrassing.   Hot cross buns were the best I have ever had.   Lovely staff too.
Situated in pictures Fowey, the variety and quality of greets were very welcome on a cold windy day.

Nice homely, friendly welcome
Good selection of breads. The foccacias were lovely -a real treat. We will be back.

Review Title: A shop window display difficult to ignore
Review Text:
Found myself inside the bakers purchasing Walnut and Rosemary bread,Saffron buns and Banana Fudge Muffins. 
All delicious and consumed very quickly. 
Happy that this bakery is not close to where we live!
But I know we will find ourselves back here. 
Recommended
We loved the focaccia bread baked daily; we missed not trying the caper version so we haven't live yet!

Review Title: Gluten Free Bread to beat the rest
Review Text: During a recent holiday in Fowey we discovered this bakery and were told we could order gluten free bread, it is baked on the premesis. We did and it was so delicous, the best i have ever enjoyed so we ordered four more loaves for our last day to bring home. It has frozen well as half loaves. I wish i lived closer to get more. Lovely staff too and and enticing layout to the shop.

I'll let the food do the talking here!

Rosemary focaccia, light, golden bread with crunchy salt crystals on top. As you bite into it, you get small bursts of olive oil flavour melting in your mouth. The pungent fragrance of fresh rosemary. Without a doubt the best I've ever tasted. 

Sourdough loaf. A beautiful big patterned loaf with a thick chewy crust. Really good flavoured bread with a very distinctive and delicious 'sour' aftertaste. Truly fantastic!

Billionaires shortbread. Light and crumbly shortbread with a thick layer of soft flowing caramel and crunchy good quality chocolate on top. Lovely big squares of the stuff. Too delicious to adequately describe. 

Staff friendly and helpful, excellent range of produce. 

A 'must go to' shop if you are visiting Fowey.

We walked past on our way up the high street and immediately noticed the rosemary and sea salt focaccia. We purchased some on our way back and took it home. It was absolutely divine. The kids loved their Billionaires shortcake, white chocolate instead of milk!
And the overnight tin loaf was perfect for toast! An old school bakery with amazing bread!

This shop was almost opposite our hotel and althought I had just had a very good breakfast I could not resist their cheese scones in the window they are delicious.
The window display will get you every time.

Popped in for a steak pasty to share, medium size was ample although they do larger versions and offer other fillings. Has other hot food on offer but when the town is busy I suspect they are liable to sell out of things. Has a small seating area if you wish to stop and have a drink as well or instead of.
Not only does the bread look good it tastes great too. They make a great variety of breads here and they all looked lovely.

The Quay Bakery is absolutely AMAZING! They have anything that could possibly want! They have their specialty monkey muffins which are a delicious cinnamon brown sugar almost pastry donut which are out of this world! They also have a great and not overpriced gluten-free bread which was perfect for my friend with a gluten intolerance! I highly recommend, it is the BEST Bakery I've been to in Cornwall & is soooo much better than the other Bakery in Fowey Niles!

The chocolate muffins in the shop window caught our attention but once inside, the almond slice, cheese pastries and delicious bread just had to leave with us. Shame it was closed on Sunday afterwise would have purchased more

Absolutely mouthwatering smells abound as you walk in too this lovely quaint bakery, everything from scones to bread pudding. Tin loafs to Walut Boules, and not forgetting the much loved monkey muffin. I have never been disappointed with any of the bread or cakes purchased here.
A proper bakery!!! The smell of fresh bread as you walk into the shop amazing. You cannot visit Fowey without visiting this bakers

A cheerful welcome and a dazzling range of artisan breads. Their muffins are so yummy and were perfect for a pudding at our hog roast celebration last year. Their sourdough is excellent, as good as my husband's but keeps better.
Fabulous freshly baked loaves and an impressive array of old fashioned, traditional cakes daily. Saffron buns very popular too and if you can't find it, just sniff the air and follow your nose!
Great range of bread and cake to chose from, saffron bun was delicious as we're  the baps we bought, wish we had one of these where we live, really lovely produce

Review Title: Rosemary and Walnut bread to die for
Review Text: Lovely to see an artisan bakery in Fowey. The bread was delicious. Unfortunately I don't think the will be a year round market and the shop may struggle.

What a glorious find. Homemade goodies, bread pudding, jams, marmalades, honey muffins breads, cheesy feet and oh where to stop. Loaded up stuff to take home as could not decide what not to buy. Could do with this in my home village

One of those bakeries that lifts the spirits.  It has an interesting range of bread, rolls and cakes, a few things you won't see elsewhere, a good range of flours for sale as well as baking equipment - and a wonderful sense of flour hanging in the air, of a baker at work just behind you, of sacks open and spilling over: it's like childhood for those of us of a certain age.  Lovely welcome too.  The produce itself varies: we had some good bread but also some rolls that  looked better than they ate (far too stodgy).  We wait to see what the fascinating Cornish gouda focaccia are like.  Overall, though, a good experience.

Found this bakery 4 years ago.  Returned this year to find it had gone fortunately only moved on to the main shopping street.  Love the variety and flavours of the breads and cakes.  The foccacia with gouda and shallots were amazing this year.  When you queue for bread at 9.30am you know it's worth buying.
Bought some very nice Saffron buns and seeded soda bread. Very good value. Everything looked freshly baked and was displayed beautifully.
The produce is good but more then ¬£2.50 for a small white loaf is rather expensive , not sure if it is worth the extra
Glorious bread, rolls, pastries and cakes. The sour dough is fantastic. Best bread I've tasted in a long while
Lovely pasties and cherry almond croissants. Not sure why I have to make this up to 100 characters..
A very good choice of breads, lovely home made cakes too, well worth a visit. Took some bread back home to freeze as so good

We went to Fowey today and read the reviews.
They are so right!!!
Wish we lived there, so we could eat their bread every day!!!
üòÄüòÄ
Lovely artisan breads and the best croissants. There's a different flavoured muffin most days. The staff are always helpful and friendly.

We bought two loaves, a walnut and rosemary and a plain soutdough. They were both wonderful, light and fluffy inside and crunchy and a bit chewy on the outside. A bit disappointed with the chocolate muffin, it was dry and stodgy and I had to throw it in the bin. But compared to other bakeries where the bread looked terribly boring I do recommend this one.
Our Daughter has a dairy and soya allergy and it was so refreshing to find such good quality food with proper ingredients. Helpful knowledgeable staff a credit to the store

Great bread - try the Sourdough for toasting. Parking is difficult but worth the effort! We love this place and have never been disappointed. Combine their bread with sausages from Kittows for a perfect sandwich :)
More than just a cut above usual high street baker, this is in a league of its own. Excellent and consistent across its range. All bakeries should be like this.
Lovely cheese scone. Great bread. The smell will lead you to there door. All looks really tasty. Home bread makers must call in. Loads of different flours and sourdough starter kits.

This lovely bakery is right on my door step and I can be found here at least a couple times a week... If it's not for one of their lovely breads, or cheesy feet it's for the amazing monkey muffins on a Saturday! The guys here have a real talent for baking, whatever you chose you can guarantee it will be worth every calorie!
Fantastic selection of breads - sourdough to die for. Cutest little "cheesy men" biscuits for cheeseboard.  If you want to buy bread no competition. GO TO QUAY BAKERY!

We have always come here for their overnight boule, it makes the nicest toast we've ever had! We've also greatly enjoyed the sticky toffee muffins and today discovered monkey muffin, which if you like cinnamon swirls you will absolutely love these and wish you'd bought more! Staff always very friendly and polite too.
What a brilliant bakery. A vast selection of old fashioned proper bread to die for. A must visit if you are in Fowey.
Excellent range of bread. Very good quality. Friendly service.This bakery is definitely worth a visit.

You must go if you're in Fowey.
A highlight of any trip to - never have we been disappointed. 
Service is friendly and informative, and the food is all a-ma-zing. Breads, rolls, muffins, cakes, and biscuits are all great. Even bought a sour dough starter earlier in the year which was good too. Can't speak highly enough of this gem of a bakery.
We went here nearly every morning for bread and croissants - the seeded sourdough loaf is the best I have had- would recommend

Review Title: THE BEST BAKERY IN THE WORLD!
Review Text: A little gem right in the heart of Fowey, Quay Bakery is a truly amazing place with the best breads and pastries around. Make sure you go there on a saturday though, as that is the only day of the week when they make there insanely good Monkey Muffins. Monkey Muffins are basically are cinnamon bun bun in a muffin form and half of it is crousant and the other half traditional muffin.

Gluten free is awful ! As there seems to be any tasty bread ! It's one of those foods that is hard to live without!! So I struck gold when I found Quay Bakery they made a loaf of bread gluten free that tasted wonderful !! Just for me ! Thank you so much !! A little expensive but I can't live without my bread and butter !! Gluten free not so bad after all!!
Very tasty pasties, a pretty varied range too and not that expensive. There is a wide selection of pastie shops but the majority close early.

Spotted the Saffron Buns on the way back from an early morning walk, it was the only bakery open, they were just the best. Popped back in for their Focaccia  rolls later the same day just lovely, also brought their day old bread for toast, but used it for sandwiches, just so fresh and tasty. Can't wait to go back tomorrow.

I'm sure many of the other places are equally as good but we got into the habit of coming here each morning because it was the only place open early.  

We tried a variety of different loaves and all were superb.  Too good in fact as they were consumed rapidly meaning that I was up and down the hill like a yoyo!!
fantastic bread cakes pasties our son in law went every morning to get croissants bread and pasties best we have tasted and if there are any left late afternoon they reduce the price.
Really good selection of fresh breads here. Our children love the focaccia buns (or whatever u call them) as a snack more than anything else.
Great selection of bread and cakes. The Focaccia is delicious and assorted flavours are available on different days. Cornish Saffron Buns area  must to try too!"
This was always an excellent bakery, but even better now in their new premises in the high street. Amazing muffins, great artisan bread. Recommended.

This shop is great, friendly staff and delicious baked. Their ciabatta loaves and focaccia are great. They do muffins of the day, my favourite being their Saturday flavour known as 'monkey muffins'- delicious! But they sell out quick! Another must try is their 'cheesy feet'
Delicious bread,Tried to sample a bit of everything but was defeated!  Great scones, cakes, and agree that the Cheesy feet are really tasty.

Please put a covering counter over all the lovely fare in your window. We've got through all your covered and wrapped food (can thoroughly recommend the cookies!) I'm not alone in not wanting to buy food that is so exposed in your very busy (deservedly so) bakery.

I have never given highest score to any of my reviews before but I tasted this bakery's bread in the kings of Prussia and I had to go to their bakery and buy more of their delicious  panini and other types of bread. The only way you can understand what I mean is for you to try some of their breads!!!

We didn't want to sit in a caf√© for our afternoon tea, so, grabbed coffee from a takeaway and walked back down the road to get our cakes; treacle tart and bakewell tart.  They were delicious.  If I had been going home that day I would have bought bread aswell, but they are not open on a Sunday (good on them :-) ), so will have to wait until we visit Fowey again to try out more of their produce.  An excellent shop with very friendly staff and enticing shelves full of lovely grub.

Cheesy Feet are totally yum! Nom nom nom! Get the pack of 4 because you'll want them!

Lovely, reasonably priced scones and a beautiful Millionaires Shortbread!

Best bakery in Fowey!

Review Title: Amazing Treacle Tart and other goodies
Review Text: Lovely bakery.  I could have bought so much, but in the end bought the treacle tart and bakewell for our afternoon tea.  Great staff, so friendly.  Highly recommend.
Gorgeous carrot cake and scones - proper homemade scones that don't just crumble and don't taste dry. Lovely selection of breads, nice service and good price.
Just go and treat yourself!  Money muffins, bread, cake, we ate the lot and took a load home.  I wish they delivered!

Review Title: At Last, Gluten-free bread flour mix that makes real tasting loaves!!
Review Text: Bought cakes and gluten-free flour to take away. Delicious fare and the flour mix is definitely the most delicious and 'grit free' ever tasted - Worth visit just for Gluten-free!
Great local cakes, very reasonable prices and super helpful staff. A must stop and by one bakery if you are passing.

Review Title: Gluten-free bread and cakes?  The best around!
Review Text: My wife dreams about the freshly-baked gluten-free bread from here.  Place your order a day in advance and collect it hot and fresh from the bakery the next day. Simply the best around, as are the cakes.  The normal bread and cakes are fantastic too.  Not to be missed for all self-caterers in the Fowey area.

Every time I pop into Fowey, a visit to Quay Bakery is compulsory. Over time, I think I‚Äôve tried most of their offerings. 
Yesterday, I bought a cheesy foot and a chocolate chip cookie. BIG MISTAKE. I was mugged by my partner. So back to the shop to buy another 2 cheesy feet. Again, mugged, this time by a friend. Back to the shop for another cheesy foot. Just buy the bag of 4 if you want one for yourself.
I LOVE their focaccias. They rarely make the walk back to the car. If you time it right and get one straight out the oven ... simply heavenly. However, my new favourite has to be the walnut and rosemary boule. Now what can I put with it for lunch? Thank you Quay Bakery.

The bread is superb. Try the bread pudding, yummy.

Friendly welcome and top quality baking, we'll definitely be back for more.

Best bakery in Fowey bar none.  Their focaccia's are great for sandwiches, and their sourdough is excellent.  Highly recommend the marmalade as well - miles better than anything else you can buy.  Friendly service too - a real gem.

Review Title: you'll want to buy everything you see as you walk into the bakery
Review Text:
If you are in the area for a while you should head there every morning for the different muffins, they are stunning. I went down every day for fresh bread and treats and each and every thing I tried was delicious. 

I whole heartedly recommend this place for its wonderful food and friendly staff. You'd be missing out if you didn't go.

Review Title: Delicious indulgence. Try the monkey muffins!
Review Text: So delightful to see a wonderful independent bakery in the centre of Fowey instead of the usual chain bakeries. The Quay Bakery's window is packed with tantalising freshly baked temptations. Surely no one can walk past without being drawn inside?! We bought some wonderfully moist freshly baked bread, and couldn't resist the monkey muffins.... soooo delicious.
Bread, buns and tray bakes, choice changes daily, all hand made. Amazing to find such an excellent, proper bakers. Their sourdough is particularly delicious and the kids loved the focaccia.

The regular pasty (steak and veg) is the best I've tasted for a while. Other flavours look interesting - tried the chicken and leek and it was very good. Pasties are always warm and the coffee is good too!
Proper bakery! When you look in the window and you have to go in and make a purchase! Such a fab variety of bread on offer and muffins to die for! Everything made with love. Saffron buns were delish!

Review Title: Even better in their new home
Review Text: Such a delight to find a quality bakery making a huge variety of tasty items on site. Love the Rosemary and Walnut loaves, the bread pudding, treacle tart, croissants, cakes and far far more. An absolute treat
If in Fowey you must visit the Quay Bakery. Their bread is simply delicious, they have a great selection of breads and cakes

OMG! So much choice. Fabulous artisan breads, cakes and muffins. 
You even get a peek in the kitchen. 
We'd can highly recommend the banana and maple cake and the cheesey feet (you can taste the black onion seeds, there's is a hint of spice and PLENTY of cheese).

Tastes like bread should be with lower salt levels but still has a succulent taste.
I would highly recommend this bakery!

If you want to eat really beautiful bread, this is the bakers to go to. Also Muffins, scones, ciabatta and cheesy feet biscuits for children, you will find a real assortment of beautiful bread baked daily here.
We picked up croissants along with millionaires shortbread. Lots of nice choices of treats and cookies. Anzac biscuits were fresh and tasty!

Review Title: Best saffron buns in Cornwall - from a Cornishman
Review Text: My husband loves his saffron buns and he's tasted a few! This bakery makes the best he's tasted- praise indeed!

We dropped in to this place based on the very positive reviews on TA, and came away with some great pastries, including an amazing bread pudding.
Great fortification for the walk ahead.

Review Title: A must for your bakery, discovered too late, (sad face).
Review Text:
Bought numerous products from here yesterday 16/06/2016 and not one was disappointing, fruit scones,saffron buns(my first ever), cherry and coconut muffin,ciabatta rolls and brioche rolls that were less sweet than usual ones, these were ideal with crab pate bought from Pengelly's fish outlet in Looe, both complemented each other. 

If you are visiting this area then, this is a must for your bakery items. We are on holiday and unfortunately found it too late.

They do gluten free.

I visit Fowey a few times every year and this bakery is absolutely fantastic. Their tomato focaccia is a savoury delight, and their toffee muffins even had me licking the baking paper because of how tasty they were. The prices are great and their selection is quite big. You cannot miss this place if you are in Fowey.

Well where do I begin, we visit fowey regularly and this is a fantastic bakery. However a miracle occurred this morning when I tried their pre order gluten free bread, that miracle was the best toast I've had in years, words cannot express my joy in getting something that resembled decent bread.My partner has tried the malted tin loaf and said it was lovely but said the white tin was a revelation.Both focaccia breads are to die for and the carrot cake and bread pudding is delicious.If I lived here I would happily walk the hills to this bakery every day .
Big n fresh with strands of saffron in em,real beaudys! Next time we call into Fowey we shall definitely call into Quay Bakery
The sourdough light rye bread is excellent and the bread pudding yumptious. I wish I'd lived in or nearby then I'd be doing all my shopping here for breads and cakes.

Review Title: Great Gluten-free bread baked to order...
Review Text: They bake some of the best gluten-free bread I've tasted. Staff are helpful and lovely to deal with...

Scrumptious breads, cakes, biscuits - also jam and marmalade. You can even buy a kit and have a go at bread making yourself! Be sure to get there early in holiday time to get croissants and if it's monkey muffin day you're in for an extra special treat!

The bread you can buy at this artisan bakery  is simply delicious - the best I have ever tasted.  I keep coming back for more - which is not good for the waistline!   Pick it up in the morning while it is still warm, eat with butter melting into it and you will be an instant convert to "proper" bread!
Very good alert with a great selection of goodies and the staff were ever so friendly and helpful. Ideal to grab all you snacks and scones from!

Lovely freshly baked local bread. Highly recommend the walnut and rosemary loaf - it's amazing! Nice friendly service and beautiful loaves. They also have really nice baking goods and products - for yourself or a lovely gift

The aroma of baking draws you to the shop as one walks alone Fore street. Fresh bread and tempting saffron buns were the attraction as wells as large scones. Artisan bread for those who want choices. Gorgeous- could not resist sampling them before getting home.

We stayed in Golant for a week and were lucky to find this little gem on the first day.  The muffin of the day was sticky toffee with extra sauce, unfortunately we were too late as they had sold out.  We settled for the monkey muffins and later we discovered the delights of these wonderful creations.  We loved them so much we went back the next day to get more but they seem to make different muffins each day.  We tried the chocolate and ginger muffins with small chunks of ginger which  we had with custard (scrummy... )We also bought the seeded sourdough bread  which was lovely.  This is a delightful shop that fills the senses as well as the tastebuds. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful.  We will be back.
As a Coeliac I have to buy Gluten Free bread - it is NOT a lifestyle choice for me! I came across this bakery in Fowey and ordered their GF bread...it was excellent!

Great bakery  good choice  of  different  types of  products  friendly  staff  and must 
when in the area  get the garlic fucaccia.

Review Title: Stunning quality baking worth travelling miles for
Review Text: Well we fancied Fowey for lunch and found this lovely cafe on the outskirts of the town near where the car ferry docks.   Then a nice stroll into town to be seduced by the aroma of fresh baked bread.   What a fabulous place even early afternoon had a huge selection of outstanding fayre on offer.    Finished predictably with a very large sourdough and some stunning cake and biscuits all made on the premises.  What a treat!
Fantastic little bakery in Fowey. There tomato bread is lovely.  All freshly baked bread baked in the shop itself.

Wow the smells from this bakery are divine.  I buy bread from here each time we visit Fowey.   The rosemary& olive focaccia are very tasty.  Rolls & breads are baked daily & muffins of the day are also lovely.  Prices good & with a queue out of the door you know it's gonna be good.

Review Title: Great Bakery, One Of The Best Ever
Review Text: As a person who lives in Fowey, I go nowhere else for bread . Their bread is so unique to any other bakery & is a must see when visiting Fowey. You cannot miss Monkey Muffin Day or any Muffin Day. The 'Yesterday's Bread' Basket is a real bargain with everything being ¬£1.With a rolling pin door handle and cute little sign by a little boy named Bruno, I love everything in there it's just so good! :)

Review Title: The BEST gluten free bread I've ever had!
Review Text: You have to preorder gluten free loaves the day before, but I cannot more highly recommend the Quay Bakery!! My loaf was crusty, delicious, and deceptively GF - I've never had such a delicious loaf in my life. Definitely recommend to my fellow gluten free eaters!
Good quality bread products - as it should be. Bread absolutely delicious and cinnamon croissant muffins were fabulous!
Absolutely everything in this bakery is amazing even just plain bread is delicious, if your ever in need of breakfast, lunch or just a quick snack come here before any other bakery
Sourdough, cheese scones, millionaires shortbread and monkey nut muffins. All excellent. A destination bakery!

Review Title: Fantastic Bread and Monkey Muffins too!
Review Text: If you are a serious bread lover (like me!), you will love the quay bakery. Fantastic, fresh bread and pastries - if you are lucky enough try a monkey muffin, but get there early as they go in seconds, the best thing I've ever tasted!
Fabulous hot cross buns & muffins - traditional & gorgeous !! They have obviously used the best ingredients  and it shows.

Fabulous selection of bread ordinary and extraordinary plus muffins cakes pastries all baked daily on the premises . Sundries such as breadcrumbs biscotti and noisy mincemeat at Xmas all completely wonderful
I adore the bread and cakes sold here. Delicious! The bread pudding and saffron buns are particularly good.
Not cheap but worth it for the scent of fresh made from scratch bread and baked goods. Cheesy feet biscuits are one item to try- the name says it all but they are delicious.
Staff very friendly and food delicious. The pasties were fantastic, very well seasoned with a deal of six pasties for ¬£20. The scones were to die for. I would recommend.

Review Title: Not if your on a diet
Review Text: What a fantastic Bakery.  The Bread and Cakes are wonderful and so many things to temp you.  it is a must to visit if you are in Fowey.

Review Title: Great bread shame about the customer service
Review Text: Bread was lovely. Unfortunate that the girl behind the till had limited customer service skills bordering on rude.
The most delicious fresh baked bread and cakes ! We cannot resist visiting every time we come here. The smell wafting from this place is fantastic !

It's almost impossible to pass the bakery without buying something. Everything is freshly baked and the sourdough bread is particularly good, as are the muffins, croissants, rolls. They don't do pasties, but plenty of other places nearby do.
Great food! Not cheap (especially with a Niles across the road), but you get what you pay for and quality doesn't come for free. Treat yourself!

Simply the most delicious bread I have tasted in a very long time. If you are visiting 
Fowey give it a try. You won't be disappointed!
This is an artisan bakery where the bread is baked on the premises at the back of the shop.  The products are excellent - not to be missed if you are in Fowey
Ci siamo passati davanti, e siamo entrati subito per acquistare le focaccine al rosmarino che erano in vetrina.. troppo invitanti, e troppo buone. Cassiera gentilissima.
Was recommended to go to this bakery and wow brought some bread and saffron buns and I must say was well worth a visit

We bought a number of loaves when we stayed for a week in Fowey.
The bread was well baked and tasted delicious. Absolutely no comparison with in store baked supermarket bread! Real bread from a real baker.

One thing we struggle to find at home is genuine fresh bread cooked on the premises. The Rosemary and Walnut is a delight, and the scones the perfect accompaniment to clotted cream and strawberry jam. The millionaires shortbread and so much more make this a first class shop. The smell early in the morning as you pass nearby is a treat for the senses.
OOOOH fab bakery, get there early because the artisan bread sells out early - and there's a really good reason for that, it's because it's really good stuff.
Every day fresh lovely bread. Their fresh baked chibatta, crisp and like a dream. Absolutely the best bakery but both good bread and cakes. Visit and become adicted

Review Title: Go here for your bread products !
Review Text: Fantastic breads and cakes made in house every day- beautiful rolls, focaccia, muffins, soudoughs etc
Enjoyed the cheap 'yesterdays bread' basket. Delicious. Also saffron muffin nice. Staff friendly polite and professional. Tempting treats.

A superb bakery just off Fowey Quay, offering a wide range of fresh, delicious cakes and pastries.
On the day I was there, a banana caramel muffin to die for, was the speciality of the day; there are different choices on different days.
Everything they sell is tantalizing and they even have "Quay Bakery" hessian bags on sale, in which to carry your purchases.

I only looked in the window!  Somehow, a treacle tart, an almond slice and a piece of millionaire shortbread appeared in my hand. 

It's some kind of wizardry...

I intend to look in the window again!

Review Title: Artisan delight - Nearly missed this one!
Review Text:
It is all too easy to walk down the main street and go into the first bakers you come across but just walk a little bit further and you will be drawn in by the smell of focaccia baking.

The range of bread, cakes and biscuits just make you want to try them all. The quality is fabulous and the kids love the "Cheesy Feet".

A very warm welcome and a pleasure to visit.

Plus point - this bakery accepts card payments so you will just need to spend over the minimum. ..such a difficult situation to be in  (not) ..decisions, decisions!

We smelt the new baked bread before we found the bakery and once inside, were very impressed with the choice of loaves and goodies. We didn't need to buy anything but couldn't resist getting two cherry muffins which we had with coffee later in the day. They were delicious!
bread for a long way! A real treat. Don't forget to make a visit here on the way to the Quay, So many imaginative and healthy choices
Excellent selection of interesting breads and cakes/pastries. Absolutely delicious. A must try so well worth seeking it out.
Quite simply the best bakery I have ever been too. Shame there aren't more bakery's like this. Rosemary & walnut bread superb.
Great friendly service from the staff. Amazing range of breads, cakes and biscuits.  Recommend the Saffron Loaf.
Eine der besten B√§ckereien in Cornwall! Foccacia mit Rosmarin unbedingt probieren.Und erst das leckere K√∂rnerbrot. Wir waren begeistert!

Review Title: Great selection of breads & tasty scones
Review Text: A wide selection of breads and a nice window display too. The scones are very tasty as is the home made jam. Well worth a stop.

Review Title: Best little Bakery for miles and miles around
Review Text: Not only do they have some fabulous granary bread, but they made us up a gluten free loaf (with 24 hours notice). Try the Italian rustic 'sticks' absolutely delicious ... don't go anywhere else in Fowey for your bread ...
Wanted some traditional cakes for tea with friends. Choices change daily but the coconut Malibu ,treacle tart , bake well tart excellent. Not cheap but large portions and satisfying.

Review Title: Fab fresh bread in the heart of Fowey
Review Text:
Focaccia is divine rosemary & sea salt is fantastic.
Muffin of the day is a treat not to be missed.
The smell emanating from this bakery lures you its a must do it .
This bakery produces some very high quality breads using slow rise yeasts etc that would rate as five stars anywhere. Service is both warm, fun and knowledgeable.

The bread and cakes here are stunning, quality you really can taste. The walnut and rosemary bread is amazing, perfect with cheese and pate - the sour dough incredible - just add butter, it was supposed to be for toast but it didn't get that far. I am slowly working through the range including the muffins. I am not local so may take a while, worth the wait though.

Review Title: Best muffins, bread and pain au chocolat
Review Text: During our stay in Fowey we picked up many pain au chocolat's freshly cooked for breakfast along with their daily muffin. All were very good. I wish we had a bakery like this in our village.

A beautiful little bakery tucked away just off the main street in Fowey,well worth searching out ,heavenly muffins,pastries bread and scones and saffron scones ,everything is good,for a special treat go Saturday ask for one of these ,you will not be disappointed
Beautiful bakery with some fantastic cakes. I had a bakewell, treacle tart and two types of focaccia all were absolutely stunning

Review Title: Not exactly a restaurant but an excellent bakery
Review Text: Fresh delicious bread and a wide range of baked goods of many kinds. The quality is extremely good, making any purchase good value.

What a delightful selection of bread cakes and biscuits, could not resist the sourdough and came out with additional scones and bikkies, would have had more if able to eat them . I do like my bakeries and this is a gem

Review Title: Pretty much as good as a bakery gets!
Review Text:
Great bread, fresh, dense and full of flavour. The rye bread is our favourite, haven't got through all the options yet though. 

I'm very glad I can go here every day!

Love it!

We arrived in Fowey late on Friday afternoon. I was up early on the Saturday morning to get our beautifully fresh croissants for breakfast at 8.00am. As you approached the shop down Webb Street the smell of freshly baked bread was simply fabulous. What a truly fantastic bread shop - all kinds of bread baked freshly overnight (still warm at 8.00am), tempting cakes and some of the best bread rolls we have ever eaten. If only every small town had a Quay Bakery !

This is a bakery not a restaurant but it has the best saffron buns in Cornwall and you must try Monkey Muffins on Saturdays and Foccacia every day. I go to Fowey every year and this is some of the best food I have ever had. I can't wait for next year|
What wonderful bread.  Best I've ever had.  Recommend the foccacia rolls and granary loaves.  Mmmmm....

Once we found the Quay Bakery during our weeks stay we always dropped by to pick up some of their saffron buns to take with us for our day out sightseeing. They were just lovely, no need for butter or jam just on their own perfect. The bakery also does mufffins and loaves, but if you do not try anything else, just try one of their saffron buns, just lovely.
Fabulous rolls and really lovely scones.  The second year running we come here to pick up rolls and scones for tea. Same consistent quality in everything we have tried here

Whilst visiting Fowey we went into this bakery as it had a great display in there window. We said we would buy a sourdough loaf but we soon found we left with a bag full of goods. As well as the sourdough loaf we bought; cheese & wild garlic mini focaccia, Anzac biscuits and two of the best saffron buns I have ever eaten. I will definitely be returning.
This is the bakery of dreams. A wonderful, quaint and unassuming place with the most amazing selection of fresh bread and baked goods. One of the highlights of Fowey. An absolute must-visit.

This has got to be one of the best additions to Fowey, the baking is outstanding and the variety ....... a different muffin every day.  My routine dog walk also encompassed a trip to the bakery and they were kind enough to serve us from the doorstep!  (A hoop to fix the dig lead to would be useful)   Whilst we were there saw them fitting a "Flood door" sad to think how hard these small traders have to work so hard to get by once us tourists have gone, hope they do well.
1st class bread,the best indeed,superb tasting bread and scones.This bakery gave us some of the most tasty bread we have had,the taste of Cornwall.
The bread and baked goods at The Quay Bakery are second to none with the Monkey Muffins and Rosemary & Walnut bread being our favourites.
This is a brilliant bakery. Not only does the bread taste beautiful but the variety is excellent. The wild garlic pesto focaccia was devine!! Everything here is top quality - it's a must visit place.

The choice of bread you can see in the window of this fabulous family run bakery definitely tempts the taste buds, trying to choose is very difficult as I could have had 1of each loaf on show.
I eventually chose a large white unsliced crusty one & wanted to rip it up & eat it straight away, it smelt delicious!
I also bought 2 fruit scones to have with a cup of tea when I got home. I can honestly say this was the best bread I have tasted in a long time & the scones were to die for. The only quibble I have is that it was raining so asked for a plastic carrier bag to put my purchases in & was told this would cost me 10p!!!!! This is not a cheap bakery & then to be charged for a carrier bag when it was obvious my goods would not be edible if I didn't purchase one was a little off putting, however I wasn't going to let a little thing like that spoil my purchase.
Keep doing what you are doing Quay bakery you are certainly getting it right & on my next visit to Fowey I will definitely be calling in again.

You have to get down to Quay Bakery pretty sharpish in the morning to ensure that you're not too late for their croissants.  Sourdoughs are lovely, saffron buns divine....everything so fresh and delicious!!
We bought some little pasties from here and they were really tasty and a great smaller snack.  The bread looked and smelt delicious too and there was a wide array of cakes.

Wonderful choice of bread , cakes and rolls, and a family run business, early mornings the baking aroma draws you in like a Bisto kid!  Looking at the photo of when it was under water after last winter's storm, they have done well to have recovered so well.  We tried the foccacia, bread pudding, almond tarts and fruit scones.  They obviously start baking early in the morning, and say that if the bread/rolls etc are ready they will be quite willing to serve you. We find it is very important to buy from local sources when on holiday, and support all local businesses.
So much choice and although I only bought enough for our lunch I would happily munch my way through a week of different styles of baking!
Fantastic choice of freshly cooked bread and tasty tarts.    We particularly liked the walnut and rosemary cob loaf and just wish we had a bakers like this near where we live.   Excellent.
Title says it all - the pastry is fantastic.  The millionaire shortbread is superb, the other nice surprise was seeing ANZAC biscuits.
Great bread, rolls and cakes. We bought several loaves and some huge hot cross buns to take home with us.
Visited on 8/4/15 and stocked up on various breads, hot X buns and scones. All excellent and did not last very long, going back there tomorrow........TD
What a surprise to find a baker like this in a little town like Fowey. And a great choice too. Good, wholesome bread is alive and well. Long may it last!
Perfect for picnic treats! We loved the flapjacks, ANZAC biscuits and the bread and butter pudding is a delight! Planning on driving from up north for a slice of that!!

Feeling peckish. We popped in for some shortbread. Only had the millionaires no plain.
Never mind came out with a 'CHEESE FOOT,PANATONE BREAD PUDDING and a SPECIALITY TREACLE COOKIE.

[Be careful of the low step in. Slipped and went down on my heel and hurt my back]
I collected some bread before leaving for home at 7.00am, the girl serving was very friendly, the bread just baked, hot and so tasty.

bought some ciabatta and ficaccia from this bakery yesterday, I am Italian and always look for good Italian-style bread, well this bakery makes better focaccia and ciabatta than some bakeries in Italy!! recommend it

Review Title: Real Artisan Bakery - A gem of a place
Review Text:
Found by smell ! ! - bought two loaves a Walnut and Rosemary Boul and a Rye Battard.

We tore some of the walnut bread off before we left town - fabulous and the rye was not heavy mixed with white flour but tasted a little of sourdough - was fantastic for breakfast the morning after toasted and topped with bacon and Poached Egg - the little bit left became pesto croutons for that nights Chicken Caesar Salad.

This woman can really bake  - I spent three years working in a Small Artisan Bakery and recognise their passion.

Would travel quite a way to buy bread again
Really nice, tasty baking, clearly made with passion and enthusiasm, thoroughly recommended if you're in Fowey, don't miss out
the window had such lovely cakes and breads on show. Had to pop in and buy a chunk of foccacia bread for myself.
Just a simple bakery, with lovely bread, cakes, and muffin of the day.  (we visited almost every day while on holiday)
If you're looking for fab bread or cakes or both, then is your place. Everything looked so tempting!
My son who loves muffins said these were delicious. He had the banana and toffee muffin which was moist and tasty.

I visited Fowey this summer and chanced upon The Quay bakery.  The Monkey muffins were amazing, so good i went back for more to take away and I've even considered making a trip down just to buy some more!!!
The bread looked and of course smelled fantastic too, but the muffins are the best thing I've tasted for a very long time.

Review Title: Fabulous bakery - always our first stop in Fowey
Review Text:
Apart from Fowey being such a special & beautiful place, we would happily visit just to shop at Quay Bakery!  A trip to South Cornwall wouldn't be complete without stocking up on their delicious products & we planned our visit for start of our holiday week, knowing the bread would last us for duration of our stay.  We purchased a Sourdough loaf & a Rosemary & Walnut loaf, both were delicious & retained their freshness for days.  We also had Treacle tart, Anzac biscuits & Chocolate & Stem Ginger muffins.  The muffins are to die for! - lovely, light, moist texture & with a warm afterglow from the ginger.  

The bread is delicious, but the Rosemary & Walnut is very special & has to be tasted to be believed.  We had at least three main dinners of Quay Bakery bread with cheese, cold meats & olives.  The rest was savoured either simply with butter or jam. 

Quality bread does cost a little more than supermarket sliced loaves, but, is also more satisfying & one of life's great pleasures.  Treat your tastebuds at Quay Bakery, you won't be disappointed.

A fantastic bakery. All types of bread and pastries. Daily fresh. During the tourist season, expect that you have to queue up for your daily bread. But worth the wait if you want tasty and good bread products.

Review Title: A lovely bakery with amazing food
Review Text: This bakery is by far the best in the whole of Fowey with stunning bread, pastries and cakes a no.1 place to go in Fowey!!!üëåüëçüòÜ
A lovely artisan bakery in Fowey, tasty bread products and cakes. A little pricey, and service a little slow due to being very busy but would recommend.

Review Title: Best place for breads, bakes sweats, especially the scones
Review Text: It was full in Fowey and no restaurant had places available. With a few breads and cookies from the bakery we just sat at the harbour and thoroughly enjoyed these freshly baked goodies. Out standing quality freshly made right there, which tops many of the bakeries we know from Germany, Austria or Switzerland. And, second to none are their scones!!
This is simply the best backery ever.  The choice of amazing breads and biscuits, not to mention the cheesy feet.  This is the only place to go in Fowey.

Visited every day!
Loved their sticky toffee pudding, focaccia breads, and all breads freshly baked!

Having been staying in Fowey for over 16 years and been to every bakery, this one is the best by some way. Everything is made fresh that day and is excellent. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Everyday I select something different and it is all amazing.
Highly recommend, 10/10

Review Title: Great bread - worth going out of your way for
Review Text: A really lovely little artisan baker. The overnight loaves were excellent as were the scones. Try the cheese scones if you are lucky enough to be there when they are making them.

Quay bakery has become my favourite shop ever. The wholemeal seeded loaf is the best bread i have ever had!! And very good value for money. You would be mad to go else where. There is something for everyone. Simply amazing bakery!
Nice little bakery that creates lovely bread and special muffins, biscuits etc. Anzac biscuits a speciality.

If you ever visit Fowey- make this bakery your first port of call & get a Monkey Muffin(or 10!) They were simply delicious. Alas, they're only made on Saturdays, which was probably good thing for my waistline! Their breads are pretty fantastic too- one of the best I've ever tasted.

A true bakery with a great range of standard breads, artizan breads and cakes.  Service with a smile and if you are looking for toasting bread or making bread and butter pudding give the day old basket a try (its still really fresh!)

What a delightful little find this was...a new shop since our last visit...and a much needed addition to Fowey!  Excellent quality bread, fabulous hot cross buns and delicious treacle tart.  This will becomes regular haunt on our annual pilgrimages to Polruan!
Worth a ferry trip over from Polruan just for the walnut and rosemary bread. Lovely bakewell and treacle tart too. Yummy!

We had our fill of the usual pasty venues while in Fowey, but tried the Quay bakery for the various focaccia rolls on offer.....WOW the tastiest savoury snack I have tried for years. 
We only tried them when were in the car on the way home - I nearly turned the car round to go back for more.
By the way the Bakewell tart is also stunning!
Just seen a review that suggested the bakery was overpriced...oh no, you get what you pay for, this was a Rolls Royce of focaccia....without question.

Thought we would try this out because of the reviews.

Although it was ok it was overpriced compared to the other bakeries and scones much better in presto.

Would shop elsewhere.

They are little feet shaped biscuits with a kick.... great for a snack ? The focaccia is good too
Recommended!
smell was gorgeous as you walk past and the bread was lovely also even if we only used it to fish for the day xx

Review Title: Quay Bakery in Fowey, Cornwall: Bread Shop
Review Text: This bakery is tucked away on a side road leading to the town quay.  If you do nothing else in Fowey you must try their bread - absolutely delicious and a huge range, including lots of wholemeal and sourdough!  I called in almost every morning when staying for a week in August.  You cannot help but be impressed.  Can't wait for my next visit.  The town's not bad either!
We tried the bread, croissants and slices of banana cake. All were very good indeed and beautifully presented. It is so good to discover a proper bakery and not a franchise for mass produced goods.

While just a tiny bakery, we were drawn back every morning during our Fowey stay due to the gorgeous focaccia with sun dried tomatoes. These were divine with rock salt crystals and at less than a pound, great value.

A very wide range of simply fantastic bread and pastries, which are really fresh and very tasty. You will not find any better. A very pleasant surprise in such a small town. I wish we had such a good bread shop in the cathedral city in which we live.

We stayed in Fowey for eight days and one of the great joys was the early morning stroll to the Quay Bakery for croissants and lovely fresh bread. It was just like being back in France. This is a truly super bakery with a big range of delicious artisan breads. Not to be missed on any holiday in Fowey !

The Quay Bakery continues to produce a great selection of breads, cakes and biscuits.  All made on the premises - the treacle tart is yummy, ideal for an emergency pud when you haven't time to make something!

You like carbs?  You love bread?  You'll love Quay Bakery.  It is very much bread focussed - not so much breakfast pastries or anything like that.  But every sort of gorgeous floury bread you can think of.

Delicious bread, scones and cakes.  I know how difficult it is to make an ordinary loaf at home let alone the output of this amazing bakery.  We tried a few different breads, all yummy.  Also bought the treacle tart and the bakewell tart which were tartylicious! Cheese scones was also amazing, with a strong hint of English mustard ( I think?)

Small but unique bakery 

Cheers scones are brilliant 

However a loaf of bread is around 4.00 - yes 4.00 pounds which is a bit crazy - I love good quality things but it isn't even that price in Fortumn and Mason in london

Review Title: Artisan breads and pasties of course.
Review Text: This is a small bakery on a side road to the Quay in the centre of town. It sells a range of delicious breads and rolls and cakes backed in the ovens visible from the shop and of course hot pasties. A large selection of unusual bread types and at quite reasonable prices. Yummy.

This is an amazing bakery. Go!

There is such a great selection of breads, baked in the oven behind the counter.. Artisan indeed. Do not even be put off by the frankly reasonable prices in the window. We are talking quality here. If you wish to spend less, still go in, you you will find a basket of 'yesterdays bread', at a pound a pop... Awesome bruschetta awaits, and actually, as bread it is fine too!
To the reviewer who says that it is inappropriate to feature this place in Tripadvisor, come on... People need to know about this place, and not only will you get the best bread and more in town (or in many towns), but you eat well! 

As I said, just go and buy the stuff!!! Awesome!
Una minuscola panetteria con forno a vista. Pane eccezionale e dolci gustosi. Da procare gli scones al formaggio e il pane alle noci. Il profumo vi inebrier√†.
Very good bread, wide variety, some cakes, scones and nibbles. Rosemary-walnut bread & 'cheesy feet' were very tasty.

I do not think a bakery should be in the same category as a restaurant.
I did think that there was a lovely variety of unusual breads. I tried their plum and almond tart and it was delicious.
I would recommend this bakery to anyone who enjoys, traditional and specality bread and cakes. Well done!
We had a very nice fresh loaf of bread. The girl suggested we try the special cake of the day (cinnamon pastry?) and it was really nice! It's not a restaurant though - it's a bakery!

Wow I wanted to take the aroma of your shop home with me.. Instead I brought some rosemary focaccia (it was wonderful with steak) some scones and breads 
Next time I'm in fowey your shop is my first stop
Visited this bakery twice whilst staying in the area - what fantastic bread. - you can see why it's so popular

I am a Brit expat in Paris.  This bakery would stand up well to my local boulangeries.  Bread, croissants, patisseries all made on the premises, and presented by knowledgeable and welcoming staff.  A touch expensive but I would buy nowhere else if I lived in the middle of Fowey.

Review Title: Artisan breads and pasties of course.
Review Text: This is a small bakery on a side road to the Quay in the centre of town. It sells a range of delicious breads and rolls and cakes backed in the ovens visible from the shop and of course hot pasties. A large selection of unusual bread types and at quite reasonable prices. Yummy.

This is an amazing bakery. Go!

There is such a great selection of breads, baked in the oven behind the counter.. Artisan indeed. Do not even be put off by the frankly reasonable prices in the window. We are talking quality here. If you wish to spend less, still go in, you you will find a basket of 'yesterdays bread', at a pound a pop... Awesome bruschetta awaits, and actually, as bread it is fine too!
To the reviewer who says that it is inappropriate to feature this place in Tripadvisor, come on... People need to know about this place, and not only will you get the best bread and more in town (or in many towns), but you eat well! 

As I said, just go and buy the stuff!!! Awesome!
Una minuscola panetteria con forno a vista. Pane eccezionale e dolci gustosi. Da procare gli scones al formaggio e il pane alle noci. Il profumo vi inebrier√†.
Very good bread, wide variety, some cakes, scones and nibbles. Rosemary-walnut bread & 'cheesy feet' were very tasty.

I do not think a bakery should be in the same category as a restaurant.
I did think that there was a lovely variety of unusual breads. I tried their plum and almond tart and it was delicious.
I would recommend this bakery to anyone who enjoys, traditional and specality bread and cakes. Well done!
We had a very nice fresh loaf of bread. The girl suggested we try the special cake of the day (cinnamon pastry?) and it was really nice! It's not a restaurant though - it's a bakery!

Wow I wanted to take the aroma of your shop home with me.. Instead I brought some rosemary focaccia (it was wonderful with steak) some scones and breads 
Next time I'm in fowey your shop is my first stop
Visited this bakery twice whilst staying in the area - what fantastic bread. - you can see why it's so popular

I am a Brit expat in Paris.  This bakery would stand up well to my local boulangeries.  Bread, croissants, patisseries all made on the premises, and presented by knowledgeable and welcoming staff.  A touch expensive but I would buy nowhere else if I lived in the middle of Fowey.

Having been tempted into the bakery by the display of gorgeous looking scones in the window I wasn't disappointed! With a small but delicious selection of local delicacies and family favourites!! Definitely worth a visit to enhance any picnic on the beach!

Review Title: Great varieties of bread,pasties and scones
Review Text: This establishment is fairly new and its products are excellent. We've supported the Quay Bakery every day .
Had the muffin of the day- Blueberry - and a slice of the Bakewell Tart and a slice of Treacle Tart and all were really tasty, am looking forward to going again before my holiday finishes!

The food is absolutely delicious. Each morning of my seven day holiday I tried without success to pass the bakery without being tempted. I can recommend the scones, pain au chocolates, granery bread and crossaints!

Review Title: Fantastic bread, fantastic cakes, great asset to Fowey
Review Text: Everything in this bakery looks lovely and tasty. I like seeing the trays of tins proving for the next day's bread. We enjoyed delicious focaccia buns and a lovely white crusty loaf (great with soup). Eat your bread the same day. Yum
Friendly staff, freshly baked bread and scrumptious cakes.  Heaven! You must try the walnut and rosemary bread and the carrot cake.
Delicious muffins with different flavours; speciality breads and the best chocolate chip cookies ever.

Review Title: Croissants which taste almost like the real thing!
Review Text: The title doesn't sound like much of a plaudit but anyone who has tried to find croissants in the UK which taste like the ones you get in France will know I am being very complimentary. The sourdough loaf was pretty damn good too.

Review Title: Fabulous bakery producing excellent bread and pastries - cant speak hufhly enough of this g of a bakery
Review Text:
What can I say? Every item absolutely delicious - the bread is how bread should be, tasty, with body and flavour, but I cant determine how well it keeps because its eaten so qickly in our house!! The quality of the products but suggest would suggest they last verywell!!  The pastries and cakes ought to carry a health warning - they get in your mouth! !!! Delicious! !!!
Dont miss this bakery - you wont be disappointed.
This isn't just a bread shop - everything they make is tasty and tempting. This is a new venture for Fowey - good luck to them.

We bought some carrot cake and cinnamon bagels from this discerning looking place, and what can I say but, WOW! The cake is amazing. Moist, tasty, just the right amount of icing. Can't wait to try our bagels. It's worth going to Fowey just for these tasty treats!
Really nice and fresh and you can see it being made. It is in a little side street next to the quay, make sure you visit in the summer

Last minute dinner guests - so what for dessert? Luckily we had tried a treacle tart kindly donated fora charity event in fowey for fran - it was fantastic so we then bought more plus bakewell tart -wow this team has to be on its way to stardom

Review Title: Our bread maker is now redundant
Review Text: So... We bought a bread maker because we couldn't get good bread in fowey -Niles great pasties but... - now we have this bakery - bu***r - our friend who is a baker and REALLY fussy and knowledgeable says this is one of the best ...  Wife now driven to bake extreme bread - guests here at 66 look out for pomegranate and seaweed focaccia.

Review Title: Top quality breads, a must for any visitor
Review Text:
Great quality bread and if you stay in any of the many apartments make sure you visit the bakery for a great start to any morning.
A small range of ciabattas, bagels, croissants, cakes and breads freshly baked daily and available with a nice smile.  Yesterdays bread sold at half price in a bargain bin proves the freshness of this establishment.
A must for your visit to Fowey.
Bought some granary style rolls from here - we were very diappointed, they were very heavy and did not have much flavour.

Review Title: Best bread in the whole of Fowey
Review Text:
This is where we bought our bread every day.  It was highly addictive! The proprietor told us she had only been open a few weeks and was amazed at how busy she was.
We asked about Gluten Free bread, and she said that already people had been enquiring  after it.  It was something the bakery would look into in the future.

Quality and value sells every time so I wish them every success.
I'm told that everything is organic. Bought the cinnamon bagels which were really good.  Sun-dried tomato focaccia was good but a little salty for my taste.
"bread to die for" - friendly service great aromas and a range that will blow your socks off.  Grab some cheese from Kittow's and you're on your way.

Been to this bakehouse many times whilst on holiday in the area and it‚Äôs excellent, great value for money, and the food is always delicious especially the cakes. Can‚Äôt wait to revisit in August üëå

We were recommended to visit The Bakery for their doughnuts.  We had some today and they were the best doughnuts we can ever remember having,  and we‚Äôre not young so have eaten many doughnuts between us!  They were a really good size and so packed with jam‚Ä¶they just ooozed!  Although we went traditional, they had so many different doughnuts to choose from‚Ä¶spoilt for choice.  I also bought a loaf of bread which is truly delicious too.  Would highly recommend a visit to The Bakery if you‚Äôre in the area ‚ù§Ô∏èüòã

Review Title: Visit every time we come to The New Forest
Review Text:
A great little place to pick up lunch and then go and sit in the forest. We call here each time we have a holiday for a meal deal and it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit!
¬£4.30 for a large fresh filled sub roll, cake and a drink.
Would definitely recommend

A lovely place to pop in after a long walk - we came in twice to have milkshake and sandwiches and then coffee and cake. - both times the coffee was piping hot and the cakes obviously very freshly made. Friendly service too

Lovely cakes. Really lovely. 
And they do a great value lunch of filled baguette, cake and drink. 
We snagged this and headed out for a days cycling. 
Would do again. Delicious

Review Title: Best Bakers in Hampshire (possible the world in my opinion)
Review Text:
Such a good selection of baked goods, visited a few times when in the area and the "Bakehouse"never disappoints.
Get there early though as its very popular
Popped here for a take away lunch. Food was excellent especially the hit and cold rolls and the doughnuts. Highly recommended.
We popped in here on several occasions - the pastries are excellent when just baked but not so good when they werent!

Review Title: Awesome doughnuts, and nice rolls too
Review Text: Recently stayed in Brockenhurst, and bought lunch from here each day, which were always nice rolls, but we treated ourselves to cherry doughnuts a couple of times too, and they are AMAZING.  So much jam and bits of cherry in them.  Yum!  Service was always friendly, and the frequent queues outside show how popular this place is.

Bought cakes after walking around the area. They were delicious, especially the iced buns. We bought extra to take back to Cornwall but they really needed to be eaten the same day.
We would make a bee-line to the bakery again if we are ever in the area.

Review Title: Very expensive pickle, under cooked rolls and pastries
Review Text: Popped into the previously great Bakehouse whilst on a short break last month, asked for 2 ham, cheese and pickle baguettes expecting the usual ¬£1 extra charge on the meal deal only to be told (quite rudely) that as it's so much extra work to add a spoonful of pickle to 2 baguettes we'd have to pay for each item resulting in a total cost for 2 meal deals with extra pickle and 4 x cold sausage rolls costing us over ¬£14, that was bad enough but when we ate the baguettes we found them to be a bit soggy and the pastries doughy and under cooked...... Shame as my wife has now vowed to never go in there again!
Fantastic food and lovely people. They were so good I could not stop eating. Thank you very much. You are the best

Grabbed a Cornish pasty whilst having a walk through the village, must say it was absolutely brilliant! Filling was delicious, pastry was soft and overall a delight- selection of cakes and other pastries was poor as they were closing but I can see why it‚Äôs popular!

We regularly visit Brockenhurst and The Bakehouse as their rolls, subs and cakes are excellent. However. this visit was marred by the girl that served us. She was rude, unfriendly and failed to say thank you. I understand that this is a very busy bakery but if she doesn't enjoy working in that environment then maybe its time for a career change. There are many people who live locally that would love a job in The Bakehouse. Stand aside and let someone with some customer service skills have your job.

Very friendly, best hot chocolate with real big choccy pieces and lovely snacks. Not a lot of seating for a large group but you must visit for the quaint pleasant atmosphere. The guy behind the counter has great customer skills. A real treat.
Stopped while passing for a snack. We picked up 2 iced buns, which were really, and would definitely recommend visiting if in Brockenhurst.

Review Title: Staff always smiling service on point.
Review Text: Love this bakery! The food is amazing, brilliant customer service and happy staff. The cheese and bacon turn overs ahh so tasty! Do brilliant meal deal as well. Will always be coming back :)

Review Title: Incredibly rude lady - we left without ordering
Review Text: Entered the shop with my small dog (didn't see a sign and a member of staff I was speaking with didn't say anything) and a few minutes later whilst I was ordering an incredibly rude lady which I assume was the owner started shouting NO DOGS, 3 times in a row. Very unprofessional, we left without buying anything. We won't go back or recommend this place to anyone.
We went to the Bakehouse last week.  The baguettes are amazing! As for the cakes,  WOW! You really need to try the doughnuts.
The best Bakery ever.  We come to visit the New forest and stay a couple of times a year.  First visit is to The Bakehouse.    We recommend this  place to everyone.

Review Title: The BEST reason to visit Brockenhurst
Review Text:
For everything a Bakery should be, this is by far the best we‚Äôve ever found. 
Be it Cakes, Bread, filled Sandwiches or their famous Donuts, this is simply excellent. 
Expect a queue as this Bakery is always popular for good reason. 
A small shop with a GIANT heart and service with a smile.

Review Title: Everything I have a dreamt a Donut can ever be
Review Text:
Just seriously that was the best Donut I have ever tasted in my life!

it is not trying to be smart with a million different stuff, just the very simple Chocolate donut made to absolute perfection.
Best selection of cakes that we found on our travels, bought one for every member of our group. Everyone enjoyed them, reasonable prices and friendly, pleasant staff.
Love this bakery. Had the pork bun many years ago and it‚Äôs still as good as it was then delicious üòã served with crackling and apple sauce. Great sweet treats also!

Not much to do in Brockenhurst bar passing through, stock up on groceries / food (and also see the Ford) but this bakery is worth the visit- tasty baked breakfast goods, sausage rolls & doughnuts amongst range of other food.

Review Title: Archaic attitude towards individuals with disabilities.
Review Text:
It surprises me that in 2021 disability discrimination is still a thing, however the young lady serving today wasn't shy when it came to displaying some of the most archaic and ignorant behaviour I've witnessed in a long time.

To cut a long story short I suffer with a severe respiratory disease which I recently underwent surgery for, this makes what should be a simple task like breathing not so easy and hence I am legally exempt from wearing a mask. To tell someone you have a disability is one thing, but to then be humiliated and treated like a liar is an absolute disgrace and you should be ashamed as a business. (Not all disabilities are visible)

Perhaps the staff, or the rude woman today specifically would benefit from some enhanced learning on communication and customer service, not to mention the equality act 2010..

I'm not one for writing reviews but some things just have to be said.

Review Title: Worth a detour on way back to Lyndhurst
Review Text: The Cornish Pasties and New Forest Swirl‚Äôs were so good the first time, we had to go back again (and again).....tasty and very good value for money.

One word. Superb üç∞üßÅüç©üòÄ. Tried several different cakes on a couple of visits all absolutely spot on. I recommend the chocolate eclair, but also tried the custard slice, belgium bun and strawberry and cream filled Belgium bun. All brilliant. 
  I can see why this is an award winning bakery. Thoroughly deserved well done. We will be back especially as the New Forest is our favourite place üëçüòÄ
We bought a roll and pasty, which weregreat and a custard slice, which was the best ever and at 95p a cup for tea and coffeeen you can't go wrong. Sat by the ford and it was all lovely.
Stopped here whilst out in the new forest with the family. Good choice of cakes etc and enjoyed by all. Our second favourite place on our few day trip so a solid 4‚≠êÔ∏è

Review Title: Excellent bakery with lots of choice
Review Text:
We are keen walkers and visitors to this beautiful area and the Bakehouse packs the perfect lunch for a great price.
They have a fantastic choice of delicious filled rolls and the choice of many cakes!
Their staff are all very friendly and helpful, we‚Äôd certainly recommend them for a tasty lunch or maybe just a sweet treat!

Review Title: Still the best bakery in the New Forest.
Review Text:
We went on holiday to the New Forest last week.  During that time we went to the Bakehouse three times.  The baguettes and doughnuts are to die for. Can't get enough of them! 

The baguettes are just amazing.  I don't know what they do, but yum, yum, yum! The doughnuts are the best Ive ever tasted.  I had the apple doughnut 3 times.

We also had sausage rolls and cheese and bacon wraps. All delicious.  

I thoroughly recommend this place. You won't be disappointed.

Review Title: Lunch on the go, great pasties!!
Review Text: We grabbed lunch from the Bakehouse after a long walk and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. A popular little bakery with a selection of sweet and savoury offerings at a really good price. Situated in the centre of Brockenhurst on the main shopping street we went for a traditional pasty plus a cheese & onion one plus two muffins. Excellent quality and a fab price at ¬£2.50 a pasty. Highly recommend for a quick bite.

Visited this bakery to pick up an easy lunch after a walk in the Forest and ended up going back twice more during our break. Always seemed to be passing, funny that. 

The Cornish Pastys are excellent as was the spicy vegetable slice. The cake selection is great with some truly impressive cream cakes on offer. The donuts are very good too. 

Looking forward to coming back on our next visit to the New Forest.

We visited today and I love a good bakery, it has been many years since I have found a bakery this amazing!

The traditional range of bread is faultless, get there early though as the bread is so good it sells fast!

Their range of cakes are hands down one of the best ranges I have seen for many years, in fact they were so good we brought some home for the next few days. The Belgium buns are amazing as are the huge custard slices, we have hot cross buns, an iced finger and gingerbread man yet to try but I have no doubt they will be amazing!

We actually visited the shop 3 times in one day, for breakfast (cake), some things to take home and then came back for lunch. The cheese and bacon turnovers are the best we have ever had and the cheese and onion slices are amazing.

If I could give 10 stars I would! Well be back üòäüòä

Review Title: If there's a better baker, I haven't seen it
Review Text: Cakes are just immense, and so affordable. The staff are lovely too.. custard doughnuts are the best on the planet

We visited during the pandemic and the shop was adopting a good level of protection.

The store has won bakery awards: certainly the bread we purchased was very good.  A good array of other items available
The title says it all- they had sold out of bread mid afternoon on a Monday. Cakes looked nice but that wasn‚Äôt what I was shopping for.
Best bakery around for miles! They offer the most amazing doughnuts! You will not be disappointed...

A visit to Brokenhurst is never complete until you have popped in to see the lovely smiley team at the bake house. Not only do they have the most delicious hot treats, the cakes..... what can I say.... to die for! A particular favourite of mine is the new forest swirl- adapted from the Belgium bun is a 10/10. Could not recommend highly enough. They also offer a meal deal for lunch comprising of freshly made baguettes filled with locally sourced produce, a cold drink and a freshly made cake of choice ranging from donuts to iced buns which is jolly good value! You‚Äôll never be disappointed.

This bakery has been an excellent place to shop this spring. Distancing is in place and staff wear masks.  Meat pies got the thumbs up from my hard to please spouse and the cakes and bread are delicious. Brockenhurst has a compact high street with the butchers, bakers and greengrocers all in close proximity. Queuing is outside at the moment as restricted to 2 inside, so best to go on a dry day. Phone a day ahead with your order so you won‚Äôt be disappointed if they run out of your favourites.
One of our favourite places to visit post forest walk. Perfect every time, food is delicious with a great sweat and savoury selection. Chicken mayo sandwiches and a nice sprinkle donut!!!!

Review Title: Best bread you will ever taste
Review Text:
This Bakehouse has been here for a long long time and you will get from here the best bread i'm sure you've ever tasted.

You must try it. We only come on holiday so it's a great dissapointment that we can't use it more often.

Lots of cakes, pastries and meal deals. Sandwiches and rolls.

Cannot recommend enough and can't wait to go back either!!!
Amazing freshly cooked food! Huge portions l, well worth the price. I travel for their cakes etc from Highcliffe!

Best custard doughnuts ever...went back twice whilst on hols! They were soft, full of superb custard and yet crispy on the outside. The smell of vanilla sugar on them was sublime. And only a pound each...huge and naughty !

Review Title: Simply the finest bakery we‚Äôve used
Review Text: This says it all!  The quality and taste of bread, baguettes, buns and cakes is something other bakeries simply don‚Äôt produce. Highly recommended is their meal deal. Tesco, Boots, et al meal deals just can‚Äôt compete on freshness and yummyness. Outstanding!  And the staff are so friendly!  What‚Äôs not to like....!

I have been coming to this bakery for many years, and i mean many!

It has the best bread that i have had from any bakery in my life. Our holidays here at the New Forest and one of the most things we look forward too is coming to this bakery.

We buy their sandwich loaves and milk loaves, and fresh sandiches (they are to die for), and the baguettes. The meal deals are great.

Not a lover of the cakes as they may suit lots of people who like huge fresh cream cakes, but i like mine a normal size, so unfortunatley i miss out on those, but we love the choc muffins, last time we had them they were still warm yummmm, and the gingerbread men. They just don't make enough of them.

A very busy bakery, but lots of staff to cope. I'd rather them be busy and not close down as they've not made enough money.

Review Title: Another visit to a great bakery
Review Text: Any trip to the New Forest area would not be complete without a visit to the bakery in Brockenhurst, whether it's for one of their oversized cakes or the great value meal deal you must not pass by without indulging.

Thi s bakery is the best one I have encountered. The bread is just gorgeous and the cakes are to die for.

I have never seen such big doughnuts.

Croissants what a way to start the day.

My husband and I popped into The Bakehouse on our day out to the New Forest.  The place is a little gem! The hot snacks are amazing and as for the cakes. Yummy ness!!! I had the best apple doughnut ever! The staff are friendly and there are always people in the shop (says a lot!). They are very reasonably priced too!
Everything I have ever purchased there has been delicious! Sweet or savory . . . Sausage rolls are a favorite!
An absolutely great place for bread, pastries, pies and sandwiches. A family run business just like bakeries used to be, first class with excellent staff
Popped in after a small break on the way home. Great selection of breads,cakes,and sandwiches. Nothing to much trouble excellent prices. Just wish we had one near us. Not to be missed.

What an experience going into this bakery,everything is so good,steak pies to breakfast slices to cherry doughnuts and Danish pastries,it‚Äôs so hard to know what to chose
The only trouble is stopping yourself from indulging too much
Can not wait to return this summer

After lunch at the pub, we thought we would find a local bakery to get a desert to enjoy down by the river before our cycle back to the campsite.
It was well after lunch and there wasn't much left but what was there looked amazing. Even though I really wanted one of the gorgeous looking eclairs (but didn't want to get cream all down me!) we both decided to have one of their filled doughnuts. I had the apple and my husband had the custard and they were probably the best doughnuts we have ever had! So fresh and so full and the flavours were to die for.
Fantastic and friendly staff, and such reasonable prices a proper asset to the village.

As soon as you get into this tiny bakery you'll see savoury and sweet treats that look delicious... good thing is that they also are very tasty! I'm not a sausage roll fan, but the one they do is great. But the "surprise" come with the doughnuts...the custard one is the best I've ever had in UK. Just that it would be more than worthy a visit.

I went in to the bakery this week while on holiday in the forest. I was served by the Irish lady and she was so lovely! She was so smiley, happy and helpful, I will be back again to see her on my next holiday:)
I have been to Brockenhurst a few times now, and always try to pick something up from The Bakehouse. The cakes are amazing and really reasonably priced. A little gem in the forest :)

Love this bakery with it's amazing bread and doughnuts to die for....the filled rolls are delicious (fresh tasty fillings like egg salad and brie and grape)...this bakery is the best in the new forest area and it is always a pleasure to be served by the lovely friendly maureen..see you soon..X

Review Title: The closest place to heaven in earth...
Review Text:
Is there a more perfect place?let me answer that for you, no there isn‚Äôt. Every time my teenage caves hit and my body ask for a treat, I go to The Bakehouse which is only a couple minutes away from college and ask for a custard doughnut and no joke man, it makes me bust a nut <3 I don‚Äôt know how they‚Äôve managed to make a crunchy yet soft doughnut with just the perfect amount of custard filling and covered in fine sweet sugar crystals. How can I get such perfect doughnut for only 90p!!!
It astonishes me honeslty in addition to this.... the people working there Ong how are they soo nice :)))
