Side note, the student meal deal and the beacon and cheese turnover are REALLY good as well ü•∞
Thanks fo listening to my TED talk and my love for the bakehouse
The shop window reveals dream place for cake lovers. Go inside and you have to buy one. They taste as good as they look.

While visiting Brockenhurst we came across the bakehouse, & thought that the bagettes & cakes in the window looked nice & as we wanted something for lunch we went in. We had a warm welcome & one of the baguettes had to be made but wasn't a problem then I noticed some of the biggest donuts around 6" dia so we had to have a couple of those for afters, the shop assistant then asked what drinks we wanted for the meal deal so we had 2 cans of coke. So 2 rolls, donuts & cans came to ¬£5.80 which was very good considering the bagettes were around 10" long, I was expecting to pay much more.
The proof however is in the eating & it all was very fresh with plenty of filling tuna mayonnaise in the bagettes & jam in the donuts.
I would highly recommend the bakehouse for a lunch time bite to eat to take on a picnic in one of the many places in the new forest.

Our favourite lunchtime treat (or brekkie for that matter). Sliced bread is excellent. Meal deal baquette, drink and a cake is terrific value and the breakfast slice is too die for on a cold morning. Great news is the range and quality is all year round
visited here twice for sausage rolls ( wonderful ) and stunning cream cakes yum yum. even came on our way home to take cakes home with us.  lovely, friendly staff too. best fresh bakes ever!!!

What a bakery,it was very hard to choose between lovely cakes wonderful pies ,that in the end I ended up buying loads.
Fantastic chocolate eclairs have never seen any as big or full of cream,tasty steak pies massive Danish pastries and a wonderful Lardy cake and a big French stick all bought today,had to stop otherwise would have bought the shop.
Will definitely go back again,it‚Äôs a good job we don‚Äôt live near or I would go every day
Title says it all, had to go and order some  to take home with us. Light as a cloud and just scrummy.

Visited this bakery for some picnic lunches to take for exploring in the New Forest. 

Busy and friendly. We had a choice of large filled rolls, cakes and cans of drink. Special offer of ¬£2.90. Delicious. Highly recommend the doughnuts...light and fluffy.
I cannot fault this bakers, absolutely love it and proper big cakes. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. Good prices & plenty of variety.

Wonderful bakery, the shop is just as appealing as it's food! I couldn't decide what to buy (seriously would eat one of everything!) I had the tuna salad roll, cheese and onion pasty and the apple turnover. I'm not exaggerating when i say they all tasted delicious. Would definitely go back to try more and would also recommended to others!! Staff helpful too!
Visited on a very busy Saturday late morning.  Service was prompt and friendly and we both got a lunch deal, which was very tasty, fresh and excellent value at ¬£2.90.

Expected a touristy area to have a bakery which preyed on the fact that people are starved of choice, but this gem of a bakery was really well-priced, giving proper value for money, because they are able to turn over so much good food.  Expect a long queue (but a short wait) as everyone seems to know that it's the best place for miles around.  Lots of locals and tradesmen were queuing as well as the tourists.  
Thoroughly recommend the lunch meal deal - under ¬£3 for a well-filled baguette, a drink and one of the smaller desserts.  
Lots of variety in the baguette fillings, if they haven't got the one you want they'll immediately make it up for you...  
Very well staffed and stocked, with a lot of tempting desserts and cream cakes.  Thoroughly recommended!

Unfortunately we discovered this gem on the last day of our stay. We all enjoyed a takeaway cake or bun and tea. Friendly fast service. They have an amazing lunch deal of huge baguette, cake and a drink for under ¬£3 definitely not worth making a picnic/packed lunch for exploring at this price. They were huge and didn't skimp on fillings. Meat from butcher across the road and free range! The breakfast and sausage rolls looked amazing but I am the only vegetarian in my family. A vegetarian sausage roll would be amazing. Will definitely be back for our next camping visit for breakfast and lunch

Absolutely love it !
 best bakery ever got no faults at all!  very yummy and super friendly staff, cant recommend enough.

We had been somewhat mislead that there was lots to do and see in Brockenhurst and were feeling a bit deflated - so we decided to cut our losses and get a picnic and drive on. We found the bakehouse and it completely made our parking fee worth it !! The most delicious filled rolls, sausage rolls, doughnuts and chocolate eclairs ! 

We are quite grateful we don‚Äôt live nearby - or our waistlines would be greatly expanded! Don‚Äôt pay to park in Brockenhurst - jump in to the bakehouse and grab a picnic then drive on into the forest :)
We joined the queue that was out of the door, and bought lovely rolls and cakes for a picnic.  Great value and all home baked
I have been going here for years and remember when the famous meal deal was ¬£2 and it's still such great value now at near ¬£3. Also recommend custard slice there as it's incredible...

Review Title: Always a queue looking in the window
Review Text:
We holiday in the area three times a year, always visit this bakery. The doughnuts are to die for, hot cross buns Devine, the new forest swirls out of this world, and the bread is gourgeous,  I would challenge anyone to walk past without going in to buy something.
The staff are always very pleasant and helpfully, we take our own container in to take buns home, so that they won't get crushed on the journey.
What else is there to say?! This is the best bakery in the world!! Just popped in to get a little selection, had a custard slice, chocolate eclair & 3 jam donuts, all fresh & very very tasty!!
We stopped and grabbed a few sweets on our way back to our hotel.  Everything was delicious and the staff was very helpful bagging it up extra for me with the rain and three kids with me.

The people are friendly and the food is always fresh and simply delicious, however, there is such small time window for you to actually get what you want. More often than not if you get there more than halfway through the lunch hour, whatever you order, they wont have left. I went in one day at 13:45, there were no baguettes or rolls out on display, which would discourage anyone from even inquiring if they had any left. I asked for a chicken baguette and I was told that they had no chicken. What is the point in being a bakery that's open until 5pm but runs out of food around 2pm and closes the kitchen around 3pm? When you actually get your food of choice though, its fantastic!

Review Title: A proper bakery, everthing is great especially the cream cakes.
Review Text: This place is what a bakery should be everything fresh and made on site, from bread to pasties to cakes, the cream cakes are to die for. Lovely filled rolls, they also do a meal deal of a roll, cake(not cream) and a drink for ¬£2.90.
Great cakes, pastries, baguettes, friendly accommodating staff, and great prices, we have to pay double what the Bakehouse was charging where we live!
So nice to see a nice old fashioned bakery - plenty of sweet and savoury foods, all reasonably priced and very tasty!

A wonderful selection of freshly baked cakes & patisseries , pies, baguettes ,filled rolls and more.
Very high quality fresh goods at such sensible prices from this vibrant & busy bakery.
Never miss this place if you are in the area.
You won‚Äôt be disappointed in this bakers, massive sized cakes and well worth the money. Everything baked on the premises and seem to sell loads. A great bakers.
Cheap and delicious! Would not have expected this combination in the new forest. I had a bacon and brie baguette with a custard slice üòçüòçüòç
Superb local bakery. Everything baked on the premises to a very high standard. You won't be disappointed with anything bought from this shop.

Visited this bakery today whilst camping in the New Forest! Even from the window we were so impressed with what we saw. The cakes looked amazing and clearly freshly home baked! I had a custard doughnut which was SO good, and my partner had the giant eclair (and I mean giant!!) Great value for money, would definitely recommend and visit again :)
Everyone you would wish for from a bakery is here, superb choice of bread, great confectionary and "to die for" pies plus a good range of ready filled rolls
I live in Brockenhurst. The Bakehouse is great for fresh bread and croissants and sells the best doughnuts ever, particularly custard ones.

We are order our donuts. The best ever. Great staff a d friendly service.
Other cakes available and equally scrummy. Savoury treats are a must. 
You put on weight just gazing in the window.
A must visit if you are in the area. If you are not in the area MAKE A DETOUR!!!!!

Review Title: A proper good old fashioned bakery, with real bakers.
Review Text: The whole family love this bakers, never been disappointed. The white bread is wonderfully soft and has real flavour. Sausage rolls/ bacon cheese puffs are made with delicious pastry and really good quality meat. All the cakes I have tried have been exceptional in quality, freshness, flavour and size. The custard slices have plenty of custard, the eclairs are about a foot long and the Belgian buns are the softest and most delicious I've ever tasted. I don't actually really like doughnuts but these are beautifully soft and stay fresh even till the next day. Apple turnovers are one of my favourites with plenty of proper apple filling. Lardy cakes are beautifully moist with plenty of fruit. We've also had the hog roast which was really lovely. Basically I don't think you can go wrong with whatever you choose and it's a must stop every time we are in the area.

Walked into Brockenhurst from our camp site,but it was worth every mile of the walk.
We travel all over the country in our Motorhome but this is the best bread and cake shop we have found.the cherry doughnuts are fantastic,and the scones are brilliant.
Would recommend this shop to everyone.
The most amazing iced bun with cherry on top I have ever eaten. Looking forward to my next trip to this village just for another bun purchase

We call here every time we are in the area. We always find the place spotlessly clean with a great selection of different pasties, pies and cakes. We call mainly for the pasties and custard slices. Both are second to none.

Been coming here for years and they never let us down.Great selection of cakes, pastries and rolls and the meal deal is good value for money.Can get very busy but worth the wait and the window is full of tempting cakes.

I always have to do a detour to Brock just to visit here. Pasties are great, so are the pies. Bread can be sliced if needed, and lasts well for proper bread. There is a reason there is always a queue out of the door.

On holiday in the New Forest we ensure every day possible we visit this bakery for the amazing filled baguettes and fantastic array of cakes, buns, pies, flans, bread, rolls and pastries, I must say my favourite is the humble Nutty Buns and would love to have the recipe on making these as its a one of taste and texture I have only ever had from this quality and not so pricey bakery.

Review Title: Just look through the window, Always a Treat
Review Text: We visit Brockenhurst regularly and always use the Bakehouse. The doughnuts are to die for, the hot crossed buns are a real treat, and the bread is out of this world, all baked fresh every day, Best Bakery I have Ever Seen

Whilst wondering around the pretty New Forest village of Brockenhurst we came across this Bakery, they had a wonderful selection of breads, cakes and savories. The cream cakes are massive, I truly have never seen cakes so large and the prices are so reasonable. Great shop.

Always stop off @ this very small bakery that seems to have the knack of providing every tempting choice for every type of customer !

It's on the village high street - easy to park & always full of product ready to go @ reasonable prices for everything baked & prepared on site .....

Worth a visit just for their filled baguettes but plenty of other tempting lunch / snack / indulgent food & soft drinks etc
I had heard of this cake shop so had to try cakes are amazing and sandwiches and pasties are full and tasty

Review Title: Great meal deal and excellent value
Review Text:
We have to stop here when we come down to the New Forest.
Two large filled baguettes two cakes and two cans of drinks for just over ¬£5.00.
The selection is unbelievable staff very friendly and during the summer months you may have to queue.
Would definitely recommend a visit here especially for fresh picnic food to take in to the forest
This bakery is a gem. Donuts, custard slices, MONSTER eclairs. So good I had a hard time deciding each visit.
Popped in here for lunch with the family. Meal deals with a fresh roll, cake and can for ¬£2.80. Fresh food, good selection  and helpful staff. What more can you ask for. Will be back.

Review Title: Definitely the best bakery in the world!!!
Review Text:
Wow, what a lovely surprise, a very large and scrumptious looking chocolate √©clairs caught my wife's eye as we were walking past, the next thing I knew, we were inside buying it! We also bought two gorgeous bacon and cheese pastries. I questioned the bill because I thought we'd been under charged but no, the food is not only fantastic but very cheep as well.
The √©clairs fed three of us adequately!
I can't wait to go back.

We literally stumbled across this fantastic Bakery as it was late and we were staring at it. They didn't have a lot left as the local lunch time crowd had cleared the place, but some hot offerings and wow they were really good. Spinach and feta bake which melted in the mouth, really flaky and delicious sausage roll and lastly.an amazing meat and potato pasty, all homemade as were the fresh sub rolls. To cap it all they even make muffins, Dorset Apple,chocolate and lemon curd, wow a superb compliment to a cup of coffee. This place is easy to find on Brockenhurst High Street parking outside if you can. It's definitely worth a visit

Always stop off @ this very small bakery that seems to have the knack of providing every tempting choice for every type of customer !

The pies / pasties & breakfast specials are all great but probably not good for you .....

So the filled rolls - that can be to order too , on the spot for virtually whatever you want if not on   menu board or on display

Cakes , doughnuts & Larry cake etc are all to die for !!? - they even box them up if more of the family / co workers fancy something ....

All takeaway drinks available including water of course ?

They have meal deals but value is pretty good anyway , regardless.

Helpful team members - fast & efficient.

Worth a detour on to the Brockenhurst high street where parking is possible
Ate our sausage roll and doughnut in the car and went straight back in for second helpings of those delicious doughnuts, cheap too.

I live in London which is a while away from here and i can say this is honestly the best bakery i have ever been too. this bakery has always been a fond memory of mine as when we used to go camping, we would always get the meal deal and the DELICIOUS ice buns. Such low prices and good value for money, good quality food and amazing service.

A Brockenhurst institution, used by locals and visitors alike. Great service from the lovely Maureen and the rest of the team. Amazing bread, donuts and filled sandwiches. Try the sausage rolls and pasties and the biggest chocolate eclair you have ever seen!

Review Title: Yum yum do not pass by
Review Text: Fantastic savouries including big sausage rolls, breakfast puff plus many more and a great selection of cakes, including massive eclairs, big custard donuts and many more. We always ensure that we pay a visit to this shop when we holiday in the New Forest

Review Title: People make an effort to go there, guess why
Review Text: People travel a fair distance to go there, and when I have been in Brock and didn't get donuts my staff get angry. I don't think I need to say more.

Review Title: Best cakes we've eaten in a long time...
Review Text: Wish we had a local bakery like this where we live. The cakes were delicious and definitely worth a trip if you are passing Brockenhurst. Many places don't make cakes like this any more!
lovely large cakes and pastries at a good price staff happy to serve you  nice shop.we wanted more than they had so they offered to make us the quantity we wanted no problem
delicious new forest twirls (aka Belgian buns!) we are looking forward to sampling more of their cakes.
Everything we have had from The Bakehouse has simply been excellent. Especially love the hog roast baguettes.
Love this place, always happy to make sandwich/roll orders even though they have loads out as we always have different requests. Cakes and donuts are amazing! A must try!

Best bread, best pastry, best sandwiches and best cakes and reasonable prices, The staff couldn't be friendlier. There's an Englishness about the place and you hope it will never die. It's a bakery not a restaurant.

I wish I lived in Brockenhurst
Excellent local bakers with great value for money meal deals, enormous delicious cakes and tasty bread. Lovely friendly staff.
You really need to try the croissants, there great, although all there food looked good, staff were very friendly

My 3 year old son loves doughnuts with sprinkles, these were the best we've found as other shops insist on putting loads of icing on first with a few sprinkles (he doesn't like the icing).

If only I lived closer or your bakery did delivery!!

Stayed above the bake house in the conveyed two level flat and awoke every morning to the smell of freshly baked loveliness. These guys go to work at midnight to prepare bread, cakes and savouries to die for. Visit and fall in love with bread again.
A friend at work told me about your Eclairs, it was worth the trip from Wareham, and we will be back next month..with friends. Great service and great food and certainly made our day out :)
They offer a great value meal deal and delicious cakes all freshly made! Visited again to purchase more cakes as they were so good! the staff are also friendly.
We call here every time we are in the area and have never been dissapointed. The pasties and cakes are excellent. The staff are always very friendly

Love this little bakery my children absolutely love the Sausage Rolls which was recommended by the local builder and they were right. The young girl who served me once was washing the floor and clearing up and she did not mind serving me and was very kind and friendly.

Review Title: I would be very fat if I lived near this bakery
Review Text: I do not have a bad work at all for this bakery. It is absolutely amazing. While on holiday I stumbled across this shop and I have thought about their Belgium Buns and donuts ever since. I highly recommend this place
Delicious large cakes and such reasonable prices. We loved the Belgium buns and doughnuts. So fresh and delicious. The sausage rolls and pasties were so nice as well.

The bread and cakes are always fresh from this bakery with friendly service. The custard slice is to die for!! - Maybe should not have put that as there might not be any left for me next time I visit.

Review Title: An excellent busy bakery with huge cakes
Review Text:
Long established in the village, this bakery provides good bread and a variety of freshly baked goods.  The cakes are enormous and tasty.

A great local benefit.
Very popular place, does good priced lunch deals. Lovely fresh bread, great selection of cakes, fast and friendly service, on street short term Parking right outside.

I am a sucker for a bakery and this one was fantastic, we stayed in the area to visit the National Motor Museum and visited on our way and I'm glad we did! The cakes are all beautiful and I indulged in a giant eclair which was absolutely gorgeous, proper thick fresh cream and lovely light choux pastry - a real treat! The fresh bread on offer all looked wonderful and the granary we picked is beautiful! If we were 3 and a half hours away I'd be there every afternoon! Sausage rolls are also a must-try! Fresh baked with real sausage meat, a proper bakery (a rarity these days) Beats Greggs hands down!

Sausage rolls that must have come from heaven all home made with meat from the local butchers, and the lightest Belgian Buns i have tasted 
Very helpful ladies behind the counter even helping someone who could choose very quickly
And some where to tie the dogs up while you choose your very tasty snack
We used to own a bakers so it was a real treat to find this traditional bakers in Brockenhurst,  we're not local but return to the area at least once a year and always have to visit them.

There has been a bakery in Brockenhurst for as long as I can remember, and it has always been excellent.  Currently my favourite purchase is the large filled doughnuts, particularly the custard ones!    They've always done good pasties here as well, and of course a good selection of breads.

We're so lucky to have this place as our local bakery. It's fabulous. Tasty bread, amazing treats and fabulous deals. The staff are always happy to accommodate if you want different sandwiches and the sausage rolls are to die for! Keep up the good work!

We use this place almost daily and it is consistently good. The bread is great and they do some good meal deals that are popular with the local students. The hot cross buns are the best I have ever tasted and the donuts and sausage rolls go down well with the rest of the family.
My son makes me drive here on a weekend for a hot sausage roll and a sprinkle donut.. Staff always very friendly and the food if not sold out is always good, but today his donut was sold out..

Review Title: Wow!  A Bakery Like it should be
Review Text: This bakery does the best bread and cakes for miles.  Everything is made fresh, on the premises.  Granary, wholemeal, white breads, rolls, cakes, pasties and all made wioth local produce.  If you are visiting anywhere near Brockenhurst this is a great place to visit and grab some real home made bread.

Review Title: Donut the size of my head
Review Text: Called into the bakehouse today and picked up some giant jam donuts. Very good value, very fresh and very yummy. If you're in brockenhurst skip past tesco & sainsburys and support a quality local bakery.
Produces a wide range of quality bread and cakes, but a bit overpriced. Very good pasties and savoury goods.Special lunch deal is good value

This is a place that we regularly purchase lunch from when visiting friends in the area.  The Baguettes are absolutely delicious and a meal deal also includes a cake and a drink for under ¬£3.  Amazing value
Great value for money on meal deal. Rolls and sandwiches packed full and taste great too! And the size of their yummy cakes, seeing is believing!! Would recommend grabbing a bite to eat here.

We found this lovely bakery in the High Street at Brockenhurst. We initially noticed the huge cakes in the window which drew us in to have a look at what else they had to offer. Sandwiches, baguettes, filled rolls, hot pastries and baguettes were also all sold here. We brought a selection of cakes and a pastry - they were really yummy and reasonably priced.

Top quality goods every time i have eaten here.

All the cakes here are quality and massive as well. Especially the eclairs which are as long as your forearm !!

Sausage rolls and bacon turnovers are especially nice

A real old bakery 
Love the cakes savouries the meat comes locally always got a great selection. All year round grab a bite to eat from here at lest once a week never been let down

First time visit to The Bakehouse and won't be the last !!!
Wonderful cakes and Bacon and melted Brie baguette,all at very reasonable prices,Queued out on the pavement but worth the wait as everything is Sooooo delicious.

The smell of freshly baked loaves, pastries and naughty treats is enough to pull you off the highstreet and indulge. It is just fantastic, so much better than supermarket bread or cakes. The staff work hard and it is great to see a functioning bakery in action. I will always buy fresh friend served with a smile from the Bakehouse, over the larger chain stores in the village, even if it is slightly more expensive. But you get what you pay for.
Popped in to buy a picnic lunch and were very impressed with the choice and value.  Well filled roll, cold drink and a cake for ¬£2.60.  Friendly staff and the cakes were very tasty!  Recommended.
Great Place for freshly baked bread cakes and pastries if in the area and fancy something naughty or a pasty or sausage roll defiantly check out the bakehouse visit overhear and my mum is a big fan!

Remember how bakers used to be with cakes the size of small cars...... This place is still like it.

Ice fingers like you have never seen, chocolate eclairs the size of your forearm, cream cakes using half a cow...

The bread is lovely and so is their hot food, filled rolls and sandwiches with more than generous fillings. 

Staff are always smiling and polite despite how crazy busy they get. 

Well worth a visit
A really good bakery which is not easy to find these days. Sausage rolls are the best around and really fabulous friendly service.

Stopped off here before a forest walk and was not disappointment. The place was heaving which was so nice to see. Service was still quick and efficient even though it was very busy. Had a pasty and apple turnover which both tasted amazing! Lots of cakes and savouries to chose from!

We go camping in the New Forest once a year and now make a bee line for their cakes.. The hot food was ok on my last visit but nothing special (tho I was at the end of a very long queue of builders so I will cut some slack) the cakes however.. AMAZING. So good we went back the next day.. The Belgian buns are the best I have ever eaten. Can't wait to go back ;)
Such a great bakery really lovely food and well worth the price as it really is great value would always go in there when in brockenhurst
Great price, amazing food. It has a great range of cakes, pastries, sandwiches and friendly staff. We sometime come to the New Forest just for this place or is always our first stop.

This bakery is simply the best bakery i have been to.
The taste of the products, friendliness of the staff and the reasonable prices are all really good.
I have no ties with this establishment whatsoever i just want to praise this place for what it is.
If i were to own or manage this place i would not make one change.
Keep up the good work.

First class family baker.  Bread, rolls, cakes, pastries, breakfasts, lunches, all made with local produce where possible. Their Cornish pasties are even better than mother-in-law used to bake and she was Cornish!

Review Title: Best sausage rolls that I have ever had and they do great cakes too
Review Text: I was introduced to the Bakehouse by a friend and I was blown away by the quality of the food on offer, great cakes and really amazing sausage rolls.  I will be coming back here very soon.

I have visited this little bakery, in the heart of Brockenhurst, a couple of times now and I will always go back whenever I am in the area.
This is a family run bakery and although it is a fairly small shop, the choice is amazing, the cakes are to die for and the prices are very, very reasonable.

Walked past here and got tempted with the yummy tasting menu.
Weather was good so managed to sit outside.
Opted for the sweetcorn fritters and a flat white.
My only negative was the time I waited for my food , about 40 minutes, it wasn't busy and I was one the last ppl to order before they closed , I think they forget but finally when the food came out it was really nice and just what I was looking for when looking for a lunch spot.
The staff were apologetic and really friendly.

Review Title: Amazing food, atmosphere probably not to everyone‚Äôs taste
Review Text: The food was lovely, the staff were friendly, but we chose not to return. The initially told that outdoor seating wasn‚Äôt available due to that area being prioritised for those with dogs, but then multiple people came in afterwards and were told it was fine (despite having no dogs). Wouldn‚Äôt have minded being inside but it was quite cramped and a bit noisy as the kitchen was open plan.

Super lovely place to eat! Service was great and really friendly despite being two people down on the day. Food was fantastic, we had the garlic mushroom dish, hotdog, crab and also mackerel sandwich. It‚Äôs was a busy Saturday, but got a table quickly and were served quickly. Highly recommend to go there if you visit Lyme Regis!
Great for breakfast and lunch. Many different options and fresh bread made onsite. We did not book a reservation and were seated right away (about 1030 on a Friday).
Such a wonderful find in Lyme Regis.  The choice of bread and cakes are amazing.  We particularly loved the Battenberg cake!
this place is so very good ! makes you not want to tell anyone and keep this jewel to yourself ! staff attentive and efficient food delicious

Got my husband a sausage roll from this establishment as we‚Äôd seen them the day before in the window when walking into Lyme. 

They have a great selection of pasties and sausage rolls, so we shall have to come back in future to try more. 

The young lady serving me was very helpful as I am wheat intolerant and couldn‚Äôt have anything on offer. She recommended another place to get myself a salad which I was very grateful for. 

Very reasonably priced food.

Review Title: Excellent place for freshly cooked food.
Review Text: Great well cooked and presented breakfast and lovely staff. We all had different dishes and they were all very tasty. The waitress was excellent.
Excellent food and very accomodating of our two year old daughter with some crayons, paper to amuse her and a booster chair as she is slightly small of the benches

Absolutely fabulous. Amazing food and service. Staff are wonderful, friendly and knowledgeable. 
The bakery is a lovely setting, the food is fresh and made on site. 
Get there early, as it‚Äôs busy, especially at the weekend.

Review Title: Great find just of the main tourist attractions, shops and beachfront
Review Text:
We chanced upon this place as we‚Äôd parked in a different location to previous visits to Lyme Regis, on our way through to the front. 
We went back later after a couple of hours of looking about, and were not disappointed. 
The service was good and the food was very good value. 
Would definitely use again. What a great find!!!

Once again Town Mill Bakery made our holiday extra special, from wonderful fresh sourdough loaves which we ordered and were ready and waiting for us to pick up, to the delicious lunch on our last day in Lyme Regis, brisket sandwich was soooo tasty, prawn salad was gorgeous, mushrooms on toast were heavenly,  washed down with the best coffee!!! all served by the most friendly and efficient staff. It is great to know there is a place in Lyme Regis we can rely on to make our holiday special every year. Thanks !!! from Gary and Claire xxxxx
Great breakfast (also visited later in the week for lunch and that was spot on too) Very friendlt staff and a lovely atmosphere.

We both had a great breakfast here. Lots to choose from. Our server was great. It was her first day on the job but we would not have known until she mentioned it. she was so good. Great little spot. We highly recommend.

Review Title: Wonderful food using the freshest ingredients
Review Text: Absolutely amazing lunch. The freshest ingredients and amazing flavours. I had the green brunch which was just packed with lightly cooked and perfectly seasoned veg. My husband had the beef brisket sandwich which he said was wonderful. Coffees were also excellent. Service was friendly and attentive. Couldn‚Äôt fault this place.

Our friends had a dog so, because the kitchen is "open-plan" we were obliged to eat semi-outside in the courtyard, which is covered but open at the front. It was a cold day, the staff switched on the heaters but they weren't sufficient; we froze. All the menu items sounded appealing, but the eggs Benedict I chose was disappointing - toast too hard (I left the crusts), ham of good quality but too much of it in relation to the two small poached eggs. Eggs Benedict should be a refined, polished, enormously appetising dish - this attempt was not.

What a lovely find. Enjoyed our wander down Coombe street, somewhere we hadn‚Äôt explored before. We just had some drinks but they were really lovely, especially my gorgeous hot chocolate. The food did look really good and we will definitely be back again to try. The nicest place to sit and enjoy a lovely sunny morning and we loved the little gift shop next door!

Great place for brunch. There are no individual tables, but just long tables and benches. However, there is enough space between people - it's not as tight as Wagamama.
We both had full English breakfasts and they were delicious. Large portions and great ingredients.

Review Title: The best breakfast, what a great spot
Review Text: Such a delicious breakfast. A really great atmosphere, buzzy little place tucked down the pretty streets in Lyme. So glad we stumbled up it and they found us a spot. Thank you for another great highlight to our trip. Can‚Äôt wait to come back.

Excellent  always. 
         I have visited on regular occasions & the food & staff here are excellent always.   The hard working chefs &!kitchen staff produce lovely fresh breakfasts with quality food.   Owners & staff  always welcoming  & obliging no matter how busy.          Bread & cakes made by n premises delicious  .    Worth visiting üëå

Myself and my boyfriend had the most wonderful visit to Town Mill Bakery on bank holiday Friday. We‚Äôve visited the bakery several times - it is our go to spot when in Lyme Regis and often make the journey to Lyme just to visit the bakery! 

We arrived to the restaurant on a particularly busy Friday bank holiday and we were seated within seconds of arriving by very friendly staff. We were given the choice to sit inside or outside, and we chose to sit outside as it was particularly sunny day and the outside seating area is very cosy and comfortable. 

Within less than 5 minutes our drinks and food order was taken by a very smiley staff member. We started with two flat white‚Äôs with beautiful coffee art, made with delicious local coffee and one Verdent Pale Ale (a south west based brewery). For our lunch my boyfriend ordered a bacon, chicken and cheese toastie with a side of lightly salted crisps, and I ordered the Green Brunch (my favourite) consisting of, homemade brown sourdough, houmous, salad leaves, tender stem broccoli, mange tout, a poached egg and grilled halloumi, stopped with seads. Despite how busy it was, our lunch arrived without less than 10 minutes! 

I couldn‚Äôt recommend visiting the bakery enough. The friendly staff, wonderful atmosphere and delicious food cooked by very talented chefs makes Town Mill Bakery not just somewhere you just stop for lunch, but rather a place you plan your trip to Lyme around.  

Thank you staff members of Town Mill Bakery creating such a wonderful brunch/lunch/ afternoon tea experience. We‚Äôll be back soon!

We stayed on the Isle of Lyme last week and went for breakfast at Town Mill Bakery on the recommendation of our host Mike. This is a must-see address!! The staff are really lovely and very professional. The breakfast is wonderful, the coffee is great, all the products are quality... a real treat!
We highly recommend!
Camille and Marion DUBOIS JOLY
FRANCE
Great food and very friendly service. Turkish Eggs were delicious and sandwiches went down well too. Well worth a visit.

I didn't dine here, just popped in for a sourdough loaf - FAB, two Eccles cakes - FAB and a piece of cheese from Glastonbury, sure to be FAB, haven't tried it yet. I've had bread, croissants etc. in the past. Always top quality produce.

Review Title: Best place to eat in Lyme
Review Text: Amazing delicious food excellent members of staff  very friendly  superb service.food is great quality ..

A day out in Lyme Regis led us to this lovely little spot. Great service and a nice little break to miss some of the rain. The food is lovely, really good and made in sight of the diners. My wife had creamy mushrooms on sourdough toast while I opted for the bacon, brie and cranberry toasted sandwich. Both were very tasty and we will be back next time we are in the area. I can also recommend the little shop next door, mince pies and battenburg were purchased for tea tonight. So much nicer to go into than the chain coffee shops you get everywhere else.

Popped in for breakfast after staying in nearby Charmouth for a holiday and walked along the beach to Lyme Regis . It was the fairy lights and fur covered seats that drew me in üòÇ Staff were very welcome and friendly and we sat outside with the dogs but under a heater so was perfect üëç Food was delicious - we came the next day too ‚ù§Ô∏è

Incredible experience from start to finish. All of the lovely staff couldn‚Äôt have been any friendlier or more welcoming. The food was fresh and came out really quickly, and was delicious. We had pancakes and bacon sandwich, and only wish we had room for more! Everything was of excellent quality and the ambience was wonderful even for a Monday morning. I encourage anyone visiting Lyme to come and eat here! And also to have a look in the shop they have next door with the most delicious goods in. Also - the coffee is strong and really good quality, and came complete with a beautiful love heart and swan! 

10/10 would recommend to anyone and am so grateful we decided to stop at this incredible spot for brunch! Thank you to all of the Town Mill Bakery team.

Having visited Lyme Regis primarily to look for sea glass we were ready for lunch. One of the party had been here before and the recommendation was spot on. We were quickly escorted to a table and menus provided. Wide range of choice for brunch/lunch. Staff were very friendly and orders taken and food delivered promptly. Our choices included, crab sandwich, smoked mackerel sandwich, sausage sandwich, Turkish eggs.  We were so impressed that we returned the next day for breakfast.
Superb breakfast. Owner / manager is a credit to his business. Fabulous service and lovely coffee and the best croissants my daughter (in her words) has ever tasted.

We visited the Town Mill Bakery over 10 years ago and had such fond memories we wanted to return with our family. It was still amazing. We went for breakfast and sat outside. All the staff were amazing with the kids, ranging from 6 month to 10 years. We ordered a full English, a veggie breakfast and the kids had pancakes. It was all delicious. We came back another couple of times during our stay for croissants, coffee and cakes. It‚Äôs set up really well for both takeaway and sitting in. The croissant and cinnamon buns were a particular favourite. Highly recommend visiting if in the area.

So glad we found this place, absolute delight. Very welcoming especially to little ones, with crayons and paper on arrival. The coffee was ace, the breakfast was awesome, the tomatoes were soooo nice!! The kids pancakes were oozing with chocolate, ideal for a birthday treat. Can't wait to come back.

Fabulous food & really welcoming. We ordered a vegetarian main course each, along with a couple of spare plates, and then shared it between us. So tasty and fresh ... a real treat. As for the cakes ... delicious! We 100% recommend.

After scouting for the perfect breakfast spot for our anniversary weekend I‚Äôd set my heart in coming here and wow did it impress!! We are from the midlands so really wanted to go somewhere that wowed us and the breakfasts we had here amazing. I had the bakers breakfast whilst my husband had the eggs Benedict and both were delicious, staff are super attentive and have the places running smoothly and the vibe is just so lovely, we shall be back next year for sure .

Undoubtedly the bread is delicious here and the overall presentation of the cafe very enticing. However I doubt I would return..
Having read about the amazing Turkish eggs I was keen to give it a try. However when I asked the waitress to expand on what it actually consisted of she could merely tell me it was quite popular and the oil was spicy. The reality was nice poached eggs sinking into a big pile of gloopy yogurt surrounded by a sea of thick bright orange mildly flavoured oil. I had to fish out the eggs and avocado and place on the toast to make the rather bland meal palatable 
Other small annoyances were the ‚Äòwait here‚Äô sign which created a massive queue resting against our seats for most of the meal and what seemed to be an expected tip of 10/15/20 pc added when we got up and queued again to pay. 

I 
I‚Äôd buy bread at their bakery but skip the lunch.

Absolutely delicious breakfasts on offer and the pastries in the take away shop next door also incredible. Very friendly and helpful staff who remembered our daughter on each visit, we went a couple of times during our lovely stay in Lyme Regis. Most definitely a local gem!

We had a really lovely breakfast here, the Turkish eggs were delicious and the tea came in satisfyingly large mugs. The service was swift and friendly and the atmosphere was relaxed. We were glad to catch them open on our last morning in Lyme Regis, as it is closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

After a super weekend in Lyme Regis we decided to have breakfast out before we left the area . Very poor breakfast, coffee luke warm and although a lot of staff service not very good had to ask for butter for our bread!

Review Title: As good as it was 12 years ago!
Review Text:
We returned to our favourite place for breakfast after 12 years! The children used to love it. We had a breakfast and it was excellent which is not easy when you have high expectations!
The Baker‚Äôs Breakfast looked so good. They use quality ingredients and it makes such a difference. Tasted wonderful. Also, Green Brunch which included avocado, tenderstem broccoli, tomatoes, hummus with lovely sourdough toast. 
The coffee is excellent too (Extract)
Staff are very friendly and definitely worth a visit

Review Title: Bathe me in those Turkish eggs
Review Text:
We decided to visit for lunch based on the reviews. The gentleman who served us was very welcoming and friendly to our daughter, offering her crayons as soon as we took our seat. Every time he came back he asked how she was doing with her drawing.

In the almost 4 years as parents, we've never felt more at ease at a restaurant than we did today. Even though it was a very busy time for them, it was such a nice touch - we didn't feel like we were a burden. 

There's something I've missed from this review - what was it? Oh yeah, the food! We both ordered Turkish eggs and they were mind blowing. Admittedly I've never had eggs that way before, but I'd be very surprised if they tasted *that* good in Turkey. The granary bread that accompanied it was perfect and the drinks were locally sourced and very refreshing. Oh and my girl loved her pancakes. I even took a bite (but didn't want to lose the aftertaste of the eggs), they were delicious too.

Once we were done, we didn't feel rushed or under pressure to pay the bill. It's a popular restaurant on a beautiful day in a busy seaside town - I'd completely understand if they needed the turnover (especially as it was the end of the season), but no, we felt welcome and not at all expendable.

Definitely recommended for anyone and everyone. 

I'll remember those eggs til the day I die.

Superb food, great service and atmosphere.
Indoor and outdoor seating.
Dog friendly.
Recommend the Turkish Eggs but the sourdough bacon sandwich was also very good.
Fabulous breakfast and super friendly staff.  We had the Turkish eggs - yummy, scrambled egg and eggs Benedict - all good sized portions.
Friendly staff, polite and professional. Wonderful food and super coffee. A really enjoyable experience- been visiting for about 10 years so see you next year!

Fabulous place tucked behind the seafront. Very popular with a range of ages, and rightly so. Excellent full bodied coffee and great to see a cafe where water is provided alongside the hot drink. Friendly service. Food looked amazing.

We stumbled across this place looking for a table of 10 for lunch. We were able to get a table and the food was just fantastic. Service was brilliant and all very reasonably priced. A true delight, so much so, we returned 2 days later!

Lovely food, lots of vegetarian options. Bench seating was fine for us but perhaps not great for everyone. Accommodated children well with pushchairs left to the side and providing highchairs. Food was generally very nice, particularly the bread. I was however, disappointed and surprised that they wouldn‚Äôt swap the poached egg on the vegetarian brekkie for scrambled (personal preference) even though it was available and the menu said to advise of any dislikes.

Review Title: The perfect independent bakery and restaurant
Review Text:
I was compelled to write a review of one of our favourite places to visit on holiday when in the wonderful Lyme Regis after reading a rather pointed review by another visitor. For a start this is a Bakery, it says so in its name, so don‚Äôt be surprised that many items include gluten! There are gluten free options as there are vegetarian but the bread and pastries do take centre stage. 
 The coffee came with beautiful latte art and the food was amazing. I would say that this is one of the best value for money places in Lyme. The portions are generous and the prices are lower than many other places near by. 
 All of the staff were attentive and friendly and more than willing to discuss what was on the menu.
 All I would say is be ready for a wait as they employ a first come first served system with no bookings. It works well and I guess removes the problem of ‚ÄúNo shows‚Äù.

Review Title: Assume Food, and the friendliest staff
Review Text:
Never failed to be treated like royalty and fed like a king.

From the smooth rich coffee, to the clearly carefully chose ingredients int he food.

My only complaint is  it to far from home to visit regularly.

My partner and I visit Lyme Regis every few weeks and always make a point to come to TMB. The service is great, food and coffee amazing (and good value), and there's always a spot outside so we can sit with our dog. We've visited most cafes in Lyme over the years (and they're all good) but find ourselves coming back to TMB every time.

The service staff are always friendly and attentive. The menu is full of bangers - personal favourites are the Eggs Benedict for brunch, or the Beef Brisket sandwich for lunch.

It's popular with locals and visitors who know about it, but because it's tucked away from the seafront we've never had to wait for a table even during the summer. The outside seating is also a nice shelter on a rainy day, or welcome shade during a heatwave.

We visit every year and it's always perfect! Best baked produce we have ever had ( well travelled ). Staff are fantastic and always so helpful. You must visit if going to Lyme Regis! See you soon üòä

We came here for breakfast. My partner is gluten intolerant and we were slightly surprised by the fact that there was only one gluten-free item on the otherwise extensive menu. This is in contrast to other establishments in Lyme Regis who have multiple gluten-free dishes and/or dishes which can be made gluten free upon request.

We asked if they have any gluten free bread, and were told no.

We asked about what we thought would be a reasonable gluten-free adjustment to their main breakfast, swapping bread for potatoes which are elsewhere on the menu, and was told in quite curt terms that it is not possible to 'pick and choose'. We were told that his was due to the small size of the kitchen, which is open and visible to the restaurant. However we have eaten at other establishments which have smaller kitchens and who have been much more accommodating. 

We were rather taken aback by the unwillingness to compromise to make reasonable adjustments, and so we left without purchasing anything. 

Giving 2 stars (instead of 1) because I am sure the food would have been very good, but we didn't order any!

Amazing place and great food for brunch. It has a lovely atmosphere, you won't get wet even on a rainy day. Great selection on a menu, food was delicious, and great options for decent. Even the dogs get a biscuit and even a bed for the stay! Highly recommend a visit.

Lady on the next table saw what I was eating as she left and remarked that the Turkish eggs was amongst the best things she had ever eaten. We agreed. It was a showstopper. Love the community bench eating style. Separate by a flower pot. Wonderful selection of drinks too. Can‚Äôt wait to return.

All I can say is faultless, lovely friendly staff, quick service, utterly delicious food, quirky fun atmosphere, beds for your dogs outside, just perfect. 
I had the Turkish eggs and the sourdough pancakes with bacon and maple syrup I have to say it‚Äôs on of the best I‚Äôve ever had. Took away pastry‚Äôs and coffee once again exceptional, sad I live so far away

Love popping in here for lunch when we‚Äôre in Lyme. So pleased it was open when we visited. 
The menu is varied and delicious. It was very busy which gave the place a buzzy atmosphere. 
Due to the long tables and benches it‚Äôs a great venue for large groups but this shouldn‚Äôt put couples / smaller groups off going. 
The waitress we had on this visit was a little abrupt and not very warm / friendly but we enjoyed our lunch and will be back.

Tried Turkish eggs for first time was so impressed , good portion size including avocado
Lovely toast served with it definitely needed to soak up the delicious garlicky sauce 
Wife had Brie and bacon toastier also delicious
Only popped in for coffee and cake but it was lovely. Nice, coffee, cakes, service and atmosphere. Looking at some of the cooked food coming out I will be returning soon.

It was so nice the seating area and the service was so fast.
The staff are so friendly and kind.
Would recommend to come for a quick break near the sea or a nice meal.
We had an amazing breakfast twice during our stay in Lyme Regis. Everything was fresh and tasted great. The vegan breakfast was amazing. Great atmosphere and staff too.

Amazing food  with a great vegetarian and vegan choice. I had the green brunch with their own homemade mixed beans as an extra, it was really delicious and very reasonable. All the staff are really  friendly  and helpful.  Well done

This was our 3rd visit whilst on holiday in Lyme Regis over the years. It is so wonderful to know that Town Mill Bakery always serves up delicious freshly baked bread, pastries and cakes, along with a superb beef brisket sandwich and most excellent coffee. Great service, and relaxed atmosphere. I wish more places were like this!  Ordered bread and pastries to come home with us too - marvellous!!

Review Title: I can still taste the Crab - THANK YOU
Review Text: OMG! - best crab sandwich ever and i will leave it at that; the place must be visited when you are in Lyme Regis

Review Title: Nice food spoilt by rude waitress
Review Text: My wife and three young children (including pram) visited this cafe for lunch, we waited for some time outside before we sat down at a table that had become vacant outside in what was a busy lunch period. We were ‚Äúgreeted‚Äù by quite possibly the rudest woman we‚Äôve ever been served by. She asked   ‚Äúwho seated you‚Äù we replied ‚Äúno one‚Äù she replied ‚Äúyou‚Äôre literally sat by a sign that says, ‚Äòwait to be seated‚Äô‚Äù we apologised and asked if the table was reserved. In all honesty our pram and their plastic beach spades obscured said sign and we just wanted to get out of the way of other customers and staff. We proceeded to order drinks without any time given to look at menus. My partner ordered diet cokes before sarcastically being told ‚Äúyou can have anything you like off the menu, but it has to be on the menu‚Äù we studied the menu and proceeded to order what turned out to be rather awful tasting sugar free colas‚Ä¶ (Diet Cokes?). What could have been an enjoyable lunch was spoilt by someone who clearly requires a customer services refresher course or perhaps a change of career.

The perfect setting for coffee, brunch, lunch  any time of day superb service and food,
great industrial style of decoration, super ambiance, will travel 100miles round trip for this experience.    LJ/Kay
Good service.  Everything cooked to order and was beautifully cooked, presented  well and tasted amazing.  Def going back.

Review Title: Every town needs a place like this.
Review Text:
Just what you'd want from a modern bakery cafe; great bread, great dishes, great staff, and a bright social space.

We came twice on a 5 day visit, once for brekkie, and once for lunch.

On site shop too for takeaway bread, cakes and other goodies.
Lovely welcome on a very rainy day in Lyme Regis. Rustic setting with London wooden tables and benches. Had toasties for lunch on lovely sour dough, tasty and good quality food.

Consistently good and always a very warm welcome at this lovely family run restaurant. Sweetcorn fritters are definitely worth a try. The sourdough bread has deservedly been awarded a gold medal in Taste of the West awards.

Review Title: The best place to eat in Lyme Regis
Review Text: Simple the best place to have breakfast or lunch in lyme regis. Go you  will see for yourself . incredible value incredible food
Thoroughly enjoyable visit. Cheese toasties were tasty and coffee good. Staff friendly and helpful. Service prompt.

We found this place whilst on a rainy walk on day one, of our three day stay in Lyme Regis. We stopped for a late lunch, the front of house  guy was lovely and seated us after a brief look at the menu. The food was equally as excellent as the service. Even the kids (6 & 11) are the huge steak pasties they were served.
We went back on Monday for brunch, before hitting the road for the drive home. The full breakfast was delicious and filled us up for the day.  The staff were once again lovely and very attentive. 
Will definitely visit again when we are next in the area.

We only had a couple of pastries but‚Ä¶
a) they were really excellent
b) I wish we‚Äôd planned to have a proper breakfast as everyone around us was tucking in and literally every item looked amazing

it‚Äôs a cosy little place and clearly the owners feel passionately about it. The guy running the place was delightful.

My wife and I are ticking off various Dorset locations one by one, so we didn‚Äôt plan to return to Lyme in a hurry. Now we will!

The food was amazing and generous portions, the service was really welcoming and friendly, hot drinks were great quality and the place had a really nice feel with lots of plants and didn‚Äôt take itself too seriously
Really good breakfast coffee good eggs good Croissant excellent. So good we went back the next day thoroughly recommend

Review Title: Lunch at this lovely Bakery with a difference
Review Text: Wandered off the sea front of Lyme Regis, to find this lovely place. Real friendly staff, food was really good, and all at very good value. A place I will love to visit again.
Best veggie breakfast I‚Äôve had in a long time. Fried potatoes, avocado, mushrooms, poached egg, sourdough, special beans and tomatoes - delicious
We came across the this place whilst walking around Lyme Regis. We had a fantastic meal and hot drinks.  The Turkish Eggs was do nice.  We'll be back

Great coffee, gorgeous food (we did breakfast & lunch), friendly & attentive staff, & really good value. The bakery shop next door is lovely too-  the granary sour dough is so delicious! I photographed our Turkish Eggs dish, but everything we had was beautifully presented & tasted even better‚Ä¶ we‚Äôll definitely be back!

Our third time visiting this bakery now, we always stop by on the way down to the south west, just for the food here.
Always accommodating and quick to be served.

The Town Mill Bakery is run by a very friendly staff.

We ordered the Chicken curry, 12.95 and the Courgette Hallumi fritter 9.50. Both were tasty and filling.

Excellent Americano.

Dog friendly.

Decided to stop here after a 4hr drive on our way to Cornwall.  We were not disappointed  - loverly welcome and great food.  We arrived just after they had opened, so the only two there -  we had Bakers Breakfast and Veggie Bakers Breakfast, Flat White and Cappuccino and apple juice.   Generous portion and well cooked/presented.   Coffee was great and well prepared.   All the staff seemed really friendly.  The only disappointment?   We live 4hrs away!!
Delicious, nutritional, wonderful, flavoursome, friendly. This place has it all. Fantastic venue, make sure you go!

Great food, always fresh and tasty. I particularly loved the sweetcorn fritters.

Only downside is that once you‚Äôve eaten their bread, you will never want to eat any other, it really is THAT good!

We were so excited to try town mill after going 10 years ago and reading the recent reviews, but we were severely disappointed. 
We arrived 30 minutes after opening and it had a few people dining but it wasn‚Äôt busy. We were seated but then ignored for over 20 minutes. Whilst waiting we  went to look in the bakery at the side to see the delicious baked goods, and they looked no better than supermarket offerings. If anything, it all seemed like it had been sat out for days, as it was dry, shrunken and lacklustre. The photos used online (promo) are not representative of what‚Äôs actually available. Due to the way it works, cafe customers go next door to look for baked goods but after being told to go look by cafe staff,  I was then questioned by the staff for pushing in (queue for takeaway) I don‚Äôt mind being questioned but it wasn‚Äôt in a polite manner and was accusatory in tone. After heading back in to the cafe, we waited a further 15 minutes and still no service. I wouldn‚Äôt mind if it had been busy but it was bordering on quiet. It‚Äôs also open kitchen and the chefs were simply standing looking like they‚Äôd rather be anywhere else creating quite an uncomfortable environment. I‚Äôd like to say the food salvaged this place but in the end we left as no one served us and we were sick of waiting. The one thing this place needs is customer service as it‚Äôs severely lacking. I also phoned prior and was hung up on by the staff member as I was clearly an inconvenience. A real letdown.

We visited this cafe after recommendation from local friends. We were not disappointed. 
I had the veggie breakfast, which is the best breakfast I have ever had! It was very tasty , especially the homemade baked beans. My husband & friends had the traditional cooked breakfast, which had very tasty , good quality sausages & bacon. Perfectly cooked poached eggs too. Very generous portions . Lovely staff, great atmosphere. 
Definitely recommend.

Absolutely delicious place for brunch, I had the pesto chicken sandwich and my partner had the Turkish eggs. We are both big eaters and couldn‚Äôt finish it! I had my sandwich boxed up as it was too good to leave. The sourdough bread was amazing, if we lived closer we would be regulars! Thank you
Just the best breakfast I‚Äôve ever had cooked for me! Delightful staff in a perfect setting. Black pudding was delicious and all ingredients so well balanced
Our first visit, the family really enjoyed the food and the relaxed atmosphere. We will be returning soon.   PS please provide a local Ale...not one from London üòâ

We ate here twice lunch and Sunday breakfast-food was excellent and the staff very attentive. Special applause for the young team member who made our coffees as they were perfect. We even bought a loaf and mincemeat tart on the way out.
Brilliant highly recommended 
Andrew and Louise from West Sussex

Review Title: Excellent food and atmosphere super dog friendly
Review Text: visited Lyme Regis for a couple of weeks and just loved coming here with my dog Rupert ,who they treated like a star .with a dog mat treats and strokes.i love all the food here over the years I've visited here and tried all the dishes all excellent in flavours and quality of ingredients .all dishes are 5/ 5 but my taste buds particularly like the sourdough pancakes with maple syrup and the cozy eggs

Exploring Lyme Regis - just me and my camera - when I came across THE TOWN MILL BAKERY. Walked in and felt instantly at home. A really good, relaxed, welcoming vibe. The lunch was absolutely delicious - I had homemade soup and cheese on toast. Excellent bread! Everything was presented beautifully but wasn‚Äôt pretentious. The staff were extremely friendly and efficient and I got the impression they were proud of the place and enjoyed working there. Highly recommended- I‚Äôm so pleased I found it!

We called in on a very wet and windy Saturday just after arrival for a long weekend away and how glad we are that we did. From the warm and friendly welcome til the moment we left was terrific. We quite often visit Lyme and are kicking ourselves that we hadn‚Äôt visited before. Everything I had with my breakfast was outstanding, poached eggs perfect, succulent sausage and proper bacon. The sourdough bread delightful and the beans worth an hour‚Äôs drive alone. The ham, eggs and hollandaise sauce was equally impressive, fresh, generous and perfectly cooked. This is undoubtedly our first stop on our next trip.
Outstanding.

Review Title: Simply not like anywhere else in Lyme
Review Text: We have been visiting for years but went into today a cold wet Saturday morning and again really really enjoyed the experience so much I had to share a review with you. The place was full  the noise generated by all the conversations  filled the air. A really great Vibe. You will either love or hate this place but if you want really quality food and drinks served in a really casual but friendly manner. A great atmosphere and really reasonable prices for the quality make a point of visiting. Only open until 3pm. The ideal time to visit is either brunch or an early dinner. I would say this is the best place in Lyme for either.

Had been huge fan of original owner at Rousdon Cafe so came with hope in heart for similar Big Bang tasty, local fare.  Friendly staff, relaxed but narrow tables, (can‚Äôt fit two plates easily opposite each other) - v dog friendly which was lovely though.  Friend had the full breakfast - good sausages but overly spiced black pudding and bland beans, (definitely not cooked slow with molasses for authentic cowboy bean taste sadly).  Sourdough bread lovely and chewy but fried in a bit of light oil so not as tasty as if given a bit of butter love.  No immediate info emphasising sourcing from local farms/producers but I could easily have just missed this and failed to remember to ask the sunny staff.  Light pancakes with maple syrup but oh dear, butter in those little generic foil wrapped pats - definitely not locally sourced!

Extremely friendly and professional service, finally we have found an amazing place that offer amazing quality of both food and experience. They gave us rugs for the dogs and a blanket for my mother in law to keep here warm. The food came quickly and was delicious!

We stopped for brunch at this great cafe, tucked away in a quiet street in Lyme Regis.
Good atmosphere, quite different from the usual run of the mill cafe settings. Excellent selection of dishes, some quite alternative. We had Eggs Benedict and Turkish Eggs, delicious and plentiful.  Coffee was good and strong, just perfect. Pleasant, efficient and cheerful staff. Thoroughly recommend.

Lovely cheese on toast and friendly staff.Coffee good and served hot which was great after our recent visit to a nearby Hotel.
Only downside was my wife's pastry was a bit stale but otherwise loved the ambiance.Will return.

During a four-day trip to Lyme Regis we went three days running.  Recommendations include the Roast Chicken sandwich on sourdough bread, crab sandwich on sourdough, poached eggs on granary with bacon and mushrooms, freshly made pancakes with maple syrup, delicious freshly ground coffee and strongly brewed tea! 

The bakery also sells everything from croissants to a selection of muffins. 

Inside and outside tables plus friendly, attentive staff. 

The highlight of our visit to Lyme Regis.

A fantastic experience. There were 12 of us and we weren‚Äôt able to book prior, but that didn‚Äôt stop the amazing staff ensuring we were seated and look after so well! The service was quick and efficient, the staff were so lovely, and the food was amazing - every meal that we had was fresh, tasty and so much better than the norm and very well priced. A really great experience that we would recommend and continue to come back to. Thank you so much!

Staffed by hippies beamed straight from Glastonbury, this side-street caff makes up for its lack of sea front location by service the most excellent foods. Big breakfast was both served speedily AND fantastically tasty - full marks for sausage and especially delicious mixture of beans. My cappuccino was also the most delicious I've ever tasted. Not cheap but excellent value. Well worth seeking out.

We found this great eatery last year on holiday and we loved it. We were keen to return this year and we weren't disappointed.  The breakfasts are wholesome, tasty and filling. The staff are welcoming and friendly. Later in the week we had the most delicious cake take out from the shop adjoining the restaurant.  There was a great choice and all cakes were fresh and delicious. We all commented on how reasonable the prices were compared to other shops in Lyme. We will see you again next year.
Really liked this place.  Service was welcoming & fast.  Food (very late breakfast after travelling down) was great & despite being busy we didn't wait too long.  Loved the industrial style inside.

Visited for first time. Friendly and welcoming staff, they even provided a doggy mat and water for Millie (our Springer spaniel).
Great food, very filling, lovely atmosphere, would thoroughly recommend.

Popped in here for a spot of quick lunch. Friendly staff, a nice mixed breakfast / brunch / menu and excellent coffee. Food was tasty and freshly prepped,  and service was good. Well worth going to away from the Main Street hustle and bustle.

Review Title: Gorgeous healthy tasty food with awesome staff
Review Text: Been in Lyme for a few days eating fish and chips and ice cream, absolutely craving something healthy. Stumbled on this place one lunchtime and oh my gosh what a find. Beautiful menu. Had pan fried mackerel with Greek salad and it was so so good. The waiter was so nice and great with the kids. Will be back.
Open kitchen, lovely setting and good menu options and generous portions.  Lovely friendly staff and would definitely recommend!

Review Title: Two visits as had to try the pancakes for breakfast
Review Text:
Had a quick lunch here on our first day in Lyme then returned for brunch on our last.

Service was brilliant, really friendly and helpful - seemed like nothing was too much trouble and super apologetic when they'd run out of sausage rolls etc. Hardly their fault when we turned up close to closing (3pm).

There's tables and benches both outside and in, suitable for us as a couple, but I also saw larger families and dogs being warmly welcomed.

I can thoroughly recommend the pancakes with maple syrup and fruit - they were amazing. Had we been staying longer I think we would have returned to sample even more off the menu.

Sehr nettes Restaurant mit super Essen und sehr netten Service ! 
Freundlich , aufmerksam genau wie man es m√∂chte . Ich w√ºrde sofort wieder dort Essen

We popped in for lunch on our way to the beach and couldn't have been happier with that decision! We ordered a bakers breakfast and the brisket sandwich. The bakers breakfast was large and tasty, and came with an extra egg as we had ordered no mushrooms. The brisket sandwich however was the star of the show: stuffed fully of flavourful, melt in your mouth beef, perfect filling to bread ratio and a really tasty horseradish source. The service was efficient and super friendly. We will definitely be returning!

Popped in to get a slice of their delicious lemon üçã polenta  cake. This cake defines moist! If you like polenta, I would highly recommend a slice. Unfortunately, I got so carried away I forgot to take a picture. üò≥
Besides the wonderful food here, the service is excellent. I was served by Kat, who had the friendliest demeanour. Nothing tops a polite, smiley face, apart from great food! Thank you Kat!
This is the second time we have visited Town Mill Bakery whilst staying in Lyme Regis and the staff, food and atmosphere are great. We will definitely be back.
We had a delicious family lunch here today, generous portions, friendly, attentive and prompt service, dog friendly sitting outside but under cover.
This place was recommended by a local so we went here for a late breakfast.  We were not disappointed!  Food was gorgeous and the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly.

Tucked away down a small street, this is a simple and unpretentious cafe that provides great food and tasty coffee. Rows of bench seating make for easy sitting and service is great from the friendly staff. We went on consecutive days for breakfast and both visits were excellent. Food is well prepared, plentiful and service is quick. Recommended for an early start or a lunch stop.

Review Title: Hit and Miss on this particular day.
Review Text:
Weird really. Visited on a day they were having wifi problems so no wifi and no card payments but all of that is OK. However it did lead to focusing on sorting out the problem rather than customers. The bins smelt of fish and were located near the outdoor tables, there was a  lack of fruit available on the pancakes and when my wife asked for some toast because they didn't have fruit for the pancakes she was told they don't do toast. It's a bakery and it doesn't do toast. 

That said the croissant and pain aux raisin were excellent as in French quality pastries and the coffee was equally superb. Genuinely even after the lack of products I would go back for the pastries and coffee. However it was all a bit haphazard so only a 3/5 for this visit.

We always visit the bakery to buy bread and get breakfast at least once when in Lyme; this time, breakfast was delicious, healthy and huge.  We always enjoy watching the chefs work and staff members are always helpful.

Overall we enjoyed our lunch. The leek and potato soup tasted fine, but was quite thin.  Last time I had soup here it was great - thick and hearty, so it may just be a one off. On the plus side the bread was good (if you like sourdough) and the service was friendly and efficient.
Great find for lunch. Really friendly service, great food, generous portions, child friendly. Also provide take-away. Will definitely go back next time we're in Lyme Regis.

The bakery was our choice for breakfast on our last morning in Lyme Regis and boy was it a great choice. Coffee was great, the breakfast was stunningly good and the toast was unforgettable. We loved it so much we bought extra loaves for the freezer at home.

Delicious,  fresh food and friendly service. 
Highly recommended - we were overjoyed to find it open yesterday. Gorgeous salad with a sneaky poached egg.

Review Title: Outstanding find for brunch, lunch or coffee and pastries.
Review Text: Friendly and welcoming service, lovely food and very dog friendly outside on the covered terrace! A must-visit hidden gem away from the beachfront crowds in Lyme Regis.

A perfect place to eat brunch or lunch! We visited twice having been so impressed with our first visit. Lovely menus, delicious food, amazing coffee! Great friendly atmosphere. They ticked every box. Service 5 stars too. Thanks Jane you made us feel so welcome! Even the chefs take the time to say hello. Will be coming here again on our next visit to Lyme. Make sure you buy some bread and cakes from the bakery too. Absolutely deleeeeeeicious!!

We found this cafe by accident, parking just up the road we noticed it was full and looked good. After a brisk walk along the waterfront we concluded that it looked the best place for lunch, I don‚Äôt think we were mistaken.

The food was great, good ingredients, freshly prepared, nicely presented.

The staff were very friendly.

Well worth searching the back streets for!

the food here is really very good. It's hard to decide between lunch or breakfast!! 

The food is freshly cooked and the bread baked onsite each day. it really is exceptional. There are good choices and nice drinks. staff very friendly. coffee is nice too. 

you have to wait to sit down, there is often a queue, and then a while to get your food. because it is cooked fresh. i wish i had this near me at home!!

Review Title: Amazing food and very generous portions
Review Text: The food here is outstanding! Lovely staff and great atmosphere. So many tempting dishes so hard to choose. We will definitely return.
Had a lovely lunch here. Fantastic food good portion and really lovely friendly staff. We had our dog with us which was no problem for them. Best cup of tea outside of home!

Review Title: Tasty well cooked brunch with generous portions
Review Text: Lovely vibe, friendly staff and tasty food. Ordered extra spinach and tomatoes which some restaurants can fob you off with half a tomato and a couple of sad spinach leaves. Here I had a lovely bunch of roasted cherry tomatoes and generous cup of beautifully wilted spinach‚Ä¶..

Popped into this wonderful bakery on arriving in Lyme Regis and settling into our holiday cottage- this gem of a bakery was two doors up from it!  Sat outside in dog friendly seats and enjoyed Turkish eggs and Welsh rarebit as a late lunch.  Absolutely delicious, wonderful ingredients and mind blowing flavours - served with/on their own very tasty sour dough.  Was beaten by the generous portion size.  Lovely staff made us very welcome and even had dog treats at the ready.  This place is not to be missed if you‚Äôre visiting Lyme for a delicious brunch or lunch.

Review Title: Amazing Bacon Sandwich, Poor Takeway Options
Review Text:
This was my 2nd visit to the Bakery  as the 1st time I had the best bacon sandwich I had ever had!! The sandwich didn't disappoint. I did want to do takeaway like I did last time but was told they only did takeaway food that was from the takeaway section because they were busy (fair enough) & also they couldn't reheat any of it. The only warm/hot food you could takeaway was soup but surely more difficult to takeaway soup than a sandwich! I didn't fancy a cold pasty or soup so I decided to sit outside & I ordered a bacon sandwich which as previous said was amazing!
I couldn't recommend a takeaway from this place unless you want soup or cold pasty but I will be back again to have the bacon sandwich.

We came for afternoon drinks and cake and we were not disappointed. Great selection of cakes and bakes and great service. We were welcomed to sit outside with our dog and they gave her a biscuit, bed and water!

Review Title: Amazing pancakes great for tourists but excellent for supporting local people
Review Text: Had amazing pancakes I'm hoping to try whole menu during my stay. Everything cooked in front of you no hidden things just proud to show there excellent food. Surports local business by buying products locally but I also liked how the locals would pop in for  freshly made loaf of bread. So offering a service to locals  and supporting tourism which all helps the community amazing well done can't wait to come back.sorry no pics of food it's so good I ate it .
This place is a hidden gem. the food is wonderful (the best Welsh rarebit I've ever had) wish we lived closer so that we could visit more often.

Lovely brunch here. Great food and really welcoming for families. Our two little ones were happy colouring and proud to have their art displayed on the pin board! Nice aesthetic - will definitely go back!

Review Title: Delicious meal in a rustic setting
Review Text: We had lunch at The Town Mill Bakery, having eaten in a variety of locations over the years in Lyme Regis. This is now our go to lunch destination. Excellent quality food and reasonably priced. Very friendly service and if you sit inside you can watch the chef at work. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

An unprepossessing place, in a lean-to, attached to a bakery. But do not let that put you off! Go inside to discover a German beer hall/refectory set up with an open kitchen  great food and coffee, and 70s/80s music.  This is a small, relatively new business that deserves to do well , with owners and staff who care about it. Give it a go!
AMAZING. Food was great, service was great, the entire experience was great. Very nice people, lots of local food. The Best.

This delightful establishment was literally on our doorstep whilst staying in Lyme. The family visited a few times and we ate our last holiday breakfast there. It is staffed by delightful people serves delicious food and is so welcoming. It's worth seeking out and sampling the food to eat in or take away.
Amazing place, fantastic food, great atmosphere (and soundtrack for breakfast) and spot on service with a big smile. Overall perfect brunch experience couldn't fault it and will certainly go back!

Just finished an amazing breakfast at the Town mill bakery! The staff are lovely and there is a warm welcome when you arrive. 
If you check their social media page before you go they will state if they are not open, we saw they were back open this weekend so had no trouble in waiting a day to visit them!  You can tell it‚Äôs a well loved place, due to queues for the bakery and restaurant.
Thank you! We‚Äôll be back next time we visit Lyme Regis

Review Title: First time visit - can‚Äôt wait to come back
Review Text: We came here with our 15 month old for some brunch. The food was amazing. As a vegetarian I‚Äôm always looking for places that have more than one option and creates amazing quality vegetarian food and town mill bakery was it! My husband had a meat option and loved his too. We‚Äôre both still a bit anxious about going out to eat with our 15 month old due to him being born during the first lockdown, but he loved it and everyone was really welcoming and kind. We‚Äôll be coming again when we‚Äôre next visiting Lyme Regis.

We called in to grab some goodies for a walking lunch. The veggie roll was the best tasting veggie roll I have ever had with a lovely mix of vegetables and cheese. Both the veggie roll and the steak pasty were a great size and very filling. The cakes were the best cakes we found in Lyme Regis.

Excellent coffee and best pancakes ever!  Every time we go to Lyme Regis we make a beeline for this splendid bakery.  Well done Jack Frost and all the lovely staff who make it such a great family friendly experience.
