This place is a definite must visit for a good, healthy large portion lunch/brunch.  We were very well looked after, the staff were very attentive, friendly, chatty and welcoming.  All the guests received the same quality of service. It is very family friendly and children were made to feel very welcome.  It is relaxed and the food was fabulous. We will definitely visit again.
A wonderful place to eat. Good and not expensive Veggie dishes, excellent coffee and delightful staff. Sort of quirky!
The breakfasts here are simple and delicious and should not be missed. The staff a re lovely and nothing is too much trouble. Well worth  a visit

Review Title: Favourite place to eat and drink in Lyme Regis
Review Text:
We came here three times. Twice for coffee and cake and once for breakfast.

The coffee was amazing, definitely the best we had in Lyme Regis. The cakes were excellent - tried banoffee cake and an almond biscuit.

Breakfast was also exceptional. We had the halloumi fritters and several different combinations of sausages, eggs, mushrooms and halloumi on toast. Portions were very generous and everything tasted delicious.

Service very good and dog friendly (but you must sit outside)

You must visit here if you come to Lyme Regis!

Review Title: Top place for breakfast or brunch
Review Text:
Tucked up a side street but a great find 
First visit we brought bread from bakery then returned few days later for breakfast only waited few minutes for a table inside.
Friendly greatening from the staff , plenty of space on the table / benches.
Order taken promptly the chef is right there cooking so many poached eggs I must say they were good 
Great coffee & food 
The guy on coffee machine well chipper interacting with clients especially the children then as we were leaving thanked us for coming.
A perfect breakfast 
Thanks
Have been twice now and on both occasions the food and service were excellent. The staff are very friendly and attentive and the food is delicious.

Stayed in Lyme Regis for a long weekend and was looking forward to eating breakfast here every morning because it looks great and it's practically next door to our accommodation.
Had the scrambled eggs and smoked salmon and it really wasnt that great,salmon didn't look or taste that great and everything lacked taste. 
Coffee was terrific though and I told the women making it was,apparently she learnt it from her son before he returned to Uni.

Review Title: Astonishingly rude take away lady owner
Review Text: Absolutely delicious coffee tainted by 2 episodes of rudeness in one order of 6 coffees. I don‚Äôt know whether the lady was having a bad day or didn‚Äôt want to be working but my friend and I were so shocked at the way we were spoken to that I felt obliged to write my first ever negative review on here.

Magnificent. We had walked to Corfe from Swanage and wanted a bite to eat.  I could not believe we could find such quality in a tourist village. I had a prawn mayo bap for a mere ¬£2.90.It sounds nothing but it was great. Nice bread, generous tasty filling. In Bournemouth I would have paid twice as much and it wouldn't have been half as good. My wife had a cake. She swore it was the best cake she had had in years.
We liked it so much we plan to walk from Swanage to Corfe again next week, and then back again, just so we can go to this bakery again. Oh! And the staff was charming.

Review Title: A great bakery of snacks and pies
Review Text:
A lovely little bakery.
Absolutely marvellous pies and pastries.
Dropped in to pick up snacks after walking round the castle. The pasties and the spinach and feta slice were lovely and a reasonable price.

Grabbed a quick pasty straight from the oven, and it was absolutely delicious. The pastry flaked, and it was just the right size.
Only observation is that it was called a Cornish Pasty but had minced beef rather than cubed. Beware Trelawneys army fining out and laying siege to the shop!
Doesn‚Äôt stop them being great though.
Bought a (very!) large brown seeded loaf yesterday. It is absolutely delicious. I froze half, and if that turns out the same I will try and make room in our freezer for a bulk purchase.

Review Title: Lovely Selection of Both Hot & Cold Items
Review Text: We only bought cakes but shout out to the Vienese Fingers and the Bread Pudding.  Hot selection smelt and looked lovely too, ideal if you don't want to pay Cafe prices.
Bought a gluten-free loaf here to take home. Absolutely delicious - nearly finished it all already despite slicing and freezing it immediately - best I‚Äôve found!

Probably one of the best bakers we have been too.
Bread is so fresh.
Sandwiches are amazing and all great value.
Best Dorset Cake ever. Every time I come to Corfe I buy one. Soo good. Very helpful staff, lovely breds too

Review Title: Best value on the South Coast.
Review Text: Went to see the castle and the model village, saw the bakery and the queue, got pork pies, pasties, sausage rolls and sandwiches,all very tasty, and very very good value, the young lady who served me was a delight, and very patient.
Staying self-catering this bakery helped ensure a brilliant holiday. Bread and cakes excellent, and the breakfast baps a real treat.
Fantastic pasties, wide selection of food available. Make sure you buy some of the corfe biscuits! Delicious!
This is genuinely one of the best places to buy a pasty I have ever been too. The pasties are hot, crispy pastry and the filling is fruitful. So lucky to have such a great bakers in Corfe Castle.

Devon buns the best.
 Dragons Bakery best bakers nothing too much trouble for them, thank you from Stella x

OMG This place is located in the picturesque Village of Corfe Castle But I‚Äôm not reviewing the bakery on its amazing location or How pretty it looks No I‚Äôm Reviewing this place on how AMAZING the food they cook here.. 
I ordered 1 Large pastie,1 Cheese slice,1 Steak Slice & I can tell you now I can‚Äôt pick a favourite out of the 3- The pastie had so much meat/Potatoe- Steak Slice had an amazing gravy covered in steak & The cheese slice was So Tasty.. 
I Remembered this places food was good but this time it was Exceptional & a must visit if your visiting Corfe Castle.. 
They stock all the Favs a bakery does & even serves Tea/Coffee to Takeaway 
Still got the taste of that Large pastie whilst writing this haha 100% Recommend.

I happen to enjoy a pork pie and these are the best. Crumbly, buttery shortcrust outer and an accompanying amount of beautifully seasoned sausage meat. It is also pleasing to find that they do not have the not so nice jelly/gravy which some pork pies might contain. It is also worth noting that the size of the pork pies are perfect for lunch or just as a snack. They are also not over priced. Result.

Bought a loaf whilst passing through the village, returned on our way home some days later and bought 3 more loaves as the bread was fantastic. Sadly we were only in Dorset on holiday and normally live miles away or we‚Äôd shop here every day. Lovely friendly staff too.

Review Title: One of, if not the BEST Bakery in Dorset
Review Text:
My Wife and I live in Dorset and we visit the Bakery
for our lunch every time we pass through Corfe
Castle, the choice of hot and cold snacks plus
cakes is superb and considering the popular location, very reasonably priced, no wonder it is so popular. Open 7 days a week throughout the year, I believe only closing on Christmas Day.
There is nearly always a queue so be patient especially during the Summer and other times when the weather good. The staff are brilliant, clean, smart and have to work very hard to cope 
with demand from visitors that decend from all parts of the uk

This never fails to please. Pasties, lardy cake, sausage rolls, sandwiches. Staff efficient and polite. I use this place a lot and they get some pretty grim customers but their patience with the North London whingers is exemplary.

Best bakery in Purbeck is no understatement. I can understand why a few neg results on here about staff not bending over backwards to be over friendly, however this was during Bad Covid 19 outbreak and the bakery area is very small. Plus we have the usual suspects on Holiday refusing to wear a mask in our home town. Pasties are the best ever, great fresh rolls and sarnies and the doughnuts are the best i've ever had. Shame about the belgium buns, bit dry,
First time in Corfe Castle and we called in the Village Bakery, tried the Cornish Pasties and they were amazing. Very impressed.

Just returned from a holiday in West Lulwoth. 
One day we (4 of us) visited Corfe Castle and happened upon The Bakery. We each had a Cornish Pasty and are all agreed these were the best pasties we had ever eaten, despite many years of holidaying in Cornwall.
Fantastic!! keep up the good work.

Soooo many delicious delights in this fabulous bakery. We bought our beach lunch here every day for over a week and faced the daily dilemma of staying with the previous day‚Äôs gem, or trying another tempting treat. Fabulous pies & pasties, freshly prepared filled rolls and an amazing array of breads, cakes & pastries too. Absolutely worth a short queue in the busy holiday season, but do spare a thought and a smile for the staff who work such long hours during the summer heat - can‚Äôt be easy working in those temperatures, patiently waiting as we agonise over so many choices of filling, bread type, naughty but nice cakes etc. 
Oh, and the coffee & bargain breakfast baps totally hit the spot too. Well done to all the team & hope you enjoy a well-deserved month or two‚Äôs respite over Christmas.

Good service and everything we bought was excellent. Can get a bit crowded as shop is small.
Parking is available around the square.
Full and half size loaves are available.  They had a good assortment of sweet baked products while we were there.  Their beef and chicken-leek pasties were divine.
Grabbed some sausage rolls and cake whilst on a visit to Corfe castle, sausage rolls were tasty and piping hot. Would recommend and visit again.

Very good cakes but we arrived after lunch so the selection was limited. Best to go in the morning.
We would recommend the lemon cake.

Always call in here for coffee and a cake whilst cycling between the Ferry and Swanage. Nice cup of coffee and a cake to keep my sugar levels up before lunch in Swanage. Secure bike parking and toilet‚Äôs near Castle ticket office are handy . Bakery staff are always polite. Regards Gary.

Rarely do you find a pasty that's full top to bottom end to end with filling. Until now! A huge beastie at ¬£4.00 but worth every mouthful. Hot, savoury well cooked filling of meat, carrot and potato. 

Fantastic and a beautiful hot loaf of malted grain bread to have with some local Dorset brie for tea with local real ale chutney.

Place is spotlessly clean. Staff are pleasant and friendly. 

Lovely üôÇ

Terrible discrimination in this shop. Got shouted at for not obeying made up rule with no legal standing at that particular time. However it is against the law to implement disability discrimination. 
Disgusting treatment.
Staff rude to disabled who were mask exempt telling them to go outside and  wait. Will never return or give them business again .

What a wonderful little bakery that has won awards for some of its products. We brought a Cornish pasty & a Viennese finger. Hubby had the pasty and his words were it‚Äôs one of the best he‚Äôs eaten including all the ones he‚Äôs had in Cornwall. The Viennese finger was melt in the mouth. Definitely going again when in the area.
Do not expect a warm welcome by friendly staff at Corfe Castle bakery, expect the exact opposite. The food isn't worth the agro either. Do yourself a favour and find somewhere that wants your custom.

Very rude and overbearing bossy staff. Heard one lady being shouted quite abruptly and asked to stand outside. I didn‚Äôt like hearing this and so decided to not offer my custom. Avoid there are many more welcoming alternatives.
Rude staff. Shouted at for their made up rules in front of others. Will never return here. I see many others are feeling the same. They need to go on a customer service course.

Really rude staff. Been in the bakery numerous times and every time, I was met by rude staff. No hello, no thank you, no customer service. I feel they bring a negative experience of living/visiting to Corfe Castle

Popped in today after a visit to Corfe Castle to pick up some lunch. What an absolute delight. Staff were very friendly, strict hygiene standards and the 2 pre-made baguettes were delicious. You could certainly tell they were fresh and deep filled. Nothing beats the aroma of freshly baked bread! 
Will most certainly return on our next visit to Dorset.
What an awesome gem! It‚Äôs not very often you encounter a bakery, that‚Äôs not part of a mainstream chain. Highly recommended and very well priced for the amount and quality received

Review Title: "A very large jewel in Dorset's crown"
Review Text:
What a fantastic bakery this is, we always call in when we visit Corfe. Everything produced onsite in the bakery is absolutely second to none. I have honestly not tasted cakes and pastries this good from anywhere else. I cannot recommend this brilliant little medieval bakery enough. 
It's often not easy to keep calm and pleasant when you are very busy but the staff always manage to do so and are always welcoming and smiling. 

We've all lived with Covid long enough now to know, it should be a given to have to wear face coverings in confined areas and we shouldn't need a sign to tell us.

Visited with family after trip to Corte Castle. Good selection of rolls, pasties and cakes at reasonable prices. Hot and cold drinks. I would recommend the carrot cake muffins and apple Dorset cake. Very busy little shop, lovely staff, definitely worth a visit.

Very welcoming little shop with friendly staff. Fully understand the need for masks and 4 people in shop restriction due to the confined space & restricted ventilation. Our timing was perfect as the pasties came out of the oven, they were fantastic. Thoroughly recommend the lemon drizzle and ginger cakes too, they are delicious. Will definitely come back here again next time we visit Dorset.

Staff expected us to stand in the doorway to see what they had on offer just because we didn't have masks with us. I hadn't seen a sign saying we were required to wear one. So we couldn't see what they had to offer, how do you expect our custom if we don't know what you have to offer and didn't even offer to tell us what they had. Very inconvenient. They weren't rude but to make such a fuss about it which made us reverse out of the door and not buy anything. You literally drove us out of the door. Shame about the impression I wanted to try your baked goods.
This place has very tasty food at reasonable prices. Especially recommend Cornish pasty and apple cake.

Couldn‚Äôt ask for better service ü§üüèº
I was tasked with collecting a Dorset Apple cake for the mother in law ( Her favourite ) with a 350 miles round trip during a global pandemic / fuel shortage. 
Arrived on the Saturday, and was flabbergasted to find out they were sold out. 
Explained my story, and requested to reserve one for the Sunday, received a message late Saturday night saying they‚Äôd made them especially for me.
Collected the cakes Sunday, dropped off to the mothering law the same day - and racked up countless brownie points. 
Fantastic service and bakery.
The cake was also incredible - can see why it was sold out so quick üôåüèºüëçüèº

Great Value Bakery to pick up filled rolls, sandwiches and cakes for a packed lunch. Prices were really good and felt very good value for money compared to other places in the area. Freshly baked bread was lovely too.

Review Title: Great place to pick up a bag of goodies before a long hike
Review Text: Great choice of quality sandwiches, pasties, quiche, cakes etc. Central location and excellent prices

Whenever we holiday in the area we make a daily trip to Corfe Castle Village Bakery to pick up yummy goods for a picnic.

The Cornish Pasties are the best ever and the pork pies are to die for.
The cakes all look yummy; last year we took a couple of Dorset Apple Cakes home with us - delicious üòã

Had  a chat with the female member of staff,  she told they are happy to take cash and credit cards which is brilliant. 
Food cooked fresh and option to have hot or cold food.

Looks like a nice bakery no entry to exemption badge holders told to wait outside and they will get to us. Not even a chance to browse. Bit much as masks not compulsory at this moment in time as well as vaccinations  are up to date

Polite and friendly service. Cakes looked amazing. Lovely pork pie. 
Award- winning bakers title well deserved.

This has to be my favourite bakery. Whenever I I in the area and need a bit of lunch,  I always come to corfe bakery mainly because of their excellent sausage roll but they also do a great pasty too! Keep it up and you will always be sure of my custom!

Review Title: Poor (no) ingredient and allergen info on labels but, delicious food.
Review Text:
Delicious food, but the ingredient labels - specifically the allergen information - are useless (every single product had a totally blank list of ingredients).  

With a family member who has a dairy allergy this made the process of buying food somewhat cumbersome (not helped by it being very busy with long queues) and potentially risky. 

That aside, the food we did buy was delicious.
Excellent bread rolls, pork pies, sausage rolls and sandwiches made to order. Staff polite and friendly and face masks required. Highly recommend a visit.
Food was brilliant, great range of options for hot and cold food and prices were really reasonable! Definitely worth a visit

Lovely bread and pastries, I was surprised to see they had various vegan offerings! 
Great service was an added bonus üòÅ
We Even stopped here for a breakfast Bacon Bun & Coffee on rout to the steam railway. Nice locally cooked bread & cakes

Review Title: Nice Village Bakery with excellent fresh bread
Review Text: I called into the village bakery to buy some fresh bread. Due to the Covid 19 restrictions they only allow one person in the shop at a time. Good selection of bread and cakes and a very  helpful assistant.  Will definitely go back again when in the area!

I came here a couple of days ago to get a few things for lunch, I haven‚Äôt been here before but I happen to come across it whilst in the area so I asked a member of staff to help me decide on what was best. The lady I spoke to was very helpful and friendly, I think her name was Paula. Thank you to the lady who helped me decide as the lunch was very nice. Will be coming back here on my next visit.
We stopped for lunch on a wet tour at the recommendation of our guide and were not disappointed.  The quality of the food and drink was very good and the staff friendly.
What a great award winning bakery! We ordered Cornish pasties and they were very tasty. Good service with good conditions for Covid.

We bought warm bread and croissants here on our first day but were rather underwhelmed by both.  Not much substance to them.  We‚Äôve heard that most of the produce is shipped in from elsewhere but warmed up @ Corfe.  Good Dorset apple cake though.
Not the most welcoming staff! 
Maybe the takeaway baguettes and rolls are good? We didn‚Äôt try them.

A proper old style village bakery which we visited to buy delicious takeaway filled sandwiches from twice during our 5 day stay. We would have visited more times but long queue at weekend. Lol, that is life these days.

Review Title: Lovely to have a stop at this bakery, food was faultless  BUT
Review Text: Felt the lady was very unhappy  about being there, not sure if it is her bakery but certainly was not welcoming, tried to be chatty but not much response, maybe better suited not dealing with the happy general public
Great bakery delicious fresh filled baguettes etc cyclist friendly so great place for a fuel stop whilst out

Been in a few times on my way past to get lunch. Food is always ok, never great, but will fill a hole at an ok price. However the elderly lady that works in there (might be the owner) is always so brash and rude. Whilst I understand the trying time currently, she‚Äôs always been the same and always puts me off from going in more often.

The bakery is known as "Corfe Castle Village Bakery." I don't where the "Dragon" part came from. We ate a few warm donuts and bought a few delicious pastries for our onward journey. It is especially famous for Dorset apple cake.
Why advertise you close at 5 pm and the lock door on a customers face at 4:45 pm? This just happened.
Popped in today for some Dorset apple cake while visiting corfe castle. Was so lovely we bought 2 large apple cakes to take home to share with family.
Always pop in for bread and cakes when in the area. First class service ,First Class Bread and Cakes. We always take bread home when we leave. Keep up the good work.

Review Title: Very good bakers with many awards
Review Text:
Simple white roll, gingerbread man, hot sausage and Eccles cake were all
Very good! Just had breakfast so couldn‚Äôt have more!
A full range of what you'd expect from a local bakers.  We went for the multi-grain loaf which was excellent.

Review Title: Outstanding Choice and Variety in Good Portions and a Fair Price
Review Text: Feels as if you have walked through a door to France. A great shop with outstanding cakes, bread, etc. The display is great and the lardy cake a must. Prices were fair. It's a busy place and your wise to stand back and take time to choose your order. Just off the town square and great to put together a picnic to eat on the steam railway.
Stopped by here for a snack & wanted lardy cake, but this was not as I knew it, it was huge and I ate it in 2 halves, there & on my journey home, but lovely!

Review Title: Fresh, tasty food at reasonable prices.
Review Text: I bought food from the Bakers during the day to eat in the evening as I was staying in a B& B locally and needed an evening meal.   The selection of filled rolls, pies, pastries, bread and cakes was amazing, and so fresh, together with cold drinks etc.  It was very popular.
This little bakery is fab. So much choice and all really yummy and reasonably priced. The perfect lunch stop when visiting Corfe Castle.

Êó•ÊõúÊó•„ÅÆÂçàÂæå„Åß„Åó„Åü„Åå„Éë„Çπ„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÇÑ„Ç±„Éº„Ç≠„ÄÅ„Çµ„É≥„Éâ„Ç§„ÉÉ„ÉÅ„É≠„Éº„É´„Å™„Å©Á®ÆÈ°û„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ
Ë¶≥ÂÖâÂú∞„Å´„ÇÇÈñ¢„Çè„Çâ„ÅöÂÄ§ÊÆµ„Åå„ÅäÊâãÈ†É„ÅßËâ≤„ÄÖ„Å®Ë≤∑„Å£„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

We were after some food yesterday at 11:30ish and the few pubs we checked at started food from midday.  So we opted for this bakery.

Efficient good service from the young man working.  Another member of staff was rather brisk/unfriendly.  Several veggie option savoury pastries and a prawn baguette, 3 drinks and 3 good local crisps ¬£15 - happy with the freshness (but not much filling on the far side of the baguette).

Cheesy vegetable lattice and pasty - delicious!  Reasonable coffee.  Able to sit nearby outside amongst the hustle and bustle by Corfe Castle.  

I‚Äôd have given a 5/5 for friendlier service and more filling in the baguette but the cheese pastries are well worth a visit.

Visited Corfe to see the steam trains and then have a walk around. Bought a chicken and chorizo pasty. Are it overlooking Corfe Castle. 

Very good food and excellent value

As we were leaving Corfe Castle for our next destination we needed sandwiches and bread, both of which we purchased.
The sandwiches were delicious, as was the loaf of bread eaten later.
Highly recommended!

Review Title: Fabulous bakery with lots of choice
Review Text:
Our visits to Corfe Castle are never complete without a visit to this bakery.
This is where we buy our picnic; it saves carrying food prepared at home in hot weather and we like to support this local business.
The staff are friendly and the choice of filled rolls, cakes and hot food is amazing.
I just had to pop,in here for a good ole cheese and onion pasty, it had been sooo long and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. I then clocked my late grandfathers favourite cake, Eccles, again yum yum and yum

Fresh bread, filled rolls and sandwiches, cakes and pastries as well as crisps etc
Service was very good. 
Good selections of bread and quality of bread was very good, filled rolls and sandwiches looked very good, but did not try.
The only bakery in the village, so they do have a niche market, but this bakery is worth a visit if you are staying or passing through.
We purchased baguettes which were a reasonable price but mine was not as nice as it looked.  Perhaps I would try a pasty if there again.

Served by friendly staff with nice products at reasonable prices. The chicken and chorizo pasty was very tasty filled with the right amount of chicken, chorizo and potato and nice and spicy. My wife would recommend the chicken and mushroom slice.
Friendly staff and nice rolls. A lot less hassle than making and carrying a picnic. A wide choice for all tastes. Will probably try to pop back before we leave for a few more scones.

Whilst we were walking all around the village we saw the Dragons Village Bakery !  There were loads of hot pies, pasties etc. and we purchased 2 which were very tasty and very hot !!!!    If you want a great pastry then try the pasties !!!   Highly recommended !!

Called in for some take out food. Excellent choice of rolls, baps, baguettes, on white or malted. Reasonably priced and very fresh. Sausage rolls were excellent, if a little over priced. Overall would recommend this establishment.

Review Title: Not just for your sweet tooth.
Review Text: We climbed up the trail to the castle and although we were meeting friends for lunch we felt we deserved a snack.  Popped into this bakery and for 2 pounds got an excellent Cornish pasty (not pastry).   It was filled with vegetables and fresh and delicious. Good plan!

Decided to stop in here for supplies for a picnic lunch on Studland beach.

Bought a selection of cornish pasties(yum) pork pies(yum yum) and other bakes and a couple of filled rolls with cakes too. All fresh and reasonably priced.

Just around the corner from Corfe Caste. There was a queue forming at lunch hour. Its an old fashion local bakery and we like to support the local businesses. Bought sandwiches and a loaf of seeded bread. Almost forgotten the taste of real freshly baked bread. Definitely not what you get in supermarkets. Really amazing selection of bread, sandwiches, pastry and pasties. And at reasonable prices.

Upon leaving Corfe Castle we were a little peckish and popped into the bakery.
What a great find, it‚Äôs a proper old bakery with a fantastic choice of goods.
I had the 3 sausage bap with an Eccles cake and wife had a filled bap with a cream cake.
Great food and great value.
Would highly recommend and return.

Cannot fault the quality of food served however the staff members who served us twice during our weeks stay (we went into Wareham because of this) were surly and rude making us feel very uncomfortable

Popped in for a snack.  My wife has a cheese straw which was excellent.   I chose a pork pie.   Wow, it was still slightly warm.  The pastry was out of this world.  Still had a crunch but proper pastry.  The pie filling was perfect.  Of all the pork pies ever eaten this was the best ever by a mile.   Also lovely polite friendly service.   Lovely shop.   Thank you.
This is an old fashioned Bakery which sells delicious homemade cakes, bread etc. We enjoyed one of their Dorset Apple Cakes and Pasties, we will be back for more!

Stopped in here a few times during my week in Corfe Castle just to get the fresh bread!
Lots of other treats available as well, right in town center.

My family (myself, my husband and my son) stopped off at the bakery for some lunch.  Husband and son were satisfied with their choices but I chose a tuna mayonnaise roll.  WELL! where was the tuna????  There was so much mayonnaise that the contents of the roll literally fell out onto my lap!!!  Please don't "water down the tuna" otherwise we will look for our lunch elsewhere!!!!

This bakery has been in Corfe for as long as I remember & is perfect for those last minute snacks before or after your walk. 
Our most recent visit included purchase of sausage roll, pasty & a cake. All ok, nothing special but equally not bad.

We had visited the castle and came across this bakery by chance and we were glad that we did.  Stunning cakes and not too expensive...I wish I had bought a second Belgian bun...it was one of the best I have ever eaten!
We had lunch on the bench outside the bakery as the pub was packed, food was piping hot and excellent. the lovely ladies in the bakery were happy and very chatty. Well done!!!!

Visiting the area to see the steam trains. We had planned to have breakfast at a local cafe we have used before but for some reason it was closed. We bought two sausage baps which were advertised as having 3 sausages. There were three halves. No problem as they were only ¬£2 each. We then went back later for a pastie, sausage roll and a couple of cakes. 

The food was excellent and the price amazing. For such a tourist location their prices are excellent. Hats off for offering excellent products at a great price.

This bakery was busy and the food was very good quality. Good range of pies parties etc. Very recommendable for a quick snack.
Friendly service

Thought it may be overpriced as just outside castle but not so.....delicious pasties and coffee.....and my daughter and I sneaked back for a selection of cakes later.....all fabulous.....definitely recommend.

Had a small Cornish pastie possibly the worst I  have ever eaten soggy undercooked pastry bland tasteless filling. I was really disappointed after reading the other reviews I thought I was at a different bakery I do hope for them it‚Äôs just a bad day

Review Title: Wonderful selection of cakes and pies
Review Text: Very popular as in the village square near the castle. Great selection of snacks. When we went to buy our pastries it was sweltering hot in there. How the staff cope is a mystery! Air con needed!

Review Title: Lovely fresh bread rolls and cakes
Review Text: Picked up some lovely fresh bread rolls on Sunday.  Love having a local baker in Corfe Castle and more than pleased to be able to recommend them to our holiday home guests.
We were staying in Corfe, and daily routine walk down to bakery for freshly baked bread. None of this supermarket fake bake, the real McCoy. Cakes, sandwiches etc all reasonably priced.

Had heard about the bakery and the wonderful goodies on sale.  What can I say, it was all true!  The bread was like proper bread, not doughy and dry.  The sausage rolls were to die for, as were the cakes especially the lemon drizzle cake.  If you are in the area, you must check it out.  Be warned though, you need to get there early as by the time they opened, there were over a dozen people waiting, the sign of an excellent bakery!

Having sampled numerous cream teas in the years I've been coming to the UK and usually been disappointed because of the dryness of the scone, at last I've found the perfect scone here at Dragons Village Bakery with its soft crumb. I'll be stocking up before I leave Corfe Castle! The bread is great too, and the service excellent.

Having used Nigel for almost 30 years now for many a birthday cake. I knew exactly where to go for scones for my mum's 90th afternoon tea party. Perfect as always. Also having had quite a few Viennesse mince pies at Xmas he also made us some of them in May.. Always very helpful staff in the shop. And the day old bread sold cheaper is still fresher than the supermarkets fresh.

We stopped off here on a walk and had the small Cornish pasty. They are amazing. 

The young staff working here were very, very polite and service was with a smile. Top marks!!
Quick bite after day at castle. Lots of food to choose from but must eat outside. There are sweet and savoury treats. Well priced.
Queues  out of the door every day says it all!! Bread pastries and cakes to die for breakfast baps tasty and value for money plus kiddies plain cheese and ham rolls for ¬£1

My two daughters and I sampled quite a few offerings during our recent visit to Swanage nearby. The enormous Crusty and Cottage rolls were exquisite and both the sausage baps and 3-rasher bacon rolls absolutely outstanding. I assume they use a very good quality flour as all we experienced was top notch. Very impressed and highly recommended.
The small cornish pastie was really lovely.  The chicken and chorizo pastie was also very very nice.  Lovely staff

After visiting the castle on a cold February day we needed something warm.  This little bakery has such a good choice.  I opted for the goats cheese and vegetable slice and it is without a doubt one of the nicest tasting pastries I have ever tasted.  All the food we ordered was delicious and the staff are very friendly and helpful.  They offered to make another customer a different roll to the ones they had made up which is such a nice personal touch.  Try the pasties!!

This is an excellent bakery to visit on bike rides. The hot pasties are excellent .  There are usually two veggie options. There is a huge range of sticky buns and cakes.  We have sampled many of them and all are delicious. Soup and hot drinks are available. 

In this otherwise excellent establishment it would be great if a move could be made towards being plastic free by offering bamboo cutlery üòÄ
The smell of freshly baked bread, pastries, cakes is too much not to go in and buy! We bought a number of different things in the bakery, all delicious.
We picked up an order early in the morning for 20 people. Everybody was extremely satisfied with the delicious fillings.

The six grain and procorn bread is brilliant.  Croissants are also very good.
A proper old fashioned artisan bakery.

Review Title: Great find right by the castle!
Review Text: After climbing the castle, we wanted something cheap and cheerful for lunch and this was perfect. It's right on the square by the entrance to the castle -- there was a line, but it moves quickly. We got 4 pasties, a baguette sandwich, and one drink for under 10¬£. Such a good value! The pasties were piping hot and everything was good. We especially liked the spicy Jamaican Vegetable pasty.
Pop in here for some fresh snacks very nice plenty hot takeaway snacks pies baked on premises and cakes as well

Review Title: Great take away hot drinks if on train
Review Text: We were on the Swanage railway and stopped off at Corfe to look at the museum. There were no catering facilities on the station that day so we walked a short distance into Corfe and got a great cup of tea from the Village Bakery. Happy smiling staff and the tea was made to our specification in good solid takeaway cups which we took back to the station with us. Shame that the bakery does not have any promotional material near the station to encourage people to make the walk.

Tiny little place, no seating, but they have the best Cornish pasties around!  Friendly service.  They also have sweets and a variety of other baked items.  Perfect place to dash in and grab something to eat.

Review Title: Cheerful service and good quality product
Review Text: I ordered two cakes for our Ruby Wedding Anniversary from the bakery. The staff were helpful and courteous. I asked if they could make sure the icing in the decoration could be ruby not pink or red. This was after a friend told me she had had a cake iced for her ruby anniversary and the colour used was NOT ruby. I was slightly disappointed about this as I'd really made the point that I did not want red. Perhaps Mr Dragon could investigate other colour options which result in a true ruby colour. Apart from that both the fruit cake and the chocolate sponge were excellent.

Cornish pasties so fresh-from-the-oven they were almost too hot to handle .. which meant that that crinkled edge that was originally designed as a pastie-handle for the busy farm-worker came in very useful indeed as we sat on a bench outside the bakery and watched the world go by in this busy, lovely square. They don't just do pasties, of course--sandwiches, rolls, so on--but everything's fresh and tasty and reasonably priced.

My kids love this bakery and we are regular visitors when we holiday in dorset. Great selection of sandwiches, pastries and huge number of different loaves to try.  Can get very busy at peak times, but it's worth the wait!

Stopped here after a walk up a big hill opposite Corfe Castle. Staff were very friendly and we had a cheese and onion pasty which was amazing and an apricot danish. Prices were very reasonable and products were well worth it.

A lovely little bakery, in the heart of Corfe village. We had some rolls and baps, which were very fresh and with plenty of filling. There was also a good selection of pies, pasties and cakes. The bread pudding was one of the best I have tasted - rich, slightly spicy and packed with fruit.
Good selection, fast and polite service and low prices made this a good place for a quick lunch. Would be happy to return

We stopped here after visiting the castle and were not disappointed. I had a lovely soup of the day and a crusty roll. There was a great selection of cakes and pasties also on offer, I wish we had this place in the village I live.
Purchased lunch here for the family. We had a lovely full prawn and salad granary roll, a tuna bap and 2 pasties all very much enjoyed and at a reasonable price.

Have visited this bakery many times. 
It is in the heart of the quaint village of Corfe. 
Plenty of choice of sandwiches, hot pasties,sausage rolls & cakes. 
Reasonable prices & quality is good.
I would give the bakery 10 out of 10 it fantastic a great place to visit when in corfe castle great food and lovely fresh warm baked bread and cakes and pastry

I visited Dragon's Village Bakery with some friends in March 2016 on a visit to Corfe Castle. I couldn't choose what I wanted so ended up purchasing more than I should have! I had a couple of savoury rolls and a couple of sweet treats, all delicious and reasonably priced. Staff happy and friendly, recommended.
Bought some sandwiches and cakes to eat at Corfe Castle for lunch,  very tasty and really reasonably priced.

This bakery offers a tasty and cheap alternative to the sit down eating places in the village. It is usefully open on a Sunday. There's nothing unusual or particularly special about the bakery, but they do what they do very well. There's a selection of warm savouries as well as filled baps, and the typical selection of British bakery cakes, such as bread pudding and almond macaroons. Everything we had was nice, and the price was good. Service was efficient rather than warm and friendly. All in all an average British bakery, but certainly a welcome shop in the village.
Want a quick bite to take away after visiting the Castle?  This is your place!  We've been here many times and never been disappointed with either the food or prices.

A lovely bakery with excellent fresh bread, cakes, pasties.  This bread is nothing like supermarket bread and is well worth getting in the queue, which is always to the door.  Doughnuts and Devon buns are yummy. It's next to the entrance for Corfe Castle, which is also well worth a visit.
Had a sausage sandwich - excellent for greasy hangover cure however we weren't hungover! Cakes looked yummy though and in close proximity to landmarks in Corfe.

After using up all our energy at the Dorset Waterpark we were desperate to find somewhere to grab some pasties.
Queue out the door so guessed it must be good! 
It was very busy and took a while to be served but worth it! 
2 large Cornish pasties, one steak bake, one chicken and salad bap, two jam doughnuts and a slice of rocky road with two bottles of oasis drink came to ¬£13! All were delicious. Very affordable and very tasty.

Whilst visiting Corfe Castle we called into this bakery and realised that it is extremely popular with a queue out the door.

The sign outside says Corfe Castle Bakery as opposed to Dragon's Bakery so maybe this page needs updating?

There is a wonderful selection of bread, pastries and cakes.  They also offer hot and cold drinks to take away.

We bought custard tarts and they were the best we have ever had, so much nicer than the mass produced ones you get in the supermarket.

It is no surprise that people queue out the door to buy their goods.
Yuk. The grease leaked thru the paper bags and we're inedible. The tea was OK. Very disappointing for such a bijou place

Popped in on our way home from Swanage, had a very tasty Prawn Baguette and a bread pudding slice. Had the best chicken sandwich I have ever had in my life here some time ago, so just had to pop in again when passing

Good choice of breads available, Cakes and pastries delicious, very friendly staff. Quaint little shop, it really is like going back in time,wonderful. The smell alone will entice you into the shop. Pasties are very good. Recommend this bakery.

We were welcomed by the friendly staff after we toured Corfe Castle.  THe building is small but quaint and warm with rich scents of perfectly baked goods.  We found it difficult to make a decision about what to eat as it all looks and smells so heavenly!  This was my third visit over the years, so I knew I had to have an Eccles cake and a Cornish pasty.  We sat on the monument and enjoyed our meal.  We highly recommend this charming jewel in Corfe.

Sign on the door does not refer to "dragons" village bakery so had to check. Very old fashioned and tired layout but good quality baking at reasonable prices. It would be lovely if they renovated the shop to modern standards to really highlight the quality of the baked goods. They'd also benefit if they sold good coffee with it - they'd become the breakfast place of choice!

A great selection of sweet and savoury treasures all at very reasonable prices.
We opted for pasties which were delicious!

We had to queue to buy some lovely scones and clotted cream but it was well worth it.
How lovely to see a business booming in a beautiful village.
in dieser Village Bakery ist alles super, das Personal hilfsbereit, die Pies und Cakes k√∂stlich und der Tee einmalig so macht Einkehren Spass
We popped in for a little snack and we ended up with a delightful slice of Dorset apple cake and a truly scrumptious lardy cake, for an incredibly cheap price. A real treat!

We popped in here for a light breakfast snack before we explored Corfe. What a find! A fabulous array of baked goods, and a hot 3 slice bacon roll for ¬£2 - a bargain. We treated ourselves to a pork pie too - they looked too good to miss. The hot drinks were good too. A must if you're visiting Corfe and fancy a treat.

It isn't pretending to be anything else other than a good old bakery serving freshly baked breads, cakes and pasties.
The rolls are plain and simple, you won't get gourmet fillings but you will get a decent generously filled roll that is cheap and cheerful.
Pasties are very greasy but tasty and freshly baked.  Cakes are OK, again nothing fancy.
We picked up a packed lunch here for long walks here which did the job of keeping us going.

Review Title: Quick service fab pasties and friendly staff
Review Text: We called for a pasty for lunch and we're met with quick efficient service,  pasty was excellent too,  so much so that we are collecting some to take home tomorrow to freeze.  Price was good too.  Recommended.

Review Title: The best bakery I've been to in a while
Review Text:
After working up our appetites walking around the castle we decided to have a pasty and a cake for lunch. 

I was not disappointed. 

They gave me an extremely tasty vegetarian slice, so good I could have happily eaten it again! The food was hot, fresh and the pastry was cooked perfectly. My partner enjoyed his steak slice and my Mum's pasty was also very good. 

It was here I was introduced to my first lardy cake. I am so glad we walked around the castle before visiting this amazing bakery.

The service was super friendly and the prices were great value for money. If lived closer I would be eating my lunch here everyday.

The best around. Nothing compares to Barnecutt's. We have been going for years as a family and wouldn't go anywhere else for pasties! 

Keep up the good work James & Co
This bakery is insane! Phenomenal food. Pasties are best I‚Äôve tasted, salad bowls and 10/10. Please open up a shop in my town!

Review Title: Luxury fish pie for supper anything but do not. It this very expensive for basically mash potato!!
Review Text:
Luxury Fish pie ‚Ä¶.. this is anything but basically a mash potato pie with unappetising small pies of fish and egg.  No prawns, dry, bland, very expensive and basically fed to the dog!

I have always been an advocate of Barnecutts pasties but even this seemed to be lack lustre, with less beef
I hope the doughnuts are better than the stone cold large sausage roll.was it left over from tuesday!

Amazing pasties!!
The best in Cornwall.
Lovely team working hard and speedy to get everyone fed.
Great service lots of choice. 
Super tasty food!
Lovely sandwiches. Extremely rude woman that served us. Bad attitude and couldn't wait to get our order out of the way. Won't be going back next time we're here.

Smart and very busy deli/bakery situated in the main town.  Bakery orders can be placed for local pickup.

Offer cakes, pastries, savoury goods and drinks.

Very popular as queue was long, staff were great and quick to serve.

Nice pasties but dreadful service with a snarl. Both female staff members looked depressed and were very unhelpful. Won‚Äôt be going back. No manners and gave the impression we were getting in their way while they cleaned glass counter front. Rude to my 16 year old son asking for a chicken pastie. Apparently you don‚Äôt do them  in contrast to the advert in the window ‚Äòtry out new chicken pastie‚Äô. Not a nice start to our beach day out on our hols. They could at least pretend to be civil!
As a child I remember Barnecutts doughnuts as the best ever. I am now in my 60s and they are still the best ever! ‚ù§Ô∏è

Review Title: Salad Pots to have a break from pasties ü§£
Review Text:
Visited the deli today for a spot of lunch as a family of 5. We are regular visitors to Cornwall, staying at Treyarnon Bay and have sampled Malcolm Barnecutt pastries many times from the Treyarnon Bay Stores shop. Unfortunately, the pasties we‚Äôve had have always been cold as no oven there so we visited the deli to sample their offerings. 

Our children had a mixture of sandwhiches and sausage rolls. My husband and I had a salad pot and shared a cheese & onion pastie. Absolutely delicious!!!! Top marks. 
We had a coffee & a flapjack too. We will be back ! Excellent üëåüèº
Very disappointing, paid ¬£5 for a "steak" pasty to find no steak in the steak pasty, be warned, I won't be buying a steak pasty from here again.
This place is amazing.will definitely be recommending.The pastys and donuts are delicious as were the cheese and bacon twists,tiffin,iced Chelsea buns and sausage rolls.
Best pasties in Cornwall!  Also love their chocolate cake with chocolate chips in it.  Always come here when I visit cornwall

Steak pasties were the best! Gorgeous pastry and lovely moist tasty filling. Also had a bowl of mixed salads from the deli, there's a big selection, delicious.  Family size treacle tart and cheese pastry bites. All good!

Review Title: Excellent flavoursome quality pasties, cakes, bread and other snacks.
Review Text: Absolutely yummy! Quality flavoursome food.  I wish it was on my doorstep!  The pasties were the very best I have ever sampled,  bread was a mix of staple and artisan, and don't get me started on the cakes!

Stopped off to buy some real Cornish pasties from this bakery whilst caravanning locally. Best I've ever tasted. Bought 6 to take home for my daughter, but my wife and I were forced to consume 2 for lunch, the waffing smell was too much. Lovely.

Lovely Bakery‚Ä¶

Well worth the trip if your staying in nearby campsites or accommodation.

Wide selection of sweet and savoury‚Ä¶Good takeaway coffee

Review Title: Great bakery with hard working staff
Review Text:
First rate pasties and wonderful coffee and breakfast rolls.

We‚Äôve been coming here for about 20 years. 
The Cornish pasties are the best we‚Äôve had (and we‚Äôve tried a lot!). 
Great coffee and breakfast rolls. 
Lovely selection of sandwiches and build your own salads. 
Cold drinks too. 
Good selection of cakes and lots for the little ones. 
Stop off here every day that we head to the beach. It‚Äôs become a welcome tradition. 
Recently learned we can order pasties by post so guess what‚Äôs next!
Staff always quick to serve you and they get VERY busy. 
They work damned hard so thank you ladies.

Another visit whilst on holiday in Cornwall. Always a great choice of pastries, cakes and of course pasties. I have tried lots of pasties but have to say these are the best. Go for the large if you are feeling hungry.
We had cornish pasties and jam doughnuts to take to beach every day.Lovely tasty snacks,Tuna roll stuffed full.

I have tried Cornish pasties from various establishments over the years, and I think Barnecutt's may do the best I have tried. They are not the cheapest pasties, but a pasty is a great value meal anyway. 

The bakery has a good selection of other baked goods, rolls, etc. - I have tried a few different items and would say overall it is  'okay', but they definitely excel on the steak pasties! 

The premises seem clean, and the staff are friendly. My most recent visit was with Covid protocols still being implemented, so it is one-way entry, with exit out of the back. We were also directed to an outside area to wait for fresh pasties to come out of the oven, after we had paid. 

I would advise arriving early, to avoid queues during the lunchtime rush, as parking is not great outside the bakery, and queue can extend near to a busy road. The pasties will be at the right temperature in 30+ minutes after purchase anyway, if left in the bag.

Review Title: Great choice of bread and pasties
Review Text: Lovely bakery. Delicious pasties in two sizes with lots of different fillings- steak ones were great. Good choice of tasty breads. Friendly staff.
Excellent pasty, sausage rolls and salad. Picked up and went down to the beach and everything was super tasty! You just can‚Äôt beat a local Cornish pasty :-)

When you're far away from home and can't make your own pasties, Barnecutt's are as good a substitute as you'll get. On a cold, rainy October day, the only thing wrong with our pasties was that we ate them too quickly!
Their freshly baked foods are a real treat and are very popular with both locals and visitors. Pasties are my favourite.
This place is amazing, great break, pasties, croissants and the deli counter serves some delicious salads. Wish I lived locally, although it may not do my waistline much good!
Lovely pasties. Slightly tricky parking in the village. Service with a smile. Easy to pop by and grab lunch on route to the beach!

Popped in early in the morning and knew it would be good because of the queue including many local tradesmen.

Had breakfast baps and some doughnuts ....all fantastic and really lovely.

Covid19 precautions all in place.

I just wish there was a sign outside so I could plan my purchases a bit better.

Wish i lived closer x
Just fantastic pastries and pasties. Their Cornish pasties are fab and an excellent choice of cakes too üòÉ

What a joy to find a decent pasty place open! Didnt expect to see Barnecutts open as we passed after visiting the beach, so immediately we pulled in for a tasty treat! Nice and hot and fresh, really hit the spot, proper job!
Always a queue and for good reason , the quality of baking and produce is first class especially the traditional steak pasties which in my humble opinion are the best on the world !
We chose a made to order tuna sandwich, sausage roll and a bowl of salad. It was all very tasty and filling. The staff were all friendly and it is obviously very popular with the locals

At the price pasties are nowadays they should be perfect every time, but it‚Äôs so random. Sometimes burnt sometimes the spuds undercooked. Malcolm Barnecutts was my favourite being a Wadebridge boy but just average now

Always a queue means fantastic food for sale. The cakes and pastries look amazing and the savouries give a great variety as well as the usual pasty options.
We ordered a birthday cake which was fabulous and tasted superb.

Review Title: I'd forgotten the joy of cheese and onion pasty
Review Text:
If every cheese and onion pasty tasted like this I'd probably not have gone decades without eating one! Absolutely top draw.

Family all enjoyed their food, nice selection and friendly staff. Limited parking outside the shop or else go for nearby street parking.

Does it all, and superbly well.
Great staff, lovely coffee, and superb produce. Still haven‚Äôt found a tastier pasty in all of Cornwall, despite everyone claiming to have won a ton of awards!!ü§£

Review Title: Not much meat in our pasties!
Review Text: We always Barnecutt‚Äôs when we holiday for 3 weeks in cornwall, and always have their pasties, but this year their skimping on their steak!! All of our pasties that we have bought have been lacking steak, we thought it might of been a batch, but unfortunately not, we bought pasties from Padstow during the week and they were filled with superb steak and lots of it. Big shame as we love buying from Barnecutts....!
Great bakery. With friendly staff and really good selection of yummy Cornish treats, cakes, bread and a small deli x I‚Äôm taking a chocolate cake home with me ! üòÅüòÅ

Visited to grab some lunch when staying nearby.

Place looked clean and tidy and we were pleasantly surprised with the vast selection, although nothing had been labelled correctly so it was quite hard to understand what each thing was.

The staff seemed efficient, but not particularly friendly - we felt a little rushed as we were all unsure what we wanted.

Some of us had pasties - steak and Stilton being a favourite. Another had a baguette which was monstrous and great value for money. Someone also had salad which was very expensive for the size and quality.

Good for grabbing food on-the-go, but not quite like a traditional Cornish bakery you‚Äôd find in the harbours.

We stopped by to purchase breakfast and a lunch pack up for the beach. With drinks, ham, cheese, gorgeous Cornish butter, cakes, salad, bread and pastries we managed to spend ¬£26 which probably sounds a lot but we all really enjoyed everything and would definitely return. We had the tiger bread, ring donut, peanut butter bar, cupcake and a selection of salads from the deli. Service was great too! Would definitely return.

We were staying in Trevone and this is the nearest bakery, we found it to be very good for all items and the staff are very patient and friendly. This is a busy place so go early if you want a specific item as they sell out.
We popped in for breakfast and it was just what we were after, something quick  it really good quality. We could have bought so much though, everything looked great!!

The pasties are to die for . Once tasted you will be back for more . We were in ST Merryn in May 2019 and visited this place 8 times . Our favourite ones were the medium cheese and onion ones . Just a tip , dinner times are the busiest time so get there early so your not disappointed . My partner also loved their doughnuts , she loved that they were freshly made
Consumed a number of pasties on holiday in the St Merryn / Padstow area and the one from Malcolm Barnecutt's Deli was easily the best. Highly recommended.

We went 4 times whilst on a weeks holiday at Treyarnon Bay. The pasties were the best we had and reasonable too. Cakes were good and lots of choice. Saffron buns were excellent. Very busy and parking a bit of a nightmare. I went in twice - my husband went the other times - and found the staff to be efficient but definitely not friendly. It felt like I wasn't really welcome.
We used this bakers a few times whilst on holiday and the quality of the sandwiches and cakes was very high.
Wonderful saffron cake sold here. Worth making a detour but there are a whole range of bakery products too. Nice to be able to support a local business

Tried this Baker recently whilst using the local shop across the road.Wow, really are the best pasties we have eaten in a long time!Full of meat and veg.Seriously good.Also had a couple of cakes which were also delicious.Keep up the good work.Does not help our waist lines but definately helps our hungry tummies.See you again.
All produce fresh and super tasty! They do a good coffee and a range of fresh daily specials. The staff friendly.

Don't go in here if you're on a diet! Lovely bread, scrumptious pasties, cakes & pastries to die for, not to mention the delicious looking deli delights. Barnecutt's is a standard visit every time we're in St Merryn.

Probably the best seeded loaf I have ever tasted. Freshly baked, had it cut thick, and it was delicious. The whole bakery was full of wonderful looking breads, pastries and cakes and smelt divine. A few stools in the window to eat filled hot and cold rolls etc seemed to be very popular. A gem.

Review Title: Very Noce produce, but becoming more commercialised
Review Text: We have always been supporters of this deli and bakery, but this year upon visiting the deli in St Merryn we were surprised in the changes, whilst everything was of a good standard it was missing the unusual items that you would often find. We collected pasties to bring home to Yorkshire, which went down a storm.
Friendly, fast service with reasonable prices. Great variety of sweet and savoury pastries, cakes, sandwiches and drinks. Eat in or take away!
Very nicely presented bakery. I did wonder why st Merryn was so busy! Lovely pasties. Best I have tasted during my weeks holiday. Pastry perfect and so much steak inside.
Freshly made sandwiches, great pasties and a good looking Bakewell Tart still to taste later. Shops all round North Cornwall so no excuse to not visiting one of the shops.

Review Title: Just go, forget the calories and enjoy!
Review Text:
It is quite an experience! Arrived to buy pasties for a healthy lunch and the queue was outside the door! Plenty of staff so it moved quickly, but you need to know what you want!
The pasties were very good.
We also bought some large cakes, an iced coffee cake and a chocolate cream cake, at ¬£4.50 each they are excellent quality and such good value!
Just glad I don't live here as it was all too tempting and good!

My husband, 80-year-old father and I visited this bakery to buy some lunch one afternoon during week commencing June 4 2018 while staying in nearby Harlyn Bay. Having been to other Malcolm Barnecutt shops in Newquay and Rock on previous occasions, we were really looking forward to trying some delicious pasties and cakes and receiving a warm welcome as we have received previously. Unfortunately, the two women working in this bakery were unsmiling and unhelpful from the start. They were clearly irritated by our polite questions about availability of pasties and sandwiches etc and barked answers at us even though there were no other customers in the shop so they had plenty of time to help us. They made us feel so unwelcome and such an inconvenience that we considered leaving without buying anything but my elderly father was hungry so we quickly made our purchases and left. It comes to something when we would recommend visiting the bakery in Tesco in nearby Padstow - where the staff are friendly and don't hate tourists - than ever return to this bakery. What a disappointment.

We visited this bakery on the way to Harlyn bay, and picked up a few pasties. They were really good - good filling, flavour, and the pastry was just right!
We also then picked up a bread, and some scones, all of which were well appreciated :)
Service was quick, and the shop itself had an air of efficiency - just what you'd like on a holiday travel!

Review Title: Lovely local bakers with the best Cornish pasty
Review Text:
Just home from 10 days in St Merryn and can say that this local bakers has had a very modern refit and continues to make the best tasting Cornish pasty I've yet to taste!
Great fresh pasties, pies, bread, salad bar and yummy cakes.  The cappuccino flapjack and chocolate toffee rice cakes are both delicious. 
Come here every year and am always delighted.

For the best pasties and saffron cake s must visit. Parking is  bit of a nightmare though, I used the side streets. 
Only open 730 till 3.

Review Title: Quite possibly the best Cornish Pasties around!
Review Text: I find that a lot of pasties can taste quite peppery and this often is too much for the kids.  The pasties from Malcolm Barnecutt are really good, full of meat in a crisp pastry and the kids loved them too which is always a good sign.  The adults thought they were pretty good too!   Definitely worth a visit.

Review Title: Delicious rolls and scones (and lots of other things too)
Review Text: We got some bread rolls from here a few times whilst staying in Harlyn and they were some of the tastiest we've ever had! Great scones too. Didn't try the variety of cakes, but they looked lovely. Friendly staff, lots of good food available and well priced (for a tourist spot).

Definitely THE best bakers we've ever been in.  Not just for their Cornish Pasties, but the whole range of stuff. If you can catch a time when it's available, you MUST try the Ham & Egg pie - makes a perfect bkfst.  Our last stop before leaving for the drive home; pasties for the journey and some for the home freezer too!

We stopped by accident next to this bakers and I am so glad we did!!!
What a friendly, well laid out shop!
Now lets talk about the cakes...firstly can I say how totally delicious the cakes were ...
We had some doughnuts and they were the lightest doughnuts we have ever had and my kids are experts on such matters!!!!
But what surprised me more was the pricing...in such a tourist area you would expect prices to be sky high ...but they were totally normal ...very well done to this company....we will certainly be back!!
Yum yum yummy
xxxx

Review Title: Best pasties in cornwall by far
Review Text: No other bakery makes pasties like Barnecutts.  I had the ham, cheese and leek pasty today it was absolutely delicious and the pastry ... well its the best, just go and buy your own
Not artisan, but of a pretty good quality. The filled rolls are fresh, the deli food is also nice. Coffee is good. Pasties also good. Friendly staff.

Review Title: Lovely bakery with plenty of choice
Review Text: We were staying in the local area and popped in to buy lunch.  Was suprised at the amount of choice of cakes and pastries.  Everything looked lovely and was very well presented.  Our only complaint is that when we came back another day at 4pm they had already closed.  Would defintely recommend

Just love this place! Love the malted bread, nice and chewy as toast. The pastries are lovely. We also came for lunch and sat outside watching the world go by. The falafel panini and cheese and ham panini were lovely very tasty. The coffees are top class! I left my phone here and didn‚Äôt realise and the assistant recognised me and came running over with it! So lucky!

Staff are amazing, sandwiches, cakes and deli are really good.
Only downside is the pasty's are always cold whenever we visit.

There is a good selection of cakes, bread, sandwiches, etc. The pasties and doughnuts are delicious and well worth it. It was very busy, which was a good sign but I do think the staff could have been friendlier.
Lovely pasties, the best I have ever had. Recommend the Steak and also the Cheese and Onion.  Great bread, especially the Tiger rolls.  I highly recommend

We love Barnecotts and visit daily to collect tiger rolls, croissants and pasties when on holiday. Friendly staff and great value prices keep repeat business flowing. Miles better than the many chain pasty shops in North Cornwall.
Love my selection of goodies. Reasonably priced and tasted great! Very busy when we arrived so that can only be a good thin. Would recommend
A regular stop for a pasty... steak and stilton is wonderful! Huge range of pastries and specialty breads. Really friendly staff
Fantastic shop,brilliant range of cakes breads and pastries,also good range for lunch times. Also offer pasties to take home from your hol that you can bake yourself.  10/10.

Very yummy cakes and pasties, not good for the waistline but excellent value.  we've been here for breakfast great bacon rolls, bought sandwiches for days out and far too many cakes than was strictly necessary
We've always rated this bakery when we visit Cornwall, great selection of fresh pasties, sandwiches and a decent salad bar/deli only a stones throw away from Padstow.
Excellent breads, cakes, sausage rolls and pasties. Large variety of salads to choose from. Also provide sandwiches freshly made and drinks.
Sat outside had brie,bacon and red currant sauce baguette. Coffee was nice. Sausage rolls excellent. Pies smelled wonderful!
Long standing fans over the years but felt let down. Obviously old stock. First thing Sunday and I felt the old warmth have evaporated. Not just from the croissants.
We just went for the pasties - traditional Cornish! They were delicious - piping hot just out of the oven! Reasonably priced - kept us going all day!

This bakery makes delicious pasties that we look forward to sampling each year on our holidays. The traditional steak and a bacon and leek were both enjoyed by those in our party. We also love their treacle tart. A delicious taste of traditional Cornwall.
Always so much choice, they have pasties,salads, sandwiches, panini etc. Everything is always good and very good price for money. Sandwiches can be made fresh with a good selection of fillings

Lovely food, you can make a more nutritional choice by going for a salad from the deli bar- made up of pastas, roasted vegetables, olives etc or there's always the pastys, pizzas, paninis and also hot breakfast baguettes.
This bakery is simply the best. Great produce that sells out on a daily basis. When the hoards arrive in August you need to get there early or be disappointed

The ladies that serve in the bakers are friendly and welcoming and very patient too. We visit this bakery every summer when we are on holiday and stock up on sausage, bacon and egg rolls for breakfast, coffee, smoothies and then pasties and cakes. Everything is fresh, tasty and truly adds a massive part to our holiday!

Found this little gem in St Merryn a bit late on our first morning where unfortunately for us all the crossiants had sold out. The lady offered to put some by the following morning however we declined as we hadn't made plans for the following day. We popped in again on the Friday before starting our journey home and ordered coffee and crossiants as well as cakes and well stuffed rolls to take with us. My wife doesn't like butter and this wasn't a problem as they offered to a fresh roll there and then. This is a busy little place that serves good fresh food (but get there early to avoid disappointment).

Awesome bakery offering take our sandwiches, cobs, salads and cakes etc. We had some cobs made up while we waited and ordered cakes too. The food was all very fresh and excellent. A superb choice - and the cakes - omg the cakes were amazing. This bakery was recommended to us and so glad we went in. Will definitely use again. The shop assistants are all very friendly and can't do enough for you.

As the son of a Cornishman I have been coming here for 55 years. I love pasties ( meat only!) and to me despite other makers claims these are the best. 
In addition I have just discovered their doughnuts and othe produce are just as good. 
The shop is always busy filled with local workers and the staff, I think, have noted the previous comments about customer service
Best home made rolls we have ever had and the Steak Pasty was just sublime - why make a picnic for the beach when you get sandwiches, rolls, pasty, fruit, cakes etc of this quality from this Deli
Lovely pasties and salad, went there several times on our weeks holiday.  All food is fresh and tasty plus a great selection of bread.  Would recommend
Just love this place, visited it too often whilst we were in St Merryn . Cakes, pasties & sandwiches were lovely. Staff very friendly & helpful
Caters for all tastes and you will not be disappointed. Lots of staff so you will not be queuing for long

God they're good. Croissants!!!! 

Nice little place to nip out to, to get some fresh croissants for breakfast. 

Delicious!

Stopped whilst in St Austell whilst on short break, for some lunch. I had a jacket potato with beans, cheese and bacon and a water, and my husband had a tuna mayo sandwich which came with crisps and an Elderflower Press√©.
My hubby enjoyed his lunch and loved the press√©.
My jacket was really lovely and tasty and piping hot. 
The staff were really friendly and helpful. 
Thanks all would definitely go back.

Review Title: Love this place for an excellent pasty
Review Text: When down in Cornwall always make an effort to pop in. Popped in for a bacon and egg sandwich and have to say it was one of the best ever. On our last day made sure we got our supplies for tea at home that night. A large Steak pasty for me, love the fact they are not peppery! Perfect flavour. And my wife had the vegetable pasty which is basically a normal pasty without the meat, she loved it. Lots to choose from in the cake department too!

Barnecutt's really have established themselves as the premier bakery on Cornwall's north coast. Superb tasting and generously filled pasties, great pastry crust.
Lots of other delicacies on offer.

Twice now have been here asked for egg mayo, to be told they had none. Why would you not have egg made up in a bakery at lunchtime. Then twice asked for prawn and marie rose sandwich and rudely asked "isn't there any in the cooler". If I wanted a soggy sandwich i would of looked, but seeing as I wanted a fresh sandwich, as it's a bakery I thought I'd ask. Also, the prawn and Marie rose was extremely dry and had little sauce. I had to add my own mayo and paprika to it. 

I will say the cakes are extremely nice but when asked to make fresh sandwiches they don't seem to like that.

Review Title: Eat all the bread and all the cakes
Review Text: Great bakery offering everything from freshly baked bread and cakes, through to paninis, breakfast baps, takeaway coffee and a salad bar.

We were recommended by a local at a petrol station to try their pasties it was our last day and had tried several "the best pasties in padstow " but very disappointed especially with a certain chuff bakery? the staff were lovely and friendly we had to wait about 15 mins for Cornish pasties we bought the last 8 to take home for family we also tried the sausage rolls Which were delicious and were given some lovey iced fingers free the hot pasties smelt amazing in the car we shared one later and they were still warm these were large and plenty to share full with tender meat and vegetables and seasoning the BEST pasties for miles around worth 10 stars üòÄ

Cannot think of another place where all the staff are so pleasant and helpful then you discover the range of products available and you realise this is a to enjoy working in and buying from.
Never found anything I did not like and have tried most of the products.
If you are St Merryn way this is well worth maki g sure you stop here.

I visited this deli upon recomendation. It was very busy, which restricted what I could see on display. The pasties were good, the cakes looked lovely all traditional. Would have loved to spend more time lookign at other produce, but was just too busy. Will drop by again.

Popped in again whilst on holiday. Love the choice of breads, cakes and pasties. Steak Pasty for lunch was perfection and my wife was very happy with her vegetable pasty too. You can now sit outside and eat your pasties in the sun!

Review Title: Something for every taste - delicious pasties plus healthier deli
Review Text: Huge selection of really good Cornish pasties plus tempting cakes but also there is now a great deli offering a range of delicious salads. Ready meals for the freezer as well. Friendly staff.

chip ahoy we went at least five times the staff were so fantastic and so friendky they are the best fish chips we have ever had hence why we went so often not so good for the figure we kept recommending it to everyone will go again next year the quenes were amazing right out the door such a good sign

We've been devotees of the Chough since its Polizzi make over and still enjoy their pasties but the overwhelming verdict among our group of 12 was in favour of Barnecutt's. Flavour, meatiness and texture of the pastry were all highly praised.

Review Title: Don't be nasty, have a pasty!
Review Text: Stopped at this well-stocked bakery, en route to Port Isaac. Being Cornish, we know that Barnecutts are always top notch! This particular spot had a great supply of pasties and pastries, despite it being early afternoon - unlike many other bakeries, who often don't bother to restock after lunch.
Stopped by for lunch.  Pasty was the best we had in Cornwall.  Smoothies delicious. Cakes were dull. Prices reasonable.

Stopped off here for a quick lunch pit stop, grabbed a few nice traditional pasties and a couple of nice coffees to take away.  It is a pity there is not more seating at the front of the shop, it would be a great cafe if there was more tables and chairs.

The barnicotts pasties are high up the chart in Cornwall but not the very best. I will let readers visiting Cornwall find the best ones out themselves.

Barnecutt's hands down make my favourite pasties in Cornwall by a mile and being a local girl I have certainly sampled a fair few!
The Bakery does everything you could want for a delicious lunch on the go. For quite a small space, they have a great range of breads, cakes, pasties and other pastry goods as well as a selection of frozen meals and their salad/deli. The staff are friendly and polite. The business gets understandable busy in the summer season, so make sure you get there early!

We always stop here just before our journey home to pick up some food, it's all excellent home made and baked. The choice is superb and everything on offer looks fabulous, it's quite a problem choosing because it all looks so good. The shop is spotless and the staff are lovely too, the only gripe is parking but it's worth the little walk required.

The Barnecutt name has been around in North Cornwall for some time but it's presence in St Merryn is relatively recent. 

Operating from the site of the former butcher's shop this bustling bakery is an asset to the village, with an impressive range of homely products and efficient service with a smile. 

10/10 from me!
Can't avoid them, too good to miss, Bacon Bites, Danish Pastry, Doughnuts, Bread Rolls, Pasties, very good all round whichever branch you visit.
I have come to Cornwall six years in a row every time going to this superb bakery it is great quality and really tasty with really amicable staff

We stopped here having researched  where we could buy the best Cornish pasties to take home with us. We were not disappointed. The pasties were excellent, great pastry and loads of tender beef. Fabulous! To be recommended.

Staying in St Merryn we visited this bakery and sat outside with a coffee & cake. Lovely friendly staff who stayed open to accommodate two tired visitors just enjoying the fresh air and sunshine in April. Would recommend.

Review Title: Great locally baked bread and pastries
Review Text: This is the place to get good quality bread and pastries. I fact it's the only pasties that my wife will eat. We alway make a habit of stopping off to buy at least a cake or two!

Great choice of breads and cakes as well as a choice of deli food to take away. The place was really busy when I popped in, thought as it was a small village, things would be quiet but it appears, like me, people travel for miles to pick up great food. Try the Chelsea buns and Sourdough bread.
Always drop in for bread and cakes when in the area, range of good choices for both. Also has prepared take away food, sandwiches etc. Always seems busy, a good sign, and staff friendly.

Every time we are in Harlyn we head to St Merryn and get Cornish pasties and bread etc from this bakers. Good quality meat filling, crisp pastry and always really tasty. Their bread and cakes are also good and don't cost the earth. At St Merryn they have a sandwich bat as well where you can order what you'd like, again good quality fillings at a good price. My sons favourite lunch place.

We have tried various local pasties on our annual trips to Cornwall but we always comeback to Malcolm Barnecutt's as we all agree, they are just the best!  The shop in St Merry, is well stocked and serves lots of pasties, cakes and sandwiches. The staff are friendly and very efficient when busy.
Best pasty in my life and it wasn't a traditional one, it was the Chicken and Chorizo. My only regret was not buying a Leek and Bacon pasty for later!

This is one on the beet delis and bakery's around. They sell delicious pastries, bread, and the deli is great. The staff are always friendly and pleased to see you. Try the ready meals if you are stuck for time they are good. The. Cakes are yummy. Sometimes we have a mixed salad box and take it to the beach . Yummy.

Cornwall is a fantastic place to visit with lots of surprising things to do my faveroute place to go is St Ervan apart from pastow of course 
St Ervan is a quiet little village with kind helping neighbors. from St Ervan you can go to lovely places like Padstow, Rumford and the beach but beware of the smeel of the fields
one of the best things about cornwall is the pastys ith the golden pastry oh and the surprise inside is delicious. if you need a place to stay near St Ervan and padstow there is a camp sitem next door and everyone is welcome in St Ervan

This bakery was packed every time we went in but service was always quick and friendly. Everything we tried from the pasties, cakes and rolls were delicious yet very reasonably priced. This meant that the customers were locals, workmen who seemed to travel to get there and holiday makers alike. Highly recommend
Although the name suggests should be a hairdressers absolutely not! It's is definitely one of the best delis I've seen in a long time. Excellent cakes pasties  and sandwiches x

Great Bakery in the centre of the village, staff always friendly, patient and helpful.
Fresh bread,pasties,& pastries are always available for early Breakfast on the way to the beach.

We've been holidaying in the Padstow area for over ten years now, and no trip is complete without several trips to Malcom Barnecutts Bakery in St Merryn. The Jam and cream doughnuts are a delight, the iced Chelsea buns are wonderful and we always leave with a couple of Cheese and Onion pasties as well as some perfectly made Latte's( whether strong or not so strong is required) Friendy staff are always welcoming and helpful. Keep up the good work. here's looking forward to our next trip.

Review Title: What a treat to have such an excellent bakery and delicatessen on our doorstep
