Review Text: We would love to have anything this good back home in Sussex. The shop was a joy to go in and look around. We found the staff to be really helpful, especially Kate. We loved their prepared meals, salad bar, Cornish pasties and all the other foodstuffs. It was an excellent way to stock up for a seaside picnic. It is very popular in St Merryn with holidaymakers and locals alike. It was especially busy on Saturday morning, when there was a great queue for bread, Cornish pasties and other delicacies. I don't like queues at all, but it was well worth the wait. We would love to go here again, next time we are in Cornwall.

Review Title: Old fashioned bread, cakes and pastries ar their best
Review Text: Quality products and reasonable prices and a very good range of products. For fresh bread that lasts, snacks that have real taste, like pasties, and cakes to forget about your diets, they have it all. Ideal for campers to stock up, or just enjoying a snack, their chain of shops are of and equal quality.
Wow!!!! What a beautiful selection of breads, cakes, pastries and deli salads. Very busy, prepare to queue at peak times, but worth it.
Our local bakery where we pick up delicious pasties, sandwiches and cakes for our beach trips! Always a queue, but worth waiting!

This place has got it spot on and is good value for money. All of the cakes and bread are wonderfully fresh every day. Take away coffee is well priced and tasty. The pasties are great and the staff are all chatty and welcoming. There are also a few chairs outside so that you can eat your croissant and have a coffee in the sunshine if you fancy.
Fab choice of foods and  tastes and all fresh. Not a very straight forward ordering situations, your never sure where to stand or queue, but it's worth the wait and agrivation.
Love this place for delicious Cornish pasties. The best in the area we think. The queues out of the door a testament to the delicious food on offer. Also great for a tasty treacle tart.

Review Title: I wish it was round the corner from home
Review Text:
Booked a birthday cake over the phone before we went on holiday and whilst in St Merryn collected the most amazing cake we have had, exactly how they said it would be and tasted out of this world 

Thank you so much you gave our daughter such a surprise when we opened it,
Good pasties, excellent breakfast pastry, nice bread. Plenty of tasty options for a simple lunch at home or on the beach.

We called here each morning to buy sandwiches, salads and treats for the beach.  The choice of cakes and pastries varied each day, were delicious and good value; noticeably cheaper than 'up north' deli's. The staff that served me were always friendly and very patient, as it sometimes takes my son a while to choose. I just wish there were Malcolm Barnecutts near home.
Once again this bakery provided outstanding food.  lemon shortcake and apple pies to die for.  Delicious.

Review Title: Best steak pasty I've ever had !
Review Text: We stayed in St Meryn and visited this bakery. The steak pasty was wonderful and we visited several times. The salads looked wonderful and it was very busy, modern and contemporary. Would def recommend.
we love this bakery. everything is freshly made. great choices, not just bread and cakes although these are lovely.
Best Cornish pasties in Cornwall! The large one is a whole dinner in itself! Beware you will want more...The fresh bread and rolls are good quality, and lasting. Nice little deli too.

This is an excellent bakery ... purchased Cornish pasties (obviously!), sausage rolls and bread.  All were lovely and excellent value.  Furthermore, the bread lasted nearly three days in terms of freshness which is unheard of these days.
Best pastys around and that said by a cornish man - my hubby.  My stepson travels from Padstow to St Merryn for these pastys and a doughnut. Hubby lived the Chelsea buns his favourites.

I am not the biggest fan of bread or pastries, but love cakes.  However, whenever I visit this deli I end up with loaves of different breads and even ate a sausage roll this year (bearing in mind I don't even eat meat), this was really tasty.  The cake selection is vast and all that I have tried have been lovely.
They sell out quite early in the day, so get in there early and get some breakfast !

Anne Fox

Purchased bread and cakes from here while stopping in the village. Friendly and efficient service, great bread and cakes. Kazi bread very good if you don't have nut allergy. Danish pastries were also very nice.

Review Title: Lovely pastries to start the day
Review Text:
Wonderful croissants/pain au chocolat etc to start the day. However they do sell out so you have to get there promptly. Just wish they would bake a few more so it wasn't a race to get them!
Lots of other tasty bakery and deli fare as well.
I like the multi seeded and kazi loaves.  Also it has a very reasonably priced salad bar.  Nice pasties too.
Fantastic croissants and Danish pastries. Staff really friendly and cheerful. Will be returning to sample the cakes!!

If you want to taste a Cornish Pasty this is the place for you. There is a wide selection of food available ranging from pasties, saffron buns to salads. The pasties are baked on the premises and taste divine. Malcolm Barnecutt's Deli is a must if you are visiting this part of North Cornwall.
The Pasties are the Best we have tried ,always take some home to freeze.Also delicious Cakes and Pastries.
We called in here most days on our holiday and every thing we bought was delicious especi√†lly the pasties. The shop was clean √† d the staff were quick and friendly.

Used the St Merryn shop a couple of times for take away food. Excellent filled rolls, packed with filling and great steak pasty. Also bought seeded bread and saffron cake when leaving. Would love to have a branch near me.
Love this place. Great coffee, great salads, staff are always so polite and fun in here. Great value. thank you

Review Title: Lovey cakes shame about the staff
Review Text:
Treats were lovely.

The staff needs serious training in basic customer service, at least lessons in smiling.
One cheeky member of staff bagged up a cake when I only asked what it was - felt obliged to buy it. 

Wouldn't recommend purely on customer service. There's plenty of places which pride in service and I would rather spend my money there.

This place is amazing. I am a bit of a food snob and loved it here. The food was so fresh and tasty the filled rolls amazing. The cakes were tasty and even the frozen meals. We on our arrival knew we would not get time to shop so brought a large vegetable lasagna it was delicious. My partner is a big meat eater and he loved it so much he insisted i recreate it for him at home. My only niggle is wish it stayed open until 5pm. Lovely place.

Lots of bakeries and food stops in Cornwall claim to offer the ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Best Pasty,‚Äù but ignore the hype and ask the Cornish locals. For those who don‚Äôt know what the big deal about pasties is, they are a tin miner‚Äôs lunch dating back hundreds of years - basically a meat pie in a shortcrust pastry, crimped to seal in all the goodness. But a pie‚Äôs a pie, right? Wrong. Perfection in pastry is always a craft that few quite achieve, and the amount and mix of filling ingredients can make or break the best pastry crust. Bernecutt‚Äôs pasties have the perfect blend of thin, crispy, flaky crust, with lots of lean steak, potatoes and suedes. My wife and I tried the cheese & onion, and steak & stilton - both were outstanding and worth the trip to Liskeard.

Visited for a pasty (one of the many occasions) being local to the area these are normally the best around here but unfortunately they aren't so good any more to much pepper, cheese pasty doesn't seem the same dunno if they've changed the recipe but I'll be sticking to what I know from now on!!!

Review Title: Fantastic local bakery, everything is 100% good quality. Lovely staff too.
Review Text:
Pasties excellent
Chocolate sponge best!
Lemon Sponge amazing!
Croissants and coffee - fab! The selection of cakes and deli are great, the breakfast menu comes in handy after a long dog walk, and no scrimping! Very generous in every way.  Good value for money.

Review Title: Quality bakery, Shame about the staff.
Review Text:
I recently visited this shop, during my 2week stay in st Merryn, 
I went in to the shop almost everyday during my stay trying the pasties, sandwiches, cakes and best of all the amazing deli bar which I have to say is the best thing I have ever eaten choosing from a variety of different dishes in a mixed medium tub. My favourite being the sweet potato and bacon.
All the staff are very welcoming and friendly,  How ever theres one tall skinny girl that I did try and avoid on a few occasion as her customer skills are terrible, she was so impolite and rude it really did shock me the first time she served me, I felt everything I asked for was an effort for her to get for me, even a carrier bag seemed so much hard work for her. She obviously doesn't enjoy her job as much as the other ladies working there. 
If it wasn't for the other happy, jolly members of staff and the quality of the products I don't think I would be reviewing this shop as highly.

Ordered a birthday cake of your daughter. Very helpful service. Ordered over the phone in a few minutes, and picked up the next day. ¬£17.50 for 8" square cake - enough for 20-30 portions. Beautifully decorated. Moist victoria sponge great cream and jam. Had a steak pasty on the side which was also great.
Best pasties, sausage rolls, one of the first stops after we arrive! They travel well too for the way back.

Lovely shop in St Merryn. 

The pasties and rolls were delicious we didnt stray from those but the cakes were also very tempting. 

Staff were friendly, happy and the shop was clean and well presented.
Best baker in cornwall, pasty heaven, woodbridge shop is fab ,the st Mervyn deli is great better than london bakers. Thank you

We was advised to visit here for their Cornish pasties and we were not disappointed! The pasties were as thick as the girl who served behind the counter.
We returned to stock up for our journey and bought equally good sandwiches and tarts

Visited this deli on several occasions while on holiday. The fillings in the sandwiches were varied and delicious and they did not skimp on the fillings. Really good value for money. The pork and apple pasties were good too. As were the beef and Stilton yum yum

Have been going there for many years, first tried them as an alternative to Morris Pasties, our local branch having closed down. Malcolm's turned out to be miles better and we have been going ever since. Have tried several pasties since, but these are still the best!

I have visited Malcolm Barnecutt Bakery many times with my family and cannot ever fault them. The pastry is divine, meat and potato in good proportion and the spices and seasoning puts them above any other pasty I have tasted. 5 stars for pasty excellence.

This is the most local pasty shop to all the people in Cornwall so proper pasties ,and us Cornish do not like outsiders reproducing our pasties,this is as a good as a proper home made pasty even as a Cornish women I love them
Lovely food, fantastic service with a great range of local/home made cakes, pasties, chutneys, bread and deli bits and pieces. Well worth a visit.

Review Title: Great place to get your picnic lunch
Review Text: We stayed at the Trewithen farmouse B&B and each day stopped off at this deli/bakery to select our picnic lunch. The choices and prices were very good and thie pasties delicious. As previous reports get their early as it's very popular.
Fabulous local bakery and deli. wonderful fresh produce, amazing cakes and bread. If you are passing through St Merry its so worth a stop
Great to see a quality bakery in such a small village. Good selection available, but make sure you get there early

Review Title: Great food and value for money!
Review Text: I regularly shop at Barnecutt's Deli Bakery in St Merryn.  Their food is excellent, particulalry the deli counter!! Their take away coffees are also good and a generously sized cup.

Review Title: Great deli shame about the staff
Review Text:
This deli is great for food the pasties are the best in Cornwall and so are the cakes 
BUT the staff are rude and unfriendly and rush you along so much that you don't always come out with what you really want

Probably the best pasties I have ever tasted. Especially love the cheese and onion. 
One word of warning though buy from the deli shop counter and not from the cafe/restaurant. I bought my usual cheese and onion pasty in the cafe but it had been warmed up so long in the MICROWAVE that it was too hot to eat, the pastry had gone soggy in the middle and the ends had gone hard. The pasties are usually warm from the shop son I have no idea why they need to use a microwave. I have no idea what other food is like but my experience wasn't great. My wife had a salad and enjoyed that.
Not really a restaurant just a deli. We visit st merryn 2 or 3 times a year. The pasties are great and we always try to get a our pasties here. Cakes and bread are good too.

You honestly cannot beat Malcolm Barnecutt Deli Bakeries.  He has a branch in Rock too which I haven't seen mentioned by other reviewers. All his shops are clean and bright and the staff are happy, polite and helpful. The standard of the food is excellent and the choice very varied. I think of myself as a bit of an expert on pasties having tried them from all over Cornwall including some "award winning" pasties and I genuinely don't think Barnies can be beaten. You never see an advert for Barnecutts, they don't need to advertise as the food does it for them.  Well worth a visit even if you have to make a detour to get to one of his shops.

Bit late in submitting this review but here goes; as a family we stayed in Wadebridge in the summer and discovered Malcolm Barnecutt's shops and the delights that lay inside. All of the family had a pasty for lunch most days and as a consequence put on a considerable amount of weight. The pasties are brilliant, the choice is wide and during the week I must have tried most varieties of their pasties. Having written this I may go on-line and order a pasty delivery.

Grabbed some pasties and sausage rolls for lunch whilst staying in St Merryn.... had to go back the next day and buy some more, absolutely delicous!!

Service friendly and speedy, great range of food, highly recommended!
The pasties are amazing. The cakes are great too - lemon drizzle and Victoria sponge highlights. That is all

We've stayed in St Merryn three times now and this is the first time we have visited Malcolm Barnecutt. The staff were friendly, we were spoilt for choice with the food and cakes.  Everything we had tasted fresh and homemade too. Definitely recommend to everyone.

We've eaten pasties from Malcolm Barnecutt bakery in Boscastle many times over the past few years and there are the best you can find, never had a bad one, whenever we buy elsewhere they don't compare to theirs. Must stop if you go near one of their bakeries, they even do 'pasties by post'. Awesome.
